title: Old and Very Old in French Museum Mirror the Fragility of Civilization
description: CILATILLON  SUR  SEINE, France  This little northern Burgundy town on the banks of what the guidebook calls the Young Seine is reasonably typical of modern France  some picturesque but crumbling stone houses in the old, poor quarters, a lot of concrete and glass boxes with full conveniences spreading out around them, and signs pointing the way to the superhighway.

title: SHAKEUP LAUDED BY CONGRESSMEN
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Members of Congress joined in widespread, bipartisan praise today for President Nixon's shakeup of his Administration's high command.

title: 2 AIDES PRAISED
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Four top Nixon Administration officials resigned today as a consequence of the Watergate case, one of the most widespread scandals in American Presidential history.

title: Gray, Secluded, Confers With Former Associates
description: STONINGTON, Conn., April 30 (AP)L. Patrick Gray spent the weekend in seclusion at his home, conferring with former associates at a New London law firm.

title: Treasury Bills Mixed At Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Yields on United States Treasury bills were mixed in the Government's Weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Spook Leaves Hanoi
description: TOKYO, April 30 (AP) Dr. Benjamin Spock and his wife left Hanoi today after a visit to North Vietnam, the Vietnam press agency reported.

title: Skylab Tests Go Smoothly But Strike Peril Continues
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., April 30 (UPI)Trial Skylab countdowns moved smoothly today but striking tracking  station workers said that they and the Benedix Field Engineering Corporation were far apart in a pay dispute that threatened the scheduled launching of the orbiting laboratory in two weeks.

title: Biaggi Ousts Troy as Campaign Chief; Queens Democrat Gladly Steps Down
description: Representative Mario Biaggi's quest for the Democratic mayoral nomination was thrown into turmoil yesterday as he dismissed City Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. as his campaign manager just as the Queens Democrat was preparing, to quit because Mr. Biaggi had not agreed to full disclosure of his grand jury testimony.

title: Brezhnev and Allende Get Lenin Peace Prize
description: MOSCOW, April 30Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet party leader, who is promoting improved relations with the United States, was awarded the Lenin Peace Prize today.

title: A Delay in CarExhaust Tests Voted Until After the Elections
description: TRENTON, April 30  The Assembly gave final passage tonight to legislation delaying for six months the controversial program to curb exhaust pollution from automobiles. The vote was 44 to 10.

title: Record Club Ads Cited In a Court Order Here
description: Charging the Record Club of America with false and deceptive advertising, the office of Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz, obtained in State Supreme Court yesterday an order requiring the club to justify its business practices or return $288,000 to New Yorkers who were induced by ads for free tapes or records to enroll in the club.

title: NINE BLACK MUSLIMS GUILTY IN LOUISIANA
description: BATON ROUGE, April 30 (AP) A state court jury convicted nine Black Muslims today of inciting to riot in connection with a January, 1972, shooting confrontation in which five persons were killed.

title: DR. ISRAEL J. BARON
description: Dr. Israel J. Baron, a retired Brooklyn urologist, died Sunday of a heart attack in Hallandale, Fla., where he lived. He was 74 years old and also had a home in Far Rockaway, Queens.

title: L.I. Bank Robbed of $19,000
description: GREAT NECK, L.I., April 30 (UPI)  Two men, one armed, fled today with approximately $19,000 from the National Bank of North America branch at 440 Great Neck Road. According to the Nassau County police, six lemployes and one customer were present when the bandits entered. One robber drew a gun and shouted: Don't anybody move and nobody will get hurt. His companion walked behind the teller's windows and scooped up the loot from two cash drawers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: While the recent boycott has not had its desired effect in reducing meat prices, I believe the boycott is of monumental importance in indicating the willingneis of a mass segment of Americans to selfdiscipline themselves regarding a growing menaceinflationwhich threatens to undermine our country.

title: Market Place: speculation Laid To Institutions
description: Ralph P. Coleman Jr., who publish the OvertheCounteres Securities Over Review and runs one of the more successful mutual fundsit buys nothing but stock of OTC companies  is angry about the way socalled professionals dump stock and shun unlisted and lowmultiple companies.

title: Watergate News Brings A Wave of Stock Buying
description: A surge of buying moved into the market yesterday morning shortly after reports circulated that several highlevel figures in the Nixon Administration were resigning in connection with the Watergate affair.

title: THE BUFFALO NEWS OPENS NEW PLANT
description: BUFFALO, April 30 (AP)The Buffalo Evening News began operations in a new fivestory building in downtown Buffalo today.

title: Kent State Memorial
description: CLEVELAND, April 30 (AP) A week of memorial activities commemorating the four students who died in a confrontation three years ago with the Ohio National Guard began today at Kent State University.

title: Suit on Hospital Closings
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (UPI) Representative John M. Murphy, Democrat of Staten Island, said today that he would file suit tomorrow to prevent the Department of Health, Education and Welfare from terminating Public Health Service hospitals throughout the country. He said he would file the suit in Federal District Court do New York.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: TEANECK, April 30Only four days before he pitched an 110 nohitter against Colgate University two weeks ago, Roger Kreutzer thought his Fairleigh Dickinson University baseball career had ended at age 19 because of a lingering arm ailment.

title: Argentine ExAide Slain; Emergency Is Declared
description: BUENOS AIRES, April 30The military government tonight declared a state of emergency in Argentina's five largest cities in the wake of the assassination by leftwing guerrillas of the former Chief of Staff of the armed forces.

title: An Endless Quest
description: The recent decision of the Ford Foundation to continue spending onequarter of its budget450 million annually to help developing nations is an, encouraging reaffirmation of American idealism and, humanitarian concern on the part of a private institution at a time when Congress seems to be turning the other way.

title: MURDER CHARGE ON OFFICER STANDS
description: The acting District Attorney of Queens, Frederick J. Ludwig, reversed his position yesterday and said he would not seek, to reduce the murder charge against Police Officer Thomas J. Shea.

title: CATTLE FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISES
description: Convinced that there are numerous factors portending increases in prices of futures in cattle and hogs as well as items used to feed those animals, traders sent all contracts booming yesterday in Chicago.

title: MITCHELL CAUTIOUS IN COMMENT ON CASE
description: Leaving his office at 20 Broad Street in lower Manhattan yesterday, former Attorney General John N. Mitchell was asked to comment on developments in the Watergate case and on the resignation of four of President Nixon's top White House aides.

title: SawedOff Shotgun Used In Bank Holdup In Pelham
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y. April 30 (AP)Two men, one aimed with a sawedoff shotgun, held up the Pelham branch of the Fiat Westchester National Bank today and fled with an undetermined amount of cash, the police reported.

title: Colonels Set Back Pacers, 114 to 102; Tie Series at 1 to 1
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 30 (AP)Artis Gilmore scored 29 points and dominated the backboards tonight as the Kentucky Colonels scored a 114.102 victory over the Indiana Pacers, to even their American Basketball Association final playoff series at one game apiece.

title: CONTRACT AWARD
description: The Raytheon Company has received a $25.3million Army contract for improved Hawk antiaircraft missiles and ground support equipment, it was announced yesterday.

title: The Dance
description: Laura Dean has the exhilarating tenacity to repeat a step a hundred times so that her audience may clearly see it, and she makes wonderful sense out of insistent repetition. She and her company presented four of her primary structure dances Friday evening at New York University's Loeb Student Center. The four works involved the basic elements of walking, turning and jumping, each done with monomaniacal devotion.

title: CONTROLS VOTED FOR ANOTHER YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, April 30With the reluctant support of the Administration, both houses of Congress approved today, and President Nixon signed, a compromise bill extending for another year the President's authority to regulate wages and prices.

title: Nixon Stockpile Sales Assailed at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 30 (AP)The president of the United Nations Economic and Social Council said today the Nixon Administration plan to sell part of the United States stockpile of metals and other commodities would harm the economies of poor nations. Sergio Armando Frazao, who is also the chief Brazilian delegate to the United Nations, said such a step should not be taken without prompt and adequate compensations to countries adversely affected.

title: Two Minicomputers Are Unveiled Here By Automation, Inc.
description: Computer Automation, Inc., introduced here yesterday two minicomputers, one of which can actually fit into a standard pizza box.

title: Giants at Teams Mercy With 5 Homeless Games
description: Another road block arose in the New York Giants road to the Yale Bowl yesterday as the National Football league released the 1973 schedule without citing that the Giants have no place to play the final five of their seven home games.

title: Vacation  Job Outlook Improves a Bit
description: Teenagers and college students in metropolitan New York can spend this summer as telephone operators, maids, vegetable pickers or as actors playing such cartoon characters as Bugs Bunny.

title: SixLane Q. and A.
description: WASHINGTON, April 30  Ladies and gentlemen, the Great Paver of the United, States:

title: Morales Defeats Jonathan
description: Pedro Morales defeated Don Leo Jonathan of Vancouver, B. C., in a wrestling exhibition before 22,090 fans last night at Madison Square Garden. Referee Eddie Gersh stopped the bout at 11:38 because of a deep cut on Jonathan's forehead.

title: MISSING MAN'S BODY FOUND IN SUFFOLK
description: PATCHOGUE, L. I., April 30 (UPI)  The body of a Patchogue man, missing since April 8, when he went clamming in his motorboat, has washed ashore on Fire Island, the Suffolk County Police reported.

title: Alice Rice Cook, Educator Dies; Led Human Relations Centers
description: Alice Rice Cook, educator and management consultant, who directed the Human Relations Centers at the New School for Social Research from 1951 to 1966 and at City College from 1951 to 1957, died yesterday at her home, 220 Madison Avenue. She was. 73 old.

title: Montevideo Papers Protest
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 30 (UPI)No newspapers were published in Montivideo today to protest Government action in briefly suspending from publication three dailies, Melding Ia Maiiana, Ahora and El Popular, which violated military censorship by publishing extracts of army charges in the Senate against a leftist Deputy.

title: From the Whisky Ring To Teapot Dome and On
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 Until now, Teapot Dome has been the phrase most often used to define the extent of ExecutiveBranch scandal. But the taint of impropriety  of money and influence misused, of public trust betrayed for private advantagehas soiled many other Administrations of both parties over the years.

title: W.H.A. Playoffs
description: W.H.A. Playoffs

title: Youth Guilty in Slaying
description: INDEPENDENCE, Va., April 30 (AP)  A 19yearold New York City native, David Michael Allen, was sentenced today to 48 years to the state penitentiary after he was convicted of murder in the Feb. 27 shooting death of a Galax taxi driver, Charles C. Shupe, 43.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Everincreasing numbers of recaptured young bluefin tuna originally tagged in the northwestern Atlantic indicate that this age group of the species is being overfished by commercial interests, says Frank J. Mather 3d, a scientist at the Woods Hole (Mass.) Oceanographic Institute.

title: A.B.A. Playoffs
description: A.B.A. Playoffs

title: U.S. Group to Weigh Action Against Monticello Raceway
description: CHICAGO, April 30 (UPI)The Harness Tracks of America executive committee has recommended that appropriate disciplinary action should be taken against Monticello Raceway for statements and conduct not in the best interests Of harness racing.

title: Egyptian Air Bases Reported Equipped For Libyan Planes
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 30Diplomatic sources report that ground equipment has been installed at some Egyptian air bases for Frenchbuilt fighterbombers from Libya and Britishbuilt planes from other, Arab countries, and that it has been tested by the aircraft during brief visits.

title: MEDD OFFERS A STIFF AIR PLO
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The State of Maryland has submitted a plan for meeting Federal air quality standards that its officials admit would take nothing short of martial law to enforce.

title: Pat McNeill Holds Lead In Women's Open Bowling
description: GARDEN CITY, April 30Pat McNeill of Durham, N. C., held the lead after 12 games today in the $30,000 United States women's operi bowling championship at Garden City Bowl. Her score was 2,544.

title: Carter Gets Democratic Post
description: HURON, Ohio, April 30 (AP) Gov. Jimmy Carter of Georgia was named today by the Democratic National Chairman, Robert S. Strauss as chairman of a party campaign committee for the 1974 Congreisional and gubernatorial elections.

title: Knits Making Mark in Textiles
description: ATLANTIC CITY, April 30 Hundreds of technical advances in the production of knitted cloth and garments are being shown here at the biennial Knitting Arts Exposition in Convention Hall. More than 450 producers of machinery yarn and production devices have moved in more than 2,000 tons of equipment to fill the 460,000 square feet of space in the building.

title: British Football
description: British Football

title: Facts About School Board Voting
description: WHO WILL BE ELECTED  Ninemember boards for each of the 32 community school districts in the city. The 288 members chosen from among the 834 candidates will serve twoyear terms, without salary, starting July 1.

title: They Looked Through a Glass Enviously
description: A window washer, a delivery man and assorted New Yorkers stopped and stared at Arnold Constable's Fifth Avenue window yesterday. A group of outoftowners, cameras at the ready, snapped pictures. Women shoppers, including one 200pounder, looked on in envy.

title: QADDAFI IS ASSAILED BY GUERRILLA CHIEFS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 30Two Palestinian guerrilla leaders have attacked the President of Libya, Col. Muammar elQaddafi, and challenged him to nationalize United States oil interests in his country.

title: Explosion in Lisbon
description: LISBON, Tuesday, May (Reuters)  A powerful bomb exploded in the building housing the corporations, social security and health ministry here early today causing some damage but no casualties, police spokesman said.

title: Rumania Invites U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, April 30 (UPI)  Rumania has extended a formal invitation to the United Nations to hold the projected world population conference in Bucharest In August, 1974, the United Nations said today.

title: Tenneco Oil Strikes Well
description: BANGKOK, April 30 (Reuters)The Tenneco Oil Company, drilling offshore in the Gulf of Thailand, has struck crude oil, mining sources said today. The Tenneco rig reportedly hit natural gas at 2,000 feet and then struck crude oil in deeper strata, about 160 miles off the coast of Songkhla Province in Southern Thailand.

title: CONTROLS VOTED FOR ANOTHER YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, April 30With the reluctant support of the Administration, both houses of Congress approved today, and President Nixon signed, compromise bill extending for another year the President's authority to regulate wages and prices.

title: Fri, Ruckelshaus Deputy, Named Acting Administrator of E.P.A.
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 ((AP)Robert W. Fri took o fice today as acting administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency upon the departure of William D. Ruckelshaus to head the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Jurists Assail Mrs. Gandhi on HighCourt Appointment
description: NEW DELHI, April 30Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has come under attack by, leading Indian jurists for naming a relatively junior judge as the Chief Justice of India, overlooking the seniority of three other Supreme Court judges. She has been accused of subverting the independence of the judiciary.

title: Dining Out in New Jersey
description: ** Nanina's in Branch Brook Park, 540 Mill Street, Belleville. (201) 7599795.

title: Study Finds Decline in Women's Colleges Since 60
description: Roughly half of the country's 298 women's colleges became coeducational or went out of business between 1960 and 1972 according to a study released yesterday by the Educational Testing Service's College Research Center.

title: 2 AIDES PRAISED
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 Four top Nixon Administration officials resigned today as a consequence of the Watergate case, one of the most widespread scandals in American Presidential history.

title: U.S and Hanoi Aides Conclude a Phase of Review
description: PARIS, April 30American and North Vietnamese delegates today concluded three sessions of talks to prepare a review of the Indochina ceasefire.

title: British Soccer
description: British Soccer

title: 24 MEN ARE INDICTED BY U.S. IN BUFFALO
description: BUFFALO, April 30  A grand jury today handed up to United States District Court Judge John 0. Henderson indictments charging 24 men with various crimes.

title: Equity Financing
description: A nonregistered secondary of 62,350 shares of Southern Railway at $36 a share was made yesterday by Paine Webber Jackson & Curtis. The company's stock was up  at 36 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Mississippi Flooding Recedes in North
description: The floodwaters receded slightly in the northern pert of the Mississippi Valley yesterday, but the danger was far from over and the damage was still mounting.

title: Biaggi Testimony to Jury Ordered Rdeased in Full
description: A Federal judge yesterday ordered the release of Mario Biaggi's testimony before a grand jury but held up the order when the mayoral candidate's lawyer said he would appeal to block disclosure.

title: Women Players Agree To Tennis Peace Pact
description: SEA PINES, S.C., April 30 An agreement between the United Stated Lawn Tennis Association and the Virginia Slims tennis circuit was announced today by Mrs. Billie Jean King, president of the Women's International Tennis Federation.

title: A Chronology of Events in the Watergate Case, an Election Scheme That Backfired
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Following is a chronology of major events in the Watergate case:

title: Fund Appeal Opens
description: Today marks the beginning of the United Fund of Greater New York's fifth annual UNITED FUND campaign to help affil iated hospital, health and social service agencies and the American Red Cross in Greater New York.

title: Arthur Daley
description: The New York Knickerbockers were generally conceded to have not too bright a chance of defeating the Celtics in the seventh and deciding game of their playoff series at Boston on Sunday. This was obvious to even the most backward of the experts. The Celtics had rallied with irresistible surge to force this showdown as they displayed the hottest hands since the guy broke the bank at Monte Carlo.

title: Esmark Begins Trading
description: Esmark, Inc., a holding company formed to handle the major business of Swift & Co., began trading yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange on a whenissued basis and closed down  at 24. Trading in Swift, one of the 30 component issues in the Dow Jones industrial average, ended Friday and Esmark replaced Swift in the average yesterday.

title: Base Lending Rate Is Cut By Finance Houses Group
description: LONDON, April 30 (Reuters) The Finance Houses Association said today that it had cut its base leading rate for May to 10 per cent from the record 11 per cent set in April.

title: Belfast I.R.A. Hall Wrecked by Bomb; 2 Blasts Prevented
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, April 30 (UPI)An explosion demolished an Irish Republican Army meeting hall in Belfast today, the army said.

title: Mayor Leads Ceremony Beginning City's Jubilee
description: A new flag, bearing the numher 75, was raised over City Hall yesterday as the city began a yearlong celebration of the 75th anniversary of the consolidation of the five boroughs into Greater New York.

title: SOLID PROPORTIONS IN GARTNER'S MUSIC
description: Kenneth Gartner took a musically sound approach to the piano works on his Town Hall recital program Sunday afternoon. His playing was uncluttered with extraneous detail, yet always solidly proportioned and usually alive to the essential character of each piece.

title: State Panel Asks Raises for Lawmakers and Judges
description: ALBANY, April 30A special state commission today recommended pay increases of $4.8million for the state's 210 legislators and 279 judges and justices of the statewide courts.

title: RARE BLOOD IS GIVEN BY THAILAND DONOR
description: GREENFIELD, Mass., April 30 (UP)A pint of some of the rarest blood in the world was on the way from Thailand to the Franklin County Public Hospital today to aid an elderly woman suffering from severe anemia.

title: Bridge:
description: Lesserknown players made a clean sweep at the Long Island Regional tournament held at Hofstra University, Hempstead, L.I., last weekend. A young Connecticut ream, James Strauss and Steve Earl of Waterbury and Bausher and Dr. EdEtkind of New Haven, beat out a strong field to take the Swiss teams title, with 122 victory points of a possible 160. Teams captained by Alvin Roth and Roger Stern of New York finished second and third.

title: KNITWEAR WORKERS ACHIEVE AN ACCORD
description: The Knitwear Employers Association and District 65 of the Distributive Workers have reached a tentative contract settlement, Harold Korzenik, counsel for the association, said yesterday.

title: Legislature Lifts a Hurdle To School Board Election
description: ALBANY, April 30The last legal snag that might have delayed community school board elections in New York City was cleared away here today as the Legislature passed by an overwhelming vote a bill to allow the use of printout lists for identification of voters at polling places tomorrow.

title: Nuclear Blast to Seek Gas Slated in Colorado May 17
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) The Atomic Energy Commission announced today that it had scheduled May 17 as the date for an underground nuclear gasstimulation test, near Meeker, Colo.

title: Chickens Snarl Traffic
description: REVERE, Mass., April 30 (AP)  A crate of live chickens toppled off a truck at the rush hour on the Northeast Expressway in this Boston suburb this morning, and the result was onehour traffic jam and a lot of dead fowl. Most of the chickens were hit as traffic slowed to a crawl. A highway crew cleaned up the road.

title: Lon Non Leaves Cambodia For Enforced Stay Abroad
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, April 30Brig. Gen. Lon Non, the controversial and powerful younger brother of Cambodia's President, Lon Nol, departed from Cambodia with his family today, but he denied that American pressure had forced him into temporary exile.

title: VETERANS BATTLE EMOTIONAL STRAIN
description: ST. LOUIS, April 30The war has come home, said Joe Garcia of Seattle, a member of the steering committee of the National Planning Conference on Emotional Needs of Vietnam Veterans. The group met here last weekend under the sponsorship of th National Council of Churches.

title: Timely Brandt Visit
description: In his drive for a new Atlantic Charter and a revitalized Atlantic partnership, President Nixon has scheduled no more important preliminary than his talks today and tomorrow with West German Chancellor Willy Brandt. In every respett, Mr. Brandt will be a key figure for the success or failure of the Administration's ambitious objectives for the Year of Europe.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Notes on People
description: After having served four years of an 11year sentence, Robert Bolivar DePugh, founder of the rightwing Minutemen organization, was released from Federal prison in Atlanta. DePugh was convicted of weaponslaw violations and failing to appear in court. As he went free on parole, he said that although the Minutemen had been inactive during his imprisonment, they were still a force that an enemy would have to contend with.

title: Police Officers in Mufti Are Sub jest To All Rules of the Uniformed Force
description: Police Officer Thomas J. Shea, who is accused of having fatally shot Clifford Glover, a 10yearold Queens youth, in the back early Saturday, was member of the 103d Precinct's neighborhood police teamand one of about 1,00 policemen who comb the streets of New York in plainclothes and a variety of disguises.

title: POLICE TOLD TO HALT SEXBOOK SEIZURES
description: NEWARK, April 30 (AP) A Federal Court judge ordered the Irvington police today not to seize sex books and films from a book store, and ordered the bookstore's harassment suit combined with two other Federal cases attacking New Jersey's antiobscenity procedures.

title: Nixon Betrayed, Landon Says
description: TOPEKA, Kan., April 30 (AP)  The Watergate affair shows President Nixon has been betrayed by stupid malefactors in high positions, Alf N. Landon said today. The former Kansas Governor and Republican Presi dential nominee in 1956 added in an interview: He isn't the first President who was betrayed by those he trusted, of course. But I don't know of anything in our history of the sweep and scope of this Watergate scandal.

title: Union Oil Tests Well
description: LOS AKELES, April 30 (Reuters) The Union Oil of California said today a first exploratory well offshore from East Kalimantan Borneo), Indonesia in the Balikpapan, Basin tested 8,400 barrels of .29 to 32 degree oil in three zones between 8,100 and 10,500 feet.

title: Blast in Rangoon Kills Four
description: RANGOON, Burma April 30 (AP)A bomb exploded at the central railway station last night, killing four persons and wounding 27.

title: ANNENBERG LETTER LINKED TO COLSON
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The State Department acknowledged today that Charles W. Colson secretly arranged for copies of a praiseful letter about President Nixon, over the signature of Walter Annenberg, the United States Ambassador to Britain, to be sent to American citizens at Government expense.

title: Manager of Merchandise Is Named by Gimbels East
description: Bruce D. Voorhees has been appointed general merchandise manager for Gimbels East, the new Manhattan store opened by Gimbel Brothers in February, 1972. Mr. Voorhees was previously merchandising vice president of women's and junfor apparel at H & S Pogue Co., Cincinnati.

title: Pro Football Schedules
description: Pro Football Schedules

title: Tilt of the Heron's Neck Is Explained
description: Standing in the coastal shallows, its head and neck tilted at a sharp angle, the great blue heron appears to be listening to the wind or merely listing for want of anything better to do with a neck so long.

title: Alan King's Son Pleads Not Guilty in Car Case
description: The 18yearold son of Alan King, the comedian, pleaded not guilty yesterday to unauthorized possession of his father's car.

title: The Attorney GeneralDesignate
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Following is a sketch of Elliot L. Richardson, who today was named Attorney General'of the United States:

title: Base Rent Repeal Bill Is Gaining Here
description: The City Council's Housing Committee voted yesterday to repeal the rent control law's controversial maximum base rent formula, which permits rent increases up to 7.5 per cent a yesr in many controlled apartments.

title: Show Marks Washington Inaugural
description: Thousands of plants, shrubs and saplings, some in blossom, were banked on the steps of the Federal Hall, National Memorial at Broad and Wall Streets yesterday to mark the 184th anniversary of George Washington's Presidential inauguration at that site.

title: SHAREHOLDING LEVEL IS EASED BY COMSAT
description: Directors of the Communications Satellite Corporation (Comsat) voted yesterday to increase from 1 to 3 per cent the maximum percentage of Series outstanding shares of common stock that may be owned by any one person.

title: End of Era in Nixon Presidency
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The resignations of H. R. Haldeman and John D. Ehrlichman from President Nixon's senior staff clearly mark the end of one era of the Nixon Presidency and the beginning of another. Things simply will not be the same. The question is how much different they will be.

title: Gas Union Rejects Offer But Works Past Deadline
description: Local 101 of the Transport Workers Union last night rejected a contract proposal from the Brooklyn Union Gas Company, but agreed to work past the midnight expiration of its old contract.

title: Nixon Asks Tax Law Shift To Ease Filing on Income
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 The Nixon Administration proposed today changes in the tax laws and tax forms that would make it easier for millions of individuals to fighre out their Federal income taxes. The Administration's proposals contained little, however, that appeared likely to satisfy the demands of those who have been calling for reform of the tax laws.

title: Church Fire Injures Sexton
description: LOWELL, Mass., April 30 (AP)A sexton was injured today in a general alarm fire that caused beavy damage to St. George's Greek Orthodox Church. Christos. Tsolios. 85 years old, was reported in good condition at a hospital with second degree burns. Fire officials said that Mr. Tsolios told theft the blaze started when a taper he was lighting candles with ignited a drape.

title: DETAINED NEWSMEN RELEASED IN SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, April 30 (AP)Two correspondents for Newsweek and French woman, arrested when they returned from a stay of 11 days in Vietcong territory, were brought back to Saigon and released from Government custody tonight.

title: Fund Pledge Bolsters Vermont In Lake Champlain Sludge Suit
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., April 30 (AP)Vermont's pollution suit against the International Paper Company and the State of New York was bolstered during the weekend by one of the people who control the state's pursestrings.

title: Brokerage Merger Is Selby Estabrook And Moseley Firms
description: F. S. Moseley & Co. and Estabrook & Co., Inc., two oldline investment houses, disclosed plans yesterday to merge, as la number of other brokerage firm consolidations also were reported.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Like so many dress designers, Ken Scott has branched out into linens for the home. Tablecloths and kitchen towels by the American, who lives and works in Milan, Italy, are being introduced this spring in the ninth floor table linens department at Lord & Taylor.

title: Licensing Agreement Signed
description: Stamford, Conn., April, 30 (UPI)  Combustion Eriering, Inc. has signd a 10year licensing agreemnt to allow Societa Italiana Refrittari Marghera Azionaria to mnufcture the full line of Combustion tngineering's monolithic refractories in Italy.

title: Damaging Watergate Disclosures Reflect Factions and Strategies of the Principals
description: WASHINGTON, April 30all the brilliant rocket fire of Watergate news  articles about burglaries and burn bags and disputes about who warned the President and who operated behind his back a coherent system of factions and strategies is still at work.

title: DRUG AGENCY BACKS A BARBITURATE CURB
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The Food and Drug Administration joined the Justice Department's Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs today in recommending tighter controls over nine barbiturate drug products.

title: G.E. DENIES SEEKING A ROLLSROYCE LINK
description: The General Electric Company, denying widespread newspaper reports, said yesterday that it had not discussed any acrosstheboard link or partnership with RollsRoyce, Ltd., the British concern. However, G.E.'s spokesman acknowledged that the two companies are working together on several engine programs.

title: The Theater: A Drathatic Montage of Spoon River Anthology
description: SPOON RIVER ANTHOLOGY, by Edgar Lee Masters, adapted and arranged by Charles Aidman. Music Naomi Chirshhom; lyrics by Charles Aldmenp tatting by Henry Scott 3d; lighting by Barry Arnold; costumes by Val Riberto; production stage manager, Cleveland Alorris;. directed by Peter John Bailey. Presented by the Spoon River Company; Joan Rowe, associate producer. At Stage 73, 321 East 73d Street.

title: SOVIET IMMIGRANTS PROTEST IN ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, April 30Eight recent immigrants from the Soviet Union tried today to gain entrance to the weekly meeting of the Israeli Cabinet to protest the Government's refusal to endorse the proposed Jackson amendment to United States legislation on Soviet trade.

title: Vote for Better Schools
description: School decentralization is still far from having achieved the hopedfor benefits, but its potentialities will never be realized without maximum involvement of New Yorkers in efforts to improve their neighborhood schools. From 6 A.M. to 9 P.M. today all regularly registered votersas well as noncitizen parents and guardians who have registeredwill have an opportunity to contribute by recording their preferences for membership in the 32 community school boards. Procedural complications snarled the school election in more hazards than ever marked the Perils of Pauline.

title: Cambodia's Motorists to Get A Bigger Gasoline Ration
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, April 30 (Reuters)  The Cambodian Government has raised the gasoline ration for civilian motorists, it was officially announced today.

title: NEW DATA CITED
description: WASHINGTON, April 30President Nixon told the nation tonight that he accepted the responsibility for what happened in the Watergate case even though he had had no knowledge of political espionage or attempts to cover it up.

title: Advertising: HusbandWife Team
description: He was a young art director who had just started in the agency business. She was a sweet young English major just out of Rutgers. They met one summer night at the Student Prince bar in Asbury Park, N. J., fell in love and were married.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Damage to Sub Checked
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H., April 30 (AP)The Navy says the submarine Greenling is undergoing extensive tests at Portsmouth Navy Yard to determine possible hull damage in a dive that accidentally exceeded her, normal operating depth limit.

title: A THAI EXAIDE SAYS U.S. HAS OVERSTAYED
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, April 30 (AP)A former Foreign Minister has condemned the continued presence of American forces in Thailand, saying it was never intended that they should remain after a Vietnam ceasefire.

title: For Burke: The Arrival of Paul Signaled End
description: The Cleveland coup that captured the New York Yankees appeared complete yesterday after the withdrawal of Michael Burke as chief executive officer of the team.

title: AMEX PRICES DIP DESPITE A RALLY
description: Spurred by the resignation of four leading aides of President Nixon who are involved in the Watergate scandal, prices on the American Stock Exchange and in overthecounter trading yesterday managed to erase some of their earlier losses.

title: Graham Asks Nation To Kneel in Repentence
description: The Rev. Billy Graham, the evangelist, who is a close friend of President Nixon, said yesterday that the Watergate scandal was a symptom of the permissiveness, corruption and crime permeating much of American life.

title: SEYMOUR SHOCKED BY PUBLIC SCANDALS
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., April 130  United States Attorney Whitney Noith Seymour Jr. declared tonight that in the memories of most of us there has probably never been a time when public confidence in the integrity of government has been so low.

title: Radio
description: Radio

title: Uruguay Devalues the Peso
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 30 (Reuters)The Central Bank devalued the peso today by increasing buying and selling rates for the dollar on the commercial exchange market to 853/862 pesos per dollar froth 837/845.

title: Texts of Statement by Nixon and of Letters of xesignation of Three Aides
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Following are the texts of a statement by President Nixon today announcing staff resignations and other changes and of letters of resignation to the President from H. R. Haldeman and John D. Ehrlichman, White House aides, and Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst:

title: Steel Production Shows a Decline For Second Week
description: Steel production in the week ended April 28 fell for the second consecutive week, accprding to figures released yesterday by the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: LINDSAY AND AIDES PLAN SOVIET VISIT
description: Mayor Lindsay, his wife and several aides will leave next Wednesday, on a sevenday visit to the Soviet Union for, a discussion of public administration and urban problems.

title: Derby Bets Start Thursday
description: New York's Offtrack Betting Corporation will handle wagering on the 3yearold Triple Crown of thoroughbred racing  the Kentucky Derby, the Preakness and the Belmont Stakesfor the third straight year, according to an announcement yesterday by Howard Samuels, the president of OTB.

title: University Accepts Fine
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., April 30 (AP)  Attorneys for the University of Vermont pleaded no contest today to charges of water pollution from a heatingsystem oil spill last month, The state's attorney for Chittenden County, Patrick Leahy, said that the university paid a fine of $1,000, and that steps it took to clean up the oil were satisfactory.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Play 1At Los Angeles, 11:00 P.M.

title: 25 Diplomats Killed In Southern Yemen As Plane Crashes
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, April 30 (Reuters)The Foreign Minister of Southern Yemen and 24 of this country's diplomats died in an air crash here today.

title: 8 FOOD SPOTS CITED FOR CITY VIOLATIONS
description: 8 FOOD SPOTS CITED FOR CITY VIOLATIONS

title: Business Records
description: Petition filed by: MARY JANE ATLAS, retail manager, 435 E. 57 St. N.Y. Liabilities, $7,914; assets, $56. THOMAS J. PETTIT, dispatcher, McFarland Road, Wappingers Falls, N.Y. Liabilities, $10,312; assets, $250.

title: RESEARCH POLICY OF NIXON DECRIED
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The president of one of the nation's foremost groups of young medical scientists charged today that the Nixon Administration's policies on health research and training were producing unacceptable risks with the lives and destinies of Americans.

title: Library Named for Keating
description: ROCHESTER, April 30 (UPI) Roberts Wesleyan College in Chili, N.Y., near Batavia, honored Kenneth B. Keating, former United Stataes Senator and former Ambassador to India, today by naming its new $750,000 library after him.

title: CITY ACTS TO CURB HONKING OF HORNS
description: The first systematic enforcement of the restrictions on blowing vehicular horns since the city's new noise code went into effect last year will begin on May 14, the Environmental Protection Administration said yesterday.

title: Kissinger IS Going to Moscow For Talks on Brezhnev's Viiit
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 Henry A. Kissinger will fly to Moscow this week for talks with Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, on plans for Mr. Brezhnev's expected visit to the United States late in June.

title: People and Business
description: A corporate realignment at the Control Data Corporation has created three functional subsidiaries, each headed by a president. The subsidiaries presidents, the head of Control Data's Commercial Credit Company and three senior vice presidents have been named to a newly established management committee, which will have operating responsibility for the computer corporation.

title: 4 Hobby Companies Cited By F.T.C. Over Packaging
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission announced today that it was making formal complaints that four manufacturers of toys, gifts and hobby items were marketing products in deceptively oversized packages.

title: Elderly Are Told of the Power In a MayDecember Coalition
description: A politically potent coalition of the young and the elderly will be aimed at increasingly onerous discrimination against them in the health, educational and welfare services that the President has asked Casper Weinberger to emasculate, it was asserted yesterday at the regional conference of the American Association of Retired Persons and the National Retired Teachers Association.

title: LOWER NET LISTED BY SOUTHERN PACIFIC
description: The Southern Pacific Company reported yesterday a $5.5million drop in its net income do the first quarter to $14.1million, or 53 cents a share, from $19.6million, or 74 cents a share, in the same 1972 period.

title: The New White House Counsel
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Into a job made vacant by scandal and into the conservativeoriented power core of the White House comes Leonard Garment, an anxiously brilliant, iconoclastic liberal for whom variety has always been not just the spice but the absolute joy of life. That's what I call supreme loyalty, one of his closest friends said today after learning that Mr. Garment, a 48yearold special consultant to the President, had reluctantly accepted the post of special counsel to Mr. Nixon, a position that became vacant with the dismissal today of the Watergatetainted John W. Dean 3d.

title: INTERFAITH LOSES CERTIFICATE BID
description: The state's Public Health Council voted unanimously yesterday to deny an application to certify. Dr. Thomas W. Matthew's Interfaith Hospital in Queens as a healthrelated fatility.

title: C.P.B., in Closed Session, Talks Of New Head to Replace Curtis
description: The executive committee of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting held a closed meeting yesterday in Cambridge, Mass., to consider, among other things, the question of who will succeed Thomas B. Curtis as board chairman. Mr. Curtis, a former Republican Representative from Missouri, resigned as C.P.B. chairman and as a board member April 18.

title: US. LOSES, 7876, TO SOVIET'S FIVE
description: SAN DIEGO, April 30 (AP)The Soviet Union's basketball team evened the series with the United Stites national team tonight with a 7876 victory. The lead changed hands 15 times in a rugged game at the San Diego Sports Arena.

title: GiftGrabbing Savers: A Vanishing Breed
description: After waiting in line to open an account at a savings bank in New York, the man was impatient.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ATLANTIC COGNAC (Atlantic Container), Le Havre May 11, Rotterdam 12, Southampton 13; sails from Port Newark, N. J.

title: Indiana Standard Expands
description: The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) said yesterday that its Amoco Chemicals Corporation subsidiary would build a multimilliondollar maleic anhydride plant at its chemicals complex near Joliet, Ill. Maleic anhydride is used in the production of unsaturated polyesters in the marine, construction and transportation industries.

title: CANADIENS CLICK ON CUP STRATEGY
description: MONTREAL, April 30 There hasn't been much time for poetry in Billy Reay's checkered and long career as coach of the Chicago Black Hawks. But today he had a ready, Unrhymed answer when asked whether yesterday's 83 loss to the Canadiens was worse than, say, a 3.1 defeat.

title: Use of Torture by Governments Is Termed a Growing Practice
description: An international organization a charged here yesterday that the use of torture by governments against political prisoners was growing and had reached epidemic proportions.

title: Books of The Times
description: Bird Lives! is the first fullscale biography of the jazz musician Charlie Parker to appear in the 18 years since his death. It has already received much praise. The author, Ross Russell, is a jazz critic, magazine writer, novelist and former record producer who teaches jazz at the Unilersity of California at San Diego. He Vigorously asserts that jazz is a revolutionary and very important art and denounces its neglect and denigration by what he calls the white establishment and the black middle class. He confesses that he has been obsessed with Parker since he first met and recorded him (for Dial records) in the midnineteenforties and writes of course it is absurd that the biography of one of the great figures of AfroAmerican music has been written by a white man, and a middleclass, Western establishmenteducated white man at that, but no black writer or scholar has come forward.

title: Costs Mount, for Dirks
description: Raymond L Dirks, the stockmarket expert who uncovered the insurance fraud at the Equity Funding Corporation of Arnerickand then ran into difficultywith the New York Stock Exchange for telling his customers about it, disclosed yesterday that his legal bills were mounting so rapidly that he Was planning to conduct a seminar and to write a book on his discovery to help defray hid costs.

title: ASSEMBLY PASSES BILL ON EVIDENCE
description: ALBANY, April 30The Assembly today passed and sent to the Senate a bill that would speed the destruction of seized narcotics to avert situations such as have occurred in New York City, where 398 pounds of drugs with a streetsale value of $73million have been stolen from the Police Department.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: NEWSMEN HAILED OVER WATERGATE
description: ALBANY, April 30 (AP)Newsmen gathered here over the weekend for the northeastern regional conference of Sigma Delta Chi, national journalistic society, hailed the achievements of Washington reporters sifting through evidence surrounding the Watergate scandal.

title: End of Era in Nixon Presidency
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 The resignations of H. R. Haldeman and John D. Ehrlichman from President Nixon's senior staff clearly mark the end of one era of the Nixon Presidency and the beginning of another. Things simply will not be the satne. The question is how much different they will be.

title: American League
description: Western Division

title: Jacob Rubenstein, 91, Dies; Retired Textile Executive
description: Jacob A. Rubenstein, a retired textile executive, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 91 years old and lived at 40 East 83d Street.

title: Rift Over Governor Stirs New Hampshire
description: CONCORD, N.H., April 30The politics of this lovely New England state, long a source of puzzlement and amusement to outsiders, has taken a bi zarre new twist in recent weeks with a series of exposures and controversies that local wags have dubbed Water gate North.

title: Libya Denies Entry to All Without Passports in Arabic
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, April 30 (AP) The Libyan Government has banned entry to all foreigners except those with Arabiclanguage passports, effectively stopping travel into the country by all but other Arabs, diplomats here reported today.

title: ANTUOFERMO BEATS KETTLES AT FORUM
description: Vito Antuofermo, the Italianborn Brooklynbased middleweight, remained unbeaten as a pro, winning a split decision over Att Kettles of Asbury Park, N. J., in 10round bout last night at the Felt Forum in Madison Square Garden. Antuofermo has 16 victories and draw.

title: A Partial Beginning
description: In his comments and actions on the Watergate scandal yesterday, President Nixon did all that was inevitable but not all that is necessary. His belated decision to dispense with the services of Attorney General Kleindienst, of John Dean 3d, his legal counsel, and of H. R. Haldeman and John Ehrlichman, his senior staff assistants, was a bow to the inescapable. It has been apparent for many days that their usefulness in public office was at an end.

title: National League
description: Western Division

title: REV. J. T. CHASE WILLET
description: The Rev. J. T. Chase Willet, minister since 1965 of the Unity Church of Flushing, Queens, died yesterday in Flushing Hospital of a stroke. He was 64 years old. Mr. Willet was a past president of the North Shore Clergy Association.

title: Wagner Denies in Court He Was Blumenthal's Liberal StandIn
description: Former Mayor Robert F. agner denied yesterday in State Supreme Court that his ecent abortive mayoral candidacy had been part of a Liberal arty scheme to have him stand in for Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal.

title: Ceremony Puts Markson In Garden Hall of Fame
description: Harry Markson, who recently retired as president of Madison Square Garden Boxing, Inc., became the 90th member of the Garden's Hall of Fame at special induction ceremony yesterday.

title: INQUIRY GOES ON UNDER PETERSEN
description: WASHINGTON, April 30The Government's investigation of the Watergate affair will remain in the hands of Assistant Attorney General Henry E.I Petersen until Elliot L. Richardson is confirmed as Attorney General, a Justice Department spokesman said today.

title: Business Briefs
description: BERLIN, April 30A largescale Soviet industrial exhibition designed to promote trade with, the West got off to a subdued start here todayits first in West Berlin.

title: First Soybeans Inspected For Shipment to China
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (Reuters)Agriculture Department statistics, on soybeans inspected for export last week, disclose the first shipment to China.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Vietnam and Watergate
description: A lot of Americans thought George McGovern hysterical last year when he said the Nixon Administration was the most corrupt in American his tory. But neither Senator McGovern nor anyone who supported hint should take pleasure in the considerable vindication they are now receiving. This grim spectacle of investigitkin, recrimination and resignation, overshadowed as it is by the probability of criminal indictment, shakes not just the Nixon Administration but American government, and to its rots.

title: Mrs. Johnson Raises Funds For a Park in Austin, Tex.
description: JOHNSON CITY, Tex., April 30Mrs. Lyndon B. Johnson and her associates on the Town Lake Beautification Committee were counting up the take today from an L.B.J. Ranch Country Dinner last night, at which she made her first public appearance since the death of her husband three months ago.

title: 10 Gay Activists Are Seized in City Hall
description: Ten members of the Gay activists Alliancefive men and five womenwere taken into custody by the police late yesterday afternoon, after they had been accused of disrupting a City Council meeting by blowing tin whistles and shouting bigots and justtice.

title: Phone Co. Deposits Called Too High in P.S.C. Report
description: Investigators for the State Public Service Commission charged in a report yesterday that the New York Telephone Company was requiring customers to pay unfair, excessive and illegal deposits for telephone installations.

title: Excerpts From Court Hearing on Biaggi Case
description: Following are excerpts from the proceedings yesterday in the Biaggi case. The partici pants were United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr.; Mr. Biaggi's lawyer, Arthur H. Christy, and the Court Judge Edmund L. Palmieri.

title: DETROIT REPORTER WINS WRITING PRIZE
description: DETROIT REPORTER WINS WRITING PRIZE

title: Rules Issued to Protect Farmers From Pesticides
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) The Labor Department issued emergency rules today to protect farm workers from the toxic effects of pesticides, which kill or sicken thousands of workers each year.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Everincreasing numbers of recaptured young bluefin tuna originally tagged in the northwestern Atlantic indicate that this age group of the species is being overfished by commercial interests, says Frank J. Mather 3d, a scientist at the Woods Hole (Mass.) Oceanographic Institute.

title: Chess:
description: When the Yugoslav grandmaster Milan Matulovic suffers a rare pasting from a lessfavored opponent, he insists on playing through to the end of the regular fivehour session, no matter how awful his position. Though he can't fool the crowd in the tournament hall, why should he let the general public in on his disaster? If his resignation is slipped in among a pile of adjournedgame results several days later, perhaps it won't make such a big splash.

title: U.S. Senators in Europe For Trade Discussions
description: BRUSSELS, April 30 (UPI)Five members of the United States Senate Commerce Committee arrived today for talks with European Common Market officials on EuropeanAmerican trade disputes.

title: Kissinger Is Going to Moscow For Talks on Brezhnev's Visit
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 Henry A. Kissingor will fly to Moscow this week for talks with Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, on plans for Mr. Brezhnev's expected visit to the United States late in June.

title: Mr. Prospector Choice
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., April 30 The size of the field for Saturday's 99th running of the Kentucky Derby may be affected by the outcome of the Derby Trial, the onemile event that will head tomorrow's Churchill Downs program. Only half a dozen will compete, and the Aisco Stable's Mr. Prospector is the standout.

title: Five Accused of Using Threats To Force Dairy Out of Business
description: A reputed Mafia member, his son and three other men were charged yesterday with having forced a Long Island dairy concern out of business through robbery and extortion demands.

title: Tennessee Chief Gets Bill To Curb Evolution Studies
description: NASHVILLE, April 30The Tennessee legislature sent to Gov. Winfield Dunn today a proposed law restricting the teaching of evolution in the state's public schools, effective in 1975.

title: N.A.S.D. Suspends Firms
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (UPI) The National Association of Securities Dealers said today it had suspended C. R. Richmond & Co., a Los Angeles brokerage firm, and Stewart Securities Corporation of Dallas for failing to file quarterly financial reports with the association.

title: 80 Pct. of Workers Called Dissatisfied With Their Jobs
description: DALLAS, April 30 (UPI).Herbert M. Greenberg, a Princeton, N.J., psychologist and pollster, said today that 80 per cent of working Americans were dissatisfied with their jobs.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Roosevelt Drivers

title: Lebanese Say They Foiled An Attack on U.S. Embassy
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, April 30 (AP)  The Lebanese security police reported today that they had foiled an attempt by Palestinian guerrilas to attack the United States Embassy, the latest of several commando incidents.

title: Astaire Comes Back to Town in Philharmonic Gala
description: Fred Astaireor the greatest dancer in the world, as George Balanchine has called himcame back to town last eight. In a special gala it Philharmonic Hall, the Film Society of Lincoln Center saluted him through the medium that carried him to international stardom. Yet 30 film clips, with as many dance sequences, from his first film Dancing Lady (1933) through The Bandwagon (1953) could only show what anybody interested in dance rather than just film had always knownFred Astaire is a dancer's dancer.

title: Sports Today
description: Sports Today

title: Knicks, Lakers Meet at Summit
description: LOS ANGELES, April 30For the third time in four years, the New York Knicks and the Los Angeles Lakers will meet at the summit of the basketball world, starting a fourofseven game series for the National Basketball Association championship at the Forum here tomorrow night.

title: ROGERS DEPENDS CAMBODIA RAIDS
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that the continued American bombing in Cambodia was legally justified by the Constitution and was a meaningful interim action to force the Communistbacked insurgents there to agree to a ceasefire.

title: April Farm Prices Down 1.5%, First Drop in Year
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP)Prices received by farmers for raw products dropped 1.5 per cent in April, the first decline in 12 months, the Department of Agriculture said today. But they still averaged 32 per cent higher than the yearearlier level.

title: BIG BOARD DRAFTS ACCOUNTING GUIDE
description: The New York Stock Exchange is circulating to accountants and executives draft of a white paper outlining new guidelines for financial reporting to shareholders of listed corporations.

title: 2 Former K&M Officers Are Sentenced to Prison
description: Two former officers of the K&M Securities Corporation, an overthecounter brokerage house, were sentenced yesterday in New York Supreme Court to up to five years each in prison.

title: Democratic Chief Named
description: MANCHESTER, N.H., April 30 (AP)David LaRoche, 28 years old, of Franklin, was elected chairman of the State Democratic party yesterday in a unanimous vote by the state committee.

title: Transcript of President's Broadcast Address to the Nation on the Watergate Affair
description: Following is a transcript of President Nixon's broadcast address in Washington last night, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: SETTLEMENT IS SET IN WINNEBAGO SUIT
description: The $445.6million suit brought by LifeTime Industries, Inc., against Winnebago Industries, Inc., in 1070 has been settled for $4million, the amount of the judgment previously rendered against the company, John K. Hanson, chairman of Winnebago, announced yesterday.

title: Gas Wanes in Michigan
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Mich., April 30 (AP)  Gas activity around this northwestern Lower Michigan community showed a marked reduction for the third consecutive day today, the State Department of Natural Resources said. Underground pressure has sent gas and water spurting to the surface for almost two weeks, nad the evacuation of 67 families has left Williamsburg little more than ghost town.

title: Daylight Time Refused And Churches Report Gain
description: TULSA, Okla., April 30 (UPI) Five local Churches refused yesterday to follow the return of daylight savings time and held services at standard time. Attendance was better than last year.

title: F.B.I. Officials Urge President To Appoint Insider as Director
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 Senior officials of the Federal Bureau of Investigation urged President Nixon unanimously today to appoint a man from the bureau's ranks to be permanent new director of the FBI.

title: Common Market Nations Near FarmPrice Accord
description: LUXEMBOURG, April 30 (UPI)Farm Ministers of the nine European Common Market Nations moved toward a compromise today on establishing new farm prices for the 197374 season.

title: Delay in AutoFume Tests Voted by Jersey Assembly
description: TRENTON, April 30  The Assembly gave final passage tonight to legislation delaying for six months the controversial program to curb exhaust pollution from automobiles. The vote was 44 to 10.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Protesting the state's failure to ratify a new contract, Essex County's 1,200 welfare workers stayed off the job yesterday, shutting down six of eight field offices serving 45,000 welfare clients.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Manhattan fur brokerage concern that pleaded guilty last February to having traded illegally in the pelts of endangered species was fined $500,000 in Federal Court in Brooklyn. Judge Jack B. Weinstein suspended all but $10,000 of the fine against VesleyForte, Inc., of 259 West 30th Street, warning that he would impose the entire fine if there were further violations.

title: Rockland Lawyer Pleads Not Guilty to Lying Charge
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., April 30 A 53yearold Spring Valley lawyer pleaded not guilty today to a charge of having lied to a grand jury investigating official corruption and organized crime in Rockland County.

title: Return of The 51st State Is Assured
description: The 51st State, the local nightly news and publicaffairs program on public television that had been threatened with cancellation, will definitely return in the fall, it was learned yesterday.

title: Sketches of Four Who Left Administration Posts
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Following are sketches of the four men who today left their posts in the Administration:

title: 2 BRONX MEN SEIZED IN A DOUBLE SLAYING
description: ORANGEBURG, N. Y., April 30Two New York City men were seized at nearby Palisades, N. Y., today and charged with the murder of two men found shot to death this morning on the Palisades Interstate Parkway here about a mile north of the New Jersey State line.

title: Nixon Asks Press for Hell When Wrong,
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Moments after President Nixon completed his television speech tonight, he walked into the room where the White House press briefings are held each morning.

title: WALKOUT AT PATH ENTERS 2D MONTH
description: The strike of the Brotherhood of Railway Carmen again PATH, the Porth Aruthority TransHudson commuter railroad, enered its second month today with the deadlock over wage increases and the length of a new contract still unresolved.

title: GTE Receives Contract
description: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., April 30 (UPI)The General Telephone & Electronics Corporation's unit, GTE Information Systems, said today it had received a communications network contract from the Social Security Administration, Department of Health, Education and Welfare. The contract calls for the development and installation of a nationwide data communications network to speed supplemental security income payments to needy, aged and handicapped persons.

title: 3 Suspects Turned In By Their Best Friend
description: BIG FLATS, N.Y., April 30 (AP)The state police in this Chemung County community, seven miles northwest of Elmira, said that when they answered a burglar alarm at Black's Feed Mill, all they found inside was a confused dog.

title: A.B.C. Televises Series Alter Tonight's Opener
description: The American Broadcasting Company will televise all but one of the National Basketball Association playoff games between the New York Knicks and Los Angeles Lakers. The network will not televise tonight's opening game in the fourofsevengame series.

title: 80 Arrested as Policemen Battle Youths at Concert
description: STOCKTON, Calif., April 30 (UPI)  Policemen firing teargas and plastic riot bullets battled thousands of youths who fought back with rocks, bottles and bricks yesterday during a rock music concert at a baseball field.

title: Body of Slain Indian Is Taken to Sioux Reservation
description: KYLE, S. D., April 30The body of one of the two insurgent Indians slain in the siege of Wounded Knee was brought here for a wake today while three traditional Indian elders met with the leaders inside the embattled village.

title: I.B.M. Meeting Votes 54 Stock Split
description: SEATTLE, April 30Stockholders of the International Business Machines Corporation approved a 5for4 stock split at the annual meeting here today after Frank T. Cary, chairman, voiced optimism for 1973 business. The additional shares will be distributed May 25 to stockholders of record May 10.

title: Summary of Tax Law Changes Proposed by the Administration
description: WASHINGTON, April 30Following are summaries of the major changes and simplifications in Hie tax laws that were proposed to Congress today by the Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shunz, speaking for the Nixon Administration:

title: McGovern Seeks More Aid For Food Stamp Recipients
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) 11 Senator George McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota said today that further improvements were needed in the food stamp program.

title: Biaggi Testimony to Jury Ordered Released in Full
description: A Federal judge yesterday ordered the release of Mario Biaggi's testimony before a grand jury but held up the order when the mayoral candidate's lawyer said he would appeal to block disclosure.

description: The strike of the Brother: hood of Railway Carmen against. PATH, the Port Authority TransHudson commuter railroad, entered its second month, today with the deadlock over wage increases and the length of a new contract still unresolved.

title: JIRO OSARAGI DEAD; JAPANESE HISTORIAN
description: TOKYO, April 30 (UPI)Jiro Osaragi, novelist and historian, whose writings on postwar Japan won him an international audience, died today at the National cancer center here. He was 75 years old.

title: Chattanooga Schools Ordered Integrated
description: CINCINNATI, April 30 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit ordered today implementation, of a lower court plan for desegregation of public schools in Chattanooga, Tenn.

title: Removing Biaggi's Mask
description: Federal Judge Edmund L. Palmieri angrily removed yesterday the mask that Representative Mario Biaggi has donned so cynically to keep the public from knowing whether he did or did not refuse to answer questions put to him by a recent grand jury. While the mayoral candidate has steadfastly proclaimed that he answered all questions, he has now made it plain that he will fight to prevent the truth or falsity of that statement from being established in the only feasible and definitive way.

title: Nixon's Speech on Watergate Contrasts With Checkers Talk
description: WASHINGTON, April 30 (AP) Although both dealt with charges of scandal, President Nixon's Watergate speech tonight bore more contrasts than similarities to his famous Checkers speech of Sept. 23, 1952.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The last legal snag that might have delayed community school board elections in New York City was cleared away as the Legislature passed by, an overwhelming vote a bill to allow the use of printout lists for identification of voters at polling places tomorrow.

title: SNAKEUP LAUDED BY CONGRESSMEN
