title: Ruling in Suit on Stock Trading Could End Mass Class Actions
description: A threejudge panel of the United States Court of Appeals ruled here yesterday that a person who files a classaction suit must pay the cost of nodfying each person on behalf of whom the suit was broughteven if that means notifying millions of people.

title: Breakfast of Champions, Or Goodbye Blue Monday
description: You have to hand it to Kurt Vonnegut Jr. In his eighth novel, "Breakfast of Champions, or Goodbye Blue Monday," he performs considerable complex magic. He makes pornography seem like any old plumbing, violence like lovemaking, innocence like evil, and guilt like child's play. He wheels out all the latest fashionable complaints about America--her racism, her gift for destroying language, her technological greed and selfishness--and makes them seem fresh, funny, outrageous, hateful, and lovable, all at the same time. He draws pictures, for God's sake--simple, rough, yet surprisingly seductive sketches of everything from Volkswagens to electric chairs. He weaves into his plot a dozen or so glorious synopses of Vonnegut stories one almost wishes were fleshed out into whole books. He very nearly levitates. Yet--astonishingly--this fiction is also a factual announcement of his intention to give up fiction. And what mars the book is that one believes the fiction, but not the facts.

title: Equity Financing
description: An offering of 650,000 shares of beneficial interest of Mortgage Investors of Washington at $15 a share was made yesterday by Goldman, Sachs; Loeb Rhoades; and Johnston, Lemon & Co., Joint managers of the underwriting group. The real estate investment trust's shares, traded overtheo counter, closed at 14 bid, 15 asked, down .

title: Shea Arraigned on a Charge of Murdering Boy,
description: Police Officer Thomas J. Shea was arraigned yesterday in Queens Criminal Court in the killing of 10yearold Clifford Glover at dawn Saturday. The charge was murder despite the efforts of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association to get it reduced.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his April 3 letter to The Times, A. Jarrell Raper deplored what he saw as a slowing down, a drawing back from the nation's commitment to racial integration. Citing a national leadership that appeared unwilling to sustain and continue the momentum toward a total amalgam of the races, Mr. Raper lamented the consequences which would follow an abandonment of this social experiment.

description: Bulgaria 2, Portugal 1. Denmark 1, Czechoslovakia 1.

title: U.S. JUDGES REJECT PARISH SCHOOL PLAN
description: CONCORD, N. H., May 2 (AP)New Hampshire's dual enrollment program of parochial school aid has been ruled unconstitutional by a threejudge Federal panel.

title: PRESIDENT ORDERS TIGHTER CONTROLS OVER PRICE RISES
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 President Nixon tightened the Government's regulation of price increases today. Nevertheless, he warned the American people that price increases will probably be higher than we would like for some months.

description: Many charge account users do not realize they can get a free ride by timing purchases shrewdly. It can amount to about 55 days free of finance charges.

description: CHICAGO, May 2 (AP).Clifford Ray, the Chicago Bulls 6foot9inch center, has undergone successful knee surgery, General Manager Pat Williams I announced today. Ray, who suffered the injury Jan. 25, will wear a cast for about five weeks.

description: CHICAGO, May 2Coach Billy Reay of the Chicago Black Hawks fears the Montreal Canadiens depth will be more and more of a factor as this series goes along. If so, then the Hawks haven't even begun to know what trouble is.

title: 10 Workmen Hurt in Collapse of 2 Tenements Here
description: Two fourstory, centuryold tenement buildings being renovated by a pentecostal church, on the Lower East Side collapsed yesterday morning, injuring 10 workmen, none seriously.

title: Books of The Times
description: Dignity is in short supply among the mastodons of organized labor. Union presidents occupy blocklong suites in marbleandglass headquarters of regal splendor, exercise stopandgo power over giant industries, manage billions of dollars in trust funds and are regular attendants at White House banquets for other visiting heads of state. But neither affluence nor authority has brought notable personal grace. Even the new breed in tabor's high command tends to be made up of men with rough edges, ill at ease away from the bargaining table or the political auction mart.

description: An assistant staff accountant of The New York Times and two other men were arrested yesterday in the Manhattan District Attorney's office on charges of seconddegree grand larceny in the alleged theft of more than $25,000 from The Times.

However, it is almost certain that the list will be reduced by two or three before the final payment of $1,500 will be made on Saturday, threequarters of an hour before the race.

description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, May 2 (AP)Asger Jorn, painter and writer, died during the night in a hospital in Aarhus. He was 59 years old.

title: Skylab Passes Final Test
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 2 (UPI)  America's skylab space station passed its final ground test today for launching May 14 on an ambitious mission to keep men in orbit for 140 days this year. A 700man ground crew put the housesize orbiting laboratory through a simulated blastoff on schedule at 1:30 P.M. to complete a sixday dress rehearsal countdown.

title: SchoolBoard Candidates Move To Void Election in All Districts
description: Lawyers representing candidates from several community school districts started legal action yesterday against the Board of Elections in an effort to nullify the results of the Tuesday elections in the city's 32 community school districts.

title: College Costs Will Rise Sharply Again Next Fall
description: The cost of sending a son or daughter to college will rise sharply again next fall, as it has every year for the last decade, and campus administrators are warning parents and students to expect the price of higher education to continue climbing in the years ahead.

title: Miss Costello Gains Lead In $30,000 Title Bowling
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., May 2 Patty Costello of New Carrellton, Md., the 1972 woman bowler of the year, held the lead at the halfway mark of the 24  game finals in the $30,000 United States women's bowling championship last night at Garden City Bowl.

title: Music: Blackman Leads
description: The National Orchestral Association has been having a reunion with some of its alumni this season, and on Tuesday night in Carnegie Hall, it was the turn of Charles Blackman, a former assistant conductor of this training ensemble. Now associate conductor of the Dallas Symphony and conductor of the San Angelo Symphony, he led the ensemble in nothing less than the Verdi Requiem.

title: Nixon Nephew Is Believed A Witness at V esco Jury
description: A man bearing a striking resemblance to Donald F. Nixon Jr., 26yearold nephew of President Nixon, was understood to have testified yesterday before a Federal grand jury here on what he knows about the activities of Robert L. Vesco.

Lahey Memorial Award. The award, presented today for the first time in nine years, is given to a layman for outstanding service to medical education by an association of medical colleges.

Herman, former general partner in the defunct brokerage firm of Jaffe & Co., from being associated with any brokerdealer or investment adviser and prohibited his acting in various capacities for an investment company.

The unit, which represents 8,000 correction officers and police and security personnel, agreed to a wageandhealth insurance package last month.

title: U.S. WOMEN SCORE IN CUP TENNIS, 21
description: BAD HOMBURG, West Germany, May 2 (AP)Patti Hogan of La Jolla, Calif., was upset in Federation Cup tennis competition today, but the United States pulled out a 2victory over South Korea to move into the quarterfinals against West Germany.

title: New Jersey Sports

Tomorrow the muscular 6footer leaves for England to play in tournaments leading up to the Wimbledon championship. He may not make the draw for. Wimbledon, but he feels he has a chance and everything in me tells me to take it.

description: BATTING NATIONAL LEAGUE HOME RUNS RUNS BATTED IN PITCHING

title: Critics Say Most Exercise Machines Don't Work
description: Linda Costanza, clad only in a black leotard, stepped onto a belt vibrating machine at the Better Business Bureau yesterday and flipped on the switch. The belt went jigglejigglejiggle against her slender, 105pound body.

title: Seymour Indicates Biaggi Balked Before Grand Jury
description: United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr. strongly suggested before the United States Couft of Appeals here yesterday that the record showed Representative Mario Biaggi had refused to answer questions before a Federal grand jury 18 months ago.

title: MRS. WANG LIU
description: HAMILTON, N.Y., May 2Mrs. Lucille Wang Liu, widow of Dr. J. Heng Liu, who was China's Minister of Health and later president of the Red Cross Society and vice president of the American Bureau for Medical Aid to China, died here yesterday. She was 81 years old.

title: Arthur Daley
description: From a monetary standpoint it doesn't even belong among such major heists as the Great Train Robbery or the Brink's job or some of Willie Sutton's fancier exploits. But from a sports standpoint it is to be doubted that any steal could match in magnitude the grand larceny that was perpetrated on the American basketball team at the Olympic Games in Munich last summer.

title: Radio
description: Talks, Sports, Events News Broadcasts

title: Thousands Vote on Second Day of the Local School Elections in Suburban Counties
description: Thousands Vote on Second Day of the Local School Elections in Suburban Counties with 761 votes over John Carway, 368, and Allen Macklowe, 72.

title: Agnew Says He Was Abrasive to Press
description: BALTIMORE, May 2Vice President Agnew, acknowledging that past criticism of the press was excessively abrasive, said tonight that the Nixon Administration would like to begin talks with the media to reduce the unfortunate hostility.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Phnom Penh Peril Not Quite Real
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 24f Phnom Penh is under siege, as a number of recent headlines have suggested, then it is surely among the most bizarre military sieges in history.

title: Tourists Ask: Why All the Fuss?
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The lines of visitors waiting to tour the White House were as long as usual for a balmy May morning. Checking their cameras and adjusting their sunglasses, schoolchildren, retirees and middle aged vacationers filed steadily through the President's residence and symbol of government.

title: Knicks at Crossroads Tonight
description: LOS ANGELES, May 2Having settled very little in last night's game, which the Los Angeles Lakers won, 115.112, the New York Knicks and Lakers will go at each other again tomorrow night in the second game of the fourofsevengame series for the National Basketball Association championship. This time a great deal will be settled.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Article 3  No Title

title: 50,717 Trucks Are Recalled; Defect Cited by Chrysler
description: DETROIT, May 2 (UPI)Chrysler Corporation recalled today 50,717 Dodge compact trucks produced in the 1971 model year because of a steering defect that in one case resulted in an accident traced to the loss of, vehicle control.

title: Churches and School Bombed in Londonderry
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, May 2 (AF)Two Roman Catholic churches and a school were blasted by explosives and a man was found dead of gunshot wounds today amid a fresh upsurge of violence in Northern Ireland.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
description: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York

title: NIXON GETS WARNING ON 1974 SENATE RACE
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)Republican Congressional leaders have told President Nixon that some of the party's strongest senatorial candidates might lose in 1974 if he failed to deal quickly with the Watergate scandal, Republican sources at the Capitol reported today.

title: Allan Kirby, Head of Alleghany, Dies
description: Allan Price Kirby, former chariman of the Alleghany Corporation, the holding company that controlled the New York Central Railroad until its merger into the Pennsylvania Railroad, died yesterday at his home in Harding Township, N. J. He was 80 years old.

title: Army and Palestinians Clash in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Thursday, May 3Heavy fighting erupted yesterday between the Lebanese Army and Palestinian guerrillas near a refugee camp and in other parts of this capital.

title: Investor Protection Unit Paid Oat $16.5Million
description: The Securities Investor Protection Corporation, created in December, 1970, to reimburse customer losses in brokeragefirm failures, said yesterday it had paid out $16.57million in cash and securities during the first two years of operation.

title: Advertising: Big Accounts Shift
description: Several milliondollarplus accounts have found new homes this week. They are always easier to place than orphans.

title: Army and Palestinians Clash in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Thursday, May 3Heavy fighting erupted yesterday between the Lebanese Army and Palestinian guerrillas near a refugee camp and in other parts of this capital.

title: Clipped Wings
description: Those old confederates, bureaucratic red tape and governmental pigheadedness, are teaming up again make life difficult for air travelers between the United States and Canada.

title: Clemente Medal Approved
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)  The Senate approved today the striking of a commemorative medal in honor of Roberto Clemente, the late Pittsburgh Pirates outfielder. The bill now goes to the House.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An inventory of 55,000 handguns at the Police Department's Property Clerk Division has shown that 13 weapons could not be located and must be considered missing.

title: The Couple Aren't Typical Anymore
description: RYE, N.Y. When David and Degen Sayer moved here from Manhattan five years ago, they went the usual route.

title: Nader Says Nixon will Quit
description: ST. LOUIS, May 2 (UPI)Ralph Nader predicted today that President Nixon would resign because of the Watergate scandal. President Nixon has not told the truth, Mr. Nader said. I don't think he is going to be able to continue this kind of coverup and remain President. Mr. Nader was speaking at a news conference.

title: Some in B52 Crews Deplore Raids on Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (Reuters)At least a dozen crew members of B52 bombers used in raids in Cambodia have written members of Congress protesting againsttthe bombing, it was disclosed today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Government investigators hi the Watergate case said yesterday that the Republicans carried out a farranging campaign of sabotage and espionage designed to win the Democratic Presidential nomination for Senator George McGovernthe man they regarded as President Nixon's weakest possible opponent in the election campaign last year. The investigators say the espionage program was authorized by H. R. Haldeman and included at least three networks of agents that were controlled by the White House and the Committee for the Reelection of the President. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Nixon Picks Callaway As Army Secretary
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)President Nixon nominated today former Representative Howard H. Callaway, an unsuccessful Republican candidate for Governor of Georgia in 1966, to be Secretary of the Army.

title: Colon Runs a 4:01.9 Mile, But Army Tops Manhattan
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., May 2Army defeated Manhattan in track today, 95.58 even though the Jaspers set three meet and Shea Stadium records. Manhattan's Tony Colon ran a 4:01.9 mile, a meet and Shea Stadium record. Colon's closest rival, a teammate, Mike Keogh, finished second at 4:09.5.

title: A MILITANT PARTY UNSETTLES INDIA
description: BOMBAY, India, April 30In a secluded house on the fringe of Bombay, an intense bespectacled cartoonist has founded a militant party whose impact has jolted the Government and caused disquiet among moderates.

title: U.S. Bond Auction Brings 7.11% Rate
description: The bond market continued to tread lightly yesterday as many investors awaited the Administration's statement on economic controls and the outcome of the Treasury's auction of 25year bonds.

title: PANTHER, TROOPER SLAIN IN SHOOTOUT
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, May 2 A state trooper and a former information minister for a New York faction of the Black Panthers were killed and the woman leader of the socalled Black Liberation Army was wounded and captured today in a shootout and chase on the New Jersey Turnpike. A second trooper also was wounded.

title: Soviet Union May Enter World Uranium Market
description: MOSCOW, May 2The Soviet Union has demonstrated a growing interest in entering the world uranium market to help meet an expected shortage of nuclearfuel supplies starting in the late nineteenseventies.

title: Woman Captured in ShootOut Called Soul Of Black Militants
description: Joanne Chesimard, who wasI wounded and captured after a shootout on the New Jersey Turnpike yesterday, has been described by the police here as a central figure in an amalgam, of black militants who have been linked to the murders and attempted murders of policemen.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, May 2 (Rauters)British reserves rose $82million to $6.11 billion in April, the Treasury, reported today.This was after receipts of $75million from publicsector foreign currency borrowing.In March, the reserves rose $118million to $60.3billion after receipts of $115million from publicsector foreign currency borrowing.

title: Princeton Takes Track, With Rutgers in 2d Place
description: TRENTON, May 2Ed Wilson, a freshman who wants as much work as he can get in track, and field, won the long jump and triple jump, had a pair of secondplace finishes and set a meet record as.he led Princeton to the team title in the 11th annual New Jersey, college, track and field championships today at Rider College.

title: 12 Seized in Boston Protest
description: BOSTON, May 2 (AP)The police arrested 42 persons today after a demonstration outside the Boston University administration building where a Marine Corps recruiter was conducting interviews.

title: HOUSE UNIT BACKS $2MINIMUM WAGE
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 A House subcommittee approved today legislation that would increase the Federal minimum wage for most nonfarm workers from the present $1.60 an hour to $2 this year and $2.20 next year.

title: Stanley Cup Final
description: AT CHICAGO

title: Senate Approves $840Million Aid to Arts
description: WASHINGTON, May 2, The Senate voted today to authorize $840million in Federal aid to the arts and humanities during the next three years.

title: Rent Demagogy
description: As the city celebrates its 75th anniversary, one key to its future health will be decent housing for its people. The vote of the City Council's housing committee to kill the computerized formula for establishing fair rents 1.2 million rentcontrolled apartments represents a demagogic step toward wrecking an important preservative of the housing the city now has.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
description: Tickets matching the number win $2,500. Tickets, with the five numbers In reverse win $225, Tickets with the first or last four numbers In order win $225. Tickets with the first, middle or last three numbers In sequence win $25. Tickets with all five numbers scrambled win $25. Tickets matching the first end second digits, the second and third, the third and fourth or the fourth and fifth win $2.50.

title: Ground Broken for Arts High School.
description: Lincoln Center was filled with singing yesterday morningnot in its concert halls, but on the street at Amsterdam Avenue and 64th Street, where students sang to celebrate the ground breaking for construction of the Fiorello H. La Guardia High School of Music and the Arts.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: The Proceedings In the UN. Today

title: Libya Bars U.S. Diplomat With NonArabic Passport
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)  Libya has refused to allow an American diplomat to enter because Ms passport was not in the Arabic language, the State Department said today.

title: Dpaths
description: Invrilings In Memorial

title: Oregon Votes Heavily in Favor of Retaining the. Local Property Tax to Finance the Public Schools
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 2 Oregonians, voting in a referendum that attracted national attention, have decided by a heavy margin to keep the local property tax as the major source of funds for their public schools.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time
description: ATLANTICA LIVORNO (Atlantica), Lisbon, May 15 and Genoa 21; sails from Port Jersey, N.J.

title: NEW SENATE FIGHT DUE ON CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, May 2With the initiative coming from the Republican side of the aisle, a new challenge is being mounted in the Senate to President Nixon's constitutional authority to continue bombing in Cambodia.

title: KISSINGER INSISTS THO TALKS ARE SET
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Henry A. Kissinger insisted today that there is an agreement for him to meet with Le Duc Tho, Hanoi's chief negotiator, in Paris later this month, but that the two sides had not yet agreed on when to announce it.

title: Civic Unit Says Biaggi Ignores Data Bid
description: Common Cause said yesterday that Representative Mario Biaggi had not responded to its request for early volunteer disclosure of his campaign finances.

title: Stocks Show Sharp Gain; Advance Best in 3 Weeks
description: The strongest rally in three weeks lifted the stock market out of the doldrums yesterday, as Wall Street awaited President Nixon's statement on economic policy.

title: Of Lies and Facts
description: WASHINGTONThe Nixon Administration has embarked on a new propaganda campaign designed to hide the facts of soaring inflation, continued high unemployment, mounting budget deficits and a shocking drop in public confidence. It is trying to convince the American public that You're all right, Jack.

title: Highest Ranking Black Leaves Administration
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)  Samuel R. Pierce Jr., general counsel to the Treasury Department and the Administration's topranking black official, has resigned, it was announced today.

title: No Boos for Bart on His Return
description: When Mrs. August Riggs 4th pointed to a stunning white standard poodle, Ch. Acadia Command Performannce, as best in show of the 3,029 dogs at Westminster in Madison Square Garden on Feb. 13, there was an outburst of booing from the crowd. In contrast yesterday, when the 85pounder was trotted around a ring by Frank Sabella in the lounge of the Manhattan Savings Bank at Madison Avenue and 47th Street, there was loud applause.

title: Giap Calls for a BuildUp Of Hanoi's Armed Forces
description: HONG KONG, May 2 (Reuters)North Vietnam's Defense Minister, Gen. Vo Nguyen Giap, has called for the urgent buildup and modernization of Hanoi's armed forces, the North Vietnam press agency reported today.

title: PRODUCTIVITY UP, CITY REPORT SAYS
description: The city is making big strides in filling its multitude of Potholes and collecting fees for parking violations, according to a third productivity report made public yesterday by Mayor Lindsay and Deputy Mayor Edward K. Hamilton.

title: Football Transactions
description: GREEN BAYReleased Pete lammons tight end; Ron Gardin, Terron Jackson ono Otto Nichols, wide receivers.

title: Rainfall Expected to Bring New Crests to Mississippi
description: ST. LOUIS, May 2 (AP)Heavy new rainfalls are expected to bring another series of crests to northern sections of the floodswollen Mississippi River. Southern areas are braced for the onslaught of high waters already headed down the river.

title: The Dance: Mendicants of Evening
description: It is more than two years since Martha Graham created a new work, but for her company's season at the Alvin Theater she is scheduled to offer two world premieres. The first, Mendicants of Evening, made its bow last night.

title: Onion Prices Drop
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)Skyrocketing onion prices have started to drop from their record levels but will remain well above those of 1972, at least for a while, Agriculture Department officials said today. Shipments for south Texas, the nation's main supplier of fresh onions at, this time of year have begun moving after delays caused by weather, spokesman said.

title: POSTAL SERVICE HONORS ITS OWN
description: At a giant, 25foothigh mailbox outside the General Post Office at Eighth Avenue and 33d Street, the United States Postal Service is selling a set of 10 special 8cent stamps that depict men and women doing various mail jobs.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BALI HI!The Topeng Dance Theater of BaU gives its only public performance in New York tonight at 8 in Alice Tully Hall, 65th Street and Broadway (EN 21911).

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An inventory of 55,000 handguns at the Police Department's Property Clerk Division has shown that 13 weapons could not be located and must be considered missing. The inveptory was undertaken after the disclosure last year of massive losses of narcotics stored with the division. The Police Department said yesterday that 30 officers who took part in theinventories of narcotics and weapons had been assigned permanently to the division fora continual audits of records, and physical inventories as required.

title: LADENBERG AND WEIS SET MERGER ACCORD
description: Ladenberg, Thalmann & Co., Inc., and Weis Securities, Inc., both member firms of the New York Stock Exchange, said yesterday an agreement had been concluded to consolidate the two concerns.

title: 2 Times Newsmen Reported Targets Of 71 Phone Taps
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Washington Post said tonight that according to two highly placed Administration sources, the telephones of two reports for The New York Times were tapped in 1971 as part of an investigation ordered by President Nixon into leaks of the Pentagon papers. The papers had been obtained by The Times.

title: Securities Industry Bill Draws Fire From Amex
description: The American Stock Exchange took sharp exception yesterday to key provisions of a bill introduced in Congress, for restructuring the securities industry. It called for a re shaping of the proposed legislation.

title: Roosevelt Results
description: Roosevelt Results

title: PANTHER, TROOPER SLAIN IN SHOOTOUT
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, May  A state trooper and a former information minister for a New York faction of the Black Panther& were killed and the woman leader of the soCalled Black Liberation Army was wounded and captured today in a Shootout and chaie on the NO Jersey Turnpike. A sec's and trooper also was wounded.

title: People in Sports: U.S. Five Adds Muscle
description: The United States basketball team, in dire need of rebounders and brute strength for its series with the Soviet Union, yesterday called on two college strongmen, Mary Barnes of Providence and Len Elmore of Maryland. They will join the team for Saturday night's game in Indianapolis and play in the fifth contest next Monday night at Madison Square Garden.

title: John Kennedy's Doctor. Recalls BreakIns Before 60 Convention
description: The Manhattan offices of two physicians who treated former President John F. Kennedy were burglarized shortly before the 1960 Democratic National Convention, Dr. Eugene J. Cohen, one of the two physicians, said last night.

title: CHARGES ON FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Justice Department charged the Finance Committee to Reelect the President today with failing to report and maintain records on a $200,000 campaign contribution by Robert L. Vesco, a New Jersey financier.

title: Aid Asked in Base. Closings
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI) Senator Edward M. KennedY,. Democrat of Massachusetts, introduced legislation today intended to provide emergency relief for 41,370 civilian workers affected by the closing of military bases announced recently by the Defense Department. The House Democratic leader, Thomas P. O'Neill, said that he would sponsor a similar bill in the Heuse. Mr. O'Neill is also from Massachusetts, one of the states hardest hit by the base closing.

title: Knoedler's Show Is, in a Word, Splendid
description: John Canaday reviewed the show Impressionist and PostImpressionist Paintings from the U.S.S.R. when it appeared at the first stop on its United States tour, the National Gallery of Art in Washington. The following is an excerpt from his review, which appeared in. The New York Times last March 31.

title: Crabiel Drops Out of Race, Throws Support to Byrne
description: TRENTON, May 2  J. Edward Crabiel, the Senate minority leader, pulled out of the race for the Democratic nomination for Governor today.

title: Former White House Aide Gets a U.S. Consulting Job
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI) A former White House publicity aide, who until recently was director of administration for President Nixon's reelection campaign committee, has been hired as a temporary management consultant by the Agriculture department, officials confirmed today.

title: Bench and Rose Each Connect for the Reds
description: Tom Seaver's strange season deepened last night at Shea Stadium when he threw two More homerun pitches while the Cincinnati Reds were overpowering the New York Mets, 61.

title: Ellsberg Judge Confirms 2 Talks With Ehrlichman
description: LOS ANGELES, May 2The judge in the Pentagon papers trial confirmed today that twice during this trial he met directly with John D. Ehrlichman to discuis the possibility of becoming director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Events Today
description: Theater Film Concerts Dance

title: Dr. Hammer Tells Trade Secrets
description: After breaking attendance records at the National Gallery in Washington, a collection of 41 impressionist and postimpressionist paintings from the Hermitage Museum in Leningrad and the Pushkin Museum In Moscow came to New York this week in heavily guarded trucks and went on display last night in a special benefit exhibition at the Knoedler Gallery.

title: Bridge: One Team Remains Unbeaten In Double Knockout Event
description: The only team to survive unbeaten in the Greater New York Bridge Association's. double knockout team championship is a sextet headed by Sandy Stern. Her husband, Roger, Andy Gabrilovich of Greenwich, Conn., Alan Messer of Upper Montclair, N.J., Lester Sokolower of Guttenberg, N.J., and Barbara Tepper of Livingston, N. J., are on the team. Theirs was an outstanding performance, since en route they defeated four higherseeded teams, two of which are among the best in the country.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: State Insurance Commissioner Richard. C. McDonough proposed regulations to require insurance companies to explain to motorists how their charges were figured.

title: Connally, Joining G.O.P., Calls It More Responsive
description: HOUSTON, May 2Former Gov. John B. Connally Texas, who was Treasury Secretary during the first Nixon Administration and was a political disciple of the late Presi dent Johnson for many years, announced today, as forecast, that he had become a Republican.

title: Judge Approves a Plan to Curb Bias in Jobs at Delta Air Lines
description: ATLANTA, May 2 (AP)Federal District Judge Charles A. Moye has approved an antidiscrimination agreement between the Government and Delta Air Lines, Inc., that could cost Delta hundreds of thousands of dollars in back pay to minority and female employes.

title: Jews Call on MoscowBound Kissinger
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Henry A. Kissinger met with three prominent Jewish leaders at the White House last night to discuss in detail the conditions of Jews in the So viet Union. Mr. Kissinger leaves tomorrow for a visit to Moscow.

title: Hoover Anniversary Is Ignored by F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTQN, May 2 (UPI)The Federal Bureau of Investigation ignored today the first anniversary of the death of J. Edgar Hoover, but Senator Robert C. Byrd, Democrat of West Virginia, took the occasion to urge President Nixon to name a permanent successor to the late director of the bureau.

title: Miss Appleby W ed To Roger M. Deitz
description: The marriage of Miss Louise Appleby, daughter of Dr. Basil Appleby and Mrs. Lila Steele of London, to Roger M. Deitz, a special counsel with the Securities and Exchange Commission, took place here yesterday morning. Rabbi Haskel Lookstein performed the ceremony at Temple Kehilath Jeshurun. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert J. Deitz of New York.

title: Mrs. Gunter WillS Uphill Battle
description: SEA PINES, S.C., May 2 Mrs. Margaret Court had a head cold, but it was Francoise Durr and Lesley Hunt who felt sicker after openinground matches in the $100,000 Family Circle Cup women's tennis tournament today.

title: Connally, Joining G.O P.,
description: HOUSTON, May 2Former Gov. John B. Connally of Texas, who was Treasury Secretary during the first Nixon Administration and was a politiCal disciple of the late Presi dent Johnson for many years, announced today, as forecast, that he had become a Republican.

title: Slain Trooper Saw, Job as a Dream Realized
description: OLD BRIDGE, May 2The straightmarked furrows in the vegetable garden behind a cluster of houses on Marlboro Road here today awaited the young plants that were to have been placed there. But the man who was to plant them could not do so because he was dead.

title: FRANCE SAYS JETS MIGHT VISIT EGYPT
description: PARIS, May 2 (AP)Foreign Minister Michel Jobert raised the possibility today that Libyan jets might have been in Egypt, as Israel has claimed, but said Libya had not violated the terms of her arms deal with France.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND COUNTER GAIN
description: Investor anticipation of actioq by President Nixon to tighten Phase 3 controls to stern runaway prices enabled the American Stock Exchange anctthe overthecounter market; to register their first advances yesterday In eight sessions.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: N.B.A. Playoffs

title: Behagen Aids U.S. In 8367 Triumph
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., May 2 (UPI) Ron Behagen and Bobby Jones sparked an explosive offense that carried the United States national basketball team to an 83.67 victory over the Soviet Union tonight, giving the Americans a 21 lead in the series.

title: Youth and Family Air Discounts To Be Phased Out From June 1
description: In a decision likely to provoke angry protests from young people and some Congressmen, the Civil Aeronautics Board ordered the nation's airlines yesterday to begin phasing out domestic youth and familyfare discounts June 1. It said the discounts must be abolished by June 1, 1974.

title: ROBERT S. GERSTELL
description: EASTON, Pa., May 2Robert S. Gerstell, retired chairman of the Alpha Portland Cement Company died here yesterday. He was 79 years old.

title: Floods, Food and Fiber
description: Torrential new rains are heightening the damage caused in the Midwest by the rampaging Mississippi and its tributaries. In a normal March and April, the Mississippi Valley gets eight to nine inches of rain; this year much of the area got fifteen to twenty inches while in the north early melting snows were making their own substantial contribution to the floods that threaten to drown midAmerica.

title: White House Ethics
description: Coming on the heels of the Watergate revelations, blatant White House misconduct in the case of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg deepens the picture of an Administration moral blinders. President Nixon's request in 1971 for special staff investigation into unauthorized disclosures of Government information may not in itself have been either improper or unusual, but everything else about the episode was.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Soggy Ending
description: WOODS HOLE, Mass. A strong, biting wind and cold rain swept across the brown dunes and marshes when we reached the tidal creek. Clearly, it was not an ideal day to flyfish for trout.

title: Rionault Resumes Production
description: PARIS, May 2 (Reuters) France's Renault automobile company resumed virtually full operations today after weeks op strikes and lockouts that brought the staterun concern to the brink of a total shutdown. Some 7,000 strikers began returning to work at Renault's main Paris plant, bringing an end to the stoppages that had sharply cut production.

title: Watergate Deposition
description: Mrs. John N. Mitchell, wife of the former Attorney General, is scheduled to give a deposition here today in a civil damage suit by the Democratic National Committee arising from the bugging of the party's Watergate headquarters last June.

title: Mississippi Antipoverty Group Urges Nixon to Release Funds
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 2An antipoverty agency in Jackson, Miss., asked President Nixon today to release a Federal grant that it said was being unaccountably held up by one of the President's appointees.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Since walls are rapidly becoming the background for a great many art and decorative media other than painting these days, it seems appropriate that a gallery has opened where what hangs on the wall is done, not with a brush, but with needle or loom.

title: Two Truce Commission Copiers Fired On Over Vietcong Area
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 2 (AP)Two helicopters carryIng four members of the truce commission were fired on today as they flew over Vietcongcontrolled territory in South Vietnam.

title: Knicks at Crossroads Tonight
description: LOS ANGELES, May 2Having settled very little in last night's game, which the Los Angeles Lakers won, 115112, the New York Knicks and Lakers will go at each other again tomorrow night in the second game of the fourofsevengame series for the National Basketball Association championship. This time a great deal will be settled.

title: H.E.W. Assistant Named
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)William A. Morrill, formerly with the Office of Management and Budget, was nominated by President Nixon today to be Assistant Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare for Planning and Evaluation. Mr: Morrill, a 42year old native of Bronxville, N. Y., will succeed Laurence E. Lynn Jr.

title: Net and Sales Soar at American Motors
description: DETROIT, May 2  The American Motors Corporation today reported net earnings of $49.2million in the JanuaryMarch period compared with $6.3million in the same period a year ago.

title: Secret Service Restricts News Coverage of Dinner
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP) Organizers of a $1,000aplate Republican Congressional fundraising affair say the Secret Service has restricted news coverage to reporters with White House credentials.

title: Knicks' Box Score
description: Knicks' LineUps

title: W.H.A. Playoffs CHAMPIONSHIP
description: April 29New Eng. 7, Winnipeg 2. May 2New Eng. 7, Winnipeg 4. May 3At Winnipeg, night. May 5At Boston, night.

title: COLOMBIA FIGHTS TRAFFIC IN DRUGS
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, May 1 Smuggling has been a style of life in Colombia for centuries and has generally been tolerated as long as it was confined to cigarettes, electrical appliances and emeralds. But now smugglers have turned to narcotics, and the country is alarmed.

title: I.T.T. AIDED FUND MACKELL SET UP
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation has contributed more than $150,000 to a taxexempt foundation established by former District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell of Queens, according to sources within the company, and public hearings on the matter are to begin today.

title: Senate Duty
description: In the crisis brought about by the Watergate scandals, the Senate has three vitally important duties to discharge. They are to help find the truth, to evaluate the harm done and to correct the weaknesses which have been exposed to the extent that laws can remedy them.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: DETROITActivated. Chuck Seelbach, righthanded relief pitcher. Optioned Dave Lemanczyk, righthanded pitcher, to Toledo of the International League.

title: EDITOR INDICTED IN NARCOTICS CASE
description: An editor of The Record of Hadkensack, two members of his family, and several of their friends have been indicted by a Bergen County grand jury on charges including possession of marijuana and hashish with intent to distribute them.

title: General Dynamics Sees Higher Sales and Profit
description: The General Dynamics Corporation indicated that it expected improvements in sales and earnings in 1973. The Phelps Dodge Corporation increased its quarterly dividend, and the Control Data Corporation discussed the preliminary talks it has been holding with the Soviet Union on cooperative programs. These were the highlights of another heavy day of annual meetings yesterday.

title: Consumers Power Plant
description: The Consumers Power Company plans to file an application next October with the Atomic Energy Commission for permission to build a nuclear power plant that would cost more than $1billion.

title: Area Board Scores Center Plan Again Despite New Plea
description: Opposition to a proposed $200million convention center in the Clinton Area of the West Side was reaffirmed last night by Community Planning Board 4.

title: Priest Charges Police Ignore Hasidim Assaults on Hispanics
description: A Roman Catholic priest charged yesterday that the police had ignored assaults by Hasidic Jews against Hispanics in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn.

title: A.B.A. Playoffs CHAMPIONSHIP
description: April 28Ind. 111. Kent. 107 (OT). April 30Kent. 114, Ind. 102. May 3At Indiana, 9:10 P.M. May 5At Indiana, 2 P.M. May 8At Kentucky, 8:10 P.M. May 10At Indiana, 9:10 P.M. May 12At Kentucky, 2 P.M. If necessary.

title: Mrs. Gunter WillS Uphill Battle
description: SEA PINES, S.C., May 2 Mrs. Margaret Court had a head cold, but it was Francoise Durr and Lesley Hunt who felt sicker after openinground matches in the $100,000 Family Circle Cup women's tennis tournament today.

title: McGovern Scores Nixon On Attitude on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)  Senator George McGovern accused President Nixon today of implying that the Watergate case was typical of American politics and called it the worst campaign scandal in modern times.

title: CHARGES ON FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Justice Department charged the Finance Committee to Reelect the President today with failing to report and maintain records on a $200,000 campaign contribution by Robert L. Vesco, a New Jersey financier.

title: Biaggi's Man in Court
description: As Arthur H. Christy walked down the steps of the United States Court House yesterday to the microphones and television cameras and reporters questions about the latest developments in the case of his client, Mario Biaggi, a television reporter suddenly stood squarely in front of Mr. Christy and asked him about his own integrity. The Court has charged that you and your client are trying to use the Court, the reporter said, referring to a statement Monday by Judge Edmund L. Palmieri that Mr. Christy's motion to have three judges look over Mr. Biaggi's testimoney before a grand jury was made in expectation of a denial and for the purpose of publicly exploiting that denial.

title: East. College Baseball
description: KNICKERBOCKER CONFERENCE

title: PhiIs Deron Johnson Goes to A's in Trade
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 2 (AP)The Philadelphia Phillies traded 33yearold Deron Johnson, first baseman who has played in the majors 10 years, to the Oakland A's today for Jack Bastable, a minor league outfielderthird baseman.

title: Soviet Increases Pressure on Physicist With Note From a Prisoner
description: MOSCOW, May 2Soviet authorities have increased pressures on the civilrights advocate Andrei D. Sakharov by delivering to him a letter purportedly from Pyotr I. Yakir, a jailed dissident leader, asserting that dissident activities are illegal and play into the hands of Western propagandists.

title: CUBA BACKS FORMING OF REGIONAL GROUP
description: HAVANA, May 2 (Reuters) Premier Fidel Castro has said Cuba would join a regional grouping of LatinAmerican and Caribbean countriesif it excluded the United States.

title: Spain Is Hopeful U. S. Won't Curb Shoe Trade
description: ELCHE, SpainThe people of Elche and nearby towns have a request to make of the Nixon Administration: Don't.

title: House Unit Clears Bill on Devaluation
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP) The House Banking Committee today approved legislation to make formal the devaluation of the dollar, by about 10 per cent against the price of gold, which took effect in midFebruary.

title: SAIGON WILL TEST FISH FOR TOXICITY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 2 (AP)The Sciuth Vietnamese and Japanese Governments began investigations today into the possibility that United States defoliants used in the Vietnam war are still contaminating marine life in Vietnamese waters.

title: The Prosecutors: Good Guy, Bad Guy, Chief
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Seymour Glanzer plays the bad guy, grilling the witness relentlessly. Donald Campbell plays the good guy, gently coaxing the witness. Earl Silbert, the chief, moderates.

title: Book Gift by Lord Clark Thanks U.S.
description: Lord Clark of Saltwood, better known to his American audience as Kenneth Clark of Civilisation, his book and television series outlining the history of apt, is giving the finest volumes in his private library to an American institution as a smalla very smallsign of recognition of what we owe to the United States. The gift, made in the form of a codicil to Lord Clark's will, was announced last night when he spoke at the annual meeting of the Association of Fellows of the Pierpont Morgan Library, the recipient.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: (c) 1973, by, Triangle Publications, Inc. (The Daily Racing Form) Aqueduct Entries Aqueduct Entries Roosevelt Entries

title: Norton Simon Art Sold for $6.7Million
description: Two great paintingsby Cezanne and Maneteach brought $1.4million at auction here last night. They were the stars of the first of a fourday series of, sales from the art collections of Norton Simon, the West Coast industrialist, at Sotheby Parke Bernet, 980 Madison Avenue. The total sale brought $6,782,900 for 47 pieces.

title: 3d Railroad Union Signs Agreement on Labor Pact
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)  The United Transportation Union signed yesterday the tentative contract agreement reached in March between the nation's railroads and 15 railway workers unions.

title: TEAMS OF AGENTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Government investigators say they now have evidence that Republican sabotage and espionage efforts in the election campaign last year were far more widespread than was previously known and were designed to help Senator George McGovern win the Democratic nomination for President.

title: 5 Accused of Plot To Send Weapons To Wounded Knee
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)  Russell Means, a leader of the American Indian Movement, and four others affiliated with the organization were indicted by a Federal grand jury today on a charge of conspiring to illegally transport arms to Wounded Knee, S.D., and to cross state lines with intent to incite a riot.

title: Fumes Fell Boston Dockers
description: BOSTON, May 2 (AP)Five longshoremen were overcome by fumes today while unloading the hold of the Norwegian freighter Talebot at Castle Island terminal. They were revived and taken to Boston City Hospital for examination.

title: Editor and Six Others Indicted On Narcotics Charge in Jersey
description: An editor of The Record of Hackensack, two members of his family and four of their friends have been indicted by a Bergen County grand jury on charges including possession of marijuana and hashish with intent to distribute them.

title: New Argentine Leader Returns in Crisis
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 2Dr. Hector J. Campora, Presidentelect of Argentina, returned here from Spain today to confer with military leaders in the wake of a series of Troskyite guerrilla attacks that have brought most of the country under martial law.

title: CONTINENTAL PHONE LIMITS STOCK DEAL
description: The Contenental Telephone Corporation, which last month offered to exchange stock valued at $35million for Telephone Utilities, Inc., indicated yesterday it would not proceed with the offer if Telephone Utilities completed a transaction under which a unit of the Pacific Power & Light Company could acquire up to 51 per cent of Telephone Utill  ties.

title: Nixon Widens His European Itinerary As He Ends 2Day Talk With Brandt
description: WASHINGTON, May 2President Nixon plans to expand his European trip this fall in quest of a new Atlantic charter to include meetings with the North Atlantic Treaty Organization and the Common Marketpossibly at the summit levelat their headquarters in Brussels.

title: PLAN ON DEBT FILED BY AMERICAN EXPORT
description: American Export Industries, a financially troubled shipping and trucicing concern, has filed a recapitalization plan with the Securities and Exchange. Commission that it described as an alternative to bankruptcy.

title: Seymour Indicates Biaggi Balked Before Grand Jury
description: United States Attorney Whitney North Seymbur Jr. strongly suggested before the United States Court of. ApPeals here yesterday that the record showed Representative Mario Biaggi had refused to answer questions before a Federal grand jury 18 months, ago.

title: TRUCK HIJACKINGS TOPIC OF HARING
description: WASHINGTON, May 2  A graphic description of the truckhijacking racket in New York City was given to a Senate committee today by a masked witness in a wheel chair who admitted having taken part in 93 hijackings and having spent 20 of his 48 years in jail.

title: College Costs Will Rise Sharply Again Next Fall
description: The cost of sending a son or daughter to college will rise sharply again next fall, as it has every year for the last decade, and campus administrators are warning parents and students to expect die price of higher education to continue climbing in the years ahead.

title: SUPERSTAR THEATER BURNED INARGENTINA
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 2A Theater in which the Argentine version  of the rock opera Jesus Christ Superstar was to have opened tonight was set afire this morning by six armed men.

title: Aide in Nixon's Pentagon Papers Inquiry Quits the National Security Council Staff
description: WASHINGTON, May 2David Young, one of the men in charge of the Presidential investigation into the Pentagon papers case, has resigned from the staff of the National Security Council, a White House spokesman said today.

title: SENATORS EXPECT NEW PROSECUTOR
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Democrats on the Senate Judiciary Committee said today that they expected Elliot L. Richardson to I appoint a special prosecutor in the Watergate case before Mr. Richardson's nomination as Attorney General came before the committee.named. The Senators noted that Mr. Richardson had already received Senate confirmation three times in the last four years  for Assistant Secreretary of State, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, and Secretary of Defense.

title: Box Scores
description: Box Scores

title: The HardHat View
description: WASHINGTONThe working people of this country are being swindled down to their socks by a political Administration that's either too ignorant to understand or just doesn't give a damn. Despite President Nixon's professed admiration for the hard hats, we need more than a hard hat to help us. We need a full suit of armor to protect us from the economic body blows of this Administration.

title: Disputed Double Contributes to 43 Victory
description: The Kansas City lefthander Paul Splittorff, scattered 10 hits and the righthanded reliever, Gene Garber, came in the ninth inning to pick up his fourth save of the season as the Royals defeated the New York Yankees, 43, before a crowd of 7,604 at Yankee Stadium last night.

title: Calvary Giveg Terminal Patients an Integrated Approach to Death
description: All of the patients who are admitted to Calvary Hospital in the Highbridge section of the Bronx have three things in common: They are medically indigent; they have cancer; they have a life expectancy of three to six weeks.

title: SCHOOLYEAR BILL LOSES IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 2The Senate rejected a bill today that would have allowed school districts to switch to year round school operations and qualify for state aid during July and August.

title: GiftTaking Laid to Judge In Compensation Cases
description: TRENTON, May 2A workmen's compensation judge was accused before the State Commission of Investigation today of accepting, theater tickets and cash from a Nofth Jersey physician who allegedly received illegally excessive fees after appearances in the judge's court on 4behalf of injured clients.

title: DRUG BILL PRESSED BY G.O.P. LEADERS
description: ALBANY, May 2The full, hoary texture of legislative politicking was on display today as Governor Rockefeller's drugpenalty bill stalled again in the Assembly, and pressure grew for making basic changes.

title: SENATORS EXPECT NEW PROSECUTOR
description: AVASHINGTON May 2Democrats on the Senate Judiciary Cominittee said today that they expected Elliot L. Richardson to appoint a special prosecutor in the Watergate case before Mr. RichardiOn'S nomination as Attorney General came before the committee.

title: Group Sues to Have I.R.S. Act on Exemption Bid
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Center on Corporate Responsibility, Inc., an organization that does research and litigation on public issues involving business, filed a lawsuit today aimed at forcing the Internal Revenue Service to act on its application for taxexempt status.

title: TEAMS OF AGENTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 2Gow ernment investigators say they now have evidence that Repub lican sabotage and espionage efforts in the election campaign last year were far more widespread than was previous ly known and were designed to help Senator George McGovern win the Democratic nomination for President.

title: Television
description: Television

title: Ruins of the Ancient City of Anshan Are Uncovered in Southwest Iran
description: Thanks to modern archeological methods, including the use of a highly sensitive magnetometer, the buried ruins of the ancient city of Anshan have been found in southwest Iran.

title: BirdBait Bill Endorsed
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)The Interior Department endorsed today a move in the House to make landowners liable for criminal prosecution if they permitted hunters to attract and kill migratory birds illegally with the use of corn or other bait.

title: Hip Cherub to Warn of V.D. Peril
description: The Health Department turned yesterday to Chubby the Hip Cherub, an animated cartoon character, as a lighthearted, attentiongetting device to help combat venereal disease.

title: EARNINGS RAISED AT SCHLUMBERGER
description: Virtually all sectors of industry are making it big in the first quarter of this year, with profits in many instances at records. The economy has been expanding at its fastest pace since the mid1960's and shortages in some basic materials are beginning to occur even with production at or near capacity.

title: U.S. Planes Bomb Again Near Cambodian Capital
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 2 (Reuters)American Phantom jets today bombed Communist positions beyond the Mekong River three miles east of Phnom Penh.

title: Notes on People
description: AkIcsandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the NovelPrizewinning author, has married Natalya Svetlova, who bore him two of his sons during the threeandahalf years he was separated from his first wife. Unofficial sources said the 55yearold writer and the 33yearold mathematician were married about three weeks ago.

title: Machinery Orders Gain
description: The value of new orders fox nonelectrical machinery, considered a key indicator of industrial investment trends, surged in March, the McGraw, Hill Department of Economics reported yesterday. Its index of new machInery orders rose 8 per cent on a seasonally adJusted basis to 463.

title: CABS THREATENED BY GAS SHORTAGE
description: The current shortage of gasoline could force a cutoff of bulk sales to New York's taxi fleets and force 800 or more cabs off the city's streets next month, a spokesman for the taxi industry said yesterday.

title: Chess: From Those Sublime Heighta Come Ridiculous Delights
description: Although chess is a sophisticated game, some of its delights are primitive. When Frank J. Marshall, the United States champion from 1909 to 1936, got off one of his stunning queen sacrifices against David Janowski, the FrancoPolish grandmaster, Janowski stared at it and hissed through clenched teeth, Swindle!

title: Suspended Detective Gets 6 Years on Heroin Charges
description: ROCHESTER, May 2 (AP)Nelson T. Evans, a suspended narcotics detective here, was sentenced today to six years in federal prison for conspiracy and for distributing heroin that disappeared from the Monroe County laboratory.

title: 8 FOOD PLACES CITED BY HEALTH AGENCY
description: The city's Health Department made public yesterday the names of six restaurants and two groceries where inspectors had found serious violations of the Health Code.

title: City College Students Hold Building in Funds Protest
description: Students demonstrating against the threatened end of free tuition in the City University and against statemandated budget cuts kept most of City College administrative personnel from entering their offices yesterday.

title: DR. MAX WOLFF, L.I.U. PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Max Wolff, professor of educational sociology at Long Island University and a sponsor of the educational park concept, died Tuesday of a heart attack. He was 68 years old and lived at 179 Woodlawn Ave, New Rochelle, N. Y. Dr. Wolff was stricken at 82d Street and Broadway as he drove from the university in Brooklyn to his home.

title: Some New Questions
description: WASHINGTON, May 2President Nixon's second attempt in two weeks to calm the nation's anxieties about the Watergate scandal has encountered grave problems here. Like his statement on April 17 reporting major new developments in the case, his television speech on Monday nightand his acceptance of the resignations of two of his most trusted associates and closest friendswas followed by new revelations froth investigators end insistent new demands from his friends as well as his foes. The new questions center on the demand for a special prosecutor in the case, which has been voiced by the Senate (in a resolution passed yesterday), by leading bar association officials, by Republican politicians out in the country, and today, in an Associated Press poll, by 32 of 40 members of the American Society of Newspaper Editors polled at random.

title: The Hope of the World
description: WASHINGTON  The last great scandals of an American Government, fifty years ago, seem now to have had an almost endearing simplicity about them. Warren G. Harding and his cronies wanted only whisky, women and money. They come down to us as characters in a musical comedy.

title: Mrs. Gunter Wins Uphill Battle From Miss Durr at Sea. Pines
description: SEA PINES, S.C., May 2 Mrs. Margaret Court had a head cold, but it was Francoise Durr and Lesley Hunt who felt sicker after openinground matches in the $100,000 Family Circle Cup women's tennis tournament today.

title: 6'MIFTER'CHARGED IN SATANIST SLAYING
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., May 2 (AP)The police charged six young beach transients with firstdegree murder today in the witchcraft slaying last Friday of a 17yearold amusement park worker.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS DOWN

title: Another West Point Cadet Is Called Violator of Code
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., May 2 (AP)Another cadet has been declared in violation of the West Point honor code in the continuing investigation of a cheating scandal that has implicated 16 so far.

title: French Woman Admits Error In Her Accusation of Nazi
description: PARIS, May 2Beate Klarsfeld, an investigator of Nazi war criminals, said tonight she had been mistaken in charging last week that the Nazi commissioner in charge of the Warsaw Ghetto through 1941 and 1942 was living peacefully in West Germany. The man she referred to, Heinz Auerswald, died late in 1970.

title: Dr. Joseph A. Freiberg, 74,. Of Orthopedic Association
description: CINCINNATI, May 2  Dr. Joseph A. Freiberg, a former president of the American Orthopedic Association and former vice president of the American Academy of Orthopedic Surgeons, died here yesterday. He was 74 years old.

title: 959 Students Win Merit Scholarships
description: A total of 959 high school seniors from across the country were named winners of fouryear renewable scholarships under the Merit Scholarship program, the Merit Scholarship Corporation in Evanston, Ill., announced yesterday.

title: JAYA IOW $27.20, CAPTURES COMELY
description: Darby Dan's Java Moon, who got to the races only once last yearan outing in late November in which she finished secondand who triumphed in her three previous races this season, beat 10 much more experienced 3yearold fillies in yesterday's 24th running of the Comely at Aqueduct.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Cincinnati Reds, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8 P.M.

title: A Move to Save Fuel
description: DES MOINES, IOWA, May 2 (UPI)  The State Senate's Goverment Committee voted yesterday to give the governor the authority to lower state speed limits to 50 miles an hour in an effort to cut down on gasoline usage and combat this summer's expected gasoline shortage.

title: PRESIDENT ORDERS TIGHTER CONTROLS OVER PRICE RISES
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 President Nixon tightened the Government's regulation of price increases today. Nevertheless, he warned the American people that price increases will probably be i higher than we would like for some months.

title: CONSUMER SUITS SEEN ENDANGERED
description: Lawyers who specialize in classaction litigation said a ruling by a threejudge panel of the United States Court of Appeals here Tuesday could have a sharp effect on consumer suits  possibly ending them.

title: Seized Woman Called Black Militants Soul
description: Joanne Chesimard, who was wounded and captured after shootout on the New Jersey Turnpike yesterday, has been described by the police here as a central figure in an amalgam of black militants who have been linked to the murders and attempted murders of policemen.

title: TV: Friedman's  Steambath on WNET Tomorrow
description: Bruce Jay Friedman's Steambath had a respectable run at an Off Broadway theater a couple of years ago.

title: KISSINGER5 VIEWS CAMBODIA PARLEY AS POSSIBLE SOON
description: WASHINGTON, May 3Henry A. Kissinger said today that the situation in Cambodia had improved both militarily and politically in recent weeks and that there was a possibility that negotiations might begin in the near future to end the fighting there.

title: In Charity's Name, Mansion Is Turned Into Designers
description: The movers and shakers of New York, society came in out of the rain last night to view the transformed Gerrich H. Milliken mansion at 723 Park Avenue. And no, one seemed to care whether or not the rooms had been swept clean of their original characterall in the name of charityrby 19 decorators whcr, had done up, the rooms lavishly, to say the least.

title: COST CUTTING IS SET BY WARD FOODS, INC.
description: William Howlett, chairinan and president of Ward Foods, Inc., said at the company's annual meeting yesterday in Wilmette, Ill., that the company had embarked upon a costcutting program, was concentrating on consumer goods and was disposing of assets not related to consumer goods.

title: Parochial School Aid Pushed
description: CONCORD, N. H., May 3 (AP) State Attorney General Warren Rudman said today that he would appeal to the United States Supreme Court a three judge Federal courts ruling that struck down New Hampshire's aid program for parochial schools. Mr. Rudman's brief statement was issued through an aide. Gov. Meldrim Thomson Jr., a Republican, directed Mr. Rudman yesterday to vigorously protect the aid program by appealing to the country's highest tribunal.

title: Hoboken Mayor Election May Reverse 69 Vote
description: HOBOREN, May 3The soun trucks are cruising the neigh borhoods, and Washingto Street, the main shopping area is plastered with red, white and blue campaign postersa signs that this town has one again been seized with th quadriennial madness know as a mayoral election.

title: National League
description: Cincinnati 6, New York 5 (n.). Chicago 4, Los Angeles 1 (n.). Pittsburgh 14, San Francisco 5. St. Louis 3, San Diego 1 (n)

title: Fruehauf Weighs Dividend
description: William Grace, chairman of the Fruehauf Corporation, said yesterday at the annual meeting in Detroit that if the company did as well this year as it was internally forecasting; the board would probably increase the dividend from its present $1.70 a share annual rate. Robert Rowan, president, estimated earnings this year at about $4.a share, against $3.05 a share last year.

title: REV. E. L. HESTON, VATICAN AIDE, DIES
description: ROME, May 3The Most Rev. Edward Louis Heston, head of the Vatican's relations with news organizations, died last night on a flightfrom New Orleans to Denver. He was on one of his frequent visits to the United States. He was 65 years old.

title: EXCHANGE TO SEEK BROKERS FEE RISE
description: Plans to raise commission rates Old possibly other brokerage charges that would affect all small and some large investors were endorsed yesterday by directors of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: NAACP Legal Fund Names DeWind to Head 1973 Drive
description: The appointment of Adrian W. DeWind as national chairman of the NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund's 33d annual fundraising campaign was announced yesterday by William T. Coleman Jr., the organization's president.

title: OTB LineUp for Derby
description: OTB LineUp for Derby

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his April 23 address to The Associated Press, Henry Kissinger declared that in seeking to find the solution for the management of their diversity the Atlantic nations must work out a blueprint that will redefine the common objectives which underline their unity. Such a blueprint, a new Atlantic Charter, will build upon the record of the past, will deal with the problems that success has created and will establish for the Atlantic nations a new relationship in the development of which that new major power center, Japan, can share.

title: DRUG DEALER GUILTY OF BLOCKING JUSTICE
description: Vincent Pacelli Jr., a convicted heroin dealer, was found guilty in Federal Court here yesterday of charges that he obstructed justice and violated the civil rights of a 28yearold Manhattan model by murdering her last year to prevent her from testifying against him in al narcotics case.

title: SCANDAL DELAYS WHITE HOUSE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 3Under the White House schedule that existed before the Watergate disclosures precipitated a staff shakeup, a new public information operation for the executive branch was to have been announced several days ago.

title: A WHITE N.A.A.C.P. SET UP IN NEWARK
description: NEWARK, May 3 Formation of an equal employment opportunity counseling and legalaid service for white ethnic groups was announced today by the recently established Center for Urban Ethnic Affairs of New Jersey.

title: A RifleCarrying Robber Makes Off With Dessert
description: WATERTOWN, N. Y., May 3 (UPI)Ivan G. Green told the police that after he locked his service station last night, he was confronted by a riflecarrying robber as he approached his parked car.

title: Navy Freeze on Transfers And Promotions Is Lifted
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 (AP) The Navy said today that it was lifting a sixmonth freeze on promotions, transfers and reenlistment bonuses.

title: Vesco Warrant Issued.
description: A warrant for the arrest of. Robert L. Vesco, the New Jersey financier who secretly gave $200,000 to President Nixon's reelection campaign, was issued in Federal court here yesterday. Details on Page 19.

title: Ludlam Star Of Camille In Title Role
description: Charles Ludlam has brazenly cast himself on Garboed waters, playing Marguerite Gautier, La Dame aux Camelias, herself, in his own free adaptation of the Dumas work. Ludlam's Ridiculous Theatrical Company Camille opened Wednesday at the 13th Street Theater.

title: W.H.A. Playoffs
description: CHAMPIONSHIP

title: Football Transactions NATIONAL LEAGUE
description: ST. LOWSGary Cuozzo, quarterback, retired.

title: KALMBACH LINKED TO DESTRUCTION OF CAMPAIGN DATA
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 Herbert W. Kalmbach, who was President Nixon's personal attorney until a few days ago, has told Government investigators that he destroyed all his campaign finance records before the new Federal campaign finance law took effect April 7 last year, sources close to the case said today.

title: CITY FACES BIG CUTS IN HEALTH SERVICES
description: ALBANY, May 3The State Department of Social Services, after completing the first of al series of audits of New York City's Medicaid reimbursement claims, today ordered a $7.7million reduction in the city's next reimbursement check.

title: 4 in Mackell's OfficeGot Free Car Use, Avis Says
description: The AvisRentACar System, Inc., permitted at least four employes in the office of former District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell of Queens to use cars free at a time the office was prosecuting a case whose outcome benefited Avis, according to documents presented to the Joint Legislative Committee on Crime.

title: Marceau Explains Aim of His Miming
description: Marcel Marceau, the mime, who has been performing at the City Center, is fluent in English, German, Italian and Spanish as well as gesture, and walking along Central Park South he had the following things to say:

title: YOGT IS MEDALIST AT 71 IN LI. GOLF
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L. I. May 3  Marlen Vogt, a Federal Bureau of Investigatorl, agent stationed in New York City, took the afternoo noff to shoot excellent toff in terrible weather and win the medal in the annual William D. Richardson amateur tournament by two strokes today.

title: DR. F. CYRIL JAMES
description: LONDON, May 3 (Reuters)Dr. F. Cyril James, principal and vice chancellor of McGill University from 1939 to 1962, died today, at his home near here. He was 69 years old.

title: U. of Pittsburgh Dismisses First Black Academic Dean
description: PITTSBURGH, May 3 Lawrence C. Howard, the first balck academic dean in the history of the University of Pittsburgh, has been dismissed after turning down a request to resign, university officials confirmed today.

title: BILL ON V,D. TESTS PASSES IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, N. Y. May 3The State Senate gave final legislative approval to a bill requiring physicians and administrators of clinics who provide obstetrical, gynecological, contraceptive and abortion services to suggest venera disease tests to patients who are residents of the state.

title: A Bitter Anniversary
description: Three years ago today several hundred students gathered at noon on the campus of Kent State University to protest the invasion of Cambodia and the continued presence of Ohio National Guard troops. Twenty minutes later a fusillade of gunfire left four students dead and nine more wounded, all victims of military ammunition.

title: Rhodesia Frees Newsman And Forces Him to Depart
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 3  The Rhodesian journalist Peter Niesewand, whose arrest in February endangered the search for a solution to Rhodesia's racial and political crisis, was released from jail today and put on a plane to London.

title: Censure of Jane Fonda Fails
description: LOS ANGELES, May 3 (UPI) The Los Angeles City Council refused today to consider a resolution censuring Jane Fonda for statements she made concerning prisoners of war. After the council adjourned, the actress reiterated charges at a news conference that P.O.W.'s were manipulated by the Pentagon into giving a distorted account of North Vietnamese prison camps and that those prisoners who contended there was systematic torture were not telling the truth.

title: PASTORE REJECTS GIANTS TV PLAN
description: Pete Rozelle, the National Football League's commissioner, went to bat, for the New York Giants in Washington yesterday and struck out.

title: Chicken With Rice
description: Chicken With Rice

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: Scranton, Pa.Bobby Cassidy, Levittown, L. I., knocked out Tommy Hicks, Ithaca, N. Y., 9 rounds, light heavyweights.

title: Report on Moving of Aliens From U. S. Stirs Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, May 3 A furor within the Government and press of this country has been touched off by a news report describing a system, apparently in violation of Mexican law, that is used by American and Mexican immigration officials to remove from the United States to the interior of Mexico aliens who illegally entered the United States from Mexico.

title: The Pop Life
description: Chuck Berry is reputed to travel only with his guitar and one amplifier. All he needs is a stage and an electrical outlet, and he's rocking n rolling. Not so with the current superstar groups of rock, who are turning themselves into rock nroll heavies.

title: Bridge
description: The dean of American bridge writers recently received a signal honor from his professional colleagues. Alphonse Moyse Jr. of New York, known throughout the world of bridge as Sonny, has been elected honorary member of the International Bridge Press Association, and is the first American to be so honored.

title: Yankee Records
description: BATTING

title: Suspect in Shootout Is Seized in Jersey
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, N. J., May 3After a 36hour manhunt, state troopers and local policemen today arrested a man they had sought as a fugitive in the shootout yesterday morning on the New Jersey Turnpike In which a state trooper and a former leader of the Black Panthers were killed.

title: Met's Records
description: BATTING PITCHING

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ATLANTICA LIVORNO (Atiantica), Lisbon May 16 and Genoa 21; sails from Port Newark, N.J.

title: Apartment Project Voted For Midtown West Side
description: The Board of Estimate voted last night for a proposal to build two 46story apartment houses to the west of Times Square as a means of upgrading the midtown West Side.

title: Upstate Bank Operations Approved for Chase
description: WASHINGTON, May 3The Federal Reserve Board approved without dissent today the proposed creation of a new bank in Albany by the Chase Manhattan Corporation and the acquisition of a relatively small bank in Buffalo.

title: Rail Traffic Increases
description: WASHINGTON, May 3The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled 16.1 billion tonmiles, 2.9 per cent above the 1972 week. Carloadings were 528,058 cars, 0.1 per cent above the 1972 level. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 5 per cent above last year.

title: Recently Published Books
description: An Eye for a Bird: The Autobiography of a Bird Photographer, by Eric Hosking with Frank W. Lane (Paul S. Eriksson, $10).

title: SECRETARIAT GETS NO.10 DERBY POST; 13 COLTS ENTERED
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 3 The names of 13 horses were dropped into the entry box to day for Saturday's Kentucky Derby. There have been bigger fields in the past, but this year's race will be the richest because of increased entry fees If all 13 go, the 1mile classic for 3year olds will have gross value of $198,800, with winner's share of $155,050.

title: City Seeks Mortgage Unit to Curb Slums
description: In a major move to prevent transitional neighborhoods from degenerating into slum areas, the city plans to submit a bill to the Legislature within a week that would create a local F.H.A. type of agency to insure bank mortgages.

title: Gov. Thomson Scores Crime Hearing
description: CONCORD, N.H., May 3 (AP) Gov. Meldrim Thomson Jr. says he believes that a twoday legislative hearing into circumstances surrounding his visit to a criminal intelligence agency was an attempt to embarrass him.

title: Health Foods Among the Fish
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: Haldeman and Ehrlichman Testify Before Grand Jury
description: WASHINGTON, May 3H. R. Haldeman and John Ehrlichman, who resigned recently as senior advisers President Nixon, appeared at length today before a Federal grand jury investigating thel Watergate affair.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: CROSSWORD PUZZLE

title: U.M.W. Aide Indicted
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 (AP) The Justice Department announced today that Ernest Stultz, a field representative of the United Mine Workers of America, had been indicted on charges of disdirecting union funds. He is with U.M.W. District 19 in Tennessee and Kentucky.

title: Connecticut Budget Reduces Sales Tax
description: HARTFORD, May 3  The Connecticut General Assembly approved a $1.2billion budget today and gave the state its first tax cut in a quarter of century. It also approved the first major tax reform in 25 years.

title: Keeping Jersey Reform
description: In Jersey City mayoral balloting next Tuesday, voters will have an opportunity to reaffirm their earlier decision for reform. Mayor Paul T. Jordan won office in a special election a year and a half ago to fill the unexpired term of a machine Mayor sentenced to prison, along with the City Council President, on charges of extortion and conspiracy. Mayor Jordan, now seeking reelection to a full term, is being opposedas he was originallyby candidate tied to the old, corrupt political ring.

title: NADIA POTTS DANCES A DEMURE SYLPHIDE
description: Nadia Potts of the National Ballet of Canada took over the title role of La Sylphide Wednesday night at the Metropolitan Opera House, where Rudolf Nureyev continues his marathon string of nightly performances with the company.

title: Ellingtonians Toast Duke
description: It might logically have been called a pride of pianists if the Lion had been there. But Willie (The Lion) Smith died 11 days before the concert last Sunday to celebrate the 74th birthday of his most noted follower, Duke Ellington.

title: Stage: Whitehead's Alpha and Beta
description: Marriage is hellat least that seems to be the message of E. A. Whitehead's play Alpha Beta, which arrived at the Eastside Playhouse last night. Well, at least marriage is hell for Frank and Norma Elliot, a Liverpudlian couple who tear each other apart over nine years and three acts.
