description: NORTH SALEM, N. Y.The city mouse has been scratching in his country cousin's garden here lately. And the resultto the delight of both breedslooks like a blooming success.

title: Miss Dubben Bride of W. B. Ryland Jr.
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L. I., May 5Miss Judith York Dubben, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Maxwell Dubben of Pleasantville, N. Y., and Sagaponack, was married here this afternoon to William Bradford Ryland Jr., of New York, Southampton and Richmond, a vice president of Bear, Stearns & Co., a New York investment concern.

title: Hobbs Paces Qualifiers for Today's Laguna Auto Race
description: MONTEREY, Calif., May 5The EnglishAmerican team of David Hobbs and Brett Lunger led the qualifiers here today for tomorrow's running of the second race of the 1973 L&M Championship for Formula 5000 cars.

title: CONSUMER UNITS GAININ CEIBBEAN
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados, May 3A vocal, combative consumers movement is growing in the Englishspealdng Caribbean, its complaints directed at such things as a frog in a bottle of fruit drink, contaminated catsup, illfitting stockings and disintegrating brooms.

title: Future Social Events
description: May 7The ultracontemporary building which is the Whitney Museum will have as Victorian an air as an innovative committee can effect at the annual Gala for Friends of the Museum. More than 1,000 enthusiasts, with tickets strictly by invitation, will dance between 9 and midnight. Something new  a predance buffet dinner, $12.50 each. Mrs. Armand G. Erpf is chairman.

title: Kleindienst Resignation Is Reported by Pravda
description: MOSCOW, May 5 (AP)Pravda told its readers today for the first time that Richard Kleindienst has resigned as the United States Attorney General. The Communist party daily made no reference to the Watergate affair.

title: City Aide Looks to 76 Bicentennial
description: In his cluttered office on Madison Avenue. Dr. Ronald Lee Gaudreau looks forward to three years from now, when the city, in hisplans, will burst out in selfrenewal in commemoration of the American Revolution.

title: CUBS SCORE, 74, ON LATE ATTACK
description: Expos Triumph, 86 Dodgers Drub Cards, 113 Hooton Stop Giants With One Hit for 7 Innings

title: Such stuff as stomach upsets are made on
description: There's birth, copulation and death, said Eliot's Sweeney. Primitive man Surrounded these events  and puberty, betrothal, marriage and fatherhoodwith constellations of ceremony. The Jews still have circumcision and bar mitzvah; the Catholics, first communion and last rites. But most Americans lack those observances called rites of passage which dramatize a significant change in status.

title: New and Reconunended
description: THE FALL OF AMERICA, by Allen Ginsberg. (City Lights, paper, $2.50.) The poet at midpoint and middle age, some friends now dead, the world tasted, turns to observing the geography of Americaand composes a long poem of fragments of these states.

title: Madison: A Sound of Music
description: MADISONWhy do I have to come all the way out to Madison to experience one of the best performances have had with an orchestra? asked Joseph Fuchs, a violinist, after a guest appearance with the Colonial Symphony Orchestra.

title: China Experts in L.I. Seminar
description: GREAT NECK, L. I.The, WashingtonPeking thaw, which began two years ago with the advent of PingPong diplomacy, reaches here today with the arrival of several experts on various aspects of Chinese life to conduct a weeklong Flying Seminar during which they will live with local families.

title: AROUND THE
description: Cut faded daffedils from plants oto prevent seed setting; do not cutdown the foliage. Sow lettuce, spinach, and other salad greens Start rosebush spraying Finish planting grass seed in bare spots Put up fencing for sweet peas. Divide mums.

title: William C. M. Kivlan Marries Elizabeth French Stribling
description: Miss Elizabeth French Stribling and William Charles Mitchell Kivlan were married here yesterday afternoon in St. James Episcopal Church. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Ralph R. Warren Jr., who was assisted by the Rev. Anthony F. Lo Gatto of St. Rosalia's Roman Catholic Church in Brooklyn.

title: Elizabeth Nickerson Bride of T. G. Davis
description: LINCOLN, Mass., May 5Miss Elizabeth Nickerson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Albert L Nickerson of incoln, was married here this afternoon to Thomas Garfield Davis, son of Dr. and Mrs. Edwin W. Davis of Chevy Chase, Md. The Rev. H. William Gregory performed the Protestant ceremony in the First Parish Church.

title: NEWCOMBE, ROCHE RATED NO. 1 BY LOTT
description: John Newcombe and Tony Roche have been selected as the top doubles team In tennis history by George Lott, fivetime United States doubles champion, twice Winner at Wimbledon and considered by many the greatest tactician ever to play doubles. He gives the top position to Newcombe and Roche based on their 10 major tournament victories as a team, including four Wimbledon titles.

title: The mood:
description: JERUSALEM. Beyond the polychrome clichs of tourist folders and the clamor of official handouts, national anniversaries often evoke a note of melancholy and a kind of numbing sorrow. They are like our own birthdays. The older we get, the more elaborate, and sometimes the more expensive, the means by which we attempt to overcome our confusion. Israel's muchheralded 25th anniversary is no exception. While 25 years is still young, Israel's experience has prematurely aged her. The anniversary is celebrated this spring with much ado, but with no little soulsearching as well.

title: Barter, the Latest Thing
description: Don Bishop, who owns Modern Coverall and Uniform Supply in Norwalk, Calif., has purchased many tires, batteries and other supplies over the last nine years for the fleet of trucks he operates. And he hasn't paid one cent for them.

title: We've Learned to Love Our Plastic House
description: CAPE MAY COURTHOUSE, N. J.I live in a house built of styrene foam the same beady, plastic stuff used to make picnic ice coolers.

title: Elizabeth J. Preis Is Bride of Lawrence Driever Jr.
description: Miss Elizabeth Jean Preis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Preis, of Forest Hills Gardens, Queens, and Lawrence Sebastian Driever Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Driever of Upper Montclair, N. J., were married yesterday afternoon by the Rev. Michael C. Conroy in Our Lady Queen of Martyrs Roman Catholic Church in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Anne Sunderman Bride of L. C. Wood Jr.
description: WESTFIELD, N. J. May 5 Miss Anne Davis Sunderman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irwin G. Sunderman of Scotch Plains, N. J., was married here this morning to Leighton Christopher Wood Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Wood of New Canaan, Conn. The Rev. Hugh D. Livengood performed the ceremony in St. Paul's Episcopal Church. He was assisted by the Rev. Kenneth Mackenzie, rector of St. John's Episcopal Church in Larchmont, N. Y.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Discrimination against women in hiring, promotion and pay was the focus of charges, an appeal and settlement yesterday. State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz accused 118 employment agencies here of accepting job orders specifying male applicants only. The jobs were for management trainees, merchandise managers and systems analysts. The chairman of the city's Human Rights Commission, Eleanor Holmes Norton, said city lawyers would appeal a court decision that overturned a commission finding of sex discrimination at Pace College. The commission's ruling last year grew out of a complaint by Dr. Valentine Winsey, an assistant professor, who said she had been denied promotion and tenure because she was woman. An appeal by Pace in State Supreme Court led a finding of insufficient evidence. Women on the faculty of Syracuse University will be paid the same as their male counterparts starting July 1, John James Prucha, the vice chancellor for academic affairs, announced. Now, a female full professor makes $23,000 and a male professor makes $36,750.

title: Baroque Vogue Extends To Summer Festivals
description: I T is no secret that Baroque music has a strong attraction for today's, audiences, particularly among the young. Announce a concert of Bach's music, and the people will generally flock to it, regardless of who's performing. A program of Vivaldi's music, played by a chamber orchestra is more likely to fill Carnegie or PhilharmOnic Hall than an evening of Brahms played by a major symphony. This kind of response is determining the nature of some of the new upcoming summer centers, where instruction for students and concerts for the public are mingled.

title: Baseball Transactions AMERICAN LEAGUE
description: CLEVELANDAdivated Frank Duffy, shortstop. Waived Jerry Kenney, utility infielder.

title: $35,500 OPENS DRIVE BY NEW DRAMATISTS
description: The New Dramatists annual fundraising drive to underwrite its program of aiding new playwrights got under way on Friday.

title: That extraordinary company of writers ironically known as the Lost Generation
description: For too long there has existed a misconception as to what comprises a literary generation. Most of the writers of the postWorld War II era, linked only by the common fact that their work commenced sometime during the years after Hiroshima, have, I'm sure, wondered at one time or another why the notion of belonging to a generation has seemed so illfitting or embarrassing. Born in 1925, I have always considered Saul Bellow, born a decade earlier, as much a part of my generation as Philip Roth, who is eight years younger than I am. This comprises a time span of 18 years and I have remained uneasy with the ideapleased enough to be associated with two writers I consider admirable but rather put off by its palpable lack of logic. It should not have bothered me (not that it has to any great degree), for as Malcolm Cowley points out, we have all been merely victims of an error of definition.

title: The QE2 Will Travel Around World in 75
description: TEL AVIV, May 5 (Reuters)  The British liner Queen Elizabeth 2 will make a roundtheworld voyage in 80 days from New York early in 1975, Capt. Mortimer Hehir said here today.

title: European Scientists Will Study Effect of Chemicals on Humans
description: ROME, May 5A group of leading European scientists agreed this week to develop biological models to study how chemicals affect the human body when it is exposed to them daily.

title: Wallace Gets Tricycle
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 5 (AP) A Minnesota inventor has come up with a handpropelled tricycle that Gov. George C. Wallace can ride, although he is paralyzed from vie waist down. Angelo Vittori of Chisholm, Minn., delivered the vehicle to Mr. Wallace yesterday.

title: Columbia Beats Yale at Net To Clinch Eastern Crown
description: Columbia clinched its second straight Eastern Intercollegiate Tennis Association championship defeating a stubborn Yale, 81, yesterday at the Columbia Tennis Center at Baker Field. The victory was the Lions 12th straight this season and gave them their second straight undefeated E.I.T.A. season.

title: U.S. Judge Backs Maine on Oil Spill
description: PORTLAND, Me., May 5A United States District Court Judge has ruled that the State of Maine is entitled to recover payment for damages to coastal waters and marine life caused by an oil spill if it can prove liability for the spill.

title: Black Pages Widening Scope
description: EAST ORANGE  The Black Pages, a new classified shopping directory devoted to black enterprises, is being distributed free throughout Bergen, Essex, Union, Passaic and Hudson Counties by the more than 200 black business owners and professionals listed therein. It also is available at Pathmark and A. & P. stores and at branches of the National Newark and Essex Bank.

title: Nixon Flies to the Bahamas From. Key Biscayne, Fla.
description: GRAND CAY, the Bahamas, May 5 (AP)President Nixon flew here today for some relaxation in the Bahamian sun.

title: The JobInterview Game
description: What do you see yourself doing in 25 years?

title: Language Study
description: Traditional foreign language courses, once an accepted part of most high school and college schedules, are fading into the curriculum background, apparently victims of the trend away from required courses.

title: BLACK YOUTH TRIED IN SHOTS AT POLICE
description: DETROIT, May 5A 19yearold black youth named Hayward Brown, charged by the state with shooting four members of the Detroit Police Department's most elite crimefighting force last December, went on trial here this week.

title: Social Announcements
description: Births Engagements Weddings

title: State U. at Stony Brook Reports It Had $100Million Impact on Economy on L.I.
description: STONY BROOK, L.I.The economic impact that the State University here had on Nassau and Suffolk Counties amounted to more than $100million in the past fiscal year, according to Carl E. Hanes, the university's assistant vice president and controller.

title: Love God, be good and mind your manners.
description: Iona and Peter Opie, as their fascinating scholarly volumes testify, probably know as much about children's games and sayings as anyone in the world.

title: Turtle Back Zoo Expands Program
description: WEST ORANGE  The Turtle Back Zoo; which has been sending small animals into Essex County schools as an educational program for the last few years, has expanded Its program to reach beyond county borders.

title: N.B.C. TOLD TO REPLY ON FAIRNESS ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP) The Federal Communications Commission informed the National Broadcasting Company yesterday that it appeared not to have met its Fairness Doctrine obligation In a pensionplan program on Sept. 12, 1972.

title: The Best of the Good
description: It might be said of children's books, as it is of children themselves, that when they are good they are very, very good and when they are bad they are simply awful. Yes, it might be said, but it wouldn't be true. What is true is there are indeed awful children's books and pathetically few of the goodonly dozen this spring. Sadly, most children's books are neither good nor bad, they're mediocre. The six books cited on these pages are the best of the good ones. They have been selected without fear or favor by The Times's children's book editor and assistant editor from the 1,000 books published so far this year.

title: Sample of Brooklyn Culture
description: A sampling of Brooklyn's most outstanding community cultural groups will be presented during the first Brooklyn!!  Adventures in Entertainment series, which opened yesterday at the Brooklyn Academy of Music and continues for the following three Saturdays.

title: Moira Ann Woolard Is Married
description: TAPPAN, N. Y., May 5In the Tappan Reformed Churc'h this afternoon Miss Mona Ann Woolard was married to Christopher Ely Thiele by the Rev. John Adams Springer.

title: Mary Maxson Bride of R. H. Lafferandre
description: ISLIP, L. I., May 5Miss Mary Leslie Maxson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William L. Maxson of East Islip and Pompano Beach, Fla., was married yesterday afternoon to Robert Halsey Lafferandre, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Halsey Lafferandre of Sayville. The Rev. William H. Wagner performed the ceremony in St. Mark's Episcopal pal Church.

title: The Kohlers of Wisconsin
description: KOHLER, Wis.So'e of America's leading figures bathe in Kohler bathtits. Kohler engines power:the garden tractors of suburbia and the sampans of southeast Asia. Kohler standby electric plants purr in motor homes and yachts. Kohler precison controls in the Saturn anti Atlas rockets helped send astronauts to the moon.

title: Aqueduct Entries
description: Roosevelt Entries

title: Worries Mar Restoration Group's Birthday
description: The BedfordStuyvesant Restoration Corporation, founded in 1967 to help stop the decay in the city's largest black community and to rejuvenate the area, celebrates its sixth anniversary today worried about a financial crisis and Federal housing cutbacks, yet determined to push forward with its mission of black enterprsie.

title: ARMENIAN CHURCH FOCUSES ON SCHISM
description: WORCESTER, Mass., May 6 The 400,000member Armenian Church of America, celebrating its 75th anniversary, faces the challenge of eliminating recent factionalism by helping to close a centuryold schism with its Protestant wing.

title: Peacock and Hatiee Win Hudson Open Canoe Event
description: NORTH CREEK, N.Y., May 6 (AP)Dick Peacock of Schenectady, N.Y., and Floyd Hatlee of Mechanicville, N.Y., paddled through 71/2 miles of Adirondack rapids and past 370 competitors today to capture the twoman open canoe class of the 16th annual White Water Derby. They covered the Hudson River run in 55 minutes 31 seconds.

title: Marine Commandant
description: WASHINGTON, May 6In early 1957, an ambitious Marine Corps colonel with a record of heroism in World War II left the Pentagon for four years to serve as an aide to a politician downtown. The colonel was Robert Everton Cushman Jr. The politician was Vice President Richard M. Nixon. The Marine officer served Mr. Nixon for the last four years of his Vice  Presidency as his chief adviser on national security, and the close relationship that developed played no small part in the officer's rising career.

title: Grandma Moses Schoolhouse Is Now a Museum
description: BENNINGTON, Vt., May 4The Grandma Moses Schoolhouse Museum, crammed with mementos of the painter but only a few of her paintings, opened here this week as an adjunct of the Bennington Museum.

title: College Results
Bengalis Rounded Up in, Raids On Homes in Pakistani Capital
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, May 6 (Reuters)The Pakistani police rounded up at least several hundred Bengalis in this capital early today.

title: Gov. McCall Seeks to Curb Oregon's Growth
description: SALEM, Ore.Gov. Torn McCall winced a little the other day when a visitor recalled his widely quoted statement of two years ago: Come visit Oregon again and again, but for heaven's sake don't come here to live.

title: Ron Daniel Again Captures 10Mile Walk on Boardwalk
description: SEASIDE HEIGHTS, N.J., May 6(AP)Ron Daniel of the New York Athletic Club today became the first winner to repeat in the 10year history of, the 10mile Olympic development walking race here on the boardwalk.

title: COURT CONSENSUS REACHEDINALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 6A consensus agreement has been reached by leaders in the Assembly on a package of bills that rejects substantial parts of Governor Rockefeller's program for restructuring the courts, according to the Judiciary Committee chairman.

title: CRAMPTON VICTOR BY NOT WITH 277
description: HOUSTON, May 6When Bruce Crampton came from Australia in 1957, his first United States golf tournament was the Houston open. He wont the event today, now worth $205,000, with a 72hole aggregate of 277, one stroke ahead of Dave Stockton.

title: Relay Called Fire Hazard On 69 and 70 Cadillacs
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP) The Center for Auto Safety said today that an electrical relay in 1969 and 1970 Cadillacs constituted a serious fire hazard.

title: PRICES UP SHARPLY AT FAIR IN CANTON
description: HONG KONG, May 6Foreign traders at this year's spring trade fair in Canton have been jolted by sharp price rises in almost every export item, putting costs for some products above world price levels.

title: 2 Quints Condition Stable
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 6 (UPI)Diane and Sc.:At, the youngest of the Anderson quintuplets. born April 26, were reported in stable condition today after their recovery from a condition that caused them to stop breathing briefly. The other three children of Mr. and Mrs. Eric Anderson of Brush Prairie, Wash., were receiving normal feeding for premature babies, officials said.

title: Staten Island Couple Killed In Belt Parkway Accident
description: A Staten Island couple, driving home early yesterday on the Belt Parkway from a visit to friends on Long Island, were killed when an eastbound car jumped the divider and landed on the roof of their automobile.

title: ContraceptivesSale Bill Due for Vote
description: ALBANY, May 6The Slate Senate is expected to act this week on a bill that would substantially liberalize the 100yearold state law restricting the sale and store display of contraceptives.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BRONX CHEER Nature lovers, including those who hesitate to venture beyond the walks of Central Park, can profitably trek up to the Bronx from today to May 25 for a rare exhibition of paintings and prints from the collections of the New York Zoological Society and the New York Botanical Garden. The exhibition, in honor of Bronx Week, kicks off today with a jazz concert and reception, between 5 and 8 P.M., at the Bronx Museum of the Arts, which can be reached through the Grand Concourse entrance to the Bronx County Building, 161st Street and the Concourse.

title: Higher Commission Rates Greeted by Wide Approval
description: Wall Street is reacting with general approvalamid some misgivingsto the plan endorsed last Thursday by the New York Stock Exchange's directors to raise commission rates.

title: Burns Says Budget Reform Is Crucial to U.S. Strength
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP) Arthur T. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve System, said today that this country could not afford large budget deficits and that budget reform was essential to a strong American democracy.

title: Foes of Fuentes Win Distric 1 Election
description: A mostly white, slate opposed to Luis Fuentes, the controversial District 1 superintendent, has won six of the nine schoolboard seats in elections in the racially torn Lower East Side district. The slate was backed by the United Federation of Teachers.

title: Yachting Results AT LARCH MONT Y. C. PreSeason EyeCleaner Regatta (Wind, NW 68 Knots)
description: Star Class (W.L.I.S. Invitation Series, Second Race; Seven Started1, Howard T, Walden Jr., Larchmont Y.C.; 2, Lawrence Shaper, Sea Cliff, L.I.; 3, Steven Andrews, Centerport, L.I.; 4, William and Alan Bartle, Sea Cliff; 5, Fred E. Heine, Greenwood Lakes, N.J.; 6, Sandy Warrick, Cape Ann, Mass.; 7, Gerard Carne, East River, N.Y.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: Concordia: The Story of Francesca da Rimini, Told by Her Daughter, by Frances Fleetwood (St. Martin's Press, $6.50). Diary of love tragedy in 13thcentury Italy.

title: Events Today
description: Events Today

title: Jane Goren Is Wed To
description: Miss Jane Goren, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hy Goren Seaford, L. I., and Miami, was married here yesterday to Gary M. Shapiro, son Mr. and Mrs. Wallace Shapiro of Hazlet, N. J. Rabbi Philip Schechter performed the ceremony at the Beekman Towers Hotel.

title: DR. FINCH REFUSED RIGHT TO PRACTICE
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 6 (UPI)The state authorities denied the request of Dr. R. Bernard Finch to practice medicine in Missouri because he was convicted of murdering his wife in California in 1959.

title: The Rise of Joe McCrane: Success Follows Marriage
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., May 6 For Joseph M. McCrane Jr., central figure in a Federal grandjury investigation of possible fraud in raising funds for Governor Cahill's 1969 election campaign, it was marriage tol Joan Mori that brought him to Cherry Hill and opened the door to a career in business and politics.

title: 40% Decline Noted In Addicts on Relief With City Screening
description: The number of addicts on city welfare decreased from 34,000 to 19,615 in the last 12 months  a drop of 40 per cent  according to an announcement yesterday by Jule M. Sugarman, the Human Resources Administrator. The figures are from April 1, 1972, to last April 1.

title: Staff of 10 Downing St. Heath's Country Guests
description: LONDON, May 6Except for emergencyduty officials, 10 Downing Street was deserted tonight and about 200 employes there went to Chequers, the Prime Minister's country residence in Buckinghamshire, as his guests.

title: Box Scores of Yesterday's Major League Games
description: Box Scores of Yesterday's Major League Games

title: College Fund Pills Post
description: JERSEY CITY, May 6Thomas Stanton, president of the First Jersey National Bank, has been named ehainnan of the board of ditecters,of the Jersey City State College Development Fund, Inc., 147 Dr. Edward J. Meade Jr., chairman of the college's board, of, trustees.

title: Bridges Wins Reelection As Head of Longshoremen
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 6 (UPI)Harry Bridges was reelected yesterday as president of the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union.

title: Mrs. Dorothy Lawrence Dead; Active in G.O.P. Politics Here
description: AGUSTA, Ga., May 6Mrs. Dorothy Bell Lawrence, a former member of the New York State Assembly long active in Manhattan Republican politics, died here today. She was 61 years old.

title: 7 Die in Carolina Crash
description: DALLAS, N.C., May 6 (AP) Seven persons were killed early today when two automobiles collided headon on U.S. 321 near Dallas, about 20 miles west of Charlotte. The Highway Patrol said that one car veered across the center line into the path of an oncoming car.

title: Monroe Excels With ReedWest Hurt
description: In another furious finish, the third in three games, the New York Knicks held off the Los Angeles Lakers, 8783, at Madison Square Garden yesterday and took a 21 lead in the fourofsevengame series for the championship iof the National Basketball Association.

title: South Vietnamese. Try Guerrilla Tactics
description: HUE, South Vietnam, May 4 The Government troops defending Hue have adopted guerrilla tactics as they continue fighting the war without their American partners.

title: Goodyear Offer Is Rejected
description: AKRON, Ohio, May 6 (AP)United Rubber Workers Local 2 here unanimously rejected today a threeyear, contract offer from Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company and announced that it would attempt to have national negotiations reopened.

title: LIONESS IS LOOSE FOR FIVE HOURS
description: A 4yearold, 400pound lioness named Elsa escaped from her cage at a zoo in an Albany suburb yesterday morning, led a posse of 150 state troopers, sheriff's deputies, conservation officers and policemen from four towns on a fivehour chase through the rolling countryside and finally returned to the zoo at the call of her matea tiger named Linus.

title: CLYDE DART
description: Clyde Dart, a lawyer, who retired seven years ago as deputy director of the incometaxviolation division of the Internal Revenue Service here, died Thursday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 3 Sheridan Square.

title: $1.5Million Reportedly Paid, To Kidnappers in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 6 (Reuters)A ransom of $1.5million was paid for the release of a Swiss businessman's son kidnapped five day ago, unconfirmed reports said.

title: Advertising: K. & E. in TakeOver
description: Kenyon & Eckhardt, of New York, and Colman Prentis & Varley, of London, which for the last eight years have owned a little piece of one another, have changed their relationship. Now K. & E. owns it all.

title: Viren 5,000Meter Victor
description: CHIBA, Japan, May 6 (UPI) Finland's Lasse Viren defeated Japan's Ichio Sato by about, five yards today in the 5,000 meter run of the ninth International Goodwill track and field meet. Viren was clocked in 13 minutes 58.8 seconds.

title: Mrs. Nixon Flies to Capital
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP) Mrs. Richard M. Nixon flew back from a Florida weekend tonight for a luncheon she is giving for Senate wives tomorrow. Returning with Mrs. Nixon were her younger daughter and soninlaw, Mr. and Mrs. David Eisenhower.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A consensus agreement has been reached by leaders in the New York State Assembly on a package of bills that reject substantial parts of Governor Rockefeller's courtrestructuring program, according to Assemblyman Edward F. Crawford, Oswego Republican, chairman of the Judiciary Committee.

title: No Vietcong Candidates In South Vietnam Voting
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 6 (Reuters)South Vietnam held its first elections today since the ceasefire but Vietcong candidates were not allowed to participate.

title: Federal Bar Group Opposes Absolute News Privilege
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 6 (UPI)The Federal Bar Association's Criminal Law Committee announced tonight that its members decisively rejected the concept of an absolute newsman's privilege.

title: Omaha Printers Stay Out
description: OMAHA, May 6 (AP)Most union printers remained off the job at the Omaha WorldHerald, Nebraska's largest daily newspaper, today as a strike continued through a third day. The newspaper continued to publish, with management and other nonunion personnel working strikers jobs.

title: 276 Ride in Central Park Bike Race
description: At 8 A.M. yesterday 276 riders mounted their bicycles at about 85th Street in Central Park and took off on a 50mile race that was to take the finishers eight times around the park road.

title: The Politics of Language
description: WASHINGTONBack when we had a half million troops in Vietnam, an irate citizen wrote a letter to the White House addressed not to the President but to his speechwriters. Why did the President keep warning about precipitous withdrawals, the writer wanted to know, when the correct adjective was precipitate?

title: Bomb Call Grounds Airliner
description: VIENNA, May 6 (Reuters)A Dutch airliner bound for Israel with 70 people on board today was ordered to make an emergency landing at Vienna airport after an anonymous telephone caller had told the KLM airline office in Tel Aviv just after the aircraft had taken off from Amsterdam that a bomb was hidden aboard. A thorough search in Vienna found no trace of explosives but as a precautionary measure passengers were to fly to Iisrael aboard another airliner.

title: Red Smith
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 6Sham has a sore mouth and a gap where two teeth should be, Secretariat is wearing mud packs on his happy feet, and in the Churchill Downs counting house they are using figures never before mentioned in that companysix million  seven million  seven and a half  come on, let's have a drink and leave the small change to the boys.

title: Astrosystem Production Is Still Geared to Military
description: LAKE SUCCESS, N. Y.Of course, we wish we had come up with the handheld calculator like Bowmar did but a lot of small militaryoriented companies have entered the industrial market with dreams of applying their stateoftheart technologies to salable products only to find the customers aren't ready for such advances.

title: Raben's Stoop Is Winner In Riverside Y.C. TuneUp
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 6 La Forza Del Destino, a 51foot sloop owned by Norman Raben of Loudonville, N.Y., was the winner on Long Island Sound today in the Riverside Yacht Club's ninth annual spring tuneup race for cruising yachts. Because of wind failure, only 11 boats of 68 starters were able to finish.

title: MITCHELL DERIDES PLEA BY HIS WIFE
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (UPI)  Former Attorney General John N. Mitchell said today that it was ridiculous for anybody to take seriously his wife's suggestion that President Nixon resign because of the Watergate scandal.

title: Reds Destroy Ship in Cambodia Convoy
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Monday, May 7(Reuters) Communist fire has struck and burned out another ship as it tried to run the Mekong River to reach Phnom Penh with vital fuel supplies, the military command reported today.

title: Some Analysts Think Rates Of Bonds Have Yet to Peak
description: The unusual present configuration of the capital markets with yields on longterm bonds just slightly above those on securities due this yearincreases the likelihood that the peak in bond rates is not yet in sight. We have almost reached the point where a buyer is paid a premium to stay in short instruments, was the Credit way Smith, BarMarkets ney & Co., Inc., sized up the situation in its latest bondmarket review.

title: Indians Sign Accord to End 68Day Seizure of Town
description: PINE RIDGE, S. D., May 6Federal and Indian negotiators announced here today an agreement to end the 68day occupation of the village of Wounded Knee by militant Indians and their supporters.

title: Black Designers Find Success in a Predominantly White Field
description: Connie Legendre and John H. Smith are interior designers separated by a continent, their ages and their different styles. Yet Miss Legendre, who is in her 30's, and Mr. Smith, who is 50, have had some of the same experiences  she in New York, he in Los Angeles.

title: BRUCE ON HIS WAY TO POST IN PEKING
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP) David K. E. Bruce left for Peking today to establish the United States first diplomatic mission in China in a generation. He said: I'm looking forward to this mission with great enthusiasm.

title: White Sox Ace Wins, 112, for 7th Victory
description: CHICAGO, May 6Wilbur Wood suffered a slight aberration in the first inning today, but it apparently shook up the Yankees more than it did the Chicago pitcher.

title: AtomTest Riots in France
description: PARIS, May 6 (UPI)Opponents of France's nuclear testing.program battled the police during demonstrations in the southern cities of Toulouse and Montpellier, the police said, today. At, least 12 persons were reported injured in Toulouse, where 400 demonstrators occupied the central plaza to protest French testing in the South Pacific.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Dance Magazine awards for this year will be presented today to Rudolf Nureyev and to three brothers, William, Harold and Lew Christensen.

title: Student Foe of Vietnam War Elected to Council in Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 6A former United States Marine lieutenant who once called for an end to the Vietnam war at a rally attended by President Nixon was elected to the Council in this university city yesterday.

title: FOES OF FUENTES WIN IN DISTRICT I UnionBacked Slate Wins 6, of 9 School Board Seats on Lower East Side
description: A mostly white slate opposed to Luis Fuentes, the controversial District 1 superintendent, has won six of the nine school(board seats in elections in the racially torn Lower East Side district. The slate was backed by the United Federation of Teachers.

title: Shalom
description: In just one generation the Jewish people have experienced the deepest despair of holocaust and the most profound exhilaration of nationhood. These are epic events of our time to be measured against the chronology of millennia. Today the state of Israel marks'its 25th year of existence in the modern world. This may be but a small milestone in 4,000 years of a people's recorded history, but it is an awesome human achievement of a living generation in the face of the forces arrayed against it.

title: WALSH WOULD SPURN A WATERGATE OFFER
description: WASHINGTON, May 6Lawrence E. Walsh, a New York lawyer who was reported by The New York Times today as having been described as the likeliest candidate for the position of special prosecutor in the Watergate investigation, said this afternoon that he would not accept it if he were asked and repeated that he had not been asked.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In the wake of the international monetary fiascos of the past two years, United States commercial policy is now set on a collision course with disaster unless some prompt adjustments are made.

title: PreMed Course for PostGraduates Helps Get Them Into Medical School
description: In the fall of 1970 Judy Blitman, 1961 graduate of Radcliffe College, went to the Albert Einstein College of Medicine to find out how to get into medical school.

title: 1,000 Ask Hess Release
description: BONN, May 6 (AP)About 1,000 demonstrators paraded through the streets of Bonn today to demand the release of Rudolf Hess, the Hitler deputy who last month marked his 79th birthday in Spandau Prison in Berlin. The march was led by Wolf Ruediger Hess, son of the last of Htllees close associates still prison.

title: Union Aide Warns on Imports
description: BOSTON, May 6 (AP)An official of the International Union of Electrical Workers said that Congressmen who did not vote for the Burkeliartke bill to restrict imports would not receive financial support from the union. Peter DeCico, president of the union's District 2, made the statement to delegates representing the 200,000member Industrial Union Department of Massachusetts.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: BRITISH RUGBY
description: RUGBY LEAGUE Semifinal Playoff

title: JOSEPH COLETTI, 74, A BOSTON SCULPTOR
description: BOSTON, May 6Joseph A. Coletti, sculptor and former chairman of the Massachusetts State Art Commission, died last night at his home here. He was 74 years old.

title: Music: Charlotte Bergen
description: Given the riches of New York's musical life, another Brahms concert at Carnegie Hall would not seem a newsworthy event, but the one given on Saturday afternoon was no ordinary affair.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Knicks vs. Los Angeles

title: FRANCIS W. DAR, CARTOONIST, DIES
description: BOSTON, May 6Francis W. Dahl, Boston's bestknown cartoonist, whose works have appeared in newspapers here for 45 years as well as in a series of books, died today at his home in Newton. He was 65 years old.

title: Soviet Said to Punish Party Aide For His. Attacks on Nationalism
description: MOSCOW, May 6A veteran Communist party official who sharply attacked excessive Russian nationalism and overglorification of the Russian past in a recent article has reportedly been ousted as acting chief of the ideological section of the party's Central Committee.

title: Television
description: 6:30 (2)Sunrise Semester (4)All About Your Car (5)Read Your Way Up (7)Listen and Learn

title: NORWAY MOVES UP IN DAVIS CUP PLAY
description: OSLO, May 6 (AP)Norway advanced to the quarterfinal round of Section A of the European Zone Davis Cup competition today on Per liegna's victory over Tom Christensen. The 157, 63, 61, 62 triumph gave Norway a 32 victory.

title: Ellsberg Judge's Act Cited In Plan to Ask End of Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, May 6Defense attorneys in the Pentagon papers trial plan to ask a Federal appeals court to dismiss the case immediately on the ground that the White House tried to compromise the trial judge.

title: Bridge:
description: MEXICO CITY, May 6The world's greatest bridge partnership arrived here Friday on the second leg of a tour that will end for them with yet another battle for the world team title.

title: Snow and Rain in Colorado Bring South Platte Flooding
description: DENVER, May 6 (UPI) A storm that brought 14 inches of snow in the Colorado mountains and four inches of rain on the eastern plainsland forced evacuation today along the South Platte River through Denver.

title: Conference Board Scores Nixon Spending Strategy
description: The Conference Board, a private, non  profit businessresearch organization, attacked yesterday the Nixon Administration's basic strategy for using the Federal budget to stabilize the national economy.

title: Wiretap Orders Reported Gone From Hoover Files
description: WASHINGTON, May 6Official documents authorizing wiretaps on the telephones of reporters and White House aides disappeared from the personal files of J. Edgar Hoover, director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, in the spring of 1971 after he threatened to disclose the existence of the taps, according to Time magazine.

title: U.S., SOVIET FIVES ARE HERE TONIGHT
description: Mel Davis of St. John's, the Knicks top draft choice, was added to the United States squad yesterday for tonight's basketball game against the Soviet Union at Madison Square Garden.

title: MRS. RANKIN VICTOR BY 2 SHOTS WITH 217
description: RALEIGH, N.C., May 6 (AP) Mrs. Judy Rankin, her major competition fading away, won the $4,500 first prize today in the Ladies Professional Golf Association Raleigh golf classic with a oneoverpar 217.

title: Business Bureau Alters Consumer Questionnaire
description: NEWARK, May 6 Like most people, businessmen are willing to be told of their shortcomings so they can improve their image. But secretly, many prefer to believe they have none.

title: May 31 Is Target Date For Jersey I.R.S. Refunds
description: NEWARK, May 6 (AP)New Jerseyans who do not receive their Federal tax refunds by the end of the month can plan on spending more than the amount they expected.

title: Warren Attacks Plan to Screen Supreme Court Cases
description: WASHINGTON, May 6The controversial plan to create new national court of appeals to share the Supreme Court's function and workload has been dealt a serious and possibly fatal blow by former Chief Justice Earl Warren.

title: GREEK CITY'S END: NEW VIEW GIVEN
description: ATHENS, May 6The destruction of Mycenae around 1200 B.C. was caused by civil war, not by foreign invasion, according to a leading archeologist who now believes there Is more truth than imagination in the legends of ancient Greece.

title: Smith, Lutz Take Doubles Tourney, Get $20,000 Each
description: MONTREAL, May 6 (AP)Stan Smith and Bob Lutz shared in the richest doubles payday in pro tennis history today as they captured the $80,000 Rothman world doubles tournament.

title: Thousands of Laborers Said to Cross Border to Work on Roads and Airfields
description: HUE, South Vietnam, May 4Several thousand North Vietnamese laborers have been sent into the northwestern part of South Vietnam to build roads and airfields and to move supplies, according to senior American and South Vietnamese officials.

title: 2 CARS ON TURNPIKE ARE HIT BY PELLETS
description: ORANGE, Conn., May 6 Pellets that the state police believe were fired from a shotgun struck two westbound vehicles this afternoon as they, approached an overpass near Exit 41 on the Connecticut Turnpike.

title: Power Grab Is Lament of Democratic Legislators Who See Governor Running Again
description: ALBANY, May 6With Nelson A. Rockefeller in his 15th year as Governor and all the signs pointing toward his seeking a fifth fouryear term next year, the minority Democrats in the Legislature, with lots of time on their hands and rue in their hearts, have already begun their quadrennial lament. This partisian threnody  cornposed of pressrelease outrage, more than a soupcon of envy, some facts and, one suspects, a desire to while away the long hours in a Republican Legislature where they are treated like a mad Victorian aunt confined to an atticis titled Rockefeller's Power Grab.

title: Protest Backs Soviet Jews On Eve of Israel's Birthday
description: Chanting and carrying signs that read Free Them Now, tens of thousands of people filled Dag Hammarskjold Plaza yesterday to protest the treatment of Jews in the Soviet Union, particularly the imprisonment of Jewish activists and the Government's refusal to allow unimpeded emigration.

title: Secretariat Rests After His Day of Triumph
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky. May 6Lucien Laurin made an early departure from Churchill Downs today to rest for a few days at his home in Miami. Before leaving, though, the trainer of the Meadow Stable's Secretariat said that he would send the colt to Baltimore tomorrow to prepare for the Preakness May 19.

title: U.S. WILL CONSIDER NEW CITY HOUSING
description: The Nixon Administration yesterday announced that, despite the freeze on new federally subsidized housing, it would now consider applications to subsidize 8,800 lowincome and moderate  income apartments throughout New York State, nearly half of them in New York City.

title: Census Candor
description: In a refreshing act of official candor, the Census Bureau has announced that it missed 5.3 million Americans when it tried to count all of us back in 1970.

title: John Thompson, 56, Dies; ExDeputy Police Inspector
description: John H. Thompson, a retired deputy inspector of the New York Police Department, died of a heart attack Saturday on a visit to the Blue Grotto on the isle of Capri near Naples. He was 56 years old and lived at 115 Beach 217th Street in Breezy Point, Queens.

title: Dance: Balinese Topeng
description: Humor is part of the religious festivals of Asia, and topeng, the masked dance theater of Bali, is another example of an art form designed to entertain both gods and mortals. Currently Americans are getting their first view of these fascinating and charming dancedramas during a national tour of a topeng company from Bali, sponsored by the Asia Society's Performing Arts Program.

title: GAS PACT IS RATIFIED BY ELECTRICAL UNION
description: Local 3 of the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers Union ratified by a 4to1 vote last night a new 26month contract with the Brooklyn Union Gas Company.

title: Ceremony to Honor Truman
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., May 6 (UPI)  Postmaster General E. T. Klassen plans to lay al wreath Tuesday on the grave of Harry S. Truman, who would, have been 89 that day, as part) of ceremonies marking the iossuance of a Truman comme Imorative stamp. The wreathlaying is to be attended by the: former President's daughter, Mrs. Clifton Daniel.

title: Volcano Subsides in Hawail
description: VOLCANO, Hawail, May 6 (AP)A brief spurt of volcanic and earthquake activity at Kilauea Volcano subsided today, with no damage or injuries reported. The eruptions yesterday touched off a forest fire in Volcanoes National Park and sent lava flowing across the Chain of Craters Highway. The fire burned out today.

title: Cosmos Win Soccer Opener, 10
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., May 6Except for the last 15 minutes, the New York Cosmos season opener against the Rochester Lancers here today was nothing but dull, rough, sterile soccer with no scoring and many fouls.

title: G.O.P. GROUP URGES CAMPAIGN REFORMS
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (AP) The Ripon Society, a liberal Republican organization, has urged George Bush, the party's national chairman, to set up group to study campaign ethics and to propose revisions in national campaignfinancing laws.

title: Bike Lanes Are Opened In 2d Day of Bronx Week
description: Thousands of Bronx residents took advantage of the latespring sunshine yesterday to sample the scattered delights of Bronx Week.

title: Joyce Faces Drug Charge
description: ROWLAND, N. C., May 6 (AP)Kevin Joyce, Olympic basketball star from the University of South Carolina, was arrested last night with friend and charged with possession of marijuana and amphetamines. Joyce, a 21yearold senior from New York, was riding with James F. Powell, 23, of Columbia, S. C., when the car Powell was driving was stopped for speeding.

title: KissingerBrezhnev Talks Continuing Near Moscow
description: MOSCOW, May 6 (AP)Henry A. Kissinger and Leonid I. Brezhnev continued talks today at the Soviet leader's country estate near here.

title: U.C.L.A.'s Harmon Breaks Collarbone in Scrimmage
description: LOS ANGELES, May 6 (AP). Mark Harmon, who quarterbacked U.C.L.A.'s football team to an 83 wonlost record and the top offensive statistics in Bruin history last season, has broken his collarbone in a spring scrimmage.

title: Camden Candidate Has Victory Party
description: CAMDEN, May 6Major Coxson, the dapper little candidate whose flamboyance has added spark to an otherwise routine Camden mayoral campaign, will not be denied his moment of glory. He held a huge victory party last week six days in advance of the election.

title: Soccer Results
description: NATIONAL CHALLENGE CUP

title: Lindsay Concentrates on Completing Priority Programs by End of the Year
description: Though wild rumors swirl in the city's political stratosphere that Mayor Lindsay may reverse himself and run for reelection as an independent, the basic operation at City Hall is a crash program to clean house by the end of the year, the conclusion of the Mayor's second term. In circulation among the Mayor's top aides at the moment are tight m emorandums from the head of each, superagency or important department giving the top priorities for the remainder of this year.

title: WATERGATE POSES PUZZLE IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, May 6Canadians, who often say halfseriously that they know American history better than their own, simply do not understand the Watergate affair.

title: BLACK UNIT BACKS NO ONE FOR MAYOR
description: Three of the candidates for the Democratic mayoral nomination appealed personally yesterday for the endorsement of the city's Council of Black Elected Officials, but none was able to muster a majority.

title: Merrill Lynch Firm Retains Top Rank As Investment Bank
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce &I Smith retained its top ranking in investment banking in 1972, according to the annual directory of Corporate Financing published yesterday.

title: Whalers Take First W.H.A. Title
description: BOSTON, May 6 (AP)Larry Pleau scored three goals and Tommy Webster contributed two today as the New England Whalers defeated the Winnipeg Jets, 96, for the first World Hockey Association championship.

title: LAWRENCE T. HOLLAND
description: Lawrence T. Holland, a former Consolidated Edison Company plant superintendent and a retired captain in the Coast Guard, died Saturday at the St. Albans (Queens) Naval Hospital. He was 72 years old and lived at 8333 Austin Street in Kew Gardens, Queens.

title: National League
description: Houston 14, New York 8. Atlanta 3,

title: KnicksLakers Composite Box
description: KnicksLakers Composite Box

title: Margaret Kennedy Lawyer's Bride
description: Miss Margaret Mary Courtney Kennedy, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Patrick J. Kennedy of Clearwater, Fla., formerly of New York, was married here yesterday to Robert Emmet Curry Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Curry of New York.

title: Unfair Entrapment
description: By the narrowest possible majorityfive to fourthe Supreme Court has turned back an attempt to limit the increasingly abused police power to entrap potential criminals by encouraging and helping them to commit actual crimes. The majority opinion, written by Associate Justice Rehnquist, insisted that a defendant with a predisposition to commit a crime cannot plead that he was unfairly trapped into committing it.

title: $2Billion Urged for BirthCurb Plan
description: RENSSELAERVILLE, N. Y., May 6A $2billion annual program to curb population growth in the world's poor countries was urged at a weekend symposium here of demographers, diplomats and physicians.

title: Storm Kills One in Kiel
description: KIEL, West Germany, May (UPI)A 20minute wind storm struck this northern German city late yesterday, killing at least one person, injuring 15 others and causing damage estimated at $700,000.

title: MANUEL BATISTA JR.
description: YORK, Pa., May 6 (AP)Manuel G. Batista Jr. of Lewisberry, a featherweight boxer in the late nineteenforties and fifties, died yesterday in an automobile accident at Pinchot State Park north of here. He was 44 years old.

title: Governor Campaigns in Bergen, Citing School and Transit Gains
description: PARAMUS, May 6Carrying familiar issues to friendly territory, Governor Cahill swung his reelection campaign into Republicandominated Bergen County today and repeatedly cited what he called his administration's accomplishments in education and transportation.

title: Knicks Defeat Lakers
description: The Knicks defeated the Los Angeles Lakers, 8783, at Madison Square Garden yesterday and gained a 21 lead in the fourofsevengame National Basketball Association championship series. The fourth game will be played at the Garden tomorrow night. Details on Page 55.

title: MOSCOW UNVEILS COMPUTER SYSTEM
description: MOSCOW, May 6The Soviet Union and its East European allies have unveiled their new unified system of computers at a Moscow exhibition, including a machine capable of 500,000 operations per second.

title: Major League Leaders
description: BATTING HOME RUNS RUNS BATTED IN PITCHING

title: VEGETABLES LEAD MEAT IN COST CUTS
description: Shoppers in the New York City area and in the Hartford area in Connecticut found some price cuts in food markets last week, but few were for meat items and those few were insignificant.

title: CUSHMAN NAMED
description: WASHINGTON, May 6Gen. Robert E. Cushman Jr., the Marine Corps commandant who'in 1971 was Deputy Director of Central Intelligence, authdriied the use of Central Intelligence Agency material and research in the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's fortiler psychiatrist, sources close to the Watergate case said today.

title: AUSSIE WOMEN WIN TENNIS TEAM TITLE
description: BAD HOMBURG, West Germany, May 6 (AP)Australia defeated South Africa, 30, today in the title round of the Federation Cup, the unofficial women's world's team tennis championships.

title: Miami Beach Closes Controversial Bass Museum
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 6The Miami Beach City Council, by closing the John Bass Art Museum last week, has moved to settle once and for all the most unhappy cultural experience this city has had in its 58year history.

title: Diplomat and a Professor Beaten by 5 Youths Here
description: A deputy minister of Liberia and a Rutgers University professor, also from Liberia, were set upon and beaten by five white youths early yesterday morning before an offduty policeman rushed from his apartment to rescue the two visitors, the police reported.

title: A Durable Amendment
description: WASHINGTONIt was Blackstone who, in the eighteenth century, articulated three principles which are basic to our thoughts on freedom of the press. First, that freedom of the press should be jealously protected, as fundamental to the public good. Second, that it is an undue infringement on that right to apply restraints prior to publication. Third, the right of free press is not so unlimited as to prevent civil, or in appropriate cases, criminal redress after publication. In spite of the furor over the Caldwell, Pappas and Branzburg cases, I believe it fair to say that the Supreme Court has gone far to establish these principles and to give them a broad and generous interpretation in favor of the press.

title: Guerrillas Future in Lebanon Is Still Being Weighed
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 6Discussions between the Lebanese Government and Palestinian guerrillas on the future of guerrilla activities in this country continued today.

title: Miss Rothstein Wins Title
description: SYRACUSE, May 6Donna Rothstein defeated Michelle Jean, 75, 36, 76, to win the tennis championship of the New York State Association of Intercollegiate Athletics for Women today. Both finalists are from Lehman College in the Bronx.

title: Hoover Files Vanish
description: Official documents authorizing wiretaps on the telephones of reporters and White House aides reportedly disappeared from J. Edgar Hoover's files in 1971 after he threatened to disclose that taps existed. Page 46.

title: Books of The Times
description: At the end of The Summer Before the Dark, Kate Brown returns to her husband and four grown children in London after several months absence. Her hair looks like a fright wig and she has aged out of all proportion to the time she's been away, but she wears these signs proudly, like a badge. Though she had always enjoyed her wellkept prettiness, she now considers this a seriously delimiting habit of mind and is determined to show her family and her husband her real self, stripped of superficial embellishments.

title: HARYARD VICTOR OVER NAVY GREW
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 6Harvard's undefeated crew beat Navy easily here today in the delayed Adams Cup Regatta. Penn was to compete also, but high winds and rough water all day yesterday made competitive rowing impossible and it was decided that the six Penn heavyweight and lightweight crews would return to Philadelphia rather than stay over for the race this morning.

title: I.R.A. Hero Wed
description: DUNDALK, Ireland, May 6 Francis McGuigan married Eileen Donohoe here yesterday, and, befitting a ceremony involving one of the most wanted men in the Irish Republican Army, many came to the party.

title: Soviets Reorganize
description: Even in Moscow it is no secret that Kremlin leaders are unhappy about the slowdown in Soviet economic growth. To reverse this trend that is endangering the goals of the current fiveyear plan, at least three types of major institutional innovations have recently been initiated.

title: N.B.C. HEAD ASKS CABLETV CURBS
description: Cable television will not gain preeminence over commercial television nor become a major mass medium if left to the normal economics of the marketplace, Julian Goodman, president of the National Broadcasting Company, said today.

title: State Calls Ambulance Service Run by City Slow and Inefficient
description: ALBANY, May 6A state audit of the New York City Health and Hospitals CorporaI don's Emergency Ambulance Service today challenged the corporation's claim that it had reduced delays in service.

title: Indians SignAccord to End 68Day Seizure of Town
description: PINE RIDGE, S. D., May 6Federal and Indian negotiators announced here today an agreement to end the 68day occupation of the village of Wounded Knee by militant Indians and their supporters.

title: Fern Mautner Wed To Edwin F. Beschler
description: Miss Fern Lynn Mautner, daughter of Mrs. Sid Mautner of Scarsdale, N. Y., and the late Mr. Mautner, was married here yesterday afternoon to Edwin F. Beschler. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John L. Beschler of Tyrone, Pa.

title: 8 Horses Die in Fire
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 6 (AP) Eight horses died in a fire today that destroyed a barn in Pennsbury township belonging to a prominent breeder, Dr. Charles Lyman. The horses killed were said to have been valued at about $25,000 each.

title: Anne Clarissa Maclin Married To David E. Cripps in Jersey
description: SAND BROOK, N. J., May 6 Miss Anne Clarissa Maclin and David Ernest Cripps of New York and Sag Harbor, L. I., were married here this afternoon in the Sand Brook Church by the Rev. John E. Hiemstra, a Dutch Reform Minister.

title: Behold the Nest Egg
description: WASHINGTONShould every American be allowed to accumulate a $100,000 nest egg, tax free? I am delighted to find that more and more people, many of them economists, answer yes. They understand that the incentive to accumulate this amount in capital gains in a lifetime could help build new capital funds which simply do not exist today.

title: CUSHMAN NAMED
description: WASHINGTON, May 6Gen, Robert E. Cushman Jr., the Marine Corps commandant who in 1971 was Deputy Director of Central Intelligence, authorized the use of Central Intelligence Agency material and research in the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist, sources close to the Watergate case said today.

title: MEXICO FLIES 30 TO HAVANA TO WIN CONSUL'S RELEASE
description: MEXICO CITY, May 6The Mexican Government acceded today to the demands of the kidnappers of the United States consul general in Guadalajara, and released 30 prisoners in seven jails across the country.

title: Bacallao Duo Takes Final
description: Pedro Bacallao of the Princeton Club and Victor Neiderhoffer of the Harvard Club defeated Joe Holmes of the Yale Club and Frank Satterthwaite of the Princeton Club, 159, 1511, 1215. 1512, to win the National Squash Tennis Association doubles championship at the Lone Star Boat Club yesterday.

title: Carroll Gardens Given HistoricDistrict Status
description: The Landmarks Preservation. Commission has designated the Carroll Gardens section of Brooklyn a Historic District. The neighborhood, comprising more than 160 twostory and threestory houses, has been praised by the commission as a good example of a 19thcentury brownstone residential area.

title: The Theater
description: ' Riverwind, a Musical, Is Revived by E. L. T.

title: Skimpy Tax Reform
description: President Nixon's package, of proposed changes in the tax laws is formidable in bulk, but it is a puny response to the real needs for fiscal reform. Genuine tax reform would generate heartening billions of revenues from individuals and corporations now paying less than their share; the Administration's proposals scarcely confront this task at all.

title: TAIWAN TV EASES CURB ON DIEM
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, May 6Television entertainment in the Taiwanese dialect was reduced to an hour a day a station by Government order last December. But in recent weeks Taiwanese weather reports have been introduced. And the Government is reportedly considering occasional special news programs in the local dialect.

title: Twixt $4.60, Rallies to Win $20,000 Race at Suffolk
description: BOSTON, May 6 (AP) Twixt, with Bill Passmore riding, surged out of the pack in the last few strides and won the $20,000 added My Fair Lady Handicap at Suffolk Downs today by threequarters of a length.

title: Army Shaping Scanners and Other Devices to Foil Assassins
description: WASHINGTON, May 6The protection of Presidents and other public figures from assassination is the focus of an Army program that envisages the use of bacteria and whippets, advanced infrared scanners and psychological stress analyzers.

title: Richardson Job Shifts Outpace SpeakingPlans
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (UPI)Lloyd Elliot, president of George Washington University, put it this way tonight: We invited the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare. The Secretary of Defense accepted, but the Attorney General declined.

title: Expanding Demands Send Prices of Soybeans Soaring
description: An insatiable world hunger for protein, which began to exceed supplies last summer, blew the lid off the soybean market last week.tein) because it is used to shorten the fattening time for cattle and hogs.ers have been increasing acreage given over to soybeans for years, usually at the expense of corn and more recently tired cotton land.

title: Harriet Zagor Married Here
description: Miss frarriet Jane Zagor was married here yesterday evening to Jeffrey A. Kelman, who will graduate next month from the Harvard Medical School. Rabbi Israel Moshowitz performed the ceremony at the Gotham.

title: SHARPY UMBECK, LED KNOX COLLEGE
description: GALESBURG, Ill., May 6 (UPI)  Sharvy G. Umbeck, president of Knox College for 24 years, died last night, apparently of a heart attack. He was 60 years old.

title: Cevert Wins in Formula 2
description: PAU, France, May 6 (UPI)Francois Cevert of France drove his Elf2 Ford to a victory today in the Pau Formula Two Grand Prix. Another Frenchman, JeanPierre Jarier, was second in a March BMW.

title: Isabel Mizrack Bride Of John Basil Gantt
description: Miss Isabel Mizrack, a candidate for a master's degree in art history at George Washington University,, was married here yesterday afternoon to John Basi Gantt, a general attorney for international matters with the Communications Satellite Corporation in Washington.

title: Aspin Says Fuel Shortage Closed 342 Gas Stations
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (UPI) Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, said today that a gasoline shortage had forced 342 service stations to close and threatened to drive nearly 1,000 others out of business soon.

description: Roosevelt Entries

description: 8:0510 A.M., WNCN: Morning Concert. Kamarinskaya, Glinka; Banchetto Musicale; Suite No. 2, Schein; Trio in B Flat, Beethoven; Fantasie in A minor, SaintSaens; Brandenburg Concerto No. 5, Bath; String Quartet No. 9, Beethoven.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: New Corporate Bonds

title: The Constitutional Crisis
description: LONDON, May 6After the terrible battering their faith has suffered in the last ten years, Americans want desperately to believe in their country's institutions. And so it is natural to hear now, in the United States, how the eventual cracking of Watergate shows that the system does work.

title: MEXICO FLIES 30 TO HAVANA TO WIN CONSUL'S RELEASE
description: MEXICO CITY, May 6The Mexican Government acceded today to the demands of the kidnappers of the United States consul general in Guadalajara, and released 30 prisoners in seven jails across the country.

description: Hours are given in Eastern Daylight Time.

title: 4 Drivers Injured In 15Car PileUp
description: TALLADEGA, Ala., May 6 (AP)A 190mileanhour, 15car crash at Alabama International Speedway injured four drivers today at the Winston 500mile Grand National stock car race.

title: Religious Orders in Ulster County Face An Increasing Demand for Their Land
description: HIGHLAND, N. Y.For distance of about 10 miles north of this Ulster County village, the shores of the Hudson River still are relatively untouched by development.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Mexican Government acceded yesterday to the demands of the kidnappers of Terrance G. Leonhardy, the United States Consul General in Guadalajara, and released 30 prisoners in seven jails throughout Mexico. The prisoners, who included accused kidnappers and bank robbers, were put aboard a Mexican Air Force plane that flew from Mexico City to Havana, as requested by Mr. eonhardy's captors. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Syrian Leader Said to Visit Moscow for Secret Talks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 6 (Reuters)President Hafez elAssad of Syria held talks with Soviet leaders during a secret 24hour visit to Moscow this week, diplomatic sources said here today.

title: Personal Finance
description: Have you increased your fire insurance coverage lately? If not, it might be a good idea.

title: Fall of Corregidor Marked
description: MANILA, May 6 (UPI)President Ferdinand E. Marcos awarded medals and citations to Filipino soldiers today for heroism in the campaign against Moslem rebels in ceremonies marking the 31st anniversary of the fall of Corregidor. Mr. Marcos, the Philippines most decorated war hero, led World War II veterans at the ceremonies on the island fortress of Corregidor at the mouth of Manila Bay.

title: 2 U.S. Mayors in Leningrad
description: MOSCOW, May 6 (UPI)Mayor Lindsay and Mayor Joseph L. Alioto of San Francisco toured Leningrad today, the Tass press agency said. The Mayors are on separate visits to the Soviet Union as guests of the Moscow City Soviet.

title: American League
description: Baltimore 5, California 0. Milwaukee 3, Kansas City. 2. Minnesota 10, Boston 3.

title: Proxmire Seeks an inquiry On Remodeling of ac135
description: WASHINGTON, May 6 (UPI) Senator William Pscomiire, alleging that $430,000 is being spent to remodel one Air Force plane used by ageneral, asked congressional auditors todayito find out if United Stites aircraft are being thrned intomflying playboy penthOuses at the taxpayers expense.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space, scientific and technical subcommittee3 P.M.

title: Protest Backs Soviet Jews OnEve of Israel's Birthday
description: Chanting and carrying signs that read Free Them Now, tens of thousands of people filled Dag Hammarskjold Plaza yesterday to protest the treatment of Jews in the Soviet Union, particularly the imprisonment of Jewish activists and the Government's refusal to allow unimpeded emigration.

title: Nellie Lutcher's Songs Stir Memories
description: Nellie Lutcher, who became famous 25 years ago singing Hurry On Down to My House, He's a Real Gone Guy and fine Brown Frame at Barney Josephson's Greenwich Village nightclub, Cafe Society, is back in New York after a 15year absence, Once again, it is Mr. Josephson who has brought her to town, this time to his restaurant, the Cookery, at University Place and 8th Street, where she is singing and playing many of the same songs in much the same way she did at Cafe Society.

title: CATHOLICS ASSAY SEX COUNSELING
description: HOLYOKE, Mass., May 6The Roman Catholic bishops of New England were told today after a consultation with 160 clergy, nuns and laity that present church sex education programs are not effective for most Catholic married couples.

title: Pennsylvania Bishop Voted
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 6 (AP)  The Episcopal Diocese of Pennsylvania elected the Right Rev. Lyman C. Ogilby of Swarthmore yesterday as Bishop Coadjutor to succeed Presiding Bishop Robert 1. DeWitt. Bishop DeWitt had announced that he would retire no later than lune. 1974.

title: Yunich Joins Drexel as Senior Adviser
description: David L. Yunich, who retired on Feb. 1 as vice chairman of R. H. Macy & Co. after serving nine years as president of its Macy's New York division, has joined Drexel, Burnham & Co., a leading Wall Street investment banker, as senior adviser.

title: JACK M. DUBOFF
description: Jack M. DuBoff, president of Jack DuBoff Associates, inurance adjusters of 116 John Street, died Saturday in Atlantic Beach, L. I. He was 63 years old and lived at 880 Fifth Avenue.

title: 12 MILLION FOUND INADEQUATELY FED
description: WASHINGTON, May 6Deapite the steady abatement of hunger as a problem since it drew significant national attention five years ago, more than 12 million Americans are still malnourished, according to Senate study made public today.

title: A SailingVessel Flotilla May Mark Bicentennial
description: The 200th anniversary of the founding of this country is to be observed here with a flotilla of tallmasted sailing ships, if a recently formed private organization called Operation Sail 1976 has its way. Henry J. Geyelin Jr., chairman of the organization, said that informal commitments had been received from 10 nations to have sailing, ships they use for sailing participate in the flotilla. Mr. Geyelin was unwilling to name the countries because of the tentative nature of his group's negotiations.

title: DELEYER RIDING STAR AT RICE FARMS SHOW
description: MIDDLE ISLAND, L. I., May 6Harry deLeyer, master of Hollandia Farms in St. James, scored a double by riding Dutch Merchant to the green working hunter championship and Dutch Mission to the intermediate jumper title today at the Rice Farms horse show.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: About 600 homosexuals from groups in New York and New Jersey marched in single file and handinhand along the north walkway of the George Washington Bridge in midafternoon yesterday in what they called a Hold Hands demonstration of solidarity.

title: Ship Hits Bridge Pier
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 6 (UPI)The Greek ship Milhalios Xilas suffered a crushed bow when she hit a bridge pier and damaged an underground telephone cable when dropping anchor in the Willamette River toay. The accident did not affect the operation of the draw span or traffic on the bridge.

title: RETRIEVER NAMED BEST AT TRENTON
description: WASHINGTON CROSSING, N. J., May 6 The sun had already set and the moon was high in the sky when Haworth Hoch of Villa Ridge, Mo., selected Mrs. Rose Lewesky's golden retriever, Ch. Wochica Okeechobee Jake, as best of the 13,700 dogs at the 44th allbreed show of the Trenton Kennel Club.

title: Bombay: Poor Find Escape in Films
description: BOMBAYShashi Kapoor, India's Ryan O'Neill, was weary. From 7 A.M. to 2 P.M. he had appeared before the cameras in a film about a poor villager who comes to Bombay in search of fame and fortune. Then he scurried across the street to another studio to work until 10 P.M. on another film with a typical plot that somehow combines the best of Jacqueline Susan n and Marcel Proust. I play the father of an illegitimate child who becomes critically ill, said the cheerful, darkhaired film star, sitting in a cramped dressing room and sipping a soda. The mother doesn't realize the boy is hers. And the doctor who operates on the kid is the lover of his mother, my old girl friend. It's complicated. There's music, too.

title: A.H.L. FINAL PLAYOFF
description: Cincinnati 7, Nova Scotia 6(Cincinnati leads four of seven series, 2.0).

title: Fordham Eight Is Beaten
description: The Washington College crew swept both events in a dual race with Fordham last Saturday on the Harlem River course. The Washington College varsity eight took the lead from the start and was never threatened.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Gimbels Staff Is Getting Free Hypertension Tests
description: Floor by floor, workers the Gimbels store on Herald Square are having their blood pressure checked in a new program sponsored by the United Store Workers Union and Cornell Medical Center.

title: Deaths
description: Memorial Seruires In Memoriam

title: Bengalis Fear 250 Died In River Vessels Crash
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, May 6 (UPI)  Two river passenger boats collided last night near here and officials said that initial reports indicated that at least 250 persons had been killed.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BRASILIA, Brazil, May 6 (AP)Eder Jofre of Brazil won the World Boxing Congress featherweight championship last night, upsetting Jose Legra of Spain with a 15round split decision. The 29yearold Legra had predicted he would win by a knockout over the 37yearold former bantamweight champion and came close in the third round when a blistering right cross sent Jofre wobbling against the ropes.

title: Prospects of an Andean Pact Stirring Interest in Venezuela
description: CARACAS, VenezuelaWith the Venezuelan Congress expected to ratify the decision to join the Andean Pact in May, Caracas has caught the Andean fever.
