description: Front Page 3  No Title

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Lindsay's office announced yesterday the completion of the installation of highintensity street lighting along the entire length of Central Park West and on 125th Street from the Hudson River to the East River.

title: JUDGE J. S. MONTESANO
description: ROCHESTER, May 7 (AP)Livingston County Judge Joseph S. Montesano of Mount Morris died today in Strong Memorial Hospital after suffering a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 62 years old.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Army will start courtmartial proceedings tomorrow against a drill sergeant accused of kicking and verbally abusing a private who died during a fivemile training hike.

title: Pulitzers Go to Washington Post, Frankel, Championship Season
description: The 1973 Pulitzer Prize for public service in journalism was awarded yesterday to The Washington Post for its investigation of the Watergate case, the affair that began with an attempt to bug Democratic National Headquarters last June and grew into a national scandal last month.

title: Polish Church Steps Up Attacks On State, Citing Education Plan
description: WARSAW. 7 (AP)Pofand's Roman Catholic Church today accused the Government of drawing up plans for education based on atheist principles with full elimination of the church.

title: Equity Auditing Studied
description: The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants said yesterday it was forming a special committee to examine whether the massive irregularities in the financial statements of the Equity Funding Corporation of America evidenced a need for changes in auditing methods.

title: HIGH COURT IN RULING ON FUND VALUATION
description: HIGH COURT IN RULING ON FUND VALUATION

title: Hunt Says Colson Ordered Forged Datain Diern Death
description: LOS ANGELES, May 7 Charles W. Colson, President Nixon's former counsel, ordered the forgery of State Department cables to implicate President Kennedy in the assassination of President Ngo Dinh Diem of South Vietnam, according to documents released today at the Pentagon Papers trial.

title: American League
description: American League

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A proposal to construct a $30million industrial park in Roosevelt, L. I., was all but dropped yesterday after nearly 300 residents of the community protested bitterly the weekly Nassau County Board of Supervisors meeting. Most of the speakers declared that the creation of the park would have required the relocation of 160 to 200 families. The principal argument in support of the plan was that new industry in the virtually allblack community would contribute $750,000 annually in taxes for the local school district, one of the most impoverished on Long Island.

title: ABDUCTED CONSUL IS STILL NOT FREE
description: MEXICO CITY, May 7Terrance G. Leonhardy, the United States consul general in Guadalajara, presumably was still in the hands of his kidnappers to day although the Mexican Government had complied with their demands to fly 30 political prisoners to Cuba.

title: Legislature Is Expected to Vote $25Million More in School Aid
description: ALBANY, May 7  Legislative agreement to supplement state aid to schools this year by an additional $25millionwhile shelving controversial proposals for basic reform of school financing  was reported today by the head of the Assembly Education Committee.

title: Radio
description: Radio

title: Mets Defeat Braves, 72
description: Just when it seemed they were going to provide Tom Seaver with his usual allotment; of one run, the New York Mets erupted for six runs in the eighth inning to give their ace righthander a 72 victory over Atlanta.

title: After DeFiling an Opponent Cheas: Let the Rooks Polish Him Off
description: When the FrancoPolish player David Janowski referred to rooks doubled on the seventh rank as blind pigs, he knew whereof he spoke. Such rooks will devour everything in range and, worse yet, constrict the enemy position so badly that countermeasures are futile.

title: People in Sports: A Soviet Bon Mot for Wilt
description: Like a It or other people, Vladimir Kondrashin, the coach of the Soviet Union basketball team, doesn't want to antagonize Wilt Chamberlain. Apparently he is having second thoughts about his widely quoted observation in New York the other day that Chamberlain is not good.

title: Give on the Job
description: The United Fund of Greater New York's 425 affiliated agencies in the five boroughs make up the largest network of local hospitals and health and social service agencies in the world. Their resources provide services for people of all ages, and ethnic, religious, economic and cultural backgrounds. Available are homes for abandoned children and the aged, agencies for the crippled and the blind, clubs and camps for youths, and clinics for family counseling.

title: Texts of Two Memos in Ellsberg Case
description: LOS ANGELES, May 8Following are the texts of two memorandums given by the Justice Department to the United States District Court here and turned over to Dr. Daniel Ellsberg and Anthony J. Russo Jr., who made them public:

title: U.S. Business Held Lax in Prinnoting Its Sales in Japan;
description: TOKYO, May, 8The United States Embassy here has advised Washington in two separate reports that American businessmen are failing to take advantage of a big market in Japan for certain exports.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
description: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York

title: Episcopal Diocese Asks Pardon For Those Jailed for Marijuana
description: The annual convention of the Episcopal Diocese of New York yesterday urged pardon and/or clemency to persons currently incarcerated for mere possession and use of marijuana, and amnesty for all who refused service in Vietnam for reasons of conscience.

title: EXNIXON OFFICIAL WARY OR BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, May 8A former high official of the Nixon Administration said today that more than $7billion of the $17billion in budget reductions detailed by the Administration in January were either of doubtful validity or inadequately justified.

title: C.I.A. LINK TO HUNT CONFIRMED BY U.S.
description: LOS ANGELES, May 8The deputy director of the Central Intelligence Agency met at the agency with E. Howard Hunt Jr. in July, 1971, and ordered that Hunt be supplied with false identity papers and such disguises as a wig, glasses and a voice alteration device, the Government confirmed today at the Pentagon papers trial.

title: Swollen Privilege
description: In its passion for secrecy and centralized control, the Nixon Administration originally put forward an enormously swollen doctrine of executive privilege. Under the pressure of the Watergate revelations, the Administration has begun to shrink its interpretation somewhat. Yet it is still bloated beyond what previous Presidents have claimed and still looks suspiciously like an effort to cover up improper behavior.

title: NASTASE IS VICTOR IN TWO MATCHES
description: BOURNEMOUTH, England, May 8 (UPI)Topseeded Ilie Nastase of Rumania breezed through his two opening matches today in the $65,000 British clay court tennis cham, pionships. Three seeded players were eliminated.

title: THIRD CEASEFIRE BEGINS IN LEBANON AFTER JET ATTACK
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Wednesday, May 9A new ceasefire between Government forces and Palestinian guerrillas was announced last night after a day marked by heavy rocket attacks by Lebanese jets on guerrilla positions.

title: Events Today
description: HOT AND COLD HEROS, a musical conceived and directed by Joe JakubowItz; presented by Mama Hare's Tree, at the 13th Street Theater, SO West 13th Street, 7.

title: Estimate on Price Rises Of Food Moved Upward
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (Reuters)  The Agriculture Department officially acknowledged today that for 1973 as a whole the rate of increase in retail food prices could be about 50 per cent above its earlier estimates and approximately twice the rise in 1972.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: CROSSWORD PUZZLE

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Atlanta Braves, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 9, 8 P.M.) (RadioWHN, 8 P.M.

title: A CONSUMER OFFICE IS CREATED UPSTATE
description: SYRACUSE, May 8 (AP)The Onondaga County Legislature has adopted a modified consumer protection code and created an office of consumer affairs.

title: One Scandal Always
description: PARISAmerican politics, on the whole shown to be considerably less dirty over the years than those of France, Italy or Spain (to name but a few examples), have managed to acquire a particularly sordid reputation now. Perhaps our original Puritan heritage inspires a special orgy of shame over Watergate.

title: Occupation of Wounded Knee Is Ended
description: WOUNDED KNEE, S. D., May 8The second Battle of Wounded Knee ended today.

title: MATLACK INJURED AS MIS BOW, 106
description: The New York Mets suffered a double loss last night, when Jon Matlack was struck on the forehead by a line drive while pitching against the Atlanta Braves, who then scored seven rus in the inning.

title: London's Hottest Ticket: Olga and Her Friends
description: LONDON, May 8 (AP) Olga Korbut, the tiny Soviet gymnast who was the darling of the Munich Olympics, is queen of London this week. She has met Prime Minister Edward Heath. Her picture is splashed across all the newspapers. And you can't get a ticket for any of the five exhibitions Olga and the Soviet national team are giving at Earl's Court, London's biggest sports hall.

title: Notes on People
description: Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the former chief of state of Cambodia, flew to Dakar, Senegal, to begin a tour of African and European countries to promote the prestige of his governmentinexile, which is based in Peking. Chou Enlai, the Chinese Premier presided at a banquet in Peking to honor the Prince and his mission on the eve of his departure. Prince Sihanouk took with him, for showing abroad, a film he made earlier in the year of a secret visit he said he had made to parts of Cambodia held by antigovernment forces.

title: M'CRANE EFFECTS TO BE AUCTIONED
description: TRENTON, May 8 (AP) Joseph M. McCrane Jr., the former State Treasurer, plans to sell his household effects, including some valuable antiques June 2.

title: College Baseball
description: College Baseball

title: N.H.L. Playoff
description: April 29Montreal 8, Chicago 3.

title: 6 in Family Killed in Fire In Brownsville Tenement
description: A fire that the authorities said had been set by an arsonist yesterday killed a woman and her three children and two grandchildren in Brooklyn. The earlymorning blaze trapped the victims on the top floor of a threestory tenement in a rundown section of Brownsville.

title: Dance: Ailey Returns
description: Nine men and nine women clap their hands, sway their hips and dance triumphantly down to the footlights to the shouts of the spiritual Rocka My Soul in the Bosom of Abraham. You know that the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater is back in town at the City Center 55th Street Theater and that for three weeks its soul will be rocked in the bosom of New York.

title: NEWS COUNCIL'S HEAD NAMES 14 MEMBERS
description: The chairman of the National News Council, Roger J. Traynor, yesterday announced the names of eight public members and six media members who will serve with him on the newly created body.

title: $80,000 Ransom for Consul Is Reported
description: GUADALAJARA, Mexico, May 8 (UPI)  A Mexican official said today that a ransom of $80,000 had been paid to Mexican guerrillas for the release of the kidnapped United States Consul General, Terrance G. Leonhardy.

title: Muskie Says Watergate Makes 76 Race Possible
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI) Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, said today that as a result of the Watergate scandal disclosures, he would not rule out running for President in 1976.

title: Scheckter's RoadHogging Stirs a Feud With McRae
description: At 23 Jody Scheckter is on his way to the upper echelon of Grand Prix drivers. Whether or not he reaches it, the brash South African already has attracted a big audience here and abroad; he also has become controversial. Scheckter's aggressive, roadhogging style, a highspeed abandon that keeps his Formula 5000 car in a constantly sideways posture, has brought him the lead in the 1973 L&M Championship on the basis of his victory last Sunday at Monterey, Calif., and his second place the week before at Riverside Calif.

title: COLSON PLAYED ROLE IN TYDINGS DEFEAT
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) Charles W. Colson, the former White House aide whose name has increasingly been linked to the WatergatePentagon papers case, played a behindthescenes role in Administration efforts to defeat a key Democratic Senator during the 1970 elections.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: U.S.Soviet Atom Talks
description: GENEVA, May 8The United States and the Soviet Union continued negotiations here today to limit strategic nuclear arsenals. The meeting was the second since the second phase of the talks was resumed last week after an Easter recess.

title: Gibson Shatters Record With 242d Start in Row
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8 (UPI)Bob Gibson of the St. Louis Cardinals set a major league record tonight by starling his 242d straight game, and he later passed Cy Young on the career strikeout list.

title: Knicks Win and Lead Lakers, 31
description: In the fourth straight wild: finish of a weird series for them championship of the National Basketball Association, the NewYork Knicks held on for a 10198 decision over the Los Angeles Lakers at Madison Square. Garden last night and left for: Los Angeles with a 31 lead in the fourofseven game series.

title: 11 Held in Morris County Raids On Prostitution, Drug Charges
description: MORRISTOWN, May 8Eleven persons were arrested today in what Morris County Prosecutor Donald Collester Jr. said was a major drive against prostitution, drug and gambling offenses.

title: ASK COURT ORDER
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 The Senate Watergate committee announced today that it would begin public hearings on May 17 and would move to compel testimony by John W. Dean 3d, the deposed White House counsel, by granting him immunity from prosecution.

title: Issue and Debate
description: On a highway map of the New York area, the Cross Westchester Expressway seems about to head out into Long Island Sound, but it stops short at the Connecticut Turnpike. Over on Long Island side, the SeafordOyster Bay Expressway is also headed for the Sound, but it stops short at the Jericho Turnpike.

title: American League Wednesday, May 9, 1973
description: New York 14, Minnesota 4. Chicago 1, Boston 0. Cleveland 2, California 0.

title: Concert
description: Max Pollikoff likes to box the compass in his Gallery of New Music programs, and the concert at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. on Sunday night offered four works in four drastically different styles. The pieces that generated the most interest, as it happened, were the most venturesome one, Michael Finckel's The Green Dream and the most conservative one, Meyer Kupferman's Angel Footprints. Both were first performances.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Simple little dresses. Whoever thought Rudi Gernreich would be lauded for his pretty dresses? They're short tentsand long ones, too. Some are based, more or less faithfully, on the cheongsam, the classic Chinese dress. They're decorated with flower appliqus, the kind childrentalented onescut out of colored paper. Some are sprinkled with knittedin Maltese crosses or patchwork squares. None is likely to start a revolution.

title: Adult Courses Across the U.S.
description: About 40 per cent of all colleges and universities now offer what educators sometimes call nontraditional courses  courses that adults may take without necessarily working for a degree.

title: Governor Signs His Drug Bills And Assails the Critics Again
description: ALBANY, May 8  With panoply and fanfare and some caustic words for his critics, Governor Rockefeller signed into law today the final version of his bills providing harsher penalties for traffickers in dangerous drugs.

title: NIXON PROPOSES DISASTER AID UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, May 8President Nixon proposed today legislation designed to consolidate Federal disasterassistance programs and give the states a larger responsibility.

title: PRINT CLUE SHOWN IN BARDEATH CASE
description: A fingerprint taken from a glass of whisky was shown in court here yesterday in an effort to identify a reputed member of the crime family of the late Joseph Gallo as the killer of a West Sidebar manager last March.

title: To Further Detente
description: Henry A. Kissinger's visit to Moscow may advance the valuable but limited progress toward SovietAmerican dtente made since President Nixon's visit a year ago. Beginnings have taken place in joint ventures to combine forces against such common enemies as cancer and pollution. Moscow appears most interested in trade expansion, partly because of its own internal needs and partly, no doubt, because of the ingrained Marxist belief in the primacy of economic factors.

title: Queens Prosecutor Will Appeal Reversal in the Crimmins Case
description: The reversal of the murder and manslaughter convictions against MrS. Alice Crimmins in the death of her two children almost eight years ago will be appealed, the Queens District Attorney's office said yesterday.

title: Kissinger and Brezhnev Hold Fourth Day of Talks
description: MOSCOW, May 8 (Reuters)Henry A. Kissinger met again today with Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party chief, for continued planning of Mr. Brezhnev's trip to Washington.

title: MCORD CHARGES PLOT AGAINST C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 8James W. McCord Jr. has charged that he was pressured on two occasions before his trial early this year to assert that he and his colleagues were working on a covert operation for the Central Intelligence Agency at the time of their arrest in the Watergate breakin.

title: AMZY B. STEED DIES; TEXACO EXCOUNSEL
description: GLEN HEAD, L. I., May 8Amzy B. Steed, a retired vice president and general counsel of Texaco, Inc., died yesterday. He was 59 years old and lived here.

title: Text of McCord Memo Charging Plot to Blame C.I.A. for Watergate Operation
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Following is the text of a memorandum submitted yesterday by James W. McCord Jr. to the Senate Watergate investigating committee and Federal prosecutors in the case:

title: 46 Are Relieved of Duty At Camp David Retreat
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) The Pentagon said today that 28 marines and 18 navy personnel had been taken off duty at Camp David, Md., President Nixon's mountain retreat, following an investigation into alleged marijuana use.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The current proposal in a taxreform package by President Nixon to provide tax credits for parents of parochialschool students is unwise by any reasonable public standard, primarily because it would entail, like the more direct attempts to obtain public funds, an extra tax burden on the general public in support of doctrinal religious education. Catholic schools, comprising about 80 per cent of privateschool students, would be the major recipients of such public aid.

title: Tax Postage Bill Urged
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) Taxpayers would be permitted to mail their income tax returns to the Internal Revenue Service postagefree under a bill introduced today by Representative J. Herbert Burke, Republican of Florida.

title: Major League Leaders
description: Major League Leaders

title: Generation Gap Down on the West German Farm Is Also a Big Problem for European Bloc
description: OBERALTEICH, West GermanyFarming is a philosophy, an almost hallowed way of life to the older generation in this village in eastern Bavaria; sons and daughters look at it more coldly, in far more practical terms. The difference between the generations reflects the way in which a modern industrial society is coping with its agricultural past.

title: Books of The Times
description: Leni Pfeiffer, the heroine of Group Portrait With Lady, is described by some 60 peopleyet they have not persuaded me that she exists. I am told that, as a child, she was odd in school, fascinated by her own excrement, and so rudely impatient for first communion that she was judged unready for it. I hear that she has such a genius for sensuality that at the age of 48 she experiences orgasm on feeling a slight unevenness in the pavement in front of her house and remembering it from a hopscotch game 40 years earlier. Leni, I am given to understand, had a promising brother who was shot for trying to sell a German cannon to the Danes. Her father went from power and affluence to jail because of a swindle that appeared to have been entirely unmotivated.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Football Transactions NATIONAL LEAGUE
description: BALTIMORESigned Mike Barnes, Miami defensive end, secondround draft choice, to multiyear contract.

title: Shultz Warns of Reduction In Funds for Hemisphere
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, May 8 (AP)The United States warned its neighbors today that financial priorities at home could cut sharply into funds allocated for hemisphere development. Secretary of the Treasury George P. Shultz, speaking at the 14th annual meeting of the board of governors of the InterAmerican Development Bank, said the Nixon Administration was carefully watching its budget.

title: Details of 72 Skyjack Attempt Are Related at 2d Trapnell Trial
description: A jury of nine women and three men in Federal District Court in. Brooklyn yesterday heard how Garrett B. Trapnell, a confessed hijacker, had been induced to permit 93 pas sengers of a Trans World Airlines jet to debark at Kennedy International Airport.

title: The Benefit of Doubt
description: WASHINGTONA recent Gallup Poll shows that 50 per cent of the 456 people polled think that President Nixon has been covering up facts in the Watergate case. Yet 58 per cent say they see little difference with respect to corruption between the Nixon Administration and others over the last 25 years.

title: CERRO NET SOARS; DIVIDEND DOUBLED
description: The Cerro Corporation's annual meeting in the WaldorfAstoria Hotel yesterday got off on a high notean announcement that the quarterly dividend was being doubled from 10 to 20 cents a shareand the tone continued for the duration of the onehourand55minute session.

title: SEVERE SHORTAGE OF ORES IS FEARED
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The ravenous American appetite for minerals will lead to severe shorta6s in the next few decades unless the nation stops wasting resources and starts employing better ways of finding and exploiting lowgrade ores, according to a report from the United States Geological Sttrvey.

title: Stuyvesant Town: Residents Are Still Singing Its Praise
description: Every morning, Harry Feldman trundles his mail cart past the flowering cherry trees and the chattering squirrels of Stuyvesant Town. In the red brick buildings, he is greeted by retired oldsters waiting for Social Security checks or letters from faraway sons and daughters. If he is late, they worry.

title: Tennessee Law Equalizes All Teachings on Creation
description: NASHVILLE, May 8Tennessee's new version of the state's oncefamous monkey law went into thd lawbooks at midnight without Gov. Winfield Dunn's, signature.

title: Panel Chides Governor on Pension Reform
description: ALBANY, May 8The State Pension Commission today contradicted Governor Rockefeller and warned that the state's new contract with its employes would effectively doom any chance of meaningful reform of the increasingly costly public pension system.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SPANISH GIFT If your budget doesn't allow a trip this year, or even if it does, drop into the Donnell Library Center at 20 West 53d Street (near Fifth) (7906447) between now and May 30 for a delightful look at Old and New Spain. The library, in cooperation with the South Bronx Project, is displaying a selection of the 2,000 books given to the project by the National Library of Spain, including the latest novels, biographies, histories, art books, scientific works, encyclopedias and illustrated children's books.

title: Bridge:
description: Any partnership that wishes to demonstrate its prowess in bidding, or simply desires some practice in this vital area, can compete tonight in the world bidding contest of the International Bridge Academy. In the metropolitan area this unusual event will be staged at the Gallerie Bridge Club, 236 East 75th Street.

title: Odetta Hopes for Rediscovery in Shift to Rock Style
description: Pounding her guitar as much as strumming ither rich, deep voice singing about men in jail and men fighting for survival  an impressive black woman in flowing robes performed in badly lit auditoriums and coffee houses during the nineteenfifties and established her name as one synonymous with American folk music.

title: Proxmire On the Press
description: WASHINGTON, May 8In a speech on the floor of the United States Senate, Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, has accused the press of being grossly unfair in reporting secret charges that President Nixon knew about the coverup in the Watergate case.

title: EXECUTIVES SHIFTED AT WASHINGTON POST
description: Directors of The Washington Post Company are scheduled to name Mrs. Katharine Graham today as chairman and chief executive officer and Larry H. Israel as president and chief operating officer.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of 650,000 units of Hamilton Investment Trust, a real estate trust, at $19.50 per unit (consisting of one share of beneficial interest and a warrant to purchase one additional share at $20, subject to adjustment in certain events) was made yesterday by underwriters managed by Blyth Eastman Dillon and Bateman Eichler, Hill Richards Inc.

title: Medical Care Of fer Is Accepted by 77 In '32Syphilis Study
description: ATLANTA, May 8 (AP)Seventyseven of the known 114 surviving black males involved in the Tuskegee, Ala., syphilis study have accepted an offer of medical care at Government expense for the rest of their lives.

title: AUSTRALIA ENDS BAN ON COMMUNIST TRADE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 8Australia is lifting her embargo on trade with Communist nations, including North Vietnam four months after withdrawal of the last Australian soldiers from the Vietnam war.

title: ASK COURT ORDER
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 The Senate Watergate committee announced today that it would begin public hearings on May 17 and would move to compel testimony by John W. Dean 3d, the deposed White House cone: sel, by granting him immunity from prosecution.

title: Developments in 2 Cases
description: Watergate and immunity: The Senate committee investigating Watergate will hold its first public hearings May 17 and will move to compel testimony by John W. Dean 3d, the deposed White House counsel, by granting him immunity. President Nixon, the White House said, will no longer advise prosecutors to withhold immunity from current or former members of the Administration.

title: State's High Court Weighs Colsey Future as Lawyer
description: TRENTON, May 8 (UPI) The State Supreme Court tried to determine today whether William B. Colsey 3d, a Mount Holly lawyer and a figure in Republican fund  raising investigations, had once disguised the extortion of $15,000 as a political contribution.

title: BONN COMPLETING INFLATION CURBS
description: BONN, May 8Financial officials of the West German Government met this evening to complete a tough program to curb inflation.

title: Woman Trotting Trainer Coping With a Maverick
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 8 Wenda Smorra, the only trainer at Roosevelt Raceway, was almost in tears last night after having seen Matt Coats, one of the four horses in her public stable, go off stride just as the field of trooters was approaching the starting line for the first race.

title: Plastic Liquor Bottles Face Ban Over Suspicion of Toxic Effect
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Food and Drug Administration is about to ban the use of plastic liquor bottles because of suspicions that toxic materials are seeping from the containers into their alcoholic contents.

title: Nimeiry Ousts Sudan Cabinet And Frees Political Prisoners
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, May 8 (Reuters)  President Gaafar alNimeiry of the Sudan has dismissed his 16member Cabinet in preparation for the real administrative revolution he has promised.

title: Major League Box Scores
description: Major League Box Scores

title: FLANIGAN BACKS NIXON TRADE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 8A top assistant to President Nixon termed blatant nonsense today the allegation that the President was seeking unprecedented power in his proposed trade bill.

title: Blaze Atop Xerox Tower Shuts Rochester Operation
description: ROCHESTER, May 8 (AP)A fire in an electrical transformer on the top floor of the 30 story Xerox Corporation tower today forced a virtual shutdown of the building for about one and a half hours. The structure houses about 1,800 employes.

title: COUNTERCLAIM FILED IN EQUITY DISPUTE
description: John W. Bristol & Co., Inc., the Boston Company, Inc., and Boston Company Institutional Investors, Inc., advisors to a number of major investors in the scandalridden Equity Funding Corporation of America, filed a $16million counterclaim yesterday in United States District Court here against Salomon Brothers, the Wall Street investmentbanking house.

title: Developments in 2 Cases
description: Watergate and immunity: The Senate committee investigating Watergate will hold its first public hearing May 17 and will move to compel testimony by John W. Dean 3d, the deposed White House counsel, by granting him immunity. President Nixon, the White House said, will no longer advise prosecutors to withhold immunity from current or former members of the Administration.

title: SEVERE SHORTAGE OF ORES IS FEARED
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The ravenous American appetite for minerals will lead to severe shortages in the next few decades unless the nation stops wasting resources and starts employing better ways of finding and exploiting low grade ores, according to a report from the United States Geological Sdrvey.

title: Proxmire Calls Press Unfair to Nixon A Day After Linking Him to Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Senator William Proxmire took to the floor of the Senate today to denounce the press for being grossly unfair to President Nixon, only a day after he had told a friend that he believed the President was involved in Watergate up to his ears.

title: Agnew Denounces Techniques Of the Reporting on Watergate
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., May 8 (AP) Vice President Agnew said tonight that while he applauded the role of the media in the Watergate scandal, some reporting techniques used have been a very short jump from McCarthyism.

title: Colorado a Disaster Area
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP)  President Nixon declared Colorado a disaster area today, making flooded sections of the state eligible for Federal disaster assistance. At the same time, Darrell M. Trent, acting director of the Office of Emergency Preparedness, announced the appointment of Donald G. Eddy as Federal coordinating officer for recovery work.

title: Pan Am Goal: Break Even in 73
description: BOSTON, May 8We propose to work like hell to break even this year, William T. Seawell, Pan American World Airways chairman and chief executive officer, said at the annual meeting here today.

title: MINE AIDE'S OUSTING DEMANDED BY UNION
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Senitor Robert C. Byrd, Democrat of West Virginia, the assistant floor leader, joined the United Mine Workers Union today in demanding the resignation of Donald P. Schlick as the Government's chief enforcer of strict new Federal safety regulations in the nation's coal mines.

title: Split on Capital Outlays
description: American industry is embarked upon a huge capital spending boom. The latest McGrawHill survey reports companies are planning to increase their outlays on new plant and equipment by $17billion this year to a total of $105.5billion nearly a 20 per cent jump over last year. Is this too much of a good thing? Many economists think it is, arguing that the investment boom is adding substantially to inflationary pressures. Some have advocated suspending the 7 per cent investment tax credit or cutting the accelerated depreciation system adopted in 1971 to spur capital spending.

title: NIXON AIDE DEFENDS EXECUTIVE PRIVILEGE
description: I WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI)  An Assistant Attorney General testified today that President Nixon could invoke executive privilege even in a proceeding involving his own impeachment.

title: $ 1Billion Added to Funds Available for Mortgages
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Federal Home Loan Bank Board acted today to increase the availability of mortgage loans at savings and loan associations by as much as $1billion.

title: Alexander A. Vandegrift Dies; ExCommandant of the Marines
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP): Gen. Alexander A. Vandegrift the former Marine Corps commandant who led the Marines at Guadalcanal in World Was IIdied today at Bethesda Navar Hospital. He was 86 years old.

title: Brinkmanship in a Car Stirs Up a Feud
description: At 23 Jody Scheckter is on his way to the upper echelon of Grand Prix drivers. Whether or not he reaches it, the brash South African already has attracted a big audience here and abroad; he also has become controversial. Scheckter's aggressive, roadhogging style, a highspeed abandon that keeps his Formula 5000 car in a constantly sideways posture, has brought him the lead in the 1973 L&M Championship on the basis of his victory last Sunday at Monterey, Calif., and his second place the week before at Riverside, Calif.

title: A Stormy Annual Meeting Indicated for I.T.T. Today
description: KANSAS CITY, May 8The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation holds its annual meeting here Wednesday amid indications that the big conglomerate's management could face a stormy session.

title: Two Candidates Debut On Cable Television
description: Candidates for chief judge of the State Court of Appeals and for New York City Controller have become the first to avail themselves of free time on a new cable television channel serving upper Manhattan.

title: Quick U.S. Help Urged to Avoid Pennsy Liquidation
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The trustees of the bankrupt Penn Central Railroad cautioned Congress today that it must act quickly on a plan that would include substantial cash aid from the Federal Government or accept the likelihood that the trains will stop running before October.

title: Goodrich's Output Halted in 6 States As 10,000 W alk Out
description: AKRON, Ohio, May 8 (UPI) More than 10,000 rubber workers struck the B. F. Goodrich Company today, halting all production at plants in six states. Contract talks were recessed, and no time for their resumption was announced.

title: Music: Rochberg Work
description: George Rochberg's String Quartet No. 2, which he completed in 1961, made its belated first appearance on the New York scene on Monday night when the Concord String Quartet played it with extraordinary intensity at Carnegie Recital Hall. Mr. Rochberg was working in a sternly atonal idiom in those days and his quartet, with its soprano soloist in the final portion, naturally put one in mind of Schoenberg's Third, which takes a similar vocal excursion.

title: Blimp Grounded by Storm
description: CHATTANOOGA, May 8 (AP) One of the Goodyear blimps a familiar sight to television sports fans, was grounded in Chattanooga today by severe weather caused by tornadoes in northern Alabama and Georgia.

title: Durocher to Return Friday
description: HOUSTON, May 8 (AP)Manager Leo Durocher of the Houston Astros, sidelined since April 20 with an intestinal inflammation, will take charge of the Astros again Friday when they play host to the Cincinnati Reds, a team spokesman said today. Durocher was hospitalized until last Tuesday and has been resting at home since.

title: M'GOVERN LETTERS FOUND GONE IN FALL
description: Correspondence between the 1972 Democratic Presidential nominee, Senator George McGovern, and the senior partner in the Wall Street brokerage firm of Unterberg (C.E) Towbin Company was discovered missing during the campaign last fail.

title: Frederick Adams, 53, Dies; A Jersey Turnpike Official
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., May 8Frederick M. Adams, a commissioner of the New Jersey Turnpike Authority and a former Mayor of Woodbridge, died today in Elizabeth General Hospital. His age was 53 and he lived at Colonia.

title: $1.2BILLION ASKED FOR MILITARY AID
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) The outgoing Secretary of Defense, Elliot L. Richardson, asked Congress today for $1.2billion in military aid for Cambodia, Korea, Thailand and other areas.

title: Cambodia Said to Retake 2 Towns Near Capital
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 8 (UPI)Cambodian military sources reported the recapture of two towns near Phnom Penh today.

title: Records
description: Of all the composers universally recognized as great by the histories of music, Christoph Willibild Gluck is surely the least performed (prebaroque masters excepted, of course). Gluck may not have been quite the purist as a reformer that he himself or some subsequent eulogists thought him to be. But he did create a number of noble operas that counterpoint the ornate excesses of the rococo.

title: Candidates Day
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame vowed yesterday to go into the ring, if necessary, to prove he was as vigorous as his younger opponents in the primary race for the Democratic nomination for Mayor.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES CONTINUE TO RISE
description: Prices of nearby soybean futures continued their dizzying climb yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Public Broadcasting Due to Name Killian Chairman
description: Dr. James Killian Jr. was expected to be elected chairman of the board of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting today in what informed sounces said would be an attempt to give the impression that the board is Independent of White House control.

title: CESAR CHARLONE
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 8 (UPI)Cesar Charlone, economist, politician and lawyer, died today of a heart attack. He was 77 years old.

title: MARCOS STRESSES NATIONAL DIGNITY
description: MANILA, May 8President Ferdinand E. Marcos tonight described new perspectives in Philippine foreign policy, including a reorganization of relations with the United States.

title: Hart Schaffner and Marx Views Antitrust Decree
description: CHICAGO, May 8 (Reuters) Hart Schaffner and Marx said today it had been advised that the Justice Department would not consent to relieving the company of provisions of 1970 antitrust consent decree relating to divestiture of 23 retail mens wear stores.

title: Philadelphia Post Office Seems to Forget Stanton
description: STANTON, May 8Postal authorities in the city of brotherly love across the Delaware from this friendly hamlet seem to exhibit a disdain from time to time toward Stanton's thirdclass post office that offends the sensibilities of its 104 boxholders.

title: SOVIET SCIENTIST FACING A THREAT
description: MOSCOW, May 8Dr. Veniamin G. Levich, an internationally known physical chemist who applied last year for permission to emigrate to Israel, was threatened today with expulsion from the Soviet Academy of Sciences.

title: Roundup: Expos Halt Astro String on Wild Throw, 43
description: Ken Singleton, the exMet who went to Montreal as part of the deal for Rusty Staub in April of last season, had a hand in two rallies last night as the Expos snapped Houston's ninegame winning streak, 43, on Jim York's wild throw to the plate in the ninth.

title: Gary Meichionni Accepts Suns MultiYear Contract
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., May 8 (AP) The Phoenix Suns signed Gary Meichionni, former Duke University star, to a multiyear contract yesterday.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Shipping/Mails

title: Television
description: 6:30 (2)Sunrise Semester (4)A11 About Your Car (5)Read Your Way Up (7)Listen and Learn

title: For 1,600 at Queens College, Over 30 Is Not Over the Hill
description: Some students were sitting after lunch at Queens College the other day. They were all over 30, their average age being close to 50, and they were all working toward either bachelors or graduate degrees.

title: DepressedArea Aid Approved By Senate Despite Veto Threat
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Senate ignored the threat of another Presidential veto today as it approved a $362.5million, oneyear extension of programs to aid economically depressed areas of the nation.

title: Proceedings in the U.N.
description: Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space, scientific and technical subcommittee10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Northeastern Crew No. 1 In Eastern Title Sprints
description: Northeastern, the defending champion, was seeded first yesterday for Saturday's Eastern sprint championships at Worcester, Mass. The Huskie crew, undefeated after four races, was placed atop the list of 15 heavyweight eights ahead of Harvard, also unbeaten.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 49

title: ExSergeants Say Army Wouldn't Uncover Noncom Club Fraus
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Four former Army sergeants who organized a ring that systematically defrauded noncommissioned officers clubs in Vietnam told Senate investigators today that the Army was incapable of uncovering such wrongdoing by itself.

title: M'CORD CHARGES PLOT AGAINST CIA.
description: WASHINGTON, May 8James W. McCord Jr. hat charged that he was pressurec on two occasions before hit trial early this year to assert that he and his colleagues were working on a covert operatior for the Central Intelligencc Agency at the time of their arrest in the Watergate breakin.

title: Ziegler Says Nixon Na Longer Advises Watergate Prosecutors to Refuse Immunity
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The White House said today that President Nixon was no longer advising prosecutors in the Watergate case not to grant immunity to present or former members of the Administration.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Citing the deaths of 24,000 people each year because of bad reactions to medication, a state appeals court upheld yesterday a rule requiring druggists to keep a profile record on their customers.

title: Pilots Strike Icelandic, Leaving 249 Stranded
description: Icelandic. Airlines was struck by its pilots last night, stranding 249 passengers booked on the airline's only evening flight from Kennedy Airport.

title: Van Lier Denies He Led Assault on Police Officers
description: BEAVER, Pa., May 8 (AP)Norm Van Lier, on trial with six other men in connection with an altercation with the police last August, denied under oath today that he led the alleged assault.

title: QE 2 Is Heading for Home On Her Cruise to Israel
description: ASHDOD, Israel, May 8 (AP) The liner Queen Elizabeth 2 steamed homeward through the Mediterranean today, half her cruise completed without any Arab terrorist attacks against her Jewish passengers.

title: Today's Events
description: A lecture on the Indian Heritage of the Bronx at the Wave Hill Center in Riverdale at 8 P.M.

title: A.B.A. Playoffs
description: April 28Ind. 111, Kent. 107 (OT). April 30Kent. 114, Ind. 102. May 3Kent. 92, bd. 83. May 5Ind. 90, Kent. 86. May 8Ind. 89, Kent. 86. May 10At Indiana, 9:10 P.M. May 12At Kentucky, 2 P.M. If necessary.

title: Yankee Records
description: BATTING PITCHING

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Stocks Stage a Rebound As Turnover Edges Ahead
description: The stock market is getting to be as much of a rebound artist as Wilt Chamberlain.

title: Syracuse Pair, With 1,279, Takes 2dPlace in Bowling
description: SYRACUSE, N.Y., May 8 (AP) Gus Lampo and Mike Orlovsky, of Endicott, N. Y., bowled 1.279 yesterday and took second place in the Classic Division doubles of the American Bowling Congress tournament.

title: CHAPIN IS NAMED MANAGER OF MET
description: Schuyler G. Chapin has been named general manager of the Metropolitan Opera. The announcement, which confirms yestcerday's reports that the appointment was pending, was made at the opera house late yesterday afternoon by George S. Moore, president of the Metropolitan Opera Association, after a special meeting of the board of directors. Mr. Chapin's contract is for the next three seasons.

title: MEANY DEMANDS VIGOROUS INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, May 8George Meany, president of the A.F.L.C.I.O., describing the Nixon Administration as steeped in scandal and twisted by privilege, called today for a vigorous and impartial investigation of the Watergate conspiracy.

title: BRITISH BLACKMAIL IN ULSTER REVEALED
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 8Lord Carrington, the British Defense Secretary, said today that British soldiers had tried to blackmail a Belfast teenager into spying for the army.

title: PACERS SET BACK COLONELS, 8986
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 8 (AP) George McGinnis stole an inbounds pass and drove under for a stuff shot in the final 23 seconds tonight to clinch Indiana's 8986 victory over the Kentucky Colonels and give the Pacers 32 lead in the American Basketball Association championship playoff.

title: Jets Sign Quarterback
description: IDAHO FALLS, Idaho, May 8 (AP)Tom Lee, a former Idaho State University quarterback, today signed a freeagent contract with the New York Jets. He said he was optimistic about making the Jets because they did not draft any quarterbacks this year and last season that position seemed to be one of their weakest.

title: Monday's Fight
description: New York (Felt Forum) Sammy Goss, 129 pounds, J., Trenton, N. J. outpointed Jos Fernandez, 129, New York, 10 rounds.

title: Hawks Top Canadiens, 87, And Trail, 32, in Playoff
description: MONTREAL, May 8 Impiobably, yet irresistibly, the Chicago Black Hawks kept hockey's longest season alive tonight with an 87 victory over the mighty Canadiens. It was the highest scoring Stanley Cup game in the 47 years the National Hockey League has kept the silver cup, and it preserved the underdog Chicagoans chances.

title: CHARLES GRAYSON
description: LOS ANGELES, May 8 (AP) Charles Grayson, novelist and screenwriter who wrote more than 20 screenplays including Beau Geste, Battle Hymn and The Barbarian and the Geisha, died Friday. He was 69 years old.

title: C.I.A. LINK TO HUNT CONFIRMED BY U.S.
description: LOS ANGELES, May 8The deputy director of the Central Intelligence Agency met at the agency with E. Howard Hunt Jr. in July, 1971, and ordered that Hunt be supplied with false identity papers and such disguises as a wig, glasses and a voice alteration device, the Government confirmed today at the Pentagon papers trial.

title: House Backs Ship Bill
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP)  Legislation to authorize $103.5million for ship purchases and shore installation programs for the Coast Guard was passed today by the House and sent to the Senate.

title: JERSEY CITY RACE IS WON BY JORDAN
description: JERSEY CITY, May 8Mayor Paul T. Jordan won a lopsided reelection victory tonight over Thomas Gangemi Jr. and the remnants of the oncepowerful Democratic organization of John V. Kenny.

title: SELLING WEAKENS DOLLAR IN LONDON
description: LONDON, May 8 (AP)The value of the United States dolJar fell in Europe today. It suffered its worst day on the London foreignexchange market since the crisis surrounding the February dollar devaluation.

title: COURT ORDERS U.S. TO RELEASE FUNDS FOR CLEAN WATER
description: WASHINGTON, May 8  A Federal court ordered the Government today to make available $6billion to the states for water pollution control, bringing Federal funding up to the full amount authorized by Congress last year.

title: Business Briefs
description: Reflecting the booming economy, the effects of inflation, inventory revaluation and dollar devaluation, firstquarter profits of 1,545 United States corporations rose 26 per cent to $11billion from $8.79billion in the'first three months of last year. The gain was but three per cent from the 1972 fourthquarter net of $10.7billion.

title: JERSEY CITY RACE IS WON BY JORDAN
description: JERSEY CITY, May 8Mayor Paul T. Jordan won a lopsided reelection victory tonight over Thomas Gangemi Jr. and the remnants of the oncepowerful Democratic organization of John V. Kenny.

title: Ralph Miller, 100, Is Dead; Brooklyn Pitcher in 1898
description: CINCINNATI, May 8 (AP) Ralph Darwin Miller, believed to be the oldest living former major league baseball player, died at a rest home here yesterday. He was 100 years old.

title: 3 CharterFlight Bookers Cited onCriminalCharges
description: Criminal charges have been brought against three New York charterflight promoters who, the Manhattan District Attorney's office alleged yesterday, stranded thousands of passengers nere aria aoroaa last summer. Although multimillion  dollar  a  year underground travel industry offering cheap flights to Europe has flourished openly for years in apparent violation of Civil Aeronautics Board rules, the criminal action was said to be the first in more than 20 years against a charterflight promoter here.

title: Nixon's Words on Diem
description: WASHINGTON, May 8On Sept. 16, 1971, President Nixon was asked at a news conference what the United States could do about the oneman presidential campaign then in progress in South Vietnam.

title: Eva Peron Lives Again On Anniversary of Birth
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 8Can't you feel it? Can't ym. feel it? Evita is present, chanted a frenzied crowd gathered in front of the General Labor Union headquarters here to celebrate the 54th birthday anniversary of Eva Duarte Pern.

title: Some Corporate Bond Prices Cain as TaxExempts Decline
description: Some sectors of the bond market snapped back from string of declines yesterday and posted moderate gains in relatively brisk trading. Many corporate issues, after some early weakness, had climbed by  point$2.50 per bond by the close of the session, and Treasury securities rose by 2 to 8/32ds of a point. Taxexempts, on the other hand, tended to drift lower as the large Hawaii and Massachusetts deals loomed for bidding today and tomorrow. Bidding is expected to be fairly aggressive.

title: Occupation of Wounded Knee Is Ended
description: WOUNDED KNEE, S. D., May 8The second Battle of Wounded Knee ended today.

title: THIRD CEASEFIRE BEGINS IN LEBANON AFTER JET ATTAG
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Wednesday, May 9A new ceasefire between Government forces and Palestinian guerrillas was announced last night after day marked by heavy rocket attacks by Lebanese jets on guerrilla positions.

title: ACCORD SEEN NEAR IN WRITERS STRIKE
description: LOS ANGELES, May 8 (AP) A settlement may be near in the nineweekold Writers Guild strike that has brought large segments of the motion picture and television industries to a standstill.

title: Sikkim Pact for Popular Rule Reported
description: NEW DELHI May 8An agreement to give the Indian protectorate of Sikkim a more democratic form of government was reportedly signed tonight, resolving the crisis that led India to take over the kingdom's administration last month.

title: ADELPIII SUSPENDS A STAR TRACKMAN
description: Adelphi University suspended yesterday its outstanding quartermiler, Dennis Walker, from intercollegiate competition in the face of threats by the Eastern College Athletic Conference and National Collegiate Athletic Association to penalize Adelphi if the senior track star continued to run.

title: G.O.P. Names Election Aide
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) Edward Mahe Jr., was appointed today as the Republican party's director of political activities to oversee party building and planning for the 1973 and 1974 election campaigns.

title: A Letter by Washington Brings Record $27,500
description: An anonymous Long Island collector paid $27,500 yesterday for a letter written by George Washington, the highest auction price ever paid for a Washington letter.

title: NASTASE IS VICTOR IN TWO MATCHES
description: BOURNEMOUTH, England, May 8 (UPI)Topseeded Ilie Nastase of Rumania breezed through his two opening matches today in the $65,000 British clay court tennis championships. Three seeded players were eliminated.

title: Europe Warned of Energy Crisisby'80
description: STRASBOURG, France, May 8A committee of the Etiropean Parliament warned today of an energy crisis by 1980 in which quite literally the lights would go out all over Europe unless the member countries of the Common Market agreed on a comprehensive energy policy.

title: Adirondacks Compromise Is Reached
description: ALBANY, May 8A compromise agreement was reached today that is expected to clear the way for passage of legislation to control development of the 3.7 million acres of private land in the Adirondack Park.

title: Traman's 89th Birthday Commemorated at Grave
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., May 8 (AP)Harry S. Truman's hometown and representatives from Washington joined today in marking the 89th birthday anniversary of the 33d President.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Threemonthold Kim Cruz was taken off the critical list at St. Vincent's Hospital yesterday, and a spokesman there said she was now in fair condition, The baby had been in critical condition with cerebral hemorrhaging since May 8, when she was rescued from her father, James Layne, who allegedly tried to sell her on the IRT subway to get money for narcotics.

title: Campers and Trailers Too Racy for the 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 8 (AP)  Campers and trailers will be barred from the infield of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway for the 500mile race May 28 because they encourage vice, according to the Speedway Traffic Committee.

title: ADELPHI SUSPENDSA STAR TRACKMAN
description: Adelphi University suspended yesterday its outstanding quartermiler, Dennis Walker, from intercollegiate competition in the face of threats by the Eastern College Athletic Conference and National Collegiate Athletic Association to penalize Adelphi if the senior track star continued to run.

title: CocaCola Profits Up in First Quarter
description: Net profit of the CocaCola Company for the first quarter this year increased 15.3 per cent to a record $40.6million, or 68 cents a share, from $35.2million, or 59 cents, in the initial three months last year, it was reported yesterday.

title: COURT ORDERS U.S. TO RELEASE FUNDS FOR CLEAN WATER
description: WASHINGTON, May 8  A Federal court ordered the Government today to make available $6billion to the states for water pollution control, bringing Federal funding up to the full amount authorized by Congress last year.

title: Advertising: Premium Progress
description: If you work on the assumption that manufacturers of items suitable for premiums wouldn't be in business long if they couldn't judge the public's needs and wants, then there are some interesting trends to note at the 35th annual Premium Show now at the New York Coliseum.

title: Major League Leaders
description: Major League Leaders

title: EDWARD J. POWERS
description: WINCHESTER, Mass., May 8 (AP)Edward J. Powers, president and general manager of the Boston Garden Arena, died today in Winchester Hospital. He was 66 years old.

description: May IL.A. 115, Knicks 112. May 3Knicks 99, L.A. 95. May 6Knicks 87, L.A. 83 May 8Knicks 103, L.A. 98. May 10At L.A., 10:30 P.M. May 13At Garden, 2:10 P.M., ticket K9.* May 15At L.A., 10 P.M.* *If necessary.

title: Derailment in West Nyack
description: WEST NYACK, N.Y., May 8 (UPI)Thirteen cars of a 137car Penn Central freight train derailed here early today near the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway. Penn Central officials could not say when service on the railroad's West Shore branch, its main northsouth freight line between Albany and New York, would be restored. Some of the cars tumbled down an embankment and came to rest near the Thruway, which the line crosses on a bridge, There were no reports of injuries.

title: Federal Officials Study Pedal Power As One Alternative to Piston Power
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 8It is incumbent upon us to get past the stage of talking about the revival of the bike as if we were trying to convince ourselves that it really is a viable mode of transportation. Rather, I think it is time to concentrate on the, disadvantages of a bicycle and try to find ways of overcoming those disadvantages.

title: The Indian Tragedy
description: Yesterday's peaceful denouement of the ten  week occupation of Wounded Knee by militant Indians and concurrent siege by Federal marshals was a credit to cooler heads on both sides. This tragic event, as an Indian leader described it, was a lesser tragedy by far than it might have been because of the restraint shown by the Government and of the ultimate wisdom of tribal leaders in agreeing to move from confrontation to dialogue.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, May 8When Marty Caffrey was still at Seton Hall Prep, he decided to follow his brother, Paul, to Seton Hall University, a mile from his home, rather than play for the New York Mets, who had drafted him.

title: INQUIRY ON RESCUES OF YOUTHS IS ASKED
description: The Connecticut Civil Liberties Union has called upon the United States Attorney in Connecticut to investigate series of recent efforts by parents to rescue their children from religious groups they regard as dangerous.

title: Peru Takes Over Declining Fisheries
description: LIMA: Peru, May 8 (UPI)The military Government of Gen. Juan Velasco Alvarado said today that it was expropriating the country's fishing industry, once the biggest in the world, because of a twoyear economic crisis.

title: Eisner Gets Housing Post
description: Lester Eisner Jr., a former Federal and state housing official, has been named acting deputy commissioner of the State Division of Housing and Community Renewal. He succeeds Avrum Hyman, who has resigned to join the staff of the Battery Park City Authority.

title: News Sammary and Index WEDNESDAY, MAY 9, 1973
description: The Senate Watergate committee announced that it would begin public hearings on May 17 and that it would move to compel testimony by John W. Dean 3d, the deposed White House counsel. The hearings are scheduled to be televised and will provide the first public testimony under oath in the Watergate case since the Federal court trial of two Watergate conspirators last January. [1:8.]

description: College and School Results

title: Time Inc. Will Sell Cable TV Systems
description: Warner Communications, Inc., has reached an agreement to acquire the cabletelevision systems of Time Inc., it was learned yesterday. Announcement of the transaction is expected to be made today.

description: Aqueduct Race Charts

title: Herbert Brean Is Dead at 65;. Editor, Author of 7 Mysteries
description: Herbert J. Brean, a novelist, mysterystory writer and editor, died Monday, apparently of a heart attack, at New York Hospital. He was 65, years old and lived at 500 East 77th Street.

title: Deaths
description: Deaths

title: Stars Deadlock Metros, 11
description: ST. LOUIS, May 8 (AP)Pat McBride's late shot gave the St. Louis Stars a 1.1 tie with the Toronto Metros tonight in a North American Soccer League game. Toronto had taken a 10 lead at 7 minutes 57 seconds when Peter Roe looped in a long shot.

title: Arms of Judaism Are Urged to Share Edifices for Saving
description: GROSSINGER, N, Y., May The use of a single religious building by the congregations of the three branches of Judaism  Orthodox, Conservative and Reformthat would cut expenses and help cope with other pressures was advocated today before 500 Conservative rabbis.

title: Trading Total Rises To 1 Million Shares For Stock Options
description: The volume of trading in stock options reached a cumulative total of one million shares at midsession yesterday on the Chicago Board Options Exchange. Trading in stock call options there began on April 26.

title: Strike One
description: The strike that has shut down Goodrich rubber plants in six states is the first somber warning that union moderation on the wage front may be cracking under the squeeze of resurgent inflation.

title: Prices and Volume Edge Up on the Amex and OTC
description: Advances narrowly outnumbered declines yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market in slightly steppedup trading.

title: Yanks Again Pick On Twins in 144 Rout
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 8There's nothing wrong with the Yankees that the Minnesota Twins can't cure. Even Rod Carew, no physician he, recognized the getwell symptoms. Don't worry, the Twins second baseman said before tonight's game, we'll help them get their averages up again. For Minnesota, the prognosis proved painfully perfect.

title: Red Smith
description: Pete Reiser, a coach with the Cubs, got knocked out the other day trying to break up a brawl with the San Francisco Giants. He had to be carried from the field on a stretcherfor the 12th time since he burst into baseball. When the Brooklyn Dodgers signed him for a $100 bonus, Pete Reiser had as much natural talent as Willie Mays, Joe DiMaggio, Stan Musial or Mickey Mantle. His weakness was that there never was a ball park large enough to contain his effort. To him, outfield fences were obstacles unreasonably impeding his pursuit of line drives. To save his life, Branch Rickey had the walls in Ebbets Field padded. Except for Pete, foam rubber might never have been invented. Only twice during his playing days was he conscious when they carried him off the field. On nine other occasions he woke up in the clubhouse or in a hospital. Once the umpire at second base had to run to the centerfield wall, bend over him and pry open his gloved hand to find the ball and call the batter out.

title: Appeal to Red Cross Says Athens Tortures Students
description: ATHENS, May 8An anonymous appeal to the International Red Cross and world opinion alleged tonight that security authorities had arrested student leaders and were torturing them.

title: Women's Interclub Golf Summaries
description: WESTCHESTER NEW JERSEY LONG ISLAND

title: Victim Tells Inquiry on Compensation Of Physician's Fees for Nontreatment
description: TRENTON, May 8A young woman injured in an automobile accident in 1969 testified before the State Commission of Investigation today that she had been referred to a physician who treated her six times by putting her in a closet with a heat lamp and dark glasses and then billed her law firm for 39 treatments.

title: DAVID J. WITMER
description: LOS ANGELES, May 8 (AP) David J. Witmer, who helped design the Pentagon as cochief and chief architect for the War Department in 194143, died Saturday at the age of 84.

title: New Books
description: Lady Scatterley's Lovers, by Gene Fowler, edited and introduced by H. Allen Smith (Lyle, Stuart, Secaucus, N. J., $5.95). Posthumous edition of a spoof written in the late nineteenthirties.

title: TEXTILE WORKERS RATIFY CONTRACT
description: Textile workers yesterday ended a sevenday strike here and in New Jersey and returned to work after ratifying a threeyear contract with two employer groups.

title: MINTYRE RESIGNS FROM F.T.C. POST
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 A. Everette Maclntyre has ended a controversy over his possible vulnerability to White House influence by resigning from the Federal Trade Commission.

title: WOMAN TAKES HELM AT PRESS CLUB HERE
description: The New York Press Club, which will mark its silver anniversary in July, inducted its first woman, president last night at its annual installation and awards dinner at the Roosevelt Hotel.

title: Jordan Protests at the U.N. Against Parade in Jerusplem
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 8Jordan protested here today against the military parade that Israel staged yesterday in Jerusalem, partly through the former Jordanian sector, in celebration of her 25th anniversary of independence.

title: ROSS LASLEY DIES; PARADE EDITOR
description: STAMFORD, Conn, May 8Ross A. Lasley, an industrial consultant who was the first editor of Parade magazine after its founding in the early nineteenforties, died last evening, apparently of pneumonia, in Norwalk Hospital. He was 74 years old and for the last several years, since his retirement, had made his home on the Calypso, a 40foot yacht moored in Stamford Harbor.

description: Front Page 2  No Title
