title: LISTEN TO YOUNG, RABBIS CAUTIONED
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y., May 9 Three leaders of major American Jewish organizations expressed general agreement today that the needs and demands of youths must be the top priority of all Jewish communal agencies.

title: JURIST CRITICIZES LEFTOVER 1930 LAW
description: In an unusual ruling in which a jurist sharply criticized a state law while invoking its provisions, Judge Joseph J. Kunzeman of the State Supreme Court in Queens County yesterday levied a total fine of $250 against the Jamaica Gas and Electric Company of Great Neck, L.I., for violations of the state's FeldCrawford fairtrade law.

title: CENTRAL BANK WOES CONCEDED BY FED
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York conceded yesterday that the Central Bank is having serious problems in controlling the nation's money supply.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Roosevelt Raceway Harness Racing Results

title: Candidates Day
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal charged yesterday that Controller Abraham D. Beame lacked the energy and stamina absolutely necessary to survive as Mayor.

title: FARM AID VOTED BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The Senate Agriculture Committee, rejecting Nixon Administration demands, approved today a farm bill providing a subsidy mechanism designed to maintain farmer's incomes at levels close to the record set last year.

title: C.I.A. HEAD ADMITS ILLADVISED ACT'
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The head of the Central Intelligence Agency said today that the agency had been insufficiently cautious in providing materials to a White House aide involved in the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: PRICE PROPOSAL WOULD FOIL LAW
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The Cost of Living Council has drafted a proposed corporate disclosure regulation that would effectively defeat the intent of controversial legislation enacted by Congress last week. The agency expects to make the draft regulation public tomorrow.

title: Weekly Fights Are Returning to Television
description: Boxing, one of the reasons there are more television sets than bathtubs in the United States, returns to the tube nationally on a weekly basis this summerJuly 7 through Sept. 1over the American Broadcasting Company, it was announced yesterday.

title: Major League Leaders
description: Major League Leaders

title: Duke Power Reports Advance Of 37.8% in Net for Quarter
description: The Duke Power Company, which operates in the Piedmont section of North and South Carolina, where the textile industry is the dominant business, realized a 37.8 per cent increase in earnings on a revenue gain of 23 per cent in the first quarter this year, it was reported yesterday.

title: YANKS TOP TWINS 5TH TIME IN ROW
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 9The Yankees bade goodby to the Minnesota Twins with mixed emotions tonight. They were happy to be going home, but they were sad because they wouldn't see the Twins again until July 6. If they could play the Twins from now until then, they could wrap up the American League's Eastern Division title and maybe the Western title, too.

title: Minor Leagues
description: Minor Leagues

title: Would the Killer Instinct Give Chess: Fischer the Tiddleywinks Title?
description: Col. Edmund B. Edmondson, the retired Air Force officer who directs the United States Chess Federation, firmly believes that, had Bobby Fischer never learned chess, he would have been world champion of something else.

title: DECLASSIFICATION OF DATA GOES ON
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) Despite cumbersome and timeconsuming procedures, the process of declassifying millions of secret Government papers is proceeding on schedule, the project supervisor said today.

title: Reflections on Watergate
description: The Administration's handling of the Watergate affair does nothing to challenge the general belief that govs ernments do a poor job of policing themselves.

title: Barclays's Offer for L.I. Trust Is Denied
description: The New York State Banking Board, acting on the recommendation of Harry W. Albright Jr., the Superintendent of Banks, denied yesterday the application of Barclays Bank, Ltd., of London to acquire the $508million Long Island Trust Company of Garden City.

title: REGISTRATION PLAN PASSED BY SENATE,
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (UPI) After breaking a monthlong filibuster, the Senate passed today and sent to the House a bill that would allow eligible voters in Presidential and Congressional elections to register simply by filling out and mailing a postcard form.

title: DRUGDATARIAING LAUDED IN JERSEY
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 9Court approval of a new rule Irequiring druggists to keep medical profiles of their customer was described as a great victory today by Millicent H. Fenwick, director of the state's Division of Consumer Affairs.

title: Kerner Makes Escrow Plea
description: CHICAGO, May 9 (UPI) Judge Otto Kerner said today that he had asked Federal Court officials to hold his $42,500 annual judicial salary in escrow, pending appeal of his conviction in the racetrack stock bribery trial. I thought it was the proper thing to do, the United States Appeals Court judge after he made the request to the administrative office of the U.S. courts in Washington.

title: Don't Fear Aliens, Lindsay Tells Soviet
description: MOSCOW, May 9Mayor Lindsay told Russians today that they had a beautiful and remarkable country and should stop being afraid of foreigners.

title: AllStar Orchestra From U.S. Schools In Virtuoso Concert
description: Even having attended American Youth Performs concerts in past years and knowing what remarkable standards these high school musicians achieve, it came as a fresh surprise to hear such an astounding display of professionalism.

title: CAMBODIAN REBELS LAUNCH 2 ATTACKS
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 9 (UPI)Communist forces have launched attacks along two major highways and infiltrated a string of villages northeast of Phnom Penh, shifting the emphasis of their offensive well away from the Cambodian capital, military sources said today.

title: List of Initial Witnesses For Senate Committee
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Following is the list of the initial witnesses who the Senate committee investigating the Watergate affair announced would appear, starting May 17:

title: Developments in 2 Cases
description: Richardson hearing: On the first day of confirmation hearings, Attorney Generaldesignate Elliot L. Richardson told the Senate Judiciary Committee that although he planned to delegate considerable authority to a special Watergate prosecutor for whom he had begun a search, he would maintain ultimate responsibility. His position was challenged amid indications his confirmation was in doubt.

title: Death Penalty Has Been Restored by 13 States
description: Thirteen states have enacted laws to bring back the death penalty and measures reinstating capital punishment are awaiting action by the Governors of two other states.

title: Radio  TV Spending Rose Only Slightly In 1972 Elections
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 Spending on television and radio advertising in the 1972 election campaign increased hardly at all from 1968, largely because a new law forced broadcasters to charge their lowest rate for political ads last year, the Federal Communications Commission reported today.

title: Eban Visits Washington
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (Reuters)  Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel arrived in Washington tonight for a short private visit. He will talk with Secretary of State William P. Rogers tomorrow.

title: House Votes a Ban On NOW Accounts; Senate Action Due
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (UPI) The House voted overwhelmingly today to prohibit mutual savings banks from opening interestbearing checking accounts.

title: Guilt of Party Is Rejected At Meeting of Governors
description: Governor Rockefeller joined other Republican Governors here yesterday in saying that Republicans in general would not or should not be considered guilty of the Watergate scandal.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Governor Cahill urged municipalities and property owners yesterday to purchase special flood insurance protect themselves against a severe threat of flooding New Jersey.

title: When a Class of Very Young Artists Was Introduced to a Venerable Art
description: When 49 youngsters filed into the GoddardRiverside Community Center the other morning, not one knew what printmaking was.

title: Japanese and Sheraton Deal
description: ITT Sheraton Corporation of national Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, said its unit the Sheraton Palace Corporation had sold the Sheraton Palace Hotel in San Francisco to a Japanese hotel chain operator, Kokusai Kogyo Company. ITT Sheraton declined to disclose the purchase price but Japanese sources put it a $5,5million.

title: City Moving to Put Down PrescriptionDrug Abuse
description: A sixpoint program to deal with an alarming growth in the abuse of such prescription drugs as barbiturates, sedatives and tranquilizers was announced yesterday by Gordon Chase, head of the city's Health Services Administration. While we've seen evidence of a decline in heroin addiction, Mr. Chase said, we've noticed the building danger of prescriptiondrug abuse, and particularly abuse of barbiturates and other sedativehypnotics, which affects all segments of the population. This is a situation which must be dealt with and monitored closely.

title: People and Business
description: Willis B. Boyer, president of the Republic Steel Corporation, was named chairman yesterday and William J. De Lancey, executive vice president, succeeded him as president. The appointment of Mr. Boyer, who is 58, fills a post vacant since Thomas Patton retired as chairman in 1971.

title: Ohio Approves a Lottery
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May (UPI)  Ohioans approved a state lottery in the primary yesterday, and members of the General Assembly were making plans today to set it up by November.

title: 3,000 Employes Dismissed By Agriculture Department
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (UPI) The Agriculture Department has ordered the dismissal of about 3,000 employes of state and county farm programs in a cutback caused mainly by elimination of a popular conservation subsidy program, officials confirmed today.

title: Credit Markets: Prices Rise on Easier Money Rates
description: Bond prices worked a bit higher on balance yesterday for the second consecutive session, aided by some easier money rates and strong demand for $2billion of Federal agency financing to be formally offered this morning to yield 7.05 per cent.

title: C.I.A. HEAD ADMITS ILLADVISED ACT
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The head of the Central Intelligence Agency said today that the agency had been insufficiently cautious in providing materials to a White House aide involved in the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: CHANGES SOUGHT ON CONTROLLERS
description: A staff report prepared for the State Charter Revision Commission for New York City says the panel has received suggestions from some commissions, civic organizations and study groups that the Controller's term of office differs from the Mayor's.

title: Pope Names 1975 a Holy Year; Big Influx Is Expected in Rome
description: ROME, May 9Pope Paul VI today proclaimed 1975 as Holy Year and directed Roman Catholic communities throughout the world to begin spiritual preparations on Pentecost, June 10, for the event.

title: Governor Appoints Armstrong as New Queens D.A.
description: Governor Rockefeller yesterday appointed Michael F. Armstrong, the former counsel of the Knapp Commission, as the new District Attorney of Queens.

title: LONDON METAL MARKET
description: LONDON METAL MARKET

title: Dance: Revelations and Blues Suite
description: There are two works that have for years and years dominated the repertory of the Alvin Ailey Dance Company  Revelations and Blues Suite. It is rare, indeed, to find an Ailey program without one of them on the bill, and quite, often both are in attendance.

title: UNION CHIEF ASSERTS TOLL MEN BACK HIM
description: Anthony M. Mauro, supended president of the Uniformed Bridge and Tunnel Officers, announced yesterday that 420 of the .482 Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority Employes he represented had quit the union and designated him as their choice for bargaining agent.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Federal Office of Wage Stabilization yesterday restored part of a raise cut back by the Pay Board during Phase 2. It ordered its payment retroactive to July 1 to 33,000 workers at 40 voluntary hospitals and nursing homes here. The workers had been granted a 7.5 per cent increase in the first year of a twoyear contract negotiated by Local 1199 of the Drug and Hospital Union. The board had cut the raise back to 5.5 per cent.

title: Diamonds and a 2Ton Safe Are Stolen
description: In an earlymorning blitzkrieg, burglars broke into the loft of a Canal Street diamond merchant yesterday, dragged a 4,000pound safe across the room and slammed it through a window and the surrounding brick wall to the street 20 feet below.

title: Illegal Amphetamine Kills 18 Persons in One Month
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs warned today of a new illegally produced amphetamine that has caused at least 18 deaths since it first appeared in. Canada and the United States a month ago.

title: Kissinger Leaves Soviet Alter Four Days of Talks
description: MOSCOW, May 9Henry Kissinger today concluded four days of intensive private talks with the Soviet leadership with the surprise assertion that the date for the visit to the United States of Leonid I. Brezhnev, the party leader, had not yet been set.

title: Business Still Roys for Florists Here
description: About 7 o'clock every night this week, 23yearOld Jint Sehmitt of East Sayville, L. I. will start gathering rosebudsperhaps 60,000 of them in all colors and stemlengths and crated with ice Making a dozen or more stops at greenhouses in Suffelk and Nassau counties, he will also pick up enough boxes of orchidi, carnations, chrysanthemums and, other varieties., 35foot trailer truck,By 1 or 2 A.M. he will be delivering them to the blossomy bedlam that the New York Wholesale flower market just before Mother's Day.

title: HAMSTERS SEEK 8% PAY INCREASE
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The International Brotherhood of Teamsters presented today a contract proposal calling for wage increases totaling $1.50 ran hour over the next three years, an increase of about 8 per cent a year, union and industry sources said. Substantial new fringe benefits were also sought in the master freight agreement with the nation's trucking industry.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES CLIMB TO RECORD
description: Soybean futures prices reached new highs on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: Dachshunds as TradeIn Start of Welty's Career
description: Badgerdog history was made last Friday when the Dachshund Club of New Jersey held its specialty at the Holiday Inn in Bordentown. It was the club's first independent show since it was organized 30 years ago by 10 fanciers.

title: Stage: Taut Rashomon
description: The famous, key props of Rashomon, the classic Japanese drama, lie scattered on the floor as you enter the tiny, stageless showcase of the C.S.C. Repertory Theater  two wicked looking swords, a woman's veiled hat, a medium's mask and a woodcutter's ax.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yeaterday was:

title: Unintelligence
description: The Agency shall have no police, subpoena, lawenforcement powers, or internal  security functions, states the National Security Act of 1947 creating the nation's Central Intelligence institutions. Scarcely having lived down the unsavory image of running an invisible government, officials of the Central Intelligence Agency have now allowed the organization to be used as a sort of secret police for the Nixon Administration.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 47

title: Volume in Options Reported a Record By Chicago Board
description: The Chicago Board Options Exchange reported yesterday that a record volume of 2,153 contracts of 100 shares each were traded. Some 500 contracts of 100 shares each were traded. Some 500 contracts changed hands in the first hour, a spokesman added.

title: 17 Hurt in Prison Riot
description: LYONS, France, May 9 (UPI)  Inmates at the SaintPaul prison staged a sevenhour riot last night and early today that left 17 injured, mostly by tear gas, authorities said.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time
description: Ship Passengers From Due Will Dock

title: GUERRILLA FORCES FROM SYRIA CROSS LEBANON'S BORDER
description: ON THE SYRIANLEBANESE BORDER, Thursday, May 10A heavily armed force of Palestinian guerrillas has crossed from Syria into the mountainous Rasheiya region of southeastern Lebanon and set up gun emplacements commanding a main highway.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters AdjaCent to New York
description: Table for High Tide for Waters AdjaCent to New York

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: State's Welfare Plan Asks For 90% of City Sales Tax
description: ALBANY, May 9Governor Rockefeller proposed today that the state take over 90 per cent of New York City's local sales tax as well as all of its stocktransfer tax, as a means of financing the proposed assumption by the state of welfare and Medicaid administration.

title: Senate Votes for a Voice On Presidential Advisers
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) The Senate passed today measure that would require Senate confirmation of appointees to key positions as Presidential aides.

title: Cash Prices
description: Cash Prices

title: A New Jersey City
description: The overwhelming support that voters in Jersey City have given their young reform mayor, Paul T. Jordan, signals an important turn in political outlook for the whole Garden State.

title: The Third Administration
description: MINNEAPOLISThe damage of the Watergate affair is done. Under the circumstances the best the President could do was assign the responsibility for uncovering the truth to Elliot Richardson. A loyal and committed Nixon partisan, the new Attorney General is a man of unquestioned integrity, intelligence and ability. He is the right man for the job.

title: ExEnvoy Says U.S. Pays For 15,000 Thais in Laos
description: WASHINGTON, May 9  A Nixon Administration official told the Senate Foreign Relations Committee today that despite the Vietnam and Laos ceasefires, 15,000 to 20,000 Thai irregular troops  financed by the United Stateswere now based in Laos.

title: F.D.A. Proposes Standards To Improve Bicycle Safety
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP)The Food and Drug Administration proposed today, the first Federal bicycle safety standards designed to reduce the annual average of 800 deaths resulting from an estimated one million accidents.

title: MONDE OPPOSES BUDGET PROPOSAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 Senator Walter F. Mondale de nounced today a plan for al overhaul of the Congressiona spending system, contending that it would turn most Sena tors and Representatives into mere petitioners on movey matters.

title: Central Derailment Kills A Danbury Man, Hurts 3
description: BRANCHVILLE, Conn., May 9A Penn Central commuter train was derailed at Topstone Curve near here today, killing one man and injuring three others.

title: Bronxites Learn of Borough's Rich Indian Heritage
description: Residents of the Bronx, celebrating their borough as the center of a manysided culture, learned last night that the area was a center of succeeding rich cultures long before Europeans opened it up to modern settlement.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Nobody's talking much about the drop in hemlines for fall. Victor Joris showed some calflength styles in his collection for Cuddlecoat. And now Ralph Lauren shows some for Polo.

title: 38YearOld Nun, In Secular Dress, Robbed and Raped
description: The rape and robbery of a Dominican nun Tuesday night in Brooklyn was disclosed yesterday by the police.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Northrop Corporation received a $50.7million addition to a previously awarded Air Force contract for F5E aircraft and support equipment for sale to foreign allies, it was announced yesterday.

title: Kimberly Signs Agreement
description: The KimberlyClark Corporadon said yesterday that it had signed an exclusive agreement with the OjiYuka Synthetic Paper  Company of Japan, giving KimberlyClark the excusive sales rights in North and Central America far OjiYuka's polypropylene durable materials. Terms were not disclosed.

title: Gallup Poll Hints Scandal Dims G.O.P.'s 74 Outlook
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 Three persons in 10 are less likely than before to vote for Republican candidates in the 1974 Congressional election because of the Watergate conspiracy case, the Gallup Poll reported today.

title: Mary Hinkson Powerful In Graham's Medea Role
description: To start off its final week at the Alvin Theater, the Martha Graham Dance Company presented Mary Hinkson on Tuesday night in her first appearance as Medea in Cave of the Heart, Miss Graham's wellknown study of jealousy in the guise of Greek myth.

title: Compromise Sent to Nixon On PhonePower Measure
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP) The House passed a $1billionayear rural electric and telephone loan bill today after Congress worked out a compromise with the Administration.

title: Tighter Monetary Rein by Reserve Is Shown in Banking Data
description: The Federal Reserve System's monetary policy is tightening slowly, banking data published yesterday showed.

title: Genesco Sees Sales Rise As Earnings Drop Slightly
description: Genesco, Inc., the Nashvillebased major apparel producer and retailer, said yesterday that preliminary figures indicated sales for the third fiscal quarter ended April 30 would show an approximate 3 per cent rise while earningspershare would be slightly less than last year due to higher taxes.

title: CRANIPTON LEADS GOLF BY 2 ON A 66
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., May 10 Bruce Crampton of Australia scrambled to a fourunderpar 6 and a twostroke lead today in the first round of the $150,000 Colonial invitation golf tournament.

title: JOHNSON AGREES TO ACQUIRE HAHN
description: Johnson & Johnson announced yesterday it had agreed in principle to acquire from private Swiss interests a majority position in the Dr. Carl Hahn Company of Dusseldorf West Germany, manufacturers of feminine hygiene products.

title: RICHARDSON FEELS HE WAS BETRAYED
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Elliot L. Richardson said today that he felt betrayed by the shoddy standards of morals of those Nixon Administration officials who have been involved in the Watergate affair.

title: Basketball Transactions
description: GOLDEN STATESigned Derrek Dickey, Cincinnati forward, secondround draft choice, to multiyear contract.

title: The Great Crippler
description: Multiple sclerosis is called the great crippler, usually afflicting those between the the ages of 20 and 40, still in the prime of career and family building. The cause of and cure for the disease, which disables the central nervous system, has not yet been found.

title: F.B.I.Tap Picked Up Calls Ellsberg Made in 1969'70
description: LOS ANGELES, May 10One year after the trial judge or dered that all information on wiretaps be handed over to the court, the Government disclosed today at the Pentagon papers trial that telephone calls of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg were picked up by F.B.I, wiretaps in late 1969 and in early 1970.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Attorney General George F. Kugler announced the appointment of Stephen Skillman of Princeton as the first assistant attorney general. Mr. Skillman has been assistant attorney general in charge of appellate matters in the Division of Law since 1969. As first assistant to the attorney general he will succeed Mrs. Marylin Loftus Schauer, who is soon to be sworn in as a judge of the Essex County Court.

title: Aqueduct Race Charts
description: Aqueduct Jockeys

title: Bible Societies Report On World Distribution
description: Worldwide distribution of the Bible and Scripture selections last year exceeded 200 million copies for the first time in the history of the United Bible Societies, it was reported yesterday at the annual meeting of the board of managers of the American Bible Society in the Pierre Hotel.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Sex and Single Gypsy Moth
description: Suburban and country homeowners whose trees are damaged each year by leafeating gypsy moth larvae may gain some satisfaction by luring a few thousand of the male adults to their demise this summer.

title: RACISM IS CITED AT FORT DIX TRIAI
description: FORT DIX, May 10  The defense for S. Sgt. John D. Layton, a drill instructor accused of kicking a collapsed basic trainee who died shortly, afterward, attempted to indicate today that one or more prosecution witnesses harbored ill feelings toward the defend ant because they believed he was prejudiced against blacks.

title: Independent Prosecutor?
description: Elliot Richardson is assuming a bold stance in his appearance before the Senate Judiciary Committee for confirmation as Attorney Generalbut it is not a satisfactory one.

title: Nader Believes Scandal Will Spur Election Reform
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 10 (UPI)Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, said today that he thought the Watergate campaign reform a tremendous shot in the arm.

title: Republican Governors Assured Of More Open Administration
description: Two special envoys from President Nixon told the nation's Republican Governors here yesterday that the President would make his Administration more open, accessible and communicative to them and to the press.

title: Kennedy Must Appeal Ruling On Squaw Island in 20 Days
description: BARNSTABLE, Mass., May 10 (AP)Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, and five of his neighbors have 20 days to appeal court decision allowing two Marlboro developers to subdivide land on Squaw Island off Cape Cod, where the Senator maintains a summer home.

title: Lebanese Strike at Guerrillas; Progress on Truce Is Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Friday, May 11 While Government jets attacked Palestinian guerrilla positions near the Syrian border again yesterday, progress was reported toward enforcing the ceasefire worked out Tuesday night.

title: Steel Price Rise Set
description: The United States Steel Corporation announced plans yesterday to raise prices of sheet and strip products by an average of 4.8 per cent, effective June 15. In Washington, the Cost of Living Council said it planned to review the action to determine if the increases were costjustified. Details, Page 51.

title: Trustee Sues ExEquity Chief, Seeking $1Million in Damages
description: LOS ANGELES, May 10 Stanley Goldblum, former chief executive of the Equity Funding Corporation of America, has been sued for damages of more than $1million in what the trustee of the bankrupt company said today was probably the first of a series of similar suits against former Equity officers.

title: INDIAN M.P. DEMANDS U.S. AIDE'S EXPULSION
description: NEW DELHI, May 11 (AP)A Communist member of Parliament demanded today that the Government arrest and deport an American Embassy political officer, whom he described as a known C.I.A. agent, unless Washington recalled him immediately.

title: HoleinOne for Miss Albers
description: TOWSON, Md., May 10 (UPI) Roberta Albers scored a holeinone on the 17th hole today at Pine Ridge Golf Course during the proamateur round of the Lady Carling open. Miss Albers, 26 years old, from Tampa, Fla., used a No. 5 iron on the par3 hole, winning a Ford LTDthe prize for getting an ace during the fourday tournament. It was the third ace of her career.

title: Alabama Legislature Sends Redistricting to Governor
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 10 (AP)The Alabama Legislature, under the last of several Federal court ultimatums, has passed a reapportionment bill today and sent it to Gov. George C. Wallace for his signature.

title: Eldredge & Co., Inc., to File Chapter XI Petition Here
description: Eldredge & Co., Inc., municipal bond dealer, announced last night that it would file petition under Chapter XI of the Bankruptcy Law in United States Federal District Court here and that it temporarily halted its business activities.

title: RICHARDSON FEELS HE WAS BETRAYED
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Elliot L. Richardson said today that he felt betrayed by the shoddy standards of morals of those Nixon Administration officials who have been involved in the Watergate affair.

title: Greek Bishops Overrule Head In Electing Old Guard Synod
description: ATHENS, May 10  The Orthodox Church of Greece today overruled its primate, Archbishop Ieronymos, and elected an old guard church government, to satisfy the wishes of the Ecumenical Patriarchate of Constantinople, its mother church.

title: Speculator Losses Seen in Rejection of Barclays Bid
description: Wall Street speculators stand to lose upwards of $2.5million as a result of the rejection by a sharply divided New York State Banking Board of the proposed acquisition of the Long Island Trust Company by the giant Barclays Bank, Ltd., of London.

title: Gold Price Rises to a High of $95.05
description: PARIS, May 10  The price of gold rose today above $95 an ounce to a new high in Europe.

title: LEONARD SHIELD GAIN IN A.A.U. RING
description: BOSTON, May 10 (AP)Ray Leonard of Washington led teenage advance today into the semifinals of the 85th annual Amateur Athletic Union national boxing championships.

title: State Studies Aurelio Role In Picking Judges Since 71
description: As part of a broad investigation into the city's criminal justice system, the State Commission of Investigation has been examining the extent to which Richard R. Aurelio has played a part in the selection of city judges since he left his job as Deputy Mayor in November, 1971, according to sources close to the investigation.

title: An Ulster Militiaman Is Killed In an Ambush in His Garden
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 10 (AP)Guerrillas ambushed and killed a militiaman in his garden today. The authorities said the killers were apparently from the Irish Republican Army.

title: Cuban Says He and Two Others Broke Into Psychiatrist's Office
description: MIAMI, May 10A Cuban real estate broker, in a deposition here today, said that he and two Watergate burglars, Bernard L. Barker and Eugenio R. Martinez, broke into the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist in September, 1971, and photographed Dr. Ellsberg's and other files.

title: NONRESIDENT FEES IN COLLEGE UPSET
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., May 10 (UPI)  A county court here yesterday struck down outofstate tuition payments for some 7,500 University of Michigan students. It could cost the university more than $5million year.

title: Autopsy on Senator Long Shows He Wasn't Poisoned
description: ST. LOUIS, May 10 (AP)An autopsy report issued tonight said the late Senator Edward V. Long, Democrat of Missouri, was not poisoneda possibility raised four months after his death by his longtime secretary.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
description: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York

title: College, School Results
description: College, School Results

title: New Method Added By National Clearing
description: The National Clearing Corporation, a concern that clears overthecounter securities transactions for 300 brokerdealers, has established a working relationship with the Central Certificate Service of the New York Stock Exchange, it was announced yesterday.

title: 447 Counties Designated For Farm Emergency Loans
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP) Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz has designated 447 counties in 19 states where the Farmers Home Administration can begin making emergency loans to help farmers recover from natural disasters, including drought and floods.

title: Macbeth, Bloch's 1909 Opera, Has a Premiere Here
description: Shakespeare's Macbeth has been set to music any number of times and, of course, the most famous opera on the subject is Verdi's. Much later came a version by Ernest Bloch, and its first New York performance was given on Wednesday night by the Juilliard American Opera Center at the Juilliard Theater.

title: Ford Says It Will Seek Sizable Price Increases in 1974
description: DETROIT, May 10  Henry Ford 2d, board chairman of the Ford Motor Company, said today the auto concern planned to seek a sizable increase in prices on its 1974 models.

title: Windfall Will Brighten More Streets
description: An unexpected $2.4million savings to the city because of unanticipated lower bids for highintensity street lighting will result in illumination by the new lights on an additional 800:miles of city streets by the end of this year, the Lindsay administration announced yesterday.

title: Equity Financing
description: A combination public offering of 460,000 shares of the Hesston Corporation common at $21.25 per share was made yesterday by underwriters managed by Merrill Lynch. The company is selling 350,000 shares and certain shareholders 110,000 shares. The company's stock, traded overthecounter, closed at 21% bid, unchanged from the previous close.

title: Steel Price Rise Set
description: The United States Steel Corporation announced plans yesterday to raise prices of sheet and strip products by an average of 4.8 per cent, effective June 15. In Washington, the Cost of Living Council said it planned to review the action to determine if the increases were costjustified. Details, Page 51.

title: Sponsors Send Invitations For Veterans Homecoming
description: DALLAS, May 10 (UPI)The group sponsoring a national homecoming celebration for all Vietnam veterans sent out its invitations yesterday. The guest list was impressive for the numbers alone.

title: 4 DIE, 100 INJURED IN OHIO TORNADOES
description: WILLARD, Ohio, May 10 (AP)Four persons were killed and more than 100 injured tonight as tornadoes ripped through the northwestern section of Ohio.

title: Barrier to Preliminary Talks on European Troop Cuts Is Broken
description: BRUSSELS, May 10The EastWest deadlock that has blocked preparations for a conference on mutual reduction of military forces In Central Europe for nearly three and a half months has been broken with an agreement to seat Hungary as less than a full participant.

title: Minor Leagues
description: Minor Leagues

title: Colson Ends His Denials on the Bogus Cables
description: WASHINGTON, May 10For more than 10 months, investigators and reporters have been searching for a connection between Charles W. Colson and the Watergate affair through his friendship with E. Howard Hunt Jr., one of the Watergate conspirators, who pleaded guilty.

title: Radio

title: On Another Front
description: In addition to his Watergate misfortunes, President Nixon has been taking his lumps from the courts on another issue. Although he had seemed to be winning politically in his spending fight with Congress, his impoundment strategy has been thrice denied by Federal judgeswhich leaves some important problems up in the air.

title: Sketches of Four Men Indicted in Campaign Gift Case
description: Spent 32 years building up a lucrative Wall Street law practice with national recognition as specialist in municipal and state financing  Had known Richard Nixon only a year or so before their law firms merged in 1967 Political novice before Mr. Nixon enticed him to run his Presidential campaign in 1968. Rewarded him for his austere efficiency with job of Attorney General. Before appointment said, I am invulnerable. I will never accept a Cabinet post.  At Justice Department gained image of a tough law and order man, advocating preventive detention but urging more control of wire taps by department. Also gained reputation of being brusque and passionless. In March, 1972, the amply built pipe smoker left Justice to mastermind the President's reelection campaign . Three months later, two weeks after the breakin at the Democratic National Headquarters, he resigned, saying his wife Martha had persuaded him to leave. Returned to his law firm of Mudge, Rose, Guthrie, Alexander & Mitchell in New. York. Born in Detroit on Sept. 15, 1913. Graduate of Fordham University and Fordham Law School Two of his three children are by a former marriage.

title: Canadiens Capture Cup in 6 Games, 64
description: CHICAGO, May 10It didn't matter that 20,000 hostile fans screeched for the Black Hawks, and it didn't matter that the Canadiens were playing for their fourth coach in six years. Montreal won the Stanley Cup anyway tonight.

title: The Screen: 'L'Amour':The Cast
description: "L'Amour," the newest chapter in the continuing series of Andy Warhol-Paul Morrissey soap-opera put-ons, takes the Factory gang to Paris where Michael (Michael Sklar), a rich American, represents his father's firm, the Watkins Bathroom Deodorant Company. Michael is head over heels in love with Max (Max Delys), a street hustler who looks like a French version of Joe Dallesandro. Michael, however, is fond of Jane (Jane Forth), a self-described American high-school dropout who has come to Paris to model with her best friend Donna (Donna Jordan), who would sort of like to marry Michael so they could legally adopt Max.This is a film unafraid to ask questions. Will Michael find happiness with Max? (No.) Will Max find satisfaction with Jane? (Not really, since Jane says she gets more excited buying make-up.) Is this sort of thing funny? (Only intermittently.)Were there fewer demands for one's attention, "L'Amour" might be worth sitting through for the occasional comic moments, such as Michael's big renunciation scene with Max ("I'm growing older, Max. . . ."), which leaves Michael so shaken that all he can do is crochet. Michael, however, is but a poor, hairy substitute for Sylvia Miles, who handles this sort of comedy better. There is also a nice title song, sweetly sung from time to time by Cass Elliot, and a rather pretty scene where everyone roller skates around the Palais de Chaillot. It looks like a high-fashion layout gone a bit looney.These things simply are not funny or important enough to compete with late-night talk shows, a new album by the Carpenters, the Watergate scandal, kung-fu movies, dining at Blimpie's, and a number-one best seller by Jacqueline Susann. We live in a time and place in which first things must come first."L'Amour," which opened yesterday at the UA Eastside Cinema, is so wan it makes one remember "Trash" and "Women in Revolt" as robust classics of their kind.

title: Nixon's Reorganization: Questions Remain
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 President Nixon's latest reorganization of his Administration completes the demolition of the socalled Berlin wall that surrounded him during his first term. And, at least in theory, it reverses the trend toward concentration of power in the hands of a favored few within the White House that has distinguished Mr. Nixon's Presidency. The architects of the wall, which so outraged Republican politicians, members of Congress and even Cabinet officers, were H. R. Haldeman and John D. Ehrlichman. They are gone, victims of the Watergate scandal.

title: How a Blirnpie's Got a Thai Line
description: Last winter, Patty Swiassolit purchased Blimpie Base #39. at Broadway and 71st Street, hoping to make her fortune selling the combination sandwiches on French bread that are standard Blimpie fare. Shortly thereafter, a McDonald's hamburger place opened across the street and, as Mrs. Swiassolit recalls, Business was just terrible. So Mrs. Swiassolit, a 25yearold native of Bangkok, consulted with her husband, Sumate, an engineer. The couple, who have been in this country for three years, decided they would try to stave off disaster by augmenting the basic Blimpie menu with Thai food.

She was convicted for murder 1971 in the death of her 5yearold son and manslaughter in the death of her 4yearold daughter. On Monday, the Appellate Division dismissed the murder charge and ordered a new trial in the manslaughter case.

title: Rhodes Wins Ohio Appeal
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 10 (UPI)The Ohio Supreme Court ruled by a 5to2 vote today that former Gov. James A. Rhodes is eligible to run for a third term as Governor in 1974. Mr. Rhodes, who served in the post from 1963 to 1971, challenged a section of the Ohio Constitution providing that no person shall hold the office of governor for a period longer than two successive terms of four years.

title: JACK E. LEONARD, COMEDIAN, DEAD

title: COLONELS FORCE 7TH GAME, 10993
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 10 (AP) Artis Gilmore popped in 28 points and pulled down 21 rebounds to lead the Kentucky Colonels to a 109.93 victory over the Indiana Pacers tonight, sending the American Basketball Association championship playoff into a decisive seventh game.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BUFFALO, May 10 (AP)Ralph C. Wilson Jr., president of the Buffalo Bills, who has offered Erie County $1.5million to name its new stadium Erie County Stadium rather than sell the stadium name to the Rich Products Corporation, which makes synthetic dairy products, said today he felt from the beginning the stadium should bear a name connected with the community and not with a commercial product.

title: British Race Driver Dies

Robert Cuthbertson of Northampton, England, Blyth's codriver, was reported slightly improved with head injuries.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES YIELD TO PRESSURE

They closed, nevertheless, at $9.04, or 4 cents higher than the $9 close on Wednesday when the high for the day was $9.05 a bushel.
