description: MONTREAL, May 12Stanley J. Pietlock, a 30yearold draft evader from Wilmingt, Del., recently became a citizen of Canada, taking a step that is being chosen by more and more of the young antiwar exiles here.

title: Mountain Skipper ($26) Takes Freehold Feature

title: The 6:32 Is a Great TrainIf You Don't Have to Ride It Daily
description: Any guidebook to New York will boast, They come from all over to this city, but what the book will not say is that they probably go back at night. New York being what it is, commuting is here to stay; and commuting being what it is, so are the struggles of the commuter. One of the longest daily commutes to New York, close to 100 miles each way, is accomplished by people who make their homes in the Philadelphia area. Many commute via the Penn Central, but a smaller and more closeknit group uses the Reading Railroad.

title: He Won't Sing Don Carlo in Italian
description: IT is typical of Sarah Caldwell that when she decided to do Verdi's Don Carlo this spring with her Opera Company of Boston, she turned to the original version, which was written for the Paris Opera and is naturally in French. The problem then was to get singers willing to learn or relearn it in that language for a pair of performances (May 22 and 24), since nowadays the work is normally sung in Italian. She had no trouble in persuading John Alexander to take on the title role. It helped that the tenor had never sung it before, but he also has worked with Miss Caldwell in the past and enjoyed it, he likes to sing in French and he relishes the challenge of a new part. He has no objection that she is restoring the opening Fontainebleau scene, giving him more to sing and making a long opera longer, or that she has, unearthed a duet no one elSe seems to know about for Carlo and King Philip to add to Act IV.

title: To Archibald, the Best Basketball Camp Is the City
description: If you're going to one of those fancy basketball camps this summer have a good time, but don't expect to meet Nate Archibald of the Kansas CityOmaha Kings.

title: Nob Hill Cable Cars to Halt
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 12 (UPI)The busy Powell Street cable cars will stop clanking up Nob Hill tomorrow when city crews begin a twoweek beautification project.

title: Jane E. Kenworthy Married in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Miss Jane Elizabeth Kenworthy and Richard Allen Arenberg were married here today in the Little Sanctuary of St. Albans School. The Episcopal ceremony was performed by the Very Rev. Francis B. Sayre Jr., dean of The Washington Cathedral.

description: Twentynineyearold Georgie Cornell, the hero of Thomas Berger's new novel, , was born in 2096 and lives in New York City. The doorwoman of Georgie's apartment house, in the jungle of the East 70's, womans the frontdoor antipollution airlock with a shotgun. Georgie's psychiatrist, Dr. Prine, wears a selfadhesive nylon beard and has been treating Georgie for frigidity with a dildo, while she tells him his complaint that it hurts is merely a defense"as Dr. Daisy Rudin explained so well in her new book on the superiority of the anal orgasm, recently published by the giant firm where Georgie works as a secretary, unsuccessfully avoiding the attempts of his baldheaded boss, Ida Hind, to steal glances into Georgie's blouse at his newly siliconed breasts.

title: Television; Staggering? Well, No, More Like Numbing

Faye Dunaway and Richard Chamberlain playing the Duke and Duchess of Windsor on television a few months ago, was a disaster. The Academy AWards annual bash is a beloved disaster. Everyone has a nasty comment for it but, judging from the ratings, no one would think of missing it.

title: New Zealand and the U.S. To Exchange Army Units

title: Living With a Prosperous Japan

The recent success of Japan's economic efforts will now require her to undergo additional and substantial transformations. She must also recognize that her economic success has produced major international responsibilities to carry.

title: Walton, Held to Average Of 3.0, Makes the Team

Bill Walton, Greg Lee and Keith Wilkes, all juniors, were the three Bruins posting the minimum 3.0 (B) classroom average required to make the honor, team of the College Sports Information Directors of America.

title: R. F. Rasch to Wed Patricia A. Penkala

Seagram & Sons, Inc., distillers. The engagement has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Bernard J. Penkala, parents of the bridetobe, whose fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Roland 0. Rasch of Lloyd Harbor, Huntington, L. I.

title: Headliners
description: The Washington Post from the outset refused to dismiss the Watergate incident as a bad political joke, a mere caper. With these words, the trustees of Columbia University last week announced that The Post had won the 1973 Pulitzer Prize for public service in journalism for its long and intensive investigation of Watergate and related developments. Other journalism awards included: international reportingMax Frankel, Sunday Editor of The New York Times, for his coverage of President Nixon's trip to China; national reportingRobert Boyd and Clark Hoyt, of The Knight Newspapers, for their disclosure that Senator Thomas F. Eagleton, who was briefly Democratic VicePresidential nominee, had a history of psychiatric treatment.

title: New and Recommended
description: THE GREAT AMERICAN NOVEL, by Philip Roth. (Holt, Rinehart & Winston, $8.95.) Roth is in mostly fine comic fettle in this novel about a World War II baseball team made up of misfits and 4F's who blunder their way through a season of futility.

title: Couture Clothes Sold 2d Hand To Aid Charity

title: 2 Defendants Say Trial Told Painful Truth
description: LOS ANGELES, May 12Dr. Daniel Ellsb g and Anthony J. Russo Jr., tired but jubilant, said today that the 89 days of their trial had served the purpose of telling the truth, the very painful truili, to the American people.

title: DR. H. J. BARTELSTONE OF COLUMBIA IS DEAD
description: Dr. Herbert J. Bartelstone, professor of pharmacology at the College of Physicians and Surgeons and professor of dentistry at the School of Dental and Oral Surgery, both of Columbia University, died here Friday of a heart attack. He was 50 years old. His office was at 111 East 79th Street.

title: In a Colombian Village the People Talk of the Treasure and How It Will Change Their Lives
description: PUPIALES, Colombia, May 1  Most people here  the barefoot children, the farmers in threadbare pants and the women in old black shawlstalk of the Treasure of Pupiales and how it will change their lives.

title: Soviet Aid for Uganda
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 13 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Soviet Government has promised to send 100 doctors to work in Uganda military hospitals, President Idi Amin has announced. The President was quoted by the Uganda radio, monitored in this Kenyan capital, as having said that some of the doctors would also be assigned to civilian hospitals.

title: Disputed Health Lobby Is Pressing for a Bill to Overturn Any Limits on Sales of Vitamins
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Thousands of food faddists, 142 Congressmen and a health lobby, which the Federal Government has linked to quackery are backing an obscure bill that would allow Americans to obtain as many vitamins as they want.

title: U,S, AGAIN ACCUSED OF RAIDS IN SOUTH
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 13 (AP)The Vietcong charged today, for the second time, that American planes had bombed in South Vietnam, saying that 34 persons had been wounded in the latest action.

title: REV. T. J, P. MURPHY, FORMER MARINER, 57
description: The Rev. Thomas J. P Murphy, a master mariner and admiralty lawyer who was ordained a Roman Catholic priest in 1964, died yesterday in the rectory of the Church of St. John the Martyr, 259 East 71st Street. His age was 57. He had been an assistant pastor at the church since 1966.

title: Jailed Nazi's Fate Strains RomeBonn Tie
description: ROME, May 13The fate of a Nazi war criminal who is serving a life sentence in an Italian military prison is straining relations between Rome and Bonn.

title: Bridge: In Which the Declarer Sees Meaning in Preemptive Bid
description: The success or failure of the United States team in the world championship in Brazil for the next two weeks will depend largely on the performances of the three young New York experts who are making their international debuts.

title: Martha Mitchell Terms Report Of Week in Hospital Nonsense
description: Mrs. John N. Mitchell was reportedly secreted in a mental hospital last week, but yesterday, sounding as ebullient as ever, she denied it.

title: Mayor Gibson Announces He Will Run Again in 1974
description: NEWARK, May 13 (AP)Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson announced today that he would seek reelection in 1974.

title: ROGERS CONFERS WITH ECHEVERRIA
description: MEXICO CITY, May 13Secretary of State William P. Rogers met with President Luis Echeverria Alvarez today and gave him details of a United States proposal for solving the problem of salinity of the Colorado River, one of the major issues between the two countries.

title: MRS. RANKIN WINS GOLF BY 4 SHOTS
description: BALTIMORE, May 13 CAP)Mrs. Judy Rankin posted a fourstroke victory today in the $30,000 Lady Carling open at Pine Ridge Golf Course by shooting par 73. Her 54hole total was 215.

title: 7th Gang Member Is Seized In Brooklyn Fire Fatal to 6
description: A seventh member of a Brooklyn youth gang called the War Gods was arrested yesterday on charges in connection with a fire last Tuesday in which a woman, her three children and two grandchildren died.

title: CERTIFICATE STEP TAKEN BY BIG BOARD
description: The New York Stock Exchange's Central Certificate Service, the computerized securities depository formed five years ago, will be taken over by the recently formed Depository Trust Company, Big Board officials announced over the weekend.

title: Where the Brokerage Profits AreCommodities
description: Time was when Wall Street brokerage houses treated their commodity departments the way families often treat a relative they would rather the neighbors didn't know existed.

title: Skylab Crewmen Hope to Gather Medical Data to Aid Future Trips
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The astronauts living in Skylab during the next month will scan the universe with telescopes and look back toward earth, with cameras, but in studying, their own performance they will be looking into the future.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Excessive criticism has been heaped on American car makers for insisting they could not meet Federal emission standards on 1975 models. Actually, Detroit had gone far toward meeting these standards on new cars with development of the catalytic converter and other modifications. But since the Federal Clean Air Standards were announced in 1970, priorities have changed with the energy crisis erupting and bringing to center stage the problem of conserving fuel. What is now needed is radical reckesign of the automobileengine, body and accessories.

title: Award Hails Yablonski
description: Joseph A. Yablonski, slain several years ago after opposing W. A. Boyle for the presidency of the United Mine Workers of America, was awarder posthumously yesterday the 1973 Ethical Humanist Award by the New York Society for Ethical Culture, United Press International reported. The award was accepted by his son, Joseph Yablonski.

title: Frances Marion Dies on Coast; Screenwriter Won Two Oscars
description: LOS ANGELES, May 13.(UP) Frances Marion, who won two Oscars and wrote most of the screenplays for Mary Pickford and Rudolph Valentino during her halfcentury in films, died yesterday at the age of 86.

title: DR. JACK J. BLINN
description: LONG BEACH, LI., May 13Dr. Jack J. Blinn, a past president of the New York Cardiological Society, died yesterday in Long Beach Memorial Hospital, of which he was a former director of medicine and medical board president. He was 73 years old and lived at 65 West Beech Street.

title: Harassment of Legal Services Is Alleged
description: WASHINGTON, May 13A study of local legal services projects has concluded that the entire program has been disrupted by continued harassment by the Office of Economic Opportunity, the antipoverty agency being dismantled by the Nixon Administration.

title: Junior Equestrians Ride for Ribbons
description: WEST ORANGE, May 13Ponytails bobbed in the breezes and dental braces glinted in the sun today as youthful contestants vied for ribbons in the finale of three days of competition in the 21st annual Junior Essex Troop Horse Show.

title: They Do Volunteer Work as Part of Their Education
description: While a recent survey indicated that students on nearby college campuses have taken on the superficial appearance of their selfcentered, socially indifferent allAmerican counterparts of the nineteenfifties, pupils at least some private secondary schools in the area have been reaching out more than ever into the community.

title: Shah of Iran Says New Jets Will Bolster Independence
description: PARIS, May 13 (Reuters)The Shah of Iran said in an interview published here today that he was buying modern arms for his country so that she could be truly independent and never have to pick up the telephone to call Mr. Nixon for help.

title: 4 Robbed in Chauffeured Limousine; 2 Gunmen Get $265,000 in Jewelry
description: Two welldressed gunmen forced their way into a limousine that was taking two couples home from a charity ball early yesterday morning and robbed them of $265,000 in jewelry and $1,900 in cash as the chauffeur drove through Central Park.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: Wottle Victor in 1:50.2
description: PITTSBURGH, May 13 (AP)Dave Wottle, the Olympic gold medalist, set a Pitt Stadium record yesterday by winning the halfmile run in 1 minute 50.2 seconds at the Pitt invitation meet.

title: Merrie Spaeth, ExActress, Is a Bride
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 13Miss Merrie Marcia Spaeth, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Philip G. Spaeth, was married at the Philadelphia Cricket Club in Chestnut Hill this afternoon to Robert S. Thanhauser Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Thanhauser.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Mrs. Frances Newmark, 76, Leader in Hadassah, Dies
description: Mrs. Frances Shaw Newmark, a leader in Hadassah and a past vice president of the Federation of Jewish Women's Organizations, died Friday at her home, 1865 East 19th Street, Brooklyn. She was 76 years old, and the wife of Ralph Newmark, a jewelry importer.

title: Enthusiasm Greets Herman Band and Shirley Bassey
description: Overamphtication buried both Woody Herman's orchestra and the singer Shirley Bassey at Carnegie Hall on Friday night. The noise produced by Mr. Herman's band reverberated through the hall as though it was playing in a barrel of mush. However, the clean, Singing sound of Mr. Herman's alto saxophone occasionally penetrated the murk.

title: Levitt Terms Supply Unit Of Schools Cumbersome
description: The Board of Education's Bureau of Supplies was accused by the state yesterday of being generally cumbersome and overly timeconsuming in dispensing requisitional supplies and equipment to the city's schools.

title: Bruce Arrives in China To Set Up U.S. Mission
description: HONG KONG, Monday, May 14 (AP)David K. E. Bruce entered China today to establish the first American diplomatic mission since the Communists took over in 1949, The veteran diplomat, who is 75 years old, said his assignment was very intriguing.

title: Rhodesia: Stumbling Search for a Solution
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 13Prime Minister Ian D. Smith says he wants a settle. ment of his country's racial constitutional and diplomatic problems, hut his critics in creasingly fear that he does not understand that he must have such a settlement.

title: Skylab Mission Is Viewed as First Big Opportunity to Survey Practical Benefits of Space Technology
description: COCOA BEACH, Fla., May 13  The Skylab mission that begins tomorrow, intended as the longest space flight to date, is regarded by experts as significant crossover point in man's efforts to establish himself in frontier regions beyond the earth.

title: I.R.S. Offers New Industry to Aid Suffolk's Economy
description: HOLTSVILLE, LI, May 13 Suffolk County, still fighting against unemployment from aerospacecontract cutbacks and diversions, is getting a new industry, the processing of tax returns by sophisticated computer systems.

title: BRITISH ETHNIC BLOC BIGGEST ONE IN U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) People of English, Scottish or Welsh origin make up 14.4 per cent of the United States population and are the largest ethnic group, the Census Bureau said yesterday.

title: Watergate Mother's Day
description: At 77, my mother can still turn out a respectable plate of chicken soup, so I came up from Washington to pay her a Mother's Day visit.

title: Elusive Vesco, Indicted With Mitchell, Is a Mystery to Neighbors
description: BOONTON TOWNSHIP, N. J., May 13For the six fears that Robert L. Vesco has lived in this small rural town, he had remained as elusive to his neighbors as he has been to Federal investigators over the last six months.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: New Odd Couple: Simon & Chekhov

title: Miss Torres Married Here
description: Miss Margarita Torres, daughter of Florencio Torres of Bayamn, Puerto Rico, and Mrs. Antonio Serrano of New York, was married here yesterday afternoon to Edward William Aponte, regional director of the Labor Department's Manpower Administration. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Ramon Aponte of New York.

title: BREZHNEV ENDS VISIT TO BERLIN
description: BERLIN, May 13 (Reuters)Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party chief, ended a oneday visit to East Germany today by presenting to Erich Honecker, the East German party leader, the Order of Lenin and by praising all Germans who took part in the wartime resistance against Hitler.

title: 7 Big Utilities Consider joint Venture
description: The seven largest power companies in New York State have announced that they are considering forming a separate generation corporation whose sole function would be to build power plants supplying electricity to all seven companies.

title: 3 Airlines Plan Extension Of FlightLimiting Accord
description: American, Trans World and United airlines have reached tentative agreement to continue a controversial plan limiting by prearrangement the number of flights each offers on transcontinental routes.

title: BELMONT MEETING WILE OPEN TODAY
description: A 30day meeting opens at Belmont Park today with $25, 000 added Vagrancy Handicap the featured event.

title: Theater: Plummer Triumphs in Musical Cyrano
Radcliffe Dethrones Princeton's Crew In Women's Regatta
Van Lennep Wins CrashFilled Targa Florio
description: PALERMO, Sicily, May 13 (AP)Gijs Van Lennep of the Netherlands and Herbert Muller of West Germany won the 57th Targa Florio in a Porsche Carrera today as three favorites were forced to withdraw before completing four laps of the world's oldest auto race.

title: METS TOP PIRATES FOR SERIES SWEEP
MRS.RANKIN WINS GOLF BY 4 SHOTS
State's Inquiry Panel Asks Abolition of Town Courts
description: An investigation that began as an inquiry into the theft of $1,846 in parking fines from the Village of Saranac Lake, N.Y., has led the State Commission of Investigation to recommend the abolition of the state's 2,500 village and town courts.

title: DEAN TIED TO PLAN FOR RING TO SPY ON 1972 PROTESTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 John W. Dean 3d, the former White House counsel, actively attempted to set up an undercover espionage and intelligence ring to infiltrate antiwar protest groups before the Democratic and Republican National Conventions last year, Government sources said today.

title: New Rabbinical College Graduates First Student
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 13 The rabbinical college of the Jewish Reconstructionist Movement graduated its first student today in a ceremony in which the movement's founder, Dr. Mordecai M. Kaplan, took part.

title: Jerusalem: Prize for a Friend, Ionesco
description: JERUSALEMA small figure in a turtleneck shirt could be seen darting around Jerusalem recently rushing from conference hall to university symposium, making speeches, accepting awards, signing playbills. For Eugene Ionesco, the creator of the theater of the absurd, it was a week of action to the exclusion of oontemplation. He was here to accept the 1973 International Jerusalem Prizea biennial award that is presented in connection with the Jerusalem International Book Fair.

title: Leonard, 5 Others Join 500 Qualifiers At 190144 M.P.H.
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 13 Running at respectable speeds of 190 to 194 miles an hour, six drivers qualified today for the 57th Indianapolis 500 auto race. They joined the 24 who made the field yesterday in the first of four scheduled days of time trials. The race will be run Monday, May 28.

title: Mayoral Aspirants Divide On Forest Hills Housing
description: The four candidates for the Democratic mayoral nomination met in a televised debate for the first time last night and became embroiled in dispute over the controversial Forest Hills lowincome housing projectthe same topic that three of them had argued at a B'nai B'rith forum in Queens earlier in the day.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: A 3yearold girl dropped her monthold cousin out or an open thirdfloor kitchen. window in a Newark apartment yesterday, the police said; and then reported what she had done to the baby sitter, who was in the bathroom.

title: FLORIDA PRISON RIOT LEAVES 45 INJURED
description: BUSHNELL, Fla., May 13 (UPI)Prison officials tried to get the Sumter Correctional Institution back to normal today while state agents investi gated rioting among more than 150 inmates last night when blacks and whites declared war on each other.

title: Colleges Fear Lag in Black Enrollments
description: OBERLIN, Ohio, May 13Admissions counselors who work with black students at the country's most selective institutions of higher education are voicing concern that the commitment to expand nonwhite enrollments is waning.

title: DAVID ROCKELLER SCORES TAX PLAN
description: David Rockefeller, chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, charged yesterday that some of the tax reforms currently being debated in Congress, if adopted, could seriously undermine business and economic growth in the country.

title: Miss Sinclaire Wed to Peter Morehouse
description: Miss Barbara Balch Sinclaire, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Murray Sinclaire of Springfield, N. J., was married here yesterday afternoon to Peter Forbes Morehouse, son of Mrs. Theodore C. Morehouse Jr, of Mountainside, N. J., and the late Mr. Morehouse. The Rev. Philip Culbertson performed the Episcopal ceremony at the home of the bridegroom,

title: LIBYAN PREDICTS OIL WILL BECOME DEFENSE WEAPON
Wallace Rebounds From Despair
Paramus School Wins Meet
description: PARAMUS, N.J., May 13Paramus Catholic High School won five events and captured the Christian Brothers track meet with 78 points at its home field today. Jerry Carney of Paramus took the twomile run in 9 minutes 29.3 seconds.

title: Wallace Rebounds From Despair
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 13One year after he was shot in a Maryland parking lot, Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama has apparently overcome the despair that marked much of his convalescence.

title: ShortTerm Cleanup
description: In selecting Michael F. Armstrong as acting District Attorney of Queens, Governor Rockefeller has made an excellent start toward cleaning up that scandalscarred office. The former counsel to the Knapp Commission brings to his new assignment outstanding qualities integrity and prosecutorial skill. More important still, he has demonstrated a zeal for enforcing high standards of public morality.

title: Colleges Fear Lag in Black Enrollments
Discredited Candidacy
description: Publication of the transcript of Representative Mario. Biaggi's testimony before a recent Federal grand jury makes it clear that, contrary to his repeated denials, he in fact did refuse to answer some questions that were put to him. He based his refusal, as of course he had every right to do, on his constitutional rights, including the Fifth Amendment's protection against selfincriminatiOn.

title: To an Indian Distiller, Sikkim Could Become a 2d Scotland
description: RANGPO, Sikkim  What is the difference between Shangri La and Johnny Walker?

title: The Money Problem
description: WASHINGTONIf anything positivE is ever to come out of the WatergatE affair, it will probably be in the area of campaign practices reform.

title: FOUNDATION TO HELP COMMUNITY GROUPS
description: The Ford Foundation has announced that it will spend $75million over the next five years to help build the capacity of local community development corporations, according to The Associated Press.

title: Renewed Fighting in Burundi Sends Refugees to Tanzania
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, May 13Renewed fighting in the southern part of the Central African nation of Burundi, in which at least 50 persons have been killed, has produced a heavy movement of refugees, many of them wounded, into Tanzania.

title: Man Wins Tennis Match
description: Bobby Riggs, 55yearold tennis star of the nineteenthirties, defeated Mrs. Margaret Court, a topranked woman player from Australia, 62, 61, yesterday in a challenge match that he said proved males were better players. Details, Page 41.

title: WITH MEATS HIGH, CHICKEN IS CHEAP
description: With red meats still selling mostly at their price ceilings in the New York area, the state's Department of Agriculture and Markets advised shoppers last week to take advantage of the favorable prices for chickens and chicken parts.

title: Personal Finance
DR. CLARENCE CLARK, RETIRED RECTOR, 97
description: POMFRET, Conn., May 13The Rev. Dr. Clarence Carroll Clark, former rector of the Episcopal Chapel of the Comforter in New York, died here today at the age of 97.

title: A British Soldier in Belfast Dies After Patrol Is Bombed
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 13 (AP)A British soldier died in a hospital today after being injured in an explosion in the Roman Catholic Falls Road area of Belfast,

title: Congress at Paris
description: When Henry A. Kissinger flies back to Paris this Thursday to try to patch up the crumbling Paris peace accords with Hanoi's Le Duc Tho, he won't be alone with his Administration aides and Presidential instructions. Congress will be there too.

title: Promotion Gifts Lift Arnold Constable Sales
description: A recent twoweek banktype gift promotion by Arnold Constable, Inc., the Fifth Avenuebased specialty store, produced a couple of thousand new charge accounts, and may be renewed for the fall season, Merwin Bayer, president, said at the weekend.

title: ISRAELIS EXPAND ARABVISIT POLICY
description: TEL AVIV, May 13  The Cabinet in Jerusalem today expanded its openbridges policy, which encourages exchanges of visits and goods between Arabs in the Israelioccupied territories and their kin in Arab countries.

title: Inside Information on Stocks Flows Steadily to the Rich
description: There is a steady flow of inside information, much of it apparently used illegally, from Wall Street brokerage and investment banking firms to wealthy and powerful investors across the country, according to financial executives interviewed in the last two weeks.

title: Consumer Group in Princeton Works With Businesses to Obtain the Best
description: PRINCETON, May 13Are business and consumer interests antithetical? While most consumer groups are skittish about aligning themselves with business interests, the Consumer Bureau of 152 Alexander Street, here, is an interesting exception. Patterned after England's Oxford Consumer Group, it embraces an experimental program of systematic cooperation between local consumers and responsible local business people. In essence, instead of flushing out the bad guys and exposing them, the bureau identifies the good guys and lauds

title: Foes of French Atom Tests Plan LondontoParis Trek
description: LONDON, May 13 (ReutersDemonstrators assembled outside the French Embassy here today to start a threeweek march to Paris to protest against projected French nuclear tests in the South Pacific.

title: Man Wins Tennis Match
description: Bobby Riggs, 55yearold tennis star of the nineteenthirties, defeated Mrs. Margaret Court, a topranked woman player from Australia, 62, 61, yesterday in a challenge match that he said proved males were better players. Details, Page 41.

title: Riggs Defeats Mrs. Court, 62, 61
description: RAMONA, Calif., May 13Bobby Riggs let his tennis racquet do the talking today.

title: Clothier, Critic of City, Seeks a Seat in Council
description: One day last March, Samuel Morell ran out of patience and decided to run for public office, perhaps to lose at the polls but mostly to raise hell because he felt that something had to be done about this city.

title: CHANGE EXPECTED IN PLAN ON JUDGES
description: Governor Rockefeller is ex. pected to ask the LegislaturE for authority to appoint up to 100 permanent Court of Claims judges  not the sixmonth criminal justices originally mentioned  to handle the increase in case loads expected to result from the state's toughened drug penalties.

title: CHANGE EXPECTED IN PLAN ON JUDGES
description: Governor Rockefeller is expected to ask the Legislature for authority to appoint up to 100 permanent Court of Claims judges  not the sixmonth criminal justices originally mentioned  to handle the increase in case loads expected to result from the state's toughened drug penalties.

title: U.S. FundsFreed, Giving Sewerage Plans GoAhead
Space Station to Go Aloft Today; Astronauts to Join It Tomorrow
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 13For the fourth time in it 15 years of spacefaring, the United States is ready to launch a new maninspace project. It is Skylab, an eight month, $2.5billion effort to de termine man's ability to live and work for long periods it the gravityfree conditions of space flight.

title: HARRY KURZ DIES; TAUGHT LANGUAGE
description: Dr. HarrY Kurz, retired head of the Romance Ianguages department at Queens College, died Saturday at his home, 315 East 86th Street He was 84 years old.

title: I.B.M. Engineer Testifies
description: TULSA, Okla., May 13 (AP) An I.B.M. computer engineer testified last week that he had turned down a $200,000 offer in January, 1970, to produce a quantity of accessory units for the Tulsabased Telex Corporation in the International Business Machines Corporation's case charging Telex with stealing trade secrets and hiring away key personnel.

title: PRIEST FATALLY SHOT IN QUEENS CHURCH
description: A 47yearold Roman Catholic priest, the Rev. John ConIon, was found shot to death in the basement rectory of St. Bonaventure's Church at 11458 170th Street in the Jamaica section of Queens last midnight.

title: LAWRENCE CONDON
description: SOUTHAMPTON, LI., May 13 Lawrence R, Condon, a New York lawyer, who had represented stockholders in publicutility reorganizations, died Friday at his summer home here. His age was 73.

title: Jersey G.O.P. Club Mixed Status, Secrecy, Loyalty
description: TRENTON, May 13  The money to finance Governor Cahill's reelection campaign will come from many sources and most of it will be funneled through former Gov. Alfred E. Driscoll, chairman of the New Jersey Republican Finance Committee. None of. it, contrary to what once had been planned, will come through the Executive Club of the Republican Party of New Jersey.

title: Bucknell Takes Tennis Title
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., May 13Bucknell University captured its fourth Middle Atlantic Conference university division tennis championship in the last five years by defeating Temple University, 8.1, today. The Bisons finished the season with a 9.1 wonlost record. Temple was 74.

title: Advertising: J.W.T Promotions
description: A big man has come from the West to take over the worldwide advertising operations of J. Walter Thompson.

title: Canadian Oil Search Planned
description: ST. JOHN'S, Newfoundland, May 13 (Canadian Press)Four companies are preparing to spend $50million more during the next two years in a continuing search off Newfoundland for an undersea oil field that will yield at least 200 million barrels. Any smaller reserve of oil below the ocean floor simply would not be worth developing, Amoco Canada Petroltum Co., Ltd., said.

title: Pitcher Killed by Lightning At Arizona Baseball Game
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., May 13 (AP)Lightning killed one aseball payer and injured seven others today during an amateur game at Lake Havasu High School.

title: Law Student Weds Manuele Delbourgo
description: Miss Manuele Alice Delbourgo, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Delbourgo of Jamaica Estates, Queens, was married yesterday morning to, Richard Leo Wasserman, who expects to graduate this month from the Columbia University Law School. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack B. Wasserman of Baltimore.

title: 4 Species of Political Columnist
description: CAMBRIDGEIt is unfair to speak of political columnists; there are four distinct species in the genus and no generalization covering all is just. We should before now have developed an adequate morphology and terminology. In its absence, if one is to be fair, one must improvise.

title: Status, Secrecy and Party Loyalty Marked Jersey G.O.P.FundRaising Executive Club
description: TRENTON, May 13 money to finance Governor Cahill's reelection campaign will come from many sources and most of it will be funneled through former Gov. Alfred Driscoll, chairman of the Jersey Republican Finance Committee. None of it, contrary to what once had been planned, will come through the Executive Club of the Republican Party of New Jersey.

title: Credit Markets Benefit From the Light Demand
End of Oil Quotas Spawns New Importing Business
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The Nixon Administration has promised to grant gasoline import licenses to independent wholesalers and retailers with comparative liberality to keep them in business.

title: Guest Coach Puts English on Croquet
description: The mere sight of G. Nigel Aspinall, holder of the AllEngland Handicap croquet title, strikes fear into the hearts of American opponents.

title: 2 of 3 Van Escapees Surrender to Police After Idle Day Here
description: Two of the three prisoners who leaped to freedom from the back of a police van taking them to Criminal Court Friday morning were back in custody yesterday, facing an additional charge of escape.

title: Mayer Retains Net Title
description: PORTOLA VALLEY, Calif., May 13 (UPI)Sandy Mayer of Wayne, N.J., a Stanford junior, defeated South Africa's Ray Moore, 6.4, 75, 36, 63, today to become the first player in 10 years to win the California state tennis championship two years in a row.

title: For Americans in Paris, Easy Living Is a Memory
description: PARIS, May 13The honeymoon  or, perhaps, the moneymoon  is over for Americans in France.

title: 5 BOROUGHS OPEN THE CITY JUBILE
description: New York City invited citizens to a birthday part, yesterday to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the city's con solidation of its five borough into Greater New York.

title: U.S Warns SingleSex Colleges of Bias
description: The Federal Govenment has told about 150 singlesex colleges or colleges that are in the process of becoming coeducational that they must file reports by early summer explaining their plans to eliminate all sex discrimination in their admissions policies.

title: Inflation Worries Canada
description: OTTAWA, Canada., May 13 (Canadian Press)Inflation jitters and a continuing consumers spending spree have stirred up serious concern that the Canadian economy is growing too fast. Demand for bank loans has been booming for months, building pressure for a rise in interest rates.

title: Soviet Union Soccer Victor
description: MOSCOW, May 13 (AP)The Soviet Union defeated Ireland, 10, today in a preliminary soccer match to determine qualifiers for the 1974 World Cup.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Suffolk County police have positively identified skeleton found in an overgrown lot in the Fire Island community of Saltaire as that of a 25yearold Bay Shore woman who disappeared May 28, 1972. The woman, Francine Tuminello, was identified through dental records. She had disappeared after a party with friends at an inn only a few hundred yards from where her skeleton was found last Saturday. Miss Tuminello's death remains under investigation.

title: James Agnew Marries Miss Conelia Angelos
description: BALTIMORE, May 13Miss Conelia Vasiliki Angelos, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carl Angelos of Baltimore, and James Rand (Randy) Agnew, son of Vice President and Mrs. Spiro T. Agnew, were married here this afternoon in the Greek Orthodox Church of the Annunciation.

title: Coatesville Record Sold
description: COATESVILLE, Pa., May 13 (AP)Ralph Ingersoll, owner of several newspapers in the Philadelphia area, has purchased The Coatesville Record, George Heintzelman, president of the afternoon paper, said today. The Record had a circulation of 11,387 last year.

title: Helms Leaves Iran for U.S. To Testify in Ellsberg Case
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 13Richard Helms, the United States Ambassador, who is the former director of the Central Intelligence Agency, left Teheran for Washington today to testify about the C.I.A.'s involvement in the Pentagon papers case.

title: Japanese and Arabs Plan to Form Bank
description: TOKYO, May 13 (Reuters)The Nomura Securities Cornpany has announced that it and four Japanese banks signed a basic agreement with the Union de Banques Arab et Francais (UBAF) to form an investment bank capitalized at $10, million.

title: Ohio Representative Freed
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, May 13 (UPI) United States Representative Thomas L. Ashley, Republician of Ohio, was released from the city's workhouse this morning after serving 39 hours of threeday sentence for having physical control of his automobile while intoxicated and for resisting arrest.

title: 2 Writers Honored By 400 Survivors Of Nazi Holocaust
description: Four hundred people for whom terror in Nazi liquidation camps had been a daily experience met yesterday to present awards to two writers who have attempted to record that experience.

title: Strike Ends in Buffalo
description: BUFFALO, May 13 (AP)A twoday strike and lockout that idled 18 Buffaloarea print shops ended Sunday with the ratification of a new contract agreement. Samuel H. Sackman, a Federal mediator, announced an end to the dispute between International Typographical Union Local 9 and the Printing Industries Association of Western New York. The new agreement covers 27 firms employing about 115 Local 9 members. The printers were expected to return to work tomorrow.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: YOU ARE NOT ALONE It seems as though Jimmy Weston's, 131 East 54th Street (8388384, 3553640), never gives an inch to solitude. Nights, the bar is crowded to overflow  it's hard to get close enough to buy a drink. The tables in the rear are usually full (often a line waiting to get in) and the almost imperceptible clearing that is the dance floor makes cheektocheek dancing almost mandatory.

title: PepCom Shareholders Prefer Mail to Meeting
description: PepCom Industries, Inc., spent nearly $5,000 to hold its annual stockholders meeting in Arlington, Va., last week. But although there are more than 2,000 registered shareholders on its books, only seven of them, other than board members or management representatives, turned out for the session.

title: Beauty Pageant Time Is Upon Us Again
description: It's that time of year again. Somebody will boom out, Ladies and gentlemen, give you Miss U.S.A. (or Miss America or Miss Universe) and millions of television viewers will see a shapely girl wearing a mantle and hanging on to a wobbling crown, smiling bravely through her tears as she walks down the runway.

title: MRS. CHESTER M. DAVIS
description: Mrs. Elisabeth Logan Davis an author and former community leader in Rahway, N. J. where her husband, the Rev Dr. Chester M. Davis, was pas for of the First Presbyteriar Church for 35 years, died yes. terday in a Chester, N. J, nursing home. She Was 87 years old

title: 4 Candidates for Mayor Disclose Assets
description: In New York, at least, fears that campaign costs are making politics a rich man's game do not apply, according to the personal financial rundowns provided by each of the four Democratic mayoral candidates.

title: Martha Mitchell Terms Report of Week in Hospital Nonsense
description: Mrs. John N. Mitchell was reportedly secreted in a mental hospital last week, but yesterday, sounding as ebullient as ever, she denied it.

title: Nixon Family Has Quiet Day At the Camp David Retreat
description: THURMONT, Md., May 13:: (UPI)  President Nixon and., members of his family spent a quiet day here today at the Camp David retreat. He and Mrs. Nixon returned to the, White House tonight by helicopter.

title: Riggs Files an Entry For Women's Tourney
description: RAMONA, Calif., May 13 (AP)Bobby Riggs said to day he had filed entry for the Virginia Slims women's tournament at Newport, Rd., beginning Aug. 11.

title: Public TV Optimism
description: Public broadcasting may yet come to fruition despite the pressures from the White House Office of Telecommunications Policy and the internal dispute between the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, a Government agency that finances programing, and the Public Broadcasting Service, which interconnects the major programs for the 235 stations.

title: Iran Gains in Cup Soccer
description: TEHRAN, Iran, May 13 (AP) Iran won the World Cup Group B soccer competition today by defeating Kuwait, 20.

title: LIBYAN PREDICTS OIL WILL BECOME DEFENSE WEAPN
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, May 13Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the Libyan leader, predicted today that the time would come when oil would be used as a weapon of Arab selfdefense and asserted the sacred right of nation to nationalize the resources in its soil.

title: Meadows Wildlife Refuge Dedicated
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 13 (UPI)Nearly 80 acres of meadowland along the Hackensack River in Bergen and Essex Counties was dedicated yesterday as a wildlife preserve by the New Jersey Turnpike Authority.

title: FAST DRILL TIME FOR SECRETARIAT
description: BALTIMORE, May 13Secretariat, a shortpriced favorite to win the $150,000 added Preakness at Pimlico Race Course Saturday, turned in an impressive workout this morning in his final major drill for the 13/16 mile race. The Preakness is the second segment of the Triple Crown series.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: POMONA, May 13The heavy crop of black hair streaked with gray now, the muscular frame carries an extra 30 pounds or so, but otherwise it's the same. Don Bragg whose polevaulting made him a favorite of track and field crowds in the late nineteenfifties.

title: TV Review
description: A memorable documentary of the life of Joseph Stalin will be telecast nationally, tonight at 8 by the Public Broadcasting Service, locally over WNET/Channel 13. This long, ambitious appraisal of the late Soviet leader, coproduoed by the British Broadcasting Corporation and KCET of Los Angeles, is a whopping, rounded, penetrating eyeful running 2 hours.

title: Picasso's Private Art Collection Is Detailed
description: PARIS, May 13Pablo Picasso's personal collection of paintings by other great artists, given to the Louvre museum at his express wish by his widow and legitimate son a month ago, includes some dazzling masterworks by Matisse Cezanne, Degas, Braque, Le Main and Henri Rousseau.

title: Soccer Results
description: ASSOCIATION CUP

title: MartialLaw Decision Due in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT Lebanon, May 13The Lebanese Parliament has been called to meet tomorrow to consider an extension of the state of emergency established as a result of fighting between the army and Palestinian guerrillas.

title: U.S. TOPS MEXICO IN CUP TENNIS, 41
description: MEXICO CITY, May 13 (AP)  Harold Solomon of Silver Spring, Md., beat Raul'Ramirez of Mexico, 86, 75, 75, today and clinched the American Zone Section B Davis Cup tennis championship for the United States, which will meet Chile, the Section A winner, in the American Zone final.

title: ROYAL BLUE TAKES GREEN HUNTER TITLE
Stockbroker to Head Hospital Drive
description: The United Hospital Fund of New York has named George L. Shinn, president of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner &. Smith, Inc., to be general chairman of its 1973 fundraising campaign.

title: Pope Calls for More Priests
description: ROME, May 13 (Reuters)Pope Paul VI said today that the shortage of priests is grave problem for the Roman Catholic Church, and he appealed for more young men to enter the priesthood.

title: News Summary and Index MONDAY, MAY 14, 1973
description: Watergate Investigation

title: Library Tops Fund Goal
description: The New York Public Library has raised $1,895,510 for its deficitridden research libraries since last summer, more than enough to qualify for an additional $750,000 challenge grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

title: L.I. Company Is Happy in Hunts Point
description: Overhead conveyor belts transport sections of aluminum tubing. Huge reels of yellow, green and purple plastic tubing are unwound on oversized machines. The whoosh of pneumatic tools and the clang of hammers hitting metal reverberate in the barnlike structure.

title: MISSING LI. BABY FOUND UNHARMED
description: For Mrs, Naomi Lepselter, Mother's Day had a special meaning. Her 11monthold daughter, missing from her home in Woodmere, L. I., since Friday, was returned unharmed yesterday.

title: 2 Rival Chicano Gangs Struggle for Power in California Prisons
description: SOLEDAD, Calif., May 13Eighty MexicanAmerican con victs at Soledad state prison were watching a SpanishIanguage movie, La Mascadera (The Mask), recently when scuffling, curses and screams of pain suddenly drowned out the film's dialogue.

title: For Americans in Paris, Easy Living Is a Memory
description: PARIS, May 13The honeymoon  or, perhaps, the moneymoon  is over for Americans in France.

title: Burke's Eclipse With Yankees Explained
description: Michael Burke and George Steinbrenner 3d, Yankee chiefs past and present, ended several months of fighting and two weeks of silence yesterday in a public reconciliation that featured a tale of a brief courtship, a sudden marriage and an even quicker divorce.

title: FAIR AMERICAN WINS N.Y.A.C. YACHT PRIZE
Hawks Send Smith, Korab To Vancouver for Tallon
description: CHICAGO, May 13 (AP)The Chicago Black Hawks slave traded a goalie, Gary Smith, and a defensemanforward, Gerry Korab, to the Vancouver Canucks for a defensemancenter, Dale Tallon, the club said today.

title: State Inquiry Panel Asks Abolition of Town Courts
description: An investigation that began as an inquiry into the theft of $1,896 in parking fines from the Village of Saranac Lake, N.Y., has led the State Commission of Investigation to recommend the abolition of the state's 2,500 village and town courts.

title: Truth and Consequences: II
description: LONDON, May 15  If President Nixon understood the large: meaning of the events labeled Watergate, if he sought to respond to the public yearning they have evoked, if he wished to cleanse himself and his country of their stain, he would have to begin by rededicating his Government to one principle: respect for law. It is an undertaking that would carry him well beyond the immediate facts of Watergate.

title: Roundup: Aaron Clouts Pair, Needs 32 to Pass the Babe
description: The estimates were for Hank Aaron to break Babe Ruth's career home run record sometime next season. The Atlanta Braves slugger is acting like he has moved the schedule to sometime this season.

title: Mayoral Aspirants Divide On Forest Hills Housing
Conservatives Will Decide on Biaggi's Future Tonight
description: Conservative party leaders read copies of Mario Biaggi's nowpublic grand jury testimony yesterday and, badly split, were to meet this evening to decide whether they should try to oust him as their mayoral candidate.

title: Gordon Bush Opera, The Hermit, Sung In Brooklyn Church
description: If Wagner were composing today, he might possibly have written a 30minute opera like Gordon Bush's The Hermit instead of his 20hour Ring cycle. A moralistic tale of how gold becomes greed becomes grief (the Ring in a nutshell), The Hermit had its premiere Friday and Saturday nights at the Union Church in Brooklyn's Bay Ridge area. It was given by a new community opera group, the Bay Chamber Ensemble.

title: TV: Experimental Technique Primer
description: From 10:30 P.M. to midnight on Friday, WNET/13 carried a mixed media video consciousnessraising event called The Television Show. Transmission of the program was live. Much of the result, however, was not.

title: American Wounded in Israel
description: AFULA, Israel, May 13 (AP) An American tourist was injured yesterday by a land mine while walking in a restricted area of a kibbutz near the Jordan River frontier, policemen reported today. Patrick Conden, about 24 years old, of Austin, Tex., was visiting a kibbutz called Neve Etan when the incident occurred.

title: Red Smith
description: Now it is final. Now they're Cleveland Yankees with touches of Steamboat Springs, Colo.; Lexington, Ky.; Chicago, Detroit, Dallas, Cincinnati and Columbus, traces New York and overtones of Santa Anita and Epsom Downs. Ralph Houk's ten was warming up for a pair of games with Earl Weaver's ten yesterday when the changing of the palace guard was formally and ceremoniously completed.

title: DEAN TIED TO PLAN FOR RING TO SPY ON 1972 PROTESTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 John W. Dean 3d, the former White House counsel, actively attempted to set up an undercover espionage and intelligence ring to infiltrate antiwar protest groups before the Democratic and Republican National Conventions last year, Government sources said today..

title: Smith Downs Ashe in $50,000 Final
description: DALLAS, May 13 (UPI)Stan Smith overcame a brief mental lapse and sloppy play in the third set today and defeated Arthur Ashe, 63, 63, 46, 64, in the World Championship Tennis tour's final match of the season.

title: Jersey Canoeist Drowns Shooting Delaware Rapids
description: DEER PARK, N. Y., May 13 (AP)  A 25yearold Bayville, N. J., man drowned Saturday when his canoe capsized in rapids on the Delaware River here, the state police said.

title: Chinese Pressing Request for Official Representation in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG, May 13High on a knoll of Victoria Peak, the Nob Hill of Hong Kong within a stone's throw of the residence of the American Consul General, a freshly painted twostory house stands vacant. Whether it will soon be occupied has become an issue threatening the cordiality of Britain's relations with China.

title: Butz Says Senator Ervin Uses Inquiry for Publicity
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 13 (AP)Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz called Senator Sam Ervin, Democrat of North Carolina, a publicityseeking Senator today.

title: Method to Help Control Earthquakes Is Reported
description: Scientists at the California Institute of Technology report that an experimental technique for giving early warning of small earthquakes also proved applicable to a major quake on the West Coast and gives promise of wider application for controls as well as warning.

title: Books of The Times
description: Philip Roth's The Great American Novel is what I would call a great American bathtub book. A bathtub book? Please let me explain. In the days of darkest preadolescence, I used to lie soaking in a hot tub... and fantasize out loud about baseball (so did at least one of my brothers often noticed upon passing the closed bathroom door and hearing from behind it a voice like Bill Stern's announcing the most incredible heroics starring my brother... which is what permits me to classify the bathtub book as a distinct genre rather than merely a personal idiosyncrasy). There is something about a hot baththe privacy,, the vapors, the soft soap, the warm water that the critical faculties down and makes all things possible. Some people sing; others announce baseball games in which the bather strikes out Babe Ruth a dozen times in row, hits safely in 152 consecutive games, pulls Walter Johnson's offering into the leftfield seats, and is even more heroically ill than Lou Gehrig. Yes, Philip Roth has really written a bathtub book. Bernard Malamud once tried to do it when he gave us The Natural, but he stuck too close to reality. Philip Roth has gone all the way.

title: Cosmos Play Metros to 11 Tie, Find New Star in Len Renery
description: Compliments of the Toronto Metros, the Cosmos returned to New York last night with four points, two badly injured players and the discovery of a star midfielder. d

title: 2 G.O.P. Legislators Back Panel on Campaign Reform
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI)  Two Republican Congressional leaders expressed support today for establishment of a bipartisan commission to recommend ways of cleaning up campaign practices after the Watergate scandals.

title: U.S. SAID TO WIDEN STORE PRICE CASE
description: A Federal grand jury empanelled by the Jurttice Department to investigate alleged price fixing by at least six New York stores has reportedly expanded its scrutiny to cover a wide range of apparel pricing practices as well as social gettogethers of leading merchants and the reasons behind some recent job switching.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DENVER, May 13 (UPI)  The sixthranked heavyweight, Ron Lyle, scored a unanimous 10round decision over Gregorio Peralta of Argentina last night. Lyle won the match, 49 points to 45, on the card of Judge Danny Loos, 5853, according to Judge Ray Beech's card, and 4845 according to Referee Joe Ullmer.

title: Maryanna Dickey, Zoologist, Is Bride
description: Miss Maryanna Dickey, daughter of John Dickey of Brooklyn and the late Mrs. Dickey, was married here yesterday afternoon to Dr. Paul Litton Fletcher Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Fletcher of Kinston, N.C.

title: German Retains Ring Title
description: KIEL, West Germany, May 13 (UPI)Lothar Abend of West Germany gained an 11th round technical knockout over Felix Said Brami of France today to retain his European junior lightweight boxing title.

title: Intermezzo With Leland
description: The swoon is a movement motif of Balanchine's fourpart ballet BrahmsSchoenberg Quartet. A careful look at the work will show that the principal ballerina in each section will find at least one opportunity to fall back into her partner's arms. But it is in the second section or Intermezzo, that this theme is most obvious.

title: ELECTRONIC CONCERT MARKED BY TIMIDITY
description: The ColumbiaPrinceton axis in contemporary American music has long been noted for its stern refusal to be seduced by the blandishments of sound for its own sake. Such rigorous intellectuality would seem to persist no matter what the imedium. Or at least so a concert of the ColumbiaPrince ton Electronic Music Center at Columbia's McMillin Theater Thursday night suggested.

title: Francis S. Bensel Dead; Lawyer, Court Reformer
description: Francis S. Bensel, a senior partner in the law firm of Kelley, Drye, Warren, Clark, Carr & Ellis, 350 Park Avenue, died Saturday in New York Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 200 East 66th Street.

title: Jacking Up Farm Prices
description: If the farm bill approved last week by the Senate Agriculture Committee wins the support of Congress, American housewives can say goodby to any hopes they may have of ever seeing food prices return to levels thatas recently as a year agothey thought of as high but bearable.

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: ROAD TO LEARNING Amsterdam Avenue is scarcely a cultural Appian Way at first glance, but it does run past Lincoln Center, Columbia University, the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine, City College and, finally, Yeshiva University, at 185th Street, where in the main center you will find a new museum (LO 88400), dedicated to Judaica.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: DENVILLE, May 14More than the $35,000 worth of prizes are dancing through the minds of the contestants in the threeday Dodge open golf tournament that will start here tomorrow over the Rockaway River Country Club's course. The river in the club's name is for real and presents a dreaded water hazard on the 18th hole.

title: Panel Finds Indians in 2 States Face Job Curbs
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., May 14 (AP)Indians in New Mexico and Arizona are being denied job and education opportunities, health care and access to water, the United States Commission on Civil Rights said today.

title: The Cost of Brokerage
description: The New York Stock Exchange wants to boost its minimum fixed commission charges by $300 millionan increase that will require approval of the Securities and Exchange Commission. Simultaneously, the Justice Department has asked a Federal district court to wipe out the Stock Exchange's system of fixed commission charges altogether on the ground that the pricefixing violates the antitrust laws.

title: JETNOISE CURFEW BY CITIES BARRED
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Supreme Court ruled 5 to 4 today that municipalities could not enact a local curfew on jet flights at their airports in an effort to control noise.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The brown bullhead, or horned pout, almost ubiquitous in the Northeast, is one of the easiest fish for the beginning angler to catch, and, contrary to its appearance, is also excellent table fare.

title: Launching on Soviet TV
description: MOSCOW, May 14 (AP)Soviet television showed videotape of the Skylab launching today 50 minutes after it happened.

title: Automated Typesetting Shown; Union Head Here Is Receptive
description: A completely automated typesetting system, developed and put into operation with the cooperation of the typographical union, was demonstrated yesterday by The Composing Room, Inc., a printing company at 387 Park Avenue.

title: Superb Imai Viola Solos At Final 3 by 3 Concert
description: Nobuko Imai led off Carnegie Hall's third and final Three by Three concert on Sunday afternoon with three works for solo viola: a Sonata by Hindemith, a Suite by Reger and Bach's Chaconne. Miss Imai's playing was just this side of spectacular as she drew long, clean, sonorous lines, triumphantly siirmounted every technical difficulty and made superb musical sense of each piece.

title: High Court Bars Review In Teleprompter Bribe
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (Reuters)  The Suprettie Court declined today to re view the bribery and perjury conviction of Irving Kahn, former president of the Teleprompter corporation.

title: The Real Contempt
description: Senator John L. McClellan, that thundesous pillar of ostensible virtue, recently said that the statistics on tiiro and a half years of courtauthors ized wiretapping should do a great deal to relieve the fears of some citizens of an excessive use of these techniques by legitimate lawenforcement agents....

title: Puttemans in Coast Meets
description: LOS ANGELES, May 14 (AP) Emiel Puttemans of Belgium, the holder of five world distance running records, has accepted invitations to compete in two West Coast track and field meets later this month, He will run at the California Relays in Modesto May 26 and at the Vons Track Classic in Los Angeles the next day.

title: CUT IN LOSS IS SEEN BY AN ERIE TRUSTEE
description: CLEVELAND, May 14 (AP) The Erie Lackawanna Railway Company's financial re, organization under the Federal bankruptcy law probably has been as successful as is feastble in its first year, a spokesman said today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
COWEN OUTVOTED BY ABDULJABBAR
description: Dave Cowens of the Boston Celtics, the most valuable player of the National Basketball Association and also the most valuable in the AllStar game, had to be satisfied with a secondteam berth in the allleague selections yesterday.

title: WEEKLONG HUNT
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation said today that records of 17 wiretaps placed on newsmen and Government officials were discovered last week in a White House safe belonging to John D. Ehrlichman, one of the Presidential assistants who resigned over the Watergate scandal.

title: Preakness May Attract Slim Field of 4 Horses
description: BALTIMORE, May 14Sigmund Sommer's Sham, the powerful son of Pretense who was second to Secretariat in the Kenucky Derby, came out for his final Preakness workout this morning at Pimlico Race Course and impressed clockers and his trainer, Frank (Pancho) Martin, as he went five furlongs in 0:58 25.

title: Prices of Bonds Decline
description: The bond market declined yesterday, but its drop wasn't nearly as pronounced as the stock market's.

title: Pressure in Jersey Fraud Reportedly Laid to Gross
description: NEWARK, May 14A key defendant in the Federal investigation of alleged fraud in the financing of Governor Cahill's 1969 election campaign pleaded guilty to perjury here today, contending through his lawyer that he was subjected to heavy pressure to lie to the grand jury and to cover up the fraud by a former high New Jersey public official.

title: GOTTFRIED WINS FROM GRAEBNER
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 14Brian Gottfried, one of the many bright American newcomers on the international tennis circuit, whipped Clark Graebner, 64, 67, 62, today in the opening round of the $150,000 Alan KingCaesars Palace tennis tournament.

title: Stocks Fall Sharply
description: The stock market dropped sharply yesterday in moderate trading. The DowJones industrial average had its biggest daily decline in almost three years, slumping 18.29 points to 909.69. It was the average's lowest closing level since Feb. 8, 1972, when it finished at 907.13. Details, Page 49.

title: Cawley, Sworn as Police Commissioner, Vows to Follow Murphy's Policies
description: During a packed ceremony in the Blue Room of City Hall, Mayor Lindsay yesterday pinned the Police Commissioner's gold badge on Donald F. Cawley and praised the 43yearold former chief of patrol as an innovator

title: MEROLA STUDYING BIAGGI'S KILLING OF SUSPECT IN 59
description: A new investigation has been started by the Bronx District Attorney's office into the event that won Mario Biaggi recognition as a police hero, the 1959 shooting case in which he killed an apparent holdup man in the rear seat of a parked car.

title: 3 Conservative Party Leaders Repudiate While 5 Others Reaffirm Support of His Can
description: Three Conservative party state leaders last night repudi ated Representative Mario Biaggi, their party's mayora nominee, while five other Conservative leaders reaffirmed their support of the candidate.

title: Two Head to Sea in Canoe
description: WILMINGTON, N.C., May 14 (AP)  two inexperienced but determined canoeists cast away from a tow craft today in a 16foot canoe they hope will get them to Portugal. They were Mrs. Shirley. Haycock, 40 years Old, of Price, Utah, and Geedy, 38 of Multi, Utah.

title: Bridge: Rubber Player's Simple Life vs. Duplicates Complexities
description: The rubber bridge player leads a simple life. He tries to make his contract, and if in the process he fails by two or three tricks he does not care. The problems of the declarer in a duplicate game are somewhat more complex: it may be right for him to resign himself to a onetrick defeat and abandon a chance to make his contract.

title: Agency Opposes More U.S. Aid To Develop Cleaner Car Engines
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Environmental Protection Agency registered its opposition today to any substantial expansion of Federal efforts to develop a lowpollution alternative to the conventional internal combustion engine.

title: Sirica Holds Dean Papers Brought From Bank Vault
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Chief Judge John J. Sirica of the United States District Court here took possession today of papers purportedly relating to the Watergate case despite a request by the White House that they be returned.

title: MERULA STUDYING BIAGGI'S KILLING OF SUSPECT IN 59
description: A new investigation has been started by the Bronx District Attorney's office into the event that won Mario Biaggi recognition as a police hero, the 1959 shooting case in which he killed an apparent holdup man in the rear seat of a parked car.

title: Discharged Porter Kills ExEmployer And Then Himself
description: A 60yearold woman who, with her husband, operated bookprinting business in the Chelsea district, was shot to death yesterday afternoon. A porter who had been dismissed from. his job at the plant last Friday shot her, the police said.The porter, according to the police; then turned his.38caliber revolver on himself, cried Remember Friday! and pulled thetrigger. He died an hour later of a head wound at St. Vincent's Hospital.

title: AGENCY JOBS FOR 2 IN G.O.P. OPPOSED
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The president of the American Statistical Association has protested the appointment of two men with strong Republican political ties but no professional background to head two of the most important statistical agendas in the Federal Government.

title: Chess: An Attack From Strength Needs No Weak Target
2 Nixon Aides Suggested a Prosecutor
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Elliot L. Richardson said today that two ranking members of the new White House staff had suggested to him candidates for special prosecutor in the Watergate case.

title: Astronomers Head Africa to Observe Extraordinary Eclipse
description: An estimated 5,000 amateur astronomers and tourists, plus 2500 scientists, are expected to converge on Africa next month for one of the. three longest total eclipses of the sun in a period of 1,052 years. It will occur June 30 and will last a maximum of 7 minutes 8 seconds.

title: Rockefeller to Head U. S. Panel on National Aims
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 Governor Rockefeller, standing in the White House briefing room, outlined plans today for a bipartisan national commission to seek a clearer sense of national purpose for the nation's third century.

title: Irate Cambodian Troops March in Phnom Penh
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 14 (AP)About 500 Cambodian soldiers, hungry and unpaid, marched through Phnom Penh today, firing their guns into the air. They promptly got a month's pay and some bread.

title: Blumenthal Acknowledges Share in Tananbaum Fees
description: The late Martin Tananbaum, president of Yonkers Raceway and a controversial figure in New York politics before his death in 1970, paid about $40,000 in legal fees to the law firm, of Assemblyman Alfred H. Blumenthal in 1965 and 1966. Mr. Blumenthal at first yesterday denied but later acknowledged that he had shared in those fees.

title: Basketball Transaction
description: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION

title: F.D.A., in Botulism Check, Orders Canner Registration
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) Confronted with a surging incidence of botulism toxin ins commercially canned food, the Government today ordered certain canners to register their processes and face a shutdown if they do not measure up.

title: Riggs at 55: Life Begins Anew, Action Never Ends
description: RAMONA, Calif., May 14At a time when he fancies himself as a 55yearold player with one foot in the grave, Bobby Riggs is finding a magic second wind in his competitive career.

title: COUNT VITETTI DIES; DELEGATE TO U.N.;78
description: Count Leonardo Vitetti, Italian representative to the United Nations from 1956 to 1958, died yesterday in Rome. He was 78 years old.

title: Tigers Trounce Yanks, 80
description: Billy Martin, the peppery Detroit manager, coached at third base last night for the first time this season and emerged from the parttime job with mixed results. He got a closer view of the Tigers 80 victory over the Yankees, but he also got too close a view of Ike Brown's bat.

title: End a Fox Suits Is Indicated
description: Two years after a dramatic management shakeup and bruising proxy fight, the 20th CenturyFox Film Corporation appears close to settling millions of dollars of outstanding claims and emerging from the limbo of a quiet Federal securities investigation and fraud case. Some major unanswered questions remain, however.

title: DR. FRANCES HOFFMAN
description: Dr. Frances P. Hoffman, professor emeritus of health and physical education at Queens College, died Friday of cancer in a Silver Spring, Md., nursing, home. She was 66 years old.

title: PAKISTANI LEADER TENDS STAY IN IRAN
description: THERAN, Iran, May 14Green and white Pakistani flags fluttered on Pahlevi Avenue today. Photographs of Ptepldent Zulfikar All Bhutto were displayed in store win dows. By noon heavily guarded limousines began moving to the airport.

title: Rutgers to Award Degree To Columnist for The Times
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 14 (AP)Anthony Lewis, a columnist for The New York Times and twice a Pulitzer Prize winner, will be awarded an honorary doctorate by Rutgers University, the university announced today.

title: Arthur Daley
description: When Bobby Riggs was 11 years old, he played his first tennis gate with a borrowed racquet and immediately began scheming for some way he could get a racquet he could call his own. Not long thereafter, he was wandering wistfully around the court when he noticed a man amusing himself by scaling away an old tennis bat and having his dog retrieve it. The dog would bound after the racquet, take it in his mouth and drop it at his master's feet. Out spun the racquet once more. The dog scampered after it. But so did Bobby Riggs. He outhustled the dog for it and returned it to the owner as the eagerness of a small boy shone all over this human retriever. I can use this better than the dog, said little Bobby. Keep it then, son, said the man. And that is how the Riggs career was formally, if oddly, launched. It carried to championships at Wimbledon land Forest Hills. It gained him rank as the top professional. But those things happened either before or shortly after Mrs. Margaret Court was born. That's what lent an air of :total unreality to the strange sequence of events that flashed in stunning, unbelievable fashion on television :screens the day before yesterday.

title: Briefs on the Arts
Legislature Passes Bill on Development In the Adirondacks
description: ALBANY, May 14The Senate late today gave final legislative approval to a bill providing for controlled development of 3.7 million acres of privately owned land in the sixmillionacre Adirondack Park.

title: Vikings Reacquire Berry; Falcons Get Lee, Warwick
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 14 (AP)  The Minnesota Vikings reacquired Bob Berry, quarterback, from Atlanta today as partial compensation when their reserve quarterback, Bob Lee, and middle linebacker, Lonnie Warwick, signed with the Falcons.

title: Magruder Said in january That Nixon Helped Run Campaign Until After Waterga
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Jeb Stuart Magruder, who served as deputy campaign manager for the Committee for the Reelection of the President last year, told an offtherecord political seminar early this year that President Nixon played a vital and active role in campaign planning and decision making until one month after the Watergate breakin.

title: BID TO CIA, CITED
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Senator Stuart Symington said today that three highlevel White House aides had been deeply involved in trying to enlist the help of the Cenrtal Intelligence Agency in domestic undercover activities other than the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: U.S. JUDGE CURBS INQUIRY BY STATE
description: NEWARK, May 14 (AP)A Federal judge today prohibited the State Commission of Investigation from making public the names of targets of its investigation of the state workmen's compensation system.

title: DELPHI RUNNER GRANTED HEARING
description: Dennis Walker, Ade1phi University's excellent quartermiler, will be given the iportunity to explain why he competed for the United States against the Soviet Union in a track meet last March 16 that was not certified by the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

title: KAUFMAN &
description: LOS ANGELES, May 14EliBroad, chairman of Kaufman & Broad, Inc., said today that the company had completely resolved a rash of rumors that had produced a bear raid or the stock and kept the stock from trading today on the New York Stock Exchange because buy and sell orders could not be matched.

title: Stocks Fall Sharply
description: The stock market dropped sharply yesterday in moderate trading. The DowJones industrial average had its biggest daily decline in almost three years, slumping 18.29 points to 909.69. It was the average's lowest closing level since Feb. 8, 1972, when it finished at 907.13. Details, Page 49.

title: Business Briefs
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, May 14 (AP)Volkswagen, the financially ailing auto maker, reported today a 40 per cent gain in net profit for 1972, but Rudolf Leiding, the company's chairman, said earnings were still far from satisfactory.

title: Skyjacker Is Called Malingerer, But Not Insane, by Psychiatrist
description: Dr. David Abrainunsen, a Manhattan psychiatrist testifying at the second skyjacking trial of Garrett B. Trapnell, insisted under intense cross examination yesterday that Trapnell was a malingerer who had feigned the symptoms of schizophrenia to fool prison psychiatrists for years.

title: Knicks Reap Harvest of Awards
description: A City Hall reception for the whole team and presentation of a sports car to Willis Reed are the remaining orders of business for the New York Knicks today, as the aura of success continued to surround them.

title: Sirica Holds Dean Papers Brought From Bank Vault
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Chief Judge John J. Sirica of the United States District Court here took possession today of papers purportedly relating to the Watergate case despite a request by the White House that they be returned.

title: Cornfeld in Geneva Jail, Accused in I.O.S. Case
description: GENEVA, May 14  Bernard Cornfeld, the American financier who, created the Investors Overseas Services mutual fund empire, was jailed here today.

title: LONGTIME SURVIVOR OF TRANSPLANT DIES
description: ALPENA, Mich., May 14 (AP)  Donald L. Kaminski, who had been the world's secondlongest living heart transplant patient, died today.

title: Gold Price Climbs Above $100 Level
Books of The Times
description: What this town needs is a good oldfashioned lynching. The real thing. With all the trimmings. It would be like going to church. Puts things in their proper perspective. Reminding everybody of who they are, where they stand. Divides the world simple and pure. Good or bad. Oppressors and oppressed. Black or white. Things tend to get a little fuzzi here in the big city. We need a. ritual. A speclar... Now I'm not talking about grabbing just any old body and stringing him up to the nearest lamp post. That's not it at all. We Intst learn to do a thing correctly With style for immediate appeal and depth for the deep thinkers, the ones who concern themselves with history and tradi tion.. What could be more dramatic? A great artist must have conceived the first lynching. As a failed poet myself, I envy his sweet touch, the sure hand that could extricate a satisfying, stable form from the raw fantasies of his peers.

title: E. PAUL GANGEWERE
description: READING, Pa., May 14 (AP) E. Paul Gangewere, retired president and board chairman of the Reading Company, died yesterday. He was 72 years old.

title: Summary of Actions Taken by the Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Supreme Court took the folowing actions today:

title: MEDVEDEV SEES NO DIFFICULTIES
description: LONDON, May 14Zhores A. Medvedev said today that he did not expect problems in returning to the Soviet Union because of what he called his factual tribute to Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Detroit Tigers, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 7:30 P.M. (RadioWMCA, 7:30 P.M.)

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: $1.4 Billion in March
CORNELIUS BOOCOCK, RUTGERS EXDEAN, 75
description: POINT PLEASANT, N. J., May 14Cornelius Brett Boocock Sr., dean of men at Rutgers University from 1948 until his retirement in 1963, died today in Point Pleasant Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived in Mantoloking.

title: Roger Hawthorne, Reporter, Covered Byrd in Antarctic
description: POCASSET, Mass., May 14 (AP)  Roger Hawthorne, a newsman for whom Rear Adm. Richard E. Byrd named a mountain in the Antarctic, died Saturday at Barnstable County Hospital. He was 68 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two civilian aides who answer the telephones when people dial 911 for police help were arrested yesterday in Manhattan Police Headquarters on charges of possessing and selling marijuana to undercover narcotics patrolmen.

title: Alternate Foods in School Lunches Opposed by Group of Nutritionists
description: WASHINGTON, May 14  A group of 31 nutritionists and 10 citizens organizations, fearing a trend away from real foods, announced their opposition today to proposed regulations of the Department of Agriculture that would formally allow alternate foods in the nation's school lunch program.

title: City Says Grolier Tricked Many Into Buying Flimsy Materials
description: The city's Consumer Affairs Department yesterday sued Grolier, Inc., accusing the encyclopedia and teaching materials company of having tricked the parents of hundreds of parochial school children into paying $300 to $500 for flimsy plastic teaching machines and sets of books.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Frank A Robbins, the suspended acting chief of the Hudson County Police, was acquitted yesterday by a Superior Court jury on charges of conspiracy and unlawfully obtaining county property.

title: Arian's Stores Petitions For Bankruptcy Action
description: Arlan's Department Stores, Inc., a large chain in the discountretailing industry, ann6unced yesterday that it had filed a petition for an arrangenient under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act. It listed debts of $81million and assets of about $75million.

title: Crowds Are Missing As Lab Is Launched
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 14 (AP)For America's first space station, Skylab 1, the crowds were most noticeable by their absence.

title: MESSENGER TRIAL SEATED TONIGHT
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 14  The trials for Saturday night's $119,732 Messenger Stakes will be paced tonight in the fourth and sixth races at Roosevelt Raceway. fifteen owners have posted $2,000 starting fees in hopes of qualfying for the 18th edition of the race for 3year olds.

title: Burundi Says Troops Halt Attack by Insurgents
description: BUJUMBURA, Burundi, May 14 (AgencA FrancePresse)  The Government said today that its troops had halted Burundian insurgents who had entered the country from Rwanda in the north and from Tanzania in the south.

title: All Sides in Busing Controversy Await Supreme Court Ruling in Richmond Case
