description: WASHINGTON, May 14 Last May, as 18th anniversary of the 1954Supreme Court dedision against segregated schools was observed, the nation was still embroiled in a bitter battle over separate schools, and busing of pupils had become the symbol of that struggle.

title: Boll, Here, Reflects on Liberty and Law and Order
description: Finding himself in a country where politicians fear the pen, Heinrich Bll feels perfectly at home.

title: BEIRUT ASSEMBLY AVOIDS TOTE TEST
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 14The Lebanese Parliament failed today to obtain a quorum to vote on extension of the state of emergency declared a week ago when there was fighting ;between the army and Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Stand on R.O.T.C. Reversed
description: DURHAM, N. FL, May 14 (AP) The University of New Hampshire Senate has voted to permit restoration of academic credit for. Reserve Officer Training Corps courses. The action reversed a decision of four years ago.

title: I.R.A. Man Wanted by British Is Killed in Clash With
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 14 (UPI)An Irish Republican Army member sought as a gunman Was killed in a shootout with, British troops today.

title: Spring and Calves Arrive in the Plain
description: GACKLE, N. D., May 14Ed Remmick owned 217 cattle one recent night. The next morning he owned 220.

title: If Sure of Gunfire Is a Sign, Sicilian Mafia Is in Trouble
description: PALERMO, SicilyWhenever the Mafia shoots, Sicilians say, it is in trouble.

title: ADELPHI RUNNER GRANTED HEARING
description: Dennis Walker, Ade1phi University's excellent quartermiler, will be given the iportunity to explain why he competed for the United States against the Soviet Union in a track meet last March 16 that was not certified by the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

title: WEEKLONG HUNT
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The acting director of the FedNral Bureau of Investigation said today that records of 17 wiretaps placed on newsmen; and Government officials werediscovered last week in a White House safe belonging to John, D. Ehrlichman, one of the Presidential assistants who resigned over the Watergate scandal.

title: DayCare Stealing Charged
description: Paul Recard, a former member of the board of directors of a Harlem daycare center, was arrested yesterday on charges of stealing about $900 from the Area 145 Day Care Center at 510 West 145th Street. Commissioner of Investigation Nicholas Scoppetta said that Mr. Recard had forged the signature of another board member to nine checks and converted the funds to his own use.

title: Leon Bibb Sings With Ailey Dancers In McKayle Work
description: There are some pieces that the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater company performs with special verve. One as Donald McKayle's Rainbow Round My Shoulder, which was seen Sunday evening for the first time this season. In addition, Leon Bibb was the solo singer for the first time since he sang it at the dance's premiere 14 years ago this month.

title: Lex Barker's Rites Today
description: The funeral of Lex Barker, the film actor who died here on Friday, will take place at 11:30 A.M. today at Frank E. Campbell's, Madison Avenue at 81st Street.

title: COVENS OUTVOTED BY ABDULABBAR
description: Dave Cowens of the Boston Celtics, the most valuable player of the National Basketball Association and also the most valuable in the AllStar game, had to be satisfied with a secondteam berth in the allleague selections yesterday.

title: Meridian Reports on Tender
description: The Meridian Investing & Development Corporation said yesterday that its directors and officers had determined that they will, as a group, tender up to 50 per cent of their nonrestricted shares if requested to do so by Donaldson, Lufkin and Jenrette, Inc.

title: MORE IN VIOLATION OF THE HEALTH CODE
description: The Health Department yesterday listed eight more foodprocessing establishments in New York City where Health Code violations were found to persist on reinspection. A third and final inspection later this month could result in closing orders, if the violations are not corrected.

title: People and Business
description: Edwin T. Meredith 3d, a 40yearold grandson of the founder of the Meredith Corporation, was named chairman yesterday. He will continue as chief executive officer. Mr. Meredith was succeeded as president by Robert A. Burnett,.45, who had been executive vice presidentoperations.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Detroit Tigers, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 7:30 P.M. (RadioWMCA, 7:30 P.M.)

title: Fighting Saints Give Neale TwoYear Coaching Pact
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., May 14 (AP)  The Minnesota Fighting Saints of the World Hockey Association today signed Coach Harry Neale to a twoyear contract. Terms were not disclosed.

title: Research Libraries Map LargeScale Cooperation
description: Directors of the New York Public Library and the Haryard, Yale and Columbia University libraries, feeling the squeeze of Federal budget cuts, rising costs and the need to cope with an evergrowing mountain of books, met here yesterday to explore coordination and cooperation.

title: Prices Plunge on Amex
PROFITS ARE DOWN AT CONGLOMERATE
Watergate Property Value Is Assessed at $33Million
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) The Watergate commercial and apartment complex, which is becoming as wellknown as the national monuments here because of the breakin last June 17, is Washington's most valuable piece of taxable commercial property, according to assessment records.

title: Auto Track. Gets Reprieve
description: PARIS, May 14 (UPI)  The International Automobile Federation today granted organizers of the May 20 Belgian Grand Prix race an extra 32 hours to make the Zolder racing circuit safer. Drivers had said loose gravel made the track dangerous. The F.I.A. had set noon today as a deadline for resurfacing. If the track is not satisfactoiy, the race will be canceled.

title: Leyland Sets Expansion
description: LONDON, May 14Britain's biggest automobile manufacturer, the British Leyland Motor Corporation, announced today an expansion program that would cost around $1.2billion over the next five years. The porgram will be financed out of the corporation's own resources plus borrowing facilities already lined up, Lord Stokes, the company's chairman, said at a luncheon here.

title: Army Chief Rejects 3Year Cat In Calley Sentence to 17 Years
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Secretary of the Army, Robert F. Froehlke, turned down today parole board recommendations that he trim three years from the 20year sentence of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr.

title: WILLIAMS FIGHTS BROKERFEE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. asked the Cost of Living Council today to reject the increase in sales commissions on stock transactions that had been requested by the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Stoned Nassau Coliseum Rock Fans Face Bad Trip
description: UNIONDALE, L. I.He was smoking something exotic from a homemade tinfoil pipe and swaying in the aisle of the Nassau Coliseum, grooving on Rod Stewart and The Faces.

title: Equity Financing
description: American Motor Innis yesterday announced proposed secondary offering of 153,723 common shares, to be sold for certain selling shareholders, had been withdrawn on grounds that prospective selling shareholders had no desire to sell their shares at present market levels. The company's stock, traded on the American Stock Exchange, closed unchanged at 9.

title: Bombing Laid to Basques
description: PAMPLONA, Spain, May 14 (UPI)A bomb exploded today in a bar on the main highway connecting Pamplona and Irun, police sources said. The sources said the bombing, which caused no injuries, was thought to be the work of, extremist Basque separatists.

title: FASHION TALK
description: After half a dozen mannequins swept down the runway of Calvin Klein's showroom just off Seventh Avenue, the last was joined by a male model wearing an identical outfit. Well, almost identical. He wore checked pants; she had on a long checked skirt. They both wore brown sweater jackets and ivory shirts. They linked arms and walked off together.

title: RESERVE CATCHER BOUGHT BY METS
description: CHICAGO, May 14On blustery afternoon in Chicago, the New York Mets finally did some mending today  their game with the divisionleading Cubs was postponed by cold weather, no new injuries were reported and they bought Jerry May from Kansas City as secondstring catcher.

title: Martin Bites His Tongue Driving Used Car at Indy
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 14When John Martin eyes his tachometer while running at high speed, he sees not only revolutions per minute, but dollar signs. The name of his McLaren is the Unsponsored Special, and it means exactly that. He is racing on his own money, and there isn't much of it.

title: 2 SENATORS DEPLORE IMPEACHMENT TALK
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York, and Senator Abraham Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, both deplored here yesterday any talk of impeachment of President Nixon in the wake of the Watergate disclosures, while endorsing measures to get to the bottom of the matter.

title: GREEK EXLEADER ASSAILS ARRESTS
description: ATHENS, May 14Greece's most recent Premier in a constitutional government accused the nation's militarybacked regime today of violating elementary principles of justice by making largescale secret arrests of dissenting students and intellectuals.

title: EDWARD V. M'CANN
description: Edward V. McCann, a proofreader in the composing room of The New York Times, died Sunday night after a brief illness. He lived at 549 East 234th Street, the Bronx, and was 60 years old.

title: Statement by Acting F.B.I. Director About Wiretap Documents
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Following is a statement of William D. Ruchelshaus, acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation on the results of an inquiry about missing records relating to electronic surveillance on certain individuals:

title: HIGH COURT TAKES REGULATORY CASE
description: WASHINGTON, May, 14 The Supreme Court agreed today to resolve a continuing dispute over whether the cost of Federal regulation of an industry should be borne by the industry itself or by the public.

title: AIR FORCE WOMAN WINS BENEFIT SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 The Supreme Court ruled today that female members of the armed services were entitled to the same dependency benefits for their husbands as servicemen have always received for their wives. The vote was 8 to 1.

title: New Vase Fragments Believed Move to Hinder Italian Inquiry
description: ROME, May I4The Italian police today said they had received anonymously 45 valuable fragments of another Greek vase attributed to Euphronios, that they believe were sent to hinder investigation of the Euphronios vase now in the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. The fragments come from a euphronios vase dug up in Cerveteri north west of here about a century ago.

title: SPACE STATION IS IN ORBIT; MALFUNCTION WILL DELAY ASTRONAUT FLIGHT 5 DAYS
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 14  Skylab, the nation's firs space station, Was rocketei into orbit today, but a deploy ment failure of its solarpowei wings forced a fiveday dela3 and serious curtailment of manned operations aboard the massive research spaceship.

title: 3 Top Mafiosi Out of Circulation
description: PALERMO, Sicily  Of Sicily's three most notorious mafiosi, one is in retirement, another is in jail and the third is in hiding.

title: 3 Made III by Fumes
description: CLEVELAND, May 14 (UPI)A city fire fighter and two Penn Central Railroad employes were treated for inhalation of fumes early today, following the seepage of silicon tetrachloride from an overturned tank car.

title: OIL AIDES AND ISRAEL DENY LIBYAN CHARGE
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, May 14Oil industry sources today categorically denied charges made yesterday by Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the Libyan leader, that seven Israeli agents had been discovered on the staff of an American oil company operating in Libya.

title: 2 Lighthouse Men Drown
description: SOUTHWEST HARBOR, Maine, May 14 (AP)  The Coast Guard reported today the bodies of two guardsmen had been recovered from the sea five miles southwest of Mount Desert light station. Lieut. (j.g.) Ernest Blanchard said the men were attendants at the Coast Guard lighthouse. Their identities were withheld pending notification of next of kin.

title: LIFE TERMS GIVEN TO HIJACKER OF JET
description: ST. LOUIS, May 14 (AP)Martin J. McNally, the convicted hijacker of an American Airlines jet here last summer, was sentenced to two life prison rterms in Federal District Court today.

title: Talks Off if Raids Go On, Tho Tells U.S.
description: PARIS, May 14North Viet nam today reiterated its charge that United States planes had struck Communistheld areas South Vietnam and warned that forthcoming talks with Henry A. Kissinger would be can celed if raids continued.

title: U.S. PANEL IS TOED OF WAR ON DRUGS
description: Drug abuse and narcotics traffic are manyheaded phenomena that tough lawenforcement and glamourous international crackdowns may drive into new forms, a Senate subcommittee hearing on the Federal Government's new narcotics super agency was told here yesterday.

title: Princeton's Seniors to Protest If Shultz Gets Honorary Degree
description: PRINCETON, May 14  A group of Princeton University seniors is planning a walkout at the school's commencement ceremonies to protest the expected awarding of an honorary degree to the Secretary of the Treasury, George P. Shultz,

title: The Boom and Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, May 14New evidence from outside the Feederal Government has become available in the last few days that helps to explain both the extraordinary pace of the economic boom in the early months of 1973 and the accompanying high rate of inflation.

title: Krislin Takes Vagrancy By Neck as Belmont Opens
description: Making a strong closing rush under the guidance of Marco Castaneda, Harold I, Snyder's Krislin captured the $28,075 Vagrancy Handicap, the sevenfurlong feature for fillies and mares at Belmont Park yesterday.

title: Elmer Snowden, 72, Dies; Former Jazz Band Leader
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 14Elmer Snowden, the jazz band leader who introduced Duke Ellington in Harlem 50 years ago, died here today at the age of 72.

title: 2 Big Producers Act
description: The steel industry made it virtually unanimous yesterday in following price increases for sheet and strip steel announced last Thursday by the United States Steel Corporation. The Bethlehem Steel Corporation and the Republic Steel Corporation indicated they would follow recent actions of other major producers and raise flatrolled steel prices, before midyear. Bethlehem, the nation's second largest producer, said its new prices would become effective with shipments of June 17 and would be in line with those generally announced by other major producers. Bethlehem's new prices will reflect increases of $8 a ton on hot rolled sheet, $9 a ton on cold rolled and $11 a ton on galvanized.

title: Oil: Delay and Disunity
description: A quarter century ago the nations of the West perceived a common danger to their securityStalin's armed divisions , in Central Europe  and united into a structure of political and military institutions to meet that threat. In the 1970's a new common danger threatens the industrialized societies of Western Europe, North America and Japan. Instead of uniting for the common defense, these nations are going their own ways, seeking their own special advantages, expressing suspicion each of the others.

title: Few Ohio Guns Registered
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 14 (AP)Only 177 of the known 3,000 machine guns owned by Ohioans have been registered under a 1968 state gun control law, according to the Ohio Adjutant General's office.

title: L.I. MOTHER HELD IN CHILD SLAYING
description: LAKE GROVE, L. I., May 14 The Suffolk County police charged today that a 45yearold widow stabbed her three children, killing one of them, early this morning as they were asleep in their small house here.

title: Jury Criticizes ExCity Official For'Abuse of PettyCash Fund
description: After a fivemonth investigation into the city's use of provisional employes, a Manhattan grand jury yesterday accused a former highranking Lindsay administration official of gross abuse of his authority and recommended disciplinary action against him.

title: Stanley Crane, Artist, Dies; Did Hudson Valley Scenes
description: WOODSTOCK, N.Y., May 14  Stanley W. Crane, a landscape painter, died today here. His age was 67.

title: Pressure in Jersey Fraud Reportedly Laid to Gross
description: NEWARK, May 14A key defendant in the Federal investigation of alleged fraud in the financing of Governor Cahill's 1969 election campaign pleaded guilty to perjury here today, contending through his lawyer that he was subjected to heavy pressure to lie to the grand jury and to cover up the fraud by a former high New Jersey public official.

title: McGlocklin Has Surgery
description: MILWAUKEE, May 14 (UPI) Jon McGlocklin, a Milwaukee Bucks guard, underwent successful operation today for repair of some cartilage in hi: right knee.

title: Bolivian Player Advances In Eastern Men's Tennis
description: WOODBURY, L. I., May 14Topseeded Marcelo de la Serna, who comes from Bolivia; made a belated start in the Eastern men's hardcourt tennis championship today and reached the fourth round at the Woodbury Country Club.

title: 2 Senate Units Act to Bar Funds to Bomb Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Nixon Administration, rebuffed on its Indochina policies by the House last week, was rebuffed further today in the Senate by two moves aimed at cutting off funds for bombing in Cambodia.

title: CELLS CONVERT POWER FROM SUN
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 14The apparatus whose inability to deploy properly has partly disrupted the Skylab space mission Is a solarcell array whose jbb is to convert rays from the sun into deetfieity for the astronauts main quarters in orbit.

title: Dirks Asks Delay in Big Board Action
description: Raymond L. Dirks, the stockmarket analyst who ran into trouble with the New York Stock Exchange for telling his clients about what he had uncovered concerning the insurance fraud at the Equity Funding Corporation of America, officially petitioned the exchange yesterday to postpone its findings in his case until several lawsuits now pending are decided in court.

title: PARISH GRIEVES FOR SLAIN PRIEST
description: All day yesterday the parishioners of St. Bonaventure's Roman Catholic Church went to the redtiled rectory in the St. Alban's section of Queens to share their grief over the murder of their priest, the Rev. John Conlon.

title: F.B.I. Kills Worker Holding Hostage on Fuel Tank
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 14 (UPI)  Federal Bureau of Investigation agents killed a distraught father with a barrage of gunshots today when he began climbing down a ladder on a 40foot fuel tank, where he, had held a hostage at gunpoint for nearly eight hours.

title: Stock Market Plunges
WHITE HOUSE DENIES NIXON FUND ARTICLE
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) The White House described as a total fabrication today newspaper article that said Senate investigators believed President Nixon might have used leftover 1968 campaign funds to buy his California estate.

title: Ft. Dix Drill Sergeant Cleared Of Abusing a Recruit Who Died
description: FORT DIX, N.J., May 14 Staff Sgt. John D. Layton, an Army basic training drill instructor here, was acquitted by a courtmartial today of charges that he had physically and verbally abused a recruit under his command.

title: WRIGHT'S 70 PACES LONG ISLAND OPEN
preparatory Meetings On Troop Cots Begin
description: VIENNA, May 14 (AP)The EastWest talks to arrange for negotiations on a reduction of armed forces in central Europe opened here today with a nineminute Meeting.

title: Drill Sergeant Acquitted Of Abusing Ft. Dix Recruit
description: FORT DIX, N.J., May 14Staff Sgt. John D. Layton, an Army basic training drill instructor here, was acquitted by a courtmartial at noon today of charges that he had physically and verbally abused a recruit under his command.

title: Unlocking Gateway
description: The proposed Gateway National Recreation Area, a series of parks and beaches stretching from Jamaica in Queens to Sandy Hook in New Jersey, will serve the nearly twenty million residents jammed into the most densely populated urban area in the nation. The City of New York, the states of New York and New Jersey, and, the Federal Government have a rare opportunity to preserve these invaluable stretches of shoreline for the enjoyment of future generations.

title: People in Sports: Nova Joins the Riggs Team
description: Round Two of the Sporting Battle of the Sexes.

title: Tales for the Marines
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 People who believe in the system are writing to ask how they can defend it against those who say Watergate proves it failure. The following guide to answering typical questions arising from the Watergate affair should be mastered so that the appropriate answer comes automatically to the tongue.

title: Victim of Robbery Slain In His Flatbush Apartment
description: A 23yearold Brooklyn man was found shot to death in his apartment late last night, the apparent victim of a robbery, the police reported.

title: Cook Testifies Before Senators About S. E. C.'s Inquiry on Vesco
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, G. Bradford Cook, testified under oath for nearly five hours today before a Senate subcommittee about the agency's investigation of Robert L. Vesco, the New Jersey financier.

title: A.E.C. Gets Permission For Underground ABlast
description: DENVER, May 14 (UPI)  A Colorado district judge gave the Atomic Energy Commission permission today to set off an underground nuclear blast in western Colorado on Thursday to free natural gas deposits.Environmentalists had argued that the detonations could poison the drinking water of 27 million Americans.

title: Italian Aide Denies Seeking U.S. Funds For Political Aim
description: ROME, May 14The presiding officer of the Senate, the former Premier Amintore Fanfani, denied today that he had requested secret United States Government funds to sway Italian politics.

title: Humphrey Urges Array Of Campaign Reforms
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., May 14 (UPI)Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Min nesota, outlined some proposals today, including stricter campaign spending laws, that he said could prevent future Watergate scandals in government.

title: A Watergate 'Warren Commision'
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Ambiguities and confusions abound in the discussions of an independent prosecutor in the Watergate case.

title: 30 Stations Sample NewsFilm System
description: About 30 minutes of film of news events, gathered by the supplier's bureaus in New. York, Washington, Chicago and Lo Angeles, and augmented by overseas material supplied Television News by Visnews, Ltd., London, was fed to stations, through telephone company lines.

title: Truce Unit to Study Bombing Charges
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 14 (AP)  The fournation peacekeeping commission voted unanimously today to investigate Communist charges that the United States had resumed bombing in South Vietnam in violation of the ceasefire.

title: Grand Jury Criticizes ExCity Official
EastWest Coach Picked
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 14 (UPI) Charles McLendon of Louisiana State and Bill Yeo man of Houston were named today as head coaches for the 49th Shrine EastWest football game on Dec. 29.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday disclosed plans to intensify efforts to upgrade conditions in the city's 10 worst singleroomoccupancy hotels and the establishment of model socialservice programs in three hotels to provide onthespot health care and counseling.

title: Advertising : Watergate Aspects
description: Advertising, probably because of its visibility and persistence, could be the most criticized facet of American business.

title: Roundup: Red Sox Win on Cepeda Hit
description: Orlando Cepeda, the first man many American League managers thought about when the designatedhitter rule was adopted, proved again last night that he could fill the role. He delivered an 11thinning single to give Boston a 10 victory over the Baltimore Orioles.

title: Theater: Caryl Churchill's Owners
Governor Offers New State Pension Plan
description: ALBANY, May 14  Governor Rockefeller submitted a pension bill to the Legislature today with a hint that unless it was passed most of the 147,000 state employes might go on strike.

title: Policeman's Son Slain
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 14 (AP)The 16yearold son of a Philadelphia policeman was shot and killed early today as he stood on the steps of his home. The police said the shot apparently was fired from a house across the, street, where smallcaliber rifles were found. A youth and a girl were held for questioning.

title: Opera: Bel Canto Group
description: What are the chances of finding a respectable performance of a rarely performed opera in the meeting room of a Manhattan church? Very good, provided you go to the Madison Avenue Baptist Church, at 30 East 31st Street, where a doughty group called the Bel Canto Opera has put on a surprising number of such performances in recent seasons, the most recent being Poulenc's Dialogues of the Carmelites, in English.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
The Day's Developments
description: The wiretap logs: William D. Ruckelshaus, the acting F.B.I. director, reported that a search of a White House safe belonging to John D. Ehrlichman, President Nixon's former chief adviser on domestic affairs, produced the records of 17 wiretaps placed on newsmen and Government officials. during a 21month effort to halt leaks of secret information to the press. Mr. Ruckelshaus said he and an F.B.I. agent found the files last Friday about an hour after the collapse of the Government's Pentagon papers case against Dr. Daniel Ellsberg, who was among those overheard.

title: Fog Over Troop Talks
description: The formal preparatory discussions between NATO and the Warsaw Pact on mutual force reductions in Central Europe is finally under way in Vienna; but the prospects for solid, rapid progress seem dim. Though details of the agreement that broke a fourteenweek impasse have not been announced, it is clear that the West has yielded to the. Soviet Union's refusal to accept full participation by Hungary.

title: Miles York, 71, ExHead Of Marine Underwriters
description: Miles F. York, who retired in 1969 as chairman of the Atlantic Companies (Atlantic Mutual Insurance Company and Centennial Insurance Company died Saturday in Berkeley, Calif. He was 71 years old.

title: 2 Senate Units Act to Bar Funds to Bomb Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Nixon Administration, rebuffed on its Indochina policies by the House last week, was rebuffed further today in the Senate by two moves aimed at cutting off funds for bombing in Cambodia.

title: Cruelty Overlooked
description: To force Tennessee walking horses to pick up their feet more qUickly than is natural and thereby develop a distinctively animated and stylish gait, trainers have Bored their horses by cutting, bruising, blistering otherwise mutilating the animals front legs and feet. Congress tried to ban this hideous practice in 1970 by passing the Horse Protection Act which, makes soring a Federal crime.

title: City Proposes to Upgrade 10 Worst Welfare Hotels
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday disclosed a plan for intensified efforts to upgrade conditions the city's 10 worst singleroomoccupancy hotels and for establishment of model socialservice programs in three hotels to provide onthespot health care and counseling.

title: Mrs. King Challenges Riggs for $10,000
description: ATLANTA, May 14 (AP)Mrs. Billie Jean King arrived from Japan today and immediately challenged Bobby Riggs to a tennis match.

title: Frank Rose, Taxi Leader Who Started as a Driver
description: Frank Rose, vice president and treasurer of the Eden Trans portation System and a leader in the taxicab industry, died Saturday of cancer in Nassau Hospital. He was 48 years old and lived at 62 Tobin Avenue, Great Neck, L.I.

title: Candidates Day
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blu menthal defended public edu cation, legalized abortion an the need for New York City'; communities to survive, as sep arate entities, as he campaigner yesterday for the Democratic nomination for Mayor.

title: South Africa Bends in Dispute With U.N.
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, May 14The Government of South Africa has recently offered concessions in its dispute with the United Nations over the territory of SouthWest Africa, and their scope has surprised, and generally pleased, white moderates and diplomats here.

title: MILLS SEES HOPE FOR TARIFF BILL
description: The chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, Wilbur D. Mills, said yesterday he did not believe that growing opposition in Congress to Presidential powers would have too much effect on the pending bill to give the President broad new authority over tariffs and trade policy.

title: Notes on People
description: President Nixon nominated Kenneth B. Keating, former Ambassador to India, as Ambassador to Israel. The Israeli Government has already reportedly told the United States that the 72year old former Senator would be acceptable. Mr. Keating served in New Delhi for three years before he resigned last summer and campaigned for the reelection of Mr. Nixon.

title: MORDVINOFF, ARTIST AND ILLUSTRATOR, 61
description: Nicolas Mordvinoff, an artist and prizewinning illustrator of children's books, committed suicide on the night of May 5 at his home in Hampton, N. J. He was 61 years old.

title: U.S. ASSAILED IN U.N. FOR RHODESIA TRADE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 14Guinea and Yugoslavia criticized the United States today in the Security Council for permitting the import of chrome and nickel from Rhodesia despite the Council's embargo on trading with that whiteruled county.

title: ROBBERS GET GOODS VALUED AT $30,000
description: Antique jewelry, old gold coins, a shotgun and three rifles valued at from $30,000 to $50,000 were stolen from a store in the Borough Park section of Brooklyn yesterday afternoon.

title: BID TO C.I.A. CITED
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Senator Stuart Symington said today that three highlevel White House aides had been deeply involved in trying to enlist the help of the Central Intelligence Agency in domestic undercover activities other than the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's former psychiatrist.

title: KISSINGER VIEWED SUMMARY OF TAPS
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Henry A. Kissinger confirmed today that ha had seen sum, marks from several wiretaps placed in 1969 and 1970, but said that he had not asked they be installed nor had he specifically approved them in advance.

title: ERIC HAGER DIES; LAWYER WAS 54
description: Eric H. Hager, a senior partnerin the law firm of Shearman & Sterling, 53 Wall Street, died Sunday of a heart attack on a vacation in Bermuda. He was 54 years old and lived in Greenwich, Conn.

title: TAM FUTURES RYAN SHARPLY
Defiance on Cambodia...
description: The nation moved a step closer toward what Senate Majority Leader Mansfield has warned could become a true constitutional crisis when a Senate Appropriations subcommittee yesterday accepted a Houseapproved prohibition on the transfer of funds for bombing in Cambodia. The Administration has already indicated it will ignore such a ban even if it is endorsed by Congress.The admission of an Administration official that the United States is financing the presence of 15,000 20,000 Thai irregular troops in Laos offers another shocking illustration of the Administration's disregard Congress and the Constitution.

title: Cahill Calls Senate Session to Reconsider Coastal Bills
description: TRENTON (AP)  Governo Cahill announced today tha the State Senate would retun here May 21 for a special ses sion to reconsider a sharp': revised package of controver hat coastal protection legisla tion.

title: U.S. Says a Grand Jury May Focus on Ehrlichman
description: C.B.S. News reported last night that John D. Ehrlichman and others whose names have been connected to White House imiestigations of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg will be the subject of a new grand jury investigation expected to open in Los Angeles, according to the Associated Press.

title: Knicks Reap Harvest of Awards
description: A City Hall reception for the whole team and presentation of a sports car to Willis Reed are the remaining orders of business for the New York Knicks today, as the aura of success continued to surround them.

title: Their Strategy: Send Army of Plays
description: Theater Strategy, an organization of 23 of America's leading experimental playwrights, is dedicated to the care, preservation and propagation of playwrights. As the name indicates, the theater also has a militarylike mission. We want to spread our work out, the way one sends an army, says Maria Irene Fornes, president of the group.

title: News Summary and Index
Vietcong Truce Unit Chief Put Back on Military Duty
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 14 (Reuters)  The Vietcong have replaced one of their top fighthig generals as head of their delegation to the Vietnam ceasefire military negotiations in Saigon and assigned him back to duty with military units in the field.

title: Legislature Passes Bill on Development Of the Adirondacks
description: ALBANY, May 14The Senate late today gave final legislative approval to a bill providing for controlled development of 3.7 million acres of privately owned land in the sixmillionacre Adirondack Park.

title: G.O.RFUNDRAISING UNDER U.S. STUDY
description: TRENTON, May 14  The Executive Club of the Republican party of New Jersey, fundraising organization to which at least 149 members of the state's business elite contributed $1,000 each, has come under the scrutiny of state and Federal investigators.

title: MARYLAND IS NO. 1 IN LACROSSE POLL.
Issue and Debate
description: Now important is a fourth major commercial jetport to the economic health of the New York metropolitan area?

title: G.O.P. DELEGATION STILL BACKS NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, May 14While expressing sentiments of disgust and revulsion over the Watergate scandal, Republican members of the New Jersey Congressional delegation say they still support President Nixon and have faith in his ability to lead the nation effectively.

title: DR. LOUIS S. SPECTER
description: WOODMERE, L. I., May 14Dr. Louis S. Specter, a retired cardiologist who had practiced in Brooklyn for half a century, died today at his home, 958 Allen Lane. He was 75 years old.

title: Skylab and Upper Rocket Stage To Be Visible at Dawn or Dusk
description: HOUSTON, May 14Two new moons were injected into orbit around the earth today, and both of them should sooner or laterdepending primarily on weather conditionsbe visible to 90 per cent of the world's inhabitants.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Nicole Ronsard says that cellulite is virtually a household word in Europe. And, indeed, whether it's pronounced selluleet in French, or chellulitay in Italian, it seems to be replacing discussions of the liver as favorite lunch table chitchat.

title: At Coast Theater, the Joy of Repertory
description: SAN FRANCISCO At a time when certain critics are questioning the value of a true repertory system in which a company pedorms several different plays in nightly alternation, San Francisco's American Conservatory Theater is providing a stirring demonstration of how effective and joyous the repertory way of life can be. Within a fourday period at the end of this its seventh year as the city's principal source of professional theater, A.C.T. has presented a sampler of this season's best productions plus a studio performance of a new play in progress, and a staging of Ibsen's Pillars of Society by the advanced students in the A.C.T. school.

title: Sonesta Sues Wellington
description: The Sonesta International Hotels Corporation filed suit here yesterday to enjoin Wellington Associates and its two partners, Sol Goldman and Alex DiLorenzo, from proceeding with a proposed offer to acquire one million Sonesta shares at $7 a share.

title: Her Home Is a Reflection of 80 Memorableand Turbelent Years
description: Mrs. James Augustus Thomas lives surrounded by two centuries of exotic fruits and flowers, a reflection both of her love of gardens and of the happier times of her younger years.

title: Book on Solzhenitsyn Tells of Struggle to Print His Works in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, May 14The first Sovietwritten literary bigg raphy of Aleksandr I. Solzhe nitsyn, the Nobel Prizewinnin novelist, has emerged with inside story of the uneven struggle to publish his work in the Soviet Union. It include charges that some Westen publishers took his books with out proper authority and have not properly used his royalties.

title: Florence Reopens ArtFlld Renaissance Corridor
description: FLORENCE, ItalyThis incomparable city has a new attraction that is exactly 409 years oldthe reopened Vasari corridor, a 3,200foot passageway linking the Uffizi Gallery with the Pitti Palace on the opposite side of the Arno River.

title: New Class of Gold Buyer Helps to Send Volume Up
description: BASEL, Switzerland, May 15 The principal gold dealer of a big Swiss bank described trading today, in which the total again soared to record prices, as among the most active he could remember.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, May 15  The Sacred Heart Grammar School's fencing team held its Trophy Night on May 5 and that program officially marked the end of the season for the sword wielders. But the awards dinner did not conclude the fencing activity for Bill Petrucci.

title: Kissinger, Congress And Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, May 15In his previous negotiations with the North Vietnamese, Henry Kissinger was negotiating from strength, but now, with all U. S. troops and prisoners withdrawn from Vietnam, he is negotiating from weakness.

title: 2 SENATORS DEPLORE IMPEACHMENT TALK
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican publican of New. York, and Senator Abraham Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, both deplored here Monday any talk of impeachment of President Nixon in the wake of the Watergate disclosures, while en dorsing measures to get to the bottom of the matter.

title: Brennan Predicts Success. For Veterans Job Drive
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI) A special government and industry program to find jobs or training for nearly 1.4 million Vietnam War era veterans in the 1973 fiscal year will surpass its target, Labor Secretary Peter J. Brennan said yesterday.

title: Legislature, in an Optimistic Decision,Votes to Adjourn for Year on Friday
description: ALBANY, May 15The Legislature today adopted a resolution to adjourn for the year this Friday, but the realists in the House agreed that, historically, they must ration their patience and laundry to go beyond that date to the traditional torpor of whereases and whereamI's.

title: Personal Income Also Shows Sharp Gain
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 Industrial production and personal income registered strong additional gains in April, Government agencies reported today.

title: The Coach
description: VALLEY FORGE, PaThe Coach was at the peak of his career. The Institution that had summoned him to the helm a few years before was flourishing. He had been sent for largely on the basis of his previous performance as the Assistant Coach, and, since he had left, the Institution had fallen into disrepair. It had incurred defeat after defeat, and an exasperated group of followers had recalled him from civilian pursuits to lead them as their Number One man. But being Number One manin contrast to being Number Two manis a different ball game. On the shoulders of the Chief falls all the responsibility for success or failure. It is a lonely position, experienced by few in this world.

title: Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: STOCKS RECOVER; DOW CLIMBS 7.75
Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Gift Horse
description: Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay have been at swords points for so long that any Rockefeller proposal to help out New York City is naturally bound to be received with considerable initial reserve at City Hall. Warranted as that reserve usually proves, it would not seem to be the right response to the plan just advanced by the Governor for state takeover of public welfare and Medicaid administration. As it is, New York State ranks next to the bottom among states (New Jersey is last) in the amount of assistance it gives localities for meeting welfare needs.

title: Professor Sees a Crisis in Economics
description: Economics is often regarded  especially by economists as the most advanced and successful of the social sciences, the only one that is privileged to confer a Nobel Prize on its star practitioners. So most mono mists shrug off attacks by out siders as illin formed, or possibly jealous.

title: Watson of Princeton Wins First New Jersey Decathlon
description: TRENTON, May 15 Rich Watson of Princeton, placing second or third in nine of 10 events, scored 5,965 points to capture the first New Jersey college decathlon championship at Rider College today.

title: Mayor Picks Kheel To Head the Panel On TrainFare Cuts
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday named the labor lawyer Theodore W. Kheel to head a committee to press for statewide approval of the Mayor's plan to finance mass transportation and reduce subway and commuter fares 30 per cent.

title: Pro Track to Be Televised
description: The International Track Association and the American Broadcasting Company have signed a multiyear contract to present exclusive television coverage of I.T.A. pro meets on the A.B.C. network.

title: 5 Indicted Here in Kidnapping Of Fellow Hasid Over Divorce
description: A 50yearold man's refusal to follow the precepts of Hasidie divorce resulted in his being kidnapped, beaten and detained by five other Hasidic Jews, a Brooklyn grand jury charged yesterday.

title: Ryan Hurls NoHitter
description: Nolan Ryan, the former Met, pitched a nohitter against the Kansas City Roy. als last night as the Califon nia Angels won, 30. He struck out 12 and walke?? three. Details on Page 57

title: Appellate Court Bars a Mall on Madison
description: The Lindsay administration's oftendelayed plan to create a Madison Avenue pedestrian mall was dealt another blow yesterday when an appeals court unanimously upheld a ruling that the city's Transportation Administration did not have the authority to create the mall.

title: Tough Stand Urged By France on Trade
description: BRUSSELS, May 15France told her partners in the European Economic Community today that it must take a strong position in defending its basic principles and interests in world trade talks scheduled to begin in September.

title: Fire Victims Forced by Welfare Strike To Move Into Newark Luxury Motels
description: NEWARK, May 15Twentynine families forced to leave their homes by fires in recent weeks, are living in luxury motels here as a result of a strike by Essex County welfare workers now going into its third week.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: As G.I.'s Fade, SO. Does Help for Vietnam's Orphans
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 15When there were 500,000 American troops in Vietnam, a few of them used to visit the sprawling Go Vap orphanage here every Sunday, to play with the children and bring them a little money and canned meat. It was the orphans one good meal of the week.

title: Skylab Appearing In Sky on Schedule As It orbits Earth
description: HOUSTON, May 15  The Skylab workshop has been appearing on schedule, in its appointed rounds of the earth, observers reported today, with at least five pieces visible from the ground.

title: Woman and Daughter Found Hanged In an Upper Montclair Basement
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, May 15The bodies of a 45yearold woman and her 24yearold pregnant daughter were found hanged in the basement of their 20room house here last evening and the police have tentatively listed them as apparent suicides.

title: Tyler Turns Down Job as Prosecutor in Watergate Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Elliot L. Richardson's first choice to be special prosecutor in the Watergate case turned down the job today, and it seemed likely that it would be at least another day or two before another person would be offered the job.

title: 4 Arab Nations Temporarily Halt Flow of Symbolic Protest
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 15 (Reuters)  Four Arab countries, staging a symbolic protest against Israel's continued existence as a nation, today temporarily halted the flow of oil to the West.

title: 3 KILLINGS DENIED BY A.W.O.L. SOLDIER
description: BUFFALO, May 15 (AP)A soldier absent without leave since Jan. 8 has pleaded not guilty to charges that he raped and murdered a girl.and killed two men over the weekend, on the city's East Side.

title: Market Place: Trading Impact of Institutions
description: There seems to be little question that institutional traders can have an undue impact on the stock market.

title: Books of The Times
description: To a grownup at least, even the most cursory glance will reveal what a literary plum pudding Iona and Peter Opie have made of their The Oxford Book of Children's Verse. There's Chaucer and Lydgate and Bunyon; Robert Herrick and Isaac Watts and Robert Burns. There's Wordsworth Coleridge, Scott, and Keats, Tennyson, Thackeray, Longfellow and Lowell. Through centuries of English literature from medieval times to the present (living authors excluded), the great names of poetry show up: Thomas Dekker, William Blake, Rrobert Browning, Walter de la Mare and T. S. Eliot. And the great names of children's literature, too  from Edward Lear to Kenneth Grahame, from Lewis Carroll to A. A. Milne. And if you recall a favorite poem you were raised onWas it Edward Lear's The Jumbles, or Cecil Frances Alexander's Ali Things Bright and Beautiful, or Rudyard Kiplin's or James Whitcomb Riley's Little Orphant Annie"?chances are it is here among the 332 selections of verses written for children, or with children prominently in mind, which, in the (Vies judgment either were cherished in their own day, or.. have stood the test of time.

title: Text of a Statement on Testimony by Walters
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Following is the text, of a statement by Senator Stuart Symington, acting chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee, on White House links to Central Intelligence Agency actions:

title: THE PATH OF LOVE LEADS MAN TO JAIL
description: WARSAW (UPI)Love broght the head of Warsaw University's publishing section a fiveyear jail  sentence, the Polish news agency, PAP said.

title: Farm Unit Predicts Downward Pressure on Meat Prices From Boycott
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The April meat boycott, whose results disappointed the housewives who led it, will put downward pressure on prices after all, a Department of Agriculture advisory for May has indicated.

title: Candidates'Day
FED SETS NEW RULE ON PUTS AND CALLS
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Federal Reserve Board issued one new rule and proposed another today, both aimed at preventing excessive use ci credit in connection with the market for put or call options on stocks.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Contributions and grants totaling $4.2million to the Associated Y.M.Y.W.H.A.'s of Greater New York were announced last night by. Sidney J. Silberman, president the group.

title: 100 Boots to End CrossCountry March  at Musetun
description: One hundred heavyduty black rubber boots from an ArmyNavy surplus store in San Diego lined up in pairs yesterday under the Brooklyn approach to the Brooklyn Bridge, heading for the brink of the East River.

title: Senate Watergate Panel Votes to Request Immunity for Dean So He Can Testify
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Senate Watergate Committee, scheduled to begin hearings Thursday, moved ahead today with plans to obtain immunity from prosecution for John W. Dean 3d, the deposed White House counsel.

title: South Africa Reserve Bank Said to Weigh Devaluation
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, May 15 (AP)  The South African Reserve Bank is considering revaluing the rand upward against the United States dollar to which it has been pegged since this year's dollar devaluetion, banking sources said. It could be pegged instead to the pound, they suggest

title: Penney's 3Month Profit And Sales Set Records
Advertising:PhilcoFord Shift
description: PhilcoFord will move its account Aug. 13 to Kenyon & Eckhardt, an ad agency for the Ford Motor Company since 1948.

title: BUDGET SQUEEZE TROUBLING NATO
description: BRUSSELS; May 15A single issue has slowly come to dominate activity at the low gray Brussels headquarters of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization: money.

title: Frisco Gets Psoriasis Hub
description: SAN FRANCISCO (UPI)The only Day Care Treatment Center for psoriasis patients in the United States has been opened by the. University of California's Dermatology Service. Paris is the only other known city that has such a center for treatment of the major skin disease, a spokesman for the university said.

title: Governor Asks 100 Judgeships To Implement Narcotics Laws
description: ALBANY, May 15Governor Rockefeller today sent the Legislature a bill to implement his new program for dealing with narcotics traffickers. The bill would permit the creation of 100 new judgeships, the addition of 100 new Criminal Court parts and the expansion of the facilities of the Narcotic Addiction Control Commission and the Department of Correctional Services.

title: J. R, SKIPPER WINS MESSENGER, TRIAL
A Fine HowDoYouDo in Budapest
description: BUDAPEST, May 15Although Hungary has of late been emphasizing relaxed prosperity rather than ideological rigor, more doctrinaire Communists cannot hide their concern over the pervasive spread of kezet csokolom.

title: The Day's Developments
description: The White Rouse Inquiry: White House sources said President Nixon received last year only an informal oral report through his then chief of staff, John D. Ehrlichman, concerning a White House inquiry into the Watergate breakin. Mr. Nixon ordered an investigation shortly after the incident, and Mr. Ehrlichman delegated the task the former White House counsel, John W. Dean 3d, the sources said. They asserted that it was after Mr. Ehrlichman's oral report that Mr. Nixon said last August that Mr. Dean had conducted a complete investigation showbig that no one in his Administration was involved this very bizarre incident.

title: HIGHPROFITFOUND FOR DEFENSE JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Senator William Proxmire released today the names of 131 defense contractors who were found in the fiscal year 1972 to have made excessive profits and who were required eto refund the excess profits to the Government.

title: A SAFER CIGARETTE IS SEEN FOR FUTURE
description: LOUISVILLE (AP)  A less hazardous cigarette should be on the market within five years, says Dr. Frank Rauscher Jr., head of the National Cancer Institute at Bethesda, Md.

title: 20,000 Expected at Fete For the Mentally Retarded
description: The Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn has announced that it will sponsor its annual One to One Festival fr a hopedfor total of 20, 000 mentally retarded children in the Sheep Meadow of Central Park May 3

title: McCrane,ExJersey Treasurer,Indicted
description: TRENTON, May 15Former State Treasurer Joseph M. McCrane Jr. was indicted by the state today on bribery and misconduct charges. He was charged with using the power and influence of his office to have more than $6million in state funds illegally deposited in three New Jersey banks and to have the banks, in turn, and the State Division of Investment purchase more than $6million in securities through Mr. NIcCrane's brother, Kevin.

title: Petition Says Philadelphia Ignores SchoolLunch Order
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 15 (AP) Community Legal Services contends that Philadelphia's public schools have failed to provide free lunches to 12,000 children from lowincome families, as ordered by a Federal judge, and is asking for contempt citations and a fine of $200,000.

title: Army to Release About 10% Of Reserve Officers in Fall
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) A little less than 10 per cent of the Army's reserve officers, will be otified next month that they are being released from active duty.

title: Biaggi Sees Bronx Inquiry As Effort to Kill Candidacy
description: Detectives from the Bronx District Attorney's office pressed their investigation yesterday of thee 1959 shooting incident, in which Mario Biaggi, then a police lieutenant, killed a 23yearold apparent holdup man.

title: Bicentennial Panel Rejects $1.3Billion Plan for Parks
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) The American Revolution Bicentennial Commission killed it bicentennial parks plan today with Government officials voting heavily against spending the money.

title: The Colonies Will Overcome
description: WASHINGTONThere's much talk of what Watergate has done to the President or the Presidencymost of it beside the point, none of it deserving of the handwringing apprehension that commonly accompanies it. The fate of a President is a matter of concern. But the fate of a nation is of more concern; and if we focus too insistently on the Presidency we may learn the wrong lesson.

title: Welfare Strike Forces Fire Victims to Live in Luxury Motels
description: NEWARK, May 15Twentynine families forced to leave their homes by fires in recent weeks, are living in luxury motels here as a result of a strike by Essex County welfare workers now going into its third week.to get these families temporary housing until new quarters could be found and to get them emergency food supplies which no longer exist because the Federal funds are no longer there, Miss Lustig said. We would check losses, rally friends and neighbors to take in those they could and try to help keep the families together and operative.

title: Newsman Seeks Apology From Rhodesia's Leader
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 15 (Agence FrancePresse)Lawyers for Peter Niesewand, formerly a newsman here, have been instructed to seek an apology from Prime Minister Ian D. Smith for remarks he made about Mr. Niesewand yesterday at an election campaign meeting in southeastern Rhodesia.

title: The Watergate Dollar
description: The price of gold roared up to $128.50 in Paris yesterdayan utterly unprecedented leap away from the dollar. Just the day before the gold price had climbed above $100 an ounce for the first time an history.

title: Restrictions Are Appealed In Compensation Inquiry
description: TRENTON, May 15 The State Commission of Investigation went to the Third United States Court of Appeals today for a reversal of a lower court's restriction on its inquiry into alleged abuses of workmen's compensation settlements, but it continued its controversial public hearings without naming its targets.

title: Fed Discloses It Voted to Slow Growth of the Money Supply
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee voted unanimously at its February meet ing to seek slower growth of the nation's money supply and other monetary, aggregates, a summary of the meeting disclosed today.

title: Dr. Eugene Rabinowitch Dies; Manhattan Project Chemist, 71
description: Eugene Rabinowitch, a leader in the development of atomic power and in the worldwide movement for its control, died yesterday at George Washington University Hospital in Washington. He was 71 years old and had suffered a stroke last Friday.

title: Bruce Meets With High Peking Official
description: PEKING, May 15 (Reuters)David K. E. Bruce, head of the new United States liaison mission in China, met today with Deputy Foreign Minister Chiao Kuanhua, who, inf o r me d sources said, urged that the two countries accelerate normalization of their, relations.

title: Defendant in Narcotics Case Is Slain In Jersey
description: A Newark man who was scheduled to go on trial next Monday on a charge of selling heroin was shot to death and a second defendant was wounded early yesterday when they were ambushed outside tavern at Commerce and Market Streets, Newark by a pair of killers who the police said had been hired for $2,000 to do the job.

title: GOLD PRICE RISE AFFECTS SILVER
description: Record prices for gold in Europe and the continued weakrtess of the dollar affected silver prices here once again Yesterday.

title: University to Hear Agnew
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 15 (AP) Vice President Agnew will be the speaker at Drexel University's commencement exercises here June 2. The Vice President will receive an honorary doctorate degree, Drexel officials said today.

title: Fox Film Profit Up; Dividend Declared
description: LOS ANGELES, May 15Almost everything Dennis G. Stanfill, chairman, told stockholders at the annual meeting here today of the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation was good news.

title: REDSKINS OBTAIN OILERS'
description: HOUSTON, May 15 (AP) The Houston Oilers announced today they had traded Ken Houston, an allpro strong safety, to the Washington Redskins for five players.

title: The Dance
description: In this age of moon walks, it was only natural that some dancers would take to the air. No one has grasped better the possibilities of moving and performing above the ground, than the Multigravitational Experiment Group, which has been bobbing and hanging from scaffolding on weekends this month at the Space, 344 West 36th Street.

title: Knicks Take Their Final Bows at City Hall
description: City Hall Plaza, the scene of many notable ceremonies, was jammed yesterday by more than 2,000 cheering fans as the city honored the New York Knicks, champions of the National Basketball Association.

title: Soviet Is Told Security Talk Is Tied to TroopCut Parley
description: VIENNA, May 15 (UPI)The Western allies said today that there must be progress in EastWest troop talks on troop reductions in Vienna if the Soviet Union wants forward movement in Helsinki on preparations for the Moscowsponsored European security conference.

title: Excerpts From Transcript of Ziegler's Regular White House Press Briefing on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Following are excerpts from a transcript of the regular White House press briefing given this morning by Ronald L. Ziegler, President Nixon's press secretary.

title: Fire Delays Times
description: Publication of this issue of The New York Times was delayed last night when an electrical fire in an excavation in front of the Times building at 229 West 43d Street caused a shutoff of power to stereotyping machines. Details, Page 43.

title: Yanks'
description: A light rainfall in the afternoon and a gloomy forecast for last night caused an early postponement of the finale of the twogame series between the New York Yankees and the Detroit Tigers at the Yanke Stadium.

title: A.A.U. Names 10 Wrestlers To U.S. World Cup Squad
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 15 (UPI) Ten athletes were named today by the Amateur Athletic Union to represent the United States in the World Cup of Amateur Wrestling this weekend in. Toledo, Ohio.

title: Tourists Enrich Israel
description: TEL AVIV (AP)Israel made $212.7million from tourism in 1972, an increase of 10 pet cent over the previous year. Tourism is the country's chief source of foreign currency.

title: Business Briefs
description: TULSA, Okla., May 15  The International Business Machines Corporation, the giant makers of computers, decided in 1970 to compete against small manufacturers of peripheral computer equipment rather than do nothing and lose more of the market, Frank T. Cary, I.B.M.'s president and chairman, testified today in Federal court here. He was I.B.M.'s fifteenth witness in the trial of a $1.2billion antitrust suit brought by the Telex Corporation, a Tulsabased marketer of peripheral equipment. The trial is in its 22d day and is expected to end early next month.

title: Records: Ragtime Sound
description: One byproduct of the current ragtime renaissance has been the appearance of instrumental ensembles devoted to arrangements, primarily of rags, that were played by dance orchestras during the ragtime era more than half a century ago.

title: Woman Joins National Guard
description: RALEIGH, N. C. (AP)Mary Jo Ann Miles, 22 years old, has become the first woman to enter the North Carolina Army National Guard in ceremonies attended by her husband, CW2 Vernon Miles, and father, Ralph Campbell. She is joining the medical detachment in Durham.

title: PRESIDENT LINKED TO TAPS ON AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, May 15President Nixon personally authorized the wiretapping of more than a dozen of his subordinates on the National Security Council and in the Pentagon beginning in 1969, reliable sources said today.

title: Potvin and Potvin Join In Defense of Islanders
description: With 347 goals scored against them in 78 games season, the New York Isladers drafted Denis Potyin, considered by many to be the.top player in amateur ranks to shore up their defense and bring them back into National Hockey League respectability.

title: Crusaders of W.H.A. Pick Vivian as General Manager
description: CLEVELAND, May 15 (AP) Jack Vivian, hockey coach at Bowling Green State University, was named general manager of the Cleveland Crusaders of the World Hockey Association today.

title: U.S. TACTIC SCORED AT CAMDEN TRIAL
description: CAMDEN, May 15In summertime following 59 dayg in court, defense lawyers for the Camden 28 asserted today that the Government had gone too far in manufacturing the crime  the defendants were charged with committing.

title: Coalition of 15 PublicEmploye Unions Decries Rockefeller's Bill on Pensions
description: ALBANY, May 15A coalition of 15 publicemploye union denounced Governor Rockefeller's pension hill today and urged the appointment of a new commission to study retirement systems.

title: WomanSues for $100,000 Over Fatty Ground Beef
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 15 (AP)A Portland woman who says she spent $17.50 to have two packages of ground beef analyzed has sued a supermarket chain for $100,719. She contends the ground beef contained too much fat.

title: Volume Is Heavy in TaxExempt Bond Financing
Australian Unions Approve Boycott of All French Goods
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 15  The Australian Council of Trade Unions today approved a ban on the handling of all French goods as a protest against France's planned nuclear tests in the South Pacific.

title: Nuclear Blast Rocks a Colorado Town Before It Occurs
description: MEEKER, Colo., May 15A hard winter has made the White River Valley wetter, greener and more beautiful this spring than usual, and ranchers are driving cattle and sheep north through town to the high summer range. Tomorrow is high school graduation, which willbe followed by the annual exodus of young people to bigger towns and colleges. Thursday,however, will be the biggest day of the year. At 10 A.M., the Atomic Energy Commission and a private company called C.E.R. Geonuclear are to set off a nuclear blast in a creek basin to get at natural gas more than a mile underground. Meeker, 30 miles to the northeast of the site, is the closest town, not counting Rio Blanco, which is a gas stationgeneral store with a zip code.

title: Skylab, Short of Power, Overheating; Further Delay for Astronauts Feared
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 15The crippled Skylab space station, already short of electrical power, developed a new and even more serious problem today when temperatures on board seared to a stifling 110 degrees Fahrenheit.

title: Japan and East Germany Establish Diplomatic Ties
description: TOKYO, May 15 (AP)Japan and East Germany established diplomatic relations today with an exchange of documents in Moscow, the Foreign Ministry announced.

title: I.R.S. SUED ON DENIAL OF CHECKOFF DATA
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) The Institute for Public Interest Representation sued the Internal Revenue Service today to gain access to files on the new $1 checkoff on tax returns for politicalcampaign contributions.

title: Planting of Grains Overcoming Delay Caused by Floods
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Planting of grains is overcoming a late start caused by heavy spring rains and flooding, the Department of Agriculture said today, and there is still time to get enough seed in the ground to produce big crops.

title: Freed From Cambodian Jails; 121 Are Flown Back to Saigon
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 15 (AP)A group of 121 Vietnamese maidents of Cambodia flew hometo Saigon today, free after having spent six months to five years in Phnom Penh jails as political prisoners.

title: Former Magician In Britain Becomes A Successful Artist
description: LONDON (UPI) A man stopped by Chananel Mifalew's table in the sandwich bar which he holds court Sundays to ask whether he knew resembled a magician whose television act was a nationwide talking point a few years ago.

title: Highway Grows in Desert
description: ALGIERS (AP)The governments of Algeria, Mauretania, Mali and, Niger have opened 250 miles of a new highway being built northsouth across the Sahara Desert. Another 420 miles is to be finished by 1980.

title: Lockheed Gets Shuttle Job
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif., May 15 (Reuters)The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation has an nounced that it has been awarded a $42million subcon tract by North American Rockwell to make the external insulation system for the space shuttle.

title: All of a Sudden He Is Noticed; Thomas Ernest (Satch) Sanders
description: His name was seldom on the lips of screaming fans and rarely was there a sign bearing his name over the balcony railing at the Boston Garden. Tom Sanders was always one of the lowest scoring forwards in the National Basketball Association. But the men who played against him would tell you that this 6foot6inch quiet man was for much of his 13season pro career the best defensive forward in the N.B.A. He played on eight championship teams after the Celtics had selected him a surprising No. 1 draft choice from New York University in 1960.

title: Toronto Fights Runway Fog
description: TORONTO (AP)A new instrument landing system for commercial jets at Toronto International Airport will nearly eliminate the need to close runways because of fog, the government said.

title: NIXON'S ESTATE DEBT IS GIVEN AS $630,000
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) The White Hous said today that President Nixon still owed $630,000 on his property in San Clemente, Calif.

title: Bridge: Top Teams Clash in Opening Of Bermuda Bowl Qualifying
description: GUARUJA, Brazil, May 13 The qualifying stage of the world championship that began here tonight seemed likely to be a threeway struggle between the defending champion Aces, the United States and Italy. The draw has produced a firstround clash between the Aces and the Italians, and the results will be a significant pointer to the eventual winner of the 1973 Bermuda Bowl,

title: Soviet Ship in Camden
description: CAMDEN, May 14 (AP)The first Soviet ship to visit here in 25 years sails fors the Soviet Union tomorrow night after a sevenday stay. The 495foot freighter Novemoskovsk took on 5,300 tons of piping for gas lines in the Soviet Union.

title: M.I.T. Given $1Million.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 15of Technology said that a (AP)Massathusetts Institute donor; who asked to remain anonymous, had given the school a S1million gift for its student loan program. M. I. T. said that the money would be paid at a rate of $100,000 year for 10 years and would permit the school to borrow approximately $3million for Its student loan program.

title: Women's Group Began as one day protest 4,215 Days Ago
description: Jan. 27: The accord to end the Vietnam war goes into effect, and the United States withdraws its troops. At home, most American citizens heave a sigh of reliefbut there are some who don't.

title: Women's Lib and Z.P.G.
description: A report on recent Chinese success in moving towards zero population growth (Z.P.G.) contains a possibly significant clue for population planners in other developing countries.

title: BOLIVIA REPORTS DEATH OF PLOTTER
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, May 15The Government announced today that it had uncovered rightwing conspiracy against it within the armed forces and that the leader of the plot had accidentally tumbled down a staircase to his death while trying to escape after arrest.

title: Newsmens Rights Backed
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., May 15 (UPI)  The Illinois house passed yesterday, 10721, a bill that would grant newsmen a qualified right to protect their news sources. Under it, a reporter coud be required to divulge confidential material only if a court found it is necessary in the interests of justice in a felony trial and if all other sources for getting the information had been exhausted.

title: Senators Back Tieman
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI) The 14member Senate Public Works Committee unanimously endorsed today President Nixon's nomination of former Gov. Norbert Tiernan of Nebraska as Federal highway administrator.

title: Stanley Crane, Artist, Dies; Did Hudson Valley Scenes
description: WOODSTOCK, N.Y, May 14  Stanley W. Crane, a landscape painter, died here Monday. His age was 67.

title: IMMUNITY HINTED IN COAST INQUIRY
description: LOS ANGELES, May. 15Local prosecutors are focusing their investigation of the breakin at the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's psychiatrist on John D. Ehrlichman, until recently one of President Nixon's most trusted advisers.

title: New Safeguards Suggested
description: BOSTON, May 15 (AP)  Jerome B. Wiesner, president of Massachusetts Institute of Technology, said yesterday that.a new Bill of Rights might be, needed to protect modern Americans from electronic surveillance.

title: MADISON MALL BARRED BY COURT
description: The Lindsay administration's oftendelaycd plan to create a Madison Avenue pedestrian mall was dealt another blow yesterday when an appeals court unanimously upheld a ruling that the city's Transportation Administration did not have the authority to create the mall.

title: Clinton Trackmen Triumph
description: DeWitt Clinton posted six victories in successfully defending its Bronx Public Schools Athletic League track championship yesterday at Downing Stadium on Randalls Island, The Governors, with 65 points, were paced by Carl McKenzie, who won the 100and 200yard dashes.

title: Public TV Is Dropping Soul Series
description: Soul, the black culture series that is just completing its fifth season on public television, apparently will not be renewed next season by the Corporation for Public Broadcasting.

title: BusinessNot Ideology
description: PARIS  Perhaps the outstanding aspect of next month's NixonBrezhnev colloquy may be the nonnalization and expansion of trade contacts between the United States and Russia. The word normalization takes precedence over expansion for two reasons.

title: The Nixon Commission
description: President Nixon has moved rather swiftly from insisting that no one in his Administration was involved the Watergate scandals to asserting that people in both parties have always engaged in such scandalous behavior. As part of his effort to diffuse the responsibility as broadly as possible, Mr. Nixon now plans to urge Congress to establish a commission to study campaign ethics, political finance, Electoral College reform, and various related topics and to report back in nine months.

title: Lindsay's School Budget Termed Hold the Line
description: Mayor Lindsay's proposed Allocation of $2,483million for the city schools for 197374an increase of $363million, or 17.1 per cent, over the current year  was. described yesterday by Board of Education officials as basically a holdtheline budget".

title: Black Protests Mounting in South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, May 15  The sound of black, protest. In whiteruled South Africa has grown louder and more persistent in recent days, as traditional. African leaders condemn the racial system they Were. expected help

title: DOLLAR UP HERE,
description: The United States dollar rallied ,sharply in the New York foreignexchange market yesterday afternoon, after taking a heavy battering earlier in the day in other world financial markets.

title: HAROLD: C. LUTHER
description: ALBANY, May 15 (UPI)Assemblyman Harold C. Luther, Republican of bolgeville, died today in Albany Medical Center, apparently. of a heart attack.

title: Stock Prices Rebound
description: The stock market turned around yesterday after opening sharply lower and closed with the DowJones industrial average at 917.44, a gain of 7.75. In the first halfhour the average was below the 900 level for the first time in more than a year. The recovery followed Washington reports showing there was no sign the economic boom was slowing. Details, Page 65.

title: DR OS AIDE OF MASARYK
description: Dr. Oskar Klinger, personal physician of the Czechoslovak Foreign.Minister, Jan Masaryk, at the time of his mysterious death in Prague in March, 1948, died Monday at, this home, 40 East 89th Street. He was 75 years old. Dr. Klinger came to the United States later in 1948 and engaged in private practice.

title: SIX ARE FOUND SLAIN ON A GEORGIA FARM
description: REYNOLDSVILLE, Ga., May 15 (AP)  Six members of a farm family were found slain today five men in a house trailer on their farm and the wife of one of them in a field about six miles away.

title: Postal Bill Balked
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) A bill to change the method of financing the Postal Service ran into stiff opposition today in the House Rules Committee, which voted 6 to 5 against clearing it for House consideration tomorrow after listening to complaints about the postal delivery service. The committee may reconsider its action at a later meeting.

title: Burger Bids Critics of Screening Court Propose
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Chief Justice Warren E. Burger challenged today critics of the proposal for a new Federal screening court, including his predecessor, to come forward with some other way of handling the Supreme Court's steadily increasing work load.

title: GUILT IS ADMITTED IN 2 BANK THEFTS
description: WATERBURY, Conn., May 15 (AP)Stephen M. McDonough, 23 years old, of Farmington, accused of bank robbery, wounding a Massachusetts state trooper and the stabbing death of a Rhode Island man, pleaded guilty in United States. District Court today to charges that he robbed two Connecticut banks in 1971.

title: Undesirable Level Of Lead Is Found In Baby Food Cans
description: The New York State Health Department said yesterday It had found undesirable levels of lead in a variety of baby juices and other foods packaged in leadsoldered cans.

title: May 110 Car Sales Top 72 by 11.9% for Record
Sports News Briefs
description: MEMPHIS, May 15 (UPI)Memphis State's basketball coed, Gene Bartow, who took the Tigers to the finals of the National Collegiate tournament this year, confirmed today he would take a team of American players to the People's Republic of China next month. The United States Collegiate Sports Council is coordinating the eightgame trip far the State Department.

title: Selection of Jury Begins Upstate in LoanShark Case
description: AUBURN, N.Y., May 15 (AP)  The selection of a jury, began today in United States District Court for the trial of Albert J. Marrone, of Utica, the last remaining defendant in loan sharkextortion case.

title: Callaway Is Sworn In as Secretary of Army
description: Howard H. Callaway was sworn in as Secretary of the Army, replacing Robert F. Froehlke, who resigned to return to his insurance business. The 46yearold Mr. Callaway is a former United States Representative from Georgia, a veteran of the Korean conflict and a West Point graduate. Among the matters Mr. Calloway may have to deal with is the case of Lieut. William L. Calley Jr., convicted of mass killings at the South Vietnamese hamlet of Mylal. A request for reduction to 17 years of Calley's 20year sentence was rejected by Mr. Froehlke on his last day in office. Calley's lawyer said he would now repeat the appeal to Mr. Cal

title: Elderly Blind Sew Dresses, Then Reap Applause
description: YONKERS  In Paris, at Christian Dior's, there is an air of barely repressed panic before each fashion showing. But you should have seen the nervousness in Yonkers at the Jewish Guild Home for the Aged Blind.

title: Owls Losing Out in Homes
description: DALLAS, (AP)  Owls are losing their favored position as the inspiration for home decorative items, according to buyer orders placed at the spring gift show at the Dallas Market Center. One designermanufacturer said that anything seaoriented, such as turtles, fish and pelicans, were the hot items.

title: HOUSE DELAYS VOTE ON DEVALUATION BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (Reuters)A vote by the House of Representatives on a bill to devalue the United States dollar by 10 per cent, which was scheduled for tomorrow, has been delayed for at least a week, House Democratic leader Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., of Massachusetts announced today.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
SOME LEADS FOUND IN PRIEST'S SLAYING
description: As more than a score of detectives continued yesterday to look for clues in the slaying Sunday night of a priest in the basement of a Queens church rectory, several promising leads were reported uncovered.

title: Cub Scoutmaster Accused Of Molesting Boy in Pack
description: A parents'complaint that their 8yearold son had been sexually molested resulted yesterday in the arraignment of 40yearold. Cub Scout leader in Criminal Court on eight charges of sodomy involving boys in his Pack.

title: RENT CONTROL LAW ON COAST IS UPSET
description: BERKELEY, Calif., May 15A citywide rent freeze ended here today when Alameda County Court Judge Robert L. Bostick ruled unconstitutional rent control law passed by Berkeley voters last year.

title: Smith Vaults 17.9, Equal to Year's Best
description: IRVINE, Calif., May 15 (AP)Steve Smith soared 17 feet 9 inches in a special pole vault competition today matching his 1973 world best. Vaulting for the Pacific Coast Club, he cleared the height on his third try.

title: Pet's 12Month Net Down After Extraordinary Item
description: Earnings of Pet, Inc., in the fiscal year ended March 31 declined to $9.6million, or $1.24 a share, from the yearearlier $16.9million, or $2.42 a share, the St. Louisbased dairy and food producer reported yesterday. Sales increased to $768.7million from $721.3million.

title: Roadsters and Other Dinosaurs
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 15In 1911 Ray Harroun won the first Indianapolis 500 with an average speed of 74.59 miles an hour in a Marmon Wasp. He dispensed with the customary riding mechanic, whose functions included keeping an eye on the whereabouts of the opposition, by using a rearview mirror.
