Immediately afterward the rules makers prohibited the mirror and made the riding mechanic mandatory, thereby starting the Indy tradition of harassing innovators who win or threaten to win races.

title: ExAide of Mine Union Asks Delay in His Murder Trial
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 15 (UPI)Albert E. Pass, a former United Mine Workers official scheduled to stand trial next month in the Yablonski murders, has asked the Federal appeals court to delay the trial.

title: W. H. CULBERTSON, 70, INVESTMENT BANKER
description: KENT, Conn May 15William Howard Culbertson, who retired in 1966 as executive vice president of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, died of a heart attack today at his home here. He. was 70 years old.

title: Substitute Teacher Seized in East Side Rapes
description: A 28yearold substitute teacher in the city school system was ordered to Bellevue Hospital yesterday for psychiatric observation after allegedly telling detectives he had committed 25 rapes on Manhattan's East Side.

title: GOVERNOR RAISING FUND FOR HOGAN
description: In a rare move, Governor Rockefeller, a Republican, has intervened In the Democratic primary fight for Manhattan District Attorney by raising funds for the incumbent, Frank S. Hogan.

title: Tonna Knocks Out Hanna
description: PARIS, May 15 (AP)  Gratien Tonna of France knocked out Tommy Hanna of Detroit tonight in the fourth round of scheduled 10round middleweight bout at Palais des :Sports.

title: Concert
description: Bernard Goldberg sat down in the principal flutist's chair of the Cleveland Orchestra at the age of 21 and has been in the front row of performers on his instrument ever since during the last 26 years as principal flutist of the Pittsburgh Symphony. So it was no surprise to hear him give an impressive display of his craf,t at Carnegie Recital Hall on Monday night. Dazzling fluency, varied tone colors, pinpoint pitchMr. Goldberg had all the good qualities one hopes to find in a flutist.

title: Gold Jewelry Prices Reflect Uncertainty as Costs Increase
description: The price of gold jewelry, you ask? We don't know what quotes to give our customers. Everything is going through the roof.

title: Custodial Workers Strike Curbs Schools in Detroit
description: DETROIT, May 15 (UPI)A strike by 2,600 public school custodial and service workers won support, today from about one third of the system's 10,500 teachers. Thousands of the city's 285,000 pupils were turned away when teachers I refused to cross picket lines.

title: DOLLAR UP HERE, DECLINES ABROAD
description: The United States dollar rallied sharply in the New York foreignexchange market yesterday afternoon, after taking a heavy battering earlier in the day in other world financial markets.

title: Japanese Smoking More
description: TOKYO (AP)The Japanese consumed a record 1,050,100million yen ($3.477.2 million) worth of cigarettes in 1972, an increase of 10 per cent over the previous year, the Japan Monopoly Corporation announced.

title: Stock Prices Rebound
description: The stock market turned around yesterday after opening sharply lower and closed with the DowJones industrial average at 917.44, a gain of 7.75. In the first halfhour the average was below the 900 level for the first time in more than a year. The recovery followed Washington reports showing there was no sign the economic boom was slowing. Details, Page 65.

title: Congressional Inquiry on Skylab Asked
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 Senator James S. Abourezk, Democrat of South Dakota, called today for a fullscale Congressional investigation of the malfunctioning of the Skylab space station.

title: Justice Rinaldi and a Publisher Sue The Village Voice
description: Two persons who said they had been linked to the Mafia by The Village Voice have filed separate libel suits against the Greenwich Village weekly, asking for a total of $10million.

title: Fire Delays Times
description: Publication of this issue of The New York Times was delayed last night when an electrical fire in an excavation in front of the Times building at 229 West 43d Street caused a shutoff of power to stereotyping machines. Details, Page 43.

title: Basketball Transactiozis
description: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION

title: Honolulu Mayor Charged
description: HONOLULU, May 15 (UPI)Mayor Frank F. Fasi of Honolulu has been ordered to appear in court Friday in connection with charges that his campaign committee failed to report 12 contributions of $500 or more  in violation of state law during his reelection campaign last year. Misdemeanor charges were filed last Friday by Hawaii's Attorney General against the campaign committee, Good Guys for Fasi.

title: Eisenhowers Move In
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) David and Julie Eisenhower, soninlaw and daughter of the President, have taken up residence in their rented home in nearby Bethesda, Md., the White House said today. The young couple moved in Friday night. The $125,000 home belongs to a close friend of the Nixon family, C. G. Rebozo, of Florida. But on their first weekend, the Eisenhowers went to Camp David to be with President and Mrs. Nixon.

title: Stage: Great Hoss Pistol
Proceedings in the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: McCrane,ExJerseyTreasurer,Indicted
description: TRENTON, May 15Former State Treasurer Joseph M. McCrane Jr. was indicted by the state today on bribery and misconduct charges. He was charged with using the power and influence of his office to have more than $6million in state funds illegally deposited in three New Jersey banks and to have the banks, in turn, and the State Division of Investment purchase more than $6million in securities through Mr. McCrane's brother, Kevin.

title: NIXON SUGGESTS ONE 6YEAR TERM FOR A PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 15President Nixon, responding to demands, for election reforms as a result of the Watergate scandal, told Congressional leaders today that a single sixyear term in the White House should be given serious consideration.

title: Senate Panel Votes, 240, To Bar Cambodian Raids
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 The Senate Appropriations Committee, in a further Congressional rebuff to President Nixon's Indochina policies, voted 24 to 0 today to cut off all funds for bombing in Cambodia,

title: Monday's Fights
description: PhiladelphiaMiquel Baretto, 144 pounds, Puerto Rico, drew with Al Hayman,. 147, Philadelphia, 10 rounds; Perry Abner, 158, Phila delphia, knocked out Nick Peoples, 153, Columbus, Ohio, 1 round.

title: Reed, Receiving Award, Says Frazier Deserves It
description: Willis Reed received a 1973 Dodge Charger from Sport magazine yesterday as the most valuable player of the National Basketball Association's championship playoff series. His 11 teammates on the New York Knicks, Coach Red Holzman and Danny Whelan, the team trainer, were honored, too.

title: COMPANY REPORTS
description: Firstquarter earnings of MCA, Inc., increased 19 per cent on a revenue gain of 6 per cent, it was reported yesterday by the film producer, operator of savings and loan associations and tape recording manufacturer.

title: Letters to the Editor The Vesco Affair: A Blow to the S.E.C.
description: To the Editor:

title: Senate Panel Votes, 240, To Bar Cambodian Raids
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Senate Appropriations Committee, in a further Congressional rebuff to President Nixon's Indochina policies, voted 24 to 0 today to cut off all funds for bombing in Cambodia.

title: Sioux Divided About U.S.Indian Negotiations at Wounded Knee
description: KYLE, S.D., May 15An arbor of ash logs covered with pine boughs is near completion,) food stocked at the home of Frank Fools Crow, one of the with the Federal negotiators this Thursday.

title: Exxon to Raise U.S.Refining Capacity
description: The Exxon Corporation, the world's largest oil company, announced yesterday plans to increase its Atherican refining capacity by 350,000 barrels a day.

title: Head of U.S. Service Agency Seeks to Broaden Its Base
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)Michael P. Balzano Jr., director of the Federal volunteer service agency called Action, announced new goals today aimed at using VISTA and the Government's other volunteer programs to step up community efforts to solve poverty and social problems.

title: AIDES SAY REPORT TO NIXON ABSOLVING HIS STAFF CAME
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The only report that President Nixon received last year on possible staff involvement in the Watergate breakin was an informal oral report from John D. Ehrlichman, senior White House officials reported today.

title: Dance: Stuttgart Ballet at the Met
Narcotics Defendant Is Slain in Ambush
description: A Newark man who was scheduled to go on trial next Monday on a charge of selling heroin was shot to death and a second defendant was wounded early yesterday when they were ambushed outside a tavern at Commerce and Market Streets, Newark by a pair of killers who the police said had been hired for $2,000 to do the job.

title: 2 Women Found Hanged In Their Home in Jersey
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, May 15 The bodies of a 45yearold woman and her 24yearold pregnant daughter were found banged in the basement of their 20room house here last evening and the police hate tentatively listed them as apparent suicides.

title: Talks on Strategic Arms Are Continued in Geneva
description: GENEVA, May 15The second phase of the talks between the United States and the Soviet Union on limiting stretegic arms was continued here today when the chief negotiators met for 80 minutes.

title: Upturn in U. S. Fertility Rate Forecast
description: BETHESDA, Md., May 15There will probably be an upturn in the American fertility rate later in this decade, the deputy director of the National Institute of Health's Center for Population. Research said today.

title: Football Transactions
description: BUFFALOSigned Bob Kamoa, California de. fensive tackle, second round draft choice. HOUSTONTraded Ken Houston, strong safety, to Washington for Jim Snowden, offensive tackle; Mac Alston, tight end; Mike Fanucci, defensive end; Jeff Severson, safety, and Clifton McNeil, wide re. ceiver. Claimed on waivers Gus Hollomon, safety, ROM New York Jets.

title: Independent Gasoline Dealers Ask Legislature to Assure Supplies Before They're Forced Out
description: ALBANY, May 15Independent gasoline dealers told a. legislative hearing here today! that major oil companies were systematically choking off their supplies in an effort to stifle competition and that they would be out of business unless a law was enacted soon to assure supplies.

title: PEREZ'S 2 HOMERS SINK DODGERS, 41
description: CINCINNATI, May 15 (AP)Tony Perez slugged a pair of home runs and accounted for all of Cincinnati's runs tonight as the Reds downed the Los Angeles Dodgers, 41.

title: How an Overweight 15YearOld Found Happiness on a Movie Set
description: A year ago P. J. Johnson was a plump Houston schoolgirl who liked to dance up a storm to rock music in her home after school. It was her only theatrical experience, she says.

title: NIXON SUGGESTS ONE 6YEAR TERM FOR A PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 15President Nixon, responding to demands for election reforms as a result of the Watergate scandal, told Congressional leaders today that a single sixyear term in the White House should be given serious consideration.

title: Texan Finds It Pays To Act Like Gentleman
description: HOUSTON (AP)  When the winner of a $100 door prize was announced at a meeting here, Don Welch consulted his ticket and snapped his fingers in chagrin.

title: Cahill Campaign Chief Says Watergate Is Making FundRaising Effort Difficult
description: TRENTON, May 16Officials for Governor Cahill's primary election campaign said today the Watergate scandal and tough, new disclosure laws were making fundraising difficult.

title: Baseball Injury Kills Youth
description: ROCHESTER, N.Y,, May 15 (UPI)  Keith Van Goren, 12 years old, of suburban Webster died in Rochester General Hospital today of injuries apparently received when hit in the head by a baseball. Van Goren and a friend were playing catch in his yard May 7 when he slipped while attempting to catch the ball. It struck him in the head as he was falling.

title: Currency Ills Hurt Payments
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 Two measures of the nation's balance of international payments worsened drastically in the first quarter of this year as a result of the currency turmoil during the period, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Dwain Tied to Plea to C.LA. To Help Watergate Group
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The deputy director of Central Intelligence was quoted today as saying that John W. Dean 3d, the ousted White House counsel, asked the agency last year to help cover up the Watergate case by paying bail and salaries for the men involved.

title: CHURCH AIDE SLAIN IN FLATBUSH HOME
description: Detectives yesterday searched for clues to an unknown assailant who had bound and shot death a young man who was director of a youth program at it Brooklyn church.

title: Skylab in Trouble
description: Unexpected technical mishaps are, regrettably, not exactly a novelty in the space program. It is still not so long ago that the explosion aboard the moonbound Apollo 13 imperiled the lives of its three astronaut passengers and forced abandonment of their lunarlanding plans in order to return the men safely to earth.

title: U.A.W. Voting Eased
description: DETROIT, May 15 (AP)The Chevrolet Division of General Motors Corporation will permit the United Auto Workers to hold local elections on company property to allow larger numbers of employes to participate in the selection of their union representatives. The division, which employs 100,000 union members at 24 plants, reversed yesterday the company policy of insisting that elections take place on union property.

title: Presbyterian Group Gathers, With Unity To Be a Key Topic
description: OMAHA, May 15The 185th general assembly of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. opened here today with union among 1,500 Protestant churches expected to be a key topic.

title: Two on Homemade Raft Drown in Rhode Island
description: HOPE VALLEY, R.I., May 15 (AP)  Two Hope Valley children drowned yesterday in Locustville Pond after a homemade raft capsized, but a third youngster was rescued.

title: Excerpts From Mayor Lindsay's Annual Report and Expense Budge Message
COUNT VITETTI DIES; DELEGATE TO U.N., 78
description: Count Leonardo Vitetti, Italian representative to the United Nations from 1956 to 1958, died Monday in Rome. He was 78 years old.

title: Baseball Transactions NATIONAL LEAGUE
description: SAN FRANCISCORecalled Charlie Williams, righthanded pitcher, from Phoenix of the Pacific Coast League.

title: REDSKINS OBTAIN OILERS'
description: HOUSTON, May 15 (AP)The Houston Oilers announced today they had traded Ken Houston, an allpro strong safety, to the Washington Redskins for five players.

title: Smith and Laver Upset; Ailing Aussie Will Rest
BabySale Case Is Put Off; Need for Witnesses Cited
description: Because no witnesses to the incident had come forward, a State Supreme Court Justice yesterday reluctantly released a man accused of attempting to sell his 3monthold baby on a subway train last month.

title: CITY ACTS TO BAR STATE CRIME BILE
description: The Lindsay administration is attempting to block the passage in Albany of a bill it feels would empower the state, rather than the city, to determine how Federal anticrime funds are spent in New York City.

title: Disqualified Filly Sets a Record
description: In the clubhouse after the fifth race at Belmont Park yesterday, a group of $100 bettors stood around cursing the stewards.

title: OUR NATIVE JOINS PREAKNESS FIELD
description: BALTIMORE, May 15The probable field for the 98th running of the $150,000 added Preakness at Pimlico Race Course Saturday increased to seven today with the addition of Our Native, who finished third in the Kentucky Derby, and two long shots, The Lark Twist and Deadly Dream.

title: ABORTION RULES REVISED BY CITE
description: The city's Board of Health yesterday scrapped Its regulations governing early abortions and replaced them with a series of guidelines that, while Incorporating the main provisions of the regulations, lack the force of law.

title: Equity Financing
description: A subsidiary of Corning Glass Works, SIgnelles Corporation, yesterday announced an initial offering, steduled to be managed by Litman Brothers, of 715,000 common shares is being postponed. The announcement cited current stock market conditions.

title: Hockey Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: Directors and Top Officers Are Named at Rheingold
description: A new slate of nine directors was elected by the shareholders of the Rheingold Cot,poration yesterday at a special Meeting and immediately named a new roster of management officers. The team had been proposed by Pepsico, Inc., which acquired 82 per cent of Rheingold in November, 1972.

title: Texan Gets 10,000 Years As Sentence for Murder
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., May 15 (UPI)District Judge Archie S. Brown sentenced Eugene Spencer Jr., yesterday to 10,000 years in the penitentiary on his conviction of murdering a police officer.

title: Bill to revamp Tax Body Gains at Council Hearing
description: Two bills designed to reform the City Tax Commission and its method of setting realestate tax assessments met with a favorable reception yesterday at a brief hearing before a City'Council committee.

title: Dean Tied to Pleato C.I.A. To Help Watergate Group
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The deputy director of Central Intelligence was quoted today as saying that John W. Dean 3d, the ousted White House counsel, asked the agency) last year to help: cover up the Watergate case by paying bail and salaries for the men involved.

title: People in Sports: Mays to Play Waiting Game for Two Weeks
description: Willie Mays dropped by Shea Stadium yesterday to pick up some mail. He wore a purple plaid suit, black leather boots, white shirt and black tie, Diamonds glistene,d from the fingers of both hands, and his tie clip shone with blinding stones. He also had something to say:

title: Cubs Topple Mets, 43; First Loss for Koosman
Garrido Ousts McDermott, Gains Tennis Quarterfinals
description: WOODBURY, LI., May 15Fourthseeded Reynaldo Garrido, teaching professional at the Woodbury Racquet Club, defeated Ron McDermott of Newburgh, N. Y., 60, 64, to lead the field into the quarterfinals of the Eastern men's hard court tennis championships as rain forced matches indoors at the Woodbury Country Club today.

title: ELECTRICAL BLAZE DELAYS TIE TIMES
description: A stubborn electrical fire that broke out last night in a 12footdeep excavation outside the entrance of The New York Times building at 229 West 43d Street caused a delay of about three hours in the publication of this issue.

title: Minimum Wage Rise Gains
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UM}The House Labor Committee approved today a bill to raise the $1.60anhour minimum wage to $2.20 in one year. It also proposed a tax credit of up to $480 a year for persons employing household domestics. The panel, on a 2313 vote, approved the wage measure that Democrats tailored to blunt Southern opposition.that helped defeat a similar wage bill last year.

title: TV: Last of America Series and Women of Year
description: On the 13th and final episode of America, shown last night at 10 on the National Broadcasting Company network, Alistair Cooke concluded, with inevitable tentativeness, that he doesn't believe the country is going to sit back and let the worst happen. It's probably all a question of relativity, of course, but the worst came perilously close to happening Monday night with an hourlong special called Women of the Year, 1973.

title: ISLANDERS MAKE POTVIN TOP PICK
WHITE HOUSE DENIES NIXON FUND ARTICLE
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) The White House described as a total fabrication yesterday a newspaper article that said Senate investigators believedPresident Nixon might have used leftover 1968 campaign funds to buy his California estate.

title: Sanders Is Named Coach at Harvard
description: Tom (Satch) Sanders, a forward with the Boston Celtics for 13 seasons, was named,yesterday  as head basketball coach at Harvard University.

title: PRESIDENT LINKED TO TAPS ON AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, May 15President Nixon personally authorized the wiretapping of more than a dozen of his subordinates on the National Security Council and in the Pentagon beginning in 1969, reliable sources said today.

title: BRITISH SOCCER
description: England 3, Wales 0.

title: Maryland Lottery Begins
description: BALTIMORE, May 15 (UPI) Thousands of persons began buying lottery tickets today, as Maryland became the eighth state to operate a lottery. A $50,000 weekly payoff and an eventual, $1million jackpot are being offered. The first drawing will be held May 24.

title: MountainClimbers Leave Mountains Of Trash on Peaks
description: WASHINGTON (UPI) Thirty years or so ago a party of amateur mountainclimbers arrived gasping at the top of Colorado's 14,256foot Longs Peak.

title: City Center Sets Plans for 30th Jubilee
description: The City Center of Music and Drama announced yesterday plans for its 30th anniversary celebration this falla celebration coupled with fundraising drive for $400,000 to help defray a $2million deficit.

title: Bus Driver's Honesty Earns $2,500 Reward
description: CHICAGO (AP)John Craddick, a 24yearold Vietnam war veteran, has a job as a bus driver.

title: A Close Aide of Tito Emerges As Fatigue Slows the Marshal
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 15After nearly three decades of strong, centralized leadership under President Titowho will be 81 years old this month a quiet process is under way in Yugoslavia to transfer the burdens and duties of power to a younger generation.

title: Old Masters Drawings at the Morgan
description: The exhibition of Drawings from the Collection of Lore and Rudolf Heinemann, which has now come to the Pierpont Morgan Library, 29 East 36th Street, is both a Wonderful event in itself and wonderful in what it promises. For this is one of the finest privately, held collections of Old Master drawings in the world, and the Heinemanns have now let it be Itnown that a substantial part of the collection will be left to the library in their Will. No precise figures or examples have been indicated.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: It was fascinating how they got out, Sheriff Ralph Oriscello said of three prisoners who escaped from the Union County jail.

title: Roadsters and Other Dinosaurs
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 15In 1911 Ray Harroun won the first Indianapolis 500 with an average speed of 74.59 miles an hour in a Marmon Wasp. He dispensed with the customary riding mechanic, whose functions included keeping an eye on the whereabouts of the opposition, by using a rearview mirror. Immediately afterward the rules makers prohibited the mirror and made the riding mechanic mandatory, thereby starting the Indy tradition of harassing innovators who win or threat

title: Red Smith
description: In tennis, Bobby Riggs beat the pantyhose off Margaret Court, proving to his own satisfaction that at 55 he could still do all right in the Virginia Slims women's tournament. Riggs has been challenged by Billie Jean King and a Florida promoter says he will offer $30,000 for a match between Riggs and Chrissie Evert, Lou Nova, who was knocked out by Joe Louis 32 years ago after learning the Dynamic Stance and Cosmic Punch from a guru named Oom the Omnipotent, says he'll fight any woman in the world for $100,000. The male hierarchy of Little League at national headquarters in Williamsport, Pa., is embroiled in a war to the death with Carolyn King, a 12yearold center field in Ypsilanti, Mich. Supported by a court ruling, an umpire named Mrs. Bernice Gera worked one game in the New YorkPenn League and retired in tears. Chances are Secretariat, the colt, could whip the champion filly, La Prevoyante. And Brian Oldfield, a 270pound shotputter with blond curls, regularly outruns Wyomia Tyus, holder of world records at 50, 60, 70 and 100 yards and 100 meters. Ah, there, Gloria Steinem; stay as sweet as you are, Betty Friedan.

title: Bonn Said to Smash Scheme to Disrupt Visit by Brezhnev
description: BONN, May 15 (UPI)The police raided the homes of leftwing radicals in several cities today to smash an alleged effort by extremists to disrupt the forthcoming visit of the Soviet Communist party chief, Leonid I. Brezhnev police sources said.

title: Drivers Die as School Bus And Truck Collide Head On
description: FRESNO, Calif., May 15 (AP)  A bus carrying 32 school children home from a field trip crashed head on with a pickup truck and burst into flames, killing bat drivers, the California Highway Patrol said.

title: People and Business
description: The two independent candidates for membership on the board of the New York Stock Exchange have been overwhelmingly defeated, the exchange announced yesterday. All 10 public and industry directors on the board's slate were elected, including three new officers  Harold W. Carhart, general partner of Carlisle DeCoppet & Co.; Fred G. Fusee, vice chairman of Avon Products, and Thomas E. O'Hara; chairman of the National Association of Investment Clubs.

title: LYNDALL CARTER, 70, CHILDREN'S CLOTHIER
description: NEEDHAM HEIGHTS, Mass., May 15  Lyndall F. Carter, chairman of the William Carter Company, children's wear manufacturers named for his grandfather who founded it here in 1865, died yesterday in Waltham Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived in Weston.

title: British Births at Record Low
description: LONDON (AP)The government reported that there were 2,924 more deaths than births in Britain, the first six weeks of this year, and the number of births was a reocrd low. There were 23,337 births and 86,261 deaths.

title: Iceland Attempts to Board Ship in Dispute With Britain
description: LONDON, May 15 (Reuters)  An Icelandic patrol boat made an unsuccessful attempt last night to board a British trawler operating inside the 50mile fishing limit that Iceland claims, a Foreign Office spokesman said today.

title: Airlines Moving to Cancel Student Fares to Europe
description: International airlines moved yesterday to cancel cutrate student fares to Europe, move that could disrupt vacation plans for thousands of under30 travelers this summer.

title: Watergate Property Value Is Assessed at $33Million
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 (AP) The Watergate commercial and apartment complex, which is becoming as wellknown as the national monuments here because of the breakin last June 17, is Washington's most valuable piece of taxable commercial property, according to assessment records.

title: Basketball Transactions NATIONAL ASSOCIATION
description: PHOENIXSigned Mike Bantam, St. Joseph's (Pa.) forward, to multlyear contract,

title: VENDERS PROTEST ITALY'S SMUT LAW
description: ROME, May 15A nationwide shutdown of newsstands in protest against Italy's pornography laws left the entire country without newspapers and magazines all day.

title: Woman Sues for $100,000 Over Fatty Ground Beef
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 15 (AP)A Portland woman who says she spent $17.50 to have two packages of ground beef analyzed has sued a supermarket chain for $100,719. She contends the ground beef contained too much fat.

title: Smith Admits Marijuana Sale
description: NORMAN, Okla., May 15 (AP)Fountain Smith Jr., an Oklahoma State University running back, pleaded guilty today to a charge of selling marijuana to an undercover agent. District Court Judge Elwin Brown called for a probation report before he imposes sentence.

title: U.S. Presses Dowdy Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UFI)The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court today to reinstate the bribery and conspiracy conviction of former Representative John Dowdy, Democrat of Texas: The former chairman of the House District Education Subcommittee now stands convicted of perjury. He was sentenced to six months in jail and fined $3,000 on that charge. But the United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit reversed a briberyconspiracy conviction on which he was originally sentenced to 12 more months in prison and an additional $22,000 fine.

title: Museum Gets Ancient Scroll
description: DALLAS (AP)  The Dallas Museum of Fine Arts has acquired for its rapidly expanding Japanese gallery a hanging scroll by an 18thcentury Japanese artist, Nagasawa Rosetsu. The scroll, which is 8feet long, shows the head, front paws and tail of a tiger.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NOTES AT NOON The Orchestra of the City of New York came into being only last year, during which it had two successful short seasons, one in spring, one in winter, of four free concerts each at St. Thomas Church. Well, the orchestra is back with us for a new season that is twice as long as either of the others.

title: POLICE HERE USE TRAFFIC TRAILER
description: For the next six months at least, a trailer will be parked in the garment district on the west side of Eighth Avenue at 40th Street.

title: A ONEYEAR TRIM IN INCOME TAXES VOTED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 16The Legislature today overwhelmingly approved a bill that would sus pend for one year the 2.5 per cent incometax surcharge authorized during the 197172 fiscal crisis.

title: Kissinger Arrives in Paris for Talks With Tho About CeaseFire
description: PARIS, May 16Henry A. Kissinger arrived here tonight for a new series of talks with Le Duc Tho to strengthen the peace in Indochina and to improve the enforcement of. the Vietnam ceasefire agreement that they completed here last January.

title: ZAMBEZI GUNFIRE KILLS 2 CANADIANS
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 16 (Reuters)  Two Canadian women tourists were killed and an American man seriously wounded yesterday when Zambian troops opened fire across the Zambezi Riber border between Rhodesia and Zambia, the Rhodesian Government said here today.

title: People and Business
description: Walter W. Hitesman, 54 years old, has been appointed president and chief operating officer of The Reader's Di gest. As president, he sue ceeds Hobart Lewis, 63, who was named chairman and who continues as chief executive officer and editorinchief.

title: Decline in Housing Continued in April
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The decline in housing starts and permits for new housing continued in April, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Interlocking Seats Blocked
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (Reuters)The Federal Trade Commission has issued a consent order that prohibits interlocking directorships between the Aluminium Company of America and the Kennecott Copper Corporation and between Alcoa and the Armco Steel Corporation. The complaint challenged previously existing director interlocking on the grounds that Alcoa competes with each of the other two firms.

title: GROUP HEALTH PLAN PASSED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) The Senate passed yesterday an $805million bill authorizing Federal funds to encourage group health plans.

title: Five Skeletons Found
description: RICHMOND, May 16 (UPI) A bulldozer on a construetion site near here yesterday unearthed five skeletons, believed to date from Civil War times. The skeletons were reburied and no further investiI cation was Planned.

title: Holland Named by Nixon To Federal Reserve Board
description: WASHINGTON, May 16President Nixon set a precedent today by appointing Robert C. Holland, a career staff official of the Federal Reserve System, to fill the vacancy on the Reserve Board created by the resignation of J. L. Robertson.

title: Nerud Puts Over a $29 Goodie
description: With seven firsttime starters in the field, Frank Blois didn't want any part of yesterday's third race at Belmont Park.

title: Costs Force Rizzo To Give Up Plans To Build Big Home
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 16 (AP)Mayor Frank L. Rizzo, tears in his eyes, said today that he was going to give up the big, new stone house he was building because he could not afford it.

title: Military in Uruguay Putting Pressure on Senate
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 16 (AP)Uruguay's armed forces, in a challenge to the Senate, refused today to lay aside a demand for the removal of a leftist senator's parliamentary immunity, a proGovernment newspaper reported.

title: U.S. AIDES CONCEDE HEALT FUND CUTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Using angry, questions and fist pounding, Senator Hubert H. Humphrey wrung from top Federal officials today an admission that most national health programs would not getmore funds In the next budget, despite Nixon Administration reports to the contrary.

title: MRS. GLADYS FICKE
description: NEW HAVEN, May 16Mrs. Gladys Brown Ficke, an artist and the widow of Arthur Davison Ficke, poet, playwright and collector of Oriental art, died Monday in the Parkview Medical Recovery Home. She was 83 years old and lived at 485 George Street.

title: An Omnibus Menace
description: The omnibus higher education bill, which Governor Rockefeller is trying to steamroller through the Legislature, represents a threat to the future independence and fiscal viability of the City University. The measure is clearly intended to destroy every vestige of Dome rule in the city's system of higher education. It would weaken the invaluable SEEK program for disadvantaged students. It would cripple those programs of the city's community colleges which are most closely linked the local employment market.

title: Dollar Firm, Gold Off
description: The dollar firmed against other currencies on leading European money markets yesterday in somewhat quieter dealings. Prices of gold bullion dropped following the sharp advances of Monday and Tuesday. Details, Page 63.

title: 9th Graders Get a Lesson on Consumerism
description: They squeezed the lettuce, examined the labeling on the white bread, tasted the American cheese, drank some apple juice and found out why supermarkets pack strawberries in cardboard containers.

title: Loeb Firm: Quiet Rise Since 1931
description: In Our Crowd, the 1967 bestselling guide to the GermanJewish banking families of New York, the author, Stephen Birmingham, recalled this putdown of John Langeloth Loeb and his relatives at the time of his marriage to a member of the Lehman clan. But those Loebs aren't the Loebs, it was said.

title: Bankruptcy Petitions Set
description: Delicias International, Inc., Asbury Park, N. J., plans to file today a petition for reorganization under Chapter XI of the Bankruptcy Act in the United States District Court for New Jersey, the company announced yesterday. Its subsidiary, Jersey June Egg Company, Inc., plans to file a petition in bankruptcy in the same court. The parent company has requested the Securities and Exchange Commission to suspend trading in its stock for 10 days.

title: BUILDERS CHARGE PLOT BY 17 UNIONS
BIAGGI SUMMONED By A NEW PANEL
description: Representative Mario Biaggi appeared yesterday before a special state grand jury investigating the possible manipulation of the court system in case in which Mr, Biaggi received $240,000 in legal fees.

title: CONSUMER GROUP ASSAILS AMTRAK
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI)A consumer group said today that two years of operation of the nation's passenger trains by Amtrak had been a disappointment and thatisome of the railroads that operated Amtrak trains were deliberately trying to kill passenger service.

title: Rockefeller and Republican Legislative Leaders Agree on $48Million Additional State Aid for the Schools
description: ALBANY, May 16Governor Rockefeller and the Republican legislative leaders agreed today on additional state aid to schools, totaling $48million.

title: ARGENTINA TO LIFT ALL MARTIAL LAW
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 16Argentina's military Government has decided to lift the state of martial law in effect in most of Argentina since May 1, after guerrillas assassinated a former Chief of Staff of the armed forces.

title: SENATE UNIT SETS INSTITUTIONS BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Senate Banking Committee approved today legislation that would permit brokers who are affiliated with institutional inVestors to continue to be members of stock exchangesand to join themso long as sales commissions on stock transactions continue to be pricefixed.

title: Parker Is Aided by McGraw Matlack Back
Nixon and Aide Cruise
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) President Nixon and two of his top aides went for a cruise this evening on the Potomac River below the capital, spokesman said. Joining Mr. Nixon on the Presidential yacht, the Sequoia, were the acting White House chief of staff, Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., and the press secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler.

title: River Still at Flood Level
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 16 (AP) Forecasters said today that it would be late this month or early next month before the Mississippi Aiver subsides to bank full status at most points along the levees. At Caruthersville, Mo., where the water level was 38.2 feet, the level was expected to fall to 32, which is flood stage, between May 28 and 31.

title: Senate Passes Measure On Free Outdoor Facilities
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) The Senate passed today bill to permit free use of certain Federal outdoor recreation facilities.

title: The Pendulum
description: Piercing through a couple of floors of the Smithsonian Institution's Museum of History and Technology in Washington is a great pendulum. To tourists and scientists, its long, slow swings demonstrate the motion of the earth, but to politicians it symbolizes the inexorability of change in public opinion.

title: S. E. C. Action Seen On Equity Funding
description: John C. Burton, chief accountant of the Securities and Exchange Commission, said here yesterday that its investigation of the insurance scandal at the Equity Funding Corporation of America would lead to disciplinary action.

title: There's Dancing in the Streets at City Center Fete
description: You won't find this in Milwaukee, said Ron Fairbrother of Milwaukee at lunchtime yesterday, as he found a group of dancers in animal masks growling at one another on the Avenue of the Americas. Sizing up the opening event of the City Center's third free Outdoor Dance Festival, Mr. Fairbrother ventured to describe it as interesting.

title: Stolen Camera Recovered
description: SALT LATE CITY, May 16 (UPI)A $3,000 camera used in the Gemini space program has been recovered by agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation two years after it disappeared from a museum.

title: Rosewall, Riessen and Newcombe Lose
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 16Battle fatigue continued to tal its toll of top players in ti $150,000 Alan King tenn tournament today.

title: Jews Accuse Soviet of Preparing a Fraudulent Trial
description: MOSCOW, May 16Nearly a hundred Soviet Jews have accused the secret police of fabricating a criminal case against half a dozen retired army officers who have been seeking to emigrate to Israel.

title: Ellsberg, at Senate Hearing, Urges Congress to Restrict Secrecy in the White House
description: WASHINGTON May 16Dr. Daniel Ellsberg, decring that secrecy corrupts just as power corrupts, urged Congress today to enact laws sharply restricting secrecy in the executive branch.

title: Lindbergh Revisits Scene Of Old Friendship on L. I.
description: SANDS POINT, L. I., May 16 A hero returned to an estate under sunny skies today in a reunion that brought back memories of glorious times, as Long Island's Gold Coast glittered as brightly as ever. The hero, Charles A. Lindbergh, was visiting the estate, Falaise, where he had often been the guest of his late friend, Capt. Harry F. Guggenheim. The occasion was the private opening of Falaise as a Nassau County museum, displaying Captain Guggenheim's style of living and giving a glimpse of an era when America celebrated heroes and bttilt estates.

title: NIXON DECLARES CONGRESS PERILS U.S. TRUCE EFFORT
description: WASHINGTON, May 16President Nixon accused Congress today of action that could severely undermine the chances of restoring peace to Cambodia and all of Indochina.

title: Farrell of Post Captures FirstDay Decathlon Lead
description: GREENVALE, L. I., May 16Jerry Farrell of C. W. Post held a slim lead over Bill Byron of Manhattan and a Post teammate, Tony Corson, today after the first day of the first C. W. Post invitation decathlon.

title: Untimely Visit..
description: A visit to this country by Leonid I. Brezhnev has been a strong probability since President Nixon's own visit to the Soviet Union a year ago. But the timing of the Soviet leader's trip next month for eight days of talks in Washington and San Clemente is decidedly inopportune. It would be in the country's best interest to postpone these talks until late fall or next year.

title: F. T.C. to Reconsider Litton Case Penalty
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Federal Trade Commission, in an extraordinary action, reopened today an antitrust case it had already decided against Litton Industries, Inc. The reopening was for the purpose of reconsidering the penalty the commission had imposed on the company for violation of the antitrust laws with its acquisition of TriumphAdler, a German typewriter company. The commission acted by a vote of 3 to 1. The majority gave no explanation for its decision. Longterm officials of the commission said that they could not remember a similar instance of reopening a case to reconsider the penalty imposed.

title: Governor Asks Report on Investigation of Lomenzo's Intervention for Contractor
description: ALBANY, May 16Governor Rockefeller has asked the State Task Force on Organized Crime to submit a full report on its inquiry into an incident in which Secretary of State John P. Lomenzo visited the State Dormitory Authority in behalf of a friend whose bid was rebuffed and then later accepted in a contract competition.

title: PoliticalDinner Millions Unaccounted for in State
description: At a time when political fundraising has touched off, a national controversy, many millions of dollars collected at political dinners in New York City and State are unaccounted for because of a loophole in the state's election law.

title: Poll Finds 7 Out of 10 in U.S Satisfied With Their Water
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 16 (UPI)Seven out of 10 Americans are satisfied with the taste, color, smell and quality of their water, according to a public opinion official.

title: Reading Defeats Seale Easily for Oakland Mayor
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 16 (UPI)Mayor John Reading, helped by a record voter turnout, won an easy reelection victory yesterday over Bobby G. Seale, the Black Panther leader.

title: People in Sports: Shipley Ships Out at Southwestern Louisiana;
description: Beryl Shipley resigned as head basketball coach at Southwestern Louisiana, a university that had the distinction of being cited for more than 100 violations of the National. Collegiate Athletic Association's rules generally in the area of recruiting.

title: Stage: Children's Mass
Advertising: A Queryon Sports
description: Sure, everybody knows that tying a maleoriented product or service in with a sportsoriented promotion is usually a successful marketing ploy, but how much more do marketers know?

title: BLACK IS ELECTED BY PRESBYTERIANS
description: OMAHA, May 16The Rev. Clinton M. Marsh of Omaha was elected last night as the Second black moderator in the history of the United Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A.

title: Books of The Times
description: REMBRANDT'S HAT. By Bernard Malamud. 204 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $6.95.

title: WILLIAM VON MINDER OF RUTGERS IS DEAD
description: SADDLE RIVER, N. J. May 16  Prof. William Von Minder, founder and former director of the division of professional accounting at Rutgers University's Graduate School of Business, died yesterday at the Allendale Nursing Home. He was 71 years old and lived here.

title: Screen: Lovely Adieu Philippine at New Yorker
SHOP TALK
description: If the stereotype of a rug merchant is someone with a heavy moustache and a certain shady perspicacity, Zehra Boccia will never fit the picture.

title: General Rescinds Jail Sentence Of Doctor Who Balked at Duty
description: DAYTON, Ohio, May 16 (UN) The commander of WrightPatterson Air Force Base, Brig. Gen. Irby B. Jarvis Jr., has rescinded the jail sentence of Kentucky doctor who was courtmartialed because he refused to practice medicine in the Air Force.

title: SENATE'S INQUIRY WILL BEGIN TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 16k wide ranging and potentially epic investigation of the reported effort last year to subvert the Presidential election campaign begins tomorrow on Capitol Hill.

title: U.S. TO REVAMP MORNING NEWS
description: John Hart and Nelson Benton will leave The C.B.S. Morning News by midsummer and the entire hourlong daily show will be revamped, Richard S. Salant, president of the news for the Columbia Broadcasting System, said yesterday.,

title: Notes on People
description: The Rev. Billy Graham, the evangelist, was clescribed by one of his daughters as a stem, but loving father who spent more time preaching than he did with, his five children as they grew up. His 22yearold. daughter Mrs. Bunny Deinert, who is married to an advertising executive in. Philadelphia, gaVe her viewson growing up in the evangelist's family in an article in the June issue of Good Housekeeping magazine.

title: Agnew Talks on Inflation
description: CHICAGO, May 16 (AP)Vice President Agnew said today that the Nixon Administration does not believe more controls are the best way to combat current problems with inflation. Mr. Agnew told a meeting of Chicago business leaders, At the moment, inflation is with us. And there is no simple, instantaneous solution for it.

title: MRS. FRANCES LANGE
description: YONKERS, May 16 Mrs. Frances Lange, who retired in 1968 as assistant secretary of the Bronx Savings Bank, died yesterday in Hilton Head Island, S. C., where she had been on vacation. She was 69 years old and lived at 485 Bronx River Road.

title: Football Transactions
description: NEW ORLEANSSigned Jim Menlo., Stanford linebacker, and Bill Cahill, Washington safety.

title: Watergate Replaces Usual War Protest As Columbia U. Awards Degrees to 6,580
description: For the first time in nearly a decade, Columbia University held a commencement yesterday that was virtually unshadowned by war protest or reference to war.

title: Helms Says He Didn't Tell Nixon About Bids to C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Richard Helms, former Director of Central Intelligence, was quoted today as saying that he felt White House requests for his agency's assistance in the Watergate affair had been improper but that he never told President Nixon of his concern.

title: 23 Die in Korean Bus Crash
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 16 (Reuters)Twentythree people, most of them high school students, were killed today when bus was hit by a train at a level crossing and plunged into a stream. More than 60 other bus passengers were injured in the accident 170 miles southeast of here.

title: 3 Officers Partly Cleared in Use of a Blackiack
description: In an unusual case involving a 107yearold law that exempts policemen from criminal charges for the use of virtually every kind of weapon, a Criminal Court judge partly exonerated three patrolmen yesterday for using a blackjack against two bystanders.

title: A ONEYEAR TRIM IN INCOME TAXES VOTED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 16The Legislature today overwhelmingly approved a bill that would suspend for one year the 2.5 per cent incometax surcharge authorized during the 197172 fiscal crisis.

title: Cornfeld Tells Court He Wanted to Aid Investors
description: GENEVA, May 16  Bernard Cornfeld told a court here today that he wanted to do everything possible to help investors who lost their savings in the Investors Overseas Services mutualfund complex he founded.fund group attracted the attention of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Mayor Peter J. Bonastia of Montclair issued an order Tuesday declaring two apartment buildingslong troubled by housing violations and tenant protestsas unfit for human habitation. His order directs the owners to repair the buildings within 120 days or the town will do the job itself or demolish said buildings.

title: TOROS TIE COSMOS IN SOCCER, 1 TO 1
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 16The New York Cosmos had to fight hard tonight to earn a 11 tie against a revitalized Miami team. Miami is under new ownership and the team name has been changed from Gatos to Toros. The Toros also have seven new players, all of them from overseas.

title: Second Candidate Rejects Special Prosecutor's Job
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Warren M. Christopher, one of the men on Elliot L. Richardson's final list of possible special. prosecutors in the Watergate case turned down the job today because he said he would not have been given enough independence.

title: Oil Agreement Reported Between Italy and Hanoi
description: ROME, May 16The proCommunist newspaper Paese Sera reported today that the Italian stateowned oil corporation, E.N.I., had reached an accord with North Viet nam on offshore prospecting in the Gulf of Tonkin.

title: LAWYERS ASK DELAY ON TWO DEPOSITIONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) H. R. Haldeman and John D. Ehrlichrnan may be indicted by the Watergate grand jury, theiz attorneys said in briefs filed today in United States District Court.

title: BROAD ROLE CITED
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Henry A. Kissinger personally provided the Federal Bureau of Investigation with the names of a number of. his aides on the National Security Council whom he wanted wiretapped, Justice Department sources said today.

title: Traffic Nailed Down By Two Falling Kegs
description: Two kegs of roofing nails fell from a truck and tied up southbound traffic for nearly three hours on the BrooklynQueens Expressway yesterday afternoon.

title: Nixon and Tanaka to Meet In Washington July31Aug.1
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) President Nixon and Premier Hakuei Tanaka of Japan will meet in Washington July 31 to Aug. 1, the White House announced today.

title: The Public Domain
description: WASHINGTONThe Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities today begins its public hearings into the vast array of allegations, we have all come to know as Watergate. The task of the committee is a unique one, as I see it, a task quite different from the executive branch investigatiori, the grand jury proceedings, and civil or criminal trials that are now under way or which may take place in the future.

title: 4Legged Lobbyist Visits Albany to Assist Trot Bid
description: ALBANY, May 16 (AP)A handsome trotter named Straight Shot visited the city today to help dramatize the effort to bring harness racing's premier event, the Hambletonian, to Saratoga Springs in 1975. The race for 3yearold trotters is run at the DuQuoin State Fairgrounds in Illinois,! but Saratoga Harness plans to make a formal bid to the Hambletonian Society later this summer.

title: Chess: Those Quiet Passive Moves Can Be Omens of Mayhem
Bridge: Italy's Blue Team Is Victor Over Its Archrivals the Aces
description: GUARUJA, Brazil, May 16 Italy's great Blue Team beat its chief rivals, the Aces, in a firstround match here last night. Giorgio Belladonna, Benito Garozzo and Pietro Forquet, who among them have won 36 world titles, were assisted in the victory by a talented newcomer, Benito Bianchi.

title: Australian Mail Union Joins Protest on French ATests
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, May 16 (AP)The Postal Workers Union refused to handle most communications with France today to protest French plans to resume nuclear testing in the South Pacific soon.

title: PREAKNESS FIELD LIKELY TO SHRINK
Israel, South Vietnam Win
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Mayl 16 (AP)Israel defeated Japan 21, and South Vietnam stopped Thailand, 10, today and advanced to Group A competition in the World Cup Asian group soccer preliminary tournament.

title: Southern G.O.P. and Goldwater Critical of Nixon on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 President Nixon's handling of the Watergate scandal was strongly criticized today by leading Republicans, who warned that dwindling confidence in the Government was damaging both the country and the party.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Business Briefs
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 16The Brazilian Government has formally canceled an agreement to supply American makers of instant coffee wtih 560,000 bags of coffee beans, the raw material for the instant product, per year free of export taxes.

title: Rhode Island Abortion Law Is Declared Unconstitutional
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., May 16 (AP)  Rhode Island's law against abortions, adopted two months ago, was declared unconstitutional today by Chief Judge Raymond J. Pettine in United States District Court.

title: The Day's Developments
description: S.E.C. and Vesco case: G. Bradford Cook resigned as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, post he had held for only 74 days. Last week, a Federal grand jury in New York that indicted, among others, former Attorney General John N. Mitchell and Maurice H. Stans, former Secretary of Commerce, said in its indictment that Mr. Stans had persuaded Mr. Cook, then general counsel of the S.E.C., to delete from an S.E.C. civil action against Robert L. Vesco, a New Jersey financier, information relating to a secret $200,000 contribution by Mr. Vesco to the Nixon campaign.

title: Rogers and Peru's Leader Confer for 2 Hours inLima
description: LIMA, Peru, May 16 (UPI)Secretary of State William P. Rogers held an unannounced twohour meeting today with Gen. Juan Velasco Alvarado, leader of Peru's revolutionary government.

title: Helms Says He Didn't Tell Nixon About Bids to C.I.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Richard Helms, former Director of Central Intelligence, was quoted today as saying that he felt White House requests for his agency's assistance in the Watergate affair had been improper but that he never told President Nixon of his concern.

title: Kaufman &
description: Top management of Kaufman& Broad, Inc., and a representative of the company's accountants, Haskins & Sells, spent nearly two hours with security analysts at the Plaza Hotel yesterday explaining the company's operations and defending its accounting practices.

title: Secret Bid to Court Is Laid to Mitchell
description: WASHINGTON, May 16A former Justice Department official said yesterday that he was asked in 1969 by John N. Mitchell, then the Attorney General, to deliver secret information about Government wiretaps to the Supreme Court shortly before the Justice Department asked the Court to reconsider its decision in an important wiretapping case.

title: CoOwner's Timely Intervention Gets Steel Byrd Into Messenger;
China Asks The Times to Bar ProTaiwan Ads, but Paper Refuses
description: The Chinese Government protested strongly and formally to The New York Times yesterday, against the paper's acceptance of political advertisements from antiPeking Chinese groups and the Chiang Kaishek Government on Taiwan. The Times was asked by the Peking Government not to accept such advertisements in the future..

title: Credit Markets: Republic Bank Wins Dallas Issue
description: In the first substantial sale of highgrade city bonds in week Dallas awarded $21mil lion of bonds to a syndicate of underwriters managed by the Republic National Bank of Dallas.

title: HOGAN SUGGESTS A NEW U.S. OFFICE
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan suggested yesterday that the United States Attorney General be stripped of his power to prosecute and that this power be transferred to a new office of Prosecutor General of the United States, which would be above politics.

title: Men's Stylish Shorts. Are. No Longer a Joke
description: To some, Sid Price, a cleanshaven, 40yearold Manhattan carpet mill sales manager with a receding hairline, slight paunch and a preference for plain brown suits, would have to be considered a square.

title: Bays 21 Soccer Victor
description: BALTIMORE, May 16 (AP) Second half goals tonight b Paul Scurti and Joseph Gya gave the Baltimore Bays a 2triumph over Bristol City c England in an international soccer match.

title: Japanese Rule Gives Okinawa New Woes
description: NAHA, Okinawa, May 15In the lighthearted play TE Teahouse of the August Moon, the wily Sakini noted philosophically that Okinawans had managed to survive the coming of the Chinese and Japanese in the past and would somehow do the same with the Americans who had just ar rived.

title: Faculty Union at Rutgers Sues State Over Guidelines on Funds
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May The faculty union at Rutgers University has filed suit to upset state guidelines allocating funds for various levels of study on the basis of studentfaculty ratios.

title: ELI LLOYD HOFFMAN
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 16Eli Lloyd Hoffman, a publicity man and humorist whose sallies on topics of the day often appeared in the New Yorkbased Broadway columns, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 62 years MA and lived in the Croydon Arms.

title: Bishop Mugavero Gets A B'nai B'rith Award
description: The Most Rev. Francis J. Mugavero, bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, last night received the human relations award of the Anti Defamation League of B'nai B'rith at a dinner in the Grand Ballroom of the Biltmore Hotel.

title: Personal Finance: Keogh Tax Plan
description: No one knows how many selfemployed persons such as artists and writers who earn money freelancing are losing important tax advantages. One estimate puts the number at more than five million.

title: Belgian Diplomats Fear Burundi Clash With Rwanda Force
description: BRUSSELS, May 16Belgian diplomats voiced fear today of renewed racial violence and possibly war between the central African nations of Burundi and Rwanda following raids into Burundi border areas last weekend by Burundian refugees living in Rwanda on the north and Tanzania to the south.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New York City Affairs Commissioner, Betty Furness, urged executives of department stores to support legislation to protect consumers rights.

title: Arthur Daley
description: It already has begun to look like one of those lingering farewells, where the lovers just can't endure the finality the last goodby. For the better part of a week the adoring Knick fans gloried in the winning of the championship by their dream princes. The day before yesterday, the Mayor paid tribute to the team in ceremonies in City Hall, Willis Reed received his sports car as the most valuable player and the squad disbanded, leaving an empty feeling in the heart of every Knick fan.

title: Overseas Criticism on Watergate Mild
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Although the Watergate scandals have raised doubts among some officials about President Nixon's ability to conduct a vigorous foreign policy, overseas criticism of the Administration has been light, and American foreign relations so far do not appear to have suffered significant damage.

title: Kihss of The Times Cited By SocialService Group
description: The Career Center for Social Services yesterday cited Peter Kihss, a reporter for The New York Times, for his contribution to public understanding of social problems. The citation was made at the organization's 17th annual meeting at the Roosevelt Hotel.

title: LOCAL BOARD BACKS ASPHALTSITE PLAN
description: Community Board 8 voted last night after an acrimonious twohour debate to approve the revised plan of the New York City Educational Construction Fund for a combined public school and highrise housing on the site of the abandoned Municipal Asphalt Plant in Yorkville.

title: Woolworth Posts 39% Increase in Earnings for First uarter
Astronauts May Go Aloft To Put Awning on Skylab
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 16Space agency engineers, in their desperate struggle to invent a way out of the orbiting. Skylab's troubles, are considering a plan to send up astronauts to spread a thin awning over much of the overheated space station.

title: PREABESS FIELD LIKELY TO SHRINK
7YearOld Illinois Girl. Seasoned DogHandler
description: They are winning younger and younger these days, but few can match the record of Tammy Carlsen. The 7yearold, competing in her first field trial, drew the applause of the oldtimers as she handled her 6yearold golden retriever to win the children's stake at the International show in Chicago.

title: Screen:Day of Jackal Fox Cast as Assassin in Zinnemann Drama
RELATIVES LABEL HANGINGS MURDER
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., May 16Relatives of the wife of a wealthy builder and her pregnant daughter who were found hanged in their home here said today that they had been murdered, but investigators in the bizarre case refused to say whether the deaths were murder or suicide.

title: Music: From'Old to New,A Range of Works at Speculum Musicae
OTB to Start Accepting Preakness Bets Today
description: The Offtrack Betting Corporation starts accepting beta today on Saturday's Preakness, with Secretariat the 35 early favorite.

title: Candidates'
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Blumenthal said yesterday that an analysis of $90,996 contributed to Controller Abraham D. Beame's campaign for Mayor showed that more than half came from realestate interests that would, therefore, dominate Mr. Beame, should he be elected Mayor.

title: Congress Inquiries Have Role in History
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 The Watergate hearings that begin tomorrow in the marblecolumned caucus room of the Old Senate Office Building may be vital to the progress of Richard Nixon's Presidency. Another set of Congressional hearings, 25 years ago, propelled him from the obscurity of Representative's first term onto the path to the White House.

title: Concourse Plaza Hotel Fights City's Closing of Discotheque Catering to Blacks
description: The city has closed a cotheque in the Concourse Plaza Hotel, and the owner the hotel, which was once shining glory of the Bronx, is saying that the discriminates against black people.

title: Overseas Criticism on Watergate Mild
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Although the Watergate scandals have raised doubts among some officials about President Nixon's ability to conduct a vigorous foreign policy, overseas criticism of the Administration has been light, and American foreign relations so far do not appear to have suffered significant damage.

title: To Plummer, Cyrano Is an Old Friend
description: The secret of Christopher Plummer's Cyranoin the new musical version of the Edmund Rostand play at the Palace Theateris in its size. Cyrano is a huge, largerthanlife figure, said Mr. Plummer. Attired in a blazer and with his twirled Cyrano mustache he looked dashing but lifesize. You can't be broad enough, he said. He's a generous character and he must be played generously.

title: REALTY TRUST SUED; SALINGER IS NAMED
description: PHILADELPHIA (UPI) A Bahamian trust, described at the holder of $1billion in real estate in 35 states in this country, today was named a defendant in a $40millimi damage suit filed in Federal District Court here.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Jack Davis, Canada's Minister of the Environment and Fisheries, was named Con servationist of the Year at a recent meeting of the International Atlantic Salmon Foundation (ISAF) held at the American Museum of Natural History.

title: L.I. and City Joust Over Business Relocations
description: There was a showdown at the Pan American Motor inn on Queens Boulevard in Elmhurst yesterday.

title: Radio
A More Effective Boycott Of Rhodesia Asked by U.S.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 16The United States said in the Security Council today that United Nations sanctions were having an economic impact on the whiteminority Government in Rhodesia and should be made more effective.

title: CLARK FOR OUSTER OF SCHOOL BOARD
description: Dr. Kenneth B. Clark called on the city's Borough Presidents yesterday to remove the five members of the Board of Education because of their recent decision in the Tilden Houses school zoning controversy.

title: STOCKS OFF AGAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
Only Two of Seed Players Advance to Quarterfinals
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 16Battle fatigue continued to take its toll of top players in the $150,000 Alan King tennis tournament today.

title: Astronauts May Go Aloft To Put A.wning on Skylab
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May I6Space agency engineers, in their desperate struggle to invent a way out of the orbiting Skylab's troubles, are conSidering a plan to send up astronauts to spread a thin awning over much of the overheated space station.

title: Israel, South Vietnam Win
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Mai 16 (AP)Israel defeated Japan 21, and South Vietnam; stopped Thailand, 10, today and advanced to Group A corn; petition in..the WOrld Cup Asian, group, soccer preliminary tournament.

title: Pillar of the City Ballet Melissa Hayden
description: The large poster ouside the New York State Theater shows a trim darkhaired figure in skinfitting leotard and tights. Her arms are extended, the neck and head are directed slightly forward. A sense of urgency and passion pervades even this twodimensional still image of Melissa Hayden in George Balanchine's ballet, Orpheus.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today May 17, 1973
description: SECURITY COUNCIL Meets at 3:30 P.M. on Rhodesian sanctions report.

title: A Viewer's Guide to Who, What and When of Watergate TV Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Here Fare some assorted tidbits for those who will be watching the Watergate hearings on television that may help heighten their appreciation of the biggest daytime television spectacular in years:

title: BASKETBALL TRANSACTION
description: NATIONAL ASSOCIATION

title: Mayor and 5 Candidates Score Governor's City University Bil
description: Mayor Lindsay and the five major party mayoral candidates joined yesterday to denounce Governor Rockefeller's higher education bill as an incursion from Albany that would destroy the traditional independence of the City University.

title: The Problem: To Do a Yearbook That's Actually Something Else
description: When the editorial design seniors at the Parsons School of Design met last winter to plan the 1973 yearbook, they were agreed on one thing. They didn't want the usual collection of graduating class portraits smiling individually into the camera, or even the clowning group shots recent yearbooks are full of.

title: SAIGON WILL OUST A WOMAN LEADER
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 16 (UPI)A South Vietnamese antiwar leader will be turned over to the Communists because she had close liaison with the Communists, a Government spokesman said today.

title: Pact in Denver Bus Strike
description: DENVER, May 16 (AP)Tentative agreement on a new contract to end Denver's sevenday bus strike was announced today by the bus drivers and mechanics union and the Denver Mass Transit Authority.

title: Cahill's Incumbent Edge Held to Be Eroding
description: TRENTON, May 16For the last quarter of a century, Republican and Democratic leaders in New Jersey have believed that the power and glamor of incumbency gave a Governor running for reelection a seemingly unbeatable advantage. Traditionally this has foreclosed a primary challenge for renomination from within the Governor's own party, and generally shackled the opposition with weak candidate and a sense of futility later in the general election.

title: CLASH IS REPORTED BY SOUTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 16 (AP)The Saigon command reported today that its troops had attacked Communist soldiers who were moving large quantities of arms near the central coast and killed 49 of them.

title: Stocks Off Slightly as Trading Slackens
Atomic Blast to Free Gas Planned Today in Colorado
description: RIO DLANCO, Colo., May 16 (UPI) The trigger that will detonate three 30kiloton nuclear devices more than 4 mile beneath western Colorado rangeland got a final check today, and test officials predict. led that tomorrow's experiment to release natural gas would be flawless.

title: SENATE'S INQUIRY WILL BEGIN TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 16  A wide ranging and potentially epic investigation of the reported effort last year to subvert the Presidential electiOn campaign begins tomorrow on Capitol Hill.

title: The Chinese Protest
description: Over the years there have been recurrent objections from widely diverse groups and individuals to particular advertisements appearing in this newspaper. Yesterday the Government of the Chinese People's Republic protestednot for the first timeagainst the appearance in The Times of political advertisements placed by antiCommunist Chinese resident in this country and Taiwan.

title: 3SHOT LEAD KEPT BY MASSENGALE
A Generalls Killed In an Upstate Crash On a Routine Flight
description: HOLLAND PATENT, N. Y., May 16 (AP)Air Force investigators were examining the scattered wreckage today of a supersonic warplane, that exploded in flight, killing its pilot, a 52yearold major general.

title: Dollar Firm, Gold Off
description: The dollar firmed against other currencies on leading European money markets yesterday in somewhat quieter dealings. Prices of gold bullion dropped following the sharp advances of Monday and Tuesday. Details, Page 63.

title: Nerud Puts Over a $29 Goodie
description: With seven firsttime starters in the field, Frank Blois didn't want any part of yesterday's third race at Belmont Park.

title: EDWARD BROWN, OF NATIONAL DAIM
description: Edward Fisher Brown, an executive in health and welfare causes and a retired vice presi. dent of National Dairy Products Corporation, died yesterday in the Veterans Administration Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at 1158 Firth Avenue.

title: A VOTE IS DEFERRED ON ENVOY TO SAIGON
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Senate Foreign Relations Committee has deferred a vote on President Nixon's nomination of Graham A. Martin as Ambassador to South Vietnam until he can testify on reported interference in the internal affairs of Italy when he was Ambassador there, a committee spokesman said today.

title: City Aides Uphold as Custom Secrecy of Cuts in Realty Tax
description: Must the City of New York maintain the confidentiality of applications by property owners for tax reductions, to protect what the real estate industry alleges are trade secrets"?

title: Frederick B. Ashplant, Banker Who Founded Firm Here, Dead
description: Frederick Bryant Ashplant, founder of the New York investment banking firm of F. B. Ashplant & Co., died Tuesday at his home in VillefranchesurMer in Southern France. He was 77 years old and lived also at 605 Ewing Avenue, Franklin Lakes, N. J.

title: Honda Raises Car Prices
description: TOKYO, May 16 (Reuters)The Honda Motor Company said it is raising car prices in Japan by 3 per cent or an average of about 15,000 yen, or about $49.25 effective May 17. Cars for export, minicars and motorcycles will be exempt from the price rise.

title: Morss on Podium As Young Players Mark a Milestone
description: A symphony orchestra that manages to approach the age of 10. in New York City is something of a miracle. One that has a high turnover among its youthful personnel and has no permanent conductor deserves even more praise for such longevity. So the Cosmopolitan Young Peoples Symphony Orchestra was justly celebrating its entry into its 10th year, with a gala benefit concert in Philharmonic Hall on Tuesday night.

title: Lindsay's Proposed Jump in Realty Tax Is Greeted With Wide Opposition
description: Government, business and civic leaders in the city joined yesterday in a flood of condemnation of the record realestate tax increase proposed by Mayor Lindsay in his $10.595billion expense budget for fiscal 1974.

title: City Ballet Honors Miss Hayden; Mayor Gives Handel Medallion
description: It was honor time for the ballerina MelissaHayden at the New York State Theater last night. The occasion was a gala evening given by the New York City Ballet, which offered the previews of two new works, Cortege Hongrois, by George Balanchine, and a new Beethoven pas de Deux by Jerome Robbins.

title: Max Zuckerman, Controller Of Israel Development Corp.
description: Max Zuckerman, controller and secretary of the Israel Development Corporation and controller of AmpalAmerican Israel Corporation, died apparently of a heart attack Tuesday evening. He was 57 years old and lived at 6907 174th Street Flushing, Queens.

title: Cambodian Cabinet in Office, Vows. Neutrality
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 16 (UPI)A new cabinet under Premier In Tam took off ice today and pledged itself to independence, neutrality and peace.

title: More Horses Sold for Slaughter as Meat Prices Rise
3 Officers Partly Cleared in Use of a Black jack
Bike Rider Critically Injured In Collision With 2d Cyclist
description: A 25yearold woman on bicycle was critically injured yesterday when she collided with another cyclist in Central Park.

title: Bishop Who Aids Indians Irks Ecuadorians
description: RIOBAMBA, Ecuador, May 7 "I used to be a slave on the hacienda but now I can work for my family and get an educationthanks to Monserior, a young Indian said passionately at a meeting of the Juan Diego farm cooperative, and the 10 other members nodded in assent.

title: DOROTHY MINER, 68, ARTS SCHOLAR, DIES
description: Dorothy E. Miner, a leading scholar in medieval arts am keeper of manuscripts at the Walters Art Gallery in Baltimore since 1934, died Tuesday at the Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore. She was 68 years old.

title: The Voice of History
description: LONDON, May 16The Convention that wrote the Constitution of the United States debated on July 20,1787, the clause making the Chief Executive of the new Government removable on impeachment and conviction. The surviving notes of the debate, by James Madison, make highly pertinent reading in 1973.

title: MRS. RIDGELY W. COOK
description: ROCKY HILL, N. J., May 16 Mrs. Ridgely W. Cook, proprietor with her husband of the Princeton realestate concern of Abbott & Cook, died at her home here on Monday. She was 42 years old and lived at 58 Princeton Avenue.

title: POST HELD 74 DAYS
description: WASHINGTON, May 16G. Bradford Cook, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission for 74 days, resigned today in the wake of allegations that he had deleted references to a secret $200,000. contribution to President Nixon's reelection campaign from a commission complaint against Robert L. Vesco, a New Jersey financier.

title: Scotland Upset in Soccer
description: GLASGOW, Scotland. May 16 (Reuters)Northern Ireland scored a surprise 21 victory over Scotland in soccer tonight, making it possible for England to clinch the British championship by gaining a draw against Scotland on Saturday. England has beaten Wales and ?? Ireland.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 16 (AP)Kip Keino has left his homeland to rejoin the International Track Association pro tour after missing several meets.

title: Film:Soul of ExSlave
Seoul Premier Visit Europe
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 16 Premier Kim Jong Pil of South Korea is scheduled to leave Saturday on an official goodwill tour of France, Belgium, Italy and Spain.

title: 3 Jockeys Snspended At Belmont for 10 Days
description: If the New York jockey colony had any notions about taking liberties at the Belmont Park meeting, it lost them yesterday.

title: Federctl Reserve Moving To Slow Rise of Lending
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Federal Reserve Board took a series of steps today to slow the huge growth in bank lending to business and, thus, to cool the inflationary economy. The moves are aimed at reducing the incentive of banks to add to their funds by issuing large certificates of deposit in order to relend them, at a profit, to borrowers chiefly buSiness borrowers.

title: U.S.China Dispute on Funds Reported Near a Settlement
description: PEKING, May 16 (Reuters)  Outstanding claims by the United States and China over funds frozen when the two countries broke diplomatic relations in 1949 will be settled soon, sources at the new United States liaison office here said today.

title: TRAPNELL GUILTY OF JET HIJACKING
5 in Gubernatorial Race Raise Issue of Corruption
description: PRINCETON, May 16Gubernational candidates of both parties, speaking at one of the state's most important political forums, raised the issue of corruption in government today but concentrated their remarks on such closetohome problems as crime, taxes, education and transportation.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A ceremony at 7 o'clock tonight in Central Park 60th Street off Fifth Avenue will mark the Parks Administration's weekday evening closing of five city parks automobile traffic to benefit bicycle riders and strollers, The schedule is as follows:

title: Bogdanovich's Paper Moon at Coronet
NEW JET CONTRACT WILL INFLATE COST
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Because an Air Force general modified the ground rules for a crucial test on a new jet engine, the Defense Department acknowledged today, the Government may have locked itself into a contract costing tens of millions of dollars more than expected.

title: American Airlines: Pilots'
New Jersey Sports
description: MONTVALE, May 16Etienne Schotte, a Belgian gym instructor who has teams in Western Europe and now even Bergen County chasing medicine balls, raised some eye brows last month at three regional parochial schools in the county and excited Ramsey's Don Bosco student body enough to receive a standing ovation. The reason was tour by his allstar krachtbal team.

title: Federal Reserve Moving To Slow Rise of Lending
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Federal Reserve Board took a series of steps today to slow the huge growth in bank lending to business and, thus, to cool the inflationary economy. the moves are aimed at reducing the incentive of banks to add to their funds by issuing large certificates of deposit in order to relend them, at a profit, to borrowers chiefly business borrowers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor

title: The Cook Resignation
description: G. Bradford Cook has shown good judgment in resigning as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission. Though he may be totally innocent of any wrongdoing, the reputation of this highly sensitive agency for integrity and thoroughness could have been undermined by Mr. Cook's present continuance in service and its highly regarded staff further demoralizedas he himself recognized.

title: White House Concedes Dean Report
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The White House conceded today that President Nixon had not talked directly with his former counsel, John W. Dean 3d, in ordering him to investigate the Watergate case and in re ceiving a report on the inquiry.

title: Deportation Appeal Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI)  The Justice Department asked the Supreme Court today to throw out an appeal by Russell Bufalino of Kingston, Pa., who had been fighting deportation to Italy since 1957. The deportation order is now effective, but the department said that it had not carried it out because of the reluctance of his native country to accept ,him.

title: JOHN L. LOEB CITED ON CAMPAIGN GIFT
