description: John L. Loeb, a Wall Street investment banker whose philanthropic gifts measure in the millions of dollars, was accused by the Federal Government yesterday of having disguised a $48,000 contribution to Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's unsuccessful 1972 campaign for the Presidency.

title: Connecticut, in New Plan, To Close Women's Prison
description: NIANTIC, Conn., May 16Connecticut's only state prison for women will be closed here In a threeyear program that will put the women prisoners to work or study in the community, or into others prisons, Where they will be kept with the male inmates.

title: Going Out Guide
description: TOUCH OF CLASS The St. Regis Hotel, 55th Street and Fifth Avenue (PL 3.4500), is 70 years old and to all appearances is as majestic ,and starchy as the betterclass hotels used to be when the nineteen hundreds came in. Yet, the Maisonette, its room down one flight from the ground floor, has, despite its glass chandeliered elegance and its obvious claim to distinction, a somewhat warmer ambiance than some of its similarly priced rivals around town. Maybe that's because it's downstairs; maybe it's because the ceiling is low enough to impart a feeling of intimancy.

title: DOLLAR ADVANCES AS GOLD DECLINES
description: PARIS, May 16The dollar firmed today and the price of gold fell sharply as somewhat calmer conditions returned to Europe's money centers following the steep speculative losses for the currency and gains for the metal of the last couple of days.

title: PRICEFIXING CASE ON STORES WIDENS
description: A widening Federal grand jury investigation of alleged pricefixing by prominent New York stores as far back as 1935, has resulted in the subpoenaing of the records and minutes of the Uptown Retail Guilda former trade association grouping most of the upper Fifth Avenue and Madison Avenue stores.

title: Right to Die Bill Loses
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., May 16 (AP)The Florida House of Representatives has rejected a bill to give terminally ill or injured persons the right to order doctors to let them die. But Representative Walter Sackett, the physician who sponsored the bill, says there is a 5050 chance of reviving the bill next week.

title: Text of Biaggi's Statement
description: I'm beginning to feel like a black man about to be lynched in the old South.

title: Petition to Recall Nixon
description: TULSA, Okla., May 16 (UPI) Rarldoiph Franklin, chairman of a committee trying to get a halfmillion signatures on a petition to recall President Nixon, says 6,000 persons have signed the petition. Mr. Franklin also said yesterday that he was receiving many calls from persons who wish to sign the petition. His aim is to send 500,000 signatures to the House Speaker, Carl Albert, by June 2.

title: MORE FOOD OUTLETS FAIL 2D INSPECTION
Equity Financing
description: Communications Satellite Corp (Comsat) filed with the S.E.C. in connection with a public offering by a prospectus of 2,895,750 of its common shares by American Telephone & Telegraph Co. Salomon Brothers, First Boston Corp. and Merrill Lynch will manage an underwriting syndicate. A.T.&.T. closed at 53, down  on the Big Board. Comsat closed at 49, up Vs on the Big Board.

title: Pennies for President Are a Budget Protest
description: WASHINGTON, May 16A group at cas itse Pennies for the President is encouraging citizens to send onecent pieces to the White House as a means of protesting the inequities in President Nixon's proposed budget.

title: FUTURES DECLINE FOR COMMODITIES
description: Weather conditions have improved In the nation's major growing areas for soybeans, corn and wheat. This, plus the fact that prices have made increases lately, combined to bring lower closing prices yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: JOHN L LOEB CITED ON CAMPAIGN GIFT
description: John L. Loeb, a Wall Street investment banker whose philanthropic gifts measure in the millions of dollars, was accused by the Federal Government yesterday of having disguised a $48,000 contribution to Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's unsuccessful 1972 campaign for the Presidency.

title: Water Resource Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) The Senate Interior Committee approved a bill to authorize $3.5million for water resource planning. The bill, sent to the Senate, would authorize a oneyear extension of programs by the Water Resources Council.

title: Move Seen to End Savings Rate Curb
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 1(AP)The Nixon Administration plans to recommend a fiveyear phasingout of ceilings that limit the interest consumers can earn on their savings accounts, it was learned today.

title: ThreeYearOld Jewish College To Open Law School Here in 74
description: Touro College, a tiny, threeyearold institution under Jewish auspices, announced yesterday that it plans in 1974 to open New York City's first new law school in almost a halfcentury.

title: Cook Note and Statement
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Following are the texts a letter of resignation addressed to President Nixon by G. Bradford Cook, Chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, and of the statement he read at a news conference:

title: Reclamation Chief Named
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI)  President Nixon appointed Gilbert G. Stamm of McLean, Va., today to be Commissioner of Reclamation, succeeding Ellis L. Armstrong, Mr. Stamm, 62 years old, has been acting commissioner since April 1. He has been with the Bureau of Reclamation in the Interior Department since 1946. He is a native of Denver and a graduate of Colorado State College.

title: Detroit School Employes End Their 3Day Strike
description: DETROIT, May 16 (UPI)About 2,600 public school custodimis and service employes ended a threeday strike today, and teachers who had refused to cross their picket lines also went back to work.

title: Gallup Poll Finds One Third Will Eat Less Meat
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Nearly onethird of American consumers plan to fight the cost of meat by eating less of it, in addition to 26 per cent who actively joined the fight by participating in the recent meat boycott, a Gallup survey shows.

title: Royals Drop Protest: They Wouldn't Get to First Base
description: KANSAS CITY, May 16 (UPI) The Kansas City Royals conceded today they had no chance to win their protest against Nolan Ryan's nohitter, so they decided to forget about it. Last night's 30 California victory was played under protest from the third inning on after Manager Jack McKeon of the Royals complained Ryan was not keeping his foot in contact with the pitching rubber.

title: ARMY COPTER CRASH KILLS 7 AT FORT KNOX
description: FORT KNOX, Ky., May 16 (UPI)Six Army officers and a military civilian employe were found dead today in the wreckage of a Huey helicopter that crashed while on a night mission to evaluate newly developed goggles for magnifying moonlight visibility.

title: PITTSBURGH RACE WON BY FLAHERTY
description: Mr. Flaherty, a 47yearold lawyer, overcame for the second time a candidate who received the endorsement of the Democratic city committee. He received 59,431 votes to 49,051 for Councilman Richard S. Caliguiri in the Democratic primary.

title: Article 2  No Title
Governor's Proposal on OTB Would Create Central Board
PRICEFIXING CASE ON STORES WIDENS
description: A widening Federal grand jury investigation of alleged pricefixing by prominent New York stores as far back as 1935, has resulted in the subpoenaing of the records and minutes of the Uptown Retail Guilda former trade association grouping most of the upper Fifth Avenue and Madison Avenue stores.

title: ...Unanswered Questions
description: With the opening of the Ervin committee hearings today, the nation carries forward the taskalready under way in several grand jury roomsof sorting out truth from rumor about the interlocking Crimes and conspiracies known as Watergate. Public testimony by many witnesses over the coming weeks may illuminate the role of one man not likely to be called as a witness, President Nixon.

title: NIXON DECLARES CONGRESS. PERILS ES, TRUCE EFFORT
description: WASHINGTON, May 16President Nixon accused Congress today of action that could severely undermine the chances of restoring peace to Cambodia and all of Indochina.

title: Southern G.O.P. and Goldwater Critical of Nixon on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 President Nixon's handling of the Watergate scandal was strongly criticized today by leading Republicans, who warned that dwindling confidence in the Government was damaging both the country and the party.

title: BROAD ROLE CITED
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Henry A. Kissinger personally provided the Federal Bureau of Investigation with the names of a number of his aides on the National Security Council whom he wanted wiretapped, Justice Department sources said today.Among those tapped at Mr. Kissinger's request, the sources said, was Helmut Sonnenfeldt, a top council official who was nominated last month to be Under Secretary of the Treasury Department.

title: Move Urged in Philadelphia On Councilman's ARA Tie
description: A Philadelphia grand jury recommended yesterday that Isadore H.,Bellis, a city councilman, be indicted for receiving bribes in connection with services he allegedly provided for ARA Services, Inc., and some of its subsidiaries. Such a recommendation is normally turned over to a second grans jury that is empowered to return indictments.

title: Accent on Intelligence
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I.For the many who have served their nation in the Central Intelligence Agency, and have faithfully observed their oath to uphold and defend the Constitution of the United States both during and after their Government service, the Watergate affair is not only repugnant but disappointing and saddening.

title: Roundup: Pirates Lose Seventh of Last Eight Games
description: When Manny Sanguillen became Pittsburgh's regular catcher in 1969, he made mistakes behind the plate and mistakes running the bases, but he overcame it all to become, some say, the second best allround catcher in baseballafter Johnny Bench.

title: Panel Backs a Limit on Campaign Funds
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP)The Senate Commerce Committee approved legislation yesterday to limit campaign spending and the way Presidential candidates would handle their money.

title: Two Rackets Juries Indict 16 Using Bugs and Wiretaps
description: Grand juries in Manhattan and Brooklyn investigating loansharking, numbers gambling and other rackets perater by organizedcrime figures returned 16 indictments yesterday based on courtordered electronic, bugs and wiretapped telephones.

title: Lebanese and Guerrillas Report Identical Views
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 17The Lebanese Government and the Palestinian guerrillas announced today that they had reached identical viewpoints on the settlement of a conflict in which at least 250 persons have been killed in the last two weeks.

title: Grant Is Given to Produce 5 TV Programs on Disease
description: The BristolMyers Company has given WNET/Channel 13 grant of $675,000 to produce, For national public television, a fivepart documentary series called The Killers.

title: Equity Financing
description: A special offering of 75,000 common shares of HarteHanks Newspapers at $11 a share was completed yesterday by Bear Stearns The company's stock closed at 10, down 1 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Pacers Knicks? It's No Match; McGinnis Will Have to Wait for His Duel With DeBusschere
description: Thoughtfully rather than noisily, George McGinnis of the Indiana Pacers predicted yesterday that the American Basketball Association champions would have a chance in a fourofsevengame playoff series with the New York Knicks of the National Basketball Association.

title: MRS. M. H. GREENEBAUM
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., May 17  Mrs. Irma D. Greenebaum, who had been active in the women's division, of the New York Federation of Jewish Phianthropies since 1917, died yesterday at her home here. She was 88 years old. and he widow of M. H. Greenebaum.

title: People and Business
description: George W. Mitchell, a member of the Federal Reserve Board since 1961, has been designated vice chairman by President Nixon. He succeeds J. L. Robertson, who retired last month.

title: SENATE UNIT VOTES WAR POWERS CURE
description: However, as approved by the committee and sent to the Senate floor, de bill does not apply to present hostilities and so would not require a halt in the bombing of Cambodia.

title: Wider Aid for the Elderly Backed by the Legislature
description: ALBANY, May 17The Assembly today approved a variety of bills designed to help the aged, and Senate Republican leaders introduced legislation that would authorize a $100million program of new housing for the elderly.

title: Reneging charged on Rights Unit Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 Staff members of the Community Relations Service have protested that Nixon Administration officials are reneging their promise to find jobs for employes dropped because the agency is being cut back.

title: COUNCIL REPEALS BASERENT PLAN
description: The City Council voted overwhelmingly yesterday to repeal the rentcontrol law's controversial maximumbaserent formula, which permits rent increases of up to 7.5 per cent a year in many controlled apartments here.

title: Radio
Advertising: Widespread Views
description: WHITE SULPHER SPRINGS, W. Va., May 17The American Association of Advertising Agencies got down to the serious business of its 56th annual meeting today by taking a broad view not only of its own industry but also of the nation and the world.

title: Dance: Romeo and Juliet
description: The Stuttgart Ballet is German company. But ballet is an international art.. It was not surprising then that Wednesday's performance of John Cranko's Romeo and Juliet at the Metropolitan Opera House could be led by nearly an allAmerican cast of principals and that the company's newest and youngest ballerina is the Bostonborn Joyce Cuoco.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ANARCHIST SEIZED IN BLAST IN MEAN
description: MILAN, Italy, May 17A young woman was killed and 45 people were injuredfive of them criticallyby a hand grenade hurled into a crowd outside police headquarters here at the end of a ceremony this morning commemorating a slain law enforcement officer.

title: Cornfeld Is Held In Swiss Custody
description: GENEVA, May 17Bernard Cornfeld was remanded in custody by a court here today in a preliminary hearing on charges of having defrauded investors in the multibilliondollar financial complex that he founded.

title: WEE BURN VICTOR IN WOMEN'S GOLF
Bronx Grand Jury To Get Biaggi Case After the Primary
description: A reexamination of the 1959 incident that won Mario Biaggi the Police Department's highest honorhis shooting to death an alleged holdup manwill be presented to a Bronx rand jury after the June 4 primary, according to sources close to the investigation.

title: Watergate Made Odle Glad He Had McCord
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP)When Robert C. Odle Jr., a Nixon campaign official, first heard about the Watergate breakin, he says he told visitors, That could never happen here because have this guy working for me named Jim McCord.

title: GEN. CHARLES WIDDECKE
description: LA PAZ, Mexico, May 17 (AP)  Maj. Gen. Charles F. Widdecke, U.S.A., retired, commander of the First Marine Corps Division in Vietnam, died Sunday in a hospital after suffering a heart attack in a fishing boat a month ago. He was 54 years old.

title: The Spokes of Power
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 There is said to be a highlevel career official here who always stands up at his desk immediately after hearing five magic words: The White House is calling.

title: People in Sports:Riggs, Round 2
description: Bobby Riggs, who apparently has found a new career in women's tennis at the age of 55, yesterday agreed to play Chris Evert in a $50,000 winner take all match at Fort Lauderdale, Fla., on Sept. 22.

title: Vermont Utility Suit Lost
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., May 17 (AP)  The Vermont Public Service Board dismissed today the New England Telephone Company's case for increases in basic service and intrastate toll call charges totaling $7.25million annually. The case was dismissed, the board said, because the company failed to supply information about the costs incurred in providing its different types of services, such as residential and business in both small towns and urban communities.

title: Casey Says He Did Not Know Of Any Mishandling on Vesco
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (UPI)  Under. Secretary of State William J. Casey said today that he had no knowledge of any wrongdoing in the Securities and Exchange Commission's handling of a fraud case against Robert L Vesco when Mr. Casey was S.E.C. chairman. Mr. Vesco is a New Jersey financier.

title: Marijuana Bill Gains
description: DENVER, May. 17 (UPI)A legislative committee voted today to limit marijuana farmers to four acres, adding an amendment to a bill that would legalize growing and selling of marijuana in Colorado. It would be sold through liquor outlets and would be taxed and the revenue would go into the state's oldage pension fund.

title: COUNCIL REPEALS BASERENT PLAN
Body of One of Two Women Shot At Victoria Falls Is Recovered
description: VICTORIA FALLS, Rhodesia, May 17 (AP)  Armed policemen today recovered the body of one of two young Canadian women killed by gunfire on the ZambiaRhodesia border near Victoria Falls on Tuesday.

title: RISE IN POLICE SET FOR PARKS IN CITY
description: As part of a new effort to bring.more people to the city's parks this summer, police patrols will be stepped up and a $1.3million rehabilitation program will be undertaken.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Al Reinfelder, president of the newly formed Striped Bass Fund, an organization dedicated to the preservation of what is probably the most sought after East Coast light tackle marine game fish, has charged that the operation of Consolidated Edison's generating plants at Indian Point on the Hudson River without cooling towers would jeopardize the species from Canada to the Carolinas.

title: RONALDJEANS,WROTE FOR BRITISH STAGE
description: LONDON, May 17 (AP) Ronald Jeans, a writer of comedy for the British stage for more than half a century, died yesterday at the age of 86.

title: HALDEN UNIT PLANS AN END TO BUSINESS
description: The Halden unit, which acts as specialists in 40 issues on the American Stock Exchange, has decided to dissolve its business as of May 31.

title: Pollution Victory
description: The Corporation Counsel of New York won an important victory for this and many other cities throughout the nation with a Federal court decision a few days ago ordering the Nixon Administration to allocate an additional $6 billion for water pollution control.

title: Stock Market Declines Despite Economic Gains
description: Despite an improvement in two key economic barometers yesterday, the stock market continued in the doldrums and finished with a sizable decline in slower trading. prices on the New York Stock Exchange opened down somewhat and gradually drifted lower throughout most of the session.

title: Red Smith
description: BALTIMORE, May 17It is billed in the press releases as THE 98TH PREAKNESS in 100 YEARS, but when you explain that this means the race wasn't run in 18919293, you aren't telling half of it. Since May 27, 1873, when a bay colt named Survivor won the inaugural running at a mile and a half, the Preakness has been contested at one mile, at a mile and 70 yards, a mile and a sixteenth, a mile and an eighth. a mile and a quarter and a mile and three sixteenths, which is the distance Secretariat, Sham and four others will go as fast as they are able on Saturday.

title: City to Bill Candidates For Illegal Advertising
description: I'llpay it, said City Councilman Robert Postel yesterday.

title: SuburbanVoluteers :jobs Are Changing and So. Are Attitudes
description: There she goes  that Westcheste County woman in the pink hospital pine fore with her diamond and Guccisou the door, into a fulltime paid job or new kind of volunteer salon that de mands more from her.

title: HEARING IS TOLD THAT MAGRUDER HAD FILE MOVED
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The deputy director of President Nixon's campaign organization ordered a file that apparently contained political intelligence removed from his desk hours after the Watergate burglary, a Senate select committee was told today as it began public hearings on the case.

title: Approval of 3 Appointments Is Delayed by Senate Unit
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The Senate Foreign Relations Committee is holding up its approval of three key appointments until a full study is made of the appointees role in the formation of recent American policy on Indochina.

title: ALCOHOL IS FOUND IN PILOT'S BLOOD
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The pilot of a plane that was seen stunting before it crashed in New Jersey killing six persons had been drinking so much that he could have been convicted of illegally driving a car, according to a spokesman for the National Transportation Safety Board. The spokesman said today that the blood alcohol content of the pilot, Anthony J. Blasi Jr., 31 years old, of Long Beach, N. J., had been 105 per cent. The blood alcohol content of Carmine J. Inteso of Union, N. J., who occupied the copilot's seat, was 120 per cent, according to the Federal official.

title: Amex Stocks Continue to Drop; 0TC List Also Shows Decline
Off Off Broadway Shows
description: It's advisable to telephone theaters for schedules and prices before going to the show. Most, if not all, theaters accept Theater Development Fund Vouchers.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 17 (UPI)Chartchai Chionoi of Thailand won a world title for the third time tonight when a twoinch gash over Fritz Chervet's left eyebrow put out the Swiss fighter on a fifthround technical knockout in their battle for the World Boxing Association's vacant flyweight crown.

title: MRS. CHARLES D. DICKEY
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 17 Mrs. Catherine Colt Dickey, the wife of Charles D. Dickey, a former partner in J. P. Morgan & do. and a retired director of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, died yesterday in Chestnut Hill Hospital. She was 77 years old and lived also in New York and Northeast Harbor, Me.

title: 3 Sad jockeys Depart. On 10Day Vacations
description: Three jockeys at Belmont Park yesterday were asking themselves the same question. How should they spend the enforced vacations of 10 days handed them by the stewards for infractions last Tuesday?

title: 3 Killed in Ulster By a Bomb in Car; 2 Others Shot Dead
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Friday, May 18 (AP)A car bomb killed at least three persons and injured two others today in an upsurge of Northern Ireland violence.

title: Business Briefs
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 17 (UPI)Oil wells in Texas will run at full capacity for the 15th straight month June, the Texas Railroad Commission said today.

title: COCOA CONTRACTS ADVANCE BY LIMIT Tight Supplies Spur Risesuger price also gain
description: Tight supply conditions continued in the cocoa market yesterday, giving impetus to another round of price increases by the available limit for all except the current May contract on the New York CoCoa Exchdnge.

title: Metropolitan. Briefs
description: The board of directors of the East Side Airlines Terminal, a joint operation of 10 domestic airlines, decided yesterday not to renew a 20year lease that expires on Oct. 31. As a result, according to a spokesman for the company, the terminal is scheduled to close then unless the city or a public agency, such as the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, can be persuaded to step in and keep it going.

title: Football Transactions
description: KANSAS CITYTraded Gerry Philbln, defen sive end to Philadelphia for Leroy Keyes, running back, one Ernie Calloway, defen sive tackle. Signed Frank Cornish, defensive tackle, as free agent.

title: Policeman Denies He Admitted Torture of Suspects on St. Croix
description: CHRISTIANSTED, V. I., May 17 (AP)The United States Attorney for the Virgin Islands, Joel Sacks, testified yesterday at a hearing that he thought a policeman had admitted to him that torture had been used to obtain confessions from the five defendants awaiting trial in the Fountain Valley murder case.

title: Parade Tomorrow
description: The annual Armed Forces Day parade, sponsored by the New York Chapter, Military Order of the World Wars, will be held tomorrow on Fifth Avenue. It is scheduled to start at 2:10 P.M. at 92d Street, proceeding south to 62d Street. The reviewing stand will be on the west side of Fifth Avenue at 69th Street.

title: MRS. WILLIAM W. HAM
description: TEANECK, N. J., May 17Mrs. Charlotte Brown Ham, widow of William W. Ham, a member of the drama staff of the old New York Sun and later a press agent, died yesterday in the Brightside Home here. She was 94 years old and formerly lived in New York.

title: GUIDELINE ISSUED FOR PROSECUTOR
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Elliot L. Richardion, in the continuing search for a special prosecutor for the Watergate investigation, issued a detailed set of guidelines today that apparently would give wide discretion and power to whoever takes up the task.

title: Girl, 16, Is Raped Four Times During Ordeal in Central Park
description: A 16yearold girl was robbed and raped four times near the Central Park Zoo yesterday afternoon by a young man who held, her captive for five hours, the police announced last night.

title: 200 Priests and Overflow Crowd Mourn Slain Pastor
description: More than 200 priests, singing and praying, marched into St. Bonaventure's Roman Catholic Church in Queens yesterday morning for a funeral service for the Rev. John P. Conlon, the church's pastor, who was found shot to death in the rectory basement Sunday nights

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Al Reinfelder, president of the newly formed Striped Bass Fund, an organization dedicated to the preservation of what is probably the most sought after East Coast light tackle marine game fish, has charged that the operation of Consolidated Edison's generating plants at Indian Point on the Hudson River without cooling, towers would jeopardize the species from Canada to the Carolinas.

title: State Arts Unit Cites Martha Graham
description: Martha Graham and Ellen Stewart, two pioneering women in their respective field of dance and theater, were among the seven recipients yesterday of the eighth annual New York State Awards for outstanding contributions to the state's artistic and cultural life.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ON THE CARPET Until about 15 years ago, about 80 per cent of American rug dealers were of Armenian provenance  with the boom in oriental rugs, the percentage may have diminished but the Armenian stamp is still strong. All of which is by way of explaining that rugs will play an important part in the fair and auction being held to mark the 75th anniversary of the founding of the first Armenian Church diocese in America (it all started in western Massachusetts). This takes place tomorrow and Sunday from noon to midnight at the Gulbenkian Cultural Center, 630 Second Avenue, at 35th Street (6860710)

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: BaltimoreBuddy Boggs, Baltimore, knocked out Kid Bassey, Jamaica, 8 rounds, welterweights.

title: A Dark Atmosphere
description: It may have been legal at the time it was started, but it was a dirty and indefensible business, nevertheless, for President Nixon and Henry Kissinger to eavesdrop and spy on Mr. Kissinger's associates on the National Security Council staff. At that, it was so dubiously legal that the Supreme Court, with Nixon appointees Burger, Blackmun, Rehnquist and Powell sitting, has since struck down the claim of the Nixon Administration to have the unchecked right to tap and bug anyone or any group it suspected of threatening whatever it considered to be the national security.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Turbans are expendable and the platformshoe craze is on, the wane. But to keep in step with fashion it is absolutely essential that you acquire, at least one big, long bulky sweater next fall. Some of the nicest will, carry the Kasper label for J. L. Sport.

title: Candidates'
description: RepreSentative Mario Biaggi picked, up the campaign trail yesterday in his quest for the Democratic mayoral nomination, shaking hands briskly with morning rushhour subway riders and.getting a generally cordial greeting in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn.

title: Burundi Breaks Israeli Ties
description: TEL AVIV, May 17 (UN)Burundi has broken diplomatic relations with Israel, the sevAfrican nation to do so enth since the ArabIsraeli war of 1967, a Government official said today. The others are Uganda, Chad, Niger, the Congo, Mali and Guinea.

title: 30,000 Mice and Rats Will Be Given Full Life Spans in a Cancer Research Project Set in Maryland
description: FORT DETRICK, Md., May 17  A building is being prepared here for experiments in which several thousand mice and rats will live in relative comfort, remarkable cleanliness and virtually complete security until old age.

title: BIG RISE IN PROFIT CONFIRMED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 The Government confirmed today what private surveys had already showna big increase in corporate profits in the first quarter of this year.

title: Wims Will Head Athletics
description: XENIA, Ohio, May 17 (AP)Dr. Lu Wims was named today as athletic director of Central State (Ohio) University. Wims succeeds William Lucas, who resigned the athletic director's post last month but will continue for a year as basketball coach before retiring.

title: PAPER REPORTS PLAN TO DISCREDIT ERVIN
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 17 (UPI)H. R. Haldeman, the former White House chief of staff, made two attempts two months ago to enlist North Carolina Republicans in a campaign to damage the credibility of Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, the Charlotte Observer said today.

title: Broad Rise Shown by Interest Rates After Moves
Credit Tightening Raises Business Loan Expense
description: The nation's largest banks may find themselves in a pain ful squeeze as a result of the Federal Reserve System's latest moves to tighten credit, key, banking officials said yesterday.

title: Dan Sikes Registers 67 To Lead Golf by Stroke
TV and Radio Coverage Of Watergate Hearings
description: Today's sessions of the Senate Watergate hearings will be televised live and in full by the Columbia Broadcasting System (WCBS) and the National Broadcasting Company (WNBC), as well as by WNET, WNYC and WPIX. The American Broadcasting Company's coverage will run from 2 to 4:30 P.M.

title: Newsman Is Slain
description: CHICAGO, May 17 (UPI)The police charged Charles McAdams today with the death of John D. Chamberlain, night editor of The Chicago Daily NewsSun wire service. The police said they were called to Mr. Chamberlain's North Side apartment by Mr. McAdams, who identified himself as a friend of Mr. Chamberlain, who died from an apparent beating.

title: Theater: In the Words of Ogden Nash;Nash at NineOpens at Helen Hayes
Grumman Meeting Is Told of Hopes for Navy F14 Jet Purchase
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., May 17The Grumman Corporation's president, John C. Bierwirth, told the company's annual meeting here today that the corporation had submitted to the Navy a. proposal under which the Department of Defense would purchase further lots of the F14 jet fighter.

title: Council Panel Votes to Reform Tax Commission
description: Two bills aimed at reforming the city's Tax Commission, by insulating its seven commissioners from political pressures and requiring public records of reduction in realestate assessments, were approved yesterday by the City Council's Charter and. Governmental Operations Committee.

title: Palestinians Still See Victory Despite 25 Years of Setbacks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 17Twentyfive years after the creation of the state of Israel, the uprooted Palestinian Arabs not only are at war with Israel but are in conflict with Arab Governments and among themselves.

title: Rights Group Says Nixon's Opposition Fails to Daunt
description: The N.A.A.C.P. Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Inc., is now opposed by the Nixon Administration in a very large number of occasions, but continues its winning record in the Federal courts, its director and counsel, Jack Greenberg, said here yesterday.

title: Yankees Down Brewers,42
Roundup: Palmer Hurls 3Hitter, Orioles Win, 41
description: Gaylord Perry, who won the Cy Young Award as the American League's best pitch er last year, failed to impress the Baltimore Orioles with his talent last night in Cleveland's Municipal Stadium.

title: Wider Aid for the Elderly Backed by the Legislature
description: ALBANY, May 17The Assembly today approved a variety of bills designed to help the aged, and Senate Republican leaders introduced legislation that would authorize a $100million program of new housing for the elderly.

title: U.S. MAFIA CASE IS HURT UPSTATE
description: BUFFALO, May 17A gambling case that the Federal Bureau of Investigation once called potentially the most crippling strike ever against the Mafia in upstate New York was in effect tossed out of Federal Court here today.

title: PRIEST IS SENTENCED ON FORGERY CHARGE
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I., May 17 (UPI)A Roman Catholic priest who ran a drug treatment center was placed on probation for three years today and ordered to pay back $1,700 that he was accused of obtaining for the center by forging signatures on welfare checks sent to expatients.

title: Powers Reelected Chief Of Typographical Union 6
description: Bertram A. Powers, president of Typographical Union No. 6, has been reelected to a new twoyear term, according to returns in the union's election that were counted yesterday.

title: Education Report Put Off
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) President Nixon signed today a resolution extending the final reporting date of the NaItional Commission on Financing of Postsecondary Education from April 30 to Dec. 31.

title: Kissinger and Tho Open Paris Talks
description: PARIS, May 17The United States and North Vietnam today, bvan a series of talks here on him to end violations of the Vietnam ceasefire agreement.

title: Richardson's Guidelines for Watergate Prosecutor
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Following is the text of the guidelines for a special Watergate prosecutor released today by Elliot L. Richardson, Attorney Generaldesignate:

title: A Forceful Oklahoman
description: An Oklahoman and a Democrat... Sworn in as S.E.C. commissioner in 1964 by President Johnson... Current term expires June, 1975... Previously acted as temporary chairman of S. E. C. for four months in 1971.. Later cited by President Nixon for serving with great distinction'... Practiced law for 20 years in Oklahoma City where he was active as a civic leader... Prior to S.E.C. appointment headed Oklahoma Securities Commission... Never active in politics... His reputation at S. E. C. is that of forceful regulator and administrator,

title: A Poverty Worker Charged With Rape Is Suspected in 16
description: A 28yearold city antipoverty worker and New York University Law School graduate was charged with rape yesterday and the police said be was suspected of committing 15 other rapes on the. Upper East Side in the last three years:

title: ROCKEFELLER SIGNS TAXCUT MEASURE
description: ALBANY, May 17Governor Rockefeller today signed without fanfare the taxcut measure that he had resisted until recently, and conceded that there might be a modest budget surplus in the coming year.

title: Green Beret Exercise
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., May 17 (AP)Administrative and tactical headquarters, have been established at Fort Devens by Green Berets of the 10th Special Forces Group for a field training exercise.

title: Notes on People
description: Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia began the 10th anniversary meeting of the Organization of African Unity, in Addis Ababa, with a declaration that all of Africa would be liberated from foreign domination in the next 10 years. The experience of the last 10 years has proved that Africans are capable of uniting and shaping their destiny, the Emperor asserted. He said it was a sad fact, however, that in the past decade Portuguese colonialism and the South African racist regime persisted.

title: FONTAINE TO DRIVE IN THE MESSENGER
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 17  Every driver in the Roosevelt Raceway paddock would have liked to have the dilemma that John Chapman faced, before the 18th Messenger Stakes which will run Saturday night. Chapman solved his driving situation in the only way he could and Lucien Fontaine may turn out the real beneficiary of the decision.

title: Mrs. Nixon Tells Press That She Is Fall of Faith
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (UPI)I'm full of faith and confidence, said Mrs. Richard M, Nixon today when asked for comment on the Watergate scandal.

title: Two Zoos Are Wiging a Custody Battle Over Patty coke
description: A custody battle has developed within the last few weeks between the Bronx Zoo and the Central Park Zoo over the future of Patty Cake, the baby gorilla.

title: Lebanese and Guerrillas Report Identical Views
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 17The Lebanese Government and the Palestinian guerrillas an nounced today that they had reached identical viewpoints on the settlement of a conflict in which at least 250 persons have been killed in the last two weeks.

title: DABNEY HELPS BOYS RETAIN TRACK TITLE
description: Boys High School scored 41 points yesterday to retain its Public Schools Athletic League track championship as five meet records were broken and two were equaled at Downing Stadium, Randalls Island. In tie for second, with 30 points, were. Brooklyn. Tech, South Shore, Midwood and East New York.

title: Sanity Defendant Confined
description: ROANOKE, Va., May 17 (AP)  Richard Ames Offutt, who was acquitted yesterday of charges of threatening the President, today was ordered confined to a mental hospital until doctors could decide whether he was sane enough to be set free. The civil order was issued after a sanity hearing in Roa noke Municipal Court.

title: Mulligan Leads Sextet at Half Note
description: Gerry Mulligan, who has been playing his baritone saxophone with Dave Bru beck's group for the last five years, has taken a brief leave of absence to lead a sextet of his own this week at the Half Note. For what is presumably a more or less pickup group, the sextet is remarkably tight and polished.

title: Ferry Planned to Connect Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: The South Street Seaport Museum announced yesterday that it planned to set up a passenger ferny service between Manhattan and Brooklyn at peak travel hours, hopefully by next spring.

title: TV Radio: Watergate
description: Potentially the most explosive television and radio special of the year, The Watergate Hearings began yesterday, as anticipated, on a note of dramatic laboriousness. Most of the opening session was devoted to establishing precisely the chains of command existing within both the White House and the Committee for the ReElection of the President before and after the Watergate burglary.

title: GUIDELINE ISSUED FOR PROSECUTOR
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 Elliot L. Richardson, in the continuing search for a special prosecutor for the Watergate investigation, issued a detailed set of guidelines today that apparently would give wide discretion and power to Whoever takes up the task.

title: Romney Studies Race For Utah Senate Seat
description: SALT LAKE CITY, May 17 (AP)A Utah Republican party official said today that former Gov. George Romney of Michigan had indicated possible interest in seeking a United States Senator seat from Utah in 1974.

title: Palestinians Still See Victory Despite 25 Years of Setbacks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 17Twentyfive years after the creation of the state of Israel, the uprooted Palestinian Arabs not only are at war with Israel but are in conflict with Arab Governments and among themselves.

title: Launching of Skylab Crew Put. Off Until Next Friday
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 17The launching of the Skylab 1 astronauts was postponed again today until next Friday, May 25, to give them time to Bain for the necessary repair job on the overheated space station.

title: Cubs Recall Juan Pizarro
description: CHICAGO, May 17 (UPI)The Chicago Cubs recalled Juan Pizarro today from their Wichita farm club of the American Association and optioned a rookie righthander, Ray Burris, to the same team. The 36yearold Pizarro had 41 wonlost record with Wichita and an earnedrun average of 3.33.

title: A LowKey Beginning Before Rapt Audience
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Precisely at 10 A.M., Sam J. Ervin Jr. hefted the new gavel carved for him by a Cherokee Indian, then rapped it on a long table cloaked in green felt, and the 1972 Presidential campaign went on trial today in the Senate.

title: PAETRUS F. BANMILLER
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 17 (AP) Paetrus F. Banmiller, group vice president for the Budd Company, died today in hospital near here. He was 59 years old.

title: LOMENZO REVEALS A G.0,P.JOB OFFER
description: Secretary of State John P. Lomenzo acknowledged yesterday that he had recently discussed taking a position with the Republican National Committee in Washington with the committee chairman, but Mr. Lomenzo maintained that it had nothing to do with an investigation involving him by the State Task Force on Organized Crime.

title: Excerpts From Transcript of Statements and Testimony at the Watergate Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Following are excerpts from a transcript of opening statements and testimony today before the Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities on the first day of its hearings into the Watergate case:

title: Philharmonic Promenades Begin 11th Season With. Spring Flavor
description: Fans of the New York Philharmonic's Promenades will be delighted to know that the cafe tables and chairs are back in place on the orchestra level of Philharmonic Hall, that Andre Kostelanetz is back on the podium and, in short, that the 11th season of the orchestra's easylistening soirees is now under way.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers drawn on May 17 were:

title: Kissinger. And Helms
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The more you analyze the testimony in the Watergate scandals, the more you have to wonder about the closed atmosphere or don't call me system around the White House in which all these extraordinary events occurred.

title: American League
M'CRANE BOOKED ON BRIBE CHARGES
description: TRENTON, May 17  Former State Treasurer Joseph M. McCrane Jr. surrendered to the state police today on bribery, conspiracy and misconduct charges.

title: Harvester Profit Up 17% in Quarter
Robert F. Warner is Dead at 64; Chairman of Hotel Marketers
description: Robert F. Warner, board chairman of Robert F. Warner, Inc., which specializes in marketing independent hotels and resorts throughout the world, died yesterday at Glencoe, his home in ArdsleyonHudson, N. Y. He was 64 years old.

title: A Mobil Dealer's Sales Are Up 400% Despite Reports of Gasoline Shortage
description: LITTLE FALLS, N. J., May 17  Despite fullpage newspaper advertisements by Mobil saying gasoline is in short supply, a Mobil dealer here is pumping, five times as much gasoline as he was a year ago when there was no announced shortage, and Mobil is giving him as much gasoline as he can sell.

title: GOLD PRODUCERS SAID TO LIFT SALES
description: PARIS, May 17A highlevel Swiss banker close to the gold market said today that the Soviet Union and South Africa, he world's two biggest gold producers, had stepped up heir sales in the open market to take advantage of what he called very nice prices.

title: Retail Store Sales Up 13%
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.044billion, up 20 per cent from the yearearlier $872million.

title: Jewish Activist in Soviet Reported Sent to Siberia
description: MOSCOW, May 17 (AP)Yevgeny Levich, a Jewish astrophysicist who was reportedly arrested yesterday on. a Moscow street, has been inducted into the army as a private and sent to a military district in Siberia, Jewish sources said today.

title: Chilean Emergency Ended
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 17 (UPI)President Salvador Allende Gossens today lifted the state of emergency he decreed 12 days ago in Santiago Province to halt renewed political violence. He said the conditions that caused the state of emergency to be invoked no longer existed,

title: JUDGE INSTRUCTS CAMDEN 28 JURY
description: CAMDEN, May 17  The Camden 28 trial went to the jury this afternoon after 15 weeks in Federal District Court here.

title: Alexandre de Manziarly, Was French Diplomat Hen
description: Alexandre de Manziarly, a retired French diplomat who had served many years in this country, died April 29 in the American Hospital in Paris. He was 74 years old.

title: Stock Price Drops As Seaboard Line Alters Its Dividend
description: Shares of Seaboard Coast Line Industries, Inc., plummeted 10 points to 23 yesterday after the company announced its directors had indicated they temporarily would adopt a stock dividend policy, instead of continuing cash dividend payments. Stock dividends usually are based on a percentage of the shares owned.

title: Legal Aid Plan Modified
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) The right of Federal antipoverty lawyers to testify for legislation on behalf of their clients was approved today by a House subcommittee drafting a Legal Services Corporation bill.

title: GRAVES UNIT VISITS HANOI AGAIN TODAY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 17 (AP)North Vietnam agreed today that a United States military team could visit Hanoi again tomorrow to inspect the graves a number of Americans who died while prisoners of war.

title: Governor's Judiciary
description: Governor Rockefeller's attempt to pack the state courts with scores of new judgesnamed by himselfto handle drug penalties downgrades his larger effort to restructure and reform the court system. Surely the State Legislature will not allow the Court of Claims to be used as a funnel for slipping through judges without proper appointive or elective safeguards.

title: Israel Stays Undefeated
description: VIENNA, May 17 (AP)Undefeated Israel defeated Turkey, 8883, in the qualifying round of the European basketball championships tonight, Other scores were France 61, Greece 57, West Germany 76, and East Germany 72. Israel has wbn four games; France is 31.

title: Larchmont Pair Gains Tie
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., May 17 (AP)Jack and Jim Linville of the Larchmont, N. Y., Yacht Club scored their second victory in five races yesterday and pulled into a tie for first place in the North American Tempest Class sailing championships.

title: Rites Held for 2 Women Found Hanged in Home
description: MONTCLAIR, May 17  Funeral services were conducted here this morning for Mrs. Renee Cali, 46 years old, and her daughter, Mrs. Leslie Grant, 24, who were found hanged in their home in Upper Montclair.

title: New Hope for Skylab
description: Skylab's troubles are not over, and it is still most unlikely that the full schedule of planned experiments can be carried out over the months ahead. But a striking technical innovation has dispelled the very deep gloom that arose earlier this week, when the space station was plagued simultaneously by the failure of some of its solar power cells to go into action properly, and by the rapidly mounting internal temperature as the sun poured in with heat unchecked because a thermal shield had been ripped away. Adept maneuvering of the Skylab vehicle has now placed it in an optimum position which it is sufficiently shielded from the sun to keep down the internal temperature but yet sufficiently exposed to the sun so that those power cells which are functioning can provide the needed energy.

title: Books of The Times
description: FEAR AND LOATHING: ON THE CAMPAIGN TRAIL 72. By Dr. Hunter S. Thompson. 506 pages, Illustrated by Ralph Steadman. Straight Arrow Books, $7.95.

title: Mets Rained Out
description: MONTREAL, May 17The New York Mets ended their strangestand best  road trip of the season tonight when rain postponed their game with the Montreal Expos, sending Yogi Berra and his ragtag army home with four victories in five games.

title: Gateway Gains in Council, But May Stall in Albany
description: The City Council took action yesterday in favor of creating the Gateway National Recreation Area, but there were indications that the Federal project was running into problems in the State Legislature.

title: College, School Results
Commodity Price Index Up 1.8 From WeekAgo Level
DR. PAUL W. GAST, GEOLOGIST, IS DEAD
description: HOUSTON, May 17Paul W. Gast, professor of geology at Columbia University and chief of the Division of Planetary and Earth Sciences at the Lyndon B. Johnson Space Center here, died yesterday in St. Joseph's Hospital. He was 43 years old.

title: Main Dish of Noodles in Anchovy Sauce
description: In the menu below, the dish marked with an asterisk is followed by a recipe.

title: Convoy of 8 Ships Is Attacked Near Phnom Perch
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 17 (Reuters)A shipping convoy with urgently needed fuel supplies for Phnom Penh came under heavy fire today about 16 miles east of the Cambodian capital, military sources said.

title: Perfectionist Watergate Counsel;Samuel Dash.
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Samuel Dash admitted today that he was a little nervous before the Watergate committee's opening session began, and there was reason. He is a central figure in the drama, and he himself has said of his appointment as the committee's chief counsel: Everything I've done personally led up to this job. For the 48yearold, partly bald Mr. Dash, everything is a word that takes in a lot. He is now a professor of law at the Georgetown University.Law Center and director of the center's Institute of Criminal Law and Procedure. He has been, among other things, a trial lawyer, a district attorney, a consultant to or member of numerous. American Bar Association projects and committees, the author of a study of electronic investigation, The Eavesdroppers, and a classmate of former Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst at Harvard Law School.

title: Provan Excels as Atoms Conquer Finn Harps, 40
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 17 (AP) Andy Provan of Southport, England, scored three goals as the Philadelphia Atoms beat the Finn Harps of Ballyhovey, Ireland, 4.0 last night in an exhibition soccer game before 10,191 at Veterans Stadium.

title: Tanner and Gottfried Move Ahead in Las Vegas Tennis
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 17Roscoe Tanner and Brian Gottfried, who weren't old enough to lose any money in this gambling kingdom one year ago, are threatening to run off with the big dollars in the Alan King tennis tournament.

title: 3 AIRLINES PUT OFF DISCOUNTPLAN END
description: Spokesmen for three international airlines said yesterday that transAtlantic student discount fares would be discontinued about June 27and not on June 1 as originally announced. This means that most of the several thousand Americans who have bought vacation tickets under the discount plan will be able to use them this summer after all, airline officials said.

title: British Boats Quit Icelandic Waters In Fishing Dispute
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, May 17 (Reuters)The British trawler fleet is withdrawing from lceland's disputed 50mile fishing limits because it has not been given naval protection, the Icelandic Coast Guard reported today.

title: RONAN SAYS FARE. MAY RISE TO 60C
description: A catastrophic 60centt ransit fare is virtually inevitable next year unless $300million in subsidies is forthcoming from the city, state and Federal governments, Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, said yesterday.

title: The B52 Letters
description: These excerpts from letters to Senator J. W. Fulbright are reprinted from the Congressional Record. Names of the writers were not disclosed.

title: Bridge U.S. Defeats Indonesia, 128, In World Championship Play
description: GUARUJA, Brazil, May 17 The United States team defeated the Indonesian team, 128, today, in the world bridge championships, regaining some ground lost yesterday, when it was defeated, 146, by Brazil, and 182, by the Aces, the defending champions here.

title: Ann Klein Challenges 2 Men in Jersey Race
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., May 17  There were the usual number of wisecracks about women's lib before Ann Klein appeared here at a meeting of the Bergen County A.F.L.C.I.O. Committtee on Political Education.

title: MEMOREX MAY CUT COMPUTER PROGRAM
description: If it cannot raise sufficient additional capital this year, the Memorex Corporation may reduce its MRX computers systems program, Laurence L. Spitters, president, and chief executive officer told the annual meeting yesterday in Santa Clara, Calif. He said that at the present rate of leasing, the company would derive less than $4million in rentals this year.

title: Philbin Is. Traded to Eagles By Chiefs for Two Players
description: KANSAS CITY, May 17 (AP) The Kansas City Chiefs obtained Leroy Keyes, a back, and Ernie Calloway, a defensive tackle, from the Philadelphia Eagles today in exchange for Gerry Philbin, a defensive end.

title: Beame's Stock Soaring in Marine Park
description: This place is a landmark known throughout the world, Vincent Cardullo, the proprietor for the last 40 years of the Airport Bar, was saying the other day.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mourners overflowed St. Bonaventure's Roman Catholic Church in Queens for the funeral of the Rev. John P. Conlon, the pastor, who was found shot to death in the rectory on Sunday.

title: ROGERSIN COLOMBIA; STUDENTS PROTEST
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, May 17 (AP)About 100 students tried unsuccessfully to block the route of Secretary of State William P. Rogers after his arrival at Bogota's airport today.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Milwaukee Brewers, at Yankee Stadium, Myer Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, (TelevisionChannel 11, 6 P.M.) (RadioWMCA, 6 P.M.)

title: Aide Quits C. I. A., Impugning Its Honesty
New Union Promises Better Daze Ahead
description: Howard Coughlin, president of the Office and Professional Employes Interna tional Union, announced yesterday the granting of charter for a West Coast hypnotists local.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Loss of power on the Penn Central's main line caused Widespread delays on commuter trains heading for New York City and on other trains. A railroad spokesman said an undertermined breakdown shut off power near New Brunswick at 6 A.M., crippling the four tracks of the line that carry trains into. New York and south to Philadelphia and Washington.

title: ABlast in Colorado Does Less Damage Than Was Expected
description: RIO BLANCO, Colo., May 17 An underground nuclear explosion equal to 90,000 tons of TNT sent gentle seismic ripples through the northwestern Colorado mountains this morning, causing small rock slides and a few cracked plaster walls but doing far less damage than had been expected.

title: Ronan Says He Pays His Way, Despite Pass
description: At his news conference on a possible 60cent transit fare next year, Dr, William J. Ronan was asked yesterday if he had.a pass entitling him to ride subway trains and buses for nothing. Yes, do, he said.

title: Eaton of Giants Retires; Beset by Double Vision
description: Scott Eaton, of the New York Giants, still suffering double vision from an injury he suffered in a scrimmage last year, announced yesterday his retirement from pro football. Eaton, 28 years old, who started at the left corner for four seasons, and at strong safety in 1971, suffered the injury when he tackled Ron Johnson in a Giant scrimmage game in training camp.

title: Film:Extreme Close Up
Acting S.E.C. Head Sees No Setback
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Hugh F. Owens, acting chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, told key members of the commission's staff today that he expected no major slowing or setback in the commission's work as a result of the resignation of G. Bradford Cook from the chairmanship.

title: FRAUD IS CHARGED IN ENERGY FUNDS
Nader Assails Maine Paper Concerns
description: AUGUSTA, Me., May 17Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, charged today that the pulp and paper industry had turned Maine into a paper plantation that imposed a onecrop economy with a onecrop politics which exploits the water, air, soil and people of a beautiful state.

title: A LowKey Beginning Before Rapt Audience
description: WASHINGTON, May 17Precisely at 10 A.M., Sam J. Ervin Jr. hefted the new gavel carved for him by a Cherokee Indian, then rapped it on a long table cloaked in green felt, and the 1972 Presidential campaign went on trial today in the Senate.

title: Simple Fare in OldFashioned Saloon
description: Landmark Tavern, 626 Eleventh Avenue (at 46th Street), 757.8595.

title: 3 on KilledinAction List
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) The Defense Department today changed the status of three Army sergeants in Southeast :Asia from captured or missing to dead by hostile action. One of them was S. Sgt. Walter Ferguson Jr. of Brooklyn, who had been listed as captured.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
C.P.B. Aides Deny Pressure Charges
description: Two more members of the board of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting have denied allegations that the White House exercised any improper influence on the independent board. At the same time, both men acknowledged that they had been in contact with White House staff members on important issues confronting the board.

title: The Consuming Shadowns
description: CAMBRIDGEIn resigning his post as President Nixon's chief domestic adviser, John D. Ehrlichman wrote: The nature of my position... has always demanded that my conduct be both apparently and actually beyond reproach. I have always felt that the appearance of honesty and integrity is every bit as important to such a position, as the fact of one's honesty and integrity. This is highly questionable moral philosophy, but truer, words of political realism have rarely been spoken.

title: Ann Klein Fights Organization Men in Quest ford Nomination as Governor
description: HACKENSACK, May 17 There were the usualnumber of wisecracks about women's lib before Ann Klein appeared here at a meeting of the Bergen County A.F.L.C.I.O. Committee on Political Education.

title: Death Penalty Bill Signed By Governor in Oklahoma
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 17 (AP)Gov. David Hall signed a death penalty bill into law today, hailing it as a deterrent to crime.

title: Rail TonMileage Gains
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 16.7 billion tonmiles, 7.1 per cent above the corresponding week a year ago. Carloadings in the same week totaled 546,874 cars, 4.1 per cent above last year. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 8.4 per cent above last year.

title: PROTOCOL TRICKY FOR U.S. IN CHINA
C. I. A Aide Says Gray Told Him in 1972 He Urged Ousting All in Watergate Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The deputy director of the Central Intelligence Agency says that L. Patrick Gray 3d, then acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, told him almost a year ago he had recommended that all those involved in the Watergate affair be discharged.

title: The Pop Life
description: The Bob Dylan and Kris Kristofferson film, Pat Garret and Billy the Kid (directed by Som Peckinpah), opens here Wednesday.. Dylan and Kristofferson both act in the film and have written the music for it.

title: Lawyers Take the Reins Held by Literary Agents
description: The scene was a palatial Plaza Hotel suite, littered with cocktail glasses and uneaten hors d'oeuvres. The cast included Irving Wallace, the bestselling novelist, and a group of powerful publishing executives who were there to negotiate a $2.3million contract for Mr. Wallace's next four books the largest known guarantee against royalties ever agreed to by a publishing concern.

title: Web of Suspicion
description: White House acknowledgment that the President ordered wiretaps on thirteen National Security Council aides and four newsmenreportedly at the persona instigation of Henry A. kissinger in some casesoffers further dismaying evidence of the degree to which individual liberties and the integrity of the executive branch itself have been compromised under the climate of selfrighteousness, secrecy and suspicion in which the Nixon Administration has operated.

title: SALEM POLICE CHIEF: SEIZED IN GAMBLING
description: TRENTON, May 17 (AP) Police Chief George A, Johnson, of Salem was arrested today on an indictment charging him with misconduct in office and gambling.

title: Oklahoma Governor Says I.R.S: Aims At Key Democrats
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 17 (UPI)  Gov. David Hall and Secretary of State John Rogers said today that they and other elected Democratic officials in several states were under investigation by the Internal Revenue Service in what Mr. Rogers called a giant polticial espionage by the Nixon.Administration that is just like Watergate.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Said to Influence Son's Acquisition of Auto Plant
description: NEW DELHI, May, 17  A controversy involving a son of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi is providing ammunition for political opponents who seek to embarrass her.

title: FAMULA TRIUMPHS BY SHOT IN JERSEY
A. &
description: Abraham & Straus, Brook lyn's largest store and the mos profitable store division of Federated Department Stores Inc., is expected soon to un dergo a major change in it top mangement.

title: 6 ACCUSED BY U.S. IN $750,000 FRAUD
description: A Federal grand jury in Man hattan handed down a 30count,, indictment yesterday against six men accused of having perpetrated a $750,000 stock fraud in a Tenafly, N. J., nursing home company.

title: HEARING IS TOLD THAT MAGRUDER HAD FILE MOVED
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The deputy director of President Nixon's campaign organization ordered a file that apparently contained political intelligence removed from his desk hours after the Watergate burglary, Senate select committee was told today as it began public hearings on the case.

title: Aaron Sues Soap Concern On HomeRun promotion
description: Hank Aaron of the Atlanta Braves, who is chasing Babe Ruth's career homerun record, sued Lever, Bros. yesterday, charging the company reneged on a contract that would have paid Aaron more than $100,000 to promote Lifebuoy soap.

title: Federal Aides and Sioux Open Talks
description: KYLE, S. D,, May 17Some of the descendants of the Teton Sioux, in eaglefeather headdress and beaded buckskin, met with five White House negotiators today in an attempt regain some of their land and power.

title: Times Announces A Picture Service For World Media
description: The New York Times Company yesterday announced the formation of a new facility, NYT Pictures, to serve the picture needs of worldwide media.

title: ABlast in Colorado Does Less Damage Than Was Expected
description: RIO BLANCO, Colo., May 17 An underground nuclear explosion equal to 90,000 tons, of TNT sent gentle seismic ripples through the northwestern Colorado mountains this morning, causing small rock slides and a few cracked plaster walls but doing far less damage than had been expected.

title: Memories, Cuban Film Draws a Bead on Alienation
Launching of Skylab Crew Put Off Until Next Friday
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 17The launching of the Skylab 1 astronauts was postponed again today until next Friday, May 25, to give them time to train for the necessary repair job on the overheated space station.

title: Mobil in Egyptian Pact
description: The Mobil Oil Corporatibn said today it had signed concession agreement with the Egyptian General Petroleum Corporation cevering about 1,5 million acres offshore in the Nile delta area east of Alexandria.

title: SEGRETTI DENIES CAMPAIGN GUILT
description: TAMPA, Fla., May 17Donald H. Segretti, a California lawyer who allegedly headed political sabotage operation for the Republican party in last Year's campaign, pleaded not guilty today to charges that he helped to prepare and distribute a fictitious letter in the Florida primary election.

title: As Tito Tires
description: For a man of eighty, President Tito of Yugoslavia celebrated last New Year's Eve with an energy suggesting he was decades younger. Not until 5 Alt did he go to bed after a night of making speeches, singing, drinking toasts, dancing. But now, less than five months later, it has, been officially indicated in Belgrade that Tito is no longer immune to the effects of age. His fatigue and, need to conserve his energy have resulted in a medically ordered rest period which, among other things, kept him from a recent major party conference.

title: BONN OPPOSITION PICKS A LEADER
description: BONN, May 17In the midst of a leadership crisis, Germany's Opposition today elected Dr. Karl Carstens, a man who has been in Parliament only six months, as its parliamentary floor leader, replacing Dr. Rainer Barzel.

title: World Court to Hear French ATest Case
description: THE HAGUE, May 17 (Reuters)The International Court of Justice will begin a hearing Monday on Australian and New Zealand protests over French nuclear tests in the South Pacific, the Court announced today.

title: A Man Disillusioned by Politics
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 17 Early every weekday morning, a slight young man named Hugh W. Sloan Jr. emerges from a saltbox house on the outskirts of this university town, climbs into a late model sedan and drives 40 miles to his desk in an industrial complex in Philadelphia.

title: CAPT. L. F. SAFFORD, NAVY CODES EXPERT
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP)  Capt. Laurance F. Safford U.S.N., retired, who was as sistant director of naval corn munications for cryptographic research in World War II, died Tuesday in Bethesda Naval Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived in this area.

title: Dealer's Sales Rise 400% Despite Mobil Shortage
description: LITTLE FALLS, N. J. May 17  Despite fullpage newspaper advertisements by Mobil saying gasoline is in short supply, a Mobil dealer here is pumping five times as much gasoline as he was a year ago when there was no announced shortage, and Mobil is giving him as much gasoline as he can sell.

title: PARTNERSHIP PLAN PROPOSED BY P.B.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The Public Broadcasting Service proposed today its own agreement for partnership to counter a declaration of peace offered last week by the Corporation for Public Broadcasting in the continuing struggle over who will control the public television network.

title: NORTH KOREA VOTED MEMBER OF W.H.O.
description: GENEVA, May 17North Korea made its entry into the United Nations complex today when it was accepted as a member of the World Health Organization, a specialized agency.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BERKELEY HEIGHTS, May 17  The words age group and swimming have been linked together for almost 20 years in the minds of American sports fans, but a different kind of agegroup swimming is flourishing at the Garden State Swim Club here.

title: For Montreal,the Spirit of 76 Carries a $312Million Price Tag, Marked Down
description: MONTREAL, May 17The next summer Olympic Games, to be staged here in 1976, received an endorsement of confidence this week following a visit to the city by Willi Daume of West Germany, a vice president of the International Olympic Committee and a most influential person in these matters.

title: U.S. REPORT CUTS GAS ESTIMATES
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 The staff of the Federal Power Commission reported today that a review it made of natural gas supplies indicated a reserve 9 per cent lower than an estimate by gas producers.

title: Ferry Planned to Connect Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: The South Street Seaport Museum announced yesterday that it planned to set up a passenger ferry service between Manhattan and Brooklyn at peak travel hours, hopefully by next spring.

title: Florida Refuses to Impeach The Lieutenant Governor
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., May 18 (UPI)  The Florida House refused by 17 votes yesterday to impeach Lieut. Gov. Tom Adams for using public employes for personal gain while Secretary of Commerce, but voted overwhelmingly to censure him officially.

title: Forum to Cut Dividend
description: Form Restaurants, Inc., announced yesterday it planned to reduce its quarterly dividend to 2.5 cents a share from 9 cents, effective in the fiscal year beginning June 1. The company said the reduction would free about $208,000 a year for establishing new cafeterias and resttaurants.

title: 2 KIDNAPPERS GET 5,005YEAR TERMS
description: DALLAS, May 18 (AP) Woodrow Ransonette, 31 years old, and his brother, Franklin, 33, received 5,005year prison terms yesterday for the kidnapping of a Texas socialite, Mrs. Amanda Dealey.

title: MISS LITTLE TAKES SHOT LEAD IN GOLF
U.S. Jury in Texas Concludes Its Inquiry in Nixon Fund Case,
description: HOUSTON, May 18 (AP)A Federal grand jury looking into a $100,000 contribution that wound up in the hands of convicted Watergate conspirator, Bernard A. Barker, recessed today without returning an indictment.

title: Wife Says Mitchell
description: Mrs. Martha Mitchell said yesterday that her husband, former Attorney General John N. Mitchell, had been protecting President Nixon in the Watergate scandal. She suggested that Mr. Nixon'inight be impeached if he did not resign.

title: Leftist Guerrillas Hijack a Venezuelan Airliner
description: PANAMA, Saturday; May 19. (AP)Leftist guerrillas hijacked a Venezuelan airliner yesterday, demanded the release of political prisoners during a forced fuel stop in Panama, then took off for Merida, MexicO.

title: PRICES ON AMEX SHOW BIG DECLINE
SYMINGTON CITES NEW DATA BY CIA.
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 Senator Stuart Symington said today that new data just given the Senate Armed Services Committee made it even more difficult for me to visualize the the President knew nothing about White House attempts to use the Central Intelligence Agency to cover up, the Watergate affair.

title: MAREMONT WEIGHS SELLING OF UNIT
description: The Maremont Corporation, announced yesterday, it, might sell its SacoLowell textile machinery. business to StonePlatt Industries of London.

title: A Library Shows Theres a. Lot About History's Women...
description: BERKELEY; Calif.  The university professor who asked in 1969, Is there enough about women to fill a quarter's course? probably feels a bit silly these days.

title: Glenn Turner and F. Lee Bailey Indicted on Charges of Fraud
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Glenn W. Turner, a Florida businessman, and F. Lee Bailey, the wellknown criminal lawyer, were indicted by a Federal grand jury today on charges of mail fraud and conspiracy in connection with the sale of distributorships for three of Mr. Turner's companies, the Justice Department said. The three concerns and eight other men also were named in a 28count indictment returned in United States District Court in Orlando, Fla. The companies, each of which has Mr. Turner as chairman of the board, are Koscot Interplanetary, Inc.; DaretoBeGreat, Inc., and Glenn W. Turner Enterprises, Orlando.

title: Dave Anderson
description: When he was the champion, his manager was always with him. So were three or four others; waiting on him, catering to his every whim. But now that he's an exchampion, it's different. Joe Frazier was carrying his own equipment bag.as he hurried into the Telestar Gym, a fifthfloor loft on West 28th Street, papered with old fight posters, stuffy with the aroma of perspiration that has seeped into its wooden floor. Behind him was a young man named Lee, but Joe Frazier actually was carrying his own equipment bag. Inside, among gray metal lockers, he realized he had no place to sit. Quickly, he motioned to Lee and they dragged in a wooden bench. When he was the champion, others would've done it for him. I'm payin the rent, he said, smiling. Got to pay the rent until George makes up his mind, Sports of The Times

title: Politicians Offer Ways to Save 35c Fare
description: Local candidates and other political figures put forward their own plans yesterday in the wake of Dr. William J. R'pnan's prediction that the transit fare would have to rise to 60 cents unless the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, which he heads, received $300million in subsidies next year.

title: Fish Wife Triumphs
description: BALTIMORE, May 18 (AP)After trailing for the first seven furlongs, C. V. Whitney's Fish Wife won a threehorse photo finish in the BlackEyed Susan Stakes today at Pimlico. Fish Wife ran the. 11.16 miles in 1:44, paying $6,40, $3.60 and $2.80 for $2 across the board.

title: Legislature Votes $124Million SchoolAid Rise
description: ALBANY, May 18  After contentious debate over a Democratic amendment that was ultimately defeated, the Legislature tonight passed by overwhelming margins in both libuses an increase in state aid to elementary and secondary education totaling $124million for the 197374 school year.

title: JERSEY INFIRM GET HEALTHPLAN AID
description: TRENTON, May 18  Officials of the New Jersey Blue Cross and Blue Shield healthinsurance plans agreed today to provide coverage for people with serious health problems at the rates charged to healthy subscribers.

title: People and Business
description: Walter C. Gumniere, president, treasurer and. chief executive officer of the Tappan'Company, has resigned all of his posts. W. Richard Tappan, chairman of the electric and gas appliance cornpany, said that he expected to succeed Mr. Gummere as president and chief executive, at a board meeting on Monday.

title: FOUR NIXON EXAIDES NAMED IN LAWSUIT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 18 (UPI) A $220,000 political espionage lawsuit was filed to day against John N. Mitchell, Maurice H. Stans, Donald H. Segretti, Herbert W. Kalmbach and the Committee for the reelection of the President by two, campaign staff members for former Senator Eugene J. McCarThy.

title: SOYBEANS CLIMB THE DAILY LIMIT
description: Soybean and wheat prices rose the daily permissible limit yesterday in a hectic session on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: From Beach Strolls to Kitchen Stints, Artists Family Likes Being Together
description: LOS ANGELESIt's not an unusual sight at 6 o'clock irt the morning to see Heidi Bucher, the noted Swiss sculptor, and her husband, Carl Lander, also an avantgarde sculptor of note, stroll along the beach at Santa Barbara with their two sons, looking for shells of a particularly pearlybeige hue.

title: Birgit Keil's Juliet Partnered by Klos At Stuttgart Ballet
description: Birgit Keil and Vladimir Klos look so well together on stage that it is obvious even through the surging crowds of Romeo and Juliet that they must be paired. Thursday evening the two made their first appearance in the title roles during the Stuttgart Ballet season at the Metropolitan Opera House.

title: Dance: City Ballet's Cortege Hongrois
Campus Notes
description: Multinational business operations need more managers with international training, so New York University's graduate business school has joined forces with two European business schools in joint venture aimed at augmenting the supply.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FULTON FOLLIES The Brooklyn Bridge was completed 90 years ago and that is why, from noon through evening, there will be a vast array of public, free entertainments and celebration tomorrow.

title: City Budget Tide..
description: The urban crisis is not over, despite President Nixon's soothing suggestions to the contrary. Black, white and Puerto Rican middleincome taxpayers continue to leave center city areas; disadvantaged, lowincome, nontaxpayers continue to arrive. Crime rates remain unacceptably high, neighborhoods deteriorate, the schools still turn out too many functional illiterates.

title: ... Fare Disaster
description: The threat of a 60cent subway fare, voiced this week by Metropolitan Transportation Authority chairman William J. Ronan, dramatically points up the longneglected inadequacy of the region's mass transit systems and the balingwire fiscal arrangements that have kept them rolling along, however haltingly.

title: Gains Seen in G.E. Talks
description: Representatives of both sides said yesterday that national contract negotiations here between the General Electric Company and 14 unions were progressing, but would give no details, United Press International reported. The contract expires on May 26.

title: 2d Autopsy Finds Bruises On 2 Women in Montclair
description: MONTCLAIR, May 18  A second autopsy on the bodies of a mother and daughter found strangled in their home on Millionaire's Row here has uncovered bruises that are consistent with either murder of suicide, a spokesman for the State Medical Examiner's office said today,

title: Market Place:
description: The announcements are flying thick and fast these days. Company A, B and CZ, too, for that matterall seem to be buying their own shares.

title: Sales Record Is Reached
Chinese Paper Urges Better Jobs for Women
description: PEKING, May 18 (Reuters)The principal Chinese Communist party newspaper, Jenmin Jih Pao, urged today that more Chinese women be given positions of responsibility.

title: 4 Children Drown in Pit
description: WACO, Tex., May 18 (AP)Four children, three of them members of the same family, drowned yesterday while wading with a group of four other youngsters in a gravel pit. Firemen identified the dead as Eva Mac, 12 years old; Cathy Mac, 10; Eddy Mac, 9, and Derrick Ratliff, 8. They apparently walked off an underwater ledge and drowned in 10 feet of water.

title: Real Test for France
description: France intends to conduct a new round of nuclear tests poisoning the atmosphere in and near the South Sea atoll of Mururoa this summerdespite widespread protests, a World Court case and threats of economic retaliation. The French claim the tests will cause no serious damage either to humans or the environment.

title: Santiago Knocks Out Lopez
description: Edward Santiago of New York knocked out Jimmy Lopez of Puerto Rico in the first round of a scheduled 10round fight last night at Stuulyside Garden. Santiago, 127 pounds, sent Lopez to the canvas with a right to the jaw. Lopez, 127,, hit his chin on the floor, managed to get up at the count of nine, but fell again and Referee Tony. Perez stopped the bout.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: Jade Fountain, 602 Ridge Road, North Arlington. (201) 9915377.

title: 2 Big Board Firms to Close
description: The New York Stock Exchange's weekly bulletin reported yesterday that two member firms will cease to do business. They are Halden & Co. and Gordon, Kulman & Perry, Inc.

title: 23,400 Tires Recalled
