description: AKRON, Ohio, May 18 (Reuters)  The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company said today that it had recalled 23,400 Deluxe Champion SupRBelt tires in size G7815, in order to recover an estimated maximum of 940 tires believed to have a manufacturing defect.

title: ELLSBERG SCORES RISE OF SECRECY
description: Daniel Ellsberg declared yesterday that the growth of the use of secrecy in government had carried the United States toward something like an executive coup.

title: N.Y. Ruling Against Barclays Resented
description: LONDON, May 18A decision by the New York State Banking Board against the Barclays Bank's proposed acquisition of the Long Island Trust Company is stirring increasing but muted resentment among British bankers.

title: A 3MONTH. STRIKE AT SHELL OIL ENDS
description: HOUSTON, May 18 (AP)Members of the Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers Union voted tonight by a 3to1 margin to end the threemonthold strike at the Shell Oil Company refinery and chemical plant at nearby Deer Park.

title: 2 Families Say Lives Changed After Raids by Drug Agents
description: CHICAGO, May 18  Two Illinois families testified before a Senate subcommittee here today that their lives had been drastically changed by unauthorized and mistaken raids on their homes recently by Federal narcotics agents.

title: Zigler Reportedly Heard Talk of Segretti's Activity
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Ronald L. Ziegler, the White House press secretary, attended a White House meeting in October, 1972, at which the activities of Donald H. Segretti, accused as a hired Republican disrupter of Democratic candidates, were discussed by other top Presidential aides involved in the Watergate scandal, according to sworn testimony here released today.

title: Some Other Memories of Marshall Bloom
description: To speak confidently of the death of either student activism or the counterculture is to exhibit hopeless naivetd. To invoke the suicide of Marshall Bloom as evidence that political activism did not and will not work, that what America needs, and is getting, Is an affirmation of traditional values, is nothing less than reprehensible.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Federal grand jury in Oklahoma Ctiy indicted the director and the producer of the Xrated movie DeepSleep, which was produced in Paterson, N. J., on charges of shipping an obscene film across state lines.

title: A Revision of Blue Laws Is Passed by Legislature
description: ALBANY, May 18  The Assembly today voted final approval of a broad revision of the state's Sunday bluelaw restrictions that would increase the penalties for violators, but remove the responsibility fox enforcement from the police.

title: WINE TALK
description: In Iberia, his monumental paean to Spain, James A. Michener fondly recalls a restaurant he. loved in Seville:

title: U.S. Judge Enjoins E.P.A. On Holding Pollution Funds
description: CHICAGO, May 18 (UPI)A judge ruled today that the Environmental Protection Agency cannot legally withhold 86billion in water pollution control funds for the fiscal year 1973 and 1974.

title: Alcan Aluminium Defends Its Marketing in the U.S.
description: MONTREAL, May 18 (Canadian Press) Aluminum, Ltd., says it can demonstrate that its marketing of aluminum ingots in the United States has not caused injury to the United States aluminum industry, a spokesman for the Canadian firm said today.

title: GOODYEAR TO RAISE SOME TIRE PRICES
description: The Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company said yesterday it would increase prices on tires for trucks, earthmoving vehicles, motorcycles and bicycies. The increases, ranging between 5 and 5 per cent, will be made June 20.

title: COMPANY MEETINGS
description: Texas Utilities Company: The company expects to spend about $1.1billion on construction through 1975, T. L. Austin Jr., president, told the annual meeting in Dallas. He said total electric plant investment would increase by some 45 per cent from this year through 1975.

title: KUNSTLER UPHELD BY APPEALS COURT
description: CHICAGO, May 18  In a ruling that appears to protect the ability of widely traveled lawyers of radical political ad entation to represent their clients, a United States appeals court has ordered a Federal District Court in Indiana to allow William M. Kunstler to represent a prisoner.

title: Statement by Caulfield
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Following is the text of a statement, by John J. Caulfield read to newsmen by Mr. Caulfield in the office here of his attorney, John P. Sears:

title: Riggs Only Getting Offers He Can Refuse
description: LAS VEGAS, May 18A $100,000 winner take all match with Mrs. Billie Jean King in late July may be the next major hustle for Bobby Riggs, tennis's newest glamour boy.

title: A Ramrod Lawyer Archibald Cox
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 Whether in amorning suit with tails, arguing a case before Supreme Court justices, or lecturing a law class at Harvard in a threepiece suit,.his 6foot, somewhat gaunt frame has always been taut. He'sramrodstraight, says a former colleague. Archibald Cox is a ramrod in more than appearance. He car ries the trait to his personality, described by one acquaintance as friendly, but, not warm. And when he makes up his mind, he's rigid, said one colleague of Mr. Cox, who was named today as the special prosecutor in the. Watergate case.

title: Music: Reich Meditations
description: Steve Reich, who appeared with his 10member ensemble for four concerts of h s music ending Thursday night at the John Weber Gallery, 420 West Broadway, is normally lumped in with Terry Riley and Phillip Glass. All three compose harmonically static, repetitive, Easterninfluenced, meditative music, and all have been discussed almost interchangeably when critics have discussed them at allfor five or six years, now. But they are gradually growing apart, and Mr. Reich's concerts amounted to a strongerthanever declaration of independence.

title: POLICE CAR BLAST HURTS PASSERBY
description: Three unoccupied police cars parked near the Jamaica, Queens, station were damaged when an explosive device went off at 3:35 A.M. yesterday. A passerby an offduty Transit Authority patrolman, was injured slightly in the blast.

title: ZAMBIA SAYS GUARD KILLED 2 CANADIANS
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, May 18 (Reuters)  Zambia confirmed tonight that the two young Canadian women killed near Victoria Falls on Tuesday had been shot by a Zambian sentry, but said that the women and an American male companion had appeared to he on their way to attack a vital Zambian power station.

title: Miffed Senator to Delay Nominations at H.E.W.
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The nominations of three toplevel administrators in the Department of Health, Education and Welfare are being delayed by the chairman of the Senate Finance Committee because of what he calls a political coverup. by the H.E.W. Secretary, Caspar W. Weinberger.

title: BROKERAGE PAYS FOR CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, Conn., May 18For a man who did not want to get his state into the brokerage business, Robert I. Berdon has not done badly at it.

title: EXNIXON AIDES LOSE ROUND IN CIVIL SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (AP) A Federal judge ordered four ormer White House aides toa to testify before Democratic National Committee lawyers in Watergate civil suit.

title: BREZIINEY ARRIVES IN BONN FOR TALKS
description: BONN, May 18Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, arrived today for four days of talks with Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany, marking a historic step toward overcoming what the Chancellor called a history of sorrows.

title: ALBANY APPROVES REVISED OTB LAW
description: ALBANY, May 18The State Legislature tonight passed a revision of the offtrack betting law that establishes a state racing and wagering board, eases the financial problems of race tracks, permits.,new local OTB operations and allows Sunday racing.

title: Ethiopian Prelate to Open Office Here for His Church
description: Abuna TheoPhilos, Patriarch of the Ethiopian Orthodox Church, will dedicate at 2 P.M. today the church's United States headquarters at 140 West 176th Street, the Bronx.

title: Excerpts From Transcript of McCord's Testimony to Senate Panel on Watergate
Brandt, and Brezhnev Both Took Big Risks to Heal the Wounds of 24 Years
description: BONN, May 18  Leonid I. Brezhnev's journey from Moscow to Bonn in his big Ilyushin jet lasted three hours today. But in another sense the trip took 24 years.

title: A Judge Hawked Hot Dogs To Pay Off Pressing Debt
description: A local Civil Court judge, facing a squeeze play apt home because of a pressing debt, moonlighted one.weekend at Yankee Stadium. selling hotdogs.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office reports that two people, a man and a woman, have come forward who say they witnessed the incident on April 28 when James Layne, 29 years old, allegedly tried to sell his 3monthold daughter, Kim Cruz, on the IRT subway. Mr. Layne was freed on parole this Week after the District Attorney was unable to find any of the more than 30 witnesses to the incident.

title: 3 Jump to Conclusion of ChaseA Police Station Yard in Queens
description: Three men suspected of attempting to cash a stolen check led the police on a chase through the Flatbush section of Brooklyn yesterday, then, ran into the arms of a dozen waiting policemen when they abandoned their car and jumped over a fenceinto a police station yard.

title: Garment Group Backs Pact
description: Office and clerical employes of the International Ladles Garment Workers Union and its locals have ratified an agreement with their union employer and averted a threatened strike, a spokesman for the employe group said yesterday.

title: HAS A LOT TO DO
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The White House said today that President Nixon had no intention of resigning.

title: Prosecutor Cox
description: The designation of Archibald Cox as special prosecutor for the Watergate imbroglio is a belated if hopeful'start on the awesome task of restoring public confidence In the Administration's return to the rule of law.

title: MRS. ALISON R. BRYAN
description: HASTINGS ON HUDSON, N. Y., May 18 Mrs. Marion; Cuthbertson Bryan, former, teacher and missionary and the!, wife of the Rev. Dr. Alison R. Bryan, who was pastor of the Hope United Presbyterian; Church in Tarrytown, died today at St. Johns Riverside Hospital in Yonkers. She was 82 years old and lived at 10 Amherst Drive here.

title: Roundup: Beckert Hitting String Reaches 26 Games
description: Glenn Beckert, the 32,yearold second, baseman of the Chicago Cubs who has a reputation as a tough man to strike out continued his hitting streak last night.

title: Stage: Children of Gods
description: In Children of the Gods the Shaliko Company (one of the New York University theater groups currently presenting its work in the N.Y.U. Theater Building at 111 Second Avenue) is attempting to condense Aeschylus's Agamemnon and Euripides's, Elektra, Orestes and Iphigenia at Aulis"all into 70 minutes.

title: Washington Cab Driver. Won't Turn Off McCord
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The cab driver had the radio on and was intently following James W. McCord Jr.'s testimony today.

title: Car. Makers Doubt Diesels Can Meet 76 Restrictions
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (Reuters)The makers of Peugeot, MercedesBenz and Opel diesel automobiles told Congress today that they can meet the 1975 autoemission standards, but not the tough restrictions proposed for 1976.

title: E. P. A. Bans Dumping in Ocean Of 8 Substances, Limits Others
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (AP) The Environmental Protection Agency has banned the dump ing of eight substances in the ocean and listed dozens more that may be dumped only with special care.

title: Mayer Gains Net Semifinal
description: WOODBURY, L. I., May 18Gene Mayer of Wayne, N. J., seeded second, defeated Kirk Moritz of Old Westbury, L. I., 62, 62, today to gain the semifinals of the Eastern men's hard court tennis championships at the Woodbury Country Club. Paul Lynner of Carle Place, L. I,, defeated Randolph Jones of New York, 61, 2.6, 76, winning the thirdset tiebreaker, 51.

title: MRS. R. G. TINNERHOLM
description: Mrs. Bawn Barrett linnerholm of Springfield, N. J wife of Richard G. Tinnerhoim, former financial vice president of the Associated Merchandising Corporation, died Wednesday in Phoenix, Ariz., where she was a winter resident. Her age was 61.

title: Potomac Cruise for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (AP) President Nixon set out on a cruise on the Potomac River tonight aboard the yacht Sequoia.

title: East Side Express Derails, Injuring 4 And Cutting Service
description: An uptown Lexington Avenue express derailed last night near Grand Central, forcing the evacuation of 200 passengers through a smoky haze and the temporary shutdown of IRT service between Grand Central and Bowling Green. There were at least four injuries.

title: Effort to Get Tax Data Laid to Caulfield
description: WASHINGTON, May 18John J. Caulfield, a former White House aide whose name figured prominently in today's Senate Watergate testimony, tried three years ago to obtain Internal Revenue Service intelligence for the White House on one of President Nixon's closest Ifriends, according to sources directly acquainted with the matter.

title: Papp Gets Threatening Letters Charging Bias Against Latins
description: Joseph Papp, founderproducer of the New York Shakespeare Festival, has turned over to the police threatening letters and posters that were plastered on his theater accusing him of discrimination against Puerto Rican and other Latin actors and performers.

title: Converter Adds Four Cable TV Channels
description: WASHINGTON, May 18An electronic converter that was patented this week can provide cable television subscribers with four additional channels not normally available. Signals that fall between the regular channels can be received.

title: BISHOPS IN BRAZIL DENOUNCE REGIME
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 18 (Reuters)  Roman Catholic bishops of Brazil's povertyridden Northeast region have charged the country's military rulers with employing torture, assassination, mutilation and imprisonment to guarantee the functioning of their capitalist system.

title: Ballet: Hidden Rites
description: In his newest work, given its premiere Thursday night at the City Center, Alvin Ailey  takes us into some mythical AfroAsian kingdom and offers an odd musichall view of what takes place in such realms.

title: Concert: May Festival
description: It was not possible to figure out just what point, if any, the program of contemporary music presented in the Composers Theater May Festival concert at the New School on Thursday night was supposed to make, but the assemblage of works maintained a respectable level of quality, and there is something to be said for that.

title: People in Sports. Orr No. 1 Again
description: Bobby Orr of the Boston Bruins became the first National Hockey League player to win the same individual award six consecutive times when he was named winner yesterday of the James Norris Memorial Trophy, which goes to the defenseman, considered the league's best by the Professional Hockey Writers Association.

title: HAS A LOT TO DO
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 The White House said today that President Nixon had no intention of resigning.

title: O.E.O. Urges Community Units Be Revamped to Aid Business
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The 36 community development corporations receiving Goverment support would be completely reorganized to reflect a business orientation under recommendadons put forward today by the Office of Economic Opportunity.

title: Ruling Rhodesian Party Defeats a Bid by, Moderates
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 18Prime Minister Ian D. Smith's party, the Rhodesian Front, has crushed a new political grouping of moderate whites in a closely watched parliamentary byelection.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The General Electric Company received a $36.8million addition to a previouslyawarded Air Force contract for J85 jet aircraft engines.

title: Oklahoma Governor, Aide Confirm Tax Investigations
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 18 (AP)  Gov. David Hall and Oklahoma's Secretary of State, John Rogers, confirmed today that their income tax returns were being investigated by the Internal Revenue Service, and both men indicated that they considered it part of national scrutiny of top Democrats.Governor Hall confirmed the investigation of his tax returns for 1968, 1969 and 1970.He issued a statement hinting that he felt it was part of a national Republican effort to discredit Democrats. Mr. Rogers charged that at least 15 Democratic governors are being investigated.In Washington Ed Riley, a spokesman for the service said that he did not know if any other governors were under investigation.

title: FOUR MEN ARE SEIZED IN DEATHS IN GEORGIA
description: WELCH, W. Va., May 18 (AP) Led by a bloodhound, policemen arrested three murder suspects today as they slept under a cliff in a forest near here. A fourth fugitive was caught last night. The West Virginia state police said that all four had waived extradition. They werereturneded immediately to Atlan?? to face charges in the mur der of six members of a farming family.

title: Preakness Pace Slow at OTB Windows
SKYLAB CREWMEN PRACTICE REPAIRS
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 18 (AP)Astronauts preparing for the first space salvage mission practiced today installing a space sunbonnet that they hope will cool off the Skylab 1 station sufficiently to allow a manned mission.

title: Stocks Tumble on Wide Front; Dow Closes at a 15Month Low
Gold Speculators Show Tidy Profits
description: LONDON, May 18 (AP)Gold inched back up toward record prices again today as one of the world's most diverse groups of investors counted tidy profits.

title: Effort to Get Tax Data Laid to Caulfield
description: WASHINGTON, May 18John J. Caulfield, a former White House aide whose name figured prominently in today's Senate Watergate testimony, tried three years ago to obtain Internal Revenue Service intelligence for the White House on one of President Nixon's closest friends, according to sources directly acquainted with the matter.

title: Cape's Name Restored By Florida Legislature
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., May 18 (AP)  A bill restoring the historic name of Cape Canaveral to the land mass surrounding the Kennedy Space Center cleared the Florida Legislature today.

title: Size of Store's Staff Is Factor in Sunday Bill
description: ALBANY, May 18The bluelaw proposals sent to the Governor this evening would forbid the Sunday sale of a list of items in stores that have more than six employes. The limit does not pertain to members of a single family who run a food store, nor does the list pertain to restaurants.

title: Dave Hill Posts 69 for 137 And 2Shot Memphis Lead
DEAL BY DOCTOR AT INQUIRY CITED
description: TRENTON, May 18 (AP)A Rahway physician gave damaging testimony at a State Commission of Investigation hearing of workmen's compensation abuses apparently after he was warned that a felony case against him would be reopened if he did not, it was learned today.

title: ALBANYAPPROVES REVISED OM LAW
description: ALBANY, May 18The State Legislature tonight passed a revision of the offtrack betting law that establishes a state recing and wagering board, eases the financial problems of race tracks, permits new local OTB operations and allows Sunday racing.

title: A Revision of Blue Laws Is Passed by Legislature
description: ALBANY, May 18  The Assembly today voted final approval of a broad revision of the state's Sunday bluelaw restrictions that would increase the penalties for violators, but remove the responsibility for enforcement from the police.

title: Antiques: Coffee Time
description: PHILADELPHIA  When coffee was added to the beverage choices of 17thcentury English aristocrats, London silversmiths went to work and, over the next 160 years, produced a stunning and diverse array of pots.

title: 22 Inmates in Camden Uprising Are Exonerated by the Warden
description: LAKELAND, May 18 (UPI)After meeting with 22 inmates who staged an 18hour uprising in the Camden County Jail Annex, the warden said today that neither the inmates nor the guard involved in the incident would be punished.

title: Girl's Rape Story Is Now Discounted By Police Officers
description: A vivid story by a 16yearold Queens high school student that she had been raped four times in Central Park during a fivehour ordeal was discounted by the police yesterday.

title: Byrne Learning to Doff Habits With Robes
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., May 18rendan Thomas Byrne, at the age of 49, is learning to be a public politician.

title: ASHE AND RICKY VICTORS IN TENNIS
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 18The dollar may be on shaky grounds internationally, but it will be four.Americans playing for the big money in the, semi final round in the $150,000 Alan King tennis tournament.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:
Sherwood Dixon, 76, Dead; State Official in Illinois
description: DIXON, Ill., May 18 (AP)Former Lieut. Gov. Sherwood; Dixon died yesterday in a hosfi !Pita! here. He was 76 years old.

title: 20 HELD UPSTATE IN PATIENTS ABUSE
description: ROME, N. Y., May 18The state police arrested 20 employes of the Rome State School today on charges of abusing dozens of the institution's mentally retarded residents. Four other employes were still being sought.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (AP)State Department officials say that China may seek to buy more than $200million in United States agricultural products this yearmainly grain and cotton. Export figures for the first quarter of 1973, however, do not reflect this level. As of March 31, $33million worth of exports had been sent to China and officials said the figures for cotton alone should have reflected sales of some $100million.

title: Senate Unit Votes Food Aid
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (AP) The Senate Agriculture Committee voted today to continue food stamp eligibility after Jan. 1, 1974, for the aged, blind and disabled. Congress last year eliminated food distribution programs for needy persons in the three categories when the programs are federalized next year with increased benefits.

title: Fuentes Is Upheld on Racism Charges
description: The State Education Comrissioner, Ewald B. Nyquist, announced yesterday that a state investigation into charges of racism against Luis Fuentes, the superintendent of Community School District 1 on Manhattan's Lower East Side, had not found sufficient grounds for the revocation of Mr. Fuentes state certificate.

title: Until 1968, Caulfield Was Obscure Detective in Bronx
description: Until the summer of 1968, when Richard M. Nixon's campaign for the Presidency rolled into full swing; John J. Caulfield was an obscure, undistinguished, $12,000ayear police detective here attached to the Bronx homicide squad.

title: High Drama in Quiet Testimony
description: WASHINGTON, May 18His voice seemed too small and grainy to have any resounding impact. His bearing was reminiscent of an accountant reciting from a balance sheet.

title: Miss Schott Is Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Schott of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Victoria Lou Schott, to Evelyn de Rothschild, son of Mrs. Anthony de Rothschild of Ascott, Wing, Buckinghamshire, England, and the late Mr. de Rothschild.

title: Miss Kelley Bride Of Kevin Sullivan
description: ARDMORE, Pa., May 18Miss Marianna Frances Kelley, daughter of Mrs. Francis H. Kelley and the late Mr. Kelley, was married here this evening to. Kevin Edmund Sullivan, son of Mr. and Mrs.. Edmund B. Sullivan of Rumson, N. J. Msgr. Herman L. Heide, uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass at St. Colman's Roman Catholic Church.

title: C.P.B. TO CONTINUE BUCKLEY'S FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, May 18s;In an avowed gesture of goodwill toward the managers and directors of public television stations around the country, the Corporation for Public Broadcasting announced today that it would continue financing, through September, of two publicaffairs programs, William F. Buckley's Firing Line and Washington Week in Review.

title: Canadian Bishop, 79, Dies
description: QUEBEC, May 18 (Canadian Press) The most Rev. Napoleon Alexandre Labrie, Roman Catholic bishop of Hauterive, from 1938 to 1956, died Wednesday. He was 79 years old. Bishop Labrie was the founding bishop of the diocese of Hauterive, on the north shore of the St. Lawrence River.

title: Detroit Store to Close
description: Crowley Milner & Co., a Detroit department store chain will vacate its present main downtown store', at the end of the lease on the building probably in 1978. Robert Winkel, president, said the main store, while still the company's largestvolume unit, had lost money for the last several years. A smaller, existing Crowley store will be maintained downtown.

title: Russo Victor in Handball
description: Lou Russo of the host club, the defending champion, and Jerry Muck, the national champion form S. Paul A.C. advanced to the semifinals of the New York Athletic Club's fourwall invitation handball tourney last right Russo beat Toni Kurowski of Jersey ctiy, 212, 217, and 'Muck eliminated Pan Miller of the Virginia Y.M.C.A., 219, 2111.

title: A Soviet Watergate Impossible, Envoy Says
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 18 Vasily S. Safronchuk, the deputy representative from the Soviet Union to the United Nations, told a group, of Princeton University students today that the Watergate scandal could not have occurred in the Soviet Union.

title: Nader Sees Politics in Gift Tax Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, May. 18Ralph Nader charged today that Republican political considerations were imposed on the Internal Revenue Service by high Nixon Administration officials last year to obtain ruling that made it possible for large campaign contributors to avoid paying millions of dollars in Federal gift taxes.

title: Film: 'Dirty Little Billy':Legend of Gunslinging Kid Explored in Film The Cast
description: Credit the team headed by Stan Dragoti, the television commercials director who is making his movie bow with "Dirty Little Billy," with giving us a realistically raw view of the beginnings of the Billy the Kid legend. Unfortunately, Billy, floundering in a search for roots in sleazy, muddy Coffeyville, Kan., and the vicious or callous unwashed types he's involved with remain largely vague, unresolved figures brawling and killing on a primitive landscape.Billy, who is portrayed by Michael J. Pollard in smiling, almost witless fashion, revolts against the hard farm life forced on him by his stepfather. Thereafter he's befriended by the town badman, Richard Evans. Lee Purcell, as Evans's prostitute girlfriend, initiates Billy into one aspect of manhood. Eventually, Coffeyville's puritanical element, led by Charles Aidman  who, for unexplained reasons, is dallying with Billy's motherdrives Billy and his pal out of town after gunning down the hapless Miss Purcell.Our callow hero, once inept with guns, uses them with bloody effect to protect his friend in a final shootout with a gang of thieving renegades. And, one may assume, Billy the Dessperado now emerges full-blown as he happily packs his six-shooters and trudges off into the sunset with his mentor.The look of an authentic period and place is captured in the dirt, sloppy roads, rickety buildings and tattered itinerants who never owned fancy 10-gallon hats, spurs or chaps. And the unremitting struggle for survival is also starkly spotlighted, especially in a couple of brutal fights staged without glorification of the principals."Dirty Little Billy" projects an unvarnished picture of the Old West, even if the contributions of the script and the dour Charles Aidman, the misused Lee Purcell and the rough Richard Evans are unconvincing. And one is inclined to agree with a confused Billy when he asks, "What's all this rushing about for?"

title: Fontaine Aiming for a Big Catch in the Messenger
Roy C. Muir, 91, ExOfficer Of General Electric, Is Dead
description: Roy C. Muir, a retired president of the General Electric Company, died on an airplane yesterday en route from Florida to Schenectady, N. Y. He was 91 years old and lived in Osprey, Fla., and Schenectady.

title: DOLLAR DECLINES AS GOLD CLIMBS
description: PARIS, May 18  New rumors that the West German Government would revalue the mark again to intensify the battle against inflation triggered new selling of dollars and buying of gold today in Europe.

title: BENJAMIN JAVITS LAWYER, IS DEAD
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., May 18  Benjamin A, Javits, elder brother and, former law partner Of Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York, died here today of a heart attack. He was 78 years old and lived here and at 980 Fifth Avenue in New York. Surviving, besides his brother, are his widow, the former Lily Birnbaum; a son, Eric; a daughter, Mrs. Joan Zeeman, and seven grandchildren.

title: U.S. Regrets Admittance Of North Korea in U.N. Unit
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (Reuters)  The United States regrets the vote by the World Health Organization to admit North Korea as a member, the State Department said today.

title: U.M.W. to Hold Convention In Pittsburgh for First Time
description: PITTSBURGH, May 18 (UPI) As a prelude to bringing its operation closer to the coal fields, the United Mine Workers of America will hold its quadrennial convention here for the first time from Dec. 3 to 14.

title: Indians Ask Presidential Rights Panel
description: KYLE, S. D., May 18  Elders from the Sioux tribes and supporters of the American Indian Movement asked Federal negotiators today for a Presidential commission to examine alleged treaty violations.

title: Archibald Cox Appointed Prosecutor for Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Elliot L. Richardson today chose Archibald Cox, Solicitor General in the Kennedy and Johnson Administrations, as the special prosecutor in the Watergate investigation.

title: A SILVER COMPANY AND AIDE INDICTED
description: UTICA, May 18 (AP) The International Silver Company of Meriden, Conn., and one of its executives have been indicted on criminal charges related to industrial spying against a rival company, it was disclosed today.

title: Torre Out for Week
description: ST. LOUIS, May 18 (AP)The St. Louis Cardinals star first baseman, Joe Torre, inlured during a homeplate collision in Chicago, will be out of action for a week, the team said today. The 32yearold Torre suffered a severe contusion of the left thigh colliding with the Cubs catcher, Randy Hundley, yesterday.

title: A jigger of Secretariatand a Dash of Sham
Russo Thinks Nixon Knew About the Watergate Affair
description: YELLOW SPRINGS, Ohio; May 18 (AP)  Anthony J. Russo Jr., codefendant in the:, Pentagon papers trial with Dr. Daniel Ellsberg, said last night lit was inconceivable that President Nixon did not know., about the Watergate affair bait fore the arrest of the defendants. I Mr. Russo made his remarks.. at Antioch College after strikmg students invited him to cross picket lines and speak. The students have been striking, for more than a month in art attempt to get the Administration to guarantee student loans.

description: Substantial contribudons fron realestate interests to Control ler Abraham D. Beanie an( from Puerto Rican residents t4 Representative Herman Badillo as well as $49,825 in loans tc Assemblyman Albert H. Blum enthal, highlighted a list of cam paign receipts for four of do five mayoral candidates in till Democratic and Liberal prima ries.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Incoterm Corporation filed with the Securities & Exchange Commission a registration statement relating to the. proposed initial offering of 530,000 shares of Class A Common stock. Blyth Eastman Dillon & Co. has been named manager of the underwriting group.

title: The Superpower Bazaar
description: PARISThe odd thing about developing SovietAmerican relationships is that although the threat of hot war is over, the cold war about finished, and an era of commercial convergence apparently unfolding, Ideological convergence isn't even remotely on the horizon.

title: Stock Prices Slump
description: The Watergate hearings and fears of a crisis of confidence affecting the Nixon Administration sent stoat prices plummeting yesterday. The DowJones industrial average tumbled 16.55 points to 895.17. This marked the first time in more than 15 months that the Dow had finished under 900. Details, Page 49.

title: Importance of Skylab
At SingleRoom Hotel, City Aides Offer Helping Hand
description: The men were saying that they had to talk to the tenants in their own language, jump in their chests, as they say on the street, and in general act as If theyhad 38's in their pockets.

title: Grave of 24th Serviceman Is Found in North Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 18 (AP)The United States Embassy disclosed today that a 24th American serviceman had been found to have been buried in North Vietnam. A spokesman said the serviceman had died in an air crash.

title: Saigon Reappoints Warden In TigerCage Controversy
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 18 (Reuters)Col. Nguyen Van Ve, replaced in 1971 as director of South Vietnam's Con Son Island prison after an international controversy over tigercage punishment cells, has been reappointed to the same post, Government officials said today.

title: RUSTIN APPLAUDS BUILDING UNIONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Bayard Rustin, executive director of the A. Philip Randolph Institute, said today that the nation's building trades unions were to be congratulated for providing jobs to black workers.

title: Constitution Sets Executive Clemency
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Executive clemency, which became an issue in the Senate Watergate hearings today, is one of the few executive powers made explicit by the Constitution, which provides in Article II, Section 2, that the President may grant reprieves and pardons except in cases of impeachment.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PASSAIC, N..J., May 18I guess no other New Jersey athlete has done what I've done, said Dave Pruzansky, in his characteristically unhumble manner. At least not in one month anyways.

title: CORNELIUS G. BURKE
description: HUDSON, N. Y., May 18 Cornelius G. Burke, a retired music critic and a founder of High Fidelity magazine, died of cancer in Columbia Memorial Hospital today. He was 70 years old and lived here.

title: Truce Team in Delta, Thwarted, Tries to Enjoy Life
description: VINH LONG, South Vietnam, May 16  When the urgent message came the Hungarians were fishing, the Indonesians were playing badminton with a Vietnamese secretary in hot pants and gold highheeled shoes, and the Poles were watching.

title: Grand Jury Clears Rizzo Of PhoneTapping Charge
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 18 (UPI)A special grand jury said today that it had found no evidence that Mayor Frank L. Rizzo, while police commissioner, had tapped the telephones of former Mayors Richardson Dilworth and james H. J. Tate.

title: Drift of the Young From Farms Worries Yugoslavs
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 17On only 25 acres of farmland rolling gently down to a small stream, Dobrivoje Pavlovic, his wife and and his semiretired father have a comfortable, selfsufficient life with two houses, a Ferguson tractor, a car and esteem as one of the leading, hardestworking families in the Barajevo commune..

title: ...And a Center Encourages Women to Take Part in Making History
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J.If I were asking tobe your school teacher or nurse, you wouldn't find anything wrong, a young state legislator and mother said recently. But when I say let me be your politician, the whole thing changes.

title: Bridge: U.S. Team Meets Disaster For 2d Day at Tournament
description: GUARUJA, Brazil, May 18 The United States team had a second day of disaster in the world championship tourlament here yesterday. It held a slender lead at the halfway stage, but collapsed in the second half, losing 50 international match points. Italy, relying throughout on the foursome of Benito Garozzo, Giorio Belladonna, Pietro Forquet and Benito Bianchi, won the match by 18 victory points to 2.

title: Several Federal Statutes May Have Been Broken
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Since President Nixon's announcement on April 17 that he had uncovered major developments in the Watergate scandal, allegations that officials and former officials of his Administration have been involved in the political espionage and sabotage case have mounted daily.

title: RUSSIANS TO INSPECT SAN CLEMENTE TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 18An advance party of 30 Soviet officials making preparations for Leonid I. Brezhnev's trip to the United States next month will fly from Washington to San Clemente tomorrow to inspect the California White House, state Department officials said today.

title: Berkey Photo Struck
description: Several hundred film processors and developers voted last night to strike Berkey Photo, Inc., and its affiliates, after rejecting a threeyear contract offer that included a $7 a week salary increase and $3 a week more in pension payments. The vote, 352 to 95, was taken at a meeting of Local 966 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters at the Royal Manhattan. Hotel at 44th Street and Eighth Avepue.

title: NIXON VETOES BILL ON CONFIRMATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 President Nixon, accusing Congress of a backdoor assault on Presidential authority, vetoed today a bill that would require Senate confirmation of the director and deputy director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Snow and State's Temperatures Fall in Freak Storm
description: A freak spring storm broke at 91yearold temperature record here yesterday and dumped up to eight inches of heavy Wet snow on western New York State, closing dozens of upstate schools and leaving thousands of people without electricity.

title: Bache Seeks to Acquire Halsey, Stuart
description: Bache & Co.,Inc., a leading member of the New York Stock Exchange, announced yesterday it had reached agreement in principle to acquire for an undisclosed amount of cash all of the outstanding stock of Halsey, Stuart & Co., Inc., which has been owned by the Chicago Title and Trust Company since 1967.

title: Rogers Supports Latins Nationalism
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, May 18 (UPI)Secretary of State William P. Rogers said today that the United States welcomed the growing nationalism sweeping Latin America and pledged to support it as a substittite for paternalism.

title: Two Labor Groups Endorse Beame's Nomination
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame received the endorsements yesterday of two major labor organizations, the United Federation of Teachers and the New York City Central Labor Council, in his bid for the Democratic nomination for Mayor.

title: TRENTON INMATES HONOR EXWARDEN
description: TRENTON, May 18 (AP)The inmates of Trenton State Prison presented a plaque today to former Superintendent William F. Fauver in an unusual display of confidence in a prison administration.

title: VOTE BY SANDMAN DEFEATS HIS BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 18A proposed amendment to the Law Enforcement Assistance Act that would make cities with high crime rates eligible for direct Federal funding was defeated during review by the House Judiciary Subcommittee this week by one votethat of Representative Charles Sandman, a cosponsor of the measure.

title: Six Are in Preakness Today, but It's a TwoHorse Race
description: BALTIMORE, May 18Secretariat will be the oddson favorite to win the Preakness Stakes at Pimlico tomorrow. With fine weather predicted, a record crowd of more than 55,000 is expected to witness the 98th running of the race, the middle jewel of the Triple Crown for 3yearolds between the Kentucky Derby and the Belmont Stakes.

title: Amtrak Funds Called Available To Assure Year of Improvement
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (UPI)Roger Lewis, president of the National Railroad Passenger Corporation, said today that the proposed Federal budget for his agency was tight but that it could provide for a year of improvement in the nation's passenger train service.

title: GREEK CHURCH SETS MAKARIOS MEDIATION
description: ATHENS, May 18  Greece's Orthodox Church delegated three Bishops today to mediate in the dispute that has split the Orthodox Church of Cyprus. The move coincided with increasing hopes of GreekTurkish settlement of the Cyprus problem.

title: LEEMATT 41 PICK IN CARTER TODAY
description: Leematt, C. Oliver Goldsmith's comeback kid who has kept surviving a variety of ailments to return to the races, will seek his fourth straight victory against nine rivals this afternoon in the 73d running of the Carter Handicap at Belmoat Park.

title: Kissinger and Tho Meet In Paris for Second Time
description: PARIS; May 18 (AP)Henry A. Kissinger, met today for second time with Le Duc Tho of North Vietnain to discuss the carrying out of the Vietnam peace agreement

title: MRS. CAMILLE STANFORD.
description: Mrs. Camille Bartlett Stanford, a descendant of Josiah Bartlett, a s gner of the Declaration of Independence, died Wednesday at the Sherry Netherland Hotel, Fifth Avenue and 59th Street where she lived. Her age was 61.

title: 2d Autopsy Finds Bruises On 2 Women in Montclair.
description: MONTCLAIR, May 18  A second autopsy on the bodies of a mother and daughter found strangled in their home on Millionaire's Row here as uncovered bruises that are consistent with either murder or suicide, a spokesman for the state Medical Examiner's office aid today.

title: Bridge Falls in France
description: CAEN, France, May 18 (AP) A 40ton section of a highway bridge under construction crashed to the ground today killing five people, the police in this northern French city reported. The accident occurred when the steel cable of a crane carrying, the bridge section snapped, the authorities said.

title: U. S. COMPLETES VESCO CIVIL CASE
description: After nearly two months of court battles, the Government concluded its civil case here yesterday for a preliminary injunction against Robert L. Vesco, the New Jersey financier, to prevent further alleged violations of securities laws.

title: 2d Amplifier for Pioneer 2
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., May 18 (AP)Space agency officials have switched radio transmissions of the Jupiterbound Pioneer.2 spacecraft to a backup amplifier. The change Was made because of a slow, erratic reduction of the main tube's output power, officials at the Ames Research Center here

title: MARCHI MODIFIES GATEWAY STAND
description: ALBANY, May 18  An aide of Senator John J. Marchi, who is urging a delay on passing legislation implementing the creation of the. Gateway National Recreation Area, said today that the Senator was leaning toward positive action on turning over the Riis Park and the Breezy Point section to the Federal Government.

title: Stock Prices Slump
description: The Watergate hearings and fears of a crisis of confidence affecting the Nixon Administration sent stock prices plummeting yesterday. The DowJones industrial average tumbled 16.55 points to 895.17. This marked the first time in more than 15 months that the Dow had finished under 900. Details, Page 49.

title: Commencement Prayers Upheld in Pennsylvania
description: PITTSBURGH,rMay 18  a panel of three common pleas court judges ruled today that prayers could be included in the commencement exercises of suburban Mount Lebanon High School.

title: Blockbuiting Laid to Realtor
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (UPI) The Justice Department filed a civil suit today against a Fort Lauderdale, Fla., real estate broker, charging him with blockbusting and other fairhousing violations. The suit was filed in Miami against Mortimer I. Robbins, president of M. I. Robbins Realty Company. It accused him of seeking to induce white owners to sell their homes by telling them that blacks were moving into their neighborhoods and of directing prospective home buyers to areas in which their race was predominant.

title: S.I.A. Backs Extension Of Exchange's Hours
description: The Securities Industry Association, a leading financial trade group, was reported yesterday to have Informed the New York Stock Exchange that Fits directors thought trading hours should be extended on the Big Board.

title: 30 Volunteers Put Fulton St. Block in Shipshape for Sea Day Tomorrow
description: In preparation for Sea Day tomorrow, a group of 30 volunteers wielded broom and shovels yesterday to clean up Fulton Street between South and Front Streets near the South Street Seaport Museum, which is sponsoring Sea Day.

title: Martin Rothstein Marries Miss Marcus
description: Miss Pauline Marcus of New York, education librarian for Herbert H. Lehman College of the City University, was married here yesterday afternoon to Martin Rothstein, a managing partner of the firm of Rothstein te Trachtenberg, certified public accountants in New York. Judge Irving Younger of the Civil Court performed the ceremony in his chainhers.

title: McCormack Joins Board
description: BOSTON, May 18 (AP) John W. McCormack, former Speaker of the House, said today that he had joined the board of directors of Massachusetts Citizens for Life Movement in America.

title: A Suspect Wanted In'64 Murder Plot Surrenders Here
description: Edward J. McGrath, a power on the New York waterfront in the turbulent nineteenforties and fifties surrendered to District Attorney Frank S. Hogan here yesterday and was charged with refusing to testify before a grand jury last February.

title: Ship Sinks Off Indonesia
description: LISBON, May 18 (Reuters) A Portuguese freighter, the O Arbiru, with 19 crew members and five women passengers, sank in a storm near Indonesia. Only one survivor has been found, a Portuguese Overseas Ministry spokesman said today. The survivor, a crewman, was found on the Indonesian island of Flores.

title: AIDE IS IDENTIFIED
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 James W. McCord Jr. testified today that an Administration official, who said that he was acting with President Nixon's knowledge, had offered him executive clemency, financial aid and eventually a job to win his silence in the Watergate scandal.

title: Byrne Learning to Doff Habits With Robes
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., May 18Brendan Thomas Byrne, at the age of 49, is learning to be a public politician.
