title: Queens Detour Set Monday
description: The New York City Traffic Department announced yesterday that it would detour traffic on Astoria Boulevard North in Queens for about two months beginning Monday to enable workmen to resurface the roadway from 46th to 31st Streets.

title: Beaths
A Poker Game That's Not for Pikers
description: LAS VEGAS, May 18 You knew why this tournament is going so slow, Thomas Austin Preston, better knoWn as Amarillo Slim, shouted to the crowd last night after the first three hours of the final event of the World Series of Poker. It's because every one of these peckerwoods here read my book.

title: NIXON VETOES BILL ON CONFIRMATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 18President Nixon, accusing Congress of a backdoor assault on Presidential authority, vetoed today a bill that would require Senate confirmation of the director and deputy director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Marjorie E. Siebern Dead; Judge of Purebred Dogs
description: Marjorie Elaine. Slebern, an internationally known judge of, purebred dogs who retired in 1971 as an art teacher in the Purchase (N. Y.) School, died ?? ?? (Pa.) General Hospital. She was 57 years old and lived in Newburgh, N. Y., and formerly in. Gardiner, N. Y.

title: NEELY FIRST PICK IN W.H.A'S DRAFT
description: TORONTO, May 18 (AP) Bob Neely, a defenseman of the Peterborough Petes, was the first player chosen today in the World Hockey Association amateur draft and he said, I'll go to the highest bidder.

title: 7th Fuel and Munitions Convoy Reaches Capital of Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 18 (AP)Six tankers and an ammunition barge reached ?? Penh today after running through Communist rocket and cannon fire along the Mekong River.

title: High Drama in Quiet Testimony
description: WASHINGTON, May 18His voice seemed too small and grainy to have any resounding impact. His bearing was reminiscent of an accountant reciting from a balance sheet.

title: CAMDEN 28 JURY ASKS REREADING
description: CAMDEN, May 18The jury in the Camden 28 case returned to the courtroom today for a rereading of the testimony of a Government informer.

title: FREEPRESS ISSUE CALLED SETTLED
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Ara., May 18  Watergate may not magically and completely restore the corroded credibility of the media, but the issue of free press has been settled for years to come, Osborn Elliott, editor and board chairman of Newsweek magazine, told an audience of advertising people here today. Television sets are rare at the Greenbrier resort hotel and few people are watching the Senate hearings, but the talk of Watergate is ,constant at the 56th annual meeting of the American Association of Advertising Agencies and almost all of the speakers have referred it.

title: Pitfalls of Hearsay
description: Senator Ervin and his Senate select committee are showing only elementary prudence and fairness in warning that guilt cannot be established by hearsay. There are other things that should not be accepted on hearsay, toosuch as orders or instructions allegedly from the President of the United States. The nation would have been spared much of its current agony if all Administra tion officials had shown similar prudence.

title: N.B.C. to Appeal a Ruling on Fairness
description: The National Broadcasting Company planning to appeal a recent Federal Communications Commission staff ruling that the 1972 N.B.C. news special Pensions: The Broken Promise violated the fairness doctrine.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Manhattan district attorney's office reports that two people, a man and a woman, have come forward who say they witnessed the incident on April 28 when James Layne, 29 years old, allegedly tried to sell his 3moutnold daughter, Kim Cruz, on the MT Subway. Mr. Layne was freed on parr ole this week after the district attorney was unable to find any of the more than 30 witnesses to the incident.

title: Art: Alice Mason Abstracts
description: The American painter Alice Trumbull Mason died in 1971 at the age of 67. For many years she had been known to a small circle of artists and followers of the art scene as a painter who had championed the cause of abstract art at a timethe nineteen thirtieswhen it was unpopular to do so. Her own abstract paintings turned up from time to time in group exhibitions, especially the exhibitions of the American Abstract Artists, an organizeLion that she helped found andthat she served in various executive capacities, but she could not be said to have made a very definite impression on the art public. She had only one solo exhibition jn 1959in her own life

title: Archibald Cox Appointed Prosecutor for Watergate
FAILURE OF BILLS ON HEALTH CITED Congressman Charges Nixon Men Hurt Measures
description: BETHESDA, Md., May 18 A Congressional leader in health legislation said today that the Administration's decisions on health policy, and the men who make those, decisions would face sharp scrtitiny in the future.

title: The Mess in the Philippines
description: ITHACA, N, Y.It is time perhaps to beg to differ with some of the pithy nonsense being circulated in defense of martial law in the Philippines.

title: Seaver, Garrett Stand Out in 43 Victory
Art: A Summer Show
description: Nudes in Landscapes, which has just opened at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, is one of those charming summer idylls that wellendowed institutions can mount when the season is over and, so to speak, the living is easy. It is a small, relaxed exhibition, comprising 16 paintings, ranging from the mid15th century to the early 20th century, drawn primarily from the museum's European paintings department. The didactic theme of the exhibition is the wedding of the nude figure with the landscape, a tradition developed in Western painting over a period of several centuries. The show encompasses some of the great names in European paintings  Rubens, Corot, Courbet, Cezanne as well as some unexpected delights, like Fauns and Nymphs Bathing, by the 17century Dutch painter, Cornelis

title: McCord Motives Seem to Puzzle Senators
description: WASHINGTON, May 18James W. McCord Jr. went to great lengths today to explain why he had participated in the Watergate burglary and wiretapping.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 559
description: MOSCOW, May 18 (UPI)The Soviet Union today lofted Cosmos 559, its second unmanned satellite to be launched in two days, the press agency Tass said. The satellite was orbiting every 89.8 minutes, its maximum distance from the earth 214 miles and its minimum 134 miles, the agency said.

title: Wife Says Mitchell Has Been Shielding Nixon on Watergate
description: Mrs. Martha Mitchell said yesterday that her husband, former Attorney General John N. Mitchell, had been protecting President Nixon in the Watergate scandal. She suggested that Mr. Nixon might be impeached if he did not resign.

title: Much Ado About Tapping
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The papers have made a big fuss about the wiretapping which Henry Kissinger and the President had the F.B.I. do on some of their top foreignpolicy people. It is typical of the way the press is blowing things all out of proportion these days.

title: BRITAIN TALKING TOUGH TO ICELAND
description: LONDON, May 18A revolt by the captains of British Trawlers fishing in disputed waters near Iceland has embarrassed London, emboldened Icelanders and brought both sides somewhat closer to a showdown on the high seas.

title: Skipper's Dream Takes Lady Maud at Westbury
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 18John Chapman wisely took advantage of a slow third quarter to win tonight's $52,177.50 Lady Maud pace with Skipper's Dream before approximately 21,000 persons at Roosevelt Raceway. It was the 14th edition of the 3yearold filly companion stake to the Messenger, which is scheduled here tomorrow night. Chapman will driving J. R. Skipper in that race.

title: Environmental Bill Signed
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (AP) President Nixon signed today legislation authorizing continuned funds for the Council on Environmental Quality and its staff, the White House said.

title: 8 Killed in Upsurge of Ulster Violence
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 18 Eight people have been killed in the last 24 hours in a new surge of terrorist violence in Northern Ireland.

title: Landlord Groups Threaten to Sue Over Base Rent
description: The city's major realestate organizations yesterday threatened simultaneous court action and cancellation of contracts with building service unions if repeal of the controversial maximumbaserent formula becomes law.

title: SUE PERFORMS LISZT AND CHOPIN
description: Roger Scime is a curious pianist. Not lacking in interest, but curious. His recital at Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night, which confined itself to Liszt and Chopin, went in and out of focus like a home movie. Mr. Scime would play brilliantly one moment, then speed glibly past important pauses, overlook dramatic punctuation marks and drop notes or distort rhythms in an apparent hurry to get on with the music.

title: Net Redemptions Of Funds in April Advanced Sharply
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Net redemptions of mutual fund shares, after dropping to a few million dollars in March, rose sharply in April to a total of $151.8million, the Investment Company Institute reported today.

title: JUVENILE JUSTICE IS TARGET OF DRIVE
description: A major drive to devise pragmatic system of justice for the nation's children got under way here yesterday with the first meeting of a dignitarystudded commission of judges lawyers, sociologists and professors.

title: Missing Fisherman Sought
description: CAPE MAY, May 18 (AP)An air and sea search was conducted today for Alfred Willis, Wildwood Crest harbormaster, missing since yesterday on a fishing trip. The 21foot outboard craft in which the 69yearold Mr. Willis sailed was found off the coast here yesterday with her motor running. There was no sign of Mr. Willis.

title: W. GERMANY LEADS BRITAIN IN TENNIS
description: Britain bowed to West Germany in the first two singles matches of their Davis Cup series in Munich yesterday. Jurgen Fassbender upset Mark Cox, 63, 64,.16, 97, and Karl Meiler upset Roger Taylor 63 64, 64.

title: MRS. LORENZ J. BROSNAN
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., May 18  Mrs. Mary Maher Brosnan, widow of Lorenz J. Brosnan, who has been counsel to the New York State Medical Association, died today in New Rochelle Hospital. She was 73 years old and lived at 3 East Avenue.

title: Pothole Alters LifeStyle Of an Over 50 Bicyclist
description: The parking situation in Manhattan irritated Mrs. Ilse Wolff so much that she decided in 1966, although only few years shy of her 70th birthday, to ridd a motorcycle to reach the homes of the dogs she grooms and trains.

title: Brewers Get 3 Runs Off Lyle to Win, 65
description: Just when it looked as if the Yankees would attain the seemingly unattainablea 500 recordand just when it looked as if Sparky Lyle was becoming invincible once again, the Yankee dreams went poof last night.

title: Rising Costs Are Factor
description: The National Tea Company, another major supermarket chain whose operating results have been impaired by rising costs and intensified price competition, reported yesterday a net loss of $36million for the fiscal year ended March 31. In the preceding fiscal year the net income was $8.9million, or $1.18 a share.

title: AIDE IS IDENTIFIED
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 James W. McCord Jr. testified today that an Administration official, who said that he was acting with President Nixon's knowledge, had offered him executive clemency, financial aid and eventually a job to win his silence in the Watergate scandal.

title: Communists Shell Near Hue With Big Guns, Saigon Says
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 18 (AP)  The South Vietnamese command said today that the Communists had battered the western defenses of Hue with nearly 600 rounds of artillery, using longrange 130mm. guns. It was the first reported use of the big guns since the ceasefire nearly four months ago.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ABRAHAM SHLONSKY, ISRAELI POET, DIES
description: TEL AVIV, May 18  Abraham Shionsky, a poet who helped adapt the tongue of the Old Testament prophets to the language of modern Israel, died today at the age of 75.

title: Manhattan G.O.P. Got $17,000 for Javits
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Senator Jacob K. Javits has reported receiving about $17,000 last year through the New York County Republican Committee, to help defray certain Senateoffice operating expenses. The money, which came from several friends of the New York Republican, was reportd the required in annual discloiures of contributions and honorariums filed this week with the secretary of the Senate by Mr. Javits, He noted that he had not been a candidate for reelection last year, but said it was appropriate to state these facts as a matter of record."

title: OIL BOOM ALTERS LIFE FOR ECUADOR
description: QUITO, Ecuador, May 9This handsome old Spanish colonial city is in the throes of a construction boom, hotels are saturated, shops are full of imported goods, streets are jammed with cars and prices are soaring.

title: A.D.A. URGES NIXON TO QUIT PRESIDENCY
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP) Americans for Democratic Action voted today to call for President Nixon's resignation as a result of the Watergate scandal.

title: Genesis of the Stories on Biaggi
description: For the last month, stories about Representative Mario Biaggi have been popping on the front pages of the city's newspapers.

title: PREMIER IS BACK ON JOB IN LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 19Amin Hafez today resumed his post as Premier, from which he resigned May 8 at the height of fighting between the Lebanese Army and the Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Diana Knowlton Grand Is Bride Of James Masters, Harvard 71
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 19  Miss Diana Knowlton Grand and James Henry Peniston Masters were married here this afternoon in an Episcopal ceremony in St. Bede's Chapel by the Rev. Dr. Arthur Lee Kinsolving.

title: Blind Are Given Art Experience
description: GREENVALE, L.I. What began as a doctoral dissertation proposal for a local Long Island artist has resulted in an unusual art experience for five blind students attending C.W. Post College of Long Island University.

title: Bringing the System to Justice
description: WASHINGTONThe accountability of the President is the central issue of the Watergate criminality. Over the years, the apparatus for unaccountable government has been building on many fronts. Pervasive seamy, the loss of. Congressional power to relentless Presidential seizure, the remoteness of bureaucracy from citizens, growing governmental illegalitythese are not recent phenomena. But the Nixon Administration has accelerated these trends to levels which would have impressed even its predecessors.

title: Election Reform
description: WASHINGTONWhile those words were being uttered, the President's fundraisers,. were collecting more than $15million with promises to contributors that if they gave before the new act went into effect their names would not be disclosed. Last week, amid continuing disclosures of how his campaign funds were used for political espionage, President Nixon acknowledged the inadequacy of the 1972 act and proposed that Congress set up a nonpartisan, toplevel, independent commission charged with making concrete proposals for reform,

title: Camera World
description: HE Youth Activities Committee of the Photographic Society of America is accepting entries for the Young PhotOgraphers Showcase which will form a traveling exhibit that will be displayed in large cities throughout the country. Open to those who will not be 26 before Dec. 31, 1973, the competition will award a first prize of $1,000, a second prize of $50, a third of $250 and a fourth of $250. Each participant can enter up to four blackandwhite or color prints, mounted or unmounted, and at least 8x10 inches in size. There is no entry fee and the closing date for entries is July 12. For entry forms and more information write: Margaret S. Hessberg, 720 Milton Road, Rye; N.Y. 10580 phone (914) 9678750.

title: Durable Tobacco King
Inventor Patents Gas Vender
description: GLEN ROCK  A retired civil engineer here believes that he has a solution to the problem that a motorist faces when his gasoline gauge reads E and servicestation signs read Closed.

title: Headliners
description: First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. lost another battle last week but he hasn't given up the, struggle. Calley is the only person convicted of the masskillings at the vietnamese hamlet of My Lai in 1968, and the ArmyAir Foree Clemeney and Parole Board had recommended that his 20year prison sentence, be reduced to 17 years. Last Monday, however, on his final, day in office, the Secretary of the Army, Robert Froehlke, turner dOwn the. recommendation. On Tuesday he was succeeded by Howard Callaway, a Georgia businessman, and Calley's attorney announced immediately that the petition for clemency would be renewed. Calley has been confined to his apartment at Fort Benning, Ga., for two years while making the appeals.

title: Steinbeck Home Put Up for Sale on Coast
description: SALINAS, Calif., May 19 (UPI)The twostory, wood frame boyhood home of John Steinbeck, the author, has been listed for sale by its present owner, the Roman Catholic Diocese of Monterey.

title: KING'S BISHOP SETS RECORD IN CARTER
France Rejects Request From Cleaver for Asylum
description: PARIS, May 19The Interior Ministry said today that France has rejected a request for political asylum from Eldridge Cleaver, the fugitive Black Panther leader.

title: Florence Foster Bride of Raja Arwade, Engineer
description: DARIEN, Conn., May 19Miss Florence Wardwell Foster and Raja Bhupal Arwade were married here this afternoon by the Rev. Nelson N. Back in St. Luke's Episcopal Church.

title: 18 Are Reported Injured. By a Tornado in Alabama
description: HAZEL GREEN, Ala., May 19 (AP)A tornado skipped across portions. of northern Alabama today, injuring at least 18 persons, officials said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: There really should be some humane way to keep families like the George A. Zabriskies ['The Wilds Are Not For Us, April 22] from moving to rural areas.

title: Mosquito Spraying Started in Bergen
description: HACKENSACKThe County Mosquito Extermination Commission Its started its preseason spraying program for the control of woodland pool Aedes mosquitoes. A helicopter is being used to inspect and spray upland county areas, according to Freeholder Victor M. Williams, chairman of the Public Works Committee.

title: Sunday Observer
description: Call it paranoia, call it childishness. Still, something strange is going on. For instance: that mysterious Gallup popularity poll giving Senator Kennedy an impressive lead over Spiro Agnew.

title: Unused Pier on the Lower West Side Is Proposed for Tennis
description: The park Department, in, a broadening of its attempt to involve the private sector in meeting the demand for indoor tennis facilities, will begin a search this week for someone to develop courts on an unused Lower West Side pier, and is considering such indoor facilities at two other city sites.

title: Ban on X Movies Extended
description: CLINTON  The Brandt theater chain has extended, at least until the end of May, its ban on showing Xrated films at the Clinton Point Theatre.

title: Whither the House Tour? Maybe to Extinction
description: The obituary may be premature, but there are those who believe that the house tourthat lucrative form of fundraising dear to the hearts of the city's clubwomenis earmarked for extinction.

title: New Novel
description: This novel continues the history of Giulio Sansovero, some of whose life was unraveled in The Book of Sansovero. He is now about as old as the year ('36) and is having house built in the tiny village of Licudi, among the olive groves of Calabria. The most notable feature of the novel is the texture of the society it describes. Licudi is so primitive that incest seems better established than the Wheel. Despite its familiar feuds and dark relationships, it presents an Arcadian face to Sansovero, an urban aristocrat.

title: State Racing Measure Leaves Tracks Unhappy
description: The head of New York thoroughbred tracks and the president of Roosevelt Raceway's harness track had negative reactions yesterday to the Legislature's approval of a new racing and betting measure.

title: Indochina A Shout of Defiance in The Senate
description: WASHINGTON  From behind the swinging caf doors of the Senate Appropriations Committee last week came a shout of defiance that shook a White House determined to continue with the bombing of Cambodia. By a Vote of 24 to 0 the committee passed an amendment attached by Senator Thomas F. Eagleton of Missouri to a routine $3.2billion supplemental appropriations bill. The amendment, if passed by both houses of Congress, Would cut off all funds for the bombing.

title: Son Born to Mrs. Lapof
description: A son was born on May 8 to Mr. and Mrs. Ray C. Lapof at LyingIn Hospital. The child has been named David Barnaby. Mr. Lapof is president of BarRay Products, a Brooklyn manufacturing company.

title: Mary K. Bigharn and Alan Binks, Safari Guides, Are Married
description: GREAT BARRINGTON, Mass., May 19Miss Maly Kirkpatrick. Bigham and Alan PenroseLangdale Binks, who are safari guides for. Abercrombie & Kent in Nairobi, Kenya, were married here this afternoon in St. James Episcopal Church.

title: Another case for Lew Archer
description: This detective story carries a dedication to Eudora Welty a gracious and appropriate gesture, but one that suggests, as the book suggests, that the author has fallen prey to the exuberance of his critics and is now writing in the shadow of a selfregard that tends to play his talent false.

title: World Series of Poker Won by an Ace High Hand
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 19Walter Clyde (Pug) Pearsor won the World Series of Pokes early today after three hours of headtohead play with Johnny Moss, who at 67 was the oldest man in the big game.

title: Brooklyn And Queens Fighting Tax Raise
description: Mayor Lindsay's proposal last week to increase real estate taxes has met with strong opposition from political leaders in Brooklyn and Queens  two boroughs where homeowners would be among the hardest hit.

title: Miss Hammond To Be a Bride
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 19Mr. and Mrs. William Knapp Hammond have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Lewis Hammond to E. Hawley Van Wyck 3d of Washington, son of Mrs. Clayton Adelbert Farrar of Greenwich and the late E. Hawley Van Wyck Jr. of Monclair, N.J.

title: DEAD MAN CASTS POLITICAL SHADOW
description: A controversial and often shadowy figure who called politics his hobby as he piled up millions from his Yonkers Raceway and other lucrative family interests, the late Martin Tananbaum wove a net of associations that even now touches or entangles three of four candidates seeking the Democratic nomination for Mayor.

title: Scandals
description: TRENTONWith the Gubernatorial primary in New Jersey just two weeks off, Governor William T. Cahill finds himself campaigning for reelection under something of a handicap: The three Republicans who originally constituted his inner political circle have been Convicted, indicted or implicated in conspiracies that involve serious criminal charges.

title: 1776 ENGRAVINGS SOLD FOR $82,600
description: A set of four engravings from 1775, depicting the Battle of Lexington, the seizure of the North Bridge at Concord and views of the battlegrounds, brought $82,500 at auction on Friday. One of about 10 known, the rare set was engraved by Amos Doolittle of New Haven from drawings made by Ralph Earl shortly after the historic April engagements. Doolittle had the engravings, handcolored, ready for sale in De ember.

title: 2 SHARE LEAD AT 144 IN BLUEGRASS GOLF
New Mauritanian Currency
description: NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, May 19 (Agence FrancePresse) Mauritania today named its new independent currency the ougiya. The currency will replace the African Financial Community franc later this year as a result of Mauritania's decision to quit the African Franc Zone. The ougiya's parity will be the same as that of the Community franc, which was traded at 1,100 to the United States dollar.

title: Senate May Approve Coast Plan
description: TRENTON  The State Senate, convening here tomorrow in a special, oneday session, is expected to reverse itself and approve a compromise environmentalprotection plan for the undeveloped stretches of New Jersey's coastline and its offshore waters.

title: When and Where Will It End?
description: PARISLike the word Vietnam with which it has curiously managed to get entangled, Watergate has developed into a sort of code symbol for Americans disgruntlement with themselves, their leaders and their destiny, disgruntlement on a scale transcending both in scope and in intensity even the sordid tragicomedy itself.

title: East Hampton Dredging Is Banned for 6 Months
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I.Spawning fish will have the bottomlands of East Hampton waters all to themselves from Feb. 15 to Aug. 15 from now on.

title: Brunner of Temple Joins Football Staff at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 19John Brunner, offensive backfield coach at Temple for the past three years, has been named offensive coach of football at Princeton.

title: JANE KROLL ROGERS
description: M'LEAN, Va., May 19Jane Kroll Rogers, an artist and founder of the RoKo Gallery in New York; died today in a nursing home here. She was 85 years old and had lived for many years in New York.

title: The World of Apples
description: John Cheever's new collection of stories, The World of Apples, his first collection in nine years, is an extraordinary book, a transfiguring experience for the reader, and Cheever at his best. There is more flexibility, daring, diversity and vigor in this book than in any other of Cheever's (except perhaps Bullet Park), as though Cheever were growing progressively young. Cheever seems the only present writer able to produce enduring short classics, such as The Ocean, The Enormous Radio, The National Pastime and The Swimmer, and in this collection, with the title piece, The World of Apples, there's another to add. Yet Cheever as a writer is never complacent. He,enters each of these pieces as if to save his life.

title: SHOP TALK
description: ENGLEWOOD  The Burrows Gallerye looks like it might be a museum, for there certainly are enough art objects on hand and some are even displayed in museum cases.

title: Secretariat Is Winner
description: Meadow Stable's Secretariat won the Preakness Stakes at Pimlico yesterday, finishing 2 lengths ahead of Sham in 1 minute 55 seconds for the mile and threesixteenths. Secretariat, ridden by. Ron Turcotte paid $2.60, $2.20, $2.10 for $2 across the board. Details in Sectlatt 5.

title: Dance
Miss Briggs Plans Bridal
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill,, May 19Mr. and Mrs. James B. Briggs of East Hampton, L. I.. and Lake Forest have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Melanie Mary Briggs, to Jeffrey Paul Donaldson. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. James R. Donaldson of New York and East Hampton.

title: Elizabeth's OpenAir Marts
description: ELIZABETH  Openair food markets still flourish here, and if the childhood nostalgia of it all has no particular appeal, the prices certainly do.

title: Gas Shortage Traces Erratic Pattern
description: RAMSEYThe service stations along Route 17 told the story last week of the erratic pattern of New Jersey's gasoline shortage.

title: Newark Is Still Losing White Residents
The legacy of that other war in Asia
description: Kissinger and Chou Enlai keep shaking hands and smiling. Americans, for the first time in a decade, seem largely relieved of the burden of Vietnam. The Japanese happily set up an embassy in Peking. Russians, Japanese and Americans talk seriously about billions of dollars of possible investments in Siberia. Even North and South Koreans have exchanged delegations and begun to talk about peaceful unification. The future in East Asia seems, indeed, pleasing.

title: On the Other Bank of the Old Raritan
description: HIGHLAND PARKAcross the Raritan River from New Brunswick, the hoMe of Rutgers, Highland Park Is con sidered the bedroom for the the faculty and staff members of the state university. Many of the 14,500 residents of this 1.8squaremile Middlesex County community delight in referring to the tie with Rutgers, even if it The Talk is minimal. And of this may be one Highland of the reasons Park why they seem to be satisfied with what they have and quite reluctant to make any changes.@@The Talk of Highland Park

title: Notes: From Railroad to Park
description: A 32mile backwoods railroad line in western Wisconsin, connecting the towns of Elroy and Sparta, isn't overgrown by weeds and forgotten today eight years after the end of scheduled train service. Instead it is the most successful part of a vigorous program by the State of Wisconsin to turn abandoned railroads into state parks.

title: Michigan Man Sentenced To 10 Years for Hijacking
description: ST. LOUIS, May 19 (AP)A Michigan man has received the maximum sentence of 10 years in prison for his part in the hijacking of an American Airlines jet here last summer.

title: Everett Fahy of the Met Is Narned. Frick Director
description: Everett. Fahy, the curator of European paintings at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, has been named director of the Frick Collection. Mr. Fahy will assume the directorship of the 53yearold institution at Fifth Avenue and 70th Street one year after Harry Grier, who headed the collection from 1964 to 1972, was hit and killed by a truck.

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: IWAS horrified at your Gestapo type crucifixion of a dedicated artist like Madame Renata Tebaldi It was in very poor taste.

title: Nashington and Lee Downs Navy in N.C.A.A. Lacrosse
Letters To the Editor; Angel Fire (Continued); To the Editor:
description: Joyce Carol Oates, commenting in this space on my review of her book Angel Fire, raises again the difficulty between poets and critics, that the poet is using modes of selfexpression that shouldn't irritate or upset anyone, that the critic is firing a cannon at a butterfly:,

title: Dieudonne Coste, Pioneer Flier, Dies
description: PARIS, May 19 (UPI)Dieudonne Coste, a pioneer longdistance aviator; died yesterday. He was 80 years old.

title: Pisani, New Rochelle High, Takes Single Sculls Race
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 19 Frank Pisani of New Rochelle High School won the John B. Kelly Cup Race by four lengths today in the Stotesbury Regatta on the Schuylkill River. He defeated John Fanelli of Father Judge High and Jim Barker of St. Joseph's in 5 minutes 54 seconds for the 1,500meter single sculls event.

title: 4 Mayoral Candidates To Speak in Queens
description: The four canidates for mayor will participate in an open forum tomorrow night at 8 o'clock at Young Israel of Forest Hills, on Yellowstone Boulevard an Burns Street.

title: Letterss to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The vote in the House on May 10 to ban the use of certain defense funds for the bombing of Cambodia may prove to be a landmark.

title: Movies
description: E races pit of his Pierre bedroom like a golden retriever, leaps into he air and lands on both feet. HIIIEEE! he yells, thrusting both arms Into the air the way Al Jolson used to do whenever be sang Maimny. The smile is dazzling, the.sweater, is Killarney green, the pants tan chino. And despite his very George Segalish moustache, the overall impressioneven though he has just; turned 32is still. WASPy boyish Adonis, Yes, it is Ryan O'Neal, come to town to talk aboid the movie that he says Or at least hopes, will exonerate himfor having made Love Story.

title: Criminals At Large
description: A new Spillanebut under it beats the heart of the old Mickey. It's named THE LAST COP OUT (Dutton, $6.95), and it's the usual Spillane mixsex, sadism, assorted fun and games with gun and fist. This one is about the Mafia, and a Mafia hating cop called back into service. There's supposed to be a mystery behind the mystery, except that anybody who doesn't guess where the author is heading when he reaches page 25 is an innocent who wouldn't know a clue from clevis.

title: Burns, Vogt, Stuart and Wise Advance to Semifinal Round of Travis Golf
DR. RALPH B. GAETA
description: RAMSEY, N. J., May 19Dr. Ralph B. Gaeta, an optometrist, died yesterday in Valley Hospital, Ridgewood. He was 60 years old and lived at 250 East Main Street.

title: New Antimatter Is Detected by Soviet
description: MOSCOW, May 19  Soviet scientists, using their biggest atom smasher in a continuing search for new forms of antimatter, reported today that they had created and detected] nuclei of antitritium.

title: Medical Grant Given Yale
description: NEW HAVEN, May 19The National Institute of General Medical Sciences of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare has awarded the Yale School of Medicine a fiveyear, $1.6million grant to establish a center for the study of human genetics and inherited disease.

title: Anne Goodman Becomes Bride
description: NEW MILFORD, Conn., May 19In the First Congregational Church here this afternoon, Miss Anne Howes Goodman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Davidson Goodman of New Milford and Boca Raton, Fla., and James Danielly Finley Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Finley of Red Bank, N.J., were married by the Rev. A. Russell Ayre.

title: KISSINGER AND THO HOLD THIRD MEETING
description: PARIS, May 19 (Reuters)Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho of North Vietnam held their third meeting in three days here today to discuss ways of carrying out the Vietnam ceasefire agreement.

title: 5 Workers Killed in France
description: CREN, France, May 19 (Reuters)Five workers were killed and three others injured yesterday when the pillar of a viaduct they were building near here collapsed.

title: PYONGYANG'S ENTRY IN W.H.O. IRKS SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 19 Premier Kim Jong Pil of South Korea, expressing regret over the admission of North Korea into the World Health Organization, asserted today that 'irresponsible acts of many countries were impeding Seoul's efforts to achieve national unification.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A citywide conference on serving the elderly has been called for Monday by the Vacations for the Aging and Senior Centers Association at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, 345 East 46th Street.

title: HOME FURNISHINGS
description: In the changing life style of Americans, hospitality has made giant strides. More and more, dinners and cocktail parties at home and buffets in the garden have become increasingly popular and hostesses vie in serving gourmet foods and presenting elaborate cookouts.

title: Spring Is Luring Riders To Scenic Horse Trails
description: BERNARDSVILLESpring has brought horseback riders back to the miles of twisting bridle paths on the fringes of Somerset and Morris Counties.

title: Supersecret Work of C.I.A. Is Scored
description: Two leading scholars in the field of national security said yesterday that the supersecret operations mechanism of the Central Intelligence Agency had become a selfserVing and uncontrolled danger to United States foreign policy and should be abolished by Congress.

title: A revisionist view of female sexuality
description: The essential astonishing revelation to come out of the women'sliberation movement is that American middleclass collegeeducated women feel crushed under the boot of male tyranny. Throughout the 1950's we had been hearing from the psychiatric sages that American women were overaggressive and competitive, castrators in the world of work as well as in the home. Their rampant Momism was driving American men to homosexuality and worsea passion for milk and ice cream, clearly symptomatic of infantile addiction to the breast.

title: What's New in Theater?
description: CYRANO, a musical by Anthony Burgess adapted from Edmond Rostand's Cyrano de Bergerac, with music by Michael 3. Lewis, got four favorable reviews (Barnes, Times; Glover, AP; Harris, CBSTV; Sanders, ABCTV), four mixed (Watts, Post; Wallach, Newsday; Raidy, Newhouse Newspapers; Gayer, UPI) and three unfavorable reviews (Watt, News; Gottfried, Women's Wear; Klein, WNEWTV).

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: COMMERCE DEPARTMENT reported firstquarter corporate profits of $62.3billion, after taxes; up 26 per cent from a year before.... G. Bradford Cook resigned as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission after 74 days because of allegations that he had deleted from an S.E.C. complaint areference to a $200,000 secret contribution by Robert L. Vesco to President Nixon's reelection campaign.... Hugh F. Owens, an S.E.C. commissioner has become acting head of the agency.

title: Automated warfare that will be remembered
description: This is an epitaph for a small people. From the spring of 1964 until early 1973, American planes, flying perhaps a halfmillion sorties, dropped nearly two million tons of bombs on Laos, or nearly a ton for every man, woman and child. Since a third of this population now are refugees, and the bombing has been confined to particular areas, a portion of the Lao people has absorbed the heaviest aerial attack in history.

title: MANILA IS BATTLING SHORTAGES OF RICE
description: MANILA, May 19Last year's floods and the 10month drought that followed caused a 25 per cent drop in rice production, but President Ferdinand E. Marcos says that imports and a production drive will prevent a severe shortage.

title: Huntington Is Studying Transit Problems
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I.  A sixmonth study began here Thursday to determine the transportation needs of Huntington residents and evolve a plan to aid them, including young people and women isto are prisoners of their chauffeuring chores.

title: Mrs. Sorger Has Son
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., May I9A son was born on May 4 to Dr. and Mrs. Martin L. Sorger at Mountainside Hospital here. The child has been named John Lawrence. Mrs. Sorger is the former Miss Susan Well of Akron, Ohio. Dr. Sorger is a member of the orthopedic teaching staff at the Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons.

title: Aura Leads 3Year Sail Series
description: With ocean sailboat racing under way in earnest it's time to catch up with the second world ocean racing championship, which is approaching, the halfway mark of its threeyear period. Wally Stenhouse, a Chicago insurance executive who campaigns the 49foot Aura holds the lead. He has accumulated 23 points and has competed in four of seven pre scribed races. Second is Jesse Philip's 56foot Charisma with 49 points, while Ralph Ryder's Phantom, a 50footer, is in third place with 65 points. The boat with the lowest fleetscore total from seven races of 22 selected ocean contests will be the winner. The SydneyHobart race on Dec. 26, 1974, is the last race counting toward the title.

title: Martha's Vineyard and the dilemma of land use
description: There is a compelling and urgent message in this book, a message which we cannot ignore and from which we cannot escape. It is that unless we squarely face the issue of land use, we cannot expect to raise the quality of life in this country to the high levels we all desire.

title: Susan Zannini To. Be a Bride
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill, May, 19  Miss Susan Margaret Zannini and Anthony Francis Abell, a descendant of Arunah S. Abell, the founder in 1837 and publisher of The Baltimore Sun, will be married next month..

title: The World
description: MEXICO CITYIf history is the diplomat's burden, Secretary of State William. P. Rogers was certainly carrying it last ,week as he started his 17day, eightnation tour of Latin America. His trip was the latest manifestation of United States concern over lessthanideal relations with the nations of the hemisphere, a concern that has been reciprocated by the Latin Americans for nearly half a century.

title: SUIT SEEKS DATA ON I.R.S. DECISION
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Ar organization that was denied taxexempt status by the Internal Revenue Service has sued to force disclosure of whether anyone in the White House, or elsewhere outside the Revenue Service, interfered in the case,

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTONAs April turned into May, James Louis Robertson slipped quietly out of office after 46 years in the Federal Government, 21 of them as one of the seven. members of the Federal Reserve Board. He left at.a vigorotts 68 years of age and with an exceptionally warm letter of appreciation from President Nixon.

title: Boy, 16, Critically Injured By a Pipe Bomb in Queens
description: A 16yearold Queens student was critically injured yesterday afternoon when a pipe bomb exploded as he was holding it in the bedroom of his apartment.

title: DEATHS OF WOMEN LINKED TO SMOKING
description: Heavy cigarette smoking among women has been linked to a greatly increased risk of dying at a relatively young age from a sudden heart attack, an autopsy study in Westchester County has shown.

title: The Paris Commune
description: A great historical tragedy, such as the story of the 1871 Commune, deserves a great historical treatment, so it is pity that Stewart Edwards has merely provided a very good one. It can be confidently recommended to anyone interested in the subject, though beginners are likely to be put off by the inelegant, alltoooften ungrammatical academese in which it is written.

title: Babbitt in the White House
description: The other day the Knight Newspapers placed a public service ad in its own and other publications. The ad's headline stated, boldly and ironically, It Can't Happen Here. The illustration showed the famous picture of Storm Troopers in Berlin putting the torch to books that were unGerman. The ad said: There is a struggle going on in this country. It is not just a fight by reporters and editors to protect their sources. It is a fight to protect the public's right to know. Even the protection of the First Amendment may not be sufficient to prevent a gradual erosion of this cherished freedom under pressure from courts and government. It can't happen here as long as the press remains an open conduit through which public information flows. But, if the press becomes a tool through which the government informs the public of only those things it thinks the public should know, anything can here.

title: In America's fiction America's self is a hidden character
description: In this study of the American novel from Hemingway to Mailer, Alfred Kazin is a critic with whom the foreigner can see eye to eye. He understands that novels are novels and will stand or fall by the way they are done. He believes in the patience and depth of fiction itself"; it is not journalism. It brings no news:

title: Thompson Projects LowKey Image
description: TRENTON"Watergate is a monumental tragedy that can only have a deleterious effect on public confidence in government, Representative Frank Thompson Jr. said the other day. The President has done an atrocious job of handling it, and I'm not altogether, sure he told the truth... Among a lot of other basic things, there have to be tighter controls on campaign funding.

title: New and Recommended
description: BREAKFAST OF CHAMPIONS, by Kurt Vonnegut Jr. (Delacorte, $7.95.) Being the life and total collapse of Dwayne Hoover, whose wife has ended it all by ingurgitating Drano and who goes berserk after reading a novel that accords him free willa comedy of despair.

title: Reservations or Two: One in the Inn and One in the Stable
description: IF you've ever seen pictures of warhorses in the Middle Ages, then you have a pretty good idea of what Davy looked like. Enormous. Hooves the size of skillets! A barbedwire mane that rose eight ferocious inches straight up from his neck. By rights the whole of his brown, almost black, hide should. have been draped in armor with each oversize ear protruding through a medieval horse helmet.

title: RUSSIAN REVERSES VIEW ON LAKE USE
description: MOSCOW, May 19A Soviet physicist has revived a controversy over the future of Lake Baikal by calling for sensible industrial use of the Siberian lake.

title: State. Tax Cut
description: The temptation to enact a state tax cut proved too great for the lawmakers at Albany to resist. Though the final figures on surpluses have not yet been Made known, it is reasonably clear that surpluses do exist; hence the Legislature voted to suspend the state's 2.5 per cent surcharge on the state income tax for one year.

title: Recordings
description: ,SHEER necessity  the proper parent of an art so nearly allied to invention, wrote Sheridan in The Critic. The classical record industry is an apt illustration of this remark and over the past 50 years four pathbreaking technical developments have come along in the nick of time to rejuvenate broad customer interest and to save the whole business from utter financial despair: electrical recording in 1924, the LP in 1949, stereo in 1958 and now, according to recent auguries at Columbia and RCA, quadraphonics.

title: Minority Business is Assisted
description: NEWARK  The Newark Council of the Interracial Council for Business Opportunity provided free advice and assistance to more than 1,200 minorityowned businesses last year.

title: Fight on Alcoholism Praised
description: CEDAR GROVE  The executive director of the National Council on Alcoholism said last week that New Jersey was moving rapidly to come to grips with the problem of alcoholism, despite the fact that the state was a late starter in the field.

title: Price Increase in Hockey
description: ST. LOUIS, May 19 (AP)The St. Louis Blues of the National Hockey League have announced a ticket price increase of 25 cents to $1.25 for next season. Prices will range from $3 to $9.25.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: Right Now: Evelyn Dixon, liaison officer for the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission, is the guest, Channel 9, 9:30 A.M.

title: Tour in Hamptons Honors Architect
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I.Alfred A. Scheffer designed his first building in the Hampton, the Barbour Beach Hampton Club m Amagansett. In 1938. It did not last long, The hurricane hi September completely demolished the structure, finished only that July,

title: State G.O.P'Man Behind the Scene
Where Are the
description: CLEARLY the theater these days is struggle for both men and women. With the exception of the few who make it REALLY BIG, the rest of us all have to be passionate maniacs of one kind or another to stay in it. But why are there so few women playwrights in the struggle?

title: JURY HEAD LEAVES CAMDEN 28 CASE
description: CAMDEN, N. J., May 19 (UPI)  The jury foreman in the Camden 28 trial asked to be relieved today after presiding over three short sessions of deliberations.

title: FRESH AIR GOAL: 19,000 VACATIONS
description: One day last month, 12yearold Julio Rodriguez of 420 East 119th Street sat down and wrote a postcard to the Hamilton family in Homer, N.Y., where he had visited last summer.

title: Biaggi's New Tack
description: For months Mario Biaggi waged a vigorous, if ultimately unsuccessful, battle to hide the fact that he had invoked the Fifth Amendment before a 1971 Federal gland jury. He abandoned the fight only after the United States Court of Appeals decided to release the minutes of his testimony, which showed that he had refused to answer 16 questions.

title: 'A'Black Cloud
description: Daniel Webster once observed that whatever government is not a government of laws is a despotism; let be called what it may. Senator Ervin of North Carolina, chairman of the select committee to look into the Watersate scandals, cited Webster's words in his opening statement as the committee began its public hearings last week. The committee is, in effect, beginning an inquiry into evidence of an attempt at despotic government, for the several crimes and conspiracies summed up in the word Watergate showed the Nixon Administration acting outside the framework of law and sometimes in direct defiance of the law.

title: The Germ of Life
description: The air of May has a special glint and gleam, especially in the woodland And wherever the pine trees grow. It is more than the dazzle of sunlight. This is the gleam of life, elemental life, as lived by the trees; for it is the pollen of the blossoms of the windpollinated trees that now come to bloom. The pines and all the conifers are spreading golden clouds of sulphuryellow pollen, and so are many of the other forest trees which depend on, the Wind to carry pollen to; the female flowers and, enable. them to produce the seeds that keep this a green, and hospitable place for other forms of life.

title: 6 Die in Colombia Fire
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, May 19 (Reuters)Six children of one family died in a fire that destroyed their shantytown home here yesterday, the police said.

title: SEVENTH AVE.
description: A complaint last year by a disgruntled Philadelphia retailer who couldn't get the merchandise he wanted has led in the last few weeks to a Federal government scmtiny of apparel pricing preiticed by leading New York stores as far back as 1935.

title: Stout Fellow
description: ROTUNDS, middleaged spreads, bulging waistlines, all ye targets of timetoloseweight  rejoice. You are the hero of a new British commemorative set  with all your, glory popping out. You in the person of The Great Cricketeer.

title: Middle East
description: For the first time as a result of calculated policy, rather than as reaction to war, four Arab petroleumproducing states last Tuesday temporarily halted the flow of their oil to consuming na tions. The embargo, which lasted one hour in Iraq, Kuwait and Algeria and 24 hours in Libya was called to protest the, 25th anniversary of the founding of the state of Israel.

title: Caught Napping By Watergate?
description: TO President Nixon, the Watergate affair is a deplorable incident. Others, not surprisingly, take a somewhat less sanguine view. In any case the continuing radio and television coverage of Watergate illustrates the strengths and weaknesses of,,, broadcast journalism. The strengths are obvious. As a recorder of an event, television is unique. The official: statement in print is one thing. The official statement oh TV, punctuated with a facial tic of sweat on the upper lip, is quite another. With some effort, a good writer can capture such details. Television does it effortlessly.

title: Poll Finds Living Cost Is. Chief Concern
description: The high cost of living has replaced the war in Southeast Asia as the major concern of the American public, according to a Gallup Poll released yesterday.

title: Service Unit In Elizabeth Still Active At Age of 80
description: ELIZABETH  The Family and Children's Society, which has been helping the people of Elizabeth and its environs since 1893, will observe its 80th anniversary on Tuesday with an assist from Millicent H. Fenwick, the state's new consumer advocate.

title: Bergen's School for Artists
description: RIDGEWOODParis has its Ecole des Beaux Arts, New York has its Art Students League and Bergen County has its Art Barn.

title: ETHIOPIAN CHURCH GETS OFFICE HERE
description: Abuna Theophilos, Patriarch of the Ethiopian Orthodox Church, yesterday blessed and dedicated the church's United States headquarters, a renovated red brick residence that once housed a Bronx synagogue.

title: Future Social Events
description: May 22Trip the lightfantastic toe in festive dress through tulips just flown from the Netherlands in the Museum of Modern Art's Sculpture Garden. Music by Jeremy Steig. Preview 120 drawings (35 Van Gogh) from the Netherlands KrollerMtIller Museum and refresh yourself (among the underwriters are Van Munching and Heineken) in the sixth floor Founders Room nightclubforthenight, where an open bar and taped dance music plus dietary dainties will be included in your $35 ticket (patron tickets $100 a pair). Proceeds benefit Junior Council activities and museum program. Mrs. Walter N. Thayer is chairman.

title: Robert Schwartzwald Weds Terese Douglas
description: Miss Terese Alix Douglas, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Spencer Douglas, was married here yesterday evening to Robert D. Schwartzwald, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morris Schwartzwald. Both families reside in Kings Point, Li.

title: Engle wood: NudeArt Issue
description: ENGLEWOOD  An art teacher at Dwight Morrow High School and three of his students have raised the issue of nudity and censorship in this Bergen County community.

title: Gardens
description: YOU'VE just missed the last one; wish you'd called yesterday, Douglas Donald cheerfully admonished the latecomer, as he scanned his list of orphans up for adoption. Although Gramercy Neighborhood Associates annual Clean and Green Day was less than an hour old, the block association, with Mr. Donald as president, had already reached its goalfinding foster parents for 41 tree pits bordering New York's Gramercy Park. LoCal residents had pledged to maintaro what may be the smallest gardens ever  the several square feet of ground that surrounds each street tree.

title: Home Repair Clinic
description: QUESTION:An overhead light bulb in my basement was accidentally broken, leaving the base of the bulb in the socket.. How can I safely remove this? F.E.I., Brattleboro, Vt.

title: Congress Awakens
description: Although the worst may be yet to come in the Watergate crisis, the news from Washington is not all bad. While the Executive slips into deeper:. disarray, a rejuvenated Congress has begun to move with remarkable determination and unity of purpose to restore the balance of power that the Founding Fathers had perceptively prescribed to check excesses of any branch of the ]Federal Government.

title: Mrs. Helen Mork Is Wed in Larchrnont
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., May 19The marriage of Mrs. Helen Ruth Mork, widow of Fice Mork, to Bernatd Freeman took place here this morning. State Supreme Court Justice J. Bertram Wegman, cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony at the home of Mr, and Mrs. Arthur L. Finn.

title: Challenge for a Housing Aide
description: NEWARK  Earl Phillips, who was pressured out of his job as director of the city's federally financed HighImpact Anticrime Program, has ended up in another equally controversial post: director of public housing for the Newark Housing Authority. It's like jumping from the frying pan into the fire, the 39yearold Mr. Phillips said last week.

title: IRT BACK TO NORMAL AFTER DERAILMENT
description: An 18hour curtailment of service on the Lexington Avenue IRT subway line caused by the derailment of eight cars Friday night just south of Grand Central was ended yesterday shortly after 4 P.M., according to the Transit Authority.

title: GAS SHORTAGE DUE IN CITY IN WINTER
description: Natural gas will be in short supply next winter in the New York area, according to the latest statistics.

title: Review 1  No Title
description: When her publisher suggested to Beatrix Potter that she prepare for the printer THE SLY OLD CAT, which she had earlier presented to his daughter Nellie, she replied, If I manage to do yet another book, it would not be that cat story(though I think it really amusing), but I do not draw cats well, and am away from that sort of background. Of course she drew cats well, and of course the volume now available (Warne, $2.50. Ages 3 to 6) is amusing. The stress being on nursery manners, the diminutive and impeccable guest may be on the menu; but his hostess, the cat, never fails to employ the civil noun of address, nor to adhere to conventional teaparty ritual; and between the time that Mr. Rat enters with a bow and the time that he exits in triumph, a full and edifying drama ensues.

title: A tired old character named Sergeant Jebb
description: This is the sort of book that gives the oldfashioned novel a bad name. A lot of work, the work of earlier authors, has gone into the repertory of craftsmanship that British writer Storm Jameson here relies on and, I can only say, exploits. The book is full of tired old tricks and tired old characters whom the author attempts to enliven by decking them in garlands of uptodate references to newspaper scandals, recent popular novels or such supposedly trendy topics as drug use among the young, pollution and nuclear holocaust. The question of who shall get a professorial chair at

title: DesertLife Films Set for Wyckoff
description: WYCKOFF  Two films about desert life will be shown Tuesday, May 29, at 2:10 P.M. in the County Wildlife Center here on Crescent Avenue.

title: Return of Wild Turkey
description: PAWLET, Vt., May 19 (AP)The wild turkey, a game bird that disappeared from Vermont before the turn of the century, once again being lumted. Six hunters have bagged trophies since the state's first spring gobbler season opened May 9. The first bird was taken by John T. Hathaway of PawletHe shot the 21 pound, six ounce turkey at 6 A.M. on opening day.

title: Deborah Mehim, Art Teacher, Fiancee of Burrett McBee Jr..
description: UPPER BROOKVILLE, L. I., May 19Mr. and Mrs. Jerald Helmer Melum have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Deborah Ruth Melum, to Burrett Easton McBee Jr., son of the Rev. and Mrs. McBee of Cranston; R. I., and Center Sandwich, N. H. A June wedding is planned.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:; The article Troubled Discount Chains [April 22] focuses chiefly on problems afflicting a very few firms, creating the unwarranted and misleading impression that the entire discount department store industry, is in trouble. The total range of facts presents a radically different picture.

title: Battles of the Budgets.
Ukrainian Cardinal Honored in Newark
description: NEWARK  This city was the scene last week of the visit of a distinguished prelate, and his appearance attracted 5,000 persons, many of them carrying small children, from as far south as Trenton.

title: Disputes On Hiring Disrupting Projects
description: Public construction projects in minority areas have been disrupted arid delayed in recent months by militant community groups demanding greater. participation by minority, workers and subcontractors.

title: City Plan On Parking Protested
description: Plans to close the privately owned 430car parking lot on Avenue H between Nostrand and Flatbush Avenues and to replace it with a cityoperated lot with far fewer parking spaces have been assailed by segments of the local community, including Brooklyn College.

title: An Involved Disk Jockey
description: LONG BRANCHIn July, 1970, when Art Vincent was laid off from his job with a manufacturer of electric computers, he, became a member of one of the rarest species still struggling for survival in the United States: A jazz disk jockey who makes his living entirely from his radio program.

title: What Is It? They Ask
description: JAPANESE umbrella pine (Sciadopitys verticillata) an ornamental evergreen, becomes a conversation piece as soon as it is planted. Though it does not offer much in the way of immediate screening and years must go by before one can sit in its cooling shade, it certainly lends itself to a role as accent on even the smallest of properties. Garden visitors want to know What is it? Where can one buy it?

title: The Long March to Power
description: In July, 1921, just before police moved in, a dozen young Chinese intellectuals hastily abandoned the Po Wen Girls School in Shanghai's French Concession. They reassembled on a pleasure boat on nearby South Lake and concluded the business of the first congress of the Chinese Communist Party (C.C.P).

title: SCHOOL TO STRESS HEALTH CAREERS,Brooklyn Facility to Open in Fall, Anker Announces
description: A girls vocational high school in Brooklyn will be turned next fall into the city's first coeducational and comprehensive school for students interested in careers in the health professions.

title: Indians Down Yanks, 64, On 3 Homers Off Peterson
Elizabeth's fight for a life of her own
description: I love this novel  first reading, second reading, browsing  but I can't make it sound as good as it is. If all plot summaries distort, and if all happy endings threaten corn, what can one do about a story that begins with Elizabeth, a fat, sloppy, unloving, miserable graduate student who attempts suicide and that then turns her into a good poet, superb teacher, a generous daughter and a happy wife? Well, what one can do with oldfashioned stuff like that is precisely what Susan Fromberg Schaeffer shows us in Falling.

title: Music in Review
description: Burdened with a mild case of bronchitis, Miss Allen still sang with exceptional sensitivity and a lovely tone in Schubert's Standchen and Brahms's Alto Rhapsody. The latter had the advantage of the hall's intimacy, and was given one of the best performances of the work this writer has ever heard. A scene from Verdi's Il Trovatore, with Miss Allen as Azucena and Keith Kibler, a promising bass, as Di Luna, went excellently but was unsatisfactory  as a concert piece.

title: Albany Bill Would Aid Old Housing
description: Several areas in Brooklyn and Queens would receive rehabilitation under a bill that has been introduced in both houses of the Legislature., The measure, developed by Housing and Development Administrator Andrew P. Kerr, would create a local agency, along the lines of the Federal Housing Administration, to insure bank mortgages.

title: Stamps
description: AP. GIANNINI, whose life was a Horatio Al*ger story, started as a peddler of vegetables and later founded the Bank of America, the largest private banking system in the world. His portrait is appearing on a new 21cent United States stamp coming out on June 27 at San Mateo, California. It is intended for a special fourthclass rate for books from one to two pounds, but its use for this purpose may be a matter of days, since on July 6 this rate jumps to 24 cents. However, it can always be used for international airmail, assuming those rates hold

title: Ticket to Happiness
description: This is the time when school days seem to grow longer and the classroom walls thicker. Counting how many days are left until summer vacation becomes more relevant than arithmetic. City children daydream about their anticipated escape from the asphalt canyons to places where the grass is greener than in the local park,,

title: Ohio Publisher Heads Panel
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP)President Nixon has announced the designation of Francis Dale, publisher of The Cincinnati Inquirer, to be chairman of the President's Commission on White House fellowships. Mr. Nixon also announced the appointments of four new members of the commission! Neal B. Freeman of BBronxville, N. Y., Elizabeth A. Kevachevich of St. Peterspurg, Fla., Blair J. Kolesa of Pittsburgh and Patricia R. Hitt of Orange. Calif.

title: F. J. Magovern Weds Susan Helen Kaiser
description: HEWLETT, L.I., May 19Miss Susan Helen Kaiser and Frederick John Magovern were married here today in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church by the pastor, the Rev. Jeremiah McLaughlin.

title: Fascinating Opera. of Fairy Tales Sung
description: MINNEAPOLIS, May 19The operatic fare available to New Yorkers is, generally so traditional that one would think nothing truly original was being created in the opera world. Fortunately this is not true, and this month at the Cedar Village Theater here, the Minnesota Opera (known until recently as the Center Opera) has been demonstrating anew that opera is still a vital and valid medium for contemporary expression.

title: Numismatics
description: BEHIND the cabinetshaking, headline making activities in Washington today, hidden in subcommittees in comparative obscurity among the big issues that are occupying the attention of major committees of the Senate and House, are several numismatic matters that could have a substantial impact on the hobby.

title: GOVERNOR URGES DELAY ON CHARTER
description: ALBANY, May 19Governor Rockefeller asked the Legislature today to defer until 1975 a public vote on the recommendations of the special state commission reviewing New York City's charter, saying more time was needed for adequate study of any revision.

title: Seton Hall Students to Aid Legislature
description: NEWARKIt was a big problem with a surprisingly simple solution.

title: KILLEN TRIUMPHS TWICE IN REGATTA
British Soldier Is Wounded In Belfast Catholic District
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 19 (Reuters)  A British soldier, was shot in the back while on patrol in the Roman Catholic Ballymurphy district of Belfast today.

title: Margaret A. Friederichs Has Nuptials
description: Miss Margaret Adele Friederichs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Friederichs, and William Henry Slattery were married in the chapel of St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church here by the Rev. Terence J. Finlay, the rector. He was assisted by the Rev. William Heffner, who is on the Overseas Mission Staff of the Protestant Episcopal Church of the United States in New York.

title: IN WEST BERLIN A LITTLE ANKARA
description: BERLIN, May 19  At Ernst Reuter School in West Berlin the other day a 12year old Turkish boy was reading a text from his schoolbook in halting German.

title: John McLoughlin Jr. to Marry Miss Anne de Foresta June 30
description: Announcement has been made here by the Marquis and Marquise de Foresta of Paris andChateau du Ramet, Saintes, France, of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne de Foresta, to John T. McLoughlin Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. McLoughlin of Princeton, N. J.

title: One Dies and 4 Are Injured In 5Car Crash in Queens
description: One person was killed and four others were injured in a fivecar collision last night at the intersection of Yellowstone and Woodhaven Boulevards in the Forest Hills section of Queens.

title: AROUND THE
description: Be on the alert for chinch bug invasion of lawns; control with Sevin or Diazinon.... Stems of lilacs, dogwood, rhododendron, mountain laUrel and azalea can be invaded by borer; check bottoms of shrubs; insert wire into borer holes to kill pests; paint lower trunks with lindane to prevent invasions.... Control tent caterpillars by spraying nests at night with Sevin.

title: Goodyear Raises Prices
description: AKRON, Ohio, May 19 (UPI)The Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company announced yesterday price increases of up to 5.5 per cent on tires and tubes for motorcycles, bicycles and farm vehicles and on sizes of truck tires and tubes used primarily on earthmoving vehicles.

title: House Passes Hobby Bill
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP) A hobby protection bill aimed at keeping imitation coins and political buttons from being solid or traded as originals has been approved by the House. The bill, which was sent to the Senate Wednesday, would require any imitative political itemsuch as a button, poster or stickerto be marked with the year it was made. Any imitation numismatic item would have to be marked copy.

title: Equal Rights
description: WASHINGTONThe Supreme Court has set the stage  or at least raised the curtain  for a whole new line of antidiscrimination decisions that could strike down hundreds of Federal and state laws that differentiate between men and women.

title: Best Seller List
Mrs. Heller to Remarry
description: HARTFORD, May 19Mrs. Lucille Codella Heller of Mamaroneck, N. Y., widow of Jack Heller, and John W. Adams Jr. of Larchmont, N. Y., plan to marry in late summer. Their engagement has been announced by Mrs. Anthony Codella, mother of the future bride, who is the daughter also of the late Mr. Codella. The prospective bridegroom, a widower, is the son of Mrs. Adams of Larchmont and the late Mr. Adams. He is vice chairman of the board of the Albert FrankGuenther Law advertising agency in New York.

title: Julie LeBlanc Is Fiancee of James Bleuer
description: DARIEN, Conn., May 19Mr. and Mrs. Moreland Paul LeBlanc Jr. of Darien, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Julie Ann LeBlanc, to James Eugene Bleuer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lorin Thane Bleuer of Vestal, N. Y.

title: Energy
description: RIO BLANCO, Colo.Trapped deep underneath the Rocky Mountains, the experts say, are trillions of cubic feet of natural gasenough to meet America's needs for decades. At a time of national hue and cry over an energy crisis, that gas represents a potentially priceless resource.

title: REVISION URGED. FOR THE Gil. BILL
description: SEATTLE, May 19The G.I. Bill of Rights, which helped educate and house World War II and Korean War veterans, is inadequate to the needs of the six million Vietnam war veterans and must be drastically revised, according to a report, that will be submitted to the White House.

title: T. W. Buek Weds Jeri Whittington
description: CRAWFORDSVILLE, Ind., May 19  Miss Jeri Jo Whittington, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Whittington, was married here this afternoon to Thomas Welles Buek, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles W. Buek of Darien, Conn. The bridegroom's father is president and chief executive officer of the United States Trust Company of New York,

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: T. C. O'Marra Jr. Weds Ann Snyder
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., May 19St. John's Episcopal Church here was the setting for the marriage of Miss. Ann Behning Snyder, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Peckwell Snyder Jr. of Lloyd Neck, Huntington, to Thomas Cowan O'Marra Jr., the son of Mr. and Mrs. O'Marra of Dix Hills. The Rev. Robert H. Platman, vicar of St. Bede's Episcopal Church in Syosett, performed the ceremony.

title: Letters to the Editor: Unhassled in Haiti
description: To the Editor: I returned from a fabulous week in Haiti and read Alfonso X. Donalson's article, The Adventures of a Hassled Soul Brother in Haiti (Travel Section, May 6). It seemed greatly distorted to me. I got the impression that Mr. Donalson was looking for trouble. The Haitian authorities caused no difficulties for me or any other visitors I met (black or white).

title: TV Mailbag.
description: To THE. EDTTOR: IN regard to Tom Burke's article on David Cerradine, King of Kung Fu, what on earth is so Jarring about the fact that Barbara Seagull answers the door while breastfeeding [their son] Free?

title: A Return To Talking
description: PARISAlmost four months after the euphoria of the ceasefire, the war, with certain changes, was still going on, and last week the negotiators were back in Paris.

title: 8 Gain in Field Hockey
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., May 19Aer Lingus of Dublin, North Jersey, Goan of Mont. real, Greenwich, District of Colitmbla, the Montreal Ambassa. ors, Toronto and New York have qualified for tomorrow's quarterfinals in the Field Hockey Association of America spring touament.

title: Woman Rides Herd on Queens Zoo
A Perfect Stranger
description: Lily wanted to be liberated from her perfect life

title: Miss Constance Alison McLean Is Bride of Brian Dale Smith
description: PAWLING, N. Y., May 19 In the garden at Westerly, the home of the bride's parents here, Miss Constance Alison McLean, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William E. McLean of Pawling and New York, was married to Brian Dale Smith, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Smith of Key Biscayne, Fla.

title: A Catalogue Food Service Is Under Investigation
description: In the Canarsie warehouse of recently opened enterprise called Galaxy Foods a minicomputer with 15 terminals is being installed.

title: Cuban Memories You Won't Soon Forget
description: A LITTLE over a year ago, the US. Treasury Department, citing restrictions on trade with Cuba, moved In on what was to be the First New York Festival of Cuban Films and closed it down. Of the halfdozen feature films thus de prived of an American audience,. one has made it back. Memories of Underdevelop ment, made in 1968 by director Tomas Gutierrez Alea from a novel by Edmundo Desnoes (published here as Inconsolable Memories), is in the middle of a oneweek run at the First Avenue Screening Room. Re portedly, reappear soon at a Rugoff theater, and, when it does, I would guess. that it will be around for a time. It is miracle.

title: Rpm Does 4:00.4 in Mile As Keino Fades to Third
description: SAN DIEGO, May 19 (AP)Jim Ryun moved from five yards off the pace, caught Kip Keino and beat him for the first time in the professional indoor track season today be fore 5,164 spectators.

title: Susan Lester Wed To William Hauser
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 19 Miss Susan Baldwin Lester, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James S. Lester, was married here at noon today to William Barry Hauser. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip M. Hauser of Chicago.

title: Salvation, selflove and autosurgery
description: This is a vertebrate book: serial, linear, strung with vigorous scenes. The Upstart is damned engrossing and a pleasure to read. For his fifth novel, Piers Paul Read leases the equipment of suspense fiction: a trial, a poker hand, thefts, a roulette game, several robust seductions and much budgetary datafor some reason money, its dull arithmetic, is as absorbing as murder. Yet even the best of these adroitly made scenes cannot arouse the pain and sympathy Read generates from one social instance: poor young man arriving at upperclass, whitetie dinner in a black tie.

title: Sandy Hamill, Priscilla Heath Plan to Marry
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., May 19Miss Priscilla Langford Heath plans to be married in September to Chalmers Martin Hamill 3d, who will graduate next month from Yale College.

title: the travelers world
description: OUT of the Nassau County District Court, a small claims court wherein plaintiff and defendant may plead their own cases, has come a decision that may establish legal precedent that will compel travel agents to be responsible for the delivery to their customers of all the services and accommodations promised in their brochures. In his ruling on a suit to recover the cost of a threeday weekend in Las Vegas in which the plaintiff and her husband were denied the hotel rooms they had contracted for and were finally installed in a Las Vegas motel, Judge Francis J. Donovan noted that the law presently lacks clarity with respect to the relationship between the travel agency and its client. He then proceeded to make law by awarding damages to the plaintiff and holding that the defendant travel agency is liable in negligence for its failure to exercise reasonable care in making the reservations.

title: HOMETOWN VIEWS OF WEICKER MIXED
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 19 In his own neighborhood, Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr. is a hero to some, but not to others.

title: ACES TOP ITALIANS
description: GUARUJA, Brazil, May 19The two topranked teams in the world team contract bridge championship here clashed this afternoon in the eighth qualifying round, and the defending champion Aces eked out a narrow victory.

title: Movie graders graded
description: To review movies is to leap precariously across the media, but the reader must bear with me: the reviewer of reviews dwells in his own special circle of hell. Andrew Sarris,Vernon Young and Penelope Gilliatt write about movies for The Village Voice, The Hudson Review and The New Yorker. Lightly, one could say that their faults have something to do with their journalistic vehicles: longwindedness (Young), windiness (Sarris), glibness (Gilliatt).

title: Dissidents Vote to Quit Southern Presbyterians
description: ATLANTA, May 19 (AP)Delegates from 260 congregations of the Southernbased Presbyterian Church in the United States voted today, 349 to 16, to break away from the church and form a new evangelical denomination.

title: CAULFIELD IS SAID TO CONNECT DEAN TO CLEMENCY BID
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 John J. Caulfield, a former White House official, has told Senate investigators that when he offered executive clemency to James W. McCord Jr., in return for McCord's silence about the Watergate conspiracy, he was operating on instructions from John W. Dean 3d, investigators say.

title: Lorna Sacks Plans Bridal
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I., May 19The engagement of Miss Lorna Lee Sacks to David Albert Rubin, son of Dr. and Mrs. Samuel H. Rubin of Teaneck, N.J., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Joseph B. Sacks of New Hyde Park. A December wedding is planned.

title: HOFSTRA OUSTED IN LACROSSE, 125
U.S. Quietly Sending Servicemen to Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 17The United States, cultivating strategic ties in Iran, has begun a quiet influx of military personnel in this pivotal nation.

title: DR. IRVING BORNSTEIN
description: PARAMUS, N.J., May 19Dr. Irving Bornstein, an anesthesiologist formerly on the staff of Jewish Memorial Hospital in New York, died today at the age of 52. He lived at 92 Iona Place here.

title: Overheated Economy
description: Worldwide inflation, and how to bring it under control, were at center stage last week.

title: Seoul Arrests for Long Hair
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 19 (AP)Policemen have rounded up more then 1,000 youths with long hair in the first days after the Government enacted a law prohibiting men from letting hair grow over their ears and collars, officials said.

title: Cyrano Out of Breath
description: IF you stop to think about it, it's odd that anyone should have wished to make a musical of Cyrano because Cyrano de Bergerac is virtually a musical to begin with. The original Rostand melodies are, of course, all verbal melodies, rococo cadenzas that ripple from tongues that still seem to be tasting bonbons. But even if they are words, they are words orchestrated for voices: arias without end, mocking duets, passages of whispered counterpoint, the long lingering coda beneath fluttering fall leaves in a convent garden.

title: Brezhnev and Brandt Sign 10Year Pact
description: BONN, May 19 I. Brezhtlev, the Soviet Commulist party leader, and Will; Brandt of Wept Germany signed and toasted a 10year agreement here today on development of economic, industrial and technical cooperation.

title: Susan L. Hanna, C. C. Spalding Jr. To Wed Aug. 25

title: A Tapping Is Heard On High
