title: Suffolk Police Give Party for Science
description: WEST HAMPTON, L. I.To help keep drunken drivers off the road, the Suffolk Police Department gave a party the other day.

title: Dance: Eugene Onegin as Spectacle
description: John Crankoi, Eugene Onegin is quite simply a superb spectacle. Although it, has been at the Metropolitan Opera House before, its: return with the Stuttgart Bellet on Friday night was splendidly welcome. Although it uses Tchaikovsky music (arranged by KurtHeinz Stolze) and, of course, the original Pushkin story, it has nothing to do with the Tchaikovsky opera, and stands, as a ballet in its own right.

title: The Greeks Have a Word for It: Catastrophe
description: HEN a Greek exclaims Catastrophe! (pronounced in Greek KahtahstrawPHEE! with the accent falling explosively on the final syllable), he may be lamenting his favorite soccer team's loss Of an important match or the incursion Of his goat into a neighbor's grapevines not tragic matters in the classical sense. But there are undertones of irony and resignation in his grief, there is reproach in the open palm he flings toward the heavens, and these are reminders of the ancient association between KahtahstrawPHEE! and ineluctable fate.

title: Economy
description: When the Watergate broke open, crisis of confidence flooded the canyons of Wall Street and spread out to money and gold bullion markets around the world.

title: Claudia Skylar Planning Nuptials
description: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio; May 19Miss Claudia Miller Skylar and David Aaron Gressel will be married here on June 12.

title: Judge Upholds Reporter On Protection of Sources

title: Hammer's Kremlin Conoection
description: LOS ANGELESFor Armand Hammer, 74yearold head of the Occidental Petroleum Corporation, the Soviet Union has been a capitalist's paradise for a half century, rich in profits for a shrewd trader with the right connections in the Kremlin.

title: Hijacked Venezuelan Plane Leaves Mexico for Havana
description: MEXICO CITY, May 19A hijacked Venezuelan airliner with 42 people aboard, four of them leftist guerrillas who had taken command of the craft, left here for Cuba today.

description: Miss Nancy L. Doerr and Robert J. Carney were married here yesterday afternoon by the Rev. John Sheridan, a Roman Catholic priest, at the home of the bridegroom, who is executive vice president of Texas International Airlines in Houston.

title: Let's Get Adel le Davis Right
description: LOS ANGELES. You can't eat well and keep fit if you don't shop well. Adelle Davis, therefore, is very serious shopper; and shopping with her is an excellent way to find out what she thinks of what we eat. At this particular moment, however, in tiny grocery store south of Los Angeles, holding against the morning sun a thin, tubular instrument used to measure sugar levels, she looked more like a navigator than a nutritionist. See this! she exclaimed, as though she had ust sighted a new world. The organic orange is 15 per cent sugar, while those"pointing to a pile of nonorganic oranges"are a vile 8 per cent. The greater the natural sugar, the more the Vitamin C. She insisted I take a slice of organic orange, and then eyed me intently, although she assuredly knew would like. it. If it tastes a million times better than other oranges, you don't need an instrument it's real!

title: Where you stand depends on where you sit
ACES TOP ITALIANS IN BRIDGE CONTEST
description: GUARUJA, Brazil, May 19The two topranked teams in the world team contract bridge championship here clashed this afternoon in the eighth qualifying round, and the defending champion Aces eked out a narrow victory.

title: WaterColors on View in Montclair
description: MONTCLAIRTo an amateur artist, watercoloring seems easy and casual, an inexpensive way to amuse oneself on an afternoon in the countryside. However, to the professional, watercoloring is an exacting and demanding medium; it requires as much forethought and coherence of design as working in oils does.

title: Bench Bats In 5
The joyof life to be found in a wilderness
description: In 1954 two urbanites, Helen and Adrian Hoover, she a metallurgist and a hopeful writer, he an artist, opted for the North Woods over life in Chicago. Helen Hoover was, it turned out, a compassionate observer of the fauna that surrounded her and a sensitive and poetic chronicler of what she saw and felt. The result has been a steady stream of magazine pieces and nature books, the latter often illustrated by Ade's drawings, all preserving in print what the Hoovers experienceda time of wonder and purity, as near the Garden lost to man as is possible in these later days. Now, in a retrospective volume, Helen Hoover sums up the memories and the values of almost two decades of wilderness living on the shore of an unnamed lake which lies between Minnesota and Canada. It was a remote setting and the wolf was often at the

title: State G.O.P. Chairmen Pledge Support to Nixon and Say He Will Find Truth
description: CHICAGO, May 19  The nation's Republican state chairmen took the unusual step today of adopting a resolution pledging support to President Nixon and proclaiming their belief that he would arrive at the truth in the Watergate scandal.

description: Gold, the oldest known cure for poverty and insecurity, once again demonstrated its magical powers last week as bullion prices moved.to a temporary high of $128.50 in European markets.

Once, even though he had decided to talk, he refused to go before the televison cameras simply to read the letter he had written about pressure to keep silent,

title: Lawrenceville Church Is 275

The celebrations include two Services of Recommitment this morning and a concert of 17thcentury music at 4 o'clock this afternoon.

title: Vietnam Bombing Dispute Snags Talks on U.S. Dead
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 19 (AP)The start of an investigation into alleged United States air attacks in South Vietnam was called off today, And the Communists boycotted la meeting of the fourparty Joint Military Team called to make arrangements to return the remains of American dead.

title: Bluechip investments
description: Just show me the Jerry Silvermans, please! It's a bit of verite in advertising. Fourteen years ago, the designermanufacturer team of Shannon Rodgers and Jerry Silverman showed an initial collection of 26 pieces. Now,they make seven collections a year with a grand total of 350 to 400 pieces. There's a reason. Wearability! That's what Silverman clothes are all about. He calls them investments. They're not cheap (prices range from $80 to $250) but they have staying power. And they have auniversal appeal. A Jerry SilvermanBoutique just opened at H. M. Rayne on London's Bond Street. One of the first customers who wanted to see the Jerry Silvermans, please was Princess Margaret.

Nixon Demands Hanoi Tell Fate of Missing Americans
description: NORFOLK, Va., May 19President Nixon said today that Hanoi had persisted in violations of the Vietnam ceasefire agreement and had failed to provide adequate information about the fate of missing American servicemen.

title: On the campaign trail
description: This latest contribution to the library of personal political journalism is modest in its aims. Bob Greene, a young Chicago reportercolumnist, is no pundit, and his account of last year's Presidential campaign is simply a firstperson report of what it was like to follow the candidates through the exhausting, irrational, quadrennial ritual. He started in July, at the convention of the liberated Democrats, and for four months followed McGovern, Agnew and, on the rare occasions he deigned to appear, Nixon. If you want to get a balanced and comprehensive story of the substance of a political campaign in this country, read somebody like Jules Witcover; if you have a taste for politics as romantic drama, try Theodore White. But if you're interested in what it's like to chase along, day after day, unremittingly ,fatigued, behind a candidate and his entourage in their mad gyrations as they play out a reallife game of Geography, you'll get it from

title: Mrs. Johnson to Pursue A Selective Public Life
description: JOHNSON CITY, Tex.A pillow on a big leather chair near the fireplace is inscribed with a small foolishness that he enjoyed. It says, This is my ranch and I do as I damn please,

title: DialaRide Is Set Up To Assist Children
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Parents In this village foresee an easing of the car pool syndrome. When a child needs a ride they can simply telephone DialARide, a newly introduced transportation service rot students at 25 cents a ride.

title: Music For Fun, Then For Audiences
description: WHERE two or three musicians are gathered in New England, there springs up a summer music festival. Or so it seems. Like all sensible people, they retreat to the country come June if they can, and surprisingly many can. They may start just playing for themselves for fun, but in short order they seek an audience. It Is not hard to find one in thee New England towns, not just among city folk on vacation, but among the local inhabitants. Many of the old wooden churches, town halls and meeting houses are discovered to have excellent acoustics. Chambermusic series proliferateone has only to check the above listings in Massachusetts, New York, Connecticut, Rhode Island, Vermont, New Hampshire and Maine. So far the saturation point does not seem to have been reachedhealthy sign of the summer times.

Eagles in 1972, was orrested on a possession of Marijuana charge last night. He was freed under $500 bond after being booked at city jail on the misdemeanor charge, the police said.

title: Morley Collection presented to Roslyn
description: ROSLYN, L. I. A step toward the revitalization of the work, life and times, of the late Christopher Morley took place recently when the Nassau County Museum presents its Morley collection to this community's Bryant Library on Paper Mill Road. I am especially proud of the Bryant Library's local history collection, said Daniel Newton, director of the unit. It is unique among libraries in Nassau County and its special collections are outstanding for a library of this size.

title: HANOI CRITICIZES ITS OWN REPORTS
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, May 19 (Agence FrancePresse)A widespread campaign of selfcriticism has been going on in the production sector for several weeks and it was taken up this week by the party newspaper Nhan Dan, which severely criticized the value of official North Vietnamese statistics.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Lighter and brighter
description: It's the kitchen, more than any other room that homeowners zero in on when they have money to renovate. In fact, more than three million American families will remodel their kitchens this yearand spend an average of $4,100. Many, of course, will spend a great deal more. People are opting for greater sense of openness, air and light in the cooking area. Skylights (top left) and even whole sides of a greenhouse (see above) or walls of glass are not uncommon in remodeling kitchens in older homes. An eatin area for the convenience of the immediate family is popular again and is even being squeezed into the tiny cubbyholes of city kitchens, wherever space permits. Older buildings and especially cooperative apartments often present nasty surprises in the form of unexpected costs.

description: Percy C. Ifill, a founder of Ifill Johnson Hanchard, a leading black architectural organization, died Friday of cancer in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived here.

title: RAIN PUTS SKIDS TO INDY 600 TESTS

Hungary Expects More Improvement in Ties With a
description: BUDAPEST, Hungary, May 18Deputy Foreign Minister Janos Nagy has declared that relations between the United States and Hungary are becoming normal and Budapest is optimistic about the durability of the marked improvement.

title: MITCHELL REJECTS ROLE OF FALL GUY
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Former Attorney General John N. Mitchell says that someone is trying to make him the fall guy in the Watergate scandal but that the effort will fail because I never did anything mentally or morally wrong.

title: MARYLAND DEFEATS BROWN IN LACROSSE
LOS ANGELES RACE TURNS VITRIOLIC
description: LOS ANGELES, May 19With 10 days to go, the Los Angeles mayoral election has turned into a slashing verbal battle. The local courts had to step in this week and order Mayor Sam Yorty to tone down some of his more vitriolic campaign literature.

title: U.S. STANDS FIN ON OIL, EBAN SAYS

title: 8,000 in Armed Forces March, On SunDrenched Fifth Avenue
description: With banners flapping and brass buttons glistening, more than 8,000 miltary men, reservists and veterans marched on sunny Fifth Avenue yesterday in the 24th observance of Armed Forces Day. Medals and service ribbons were plentiful:

title: Was the Cheering Premature?
description: ON May 2, the Senate voted to authorize $840million in Federal aid to the arts and humanities during the next three years. There were some ominous notes during the passage of the bill, even though the final vote, was 7614. And the Proxmire amendment, which would have cut the authorization by about half, was defeated by a vote of 6130. But Proxmire will be'heard from again, and in the course of his argument against the appropriations, he came up with a curious line of reasoning. He Suggested that primarily the enjoyment of concerts, art, museums and opera is by the upper and upper middle classes. (That's bad?) The powerful Sen. John L. McClellan, chairman of the Senate Appropriations Committee, also had his reservations'An increase in funds of the magnitude contemplated is clearly out of line, he argued. Certainly, it is out of line if. we intend to make a good effort to hold the line on spending

title: Hardly a Paper Tiger
description: At a time of zero population growth in the United States, the KimberlyClark Corporation is spending roughly $100million to achieve national distribution next year of a major new consumer product: a shaped, pinless and disposable diaper that it calls Kimbies.

title: Kamel Youssef Weds Frances M. Gardner
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N. Y., May 19Miss Frances Marion Gardner, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David J. Gardner of Briarcliff Manor, was married here at noon today to Kamel S. Youssef, son of Mrs. Sobhy Youssef of Alexandria, Egypt, and the late Mr. Youssef, who was a director of the port of Alexandria. The Rev. Gabriel Amin AbdelElSayed, a Coptic priest, performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Bernard J. O'Connor, at St. Theresa's Raman Catholic Church.

title: Tables Laden in Tenafly For 4th Hellenic Festival
description: TENAFLY  The Greek Orthodox community of Tenafly is holding its fourth annual Hellenic Festival this weekend.

title: U.C.L.A. CAPTURES PAC8 TRACK TITLE
An introduction to ItalianAmerican history
description: Until recently the quality of the literature on ethnic America, except for JewishAmerican history, has been poor. This poverty seems to have been especially evident in the case of ItalianAmericans. While they have been the sub ject of a few firstrate sociological and psychological studies their history has suffered from amateurism, filiopietism and defensiveness. The fact is, as Erik Amfitheatrof writes, that ItalianAmericans have always been notoriously defensive about their ethnic heritage. A proud people, they have had to strugglelike other minoritiesagainst a debilitating sense of always have to measure themselves by AngloSaxon

title: Myths and truths about a favorite American pastime
description: Chauvinist pig had not crept into the language 69 years ago when Albert Goodwill Spalding, a chauvinist from Ogle County, 111., undertook to prove that baseball was native American game untainted by British origins. A pioneer player and manager who had become head of a sporting goods house, Spalding was

title: Mother was only respected An Untold Story
description: As everyone knows who follows the news, a significant portion of An. Untold Story (the only truly significant portion, in fact) appeared in two issues of Ladies Home Journal prior to book publication, arousing with its sensational disclosures of the private lives of the Roosevelts a storm of controversy that no doubt warms the hearts of Putnam's sales staff.

title: More Hypnotists Organize
description: Howard Coughlin, president of the Office. and Professional Employes International Union, has announced the granting of a charter to a West Coast hypnotists local. Last month, similar charter was issued to Local 469 in Pittsburgh.

title: A Crackdown on Horn Honkers Jangles Nerves of Miscreants
description: A lot of car, truck and taxicab hornblowers in are blow ing their tops as well as result of the city's new antinoise campaign.

title: Despite Couit Ruling, Problems Persist in Gaining Abortions
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 19Nearly four months after the Supreme Court struck down restrictive abortion laws, women In many areas of the country still find that terminating a pregnancy means leaving their home state, paying high prices or running the risk of exploitation by commercial referral services.

title: Marching Out of the Past
description: EAST MEADOW, L. With a blaze of muskets and a flourish of bagpipes, the Redcoats surprised the Colonial regiments; scoring decisive victory in the Battle of Eisenhower Park. Hessian mercenaries, their grenadier helmets gleaming, and kilted Black Watch Highlanders, the famous Fighting 42d, fought alongside the British. Colonial forces included Lafayette's elite Corps of Light Infantry and Knowlton's Connecticut Rangers, roughhewn men known for their sharp shooting and espionage techniques.

title: News of the Rialto
description: THERE are those who are dedicated to the preservation of Alaskan seals, others to the propagation of dahlias and a few who still nourish the notion that repertory is the theater's true Nirvana. Two of the latter are T. Edward Hambleton, who for more than a generation has nursed the Phoenix through its rise and fall and rise, and John Houseman, head Of the City Center,, Acting Company, who goes back even further, to the halcyon days, of the Mercury Theater. Both men are currently plotting' their course for the coming campaign and both are in the usual state of spring euphoria.

title: Credit Rate Of Nassau Is Raised
description: Moody's Investors Service, one of two nationally recognized bond rating agencies, has upgraded the credit standing of Nassau County  a move that should save county taxpayers en estimated $100,000 a year.

title: Conservatives Expecting Sandman to Win in Jersey
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 19The campaign of Representative Charles William Sandman Jr. to defeat Governor Cahill's bid for renomination is attracting the support of conservative leaders from around the country who anticipate a major upset in the June 5 Republican primary.

title: New Beach Facilities at Spruce Run
description: CLINTON  A beach designed to handle up to 3,000 bathers of all ages, a wading pool for toddlers and special facilities for the elderly and handicapped are among the new accommodations that will be available, starting next Saturday, at the $4million Spruce Run Recreation Area.

title: Brooklyn Pickpockets Foes
description: The short, somewhat ample woman with the vacant look on her face stepped up to the window of a shoe store on Brooklyn's busy Fulton Street and seemed to stare absentmindedly at the colorful display. Nearby, jostled and harried, another woman clung tightly to a shopping bag and waited for the next bus to arrive.

title: Amateur Sports Inquiry Slated by Senate Group
Shorter Reviews
description: The former Washington columnist for The Times recalls in an, elegiac mood his youth in Kentuckycountry living in a bygone era, the big brick house inhabited by a large family and headed by Grandfather, foxhunting, lots of bourbon, camp meetings, Negro preachers full of the Lord, rowdy Saturday nights. The young Krock decides to become a newspaperman and heads for Louisville and the rough and tumble world of oldtime journalism; he writes evocatively of a cub's life and Louisville society in the early 1900's. As the book ends, he arrives in Washington and the wider world he described so well in his bestselling Memoirs.

title: Minnesota Nine Wins Title
description: MINNEAPOLIS, May 19 (UPI) The Minnesota Gophers won the Big Ten baseball title today by defeating Illinois, 76, at Bierman Field.

title: Suffolk Artists Opening Studios for Tour
description: Each time Stan Brodsky takes his sketch pad and pastels to a favorite spot near the Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, he finds new inspiration. The water, the beach, the foliage along the shoreall eventually turn up as Prussian blues, wheat golds, or Kelly greens on the artist's canvases.

title: England Triumphs Over Scotland, 10, In Soccer Final
description: WEMBLEY, England, May 19 (UPI)A 54th minute goal by Martin Peters gave England a 10 victory over Scotland today and the British international soccer championship.

title: Lise Holt Is Bride Of Duane Bradley
description: BLUE HILL, Me., May 19 Miss Lise Holt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. William Holt of Plainfield, N.J., was married here this afternoon to Duane Bradley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas R. Bradley Jr. of Chula Vista, Calif. The Rev. John Herrick, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony in the Beth Eden Chapel.

title: Brown Reaches Semifinal Of Westchester Tennis
description: ARMONK, N. Y., Mav 19Bailey Brown led the way into the semifinals of the Westchester tennis championships today with a 6.3, 6.2 victory over Larry Davidson.

title: Mrs. Gurfein Has Son
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., May 19A son was born April 20 to Mr. and Mrs. James Gurfein in the White Plains Hospital. The child has been named Scott Eric.

title: Growing Up fast in Kenya When American
description: Katharine B. Sacks spent three months in Kenya last summer as a I6yearold volunteer for Catholic Relief Services. Much of her work was in a clinic near Nairobi. The following article was originally written for her senior English class in the Hopkins Day Prospect Hill School in New Haven, Conn. Next fall she will be a freshman at Yale University.

title: I.B.M. Is Proving a Good Neighbor in Affluent Bergen Town
description: FRANKLIN LAKES  As more and more industrial giants desert the cities, especially New York, for pleasanter working and living conditions in suburbia, so do prohlems grow both for the chosen community and the relopited workers.charitable causes.

title: U.M.W. Credit Union
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP) Fulfilling a campaign promise, the new leadership of the United Mine Workers has moved to establish a Federal credit union to make coal miners money work for coal miners. The union president, Arnold R. Miller, and seven officers formed an interim board Wednesday to guide development of the credit union, which is expected to begin service Aug. 1.

title: Secretariat Told Jockey How He Wanted to Win It
description: BALTIMOREm May 19 Mrs. Penny TWeedy said it all in a few jubilant words at the champagne party in the pressbox after Secretariat's smashing success in today's 98th Preakness: We got two down, and one to go.

title: Soviet Visitors Praise U.S. Cleanup
description: Soviet environmental experts said here last week that they were so impressed with some of the recent environmental controls put into effect in the United States that they would rec. onunend their adoption in the Soviet Union.

title: Preacher Adds Speaking Tour To RadioTV Series on Coast
description: PASADENA, Calif., May 19Garner Ted Annstrong, a nationally known preacher and commentator, has added a speaking campaign, in various cities in the United States and Canada to his radio and television series produced here by his father's worldwide. Church of God and Ambassador College.

title: Rare Mute Swans Threatened
description: ROCKAWAY TOWNSHIP  The proposed construction of an electricpower station at Mount Hope Lake has stirred opposition from naturalists concerned about the survival of a rare colony of mute swans.

title: Revolutionary Suicide
description: All through his adolescence, the author of this memoir took it for granted that he would know how to read when he came of age because knowing how to read was a gift conferred with manhood. He was a senior in high ,school before he recognized that he was a functional illiterate.

title: Study Finds Addiction Severe In Infants of Methadone Users
description: Infants born to mothers who are taking methadone have more severe reactions to the drug than heroinaddicted babies have to heroin, according, to a study by a Metropolitan Hospital pediatrician.

title: FREE HAND URGED FOR PROSECUTOR
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 Despite their pleasure over the naming of Archibald Cox as the special prosecutor in the Watergate case, members of the Senate are exisected to press hard the issue of this independence of action.

title: The Mad Russian Collector of 50 Picassos, 38 Matisses
description: FEODOR CHALIAPIN, in in, his chronicle of his life and time, Man and Mask, identifies a series, of steps in the advancement of a Moscow merchant. Of peasant stock, after years of privations, he gradually accumulates a few rubles, and becomes a capitalist. Next, he installs himself as a proprietor of a small shop or store. Then he establishes himself as a merchant of the first Guild. Wait a little... Behold, his eldest son purchases the first Picasso and the first Gauguin, and brings the first Matisse to Moscow.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Persistent selling in the stock market sent the DowJones industrial average below the 900 mark last week for the first time since late January, 1972.

title: Priscilla Sawtelle Wed To Richard Prigmore Jr.
description: HOUSTON, May 19Miss Priscilla Camille Sawtelle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. G. McAdow of the Bethany Christian Church performed the ceremony at the Sawtelle home.

title: Real Estate Man Fined.
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 19 (AP) May 19Terry McGinnity, 34 years old, a real estate man who drew White House praise for a 1971 essay about America's Fundamental Values, has been fined $800 for refusing to show a black woman a house in an allwhite neighborhood.

title: MEANT URGES TRUTH ON WATERGATE CASE
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (UPI)  George Meany, breaking his silence on the Watergate scandal, says the United States will be practicallyy, without an executive branch of government until the White House discloses everything about the scandal.

description: STOCKHOLM, May. 19 (AP) The militarization of the world continues unabated, the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute has reported in its fourth yearbook.

description: HUNTINGTON, N. Y.  While large cities such as Richmond, Detroit and Denver have been unable to achieve school integration without community conflict and resort to court action, this small, generally affluent community on Long Island has found the going much easier.

title: The Greening of Show Biz
description: IT will be interesting to see how long that manner, more hearty and insatiable than innocent, survives the death last week of Abel Green, 72, the editor of Variety since 1933, the man whose style was his total content, the ordrperson who, in 1973, might say when he was going out to lunch at 21 that he was grabbing some groceries. A.G., as he signed his cryptic, often illegible staff memos jotted on small sheets of green note paper, was responsible more than anyone else for the marvelously mixedup, manic tone of what Bill Greeley, a Variety television reporter, once called the last of the home town weeklies, the home town being as easily Jean Seberg's Marshalltown, Iowa, as Hollywood, New York, Paris, Rome, London, Las Vegas, Miami, Hong Kong, or wherever else some film was being shot, some hoofer was hoofing, or some friend of Abel's had found time to write a postcard. It was largely because of Abel that Variety became the panoramic, gossipy, often scoopfilled (and, sometimes deadwrong) show biz ,thronicle that might run, a carefully prepared, highly technical breakdown on a fihn company's financial affairs, cheekbyjowl with an A.G. story be

Bailey Calls Indictment Retaliation for His Book
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 19 (UPI)  F. Lee Bailey, the criminal lawyer, said today that he was indicted by a Federal grand jury in Orlando, Fla., yesterday because the Postal Service wanted to get back t hirB.

description: In the springtime, with trash young greens heaped in produce bins, easy and delicious soups can be simmered in minutes. instead of hours.

The union president, Arnold R. Miller, and seven officers formed an interim board Wednesday to guide development of the credit union, which is expected to begin service Aug. 1.

description: WASHINGTON, May 19 The General Accounting Office today accused Maurice H. Stans, President Nixon's campaign finance chief, of an obvious attempt to evade the disclosure requirements of the new Federal campaign spending law.

title: Bridge

In a match in the Von Zedtwitz Knockout Team Championship Peter Weichsel,. as South, contrived to make his contract a certainty by generously presenting the defense with an overruff.

description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., May 19 Miss Linda Livingston Wall, daughter of Mr. and a Mrs. Frank William Wall of Oyster Bay, was married here today to John Schuyler Schieffelin, son of COoper Schieffelin of New York. and Bridgehampton and the late Mrs. Eleanor Lindsay Schief felin.

title: Mrs. Helen Swenson Wed to Francis Parkman Jr. of Education Agency
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 19  Mrs. Helen Swenson of Riverdale, the Bronx, New York, was married here at noon today to Francis Parkman Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Parkman of Brookline. The bride, is the daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Winthrop Williams of NeW York and Warren, Pa.

title: Murphy's Law Trips Skylab
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla.There is saying among space engineers that whatever can go wrong will go wrong. They call it. Murphy's Law, and every time they design and build a spaceship they go to great and costly extremes to defy the law.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: I'm not in the television business. I don't write, produce, comment, act, regulate, manage or even criticizeat least in public. But my job is dependent upon television, and I am one who feels people like me owe more to this medium than just financial support. The days when the sponsor's responsibilities consisted of avoiding controversial programs and paying the bills are, I believe, overif they ever existed.

title: College Point Site Draws 2 Companies
description: The sprawling, 550acre industrial park planned for College Point in Queens received a big boost last week with the announcement that two companies had contracted to purchase land for new facilities there.

title: Drive, Liz Said

But so would you be if you had measles. So; while Missiaylor worries and watches her blotches, director Larry Peerce and the other stars. of Ash Wednesday.Henry Fonda and Helmut Bergerare.. doing:their ummeasly best to shoot around her.

title: Joan Miro
description: OF the artists liberated by the Surrealist revolution, the Catalonian painter, Joan M:r6, may well have been the most durably emancipated. Andre Breton, who assumed powers akin to papal infallibility when it came to matters of Surrealist doctrine, once remarked that Mire might pass for the most surrealist of us all.

title: Extensive Fraud Charged In Europe Farm Subsidies
description: PARIS, May 19Shady entrepreneurs are bilking the Common Market of millions of dollars a year in a growing scandal, European officials believe.

title: Thinking About the Unthinkable
description: In August, 1970, Life magazine published an article that accused Democratic Senator Joseph D. Tydings of Maryland of misusing his position to promote the interests of a company in which he later held stock. Mr. Tydings repeatedly denied the charge, but the article almost certainly contributed to his defeat later that year by J. Glenn Beall Jr., a Republican.

title: Home improvement
description: WHEN an electric appliance or cither motordriven piece of equipment in the home breaks down before it should most people tend to blame the manufacturer of that particular item  the appliance is of poor quality, the manufacturer is deliberately building in early obsolescence, or the item was improperly designed in the first place.

title: Huntington School Plan Approved By State
description: HUNTINGTON VILLAGE L. L, After four month of protest by various groups to the Board of Education'. plan for integration of the public schools of Huntington's District 3, State Education Commissioner Ewald B. Nyquist has approved the plan and ordered that it be implemented in September.

title: In Cold Print: Selling Out and Buying In
description: If Norton Simon had actually bought W. W. Norton and Simon & Schusterboth deals were discussed, neither consummatedwe could have had a publishing goliath called Norton, Norton Simon, Simon (& Schuster). That one didn't work out and apparently ITT's adventures in Chile have driven its stock so low that its takeover of Putnam's is off, but conglomerates seem to be in publishing to stay. Doubters need only look at the ownership of Holt, Rinehart & Winston (C.B.S.); Random House, Knopf, Pantheon and now Ballantine (R.C.A.); Warner Paperback Library (Warner Communications); Little, Brown (Time Inc.), to name only the most visible. And it is probably poetic justice that the first conglomerate to kill a trade publisher was a print conglomerate, the Los Angeles Times Mirror, which recently did in World Publishing's trade division.

title: Ann Shifman Is Bride
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., May 19Miss Ann Lesley Shifman of Larchmont, daughter of Harry Shifman, general manager of the Royal Caribbean Hotel in Montego Bay, Jamaica, and Mrs. Shifman, was married here this morning to E. Don Smith of Stamford, Conn. son of William E. Smith of Fort Worth, Tex., and the late Mrs. Roxanne Smith. The Rev. Arthur G. Barton performed the ceremony in Christ United Methodist Church. The bridegroom's former marriage ended in divorce.

title: Mary McBride Is Wed
description: DARIEN, Conn., May 19St. John's Roman Catholic Church was the setting here this morning for the marriage of Miss Mary Frances McBride, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Xavier McBride of South Norwalk, to Bruce Edward Konrad, also of South Norwalk, son of Mr. and Mrs. Spart Konrad of Chappaqua, N. Y. The Rev. Pierre A. Botton performed the ceremony.

title: NORTHEASTERN CREW CAPTURES BURK CUP
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 19 The Northeastern University crew, the Eastern sprint champions, remained undefeated tonight, defeating Pennsylvania by one and a half lengths to win the Joe Burk Cup over the 2,000meter course on the Charles Rivdr.

title: Mayoral Candidates Give Views on Fiscal Matters
description: The four Democratic candidates for Mayor, present a composite picture of fiscal conservatism, a predilection for broadbased taxes rather than increased real estate taxes, a determination to take an activist role in labor negotiations, and a variety of schemes to streamline the budget process and attract and hold business.

title: Rhodesia Says More Shots Are Fired from Zambia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 19 (UPI)Three shots were fired today from the Zambian side of the Victoria Falls, where two young Canadian women were killed and an American man was wounded by gunfire Tuesday, the Rhodesian police said.

title: C.C.N.Y. Coach Joins Olympic Fencing Body
description: Edward Lucia, City College fencing coach, has been appointed to the Unfted States Olympic Fencing ,Committee.

title: Alice Shanahan, Teacher, Is Bride
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., May 19In the Immaculate Heart of Mary Roman Catholic Church here this morning, Miss Alice Mary Shanahan and Robert Alan Cross, 1970 graduates of Niagara University, were married by the Rev. James Shevlin.

title: Adirondack Park
description: ALBANYThe sixmillionacre Adirondack Park in upstate New York is the biggest wilderness tract east of the Mississippi Riverlarger than Yellowstone, Yosemite, Grand Canyon, Glacier and Olympic National Parks combined and equal in size to Vermont.

title: Coney Is. Beach Opens; Polar Bears Enjoy It
description: Seagulls and pigeons heavily outnumbered the sunbathers and very few swimmers yesterday as Coney Island opened its 144th season. The day also marked the opening of other city beaches.

title: Five Businesmen in Seoul Are Seized in Crackdown
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 19 The Seoul district prosecutor's office arrested five South Korean businessmen today and was searching for seven others under a Government program to crack down on antisocial business practices.

title: To finish a picture implies killing something off
description: This Wednesday, an exhibition of paintings from Pablo Picasso's last years will open in the great hall of the Palace of Popes in Avignon, in southern France. Planned before the artist's deathhe was at work on new pictures for the show when he fell illit is the first of many memorial exhibitions that doubtless will be held. Last June, my wife and I had the good fortune to have Picasso show us about 60 paintings, most of which he had executed earlier in the year. A large number of these should be among the 201 paintings he had helped to assemble for the Avignon exhibition (a sampling of which is shown on these pages and on the cover of this Magazine). The work I saw suggests that the surprise of the exhibition will not be in the idioms or the subjects of the pictures, for these resume Picasso's work of recent decades, but in the sheer mass of vigorously executed paintings it was possible for this artist to produce during and after his 90th year. Whatever one's reactions to individual paintingsand the best of them have a mordancy in the drawing and compactness of design finer than anything Picasso had shown in recent yearsthe enterprise as a whole is astonishing, and is informed with an urgency reflecting Picasso's conviction that him alive.

title: Authority Over Land Use is Termed a Public fight
description: WASHINGTON, May 19A Federal task force on land use said today that henceforth development rights on private property must be regarded as resting with the community rather than with property owners.

title: Chess: Rote Route Not Right Route To Skill With Combinations

description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y., May 19A, shootout by a parking lot here this afternoon left two town policemen wounder and set off a carandfoot chase through quit residential streets in neighboring Bronxville and Tuckahoe.

title: Televition
description: Aspopular culture, television is better than movis. On almost anr given evening, youcyan watch a good program ,Or two on TV; you would be fairly hardpressed, on the other hand, to find even two enjoyable movies a week, and if you did find them, you would still have to get to them and, worst of all, pay a lot to see them. And when you pay for a movie that you end up disliking, you often feel that whoever persuaded you to see the filmyour friends or the criticshas betrayed you.

description: ALTAVISTA, Va., May 20 (AP)  Edward Hudson Lane, founder and board chairman of the furniture company, died in his home last night. He was 81 years old.

title: F.B.I. Taps Called Plan to Discredit Dr. King

description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 20 (UPI)  The California Angels obtained Mike Epstein, a 30yearold first baseman who hit 26 home runs and drove in 70 runs for the world champion Oakland A's last season, in a fiveplayer trade with the Texas Rangers today.

title: Justice Officictis Find Corruption Rife Among Immigration Aides lin Southwest
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The Department of Justice has amassed evidence of widespread corruption in one of its own branches, the Southwest Region of the Immigration and Naturalization Service, Government sources have told The New York Times.

title: People's Bench Qffers A Form to Aggrieved
description: In the corridor east of the City Hall Rotunda, just past a waisthigh metal gate that is almost always open, are two long wooden benches. They look like church pewswhite straightbacked, with tall sloping sides,

title: Ervin Crititizes Delaying Trial Until '73
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., chairman of the select Senate committe investigating the Watergate affair, criticized today the Justice Department's handling of the case, saying he believed that five men caught redhanded in actual burglary should have been tried before the 1972 election. The trial was held this year.

title: Reid's Tour Called Opening of Gubernatorial Bid
description: ELMIRA, N.Y., May 20Representative Ogden R. Reid of Westchester County, who switched from the Republican to the Democratic party last year, barnstormed Democratic functions in five upstate counties over the weekend in a tour that focused the attention of party leaders on one of the newer potential candidates for Governor next year.

title: Podgorny Begins Trip
description: MOSCOW, May 20 (UPI)President Nikolai V. Podgorny left today for a visit to Afghanistan, Tass, the official Soviet press agency, said.

title: Brezhnev Affirms His Washington Date
description: BONN, May 20Leonid I. Brezhnev, continuing his discussions with Chancellor Willy Brandt today, reassured inquiring newsmen that he would quite certainly visit Washington as scheduled on June 18, despite the burgeoning Watergate scandal.

title: Bridge: Aces Lose Points in Match With Italy by Playing Safe
description: GUARUJA, Brazil, May 20 With six qualifying rounds remaining to be played in the world team bridge championship here, it has become a case of Italy first, the Aces second and the rest nowhere. The two favored teams moved further ahead of their rivals in ninthround play last night, when Italy slaughtered the United States, 191, and the Aces did almost as well by beating Indonesia, 182.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MONZA, Italy, May 20 (AP)Two motorcyclists were killed and seven injured today in a spill at the Monza Autodrome during the 250 cubic centimeter class race of the Grand Prix of Nations. Renzo Pasolini of Italy and Jarno Saarinen of Finland died of injuries suffered in the fiery. crash. Organizers canceled the races scheduled later in the day.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ORANGE, May 20When Andy Stanfield was running for Seton Hall University 21 years ago, he was known the fastest human of his time. After a brilliant collegiate career he won the gold medal at 200 meters in the 1952 Olympic Games at Helsinki, Finland.

title: Stage: Smith, a Pleasant Little Musical at the Eden
description: Anyone wanting a pleasant little musical to take Aunt Jane from Nebraska to might just possibly find it at the Eden Theater. The show is Smith, and it is a full Broadway show in what is usually thought of as an Off Broadway theater.

title: African Film Makers Seek Aid Here
description: Gordon Parks, the black American director of the Shaft action movies, sat listening intently the other day to a delegation of African producers seeking ways of getting their films into the lucrative American market.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HIGH FINANCE If you have a halfhour or 60 minutes to invest, you'll find that the American Stock Exchange, 78 Trinity Place (9382464) it's just back of Trinity Churchwilltell you all. All about how a stock exchange works, that is. The exchange has recently refurbished its visitors gallery, and there are all sorts of buttons for you to push. The pushing elicits illustrated, very clearly explained diagrams that show you how a share moves from seller to buyer. There are audio narrations, too, with what seems to be actual ne gotiating going on. The display tells you what an exchange does, what it doesn't do.

title: A.B.A.N.B.A. Game Is Off
description: DENVER, May 20 (UPI)The third game between the American and National Basketball Association, scheduled in New York May 31, has been canceled, the A.R.A. Players Association said yesterday. It said the N.B.A. ,Players Association had refused to cooperate with the network producing the game.

title: Cambodia's. Lon Nol Reported Planning Medical Trip to U.S.
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 20 (AP)The ailing President of Cambodia, Lon Nol, will leave soon for medical treatment in the United States, a highranking Government official said today.

title: DRIVERS UNFAZED BY GAS SCARCITY
description: Motorists appear to be not deeply concerned as yet about the possible shortage of gasoline, although some of them are looking more closely at smaller cars and even at the possibility of carrying emergency fuel supplies in case they do run out of gas.

title: Screen: From Italy, Mattel Affair
Building to Resume at St. John the Divine
description: The Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine celebrated its 100th anniversary and the installation of a new dean yesterday with prayer pomp, carnival  and a disclosure that construction at the Episcopal cathedral, would resume.

title: State Consumer Parley Stirs Mixed Reactions
description: TRENTON, May 20  The conference called here yesterday by Millicent Fenwick, director of the State Division of Consumer Affairs, to discuss consumer priorities turned out like one of those blind cartons offered at auctionspacked with useless things, familiar things, a few items that are helpful and a sur prise or two. About 25 persons, including four ex ecutive directors from Better Business Bureaus in New Jersey, met at the State House and got their first surprise of the daya capsule appearance by Governor Cahill, who welcomed them and commended Mrs. Fenwick for outstanding work. Mrs. Fenwick was appointed to her post by the Governor last January.

title: TV: Father of Relativity
description: One of the More fascinating figures of the century, surely, was Albert Einstein, about whom most of us know as little, as we do of his theory of relativity. The great, visionary scientist was reportedly a simple man. Why not a simple, factual documentary? Surely film footage and pictures are available. And what about reminiscences by Princeton associates of his final years?

title: JULIUS A. THOMAS OF URBAN LEAGUE
description: DAYTON, Ohio, May 20Julius A. Thomas, director industrial relations of the National Urban League in New York. from 1943 to 1961, who played a major role in widening employment opportunities for blacks, died here today at the age of 76. He moved to Dayton from New York last year.

title: Reid's Tour Called Opening of Gubernatorial Bid
description: ELMIRA, N.Y., May 20Representative Ogden R. Reid of Westchester County, who switched from the Republican to the Democratic party last year, barnstormed Democratic functions in five upstate counties over the weekend in a tour that focused the attention of party leaders on one of the newer potential candidates for Governor next year.

title: Sports Today
description: Meta vs. St. Louis Cardinals, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens. 8:05 P.M. (RadloWHN, 8 P.M.)

title: Heath Arrives in France For Talks With Pompidou
description: PARIS, May 20 (Reuters)Prime Minister Heath arrived here by air tonight for two days of talks with President Pompidou beginning tomorrow.

title: Lewis Wins in Handball
description: Fred Lewis of Miami Beach defeated Lou Russo of Lake Grove, L. I., 2116, 2115, to win the open singles division at the fourth annual NewYork Athletic Club invitation handball tournament yesterday.

title: BLACKS TIGHTEN TIES TO AFRICANS
description: WASHINGTON, May 20At a time of everincreasing black awareness, American blacks have begun forming closer links to African blacks.

title: Secretariat Is Scaring Off Rivals
description: BALTIMORE, May 20Secretariat, the Meadow Stable's hero of yesterday's Preakness Stakes as well as of the Kentucky Derby two weeks ago, shipped out today to prepare for the Belmont Stakes. Also moving from Pimlico to New York was Sigmund Sommer's Sham, runnerup to Secretariat in both races, which, with the Belmont, make up the Triple Crown for 3yearolds.

title: Student Unrest in Barcelona
description: BARCELONA, Spain, May 20 (UPI)  Most classes were ordered suspended at the central university today after student disturbances stemming, campus sources said from political motives as well as from disagreement with the university administration.

title: VIETCONG BRIEFED BY THO ON TALKS
description: PARIS, May 20Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho left continuing Vietnam ceasefire talks to their deputies today amid indications that both sides were sticking to their hard initial positions.

title: Sports Today
description: Mete vs. St. Louis Cardinals, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 P.M. (RadioWHN, 8 P.M.)

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Graham Martin, William Sullivan, G. McMurtrie Godley and William Colby currently are nominees for high office who may slide by in the general desire not to turn over any more stones.

title: Books of The Times
description: James Jones gives you a lot of groceries for your money, Not from the gourmet Shopjust plain, hearty, bellyfilling fare. In his first suspense novel, he has chosen for his setting a beautiful Greek island, favored by hippies and a few decadent rich folk. This transient population struggles against anomie with sex, drugs, intrigue and murder, but Lobo Davies, Mr. Jones's private eye is there for an innocent month's vacation. He hasn't chosen the island; the holiday is a gift from a rich client for whom Lobo has done a bangup job.

title: Nancy Irnershein Is Wed
description: LAWRENCE, L.I., May 20 Miss Nancy Imershein, daughter of Mr. and Charles J. Imershein of North Woodmere, was married here today to David Carver, son of Mr. and Mrs. Spencer Carver of Valley Stream. The ceremony was performed in Temple Sinai of Long Island, by the Rev. Dr. Abram Vossen Goodman, rabbi emeritus, and Rabbi Mark N. Goldman.

title: THIEU ANNOUNCES 8YEAR PROGRAM OF WAR RECOVERY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 20  President Nguyen Van Thieu announced an ambitious new eightyear plan tonight for the reconstruction and economic development of South Vietnam, declaring that the danger of the renewal of war appeared to be receding.

title: Shorter Quits After 18 Miles
description: HELSINKI, Finland, May 20 (AP)The Olympic champion, Frank Shorter of the United States, quit an international marathon today after about 18 miles with a possible broken ankle. He was leading the 26mile, 385yard race.

title: Benno de Terey, 70, Dies; French &
description: Benno de Terey, an interior designer, who had been chief interior designer for French & Company and earlier had worked in the design departments of William Baumgarten & Company and W. & J. Sloane, died Friday of a heart attack, at his home, 53 East 75th Street. His age was 70.

title: A.B.A.N.B.A. Game Is Off
description: DENVER, May 20 (UPI)The third game between the American and National Basketball Association, scheduled in New York May 31, has been canceled, the A.B.A. Players Association said yesterday. It said the N.B.A. Players Association had refused to cooperate with the network producing the game.

title: CASPER WARREN, BAPTIST LEADER
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 2C (AP)The Rev. Dr. Casper C. Warren, a Charlotte pastor who helped lead Southern Baptists to become the country's largest Protestant denomination, died today. He was 76 years old.

title: Iceland RulesNATO Base Barred to British Planes
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, May 20 (Reuters)  Premier Olafur Johannesson banned all British military planes today from landing at the North Atlantic Treaty Organization airfield at Keflavik.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Ten per cent of New York adults screened by the city's Health Services Administration in the last 12 months for symptoms of hypertension were found to have definite evidence of high blood pressure, the agency said. Among adolescents, the proportion of hypertensive suspects ranged between 2.4 and 5 per cent.

title: 17 OF CAMDEN 28 FOUND NOT GUILTY
description: CAMDEN, N. J., May 20A jury of five men and seven women today found 17 members of the Camden 28 not guilty of breaking into the Federal Building here in 1971 and destroying draft files, even though the defendants admitted having done so and 80 Federal Bureau of Investigation agents caught them at it.

title: Dr. David M. Hume, a Developer Of Transplant Techniques, Dies
description: CHATSWORTH, Calif., May 20 (UPI)Dr. David M. Hume, a surgeon who, helped develop the technique of human organ transplants, died yesterday when a plane he was piloting crashed on takeoff at Van Nuys Airport. He was 55 years old.

title: Commodity Option Deals Coming Under Scrutiny
description: The collapse of a big West Coast dealer in commodity options and the arraignment of its former president last Monday on fraud charges have combined to cast a deep shadow over the newest game in own.

title: Baby Falls but Stays Afloat
description: BARRY, Ill., May 20 (AP)A 2yearold boy doing absolutely terribly in a Y.M.C.A. swimming course for babies fell into a cistern at a babysitter's home and stayed arloat until rescued, officials said yesterday. The child is Richard Robin Gregory, !son of Dr. and Mrs. Richard Gregory of Barry.

title: Miss Larrieu Top Miler
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., May 19 (UPI) Francie Larrieu of the San Jose Cindergals set United States women's mile record of 4 minutes 38.7 seconds last night in the Bakersfield Track Classic. The previous mark of 4:39.6 was set by Seattle's Doris Brown two years ago.

title: Juror Lauds Camden 28 For a Job Well Done
description: CAMDEN, NJ., May 20Well done, said a letter to the Camden defendants written by one of the jurors, Samuel Braithwaite, an Atlantic City cab driver. He had left the letter with the clerk of the court with instructions to deliver it at the close of the trial.

title: Remund's Hydroplane Wins At Record Speed in Miami
description: MIAMI, May 20 (AP) Mickey Remund established stadium record of 111.150 miles an hour in his Pay N Pak unlimited hydroplane today on the way to capturing the $25,000 Champion Spark Plug Regatta.

title: Wayne W. Stetson, Headed Atlantic City Convention Unit
description: MARGATE, N. J., May 20Wayne. W. Stetson, executive vice president and general manager of the Atlantic City Convention Bureau, the country's oldest, died yesterday in his sleep at his home, 3 Osborne Avenue. He was 65 years old.

title: MRS. YOUNG VICTOR IN BLUEGRASS GOLF
Miss Rankin Bride Of W.M.Specht 3d
description: RED BANK, N. J., May 20 Miss Mary Christine Rankin was married here this afternoon to William Michael Specht 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Specht Jr. of Bricktown.

title: Panel of Jewish Scholars Translating the Bible
description: The Bible was written by individualsfamiliar figures like David and anonymous authors or editors known only by such cold scholarly names as J or DeuteroIsaiah.

title: Labor Government In Australia Loses In Vote in Key State
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 20 Prime Minister Gough Whitlam's sixmonthold Labor Government suffered a setback in the elections yesterday in the key state of Victoria in southeastern Australia.

title: Revolution Near at CheckOut Counter
description: WASHINGTON, May 20Supermarket customers are about to witness the dawning of new era in food merchandizing automation of the checkout counter.

title: NEW PENSION BILL OFFERED IN ALBANY
description: Republican leaders of ti Legislature yesterday propose an alternative to Governor Rockefeller's embattled proposal that all government en ploye unions in the state forced to accept the new pet sion pact worked out by ti Governor and the Civil Service Employes Association.

title: Texas Stays Johnson Tribute
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 20 (UPI) The Texas Senate could not agree yesterday whose birthday to delete when adding former President Johnson's birthday to the state holidays, so the bill was sent to a conference committee for a decision.

title: ITALIANS SUSPECT VIOLENCE IS PLOT
description: ROME, May 20Italy has asked police agencies in France, Switzerland, Britain, Israel and elsewhere for help in finding out whether there is an international conspiracy to organize acts of terrorism and stir disorders in this country.

title: METS WAIT 2 HOURS TO POSTPONE GAME
description: After a twohour wait, yesterday's game between the Mets and Pittsburgh Pirates at Shea Stadium was postponed by rain. There was an advance sale of more than 33,000 tickets and 32.025 persons had entered the park hoping the rain would stop. By 4 P.M. it hadn't and the game was postponed.

title: Daughter Is Doubtful Nixon Would Resign
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (UPI)Mrs. David Eisenhower said today that the Watergate scandal was making her father's life difficult and overshadowing his achievements as President, but that she doubted it would force him to resign.

title: Personal Finance
description: Graduation days and june weddings inevitably bring up the question of presents. For the parent, grandparent or longtime family friend a good idea might be a gift of stock.

title: Brother vs. Brother
description: The omnibus higher education bill, which Governor Rockefeller has been trying to ram through the Legislature, can only be. described as a gubernatorial power grab aimed at taking control of the City University away from the city.

title: Charge Naming the I.T.T. Is Reported Cut in S.E.C.
Randy Johnson Is Signed For '73 Season by Giants
description: Randy Johnson, whose injury gave Norm Snead the opportunity to become the Giants No 1 quarterback last season, was the club's first seasoned player to sign for 1973, the Giants announced yesterday.

title: Watergate and 1976
description: WASHINGTON, May 20Inevitably, careers will be both enhanced and destroyed by the Watergate affair. And not only on the most obvious, immediate levelfor example, the disappearance of H. R. Haldeman and John D. Ehrlichman from the White House inner circle, and the consequent promotion into influential roles of Leonard Garment and Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. The whole cast of Presidential aspirants for 1976 has already been affected, and will be further affected with every day's fresh revelations.

title: Strike Threatens State's Horse Racing
description: Representatives of race track employes will vote today whether to call a strike that would halt all horse racing in New York State. If so voted, the strike could begin today, but it is more likely that it would begin tomorrow.

title: The Dance
description: Apollo is George Balanchine's bestknown ballet to a Stravinsky score. Yet the New York City Ballet's public has not always seen it as it should be seen, simply because those in the title role have sometimes failed to transmit the choreography. They have rounded out its angular edges, added personal accents and mannerisms, improvised transitional steps when unnecessary.

title: WHITE HOUSE UNIT REPORTEDLY SPIED ON RADICALS IN 70
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 The White House established a secret intelligence unit in 1970 to collect and evaluate information about radical and antiwar groups, sources close to the Watergate investigation said today.

title: President Spends Sunday At Camp David Retreat
description: CAMP DAVID, Md., May 20 (UPI)President Nixon spent a rainy Sunday at his Catoctin Mountain retreat today, reviewing papers and relaxing with his wife and a friend, C. G. Rebozo of Key Biscayne, Fla,

title: City Tosses a Birthday Party for Brooklyn Bridge, 90
description: The ostensible reason several thousand people turned out in a constant rain to gather on both sides of the Brooklyn Bridge yesterday was that the bridge was having its 90th birthday party, thrown by the city.

title: POLICE SEEK 2 MORE IN MT. VERNON CLASH
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., May 20The police here and in New York City continued today to seek two men who escaped after a wild shootout and chase yesterday in which two Mount Vernon policemen were shot, a family was briefly held hostage and a motorist was kidnapped to Manhattan.

title: To Be Let Alone
description: WASHINGTONOn April 27, 1966, in his only appearance before the United States Supreme: Court, Attorney Richard Nixon rose to argue for the individual's right to privacy.

title: Susan Levine Married
description: Miss Susan Levine, a January graduate of George Washington University, was married at the TavernontheGreen yesterday to Malcolm Netburn, who expects to receive his degree from the university next month. Cantor Sidney Ochs performed the ceremony. The parents of the couple are Dr. and Mrs. Jack Levine and Mr. and Mrs. Aaron Netburn, all of New York, Dr. Levine is an orthopedic surgeon, Mr. Netburn a senior vice president of the New York Hanseatic Corporation.

title: Sale of U.S. Arms To Israel Since 67 Is Put at $1Billion
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (UPI) Declassified Pentagon figures on United States weapons sales show that Israel has bought almost $1billion worth and more than three times as much as the Arab countries since the 1967 Middle Eastern war.

title: BRENT WINS FINAL IN ARMONK TENNIS
description: ARMONK, N. Y., May 20Rod Brent, an Australian now teaching in Mamaroneck, won the annual Westchester tennis championship today by defeating Bailey Brown in the final, 76, 62.

title: 14 Candidates for Mayor Favor RentLaw Change
description: Expanded use of realestatetax abatement, more city loans to landlords and developers, and attempts to secure lower mortgageinterest rates are among the approaches that the four candidates in the June 4 Democratic primary for Mayor say they would pursue to meet the city's housing needs.

title: Hospitalized Dr. Sander Gets Up, Wins Marathon
Manitoulin, Shoemaker Up, takes $38,800 Coast Race
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 20 (AP)Manitoulin, ridden by Bill Shoemaker, captured the $38,800 Cortez Handicap at Hollywood Park today and led two other horses trained by Charles Whittingham into the first four places.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Stephen Burrows, Henri Bendel's resident designer, has a few new tricks up his sleeve for fall. This is the designer who, a few years back, took the stiffening out of clothes and put things together in bold patches of color as carefully as an abstract painter.

title: Randy S. Boroff Weds Miss Kaufman on L.I.
description: WANTAGH, L.I., May 20Miss Batbara Kaufman, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Kaufman, was married here this afternoon to RarIdy S. Boroff, son of Mr. and Mrs.. Paul Boroff of Levittown. Rabbi Mordecai Rubin per: formed the ceremony, assisted by Cantor Henry Wahrman.

title: Marchi vs. Gateway
description: After all the thought and effort that has gone into the concept of the Gateway National Recreation Area, seems preposterous that it should now be threatened with postponement and weakening by the vague reservations of a single state legislatorone, incidentally, for whom we normally have great respect. Yet that will be the result if Senator John J. March of Staten Island succeeds in his attempt to exclude Great Kills Park, from the Gateway project.

title: DeRose Backers Are Relying On Gaining a Big Ethnic Vote
description: HACKENSACK, May 20Senator Ralph C. DeRose, a candidate for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination, walked into the carpenters union hall on Bergen Street during a recent campaign tour and was bearhugged by a wellwisher who asked, Hey, are you Italian or Sicilian?

title: Roger Mc Guinn Returns, Without Byrds
description: The Byrds were one of the great rock groups of the sixties, and their potential, had they not broken up, was even greater than their accomplishment. For a while this spring, it looked as if they might get together again. But after an album had been produced, their plans collapsed, and the Roger McGuinn Band that finally showed up at the Academy of Music this weekend consisted of McGuinn and three nonByrd backup musicians.

title: GUSTAVE FELDMAN
description: Gustave Feldman, a leader in the dresi industry, died of a heart ailment yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital, which he had served as executive director of the Jack Martin Fund. He was 61 years old and lived at 5 Regent Drive in Lawrence, L.I.

title: Ailey Gets Informal Bid to Visit China
description: The Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater received an impromptu, informal offer yesterday to visit China. Meeting backstage with a 21member delegation of highranking Chinese journalists who had just attended the company's matinee performance at the City Center, Mr. Ailey said, We are very lucky to have you here. And we would like to perform in your country.

title: Officials Say Heating Oil Shortage Could Be Severe
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 Beyond the threat of a summer gasoline shortage which is pre occupying Government energy planners, the oil industry and motorists, looms the prosper of a shortage of home heating oil next winter that could bi worse than the one last winter

title: Hawaiian Punch Order
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (Reuters)  The Federal Trade Commission) said today that it had provisionally accepted a consent order barring RJR Foods, Inc,, of New York prom misrepresenting the natural fruit juice conent of its Hawaiian Punch.

title: 17 OF CAMDEN 28 FOUND NOT GUILTY; Admitted DraftOffice Raid Both Sides Ask Dismissal of Charges on 11 Others
description: CAMDEN, N. J., May 20A jury of five men and seven women today found 17 members of the Camden 28 not guilty of breaking into the Federal Building here in 1971 and destroying draft files, even though the defendants admitted having done so and 80 Federal Bureau of Investigation agents caught them at it.

title: Frank Lloyd and the Marlborough: Art and Success
description: When Frank Lloyd, head of Marlborough Galleries, had private audience with Pop Paul VI a few years ago, hi mentioned that the church hac always supported art in the past. Why shouldn't it support modern art as well? he asked.

title: Rent Mirage
description: The City Council, always ready to take the easy way politically, has decided that the eve of a primary election is a nice time to dangle before families in 1.2million rentcontrolled apartments the illusion of a rent cut.

title: The Plea of Ignorance
description: Should William J. Casey resign from his position Under Secretary of State for Economic Affairs because of a. subordinate's handling of the Vesco case at the time Mr. Casey was chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission?

title: TAIWAN SEES U.S. KEEPING SOME TIE
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, May 20can acquaintances these days, Chinese in Taiwan tend to ask when, rather than whether, the United States plans to recognize Peking. Such a question is no longer considered defeatist or disloyal, as it would have been previously, but realistic.

title: Matawan to Investigate AntiSemitic Incidents
description: MATAWAIN TOWNSHIP, May 20Mayor Thomas J. Powers and Dr. John F. Regan, the superintendent of Matawan regional schools, will meet tomorrow to discuss an incident last week in which the face of a 12yearold boy was smeared with ink, apparently because he is Jewish.

title: FRANK M'COOL
description: CALGARY, Alberta, May 20 (UPI)Frank McCool, assistant publisher and general manager of The Calgary Albertan and former goalie for the Toronto Maple Leafs of the National Hockey League, died today. He was 54 years old.

title: Two AntiCatholic Articles Of Swiss Charter Repealed
description: GENEVA, May 20Two antiRoman Catholic articles of the federal constitution, banning the Society of Jesus and the founding of new convents and monasteries, were repealed by a narrow minority of voters today.

title: DR. JOHN SPAETH JR. OF WESLEYAN DEAD
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., May 20John W. Spaeth Jr., professor..of classics at Wesleyan University and dean of the faculty from 1949 to his retirement in 1963, died last night in Middlesex Memorial Hospital here. He was 77 years old and lived in Cromwell.

title: AIDE TO BOIARDO IS SLAIN IN JERSEY
description: The body of a 53yearold New Jersey man reputed to have longtime underworld connections was found stuffed in the trunk of his wife's 1970 Cadillac, which had been left last week in the parking lot of a department store in Kearny.

title: Belgian Grand Prix Won By Stewart
Russians Eager for Accord
description: MOSCOW, May 20In 1922, after a meeting with Dr, Armand Hammer, a young American physician eager to do business with the Soviet state, Lenin told other members of the ruling Politburo:

title: For 6 African Nations, A Catastrophic Famine
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. May 20The famine that is threatening millions of Africans in six droughtstricken ,coup tries bordering the Sahara has been described here as catastrophic.

title: U.S.Companies and Soviet Discuss a Vast Gas Line
description: LOS ANGELES, May 20Dr. Armand Hammer, chairman of the Occidental Petroleum Corporation, is negotiating a massive new pipeline deal with the Soviet Union that, he says, could be twice as big as the estimated $7billion or $8billion transaction in chemical fertilizers that he signed in Moscow last month.

title: FORMULA 5000 RACE WON BY SCHECKTER
DAVE HILL VICTOR IN MEMPHIS GOLF
Ethnic Groups Ignore Rain on Parades
description: While the 90th birthday celebration of the Brooklyn Bridge boasted big crowds and fireworks displays, this meltingpot city was also the scene yesterday of parades and festivals by and for Hasidic JeWs, Norwegians, Greeks and Chinese.

title: RONALD MIDONNELL, CANADIAN DIPLOMAT
description: OTTAWA, May 20 (Canadian Press)Ronald M. MacDonnell, the Canadian High Commissioner in Colombo, Sri Lanka, died yesterday of a heart attack. He was 64 years old.

title: Chinese Gymnasts Take A Wet Excursion Here
description: A gymnastics team from China toured in the rain yes, terday before its meet tonight with a United States team at Madison Square Garden.

title: Watergate and the Europeans
description: PARIS, May 20The Watergate affair has provoked many questions about how other world leaders plan to deal with President Nixon in a series of coming meetings.

title: Mississippi River Is Lower; But Still Above Flood Level
description: VICKSBURG, Miss., May 20 (UPI)  The Mississippi River fell twotenths of a foot today to 52,6 feet, but officials predict it will be June or later before it falls below flood levels of 43 feet.

title: Vegetable Prices Here Are Up, Meat Prices Remain at Ceilings
description: Price rises hit popular vegetable items last week as meat prices remained unchanged at their ceilings except for chock roast, which dropped 4 cents a pound to $1.35 in some stores.

title: Catholic Is Killed in Belfast In the 10th Slaying in 4 Days
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 20 (AP)Gunmen killed Roman Catholic painter today, raising Northern Ireland's death toll in four years of sectarian feuding to 801.

title: U.,S.Companies and Soviet Discuss a Vast Gas Line
Miss Larrieu Top Miler
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., May 19 (UPI)Francie Larrieu of the San Jose Cindergals set a United States women's mile record of 4 minutes 38.7 seconds last night in the Bakersfield Track Classic. The previous mark of 4:39.6 was set by Seattle's Doris Brown two years ago.

title: An Aide to Boiardo Is Slain in Jersey
description: The body of a 53yearold Jersey man reputed to have longtime underworld connections was found stuffed in the trunk of his wife's 1970 Cadillac, which had been left last week in the parking Tot of a department store in Kearny..

title: Niger Leader Ending Tour
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, May 20 (Agence FrancePresse)President Diori Hamani of Niger arrived here from Ghana today, and is expected to hold talks with President Felix HouphouetBoigny before flying on to Upper Volta tomorrow.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
Gay Alliance Has Dance at Princeton University
description: PRINCETON, May 20 (AP)More than 300 people, most of them males, attended a dance at Princeton University last night sponsored by the Gay Alliance of Princeton, a group of student homosexuals.

title: URBAN FELLOWSHIP WON BY 20 IN NATION
Red Smith
description: BALTIMORE. May 20While the sovereign Secretariat lorded it over the American racing scene yesterday, his most persistent rival of last year was mounting a challenge that could result in a classic confrontation three weeks hence. Network television cameras and the biggest outpouring of horseplayers in Maryland history had eyes only for Pimlico, where Secretariat demolished the field in the 98th Preakness Stakes. But meanwhile, back in Elmont, L. L, a pert and plucky little colt named Stop the Music was ripping off the fastest mile ever run at Belmont Park by horse or scalded cat. If Stop the Music doesn't pick up the gauntlet and Pancho Martin doesn't cool off, the New York Racing Association may have to offer trading stamps to drum up opposition for Secretariat in the Belmont. The big colt's smashing victories in the Kentucky Derby and Preakness have convinced most horsemen that to oppose his final bid for the Triple Crown would be a waste of their own stock.

title: Ehrlichman Focus Of a Coast Dispute
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., May 20Several years ago John D. Ehrlichman, class of 1942, was selected for the Hall of Fame at Santa Monica High School, and his picture was placed on a wall of the history building alongside such luminaries as Glenn Ford, the actor, class of 1934, and Ernest C. Arbuckle, a banking executive, class of 1929.

title: Joanne Ava Vosko Married Upstate
description: CHAZY LANDING, N. Y., May 20Miss Joanne Aya Vosko, daughter of Mr. ante Mrs. Irwin Lyon. Vosko of Nassau, the Bahamas, was married, here last night It) Mitchell Zuckerman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morton Zucker.man of Tuckahoe; N.Y., and Ogunquit, Me. Rabbi Rich and David Messing performed the ceremony at the summer home of the bride's parenti.

title: Play's the Thing As Cosmos Gain Only a 11 Draw
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 20 The New York Cosmos, in driving rain and before 2,364 paying fans, put on their best performance of the season at Hofstra Stadium today, but the scoring script was the same as in their last two games.

title: Soviet Wrestlers Take 2Day Meet at Toledo
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, May 20 (AP) The Soviet Union defeated the United States, 164, in the thirdround match to capture the first World Cup of amateur wrestling event.

title: HIJACKED PLANE BACK FROM CUBA
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 20 (AP)A Venezuelan airliner hijacked to Cuba returned here today with the passengers and crew members taken as hostages by armed leftists on an erratic trip through five LatinAmerican countries.

title: IRISH SPORTS RESULTS
description: MUNSTER SENIOR HURLING Championship Match

title: POSEY CAR BUMPED FROM INDY FIELD
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 20The field for the May 28 running of the Indianapolis 500 was filled out to 33 cars this afternoon with the usual lastminute scrambling to make the race.

title: BURNS TOPS WISE IN TRAVIS, 4 AND 3
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., May 20 George Burns, just about the best and busiest amateur golfer in the area these days, took his second consecutive tournament today beating Paul T. Wise, 4 and 3, in the final of the 63d annual Walter J. Travis Memorial tournament.

title: Raids by Young Robbers Plague Jewelers in St. Louis Area
description: ST. LOUIS, May 20Raymond J. Karst opened his jewelry store in the welltodo suburb of Clayton last Tuesday and then he promptly locked the door.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: A Coast Guard air and sea search for 69yearold Alfred J. Willis of Wildwood Crest was called off. Mr. Willis, missing since last Thursday afternoon, disappeared from his 21foot motorboat. It was recovered three miles from Wildwood Crest in Delaware Bay... A 15yearold South Orange youth, John Middleton, was found dead on the ErieLackawanna Railroad tracks in Maplewood. The police believe he fell from the engine of a passenger train while trying to hitch a ride.... The police of East Brunswick were investigating the death of 12yearold William Burns, whose body was found hanging from the rafters of an unfinished house in the Appletree Estates development Saturday evening. The police said there was no evidence of foul play.

title: Deposits Off. Off at Savings and Loan Units
description: The flow of new deposits into the nation's savings, and loan associationswhich as a group are the largest single source of homemortgage money dropped 55 per cent during April, the United States Savings and Loan League estimated yesterday.

title: Justice Officials Find Corruption Rife Among Immigration Aides in Southwest
description: WASHINGTON, May 20The Department of Justice has amassed evidence of widespread corruption in one of its own branches, the Southwest Region of the Immigration and Naturalization Service, Government sources have told The New York Times.

title: BUSING FOE FADES FROM LIMELIGHT
description: PONTIAC, Mich., May 20Irene McCabe, who once waged an antibusing campaign that won national attention, is a sadder but wiser housewife again.

title: THIEU ANNOUNCES 8YEAR PROGRAM OF WAR RECOVERY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 20  President Nguyen Van. Thieu announced an ambitious new eightyear plan tonight for the reconstruction and economic development of South Vietnam declaring that the danger of the renewal of war appeared to be receding.

title: Disappointed Bensonhurst Residents Still Like Biaggi
description: I still like the guy! Under the elevated tracks along 86th Street, the main shopping street of Brooklyn's Bensonhurst section, talk is constantly interrupted by the clang and clatter of the B trains overhead.

title: Elizabeth Martin Bride of Physican
description: Miss Elizabeth M. Martin, a member of the nursing staff at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center, and Dr. Richard B. Heyman, a recent graduate of Columbia's College of Physicians and Surgeons, were married yesterday in the Pauline Hartford Memorial Chapel at the Medical Center. Criminal Court Judge Bruce McM. Wright officiated.

title: Another Law Violation is Charged to McCrane
description: TRENTON, May 20 (AP)Former State Treasurer Joseph McCrane Jr., who is under indictment for alleged misconduct in office and conspiracy to use state funds to help his brother's brokerage firm, failed to file a required statement disavowing possible conflict of interests, according to an offical in the Treasury Department.

title: Slate Backed by U.M.W. Leader Wins
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., May 20Members of United Mine Workers District 17 have elected officers backed by the union president, Arnold Miller, in the first election in the district's history.

title: Tornadoes and Rain Strike Southern and Central States
description: ATLANTA, May 20 (Reuters) Weather warnings remained in force today after a series of tornadoes and severe thunderstorms skipped across several Southern and central states, injuring at least 40 persons and damaging property.

title: Koch Says Secrecy in the Government Kept Congress From Budget Scrutiny
