description: Representative Edward I. Koch recalled for an appreciative audience over the weekend the time when he and other freshman Congressmen were invited to breakfast at the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Nestl Is Lifting Cloak of Multinational Secrecy
description: Multinational corporations must explain themselves more.

title: Even Sesame Street Gives Message As Canadians Pursue Their Heritage
description: TORONTO, May 17  Not many years ago, a typical reading lesson in a Canadian elementary classroom might have been about a visit to grandmother's farm in Iowa, and pupils might have learned to count from a book that showed an American father adding up the cost of Americ.an gallons of gasoline.

title: JOAQUIN BAU NOLLA
description: MADRID, May, 20 (Reuters) Joaquin Bau Nolla, one of Generalissimo Francesco Franco's stanchest supporters and president of the Council of State, died.today. He was 75 years old.

title: The Long Relationship
description: WASHINGTON  It is more than mere dogma to believe that the official spokesman must bear the torch for honesty and integrity. He must also In his labors develop the discrimination to detect even from a distance the barest scent of the false and always must avoid the easy temptation that seduces right and honesty and courage.

title: Garment Workers Get 20% Increase In New Contracts
description: Wage increases totaling 20 per cent over three years will go to 20,400 blouse, skirt and sportswear workers here as result of new agreements with employer associations that were announced yesterday.

title: 4 Candidates for Mayor Favor RentLaw Change
Roundup: Wood Records No. 10 in His 3Day Plan
description: The Chicago White Sox played their 33d game of the season yesterday and recorded their 21st victory in the opener of a doubleheader with the Minnesota Twins. Wilbur Wood, the tireless knuckleball pitcher of the White Sox pitched in his 13th game and registered his 10th victory, the first pitcher in the major leagues to reach that total.

title: METS WAIT 2 HOURS TO POSTPONE GAME
Metropolitan Briefs
description: Within a few hours yesterday morning; four men met death by street stabbings in four boroughs of the city: At 1:45 A.M., at Anisterdam Avenue and 143d Street, Wrensman Ferguson, 25 years old, of Tampa, Fla., was found fatally stabbed. He had no money in his pockets.... At 1:50, in front of 93 Beach 33d Street in the Edgeinere'section of the Rockaways, Queens, Joseph L. Mabry, 34,.who lived at that address, was stabbed with a carving knife after what detectives said was a fight with a nextdoor neighbor, James Cook, 35. Mr. Cook was charged with the killing,... At 2:20, at West Farms Road and Jennings Street in the Bronx, Carlo Burroughs, 35; of 984 East 172d Street, was stabbed fatally in the stomach. Detectives, who said the killing was an aftermath of an earlier, fight, were questioning three men.... At 6:35, at Fifth Avenue and Douglas Street, Gregori Rosa, 38, of 295 Fifth Avenue, was stabbed in the back and died, in what the police said was a fight over a family matter. Samuel Quinones, 21, of 535 Dean Street was arrested.

title: Books Today
description: A Journal, of the Plague Years by Stefan Kanfer (Atheneum, $7.95). About show business and blacklisting.

title: EDLU SAIL TROPHY WON BY CHARISMA
Candidates'
description: A young man in a black homburg peered from under an umbrella at Hester and Orchard Streets yesterday and asked Representative Marie Biaggi, Is all this stuff in the press going to hurt you?

title: City to Remove Posters And Bill the Candidates
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday instructed the Environmental Protection Administration to remove all campaign literature affixed to public property and bill the offending candidates for the job.

title: The End Of the Affair
description: WASHINGTON, May 20For four years most of the press and other natural skeptics in Washington suspended their disbelief when it came to Henry Kissinger. He had three qualities that were in desperately short supply at the top of the Nixon Administration: intelligence, humor and accessibility. He was worth seeing, and he could be seen.

title: Budget Wrangling Follows Ritual
description: Mayor Lindsay's submittal of his $10.595billion expense budget for 197374 is the beginning of a fiscal agony that will be ended in a few weeks by a secret legislative ritual that Budget Director David Grossman describes as the tango for three. The public joint hearings of the Board of Estimate and City Council; the subsequent privateand separatesessions of the Board of Estimate and City Council; the haggling, armtwisting and wheelingdealing, during which the Mayor's most trusted intermediaries flit about City Hall corridorsall of this is just the buildup for the tango.

title: Avoiding BoomBust
description: The American economy is now running flat out in an inflationary boom that could turn into a bust unless is soon brought under control. The latest Government data show that corporate profits jumped by $11.6 billion in the year's first quarterthe second biggest increase in history. Gross National Product has been climbing even faster than reported earlier; the nation's total output was advancing at a 14.6 per cent annual rate in the first quarterwith an inflation rate of 6.6 per cent.

title: Sandra L. Gabrilove Is Married
description: Miss Sandra Leslie Gabrilove, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. J. Lester Gabrilove of New York and Montague, N.J., was married here yesterday afternoon.to Michael I. Saltzman. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Edward H. Saltzman of Paterson, N.J., and Lake Worth, Fla.

title: CARBON COPY WINS DOG SHOW HONORS
Robert J. Stein, Architect, Weds Joan B. Lerner
description: WOODBURY, Conn., May 20Miss Joan Berg Lerner, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Martin Lerner of Bronxville, N.Y., was married here this afternoon to Robert Jonathon Stein, son of Dr. arid Mrs. William H. Stein of New York and Woodbury. Rabbi Solomon W. Sternstein performed the ceremony at the Stein home.

title: Voice of America Is Candid In Reporting on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (UN) The Voice of America is pulling no punches in its reporting of the Watergate scandal overseas, and some members of the Senate are concerned about the candor.

title: DeRose Backers Counting on Ethnic Vote in Jersey
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., May 20Senator Ralph C. DeRose, a candidate for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination, walked into the carpenters union hall on Bergen Street during a recent campaign tour and was bearhuged by a welwisher who asked, Hey, are you Italian or Sicilian?

title: Mrs. Stuyvesant Pierrepont, Civic Leader, Is Dead at 87
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 20Mrs. Nathalie de Castro Pierrepont, widow of R. Stuyvesant Pierrepont, banker and society leader, died yesterday at her home, 1 Haslet Avenue. She was 87 years old. Mrs. Pierrepont lived also in Boca Grande, Fla., and was a founder and first president_ of St. Mary's Hospital in West Palm Beach.

title: Fosse Adds Emmy to Oscar and Tony; The Waltons Best Drama Series
description: Bob Fosse won three television Emmy awards last night for producing, directing and choreographing Singer Presents Liza With a Z, and in so ding won this year's Triple Crown of show business.

title: Advertising: F.T.C. Is Denounced
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., May 20The president of an ad agency, which along with two of its clients has been the target of the Federal Trade Commission it recent years, thoroughly denounced the practices of that Government body here yes. terday.

title: Wounded Knee Returning to Normal But Bitterness of Occupation Remains
description: KYLE, S.D., May 20  The helicopters carrying the White House negotiators are gone. Scattered knots of Indians, many in cowboy hats, smoke and talk quietly while the sun, an ever deepening orange, disappears behind low hills.

title: BULGARIANS LIKE ZIP IN WASH CYCLE
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, May 20In Bulgaria it is only a few years since a family regarded a washing machine  any washing machine  as a significant step to a better life.

title: In Vietnam, With Plastic Surgeons in Demand, Cosmetic Surgery Thrives
description: SAIGON, South VietnamThirty years of war have filled Vietnam's hospitals with tattered, scarred, and burned limbs ready for plastic surgery. But plastic surgeons are finding it more lucrative to run cosmetic surgery clinics for wealthy Saigonese.

title: City of Light: Study Takes a Dim View
description: PARIS, May 20Paris, the city of light, has just received a stinging blow to its vanity  which is considerable.

title: Roberta Books Has Nuptials
description: NEWTON CENTRE, Mass., May 20Miss Roberta Paula Books, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Books, was married here this afternoon to Jay Stanley Negin, son of Samuel Negin of Stamford, Conn., and the late Mrs. Martha Kaufman Negin.

title: U. S. Role in Okinawa Shifting as Japan Deploys Forces There
description: NAHA, Okinawa, May 15The American Air Force of ficer thought for a moment then said: Are we uneasy about the Japanese taking over our air defense mission? Well I've flown against Japanese pilots half a dozen times in training exercises. Never once did I get through. They always got me before I got to the bombing target. No, they're good and we think they'll take care of things O.K.

title: The Common Purpose: Integrity
description: WASHINGTONWatergate exposes a crisis in integrity. There is only one cure: integrity. We have seen contempt for the constitutional system and the rule of law. We will take the cure, now, or sink in degradation.

title: ESMONDE F. O'BRIEN
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., May 20Esmonde F. O'Brien, a former member of the New York and American Stock Exchanges, died today at St. Agnes Hospital in White Plains. He was 74 years old and lived at 257 Fox Meadow Road.

title: Soviet, Rumania N. Zealand, Spain Clinch Cup Tennis
description: BUDAPEST, May 20 (AP)Alex Metreveli defeated Balacs Toroczy, 64, 64, 63, today to give the Soviet Union a 3.2 victory over Hungry in their thirdround European Zone Davis Cup Tennis match.

title: Building to Resume at St. John the Divine
description: The Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine celebrated its 100th anniversary and the installation of a new dean yesterday with prayer, pomp, carnival  and a disclosure that construction at the Episcopal cathedral would resume.

title: Skylab Is Cleared Of Poison Gases And Is Cooled Off
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 20 (AP)  Mission Control cleared poison gas from inside the overheated Skylab space station today, but temperatures, in the craft, which had dipped slightly, rose again to about 115 degrees. On the ground, sun shades designed to cool the space station neared completion.

title: Three Slain in Paris Cafe
description: PARIS, May 20Two gunmen walked into a Paris cafe today and shot to death three men, One of the victims, Louis Nesmoz, 47 years old, spent eight years in prison for his part in a 1964 holdup in Milian, Italy, in which jewels worth $400,000 were stolen. Only $40,000, in gems were recovered.

title: Survivor of Fishing Boat ClungTo Life Raft as Friends Died
description: NARRAGANSETT, R. I., May 20 (AP)A survivor of a sunken fishing charter boat said today that he clung to a life raft for five hours while watching friends lose their grip and slip away into the chilly Atlantic.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Colonialism 3 P.M.

title: A.D.A. BIDS U.S. END INDOCHINA BOMBING
description: WASHINGTON, May 20 (AP) The Americans for Democratic Action convention called today for an immediate end to all United States bombing in Indochina.

title: Libya Raises Another Barrier To Foreigners Seeking Entry
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, May 18Libya, in another step to isolate herself from the nonArab, nonIslamic world, has told foreign airlines that from now on all tickets for arriving travelers must be written in Arabic.

title: Belgian Grand Prix Goes To Stewart
Schweitzer Successor Is Still soght
description: PARIS, May 20The search to find a replacement for Pierre Paul Schweitzer, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, is proving to be more difficult than anyone had imagined, including the Americans who hastened his departure.

title: POLICE UNION SAYS STATE IS DISHONEST
description: ALBANY, May 21The state police union today accused the state of dishonest and vile dealings in negotiating a new wage contract.

title: Chinese, U.S. Gymnasts in Friendly Strife
description: In an atmosphere of such unending cordiality that Chinese coaches consoled Americans who slipped, and Americans gave pats on the back to the Chinese, the countries gymnastic squads attraced 13,857 fans to Madison Square Garden last night.

title: MARYLAND, VIRGINIA IN TITLE LACROSSE
description: Lacrosse action will center on Baltimore next weekend with the semifinals of the National Collegiate Athletic Association championship tournament.

title: SAFEWAY PRICES CUT FOR MEATS IN WEST
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 The Government reported today I hat Safeway Stores, Inc., had temporarily reduced prices on meat products at 553 supermarkets in California and the Southwest to refund to customers $80,965 that the chain had collected in excess of legal price ceilings.

title: Mackenzie Pipe Dream?
description: OTTAWAThe best hope of fore stalling an oil pipeline across the stet of Alaskaa project long anathema most environmentalistshas been the discovery of an acceptable alternative For many months that alternative ha: been widely thought to lie in the valley of Canada's Mackenzie River, some 300 miles east of the great oil field! on the Alaskan North Slope. But judging from the atmosphere here and inTorontoand for reasons political economic and environmentalthai hope is exceedingly dim.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Chemical Bank branch on 125th Street between Lenox and Seventh Avenues in Harlem was robbed by man who handed a teller a note demanding all her money. He was given $2,000, and he fled.... An A. & P. supermarket on Metropolitan Avenue near Forest Avenue the Ridgewood section of Queens was held up by three men who forced the manager to hand over $6,500. They escaped in a car.. Extra police patrols were ordered to check on Temple Shalom in Brick Township, N. J., frequent target of vandals recently. Officials said there was no evidence of widespread antiSemitism but that scattered incidents such as the painting of hate slogans had occurred.

title: Wirt E. Hosao Dead at 86; Led RollsRoyce of America
description: BRONXVILLE, May 21 Wirt E. Hosac, former president of RollsRoyce of America which he headed from 1924 to 1931, died at his home here to day. He was 86 years old.

title: Equity Investigates the Dismissal Of Latin Actress From Verona
description: Actors Equity confirmed yes

title: Tough Libyan Cultural Revolution Stresses Merger With Egypt
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, May 17On April 15 Col. Muammar elQaddafi, the Libyan leader, proclaimed a cultural revolution and declared that he was turning the government of his country over to the popular masses.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BLOOMFIELD, May 21For the Flannery family this Essex County suburban community, only time will tell whether the Army or the Navy will prevail among the seven children.

title: Return to Consultation on Union Voted by United Presbyterians
description: OMAHA, May 21The 185th General Assembly of the United Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. voted tonight by a 65 per cent plurality to return to the Consultation on Church Union.

title: People and Business
description: Tommie Agee, one of the heroes of the Championship New York Mets of 1969, is one of the organizers of a, proposed national bank in Queens.

title: Arnold F. Sward, Officer Of Olin Thompson Plastics
description: YONKERS, May 21 Arnold F. Sward, a vice president of Olin Thompson Plastics Corporation of Stamford, Conn., and former marketing manager of the Union Carbide Plastics Company, died Friday at his home, 77 Winnebago Road. His age was 60.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Anne Kiein just may bring back another longmissing ingredient to the fashion scene: taste. She already has accomplished a lot. Five years ago, she started her present company with her husband, Chip Rubinstein, to make welltailored sports clothes. Now everybody's rushing into sportswear and separates are a way of life.

title: Temperature Rise Stirs Concern That Food on Skylab May Spoil
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 21 (AP)Temperatures soared again today aboard the overheated Skylab space station, causing flight surgeons to worry that some of the ton of food aboard may spoil.

title: LongTime Professional Spy
description: WASHINGTON, May 21When Richard McGarrah Helms presented his credentials as Ambassador to Iran to the. Shah last month, the official press in neighboring and not particularly friendly Iraq described Mr. Helms as an ugly American. To an outsiderone who had seen Mr. Helms's biography but did not know him personallythat appellation might have seemed apt.

title: Paterson Building No Longer in Use Destroyed by Fire
description: PATERSON, May 21A fourstory, 150,000squarefoot abandoned printing factory was destroyed here today by a fire that raged out of control for two hours.

title: Times Data Bank Widens Operation; Pricing is Revised
description: The New York Times Company announced yesterday the start of full commercial operations of its computerized Information Bank system and a new pricing system for the service.

title: Stocks and Bonds Fall
description: Stock and bond prices fell sharply yesterday as Wall Street continued to reel under the combined impact of the Watergate scandal, tightening credit conditions and inflationary fears. The DowJones industrial average dropped 8.66 points to 886.51..Volume on the New York Stock Exchange was a brisk 20.69 million shares. Details, Page 53.

title: DOESN'T FEAR TALKS OF BIG 2, EBAN SAYS
description: Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel said here yesterday that his country saw nothing to fear from forthcoming talks on the Middle East between President Nixon and the Soviet leader Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: Episcopal Unit Backs Ordination of Women
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. May 21 (UPI)The Episcopal diocese of Connecticut, the oldest in the United States, has approved the ordination of women as priests.

title: Imimodest Proposals
description: WASHINGTON, May 21It is not too early in the Watergate business to start drawing lessons and thinking about reform. Following are a few of the more obvious things that might be done to improve the quality, of Government.

title: Bolivian Minister Replaced
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, May 21 (Reuters)Interior Minister Alfredo Arce Carpio was replaced by an army colonel today as.a result of the police killing last week of former Interior Minister Andres Selich Chop. The replacement of Mr. Arce by Col. Walter Castro Avendalio came after a weekend. of intense pressure on President Hugo Banzer Suarez from rightwing ers infuriated by Colonel Selich's death at the hands of police interrogators, who said he had fallen down a flight of stairs.

title: EDWINC YOGEL 89, COLLECTOR OF ART
description: Edwin C. Vogel, a former senior officer of the C. I. T. Financial Corporation, a leader in several philanthropic organizations and a wellknown art collector, died yesterday of a heart ailment in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 89 years old and lived at 781 Fifth Avenue.

title: PUBLIC TV AIDE URGES CHANGES
description: A major change in the present structure of public broadcasting in the United States could be necessary to assure its freedom from political inter1 ference, according to Ralph B. Rogers, the acting chief executive officer of the Public Broadcasting Service.

title: Carlo Gadda, Novelist, Won International Prize in '63
description: ROME, May 21Carlo Emilio Gadda, a novelist and essayist, died here tonight. He was 79 years old.

title: BLACKS BELIEVED DEFYING THE MAFIA
description: KEARNY, N. J., May 21A series of ganglandstyle killings in New Jersey have raised speculation among lawenforcement agencies as to the possible emergence of a struggle for control of the narcotics and numbers rackets between daring and ambitious black operators and the entrenched Mafia.

title: Johnson's Herefords Sold for High Prices
description: STONEWALL, Tex., May 21 (UPI)Cattlemen from 14 states, Puerto Rico and Mexico paid $140,560 today for the prize Hereford herd of the late President Johnson because of the demand, not the L.B.J. name.

title: BLACKS BELIEVE DEFYING THE MAFIA
description: KEARNY, May 21  A series of ganglandstyle killings in New Jersey have raised speculation among lawenforcement agencies as to the possible emergence of a struggle for control of the narcotics and numbers rackets between daring and ambitious black operators and the entrenched Mafia.

title: Police Kill Gunman in Memphis After He Slays Five in Street
description: MEMPHIS, May 21 (UPI) An apparently berserk man opened fire with a rifle on a treet here today, killing five persons and wounding four before he died in a barrage of police gunfire.

title: THOROUGH INQUIRY IS PLEDGED BY COX
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Archibald Cox, named by the Attorney Generaldesignate, Elliot L. Richardson, as special prosecutor in the Watergate scandal, told the Senate Judiciary Committee today that he would pursue his investigation into the Oval Office of the White House if the trail led him there.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Top ballet Duos Invited to Spoleto

title: Bailey Released on Bond
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, May 21 (AP)F. Lee Bailey, the trial lawyer, has appeared before United States magistrate in connection with a Federal grand jury indictment in Florida last Friday. Mr. Bailey was released on a $5,000 recognizance bond after he signed an agreement to appear at an arraignment later in Orlando, Fla.

title: 12 indicted in Gary
description: GARY, Ind., May 21 (AP)Two Gary policemen and 10 other persons were indicted today by a Federal grand jury ere studying the Gary narotics traffic. The indictments ere announced at a news conI erence called by Mayor Richrd G. Hatcher. He said the announcement was being made as a move to restore credibility to the Gary Police Department.

title: Surgery for Browns'
description: CLEVELAND, May 21 (AP)Chip Glass, backup tight end for the Cleveland Browns, will undergo surgery tomorrow to correct a back problem, the football team said today.

title: THOROUGH INQUIRY IS PLEDGED BY COX
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Archibald Cox, named by the Attorney Generaldesignate, El: hot L. Richardson, as special prosecutor in the Watergate scandal, told the Senate Judiciary Committee today that he would pursue his investigation into the Oval Office of the White House if the trail led him there.

title: Monticello Appeals Superfecta Ruling
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., May 21With support of drivers competing at Monticello Raceway, Leon Glze. nberg, the track president, has appealed to the State Harness Commission to reinstate superfecta wagering at Monticello.

title: Indians Drive Out Medich And Trounce Yanks, l05
Vietnam Casualties Honored
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP)  The Senate adopted a resolution today dedicating Memorial Day next Monday as a special commemorative day for the 359,879 dead and wounded members of the armed forces whose loss and suffering were occasioned by the war in Vietnam.

title: Priorities for Africans
description: If the 41nation Organization of African Unity takes its own charter seriously at its tenthanniversary summit meeting in Addis Ababa this week it will give priority to two tasks above all others: relieving the famine that threatens millions of Africans in six countries bordering the Sahara, and halting the killing of. Africans by other Africans for ethnic and tribal reasons.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The United States Supreme Court declined to block a New Jersey court ruling under. which 11 members a Freehold, N. J., education association are scheduled be imprisoned next month for contempt of an antistrike order.

title: COURT BACKS BAN ON SCHOOL MERGER OF A CITY, SUBURBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 The Supreme Court affirmed today a decision that struck down as unconstitutional sweeping school desegregation plan for Richmond that would have merged white suburbs and the heavily black Virginia city into a single system.

title: POLITICAL CAUCUS TO RALLY BLACKS
description: Asserting that many middleincome blacks are alienated from the political process, a group of politically active blacks announced the formation yesterday of the Independent Black Political Coalition, which they said would attempt to organize this group of black New Yorkers into a political force.

title: A Flaming Feminist Lauds Court
description: GLOUCESTER, Mass.When Mrs. Sharron Frontiero, who describes herself as a flaming feminist, heard about the recent Supreme Court judgment that female military personnel were entitled to the same dependency benefits for their husbands as servicemen for their wives, she burst out with a joyous, Hot damn!

title: A Delayed Obituary
description: AMHERST, Mass.  When Emily Dickinson died here in May 1886, The New York Times made no mention of her death. It seems fitting this May that the omission be redressed with publication of an obituary of the shy and elusive person whom critic Mark Van Doren called the greatest woman poet. Miss Dickinson wrote in one poem, I had often thought/ how notelessI could die.

title: Surgery for Browns'
description: CLEVELAND, May 21 (AP)Chip Glass, backup tight end for the Cleveland Browns, will undergo surgery tomorrow to correct a back problem, the football team said today.

title: Vaughn Monroe, 62, Dies; Singer and Bandleader
Roundup: Stargell Helps Pirates Win
description: Willie Stargell, Pittsburgh's 6foot2inch, 215pound slugger, likes to hit home runs, but he also likes to win. Last night he did both as the Pirates downed the Philadelphia Phillies, 54.

title: CAMDEN JURORS CITE ROLE OF U.S.
description: CAMDEN, N. J., May 21Some jurors who yesterday acquitted 17 defendants in the Camden 28 draftrecorddestruction case said today that they had done so because the Government had gone too far in encouraging the destruction by the antiwar activists.

title: Advertising: A Friend of Clients
description: What I am is a salesman, basically, said John Gambling, 43yearold, $300,000ayear broadcaster, who broke through the $100,000 barrier when he was about 30.

title: Wilcox, Davison Lead in Open Trials
Two Medical Groups Say That Cuts in Federal Budget Are Threat to U.S. Health Goals
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Organizations representing medicine and psychiatry charged today that the Administration's budget policies threatened important national health goals.

title: Candidates'
description: Assemblyman Albert H. Biumenthal won the endorsement of the Citizens Union for the Democratic mayoral nomination yesterday, affording. him a tay of sunshine amid the rain that curtailed street campai ning by the four aspirants for the office. In the evening, they engaged in another of their facetoface debates, and again the confrontation was dominated by the controversial housing project in Forest Hills.

title: 38 Hurt in Queens L.I.R.R. Derailment
description: A Long Island Rail Road train derailed yesterday morning in Woodside, Queens, injuring 38 persons and stopping all traffic on the line into Pennsylvania Station for an hour and a half.

title: DR. MAX HERTZMAN
description: Dr. Max Hertzman, who retired last year as associate professor, of ,psychology at City College, where he founded the widely known clinical psychology program, died of a heart attack Wednesday at his home, 225 West 86th Street. He was 61 years old.

title: Swamp Fire Threat Ends
description: BONITA SPRINGS, Fla., May 21 (UPI)Officials of the state forestry division said yesterday that the Audubon Society's Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary was no longer being threatened by a fire that raged through 20 square miles of swampland last week,

title: Credit Policy's Impact Is Felt on Wide Front
description: Interest rates continued to surge along a broad front yesterday, with the opinion spreading among professionals. that no early stabilization of the bond and money markets was in sight.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE UPSTART By Piers Paul Read. 345 pages. Lippincott. $7.95.

title: Gold Up $6.50 to Record As Dollar Falls in Europe
description: PARIS, May 21  Renewed worries over the United States in light of the unfolding Watergate scandal pushed up the price of gold by $6.50 an ounce to a new closing high and knocked the dollar lower today in the'money centers of Europe.

title: Untimely VisitII
description: The glowing words Leonid I. Brezhnev used in Bonn yesterday to herald a new era of SovietWestern peace and cooperation were among the warmest any Kremlin leader has directed toward the West since World War II And though his nominal audience was the people of West Germany, the Soviet leader undoubtedly had the United States at least as much in mind.

title: 4 Democratic Candidates for Mayor Favor Strengthening Role of Neighborhoods
The Missing in Indochina: No Evidence Any Live
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 21 (AP)  There is no indication that any Americans listed as missing in action in Southeast Asia are still alive, the general in charge of locating them said today.

title: JUSTICES REBUFF CONSUMER ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, May 21The consumer movement was denied a potentially powerful weapon today when the Supreme Court let stand a decision denying states the authority to challenge on behalf of all their citizens pricefixing of inexpensive food items.

title: California Legislator Killed
description: ALAMEDA, Calif., May 21 (UPI)  Assemblyman Robert Crown, Democrat of Alameda, died early today of injuries suffered when he was Mt by a car while jogging. He was 51 years old.

title: Line TV of Hearings To Be Resumed Today
description: The Senate Watergate hearings resume this morning on Capitol Hill with live television coverage starting at 10 o'clock, Complete coverage is planned by Channels 2, 4, 7, 13 and 31. Live coverage of the bearings is also scheduled by radio stations WINS, WRVR, WNYC and WBAI.

title: Israel Soccer Victor
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 21 (UPI)  Israel overwhelmed Thailand, 60, today in a soccer World Cup preliminary tournament.

title: Has Success Caused Crisis in the Conservative Party?
description: The Conservative party never had any serious trouble quietly squelching its dissidents when, as a familysize, family like organization, it was losing elections.

title: White House Will Disclose Nixon Land Data on Friday
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP) The White House said today it would disclose on Friday details of President Nixon's land transactions in California and Florida.

title: 4 PANTHERS ADMIT GUILT IN SLAYING
description: The second trial of four Black Panthers charged with the 1971 murder of a member of a rival faction of the party ended abruptly in State Supreme Court in Queens yesterday when the defendants pleaded guilty to the reduced charge of attempted manslaughter in the second degree.

title: FOSS LEADS SALUTE TO ISRAEL IN SONG
description: The tribute to Israel's 25th anniversary devised by Lukas Foss and the Brooklyn Philharmonia Saturday night at the Brooklyn Academy of Music promised a good deal more than it delivered. Mr. Foss'sidea to present a program of music written to the Psalmswas a good one, but the pieces he selected were only of fitful interest and the performances left a lot to the imagination.

title: Mitchell, Stans and Sears Deny Guilt On Charges of Intervention for Vesco
description: Two former Cabinet officers and a prominent New Jersey Republican stood before Federal Judge John M. Cannella tinder tight security here yesterday and pleaded not guilty to a 46page Federal grand jury indictment charging them with conspiracy to defraud the United States and obstruct justice.

title: Antiwar Veterans Group Urges That Data on It Be Made Public
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 The Vietnam Veterans Against the War called on the Internal Security Division of the Justice Department today to make public any information it had gathered on the antiwar organization.

title: TV: A New Look for the Emmy Show
description: As awards shows goand most of them should definitely gothe Emmys, devised by the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences, have not had an easy time of it in their 25 years. The annual affair on television has generally been fascinating only for its aspects of unmitigated entertainment disaster.

title: Parsons School Honors Lithographers'
description: Edward Swayduck, whose laborunion magazine, Lithopinion, has paid artists more than $1million for commissioned works, received the Parsons. School of Design award last night as a moving force in fostering the new technology that has revolutionized graphics.

title: 20 Die in Pakistani Storm
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan, May 21 (Reuters)Twenty persons, including 12 childreh, were reported killed and over 100 in:jured: after winds of 80 miles an lfowr swept this city and adjoining areas yesterday.

title: Text of the Soviet Party Leader's Television Speech to the West German People
description: My arrival here at the invitation of Federal Chancel lor Willy Brandt and our talks  all this in itself indicates that relations between our countries are developing successfully.

title: N.C.A.A. District 1 Diamonds Picked for Baseball Playoffs
description: BOSTON, May 21 (AP)Fenway Park and Soldier's Field at Harvard will be the playing sites this wekend of the National Collegiate District 1 baseball tournament.

title: Report Shows Rise In Short Interest Of 553,954. Shares
Bridge: Big Victory Proves Elusive For U.S. Team in World Tilt
Race Track Unions Seek To Amend New State Law
description: Leaders of 57 racetrack labor unions indicated yesterday they would shut down horse racing in New York tomorrow unless the Legislature amended certain sections of the state's new racing and betting bill. Job security is the key issue.

title: New A.E.C. Chairman Moves Against Dominance of Congressional Joint Panel
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 Dixy Lee Ray, the new chair man of the Atomic Energy Commission, has won her first big fight with the Congressional Joint Committee on Atomic Energy. In the process she may have achieved something her male predecessors never could establishing the commission's independence from the domineering Congressional committee.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: A recently published booklet entitled Fishing Western Long Island Sound will be of great help to those who are sometimes confused on how to find and catch the many species of food and game fish available in this rich estuary.

title: The Adirondacks Plan
description: Governor Rockefeller has done a service not only New Yorkers but to the nation as a whole in his determined and successful effort to save the Adirondacks from the blight of unrestrained development.

title: Dow Drops 8.66 as 20.69 Million Volume Is Hit
Ambrose to Quit as Nixon Adviser and Drug Enforcement Chief
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Myles J. Ambrose, the top Federal antinarcotics law enforcement officer who, while Customs Commissioner, visited a Texas rancherbanker subsequently indicted in an alleged smuggling conspiracy, plans to leave Government service.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Weekly Sale
COAST PROTECTION IS VOTED IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, May 21  The State Senate reversed itself today and approved a compromise environmentalprotection plan fbr New Jersey's undeveloped coastline and its offshore waters. 1

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The state police announced in Albany that they had made 39,140 arrests for other than traffic violations in 1972, an increase of 11.8 per cent over the 35,008 recorded in 1971. Traffic violations totaled 464,677 in 1972, up 9.4 per cent from the 424,589 of the preceding year.

title: Easco Subsidiary Receives $28Million NASA Contract
description: The Easco Corporation announced yesterday that its J, E. Greiner Company subsidiairy received a $28million contract from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and a $30million award from the Civil Aeronautic Administration of the Republic of Panama.

title: Joslyn Manufacturing Unit Planning a Price Increase
description: The Joslyn Manufacturing & Supply Company said yesterday that its Joslyn Stainless Steels division would raise prices on a series of stainless steel forging billets by a range of 7.3 per cent to 14.8 per cent, beginning with shipments June 18.

title: MAN FOUND HANGED IN QUEENS JAIL CELL
description: A 22yearold inmate was found hanged yesterday in his cell in the Queens House of Detention, where he had been working as a porter while serving a oneyear sentence.

title: Black Panthers and the Future
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 21Officially, Bobby G. Seale lost by a landslide last week in hi bid to win election as Mayo of Oakland. But as far as the Black Panther party is concerned, he won a significant victory.

title: Confronting the Truth
description: Government lawyers and some laymen are worried that the Senate Watergate hearings are inhibiting active prosecution and may even preclude a fair trial for some of the key conspirators. To this criticism, Senator Ervin said Sunday: I think it is much more important for the American people to knowand Congress to find outwhat happened, than to send one or two people to jail.

title: HIGH OF $10.20 HIT BY MAY SOYBEANS
CAMDEN JURORS CITE ROLE OF U.S.
description: CAMDEN, May 21Somejurors who yesterday acquitted 17 defendants in the Cami den 28 draftrecorddestrut tion case said today that they had done so because the Government had gone too far in encouraging the destruction by the antiwar activists.

title: 12 OldTime Players Gain Football Hall
description: Twelve former football play ers who started their college careers before 1920 were named yesterday to the Pioneer Player category of the National Football Foundation's college football hall of fame.

title: C.I.A. MEMO SAID TO QUOTE: HALDEMAN ON NIXON WISHTO HALT F.B.I. FUND STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, May 21H. R. Haldeman, the former White House chiefof staff, reportedly told an official of the Central Intelligence Agency that it is the President's wish that the C.I.A. attempt to halt an investigation into one aspect of the Watergate case.

title: Dean Said to Have Ordered Watergate Defense Aid
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 John W. Dean 3d, the former White House counsel, ordered Herbert W. Kalmbach, President Nixon's personal lawyer, to begin raising money for the five men arrested in the Watergate bugging last June 17, sources said tonight.

title: Rutgers Promotes Dr. Burks
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 21 (AP)Dr. Ardath W. Burks, director of international programs for Rutgers University, has been named aQqnciate vice president for academic affairs. Dr. Burks, 58 years old, of Bound Brook, will be involved in policy and program development relating to academic affair&

title: Iceland Accuses the British of Invasion
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, May 21 (Reuters)The Government today accused Britain of having invaded the Icelandic fishing area and announced that it, was recalling its ambassador from London for consultations.

title: Theater
description: In the Henry Street Settlement production of Ron Milner's What the Wine Sellers Buy at the new Federal Theater, the play's flaws as well as its considerable virtues are intact.

title: Donald Perkins, 61,an Executive Of Cowles Publications, Is Dead
description: Donald Perkins, who retired in 1971 as executive vice president for sales of Cowles Communications, died yesterday it New York Hospital. He was. 61 years old and lived at 201 East 62d Street.,

title: HalfPrice Tickets Will Go on Sale At Times Sq. Unit
description: The establishment of the Times Square Theater Center, a nonprofit ticket information and sales facility that will market unsold tickets at half price on a day of performance only policy at no charge to producers or theater owners, was announced yesterday. There will be a nominal service charge.

title: New Jersey Girl Signs Athletic Grant at Miami
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., May 21  Lynn Genesko, a 17yearold New Jersey girl, today was awarded an athletic scholarship by the University of Miami. It is believed to be the first, grantinaid given to a female by a major university in the United States.

title: Europe Cool to U. S. Design for New Ties
description: LONDON, May 2IA month after Henry A. Kissinger offered the Nixon Administration's ideas for developing new transAtlantic relations, European officials are reacting with a mixture of public politenes private irritation and concern, and some open and serious reservations.

title: Equity Financing
description: A nonregistered secondary distribution of 40,000 shares of Suburban Propane Gas Corp. at $21 a share was oversubscribed yesterday, Goldman Sachs reported. The company's shares closed at 21 down  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Business Briefs
description: MOSCOW, May 21David Rockefeller, the chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, conferred today with Premier Alexei N. Kosygin and said later that Soviet leaders seemed confident President Nixon would succeed in obtaining tariff and credit benefits for the Soviet Union.

title: Assembly Votes Bill to Curb Decline of Areas in City
description: ALBANY, May 21The Assembly today approved a bill creating a Rehabilitation Mort gage Insurance. Corporation that would insure parts of private mortgage loanson housing to help prevent the continued decline of certain neighborhoods in New York City.

title: Yoko Ono's Talent Joins Rock Show To Benefit WBAI
description: Sunday's WBAI benefit concert at Town Hall was by no means your normal rock concert. Yoko Ono was headlining. She brought on a director's chair entirely covered with white bag and said That's John there, in the bag. The reference was to her husband John Lennon  the most public John in the world, added Mrs. Lennon.

title: ExOfficial in Newark Guilty in a Heroin Case
description: NEWARK, May 21 (UPI)A former official. of the Newark Model Cities program pleaded guilty today to having conspired to distribute 68 grams of heroin with a street value of about $20,000.

title: 6 ExAides of Atlantic City Are Given Prison Terms
description: CAMDEN, May 21Saying that the mood of the country today will not accept inproper or immoral conduct by public officials, a Federal judge sentenced six former high officials of Atlantic City to prison terms ranging from two to six years today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BOSTON, May 21 (AP)  Boston University will be eligible for the Yankee Conference football title begining this season, Adolph W. Sanborski, the commissioner of the conference, announced today. Boston U., which gave up its independent status to join the Conference in 1971, was scheduled to become an official title contender in 1974, when it would play all six other conference meinbers.

title: Reserve Backs Purchase of Shoppers Charge
description: The Federal Reserve Board yesterday aproved the purchase of the Shoppers Charge Service by the American Fletcher Corporation from the Firstmark Corporation, formerly known as, the CIC Corporation.

title: Gunmen Shooting From Autos Wound 3 Men on Belfast Street
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 21 (UPI)Gunmen in cars wounded three men in Belfast today and a bomb blasted country police station.

title: 4 Black Panthers Plead Guilty To a Lesser Charge in Slaying
description: The second trial of four Black Panthers charged with the 1971 murder of a member of a rival faction of the party ended abruptly in State Supreme Court in Queens yesterday when the defendants pleaded guilty to the reduced charge of attempted manslaughter in the second degree.

title: Australia Asks Tribunal. To Halt French ATests
description: THE HAGUE, May 21 (UPI) Australia, asserting that all her inhabitants, including unborn babies, had radioactive particles in their bodies, today asked the International Court of Justice to stop France temporarily frorn atmospheric tests in the South Pacific.

title: Detective Pleads Guilty To Taking $4,000 Bribe
description: A New York detective has pleaded guilty in Federal Court here to a charge of accepting a $4,000 bribe while a member of the joint Federal, state and city narcotics task force.

title: Flames Fan Yorkville's Anger Over Methadone Clinic
description: A fouralarm fire in Yorkville early yesterday forced a methadone clinic to shift operations to a trailer in 84th Street, fanning resentment in a neighborhood already hostile to the very existence of the clinic.

title: Warning Against Blaming C.I.A. Is Laid to McCord
description: WASHINGTON, May 21James W. McCord Jr. sent John J. Caulfield, a former White House aide, an unsigned letter shortly before the Watergate trial warning that if the Nixon Administration persisted in an attempt to depict the bugging operations as inspired by the Central Intelligence Agency, he. would bring the house down, sources close to the case said today.

title: Aussies Win 3d Soling Race But Dutch Hold Series Lead
description: QUIBERON, France, May 21 (AP)An Australian boat captained by J. Bertram won the third race today in the Soling Class world sailing championships, but the Dutch held the overall lead,

title: STOCK EXCHANGES ACT TO CUT COSTS
description: The New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange disclosed yesterday that they are taking steps to trim operating costs as a result of reduced trading volume this year.

title: HOUSE PANEL HEARS COOK, EXS.E.C. HEAD
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP)  G. Bradford Cook, who recently quit as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission in the Robert L. Vesco case,, testified secretly today for two and a half hours before a Congressional subcommittee.

title: Gold Up $6.50 to Record As Dollar Falls in Europe
description: PARIS, May 21  Renewed worries over the United States in light of the unfolding Watergate scandal pushed up the price of gold by $6.50 an ounce to a new closing high and knocked the &liar lower today in the money centers of Europe. Foreign exchange dealers here and in Zurich said the selling of dollars originated this time from New York, from American banks and corporations.

title: 2 U.S. Companies Sign Accords to Seek Oil in Egypt
description: CAIRO, May 21Two major American oil companies have signed agreements with Egypt committing them to spend a total of $73million on offshore explorations in the Mediterranean north of the Nile. Delta.

title: BREZHNEV URGES PEACE AND TRUST AS BONN TRIP ENDS
description: BONN, May 21Chancellor Willy Brandt and Leonid I. Brezhnev ended four days of talks here today with a joint declaration of economic and cultural cooperation and a moving television speech by Mr. Brezhnev calling for a new continent of Europe, a continent of peace, trust and cooperation.

title: COURT BACKS BAN ON SCHOOL MERGER OF A CITY, SUBURBS
Europe Is Cool to U.S. Plan for New Ties
description: LONDON, May 21A month after Henry A. Kissinger offered the Nixon Administration's ideas for developing new transAtlantic relations, European officials are reacting with a mixture of public politeness, private irritation and concern, and some open and serious reservations.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL Meets at 10:30 A.M. on Rhodesian sanctions report.

title: Testing of SAC Missiles Is Complicated Process
description: VANDENBERG AIR FORCE BASE, Calif.At frequent intervals Gen. John C. Meyer, commander in chief of the Strategic Air Command, abandons the mathematical precision of his calling and invokes Lady Luck.

title: 38 Hurt in Queens L.I.R.R. Derailment
description: A Long Island Rail Road train derailed yesterday morning in Woodside, Queens, injuring 38 persons and stopping all traffic on the line into Pennsylvania Station for an hour and a half.

title: U.S. Currency Plan Outlined
description: WASHINGTON, May 21The Treasury, the Federal Reserve Board and a key Congressional subcommittee disclosed agreement today on new system of morefrequent reporting on interventions by the Government in the foreignexchange markets.

title: Rain Gives Mets Another Day Off
description: For the second day in a row, the Mets were rained out of their scheduled National League game at Shea Stadium last night.

title: A Surfeit of Fervor
description: The acquittal of most of the Camden 28 and the likely dismissal of charges against the rest is an interesting and not altogether reassuring sign of an age marked by moral and patriotic fervor.

title: People in Sports: A Third Degree
description: Bill Bradley, who has Bachelor of Arts degree in history from Princeton and a Master of Arts in Philosophy, Politics and Economics from Worcester College in Oxford, England, will receive an honorary doctor of humane letters degree Sunday at the St. Peter's College (N. J.) commencement. The Knick forward, a Rhodes scholar, also will be the commencement speaker. All that and two National Basketball Association championships.

title: NEW ORDERS DROP IN DURABLE GOODS
2 UNIONS OFFER RAILWAY PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Two major railway unions add ed conflicting proposals today to a growing list of plans for resolving the Northeastern rail crisis.

title: For a Gifted Design Group: A Party to Show What It's Doing
description: An 18foot yellow and red giraffe upstaged the two giant Elie Nadelman sculptures last night in the promenade of the New York State Theater. And that's exactly what the Design Works of Bedford Stuyvesant, Inc., and West Point Pepperell, Inc., hoped would happen when they placed the longnecked beast, a plywood and plastic wonder swathed in sheet and coverlet in the center of the indoor forum.

title: Connecticut Town Discovers Its Nuclear Power Plant Is a Mixed Blessing
description: WATERFORD, Conn., May 21  When Northeast Utilities began construction of its first nuclear power plant here in 1966, it seemed as if this rural suburb of New London had found a solution to the problems plaguing suburban communities nationwide.

title: Britain to Cut Spending In Bid to Curb Economy
description: LONDON, May 21The Govlernment announced today cuts in public spending of about $1.5billion in a move to contaM the rapid expansion of Britain's economy.

title: Hurok Artists Hail Impresario a Met
description: When the Last Trumpet blows, don't be surprised to see a short man in a large slouch hat sidle up to the musician and sign him to an exclusive contract. The billing, of course, would have to read S. Hurok Presents the Angel Gabriel, but that still puts the celestial trumpeter right up there with Pavlova, Elman, Chaliapin, Artur Rubinstein, Margot Fonteyn and Martha Graham. Not to mention hundreds of others of comparable magnitude who have been on Solomon Hurok's managerial rosters since the Ukrainianborn impresario went into business in 1913.

title: Equity Postpones Meeting
description: The annual meeting of Equity Funding Corporation of America, scheduled for today, will not be held, a spokesman for the company said yeastday. The company is operating under Chapter X of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: 5 ExKlansmen Convicted in School Bus Bomb Plot
description: DETROIT, May 21Five formore members of the Ku Klux Klan were convicted in United States District Court here today of plotting to bomb school buses in nearby Pontiac during the height of a busing controversy there nearly two years ago.

title: Marshal Ivan S. Konev, War Hero Dies
description: MOSCOW, May 21 (AP) Marshal Ivan S. Konev, a celebrated World War II commander, has died, the official press agency Tass reported today. He was 75 years old.

title: 6 ExAides of Atlantic City Are Given Prison Terms
description: CAMDEN, May 21Saying that the mood of the country today will not accept improper or immoral conduct by public officials, a Federal judge sentenced six former high officials of Atlantic City to prison terms ranging from two to six years today.

title: Kelley, a Former Police Official, Named Commissioner in Suffolk
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., May 21 Eugene Kelley, a lawyer and former deputy police commissioner, was designated today as the Police Commissioner of Suffolk County, replacing John L. Barry, who had held the post for the last 11 years.

title: BREZINEV URGES PEACE AND TRUST AS BONN TRIP ENDS
description: BONN, May 21Chancellor Willy Brandt and Leonid I. Brezhnev ended four days of talks here today with a joint declaration of economic and cultural cooperation and a moving television speech by Mr. Brezhnev calling for a new continent of Europe, a continent of peace, trust and cooperation.

title: STUDY LINKS CANCER TO ARTIFICIAL SUGAR
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (AP)  A new Federal report today lent support to the theory that there is a link between cancer and saccharin, the only artifical sweetener remaining on the market since cyclamates were banned.

title: Rockwell Acquires Rimoldi
description: The Rockwell International Corporation announced yesterday it had completed the purchase of a 100 per cent interest in Virginio Rimoldi & Co., Milan, Italy.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: POLE STARS It is all because of Copernicus, the Polish scientist, that the Hayden Planetarium, 81st Street and Central Park West (8731300), is giving its first purely musical evening, black zie at that.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, May 21The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Governor Defends Intervention in Contract Bidding
description: ALBANY, May 21Governor Rockefeller asserted today that it was utterly unwarranted to consider recent reports of meetings between state officials and contract competitors weakening of his insistence on a tight ship administration.

title: Earnings of Sears Climb 23.1% on 14.3% Sales Rise
WILLIAM H. LAUTZ
description: William H. Lautz, for 30 gears an antiques dealer here specializing in 18thcentury porcelain, died of a heart attack yesterday in the lobby of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel. He was 82 years old and lived at 106 East 61st Street.

title: Steel Industry Assailed on Pollution
description: The steel industry was sharply attacked here yesterday for allegedly not having done enough to control pollution of the environment.

title: Stocks and Bonds Fall
description: Stock and bond prices fell sharply yesterday as Wall Street continued to reel under the combined impact of the Watergate scandal, tightening credit conditions and inflationary fears. The DowJones industrial average dropped 8.66 points to 886.51. Volume on the New York Stock Exchenge was a brisk 20.69 mil,lion shares. Details, Page 53.

title: Head of Safety Panel Concedes White House Pressure on Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Tne chairman of the National Transportation Safety Board, which WaS established as an independent agency, acknowledged today that the White House had influenced the appointment of key staff personnel.

title: Impressive Roster of Talent Left Its Mark on Culture
description: S. Hurok presentsit hasbecome the Good Housekeeping Seal of Approval of the cultural set. Many other impresarios and entrepreneurs have offeredbut only Hurok has presented. Mr. Hurok at 85 seems the same as ever. He is planning for the years ahead, and the only time he has ever looked at a calendaris to fix a booking. He is satisfyingly the arche typal impresariohe even carriesa silvertipped cane, and he still wears, as rakishly as ever, a broadbrimmed fedora.

title: Con Ed's Chief Says Lag in PerShare Earnings Must Be Reversed
description: Charles F. Luce, chairman and chief executive officer of the Consolidated Edison Company of New York, Inc., said at the company's annual meeting yesterday that the most disappointing aspect of the last five years of his stewardship has been the lag in earnings for our commonstock holders.

title: WALDHEIM ISSUES MIDEAST REVIEW
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 21  Secretary General Waldhehn, summing up United Nations efforts to achieve a stable peace in the Middle East, today called the problem an extremely complex and difficult one, but said that a new effort to find a way to a settlement in the Middle East need not be futile.

title: 18 White House Fellows Selected; Enthusiasm Undimmed by Watergate
AMEX SLIDE SETS A 3YEAR RECORD
Sham to Face Secretariat Again in Belmont Stakes
Man Who Says He Made Call To McCord Saw Investigators
description: HADLEY, N. Y., May 21 (UPI) A former New York City policeman who says he was the anonymous caller who offered James W. McCord Jr. executive clemency said today that he had spoken with investigators for the Senate committee investigating the affair.

title: N.C.A.A. Retreats, Reinstating Samara of Penn
description: Fred Samara, the University of Pennsylvania decathlon athlete who was suspended last Thursday for having competed in a United StatesSoviet Union meet, was declared eligible for intercollegiate sports yesterday by the National Collegiate Athletic Association. The senior may now compete in the two remaining major track meets of the college season.

title: Gasoline Sales to Be Cut
description: MILWAUKEE, May 21 (UPI) The Clark Oil and Refining Corporation announced today plans to cut back gasoline sales at its service stations by approximately10 per cent of current sales effective June 1.

title: ALICE DIXON BOND
description: HANOVER, N. H., May 21Ars. Alice Dixon Bond, literary editor of The Boston Herald from 1940 to 1964, died here yesterday. She was 81 years old.

title: NEW HOUSING DUE FOR NASSAU JAIL
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 21New housing units for inmates involved in the Nassau County Jail's workrelease program will be built in an effort to smooth their return to society, County Executive. Ralph G. Caso said today.

title: In a Tel Aviv quarter Called Hope, the Residents Have Little
description: TEL AVIV, May 21 There is something poignantly inappropriate about the name of the sprawling, congested quarter of Tel Aviv known as Hatikva. Its name, in Hebrew, means The Hope  the one ingredient conspicuously missing from the lives of many of the section's people.

title: Mother of Dead Woman Accuses SoninLaw in Florida Drowning
description: NEWARK, May 21 (UPI)The mother of Linda Rockfeld, the heiress who died in a boating incident in Florida last December, filed a complaint today saying that Mrs. Rockfeld's husband had caused her wrongful death.

title: WHITE HOUSE TIED TO PRICE INCREASE
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 A top official of the dairy farm groups that contributed more than $400,000 to President Nixon's reelection campaign has testified that he believes the] White Housenot Government milk pricing expertsmade disputed decision to raise the price of milk. The donation was made immediately after the Agriculture Department raised the federally regulated price.

title: Soviet Wrestlers Face U.S. In Wisconsin Meet Tomorrow
description: MADISON, Wis., May 21 (UPI)  Three Olympic champions pions head the Soviet Union wrestling team which will meet a United States team here Wednesday.

title: 14 FOOD SPOTS FAIL 2D CITY INSPECTION
Japan Sees a May Deficit on U.S. Trade
description: TOKYO, May 21  Finance Minister Kiichi Aichi predicted today that Japan this month would run its first monthly deficit in trade with the United States since February, 1971.

title: He Stole No Money
description: Former Attorney General John N. Mitchell has joined the growing ranks of those who insist that they are being made the scapegoats for other people's wrongdoing in the Watergate scandal. Reaffirming his clear conscience, Mr. Mitchell said: I've never stolen any money. The only thing I did was to try to get the President reelected. I never did anything mentally or morally wrong.

title: Kissinger Reports Some Gains In Paris Negotiations on Truce
description: PARIS, May 21 (AP)American and North Vietnamese negotiators have made some progress in their talks on ways to enforce the shaky Vietnam peace agreement, Henry A. Kissinger said today.

title: After 272 Years, an Opera Is Revived
description: CINCINNATI, May 21Thirdprize winners in composition competitions seldom find much cause for rejoicing, but henceforth they may gain solace from the case of Daniel Purcell. This younger brother of Henry, the famous Purcell, set William Congreve's The Judgment of Paris to music in 1699 in the hope of winning a prize of 200 guineas. Purcell came in third (following John Weldon and John Eccles), saw his opera performed Once in 1701 in a program presenting all the winning works, and that was that. Or so he must have thought.

title: Warning Against Blaming C.I.A. Is Laid to McCord
description: WASHINGTON, May 21  James W. McCord Jr. sent John J. Caulfield, a former White House aide, an unsigned letter shortly before the Watergate trial warning that if the Nixon Administration per sisted in an attempt to depict the bugging operations as inspired by the Central Intelligence Agency, he would bring the house down, sources close to the case said today.

title: Nixon and Haig on Cruise
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 (UPI) iPresident Nixon, accompanied by the White House chief of staff, Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., took a dinnerhour cruise aboard his yacht Sequoia on. the Potomac River today. The a President spent most of the day; in his office in the Executive Office Building next door to the White House. A spokesman said that he had met frequently with staff members.

title: Kissinger Will Not Quit, White House Declares
description: WASHINGTON, May. 21 (UPI)Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's foreign affairs adviser, has no intention of quitting his post, the White House said today.

title: Loeb Awards Won by Men At A.P. and 2 Magazines
description: The annual G. M. Loeb awards for business and financial writing were announced yesterday by the University of Connecticut.

title: Hunter Honors 2 Wrestlers
description: Phil Rosenthal and Hector Negron, of the Hunter wrestling team, were recipients of the Golden Hawk Award at the College's fifth annual athletic awards dinner last night. The award is presented to the senior who combines a high degree of academic and athletic excellence.

title: Chess: Ashes of Defeat Can Make The Soil of Invention Fertile
2 Who Wired Door Of Jail Cell Indicted On Assault Charge
description: MORRISTOWN, May 21Two Morris County jail inmates were accused today of removing the insulation from an extension cord on a television set, placing the wire around a jail door and plugging in the wire when a guard tried to open the door.

title: Notes on People
description: President Nicolae Ceausescu of Rumania arrived in Rome fUr a weeklong visit that is expected to include an audience with Pope Paul VI and a trip to the tiny Republic of San Marino. Mr. Ceausescu will be the third Commumist head of state to visit the Pope. President Nikolai V. Podgorny of the Soviet Union visited the Pontiff in 1967, and President Tito of Yugoslavia had an audience in 1971. What Rumania and San Marino seem to have in common, diplomatically, is recently improved relations with China.

title: Talking Out Their Problems in a Van
description: Betsy, 16 years old, had problems, but no one to tell them to. Her mother had been bedridden for two years, distraught and depressed by the death of her husband, leaving Betsy to care for a younger brother and sister.

title: Arthur Daley
description: After many years in a windowless office in ground floor quarters beneath Madison Square Garden, Harry Markson finally has a room with a view. He nowlooks out on the city from the 18th floor of a tower in the Garden complex, but he had to retire as president of the Garden's boxing subsidiary corporation and. assume the role of consultant in order to rate the move upstairs. However, Harry was always at a far higher level than the seamy sport that has been a vital and vibrant part of his life for 40 years. The marvel of it all is that he has never been soiled by it. In fact, some of his own honesty, integrity and probity have rubbed off on the racket and these qualities have been transmitted in their entirety to the Garden's boxing operation, long regarded as a citadel of respectability. It's almost two months since Harry retired formally, sufficient time for him to get the feel of his new situation.

title: CANADIAN OIL STOCKS LEAD A PRICE SLUMP
description: TORONTO, May 22  Most stocks on the Toronto Stock Exchange plunged today in the face of the continuing United States dollar crisis and bad news in New York and Toronto about the future of Canada's oil industry.

title: Claire Bloom's Doll's House on Film
People Movers on Aerial Loop Proposed for Lower Manhattan
description: Transportation officials here have been given a longawaited peoplemover report that recommends an elevated loop around Lower Manhattan and conversion of 48th and 49th Streets for use by buses and pedestrians only.

title: Cambodian Units and U.S. Jtets Fight to Retake Key Road Link
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 22 (UPI)Government forces with strong United States air support fought today to regain control of a sixmile stretch of Route 4 linking Phnom Penh with the seaport of Kompong Som, 134 miles to the southwest.

title: Krogh Meeting Is at Issue
Berman Goes on Bench
description: Frederic S. Berman, a former member of the Lindsay administration, was sworn in yesterday, by Mayor Lindsay to an interim term on the criminal Court bench. A former State Senator Mr. Rerman was Commissioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance from 1966 to 1969. He will serve on the bench until Dec. 31. The post pays $33,525 a year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Lamhut Unfurls Outdoor Dance Banner
description: As her contribution to the City Center's free outdoor dance festival, the choreographer and dancer Phyllis Lamhut is presenting a bit of nonnostalgia and social comment entitled O.T.D. (OffTrack Dancing). The piece was performed outside the Seagram Building at noontime yesterday in the series by four dance companies that will continue through next Wednesday in all the boroughs.

title: STATE OUSTS AIDE OVER PEROT PLAN
description: ALBANY, May 22The State Commissioner of Social Services said today that he had removed a consultant working on computerization competition last April after the consultant showed a bias against the plan of one of the competitors, H. Ross Perot.

title: McCord Gives a Lesson On How to Tap a Phone
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 The Senate committee investigating the Watergate affair and a nationwide television audience were shown how to wiretap a telephone today by one of the most highly publicized wiretappers in the nation, James W. McCord Jr.

title: Gross, Cahill Leader in 69, Cited by U. S. in T ax Fraud
STATE POVERTY AID DUE TO BE CUT 50%; U.S. Plans poop() Grant Instead of $650,000
description: TRENTON, May 22  New Jersey's grant of $650,000 in Federal operating antipoverty funds will be cut to $300:000 for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1974, according to a memorandum made public today.

title: 3 Prosecutors Nearly Quit
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The three Federal prosecutors in the Watergate affair were on the verge of resigning from the case today, Justice Department sources said. They delayed their decision until a meeting tomorrow  their first  with Archibald Cox, the former Solicitor General who has been designated special prosecutor to supervise the case.

title: C. B. S. Wins Major 1972 Emmys for News
People Movers on Aerial Loop Proposed for Lower Manhattan
description: Transportation officials here have been given a longawaited peoplemover report that recommends an elevated loop around Lower Manhattan and conversion of 48th and 49th Streets for use by buses and pedestrians only.

title: AMATEUR SPORTS PROMISED FUNDS BY SENATOR LONG
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 A promise to help commit as much as $10million in Federal funds to amateur sports programs in the United States, ineluding the Olympics, was the highlight of the opening of Senate hearings today on four proposed sports bills. The promise was made before a subcommittee of the Senate's Commerce Committee by Senator Russell Long, Democrat of Louisiana.

title: Roundup: Speier Helps Giants Move Into First
description: The new San Francisco batting order prescribed by Charlie Fox, the Giants manager on national TV Monday night may be just what the doctor ordered. It has done wonders for Chris Speier, who was the batting star for the second night in a row as the Giants defeated Atlanta, 73 last night and took over first place in the National League West.

title: Hart Collects 4 Hits, Including 3Run Homer
Man Who Killed 5 Seemed Different, His Father Asserts
description: MEMPHIS, May 22 (AP)A gunman who killed five persons in a shooting spree never would take much pushing around, his father said today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BOSTON, May 22 (AP)The Boston. Bruins of the National Hockey League obtained a goalie, Gilles Gilbert, today in a trade with the Minnesota North Stars for center, Fred Stanfield.

title: Anticrime Seminar Set
description: Columbia University and the New York State Commerce Department will conduct a Crime Prevention Seminar for Upper West Side merchants and residents at 7 P.M. tomorrow in the university's School of International Affairs, 118th Street and Amsterdam Avenue. The seminar will deal with crime insurance available through the Federal Government and crimeprevention devices.

title: VACCINE TO FIGHT A CATTLE DISEASE
description: A University of Illinois scientist announced yesterday the development of a vaccine against a costly cattle disease that has seriously limited expansion of the cattle industry in semitropical and tropical regions.

title: Pusey to Train 20 Horses For S. Dancer at Yonkers
description: YONKERS, May 22Maurice Pusey, former head trainer for the Herve Filion stable in New York, will serve in the same capacity for Stanley Dancer when harness racing resumes at Yonkers Raceway Friday night.

title: Grand Central May Shut In Early Morning Hours
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority and the Penn Central said yesterday that they had discussed the possibility of closing Grand Central Terminal in the early morning hours, They emphasized that the proposal, which would eliminate some trains, had not passed the discussion stage,

title: E.E.C. Agrees on Need For Common Oil Policy
description: BRUSSELS, May 22 (AP)Common Market governments agreed today on the need to work with the United States, Japan and other industrialized countries to assure supplies of oil and gas.

title: WALTERS UNCERTAIN OF HALDEMAN QUOTE
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) Lieut. Gen. Vernon A. Walters, deputy director of the Central Intelligence Agency, was reported today as saying that he was not certain he was told it is the President's wish that the C.I.A. block a part of the Watergate investigation.

title: BRONX CAFE FOES DENY ANY RACISM
description: Angry residents of apartment houses in the vicinity of the Concourse Plaza Hotel in the South Bronx denied heatedly last night that their campaign to prevent a discotheque in the hotel from reopening stemmed from racist motives.

title: Clark Doubts Nixon's BreakIn Remark
description: Ramsey Clark, the former Attorney General, said last night that he did not know of any national security program,stitute under which breaking and entering for searches or photographing documents was authorized by the Justice Department during the Kennedy and Johnson Administrations, The Associated Press reported.

title: SULLIVAN LEAVES PARIS FOR SAIGON
description: PARIS, May 22As AmericanNorth Vietnamese talks here appeared to be nearing an end, William H. Sullivan, Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asia and Pacific Affairs, left by air for Saigon tonight.

title: Books Today
description: A Childhood for Every Child: The Politics of Parenthood, by Mark Gerzon (Outerbridge & Larzard: Dutton, $7.95).

title: Watergate on TV Today
description: The Senate Watergate hearings will be covered live again at 10 A.M. today by all three major commercial networksthe American Broadcasting Company, the Columbia Broadcasting System and the National Broadcasting CompanyThe Public Broadcasting System will continue to provide a tape of the day's hearing to its stations starting at 8 P.M.

title: AUCTION OF COINS CANCELED BY MET
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art has canceled ,plans for a controversial auction sale of 6,000 coins in Zurich, Switzerland, in September. The coins, which has been on loan from the Metropolitan to the American Numismatic Society from 1917 until last year, will be purchased by the society for $150,000.

title: Blazers Shift to Vancouver, Completing $1.9Million Deal
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, May 22 (AP)Jim Pattison, a Vancouver businessman, announced today that he had completed the purchase of the franchise and player contracts of the Philadelphia Blazers of the World Hockey Association.

title: Nixon to Greet P.O.W.'s
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) President Nixon will address more than 500 returned Vietnam war prisoners at the State Department Thursday afternoon before a White House dinner in their honor that night. The White House said today that Mr. Nixon would welcome the former P.O.W.'s in the main auditorium of the State Department at 2:30 P.M. and then greet each man in a receiving line.

title: The Not 1 Baltimore Shares Obie Award With River Niger
description: Lanford Wilson's The Hot Baltimore and Joseph A. Walker's The River Niger shared top honors as best play of the year at the 197273 Obie Awards ceremony Monday night. The Obies are given annually by The Village Voice for work off Broadway and off Off Broadway. Mr. Wilson and Mr. Walker each received a prize of $250.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CITY LINE Paolo Soled is a city planner yet to be realized. He is a radical architect who believes that the place for people to live is in cities, but in cities such as you never saw. The cities he designs at his Cosanti Foundation out in Arizona, are huge, self contained fabricated units, some of them designed for underground or undersea sitting. He is an environmentalist who would keep these large communities in the midst of natural areas.

title: Coal Cars Haul Grain to Ease Glut
description: The glut of grain tied up in railroad grain hopper cars and boxcars at Gulf ports waiting for elevator and ship space has caused a diversion of some 30 million bushels to surplus coal hopper cars. The grain is being moved over Chesapeake & Ohio and Baltimore & Ohio tracks to Newport News, Va., for shipment to South American and Black Sea ports.

title: Bridge: Italy and the Aces Will Vie For the World Team Title
description: GUARUM, Brazil, May 22 The world team championto be played here Thursday and Friday will be between Italy and the Aces, giving the Americans a chance to revenge themselves for their defeat a year ago in the final of the World Team Olympiad in Miami Beach, Fla.

title: Amin Seizes More Concerns
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, May 22 (Agence FrancePresse)President Idi Amin in a surprise move today announced the takeover of all remaining British concerns in Uganda.

title: BorgWarner Closes Unit
description: The BorgWarner Corporation said yesterday that its plumbing products division would cease the manufacture of castiron plumbing fixtures at its plant in Mansfield, Ohio, effective Sept. 1. The move will affect about 300 employes.

title: Watergate Halts Nixon Library Plan
description: LOS ANGELES, May 22With a majority of its executive board of trustees directly implicated in the Watergate investigations, the Richard M. Nixon Foundation has put aside for the time being its plans to build a library and museum as a monument to the President.

title: Suffolk Finds No Substantiation In 100 Police Brutality Charges
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I. May 22 The Suffolk County Executive, John V. N. Klein, reported today that 100 sworn cases of alleged police brutality had been filed since last August.

title: Miss Evert May Face Mrs. Court
description: PARIS, May 22With four exceptions, the elite of tennis will start after the French open titles tomorrow and players like Jimmy Connors will find out where they rate in the tennis world and Chris Evert may get a hint of how she will do against Bobby Riggs in September.

title: Red Smith
description: If anybody doubts that sport brings out the best in men, he must be reassured by the way the recent success of the Houston Astros has illumined all that is sweetest and most sportsmanlike in Spec Richardson, their general manager. In fact, Richardson has exhibited such polished taste and simple dignity that one questions whether he belongs in a sweaty occupation like baseball and wouldn't be better suited to Roller Derby or professional wrestling.

title: AllStar Poll Due Saturday
description: Balloting for the baseball AllStar squads will begin Saturday. Ballot cards will be distributed in major league and minor league parks and retail stores.

title: Historic Sites Bills Gain
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) The Senate passed bills today aimed at preserving the nation's historic properties and archeological data at water project sites. The bills, sent to the House, would authorize $45million to continue for three years a program for the preservation and restoration of historic sites and strengthen 1960 law designed to preserve archeological relics and specimens in the construction of dams and reservoirs.

title: Firestone Tire Raises Profits
UNIONS HOLD OFF STRIKE AT TRACKS
description: Sam Koza, the redcoated bugler at New'York's thoroughbred tracks, can expect to continue doing his thing today at Belmont Park.

title: South Africa Giving Blacks Strike Right
description: CAPETOWN, May 22The South African Government, in an unexpected and dramatic] move, introduced in Parliaments, today legislation that would) give many of the country's black workers the legal right to strike.

title: SteppedUp Effort To Explain Phase 3 Urged by Grayson
description: C. Jackson Grayson Jr., who was chairman of the Price Commission during Phase 2, yesterday opposed reimposition of wage and price controls but called for a stronger statement of Phase 3 and more interpretations of its thrust by Government officials.

title: HOUSE PANEL BACKS 120DAY TROOP LIMIT
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) A 120day deadline on the President's power to commit United States troops abroad without specific approval by Congress was supported by the House Foreign Affairs Committee today, 25 to 7.

title: BUCKS AND JONES SETTLE A DISPUTE
description: The National Basketball Association Commissioner, Walter Kennedy, announced yesterday settlement of.the dispute between the Milwaukee BuCks and the former Buck guard, Wall Jones.

title: Police Shoot L.I.R.R. Rider After an Alleged Threat
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., May 22 (AP)A patrolman shot a 23yearold man aboard a Long Island Rail Road train in the Farmingdale station last night.
