title: 2D INDIAN PT. PLANT YIELDS ATOM POWER
description: Consolidated Edison's new $200million nuclearpowered electric plant, Indian Point No. 2 in Buchanan, N. Y., produced its first nuclear energy yesterday, a spokesman for the utility said.

title: Assembly Defeats Bill Proposed by Governor for Construction of Battery Park City Apartments
description: ALBANY, May 22  The Assembly today defeated a bill proposed by Governor Rockefeller, that would have transferred $400million in bonding authorization from the State Housing Finance Agency to the Battery. Park city authority.

title: Improvements Planned For Lindenwold Line
description: TRENTON, May 22 (AP)The Cahill administration formally agreed today to take part in a $36million improvement program for the Lindenwold highspeed rail line that connects Philadelphia and South Jersey.

title: The Laws That Apply
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn.  The question of whether or not Attorney General Mitchell and/or the Presidential confidants, Ehrlichman and Haldeman, ,acted unlawfully in the Watergate and Ellsberg incidents and, if so, whether or not this occurred with the prior or subsequent knowledge or approval of President Nixon, raise a number of significant questions concerning the criminal and constitutional process.

title: Dean to Testify Today on Role In Sudden Shift of I. T. T. Files
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 John W. Dean 3d, dismissed White House counsel, is to testify under oath tomorrow on his role in the sudden shift of tiles of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation last October from the Securities and Exchange Commission to the Justice Department in order to forestall examination of the files by Congressional committees.

title: The World And Watergate
description: It is not easy for the American people to believe in the noble sentiments of politicians these days, but when the leaders of the Soviet Union and West Germany meet on the Rhine and begin negotiating contracts for a radical turn toward cooperation in a new world order, even the Watergate seems less important.

title: G.A.O. Study Finds 13Million Overrun In Cost of Transpo
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) A General Accounting Office study says a lack of competitive bidding and proper planning contributed to a $13million cost overrun on the Department of Transportation's trade fair last year.

title: PHILLIPE VICTOR IN 880 AND MILE
IRT Gilded Parlor Car Now Museum Piece
description: EAST HAVEN, Conn., May 22New York City's only subway parlor car, with its gilt ceiling, thick carpet and heavy green velvet draperies, will go on public display Saturday at the Branford Trolley Museum, a sanctuary here for worn and sentimental symbols of past eras.

title: 20 Seat, BatteryRun Minibuses Studied for Welfare Island Community.
description: A 20seat, electricpowered minibus that the State Urban Development Corporation is considering for use in its new Welfare Island community was demonstrated briefly in city traffic yesterday.

title: CONCORD ENSEMBLE PLAYS BOLCOM PIECE
description: A new work by William Bolcom was the centerpiece of the Concord String Quartet's second program this season in Carnegie Recital Hall on Monday night. It was his String Quartet No. 9, completed last year and being given its premiere on this occasion.

title: Preston Robinson, Who Devised Atomic Bomb Triggers, Dead
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., May 22 (AP)Dr. Preston Robinson, the scientist and inventor who designed the energy storage capacitators that triggered the first atomic bombs, died yesterday at his home here. He was 70 years old and was a retired executive of the Sprague Electric Company in North Adams.

title: TESTIMONY HEARD
description: WASHINGTON, May 22A former White House official told the Senate Watergate committe today that John W. Dean 3d, the deposed Presidential counsel, had ordered him to offer executive clemency to James W. McCord Jr.

title: Paris Gets New Paper
description: PARIS, May 22 (Reuters)A new leftwing daily newspaper, called Liberation, appeared. here for the first time today with JeanPaul Sartre, the philosopher and write, as its managing editor.

title: Sevareid Is Hospitalized; In CoronaryCare Unit
description: Eric Sevareid. the Columbia Broadcasting System correspondent, was hospitalized at the Booth Memorial Medical Center in Flushing, Queens, yesterday afternoon, after he suffered abdominal pains on a flight from Washington to La Guardia Airport.

title: President Ends Insistence That Executive Privilege Bars Testimony by His Staff
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 President Nixon abandoned today his once adamant insist. ence that executive privilege should keep his personal staff from having to testify before Congress about the Watergate scandal.

title: Agnew Says Statement Shows Nixon's Courage
description: ORLANDO, Fla., May 22 (AP)Vice President Agnew said tonight that President Nixon's Watergate statement had shown remarkable moral courage and devotion to duty.

title: Kennedy Reelected Head Of the Pressmen's Union
description: William J. Kennedy has been reelected to a new oneyear term as president of Pressmen's Union No. 2, the union announced yesterday.

title: WESTBURY PACER GAINS 3D IN ROW
2 Die as Police In Srinagar Fire on AntiBritish Mobs
description: SRINAGAR, Kashmir, May 22 Two persons were killed when the police fired on violent crowd of antiBritish demonstrators here today.

title: Mrs. Rachel Huggins Baker, Mother of Judge Motley
description: NEW HAVEN, May 22 (AP) Mrs. Rachel Huggins Baker, the mother of Constance Baker Motley, the first black woman to serve as a Federal judge, died yesterday at St. Raphael's Hospital. She was 66 years old.

title: LANDLORD IS FINED FOR HARASSMENT
description: The landlord of a Manhattan apartment building in front of which a tenant suffered a fatal heart attack in 1971 during a debate with the owner and the city's Rent Commissioner before television cameras has been fined $7,000 for harassment of tenants.

title: Heath and Pompidou Shun Idea of an Atlantic Summit
description: PARIS, May 22Prime Minister Heath of Britain and President Pompidou of France, ending a twoday meeting here, today virtually killed the idea of a summit conference of Atlantic leaders when President Nixon visits Europe this fall.

title: Mrs. Pyles Is Wed To E. B. Murray Jr.
description: BEL AIR, Md., May 22In the First Presbyterian Church here at noon today, Mrs. Nancy Mann Pyles of New York, daughter of the late Dr. and Mrs. Herbert Mann of Richmond, was married to Edwards B. Murray Jr., also of New York. He is the son of Mrs. Murray of Macon, Ga., and the late Mr. Murray.

title: Queens Trees Saved From Ax, At Least for a Time, in Protest
description: Community pressure yesterday forced demolition crews to spare 14 trees in the Elmhurst, Queensat least temporarily.

title: Greenspun Says Hughes File Was Sought
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 22Hank Greenspun, editor and publisher of The  Las Vegas Sun, charged today that burglary attempt at his office last summer was not to obtain blackmail type information on Democratic Presidential candidates, as James W. McCord Jr. testified this morning at the Senate's Watergate hearing in Washington.

title: Many in Coop City, Once Biaggi Area, Believe He Has Betrayed Their Trust
Soviet Women's Five Wins
description: LIMA, Peru, May 22 (AP) The unbeaten Soviet women's ??eam scored a 9056 victory over Cuba in the eightgame oundrobin women's World Basketball Festival last night.

title: Governor Signs Adirondack Park Bill
description: ALBANY, May 22Governor Rockefeller signed a bill today that will sharply curtail development on the 3.7 million acres of private land in the six million acre Adirondack Park and called the measure One of national significance.

title: CONSUMER PRICES INCREASE. 7% HERE
description: Rising costs of food and housing contributed most to the seventenths of 1 per cent rise in consumer prices in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area in April, the Bureau of Labor Statistics said yesterday.

title: The Dance
description: It's showtime at the auditorium of the Library and Museum of the Performing Arts, and devotees of Small Hotel, Alice Blue Gown and tap dancing will very much enjoy the Jerry Ames Tap Dance Company.

title: Latins Say Burch Gave a Hiring Pledge
description: WASHINGTON, May 22A newly organized coalition of Spanish speaking Americans said today that it had obtained a pledge from Dean Burch, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, that the agency would intensify its efforts to hire and promote Spanishspeaking employes for its own staff.

title: Refugees in Lebanon Under New Rule
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 22New measures for tightening order in the Palestinian refugee camps in Lebanon are now in force as a result of last week's agreement between the Lebanese Government and Palestinian guerrillas.

title: SENATE OVERRIDES NIXON VETO, 62.22
5 Major Retailers Report Rising Profits and Sales
description: Reflecting three months of sharply increased consumer buying, five of the country's largest retailers  the Allied Stores Corporation, Montgomery Ward, the S. S. Kresge Company, the May Department Stores Company, and the McCrory Corporationyesterday reported big gains in both sales and net income for the first fiscal quarter.

title: Partner of Colson Reportedly Urged Pressure on S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, May 22A law partner of Charles W. Colson, former White House special counsel, proposed last month that they lean on the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission to appoint a counsel for the commission that would help their clients, according to a memorandum published by The Washington. Post in tomorrow's edition.

title: State Department Abjures Suggestion by Fulbright
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UPI) The State Department said today that the United States had no intention whatever of using force to secure an adequate oil supply from the Middle East.

title: The Hucksters
description: NOTRE DAME, IndIt may be premature to try to put Watergate into any reasonable perspective. The whole country has been grievously wounded and vacillates between indignation and shock, both of which are amply fed by each day's revelation of new perfidy in everwidening circles.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. St. Louis, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 2 P.M.

title: Vetlesen Prize Given To a Coast Physicist
description: Columbia University's $25,000 Vetlesen Prize for achievement in the earth sciences was presented last night to William A. Fowler, a 61yearold physics professor at the California Institute of Technology.

title: Soviet Asks U.S. Approval of Huge Fertilizer Deal
description: WASHINGTON, May 22A highranking Soviet official has come to Washington to seek formal endorsement by the Nixon Administration of the $8billion, 20year fertilizer deal worked out by the Soviet (Government and the Occidental Petroleum Corporation last month, a Commerce Department official said today.

title: Three East German Soldiers Reported Victims of Mines
description: TETTAU, West Germany, My 22 (AP)Three East German border guards fell victim to their own mines along the heavily fortified border dividing the two Germanys, Bavarian border police officials reported today.

title: Police Seize an Etruscan Vase in Italy
description: ROME, May 22  An archeologist said today that a 2,500yearold Etruscan vase that the police seized in northern Italy during a recent routine check was more important than the Greek vase the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York bought for $1million last year.

title: NEW UNIT TO FIGHT FOR CHILD RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The formation of a group seeking to reform laws dealing with children's rights was announced here today.

title: PRESIDENT'S VIEW
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 President Nixon conceded today! that there had been wideranging efforts in the White House to conceal some aspects of the Watergate case, but he said those actions had stemmed from his legitimate interest in protecting national security.

title: ACCORD IS REACHED IN BUILDERS STRIKE
description: SPRINGFIELD, May 22 (AP) A settlement was reached today with most of the craft unions whose strike has halted more than $2billion worth of construction in New Jersey since May 1.

title: DEBRIS ON TRACK DISRUPTS L.I.R.R.
description: Thousands of Long Island Rail Road commuters were delayed yesterday on the Brooklyn branch one day after the derailment of a train in Woodside Queens, resulted in injuries to 38 commuters.

title: From Nixon's Statement
description: It is clear that unethical, as well as illegal, activities took place in the course of that campaign. None of these took place with my specific approval or knowledge. To the extent that I may in any way have contributed the climate in which they took place, I did not intend to; to the extent that I failed to prevent them, I should have been more vigilant.

title: Nyquist and Shanker Assail Proposed US. Education Budget
description: WASHINGTON, May 22A New York State Commissioner and a union leader warned today that President Nixon's proposed education budget would slash 25 per cent of the services provided to 100,000 slum children in New York City, place thousands of paraprofessionals on relief rolls in the city and wreck havoc in upstate school districts.

title: Warning on Confidentiality
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UPI) A typewritten blue index card was placed before the seat of each of the seven Senators on the Senate Watergate committee before the start of today's hearing. It read: Please noteAll television microphones become hot the moment a Senator walks into the room. Please keep all confidential conversations in a low tone.

title: 4 in Democratic Race Pledge Foot Patrols
description: If any one of the four Democratic mayoral candidates is elected in Novemberand if he keeps his campaign promisesshortly afterward there will be more uniformed foot patrolmen walking the streets.

title: Shadow and Substance
description: PARIS Henry Kissinger's latest Paris visit for the old familiar reason of still more Vietnam talks had an interesting byproduct. He discovered that although Europeans were far less alarmist than the vast majority of Americans about the international implications of Watergate, Europeonever theless really didn't think too much of his Easter Monday speech urging new Atlantic charter.

title: Retarded Children Sing And Jump at Tully Hall
description: Darryl Crenshaw, an 11yearold black boy in an embroidered maroon velveteen jacket, was one small volcanic island in the seething sea of 2,200 mentally retarded children who attended two concerts by the West End Little Symphony yesterday at Alice Tully Hall in Lincoln Center.

title: Advertising: Ridder's Markets
description: Say this for Bernard H. kidder Jrhe's big enough to look the part of founder and chairman of the Minnesota Vikings, the professional football team.

title: Blazers Shift to Vancouver, Completing $1.9Million Deal
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, May 22 (AP)Jim Pattison, a Vancouver businessman, announced today that he had completed the purchase of the franchise and player contracts of the Philadelphia Blazers of the World Hockey Association.

title: House Panel Rejects Nixon Drug Law Plan
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP)The House Government Operations Committee voted 23 to 17 today against President Nixon's plan to reorganize drug law enforcement.

title: ATTEMPT TO OPEN ANTIOCH BLOCKED
description: YELLOW SPRINGS, Ohio, May 22Antioch College officials were turned back by 230 angry students and faculty members today as they attempted to reopen the campus, shut down for 32 days by a student strike over financial aid.

title: Candidates'
description: Mayoral candidates and other city officeseekers pledged yesterday to fight to save the 35cent fare and offered plans  none of them new to solve New York's masstransportation quandry at a hearing here.

title: People in Sports: Barry Beats Pants Off Biletnikoff
description: Rick Barry of the Golden State Warriors of the National Basketball Association won a Bay Area pro athletes decathlon in Los Altos when he hit a softball 287 feet, bowled a 558 series, won the 50meter swim in 0:31.1, tossed a football 61 yards 24 inches and played golf and tennis in creditable style. A dozen athletes competed in the weekend event with profits going to the March of Dimes. Fred Biletnikoff, the Oakland Raiders wide receiver, hit the water in a slick racing dive but left his trunks behind. After finishing the 50yard event in 0:34.7, Biletnikoff huddled in the corner of the pool while his

title: Equity Financing
description: A special offering of 71,100 common, shares of Host International at 12 was made yesterday by Goldman Sachs. The company's stock closed at 12, down  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: U.S. Releases $25Million For Education of Veterans
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) Yielding to a Vietnam veterans group's lawsuit, the Nixon Administration said today that it would free $25million for a new veterans  education program.

title: TV: Whodunit on a Train
description: Young David Steinberg acquits himself with cheerful, natural ease in Night Train to Terror, a trite, madeforTV whodunit tailored as the young comedian's first dramatic role. It goes on for 90 long minutes tonight at 11:30 in the American Broadcasting Company's Wide World of Entertainment slot. At least Mr. Steinberg keeps his cool, as a blithe, green horn private eye who ingeniously solves two train murders.

title: BANKS CAUTIONED ON LOAN GROWTH
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 The Federal Reserve Board appealed to the nation's banks today to discipline further expansion of their loans, which have been growing at record pace and contributing to the boom in the economy.

title: 2d Amex Specialist Unit Quits
description: The American Stock Exchange, many of whose specialists have absorbed substantial losses in the plummeting markets of recent months, confirmed yesterday that another of its specialist units had been dissolved.

title: Atoms Sink Olympique, 20
description: MONTREAL, May 22 (AP)The Philadelphia Atoms scored a goal in each half and defeated the Montreal Olympique, 20, tonight in North American Soccer League action. The Olympiques were blanked for the third straight game.

title: Argentine Gunmen Kill a Labor Leader
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 22A labor leader identified with the conservative wing of Peronism was shot dead today by unidentified assailants in the city of La Plata, about 30 miles southwest of the capital.

title: TESTIMONY HEARD
Text of a Statement by the President on Allegations Surrounding Watergate Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, May 22Following is a statement by President Nixon today on the Watergate case as released by. the White House:

title: Excerpts From Transcript of Testimony to Senate Group Investigating Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 22Following are excerpts from a transcript of testimony today in the third day of hearings on the Watergate case by the Senate Select Committee on Presidential Campaign Activities:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Residents of 39 houses in the GreenpointWilliamsburg section of Brooklyn, known as the Northside, lost a threeyear court fight yesterday against condemnation of their properties on the ground that the premises were being taken for private gain.

title: Collision Kills 8 in Mexico
description: SAN LUIS DE LA PAZ, Mexico, May 22 (AP)A bus and a trailer truck collided today near this town in central Mexico, killing eight persons and injuring seven, the police reported.

title: Music: Zemlinsky Songs
description: Bethany Beardslee shone her light into an obscure corner of music history on Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, where she sang five songs (four of them in their first performances) by Alexander Zemlinsky. Zemlinsky was the composition teacher of Schoenberg, and also his fatherinlaw. The Zemlinsky works provided historical perspective to Miss Beardslee's program of contemporary songs, presented as the season's final concert in the series known as.The Continuing AvantGarde.

title: U.S. and Britain Veto Curbs in Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 22  The United States and Britain today vetoed a resolution in the Security Council that would have extended trade sanctions against Rhodesia to include South Africa and Portuguese territories in Africa.

title: PATH AGREEMENT ELUDES U.S. BOARD
description: The National Mediation Board pressed its efforts yesterday to mediate the strike of railway car men that has shut down the PATH railroad system for 52 days.

title: NIXON NOMINATES 2 FOR PENTAGON POSTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) President Nixon announced today his nominees for two Pentagon vacancies.

title: Brezhnev Leaves After Brandt Talks
description: BONN, May 22Leonid Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader, left Bonn for Moscow this morning after four days of what he called long, constructive and truly friendly talks with Chancellor Willy Brandt. His effusive handshaking farewells to his hosts delayed his takeoff 35 minutes.

title: Four More British Banks Cut Prime Rates to 8%
description: LONDON, May 22 (Reuters) Four more major British Bank, Hambros Bank, Ltd., Wilthey were cutting their base or prime rate to 8 per cent from 9 per cent, effective tomorrow.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The nicest thing one can say about furrier is that he isn't in awe of his materials and goes blithely ahead treating pelts as though they were wool. Birger Christensen, the Danish furrier, does just that and his new collection for Bonwit Teller is full of young, snappy furs a woman might wear as casually as a tweed coat or a sweater.

title: Israel Sees No Effect on Ties; Reports of a Tap Taken Lightly
description: JERUSALEM, May 22Prime Minister Golda Meir described the Watergate scandal today as a sad and disturbing affair, but said it had had no effect whatsoever on relations between the United States and Israel.

title: Radio
Paychecks Buying Power Increased Here Last Year
description: The purchasing power of factory workers paychecks in the New York metropolitan area rose in 1972 for the second consecutive year, after declines in the two preceding years, the Department of Labor reported

title: A New I.B.M. Processor Will Speed CheckSorting
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced yesterday a new document processor that it said would help banks balance their growing checksorting load.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP)The Senate voted today by 43 to 33 to limit to Massachusetts and New Hampshire the use by mutual savings banks of a form checking account on which interest is paid. The vote was to adopt an amendment of Senator. William Brock, Republican of Tennessee, containing this limitation.

title: Skylab Countdown Is Postponed 9 Hours
description: CAPE KENNEDY, May 22 (UPI)With the start of the countdown delayed nine hours to conserve rocket batteries, the Skylab 1 astronauts finished training today for their flight Friday to try to salvage their crippled space station.

title: SADAT COUNSELED BY BRANDY ENVOY
description: CAIRO, May 22  Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany, who ended a threeday visit here today, reportedly assured President Anwar elSadat that the United States and the Soviet Union were pressing for a rapid peaceful solution of the Middle East conflict.

title: From Nixon's. Statement
description: It is clear that unethical, as well as illegal, activities took place in the course of that campaign. None of these took place with my specific approval or knowledge. To the extent that I may in any way have contributed the climate in which they took place, I did not intend to; to the extent that I failed to prevent them, I should have been more vigilant.

title: 3 Prosecutors Nearly Quit
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The three Federal prosecutors in the Watergate affair were on the verge of resigning from the case today, Justice Department sources said. They delayed their decision until a meeting tomorrow  their first with Archibald Cox, the former Solicitor General who has been designated special prosecutor to supervise the case.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Dr. William J. McKeefery has been named president of William Paterson College in Wayne and will assume the post July 1. Dr. McKeefery comes to his new position from the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va., where he had been executive vice president.

title: BLUE CROSS PLANS PREPAID SERVICE
description: Blue Cross of New York yesterday announced the establishment of its first prepaid grouphealth plan, at the Long Island JewishHillside Medical Center on the QueensNassau border.

title: Price at Newsstand Lowered to 50 Cents By Reader's Digest
description: The Reader's Digest, until recently the magazine that boasted the largest domestic circulation, announced yesterday that it was going against the trend in the magazine business and lowering its newsstand price.

title: San Francisco System Opens 3d Transit Link
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 22 (UPI)  The nation's first new mass transit system in 65 years completed its 58mile network on the east side of San Francisco Bay yesterday. with some trains taking twice as long as scheduled to make the run.

title: Nixon on VVatergate: A Shrinking Defense
description: WASHINGTON, May 22In the face of extraordinary pressures, President Nixon has furnished another elaboration of the role of the White House in the Watergate and associated scandals.

title: Mc Cord Says Hunt and Liddy Made Plan for Burglary at Las Vegas Newspaper
description: WASHINGTON, May 22James W. McCord Jr., ending two days of testimony before the Senate committee investigating the Watergate case, told the committee today of plans to break into the office of a Las Vegas newspaper publisher and to use a plane owned by Howard R. Hughes to escape afterward.

title: Gen. Graves Erskine, 75, Dead; Led Third Marines at Iwo Jima
description: WASHINGTON, May 22Gen. Graves B. Erskine, who was promoted to fourstar rank on retirement from the Marine Corps in 1953 but continued until 1961 as assistant to four Secretaries of Defense for special intelligence operations, died last night in Bethesda Naval Hospital. He was 75 years old.

title: Marijuana Bill Loses
description: DENVER, May 22 (UPI)State legislators rejected a proposal yesterday that would have made Colorado the only state in the Union in which marijuana could have been sold and used legally.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: NEWARK, May 22Everytme was in a. hurry to get, the last New Jersey college baseball luncheon over as quickly as possible and go to watch The Game at Fairleigh Dickinson's campus. The Game was between F.D.U. and Seton Hall to decide the winner of the Metropolitan Conference, the two teams having tied, for first.at the end of the regular season.

title: Rogers, in Brasilia, Sees New U.S.Latin Cooperation
description: BRASILIA, May 22 (UPI) Secretary of State William P. Rogers flew to Brazil's capital from Rio de Janeiro today and told his hosts that he was certain we are entering a new era of cooperation among the states of the Americas.

title: Exchange Seat Price Dips
description: The New York Stock Exchange said yesterday that seat was sold for $82,000, down $5,000 from a membership transfer on Monday.

title: Frederic Ludwig, 69, Dies; Led Yale Photography Unit
description: NEW HAVEN, May 22 (AP)Frederic G. Ludwig, inventor of the portable photocopy machine and the portable microfilm camera, died Sunday. He was 69 years old.

title: Bold Actions Characterized Gross's Rise
description: Careful, quiet research and thenwhen the time is right bold, swift action without concern for the weight of the opposition. That, according to politicians who know him, has been the pattern that Nelson G. Gross followed to ;considerable political success.

title: Volkswagen Prices To Rise 2.9% Here; 3d Increase in 73
description: Volkswagen of America, Inc., announced yesterday the third increase this year in suggested retail prices for Volkswagen, Porsche and Audi models. A spokesman said in Englewood Cliffs, N. J., that the increases, averaging 2.9 per cent, would affect cars arriving in the United States as of May 21, and were necessitated by the decline of the dollar in inter national currency markets. Under the increases, the price of the Volkswagen Beetle will move up by $100, to $2,299. The price of the Super Beetle will be raised by $50, to $2,499, while the price of the Porsche 914, the lowestpriced car in that series, will be advanced by $150, to $4,649.

title: SOME FISCAL DUTIES ARE SHIFTED TO G.S.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) President Nixon announced today a shift of many financial management responsibilities from the Office of Management and Budget to the General Services Administration.

title: SENATE UNIT VOTES MILITARY AID CUT
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The Senate Foreign Relations Committee voted today to slash the Nixon Administration's request for military assistance funds by more than 40 per cent and to phase out the military aid program over the next four years.

title: SCIENTIST FEARS OPIUM SHORTAGE
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 American Government policies have helped to create an incipient world shortage of legitimate supplies of opium, according to a pharmacologist at Georgetown University here.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: An Off Broadway actress and a Broadway actor were chosen yesterday as winners of the 29th annual Clarence Derwent Awards for the best supporting performance in nonfeatured roles.

title: BANK ROBBERS GET
description: Three armed men robbed bank in Kew Gardens, Queens, of $10,000 shortly after opened yesterday but minutes later two of the men were captured with $8,000. The third suspect escaped with $2,000.

title: Primary Choice
description: Four contestants remain in the primary race for the Democratic nomination for Mayor of New York. While, the successful candidate will not necessarily be elected Mayor in November, the Democratic preponderance in this city is so great that this year in particular, the chances strongly favor the Democratic nominee. Under the law, a candidate must obtain at least 40 per cent of the vote cast to be named winner in the June 4 primary; if no one receives that much, the two leading candidates will engage in a runoff three weeks later.

title: Colgate Seeking Helena Rubinstein Inc.
description: The ColgatePalmolive Company announced yesterday it is negotiating to acquire Helena Rubinstein, Inc., one of the nation's leading cosmetic manufacturers.

title: RATES AGAIN RISE IN CREDIT MARKET
Mechanic of Ringer Car Put on Year's Probation
Books of The Times
description: In The Queen of a Distant Country, John Braine has postulated a novelist who pours everything into his work and has nothing left for the ordinary purposes of humanity. Then he unreasonably asks us to take an interest in the fellow, which is rather like calling a father in from the hospital waiting room and putting the placenta, instead of the baby, into his arms. If Tom Metfield is the archetype of the writer, then we all ought to lay down our pens. Once the best known of Britain's Angry Young Men, Mr. Braine has become a complacent old hen. His latest novel consists, for the most part, of a clutch of dogeared dogmatisms about writing and it reads as if believes them. Though Tom Metfield averages 30,000 year from his book, nobody, even in these inflationary times, would give a penny for his thoughts. He believes, for example, that the better the novelist, the duller his personal life. The practice of any art, he contends, destroys personality. This, naturally, would include Dostoyevsky, Melville, Tolstoy, Flaubertor, for that matter, Picasso, Rembrandt and Goya.

title: How Dorothy Carnegie Won a Husband and Influenced a Business
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I.  Dorothy Carnegie  leggy, Strawberry blonde, somewhere past 40"presides over the worldwide operations of Dale Carnegie and Associates, Inc: So I have no time to sit and whittle and spit, she explained recently in a voice as rich as the wheat fields in her native Oklahoma. Even so, Mrs. Carnegie agreed to sit and spin a good oldfashioned tale of the American dream come true.

title: Dance: Variety of Talents
description: Dance at the weekend had our own New York City Ballet and our most welcome visitors, the Stuttgart Ballet, playing across the Lincoln Center Plaza, with the Stuttgart at the Metropolitan Opera House and the City Ballet at the New York State Theater.

title: Maritime Fruit Sets Deal
description: Maritime Fruit Carriers Company, Ltd., an Israeli shipping company, said yesterday that it had entered into an agreement with the Bethlehem Steel Corporation providing for the purchase of two 265,000ton tankers to be delivered in 1977 and 1978. The agreement is subject to certain conditions, including a granting of a 41 per cent construction differential subsidy by the U.S. Marilime Administration.

title: People and Business
description: Two wellknown Americans on opposite ends of the political spectrumVice President Spiro Agnew and John Kenneth Galbraith, the Harvard economistspoke yesterday about America's economic growth.

title: Bold Actions Characterized Gross's Rise
description: Careful, quiet research and thenwhen the time is right bold, swift action without concern for the weight of the opposition. That, according to politicians who know him, has been the pattern that Nelson G. Gross followed to considerable political success.

title: PRESIDENT'S VIEW
Monday Night's Fights
description: TokyoBill Douglass, Columbus, Ohio, knocked out Steve Smith, Philadelphia, 3 rounds, middleweights.

title: James Gordon. Bennett Fund Makes Grants of $110,000
description: Scholarship grants totaling more than $110,000 for children of New York newspaper employes that will enable 80 students to continue study at college and for 33 others to enter the college of their choice were disclosed yesterday following the annual meeting, of the James Gordon Bennett Memorial Corporation.

title: Pentagon Is Unhelpful On Visit to Thai Bases
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UPI)The Pentagon indicated yesterday that it did not want American reporters making regular visits to air bases in Thailand where the aircraft and crewmen who bomb Cambodia are stationed.

title: Watergate Affair Moves A.B.C. To Expand Investigative Activity
description: The Watergate scandal, and the role investigative reporting played in uncovering it, has encouraged the American Broadcasting Company to expand its activities in the investigative area, according to Elton H. Rule, president of A.B.C., Inc.

title: Consumer Prices Up 0.7% in April, But Climb Slowed
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 Consumer prices rose strongly again in April, but a little less rapidly than in the preceding two months, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Consumer Prices Up 0.7% in April, But Climb Slowed
Floating Out the Storm
description: With all the other strains and stresses produced by Watergate, one can be grateful that the United States is not simultaneously caught in a collapse of the dollar and a breakdown of the international monetary system.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A 49yearold New Jersey orthopedic surgeon, who had pleaded guilty to evading almost $150,000 in Federal income taxes due the Government in 1967, was indicted yesterday for bailjumping when he failed to appear for sentencing.

title: Istomin, Stein, Rose Revel With Brahms In Hunter Program
description: Eugene Istomin, Isaac Stern and Leonard Rose sold out the Assembly Hall at Hunter College Saturday night, even without letting it be known that they will not reconvene as trio for another New York concert until the 197475 season.

title: SPORTS BOND ISSUE DELAYED BY STUDY
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, May 22  Underwriting officials said today that they did not know when the $268million bond issue designed to finance the proposed race track and sports complex here would be brought to market.

title: 17 INDICTED ON L.I. OVER AUTO THEFTS
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 22An interstate auto theft ring that allegedly stole expensive cars on order has been broken up through the efforts of police authorities in Nassau County and New York City and the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Nassau County District Attorney William Cahn said today.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Just as New Yorkers are readying their terraces and pocketsize gardens for summer, along comes Greenwich House Pottery with a timely Pots for Plants show. The exhibition and sale at 16 Jones Street runs through June 2 and is far more than the show's name implies, With no end of imaginative things for indoor and outdoor gardeners.

title: Gross, Cahill Leader in 69, Cited by U.S. in Tax Fraud
description: NEWARK, May 22  Nelson G. Gross, the New JerSey Republican leader who delivered the party's support here President Nixon in 1968 and to William T. Cahill in the gubernatorial election a year later, was indicted by a Federal grand jury today on charges of masterminding an income tax conspiracy fraud involving the financing of Mr. Cahill's 1969 election campaign.

title: Funds Shifted to F14
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (Reuters)The commandant of the Marine Corps, Gen. Robert Cuslunan, has agreed to switch $890million earmarked for the McDonnellDouglas F4 to the Grumman F14 fighter. General Cushman, who last week told a House defense appropriations subcommittee he wanted the F4, has now told a subcommittee hearing he was persuaded by the Navy to buy the F14 instead.

title: Police Chief Suspended
description: SALEM, May 22, (UPI)Police Chief, George A. Johnson was suspended by the City Council last night. The 51year. old chief was indicted last week in Trenton on misconduct and gambling charges. Mayor Ralph Reeves said the chief's replace. meet would be named within several days.

title: The Camden Acquittal
description: The acquittal of seventeen members of the Camden 28 and the prosecution's recommendation for diimissal of charges against the remaining eleven defendants clearly part of a growing revulsion against abuse of governmental power. The antiwar protesters had been arrested in 1971 while breaking into a Federal building and destroying draft records. Since they subsequently admitted their action in ,court, their acquittal constitutes something of a legal landmark: it was based on the jury's finding thatthough the defendants were guiltytheir offense was dwarfed by the Government's deliberate use of an agent provocateur to assure the commission rather than the prevention of a crime.

title: Protection Guide Issued
description: A 20page booklet on methods of safeguarding the home against criminals has been issued by the city. Mayor Lindsay said that some 400,000 copies had been printed and would be available at the police stations or through the Office of Neighborhood Government at 5663600.

title: 15 Scholarships Made Available For Women Athletes by Miami
description: The University of Miami In Coral Gables, Fla., has awarded five athletic scholarships to women during the past two weeks and has 10 more to give to women high school graduates able to enter the Miami freshman class next fall. It is considered to be the first time a college with such a bigtime athletic stature has given an athletic grant to a woman. Certainly no other bigtime sports college has offered 15 women's athletic scholarships in one

title: DAVID R. PORTER, 91, EXY.M.C.A. OFFICER
description: PORTLAND, Me., May 22DaVid R. Porter, a retired executive of the Young Men's Christian Association, died yesterday at his home in Abingdon, England, near Oxford, where, in 1904, he had been one of the university's original Rhodes Scholars. He was 91 years old.

title: BUCKS AND JONES SETTLE A DISPUTE
description: The National Basketball Association commissioner, Walter Kennedy, announced yesterday settlement of the dispute between the Milwaukee Bucks and the former Buck guard, Wall, Jones.

title: Rioting Erupts in Londonderry After Catholic's Death
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Wednesday, May 23 (UPI)A 21yearold Roman Catholic injured in disorders last week died last night and news of his death set off new rioting in Londonderry, where young mon fought British troops from behind barricades fashioned from burning buses and automobiles.

title: Presidential Testimony
description: President Nixon has at last emerged from his cavalier dismissal of the Watergate conspiracy as a deplorable incident. Not only is it officially acknowledged to have been somewhat more than that; it was followedthe President finally concedesby a deliberate operation to cover up parts of the conspiracy, a coverup orchestrated from the White House, undertaken in its general lines if not in its details with the President's knowledge and on his instructions, for reasons of national security that he is now attempting to explain.

title: 30 KILLED IN INDIA AS POLICE REBEL
description: NEW DELHI, May 22Indian troops battled a state police force in Uttar Pradesh today in an attempt to put down a rebellion among the policemen.

title: Dollar Is Stronger In Uneasy Trading; Price of Gold Ebbs
description: PARIS, May 22After its recent battering, the dollar fared better in Europe's money centers today. And gold dropped $1.50 an ounce from its record closing price of $112 yesterday.

title: Rockland Rejects Sewer Plan; A Victory for Conservationists
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., May 22Members of the West Branch Conservation Association broke out the champagne at 2:30 this morning to toast the end of a threeyear career in what they called sealer politics.

title: Heath and Pompidou Shun Idea of an Atlantic Summit
description: PARIS, May 22Prime Minister Heath of Britain and President Pompidou of France, ending a twoday meeting here, today virtually killed the idea of a summit conference of Atlantic leaders when President Nixon visits Europe this fall.

title: Youths Pressure Congress to Save AirFare Discounts
description: There are six children in the Robert O'Donnell family of New Canaan, Conn., four of whom will be in college next fall. By their reckoning, the Civil Aeronautics Board has just added hundreds of dollars to the cost of higher education  and taken away a dimension of living.

title: Watergate Halts Nixon Library Plan
description: LOS ANGELES, May 22With a majority of its executive board of trustees directly implicated in the Watergate investigations, the Richard M. Nixon Foundation has put aside for the time being its plans to build a library and museum as a monument to the President.

title: U.S Aide Says 3 Took C.I.A. Lie Tests
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 The State Department acknowledged today that three of its officers were given lie detector tests by Central Intelligence Agency personnel in 1971, at the request of the White House, as part of an Administration effort tc curb news leaks.

title: Records
description: The dance music of the 15th and 16th centuries has in almost irresistible allure. This is hardly music of Strenuous intellectuality, let done profound relieod, ty, and it can hardly be taken as the quintessence of prbBaroque musical art. But whether courtly or popular, this is music of unabashed appeal, and three recent records can serve as fine introductions to it.

title: Distributors Score Connecticut's Plan On Gasoline Prices
description: HARTFORD, May 22  An Independent fuel distributors association urged a Connecticut legislative committee today not to pass a key part of its program to protect independent dealers during the current gasoline shortage because, the association maintained, the remedy might do more harm than good. However, after hearing the testimony the committee met in executive session and recommended passage of the legislation.

title: 10 AIRLINES SUED OVER FARE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 A classaction suit against 10 airlines was filed in United States District Court today alleging that the airlines have overcharged transPacific passenger about $1.7million since May 1a complaint that could, theoretically, lead to more than $5million in refunds if it is upheld.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
McCord, Caulfield Meet Again in New Light
description: WASHINGTON, May 22James W. McCord Jr. and John J. Caulfield came face to face again today, not at the second scenic overlook of the George Washington Memorial Parkway, but at the very center of the Senate investigation of the Watergate conspiracy.

title: Output Up, Ideology Down, and Hungarians Find the Living Easy
description: BUDAPEST, May 17It was in Hungary, nine years ago that Nikita S. Khrushchev pro nounced his idea of goulas Communism, and it is her that satisfying the consume appears to have been elevate to the principal goal of the movement.

title: Notes on People
description: Government sources said that the leading candidates for appointment as administrator of the Federal Environmental Protection Agency are Henry L. Diamond and John It. Quarles Jr.

title: SILVER PRICES HIT BY PROFIT TAKING
ANTIBUSING BILL STAYED IN ALBANY
BUSINESS GROUPS URGED TO AID CITY
description: George Champion, chairman and president of the Economic Development Council of New York, proposed yesterday that eight citywide business groups here coordinate their research, manpower and programing to develop a unified policy'for the improvement of New York City.

title: City Maritime Students Get a New Classroom
description: National Maritime Day took on special significance yesterday as the city's maritime high school students got a new classroom.

title: What Price Watergate?; Crisis of Confidence Depresses Markets, But It May Be Consequences, Not Cause
description: The crisis of confidencewhose symbol is a certain apartmentoffice complex in Washingtonhas already taken a heavy toll, measured simply in pecuniary terms.

title: STOCKS REBOUND FOR MODEST GAIN
Wood house in Winner's Circle Once Every 4 Mounts at Belmont
Amex Prices Ease
A BROAD PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The White House urged the Federal Bureau of Investigation in 1970 to mount a massive counterinsurgency program, involving spying, wiretapping and burglaries, against the Black Panthers, potential Arab saboteurs, antiwar radicals and Soviet espionage agents, wellplaced sources said said today.

title: Personal Finance
description: The nation's 8.5 million mutual fund shareholders have just won a victory that could save tax dollars when they give away or leave mutual fund shares to their heirs.

title: MRS. GERALD B. ZORNOW
description: ROCHESTER, May 23Mrs. E. Gaylord Baker Zornow, wife of Gerald B. Zornow, chairman of the Eastman Kodak Company, died today in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. She was 58 years old.

title: Morgan Bank Sees Equity Funding Loss
More of the Truth...
description: President Nixon's lengthy statement on the Watergate scandals reveals more of the truth than he or any his senior associates had previously been willing to put on the record. The involvement of the President and his White House aides in the tangled events that led these assorted crimes and conspiracies and the subsequent attempt to cover them up is much more extensive than had previously been acknowledged.

title: 12 U.S. Artists, First Since '67 Chosen for the Sao Paulo Bienal
description: Twelve Chicago artists have been chosen for the 12th Sao Paulo Bienal exhibition in Brazil this September, it was learned yesterday. Their participation in the international art exhibition, which rivals the Venice Biennale in prestige and scope, marks the first time that American artists have been represented in the Brazilian show in six years.

title: Gimbel Analyzes Loss
description: Increased expenses and unsatisfactory sales gains were responsible for Gimbel Brothers loss in the first quarter against a profit in the like 1972 period, Bruce A. Gimbel, chairman, told the annual meeting here yesterday.

title: U.S. Five Beats Peru, 6867
description: LIMA, Peru, May 24 (AP) The United States rallied mid way through the second half and edged Peru, 6867, in the World Basketball Festival. The Peruvians led, 3926, at the it half,

title: Fire Destroys Ballpark
description: BLUEFIELD, W. Va., May 23 (AP)Facilities at cityowned Bowen Field, home of a farm club of the Baltimore Orioles, were destroyed by fire and authorities said they were investigating the possibility of arson. The Class D farm club in the Appalachian League was to open itS season next month.

title: JUSTICES REJECT MOST CASES FILED
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Supreme Court dismisses 70 per cent of the appeals that reach its docket without any discussion of their merits among the justices, Associate Justice William J. Brennan Jr. said tonight.

title: PENTAGON TO CUT ENLISTED AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Defense Secretary Elliot L. Richardson, responding to Congressional critics announced today a 28 per cent reduction in the number of enlisted men being used as personal servants by general and admirals.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: A Greek Publisher Begins Jail Term for Agnew Report
description: ATHENS, May 23Yiannis Horn, publisher of the Englishlanguage daily Athens News, was picked up by the security police tonight to serve six and onehalf months in jail for printing a misleading headline about Vice President Agnew of the United States.

title: SHOP TALK For $3 You Can Have Your Own Watergate Game Plan
description: The Senate investigations into the Watergate scandal may be grinding out slowly, but two enterprising men are already capitalizing on the nation's current fascination.

title: 12 POLICE INDICTED INDETROIT INQUIRY
description: DETROIT, May 23Twelve Detroit policemen, along with 16 other persons, were indicted today on charges of taking part in an illegal narcotics operation extending beyond Michigan into seven other states and Canada.

title: Watergate: Surviving Cynicism
description: WASHINGTON  The immediate focus of Watergate should not be the institution of the Presidency; it must be the Nixon Administration. The trouble is that too many are asking that we blur the distinction. In rallying around the Presidential flag, they inevitably risk falling under the banner of cynical disregard for the facts and the law. In seeking to save the Presidency, they could destroy it.

title: Police Agent Tells of Offer From a Watergate Plotter
description: MIAMI, May 23 (AP)man working as a police undercover agent says that Eugenio Martinez, a convicted Watergate burglar, offered him $700 a week to work as a political spy during last summer's Democratic National Convention, The Miami Herald reported in today's editions.

title: Bay State Town Rejects 12Month School Year
description: BELLINGHAM, Mass, May 23 (AP)With about 100 townspeople looking on, the Bellingham School Committee voted 3 to 2 yesterday against a proposed 12month school year aimed at easing crowded classrooms.

title: SHIM RAISES CORRUPTION ISSUE
description: PARAMUS, May 23Representative Charles W. Sandman, in one of the sharpest attacks he has made on Governor Cahill, asserted today that corruption was the overriding issue in the Republican primary, and maintained there was no way possible the Governor could lead a G.O.P. ticket to victory in a general election.

title: Nassau Doctors Elect Chief
description: Dr. Harold Mayberger a Glen Cove, L. I., obstetriciangynecologist, yesterday was elected president of the 2,100 member Nassau County Medical Society. Dr. Mayberger, a graduate of the University of Alabama and the Long Island College of Medicine, succeeds Dr. Perry Mandel of Garden City.

title: Stocks on Big Board Continue to Rally
House Panel Backs Bill To Curb Foreign Travel
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) The House Internal Security Committee approved legisiation today that would outlaw unauthorized visits by United States citizens to countries fighting the United, States.

title: SULLIVAN VISITING SAIGON FOR TALKS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 23William H. Sullivan, Deputy Assistant Secretary of State for East Asia and Pacific Affairs, arrived here tonight for discussions with South Vietnamese officials on how to carry out the Paris peace Agreement.

title: South Korea Wins Boxing; U.S Team Finishes Third
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 23 (AP)South Korea placed first by winning five gold medals an a silver in final matches today in the annual boxing championships of the International Military Sports Council. South Korea had won four bronze medals in semifinal matches.

title: Assets of $464,046 Disclosed by Cahill
description: TRENTON, May 23Governor Cahill said today that he had total assets of $464,046 and paid Federal taxes of $19,024 last year on a gross income of $61,219.

title: Cosmos 560 Launched
description: MOSCOW, May 23 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union launched today the 560th in its Cosmos series of satellites, the news, agency Tass reported.

title: TV: News Awards as Entertainment
description: Before the first Emmy news and documentary awardceremonies got under way over the Columbia Broadcasting System network Tuesday evening, an urgent, offcamera voice asked, Would you believe Walter Cronkite, John Chancellor, Howard K. Smith and Harry Reasoner all together on one broadcast? Presumably, most viewers would believe it, but not perhaps without a degree of trepidation.

title: Hearings to Be Carried On 5 TV Channels Here
description: The Watergate hearings today will be carried live on television channels 2, 4, 7, 13 and 31, beginning at 10 A.M.

title: Levity Finds a Way Into Senate Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Adding the first bit of levity to what had been long hours of serious testimony, a former New York City policeman told the Senate Watergate committee today that his old buddies would never have bungled a job the way the Watergate burglars did.

title: Democratic Mayor Hopefuls Ask Tighter Relief Setup
Briefs on the Arts
description: Tony Curtis will make his Broadway stage debut next season as the star of a new comedy, Turtlenecks, written by Bruce Jay Friedman and Jacques Levy. The film actor's career spans 25 years and 60 movies, which include such comedies as Some Like It Hot, Operation Petticoat and Boeing, Boeing. His dramatic movie roles include Houdini and The Boston Strangler. The authors initially collaborated on Scuba Duba, which Mr. Friedman wrote and which Mr. Levy directed. Mr. Levy will also direct Turtlenecks, which will be David Merrick's first production next season. It is scheduled to have its premiere in mid

title: Man Accused of Forging Ph.D. For School Job Indicted Here
description: A 40yearold man who assertedly posed as the holder of a Ph.D. from Columbia University and worked as a $24,000ayear program director in Community School District 9 last year was indicted yesterday on charges of forging records of a degree he never obtained.

title: Tuesday Night's Fights
description: Wembley, EnglandJohn Conteh, 168 pounds, England, outpointed Chris Finnegan, 166, England, 15 rounds; Conteh gained British and Commonwealth lightheavyweight titles and retained European crown.

title: Evans of UConn Leads First I.C.4A Decathlon
ARE BEING REVIEWED
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) The income tax returns of seven Governors are being investigated, the Internal Revenue Service said today.

title: Democrats Raise Over Million, A Record, at Washington Dinner
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI) More than 2,500 Democrats paid $500 a plate tonight to attend a fundraising dinner that raised a record total of more than $1million for next year's Democratic Congressional campaigns.

title: Political Appointments of Envoys May Be Limited
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The timehonored practice of rewarding political contributors and supporters with ambassadorships seems destined for sharp limitations in the future.

title: L.I. Six Joins New League
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., May 23 (AP)The Long Island Cougars, based in Commack, Suffolk County, have been admitted to the North American Hockey League, The N.A.H.L. replaces the Eastern Hockey League.

title: Aaron Withdraws His Suit In Lever Bros. Promotion
description: Hank Aaron, the Atlanta Braves slugger, withdrew a lawsuit in Manhattan State Supreme Court yesterday against Lever Bros. The suit stemmed from an agreement by Aaron and the company to capitalize on Aaron's pursuit of Babe Ruth's career home run record. A spokesman for Lever Bros. said a new modified agreement had been reached with Aaron.

title: Legislature Backs Ban on Forced School Busing
description: ALBANY, May 23  After a bitter twoday dispute that included charges of racism, the Senate tonight voted final legislative approval of a resolution calling for a Federal constitutional ban on the assignment of students on the basis of race.

title: Yanks Top Tigers, 65, And Gain Tie for First
Nicklaus, Player to Rejoin Pro Golf Circuit Today
description: ATLANTA, May 23  Jack Nicklaus and Gary Player, both fit and with similar goals, are back on the golf tour. They are here for tomorrow's start of the $150,000 Atlanta Classic, in which each will be starting the final drive for the ,United States Open, with begins at the Oakmont (Pa.) Country Club on June 14.

title: Neil Mahoney Is Dead at 66; Red Sox Scout Since 1939
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 23 (UPI)Neil T. Mahoney, director of scouting for the Boston Red Sox baseball team, died today at the age of 66.

title: Sweden Posts Soccer Upset
description: GOTEBORG, Sweden, May 23 (AP)  Sweden, led by Roland Sandberg's two goals upset Austria, 32 tonight in a Group I World Soccer Cup qualification match before 50,000 fans at Ullevi Stadium.

title: G.O.P CHIEFS GIVE NIXON AN OVATION
description: WASHINGTON, May 23President Nixon received standing ovation from 22 Republican Senators and Representatives today after he again invoked the name of national security in connection with the Watergate case.

title: Gain in Sales Reported By ROBERT E. BEDINGFIELD
description: SADDLE BROOK, N.J., May 23The Grand Union Company told shareholders at their annual meeting here today in the Marriott Motor Lodge that although sales in the first 11 weeks of the current quarter ending next week were 8.98 per cent ahead of a year ago, profits probably would be lower.

title: Campaign Costs a Concern Of Four in Controller Race
description: Moneyappropriately enough dominates the discussion between the four men seeking the Democratic nomination for Controller.

title: Bond Price Drops Continue
Ex C.I.A. Head to Get Award
description: LOS ANGELES, May 23 (UPI) John A. McCone, Director of Central Intelligence from 1961 to 1965, will be presented with the Brotherhood Award of the National Conference of Christians and Jews at a dinner here June 7, it was announced yesterday.

title: BAR UNIT GIVES PLAN FOR PICKING JUDGES
description: The Association of the Bar of the City of New York urged yesterday that a citizens committee be created to pass on the qualifications of new State Supreme Court justices and judges of the Court of Claims who will implement newly enacted state narcotics legislation.

title: Track Unions Expecting To Win on Job Security
description: New York racing's latest labor crisis remained unsettled yesterday as union leaders waited at Belmont Park for word of legislative developments in Albany.

title: Dance
description: There is a special mystery to Alvin Ailey's Masekela Language, given by the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater at the City Center 55th Street Theater Tuesday night.

title: Col. Alois Podhajsky, 75, Dies; Trained Lipizzaner Stallions
description: VIENNA, May 23 (UPI)Col. Alois Podhajsky, former chief of the Spanish Riding School here, who helped rescue the famous Lipizzaner white stallions from Russian occupation, died today at the age of 75 following a stroke.

title: W. and L. Quits Conference
description: LEXINGTON, Va., May 23 (AP)Washington and Lee University announced today it was withdrawing from the fourmember College Athletic Conference, effective June 1.

title: A Cambodian Landscape: Bomb Pits, Rubble, Ashes
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 21The destruction Cambodia has multiplied greatly since the escalation of the American bombing began here in February. Scores of villages have been blown away. Twelvefootdeep bomb craters pock the ruins. Great numbers of livestock have been killed, harvested crops burned to ash, orchards destroyedall creating a degree of damage, and therefore a reconstruction problem, that until now had been associated only with North and South Vietnam.

title: Boy Accidentally Shoots Classmate, 9, in Bronx
description: A 9yearold Bronx boy was accidentally shot and wounded in the neck yesterday by classmate who told the police later that he had found the 32caliber pistol in a garbage can and had thought it was toy.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ORIENTATION For the last several months the Chinese Government that operates out of Taiwan has had a Chinese Cultural Center in a neat fourstory building at 159 Lexington Avenue on the corner of 30th Street. (7254950).

title: RAINED OUT AGAIN, METS HEAD WEST
description: After having been rained out for the third time in the last four days, the New York Mets took off for sunny California last night just in time to avoid beginning to rust. They will play four games in Los Angeles, starting tonight; three in San Francisco and three in San Diego, then two in Cincinnati on the way home.

title: Jerseyan Has Short, Happy Fling at French Tennis
description: PARIS, May 23The way out of the $133,000 French open tennis championship was just as easy as the road in but at least Steve Siegel of Teaneck, N.J., made it to Paris in the spring. Wimbledon is next.

title: Truce Aides Visit Vietcong Capital
description: LOC NINH, South Vietnam, May 23 (AP)The town nestles amid rubber trees just an hour's helicopter ride from Saigon. Its streets are muddy like any other South Vietnamese town in the monsoon season. Barefooted children wave at foreigners passing by.

title: Business Briefs
description: The Xerox Corporation introduced yesterday two major new productsa color copier and a computer printout device that uses xerographic techniques rather than the traditional impact, or typewriter, methods of printing out date.

title: 4 Seized on Charges Of Beating 2 Guards At Brooklyn School
description: A school security guard, his father, his brother, and a cousin were arrested yesterday on charges of assaulting two security guards at another school.

title: DOLLAR SHOWS GAIN AS GOLD DECLINES
description: LONDON, May 23 (AP)The dollar recovered against most leading European currencies today and gold slipped back from its record highs.

title: Lampkin Next for Malave
description: Chu Chu Malave of New York and Ray Lampkin of Portland, Ore., will meet in a scheduled 10round junior lightweight bout June 4 at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum, the first of 14 consecutive Monday night fights to be held at the Felt Forum. Lampkin has a 2111 wonlostdrawn record. Malave's record is 2032.

title: Garbage Truck Recovered
description: ISABELLA, Pa., May 23 (UPI) State policemen found stolen garbage truck yesterday parked along a rural road near this southwestern Pennsylvania village after passing motorists complained about a foul odor. The $6,000 truck, owned by Robert Donan of nearby Rice Landing, was stolen early Monday with a full load of garbage.

title: Chinese Journalists Visit Boston as Part Of a 4Week Tour
description: BOSTON May 23A group of 18 of China's leading journalists spent a pleasant day here today struggling with New England lobster, hearing a lecture by one of America's leading economists and observing the latest in American medical technology,

title: G.O.P. CHIEFS GIVE NIXON AN OVATION
description: WASHINGTON, May 23President Nixon received standing ovation from 22 Republican Senators and Representatives today after he again invoked the name of national security in connection with the Watergate case.

title: Roundup: The New Order Aids Red Sox in Triumph
description: Two New Yorkers who have made good up North did so again last night and it helped the Boston Red Sox to a 53 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers.

title: Suit Filed to Free Funds For LandGrant Colleges
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (AP) The United States District Court was asked today to force the Nixon Administration to release $10million in landgrant funds appropriated by Congress last year.

title: Levity Finds a Way Into Senate Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Adding the first bit of levity to what had been long hours of serious testimony, a former New York City policeman told the Senate Watergate committee today that his old buddies would never have bungled a job the way the Watergate burglars did.

title: ASSEMBLY TABLES SCHOOLPOST BILL
description: ALBANY, May 23The Assembly Republican leadership dealt a serious blow today to Governor Rockefeller's proposal for an inspector general of public schools and many legislators concluded that the measure was dead.

title: Ford Will Pay $1Million To Halt Argentine Terror
description: DETROIT, May 23The Ford Motor Company decided today to meet terrorist demands to send $1million worth of ambulances and donations to hospitals in Argentina to prevent further attacks on its employes and its subsidiary in Buenos Aires.

title: Conservative Architect of Security Plan Tom Charles Huston
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The young lawyer who drafted the White House's new domestic security plan in the summer of 1970, Tom Charles Huston, is a fervent, scholarly conservative who wishes he had lived in the 18th century. His intellectual heroes are Cato, the Roman moralist, and Thomas Jefferson; the portrait on his office wall here was of John C. Calhoun, the Southern theorist of states rights and nullification of Federal

title: Green Power Politics
description: TRENTON, May 23  The political implications of the Watergate case and the repeated charges of corruption involving high levels of Governor Cahill's administration have sparked a new effort in New Jersey to go beyond the state's tough new campaign financial disclosure law and eliminate the the reliance of political candidates and parties on private contributions. The effort has been been translated into legisla,tion sponsored by Assemblyman Albert Burstein, a Bergen County Democrat, and it is expected to be a major plank of the Democratic platform should Brendan T. Byrne win the party's nomination for Governor in the June 5 primary election.

title: RIOTING PROTESTS DEATH IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 23  Three cars were seized and set on fire today in Londonderry by rioters protesting the death of a young man apparently killed by a rubber bullet fired by a British soldier.

title: Manitoba Awards Contract
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, May 23 (Canadian Press)A $102million Manitoba Hydro contact, possibly the largest in the province's history, has been awarded to Long Spruce Constructors for building a dam and powerhouse on the Nelson River.

title: Sarah Caldwell Leads Original 4Hour Don Carlo
description: BOSTON, May 23When Sarah Caldwell produces a work with her Opera Company of Boston, she generally tackles it from an unusual angle. So when she decided to do Verdi's Don Carlo, she went back to the original version, which was written for the Paris Opera and first presented there in 1867. She led her production at the Orpheum Theater here last night, all four and a half hours of it.

title: U.S. Reserve Assets Fell To $12.9Billion in April
description: WASHINGTON, May 23United States reserve assets fell $27 million to $12.9billion in April, the Treasury Department reported today. Dollar equivalents have not been revalued to reflect de facto conversion rates.

title: Soybean Futures Rise by Daily Limit
description: Soybeans climbed the daily permissible price limit of 20 cents a bushel once again yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Weis Being Studied By Stock Exchange
description: The New York Stock Exchange confirmed late yesterday that it was looking into the financial situation of Weis Securities, Inc., amid reports of financial irregularities. Weis is a member firm that does a substantial reail business.

title: EARL E. BEYER
description: Earl E. Beyer, a former partner in Baker, Weeks & Harden, stockbrokers here, died yesterday in Greencastle, Ind., where he had been living in retire ment. He was 87 years old.

title: Football Transactions
description: NEW ORLEANSSigned Preston Riley, wide receiver.

title: Half a Loaf on Berlin
description: Leonid I. Brezhnev's visit to West Germany must have produced everything Chancellor Willy Brandt had hoped forexcept a clearcut statement on Berlin. The Soviet Communist leader heaped praise on his host, signed economic and cultural agreements that could substantially advance dtente, and pledged Moscow's cooperation building a new Europe of peace, mutual trust and reciprocally advantageous cooperation among all countries.

title: Chess: Premature Attack Invites The Catastrophic Riposte
INDICTED CITY AIDE HONORED AT PARTY
description: Mayor Lindsay and 400 others raised about $40,000 last night in a gala reception at the St. RegisSheraton Hotel or the legal defense of Norman A. Levy, former president of the city's Tax Commission, who is under indictment on charges of fixing parking tickets in Brooklyn.

title: The Summaries FIRST ROUND
description: MEN'S DIVISION

title: U.S. Options Plan Scored By Commodities Industry
description: WASHINGTON, May 23A Government proposal that would limit dealings in highly speculative commodity options to persons or concerns outside Federal control was vigorously attacked by the commodities industry here today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SOUTHPORT, England, May 23 (Reuters)  Phil Rodgers, who flew 7,000 miles from California to compete in the Benson & Hedges matchplay golf tournament here, was defeated today in the first round He lost on the 20th hole to Bob Shearer, a 24yearold Australian. The only other American in the field, Ron Cerrudo just squeezed home against Baldo Dassu of Italy. He wen on the 19th hole by sinking a 20foot birdie putt.

title: Senate Speedily Confirms Richardson by 823 Vote
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Senate confirmed Elliot L. Richardson today as the new Attorney General by a vote of 82 to 3, sweeping away its usual rules to hurry the confirmation through and adding praise for Mr. Richardson personally and for his choice of Archibald Cox as special prosecutor in the Watergate investigation.

title: Reserve Board Denies Boston Bank Acquisition
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Federal Reserve Board denied today the application of the parent holding company of New England Merchants National Bank of Boston to acquire the Hancock Bank and Trust Company of Quincy, Mass.

title: Equity Financing
description: The McCrory Corporation yesterday said that about 1,570,000 common stock purchase warrants had been tendered and accepted in response to the company's offer which expired Tuesday. The company's stock closed at 20, down .

title: Primary for Controller
description: The powers of the City Controller are vast, second only to those of the Mayor. He is the city's chief fiscal officer, charged with reviewing the proposed budget, making pension fund investments, paying the city's bills and auditing the spending of public funds. Sitting with the Mayor, the City Council President and the presidents of the city's five boroughs, the City Controller is a member of the Board of Estimate, which adopts the budget, authorizes housing projects, approves contracts with private firms and plays a major role in virtually all other city actions outside the enactment of local laws, which is the prerogative of the City Council.

title: Extra Days for Atlantic City Assailed by Racing Group
description: COLTS NECK, N. J., May 23 (UPI)The president of New Jersey's largest thoroughbred racing association said yesterday the state would lose some $4million in tax revenues be cause of a recent decision alloting additional racing days to the Atlantic City Race Track,

title: City Ballet Source Combines Pizzicato And Paris Piquancy
description: Yes, there is something of the Paris Opera Ballet and the 19thcentury about the ensembles in the New York City Ballet's La Source. With so many pretty girls in pink tutus waving their arms and kicking their legs to Leo Delibes's music, one can just hear a Comte de Cambriolage looking the field over from his box and asking about the third one from the left.

title: The Men of Zeal
description: BOSTON, May 23President Nixon's latest statement on Watergate shows all the signs of haste and desperation. He evidently saw that testimony before the Senate Select Committee and in other forums was bringing the crimes closer and closer to the oval office in the White House, and he sought to soften the impact by further concessions and explanations.

title: Camera Reveals Food Theft From an Upstate School
description: LACKAWANNA, N. Y., May 23 (AP)Photographs taken by a hidden camera indicate largescale theft of food from the Lackawanna High School, it was disclosed today.

title: News Summary and Index THURSDAY, MAY 24, 1973
description: Watergate Investigation James W. McCord Jr.'s former lawyer questioned the credibility of the convicted Watergate conspirator and suggested to the special Senate investigating committee that McCord had participated in an antiAdministration vendetta. The lawyer, Gerald Alch, contradicted some points of McCord's earlier testimony and said that McCord's lawyer, Bernard Fensterwald, once confided, We're going after the President of the United States. [Page 1, Column 8; Text, P. 32.]

title: Notes on People
description: The Vatican's new man in Washington will be the Most Rev. Jean Jadot, a 63yearold Belgian priest. Pope Paul VI named Father Jadot the Apostolic Delegate to the United States. The Belgian priest, who now is the Apostolic Pronuncio in Cameroon and Gabon, will be the first nonItalian papal envoy to this country. Because the United States and the Holy See do not have formal diplomatic relations, the Apostolic Delegate has no official diplomatic rank in Washington. Traditionally, however, the delegate maintains contact with the White House and the Government, and reports to the Vatican on American affairs. Father Jadot replaces Luigi Cardinal Raimondi, who is now in charge of the Vatican department that investigates candidates for sainthood.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: May 24, 1973 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: British Match Bids for Wilkinson Sword Shares
description: The British Match Corporation announced yesterday London it had made a bid to acquire the shares of Wilkinson Sword, Inc. the British razorblade manufacturer.

title: ALCH ON THE STAND
Tass Publishes Summary Of Denial by the President
description: MOSCOW, May 23 (Reuters)  The official Soviet press agency Tass, published today short summary of President Nixon's statement yesterday on the Watergate case.

title: Cornell Dedicates Museum To House Art Collection
description: ITHACA, N. Y., May 23 Cornell University dedicated its new $5million Herbert F. Johnson Museum of Art today.

title: Changing Room Is Critics'
description: The New York Drama Critics Circle yesterday picked The Changing Room, a British import, as the best play of the 197273 season, "The Hot 1 Baltimore as the best American play and A Little Night Music as the best musical.

title: Violence and Terror by Street Gangs Arouse Public Outrage in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 23 Two weeks ago, 9yearold Ronald Hollis was wounded by a stray bullet from a gang fight that broke out on a corner near his home in the Strawberry Mansion section of Philadelphia.

title: Con Ed Sells 6.5 Million Shares for $151Million
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New York sold 6.5 million shares of common stock yesterday to raise more than $151million to help finance a $3.1billion expansion program the power company plans over the next five years.

title: Chrome Imports Ban Asked
description: WASHINGTON, May 23, (UPI)  Leonard Woodcock, president of the United Auto Workers Union said today the United States should resume its ban on chrome imports from Rhodesia because they were unnecessary and also because they were causing widespread unemployment in the American ferrochrome industry.

title: Foundation Honors P.O.W.'s
description: The United States Flag Foundation gave its annual award yesterday to all the returned prisoners of the Vietnam war, according to United Press International. The foundation was founded in 1898. It publishes ilterature on flag history and the flag code and has fought several flagdesecration cases successfully in the courts.

title: KISSINGER AND THO END TALKS IN PARIS
description: PARIS, May 23The United States and North Vietnam today ended an intensive week of talks on how to end violations of the Vietnam ceasefire, and Henry A. Kissinger said significant progress had been made.

title: Countdown Resumes for Crew Going on Skylab Repair Mission
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 23The countdown for launching the Skylab 1 astronauts was resumed early today as engineers raced to outfit the Apollo spacecraft for a repair mission Friday to the overheated Skylab space station.

title: W. R. Morton Keast Dies; Philadelphia Architect, 84
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 23 (AP) W. R. Morton Keast, a wellknown architect here, died yesterday at his home in Bala Cynwyd. He was 84 years old.

title: No School on Primary Day
description: The Board of Education has adopted a resolution to close the city schools to regular classes on Primary Election Day, June 4. Legislative action has set the polling hours from 6 A.M. to 9 P.M.

title: Shipler of Times Is Cited Twice As Two Groups Give Awards
S.E.C. DISCIPLINES LAVENTHOL FIRM
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Securities and Exchange Commission broke new ground to day in forcing an upgrading of quality control standards of certified public accountants subject to the agency's rules of practice.

title: A Conflict Emerges at Hearing: Personal Loyalties vs. the Law
description: WASHINGTON, May 23John J. Caulfield and Anthony T. Ulasewicz broke the law. They conceded that. They know the law.

title: N.C.A.A Playoffs to Open Today
description: Three of the best running teams in recent Eastern intercollegiate competition and one that makes up, for lack of speed with long hitting will open the National Collegiate Athletic Association District II baseball playoffs today at Mercer County Park in Trenton in a twilightnight doubleheader. Seton Hall Temple and Buffalo are the runners. Penn State counts on the long ball.

title: KENNEDY PROMISES HEALTH STUDIES AID
description: BETHESDA, Md., May 23  Senator Edward M. Kennedy told employes of the National Institutes of Health today that he would do his best to defend the nation's medical research effort against what he called the shortsighted health policies of the Nixon Administration.

title: TESTIMONY BY DEAN ON I.T.T. POSTPONED
