title: Joan Dillon Moseley Wed to Gray Bryan 3d
description: PEAPACK N. J., May 26Miss Joan Dillon Moseley was married here this afternoon to Gray McWhorter Bryan 3d. The Very Rev. Canon Gordon Albion came from his parish in Surrey, England, to perform the ceremony in St. Brigid's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Photography
description: LONDON FOR a town with only one major photography gallery, London will be putting on a number, of photography exhibitions during the summer tourist season. And since few of these shows are likely to cross the Atlantic, American visiors will have lots of unfamiliar and unexpected things to see.

title: Congress
description: WASHINGTON  Even for those members of Congress who wish Richard Nixon no political harm, Watergate seemed like an unexpected ally arriving in the last stages of a losing battle.

title: Current Challenge to Rose's Leadership of Liberal Party Could Affect Gubernatorial Race Next Year
description: Alex Rose is not usually given to public invective. His dispassionate and shrewd view of politics and politicians has been one of the secrets of his success as leader of the Liberal party and as a major political figure for a quarter of a centurf.

title: ABORTION CLINICS FACE CRISIS HERE
description: The Center for Reproductive and Sexual Health, Inc., one of the city's larger abortion clinics and one with a mainly outofstate clientele, has become the first to suspend activity as the result of the United States Supreme Court decision in January that made abortion as legal elsewhere as in New York.The nonprofit clinic, at 424 East 62d Street, originally and still generally known as Women's Services Inc., was organized in alliance with the Clergy Consultation Servtice, a nationwide abortionreferral network, under the liberalized 1970 state law.

title: Rogers Ends Argentina Visit, Will Conclude Tour in Jamaica
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 26 Secretary of State William P. Rogers left Argentina tonight for Jamaica and the last leg of a tour of eight LatinAmerican nations.

title: Montreal Alouettes Acquire Two Castoffs From N.F.L.
description: MONTREAL, May 26 (Canadian Press) The Montreal Alouettes have announced the signings of a defensive end, Cecil Pryor, and a cornerback, Phil Price.

title: Good Wheat Crop Is Predicted
description: TRENTON  New Jersey farmers expect to harvest a good deal more wheat this year. According to the New Jersey Crop Reporting Service, wheat acreage for harvest in 1973 is expected to total 41,000 acres, up 6,000 acres from last year and 10,000 acres more than in 1971.

title: JUMPING TITLE TAKEN BY EAST SIDE DRIVE
description: SUMMIT, N. J., May 26Pat Byrne rode East Side Drive to the open jumper championship today by winning two of the three classes at the Watchung Riding and Driving Club horse show.

title: City Council Committee To Meet on Tuesday
description: The following City Council committee is scheduled to meet in the Council Committee Room this week:

title: Cambodian Fighting is Creating New Refugees by the Thousands
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 22  Cambodian war refugees, their numbers increasing by the day, are ining in a bleak present and facing a deteriorating future. Tens of thousands of new

title: Canarsie Market Has Sweet Smell of Success
description: Just mention Canarsie to any Brooklynite over 35, and you will be involved in a tale of wastelands, swamps, garbage dumps and a community built on wet, spongy acreage, with much of the landfill made up of the victims of Murder, Inc.

title: Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS  The estimates brought back by the factfinding team of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization were staggering: At least 5 million and possibly 10 million people in a belt of six countries south of the Sahara are threatened by starvation.

title: New Director, Old Scheme
description: THE Juilliard School's American Opera Center began with high hopes when it was founded four years ago, coincidental with the school's move to Lincoln Center. The opera center was to be a training ground for singers who were beyond the grad. nate. level but not yet of major operahouse caliber. Aside from its value to the students, the company prom. ised to provide New York with productions of nonstand and works under a variety of interesting conductors and stage directors. The new Juilliard Theater would serve as an elegant, admirably equipped showcase for the fresh repertory and youthful artists.

title: Music
description: HEN Rossini died, in 1868, all of the obituary noticesand for this great man there were, obituary notices front St. Petersburg San Franciscopursued much the same line.. What a loss to mankind that Rossini hat not Written an Opera since William Tell in 1829 True, the Stabat Mater had been written during Rossini's retirement after the pramiere of William Tell. A few writers  even knew of the existence of the Petite Messe Solennelle.' 0therwise there was nothing. Or so they Said.

title: Fund's Message Is Heard
description: The foundation, the WallaceEljabar Fund, Inc., has disbursed approximately, $650,000 a year in grants to support activities which will provide public information and the basis for the resolution of problems in New Jersey which might otherwise be ignored or receive insufficient attention.

title: FEED GRAINS YIELD MAY BRAKE PRICES
description: WINTERSET, Iowa, May 26  Skies over the Corn Belt states were hazy and, gray this week. But the hot winds were finally blowing and farmers were working in their fields far into the night, sowing corn and soybean crops delayed by the wettest spring in memory.

title: President Appoints Four United Nations Delegates
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., May 26 (UPI)President Nixon today announced the appointment of four career officials to the permanent United States delegation to the United Nations. They will serve under John A. Scali.

title: Ellen Burke Is Bride Of Jack Orlando Here
description: Miss Ellen Burke, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis D. Burke of New York and Point Lookout, L.I., was married here yesterday morning to Jack Peter Orlando, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ignatius Orlando of New York. The Rev. Richard Dillon performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of the Epiphany.

title: Margaret Eaton Is Wed
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 26  Miss Margaret Barrett Eaton, daughter of Mrs. Jordan Stewart Eaton and the late Mr. Eaton, was married here this morning to Leonard Francis Pinto Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Pinto. Both families are of Stamford. The Rev. Joseph Haffernan performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Cecilia's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Susan Young, Jonathan Mark Plan to Marry
description: ROCHESTER, May 26Dr. and Mrs. Donald Adam Young have announced that their daughter, Miss Susan Elizabeth Young and Jonathan Ira Mark will be married on June 10. The future bridegroom Is the son of Mrs. Fred W. Friendly of Riverdale, the Bronx, New York, and the late Sandor Mark.

title: Among Harriet's ancestors are Clarissa, Emma and Cathy
description: After Claude by Iris Owens a love story with a weirdly happy ending and an extraordinary heroine who, in telling the story, displays capacity for wisecrack and invective aimed at Catholics, blacks, Jews, Communists, liberals, short people, Arabs, Frenchmen and others. In brief, she has a democratic and indefatigable style of bigotry which resembles the satire of Lenny Bruce, but it is authentically hers because it is inspired by her personal problems. She admits to being entirely conscious of none of them. We know, for example, that she is a tall woman, but, through her denigrating references to short people, we must guess that she sees herself as a Jewish Watusi.

title: London Shop Supplies Rare Breed of Reader
description: No. 1 Lower Grosvenor Place in London never will qualify as a bustling building. In fact, it has a Dickensian character what with two brougham lamps flanking an oldfashioned plate glass window. You might expect, to meet Tiny Tim inside. There is a small hanging sign over the door. The top half shows an open book with Show a horse on each side. Underneath is a name: J. A. Allen. The building houses the only bookstore in the world devoted exclusively to horses and Allen has been the proprietor since 1926. Horse Show News 1926. Horse Show Show 1926.

title: The record of a struggle with prose and life
description: Recovery, posthumously published, is John Berryman's unfinished and only novel. It is also, in every willed page, a turn away from the dangers and enrichments of his poetry. It was probably being written at the same time as Delusions, Etc., verse published after his suicide last year, and the two books should be read as parallel last acts. The word he chose as title for his final poems drums through the novel as well: delusion is no longer a bitter, halfaffectionate way of designating his writing, but rather the deadly enemy that keeps him from facing down an alcoholism that will destroy him. In an odd way, Delusions, Etc. and Recovery might make up one book  could even be printed in alternating verse and prose, like a dark parody of Dante's Vita Nuova, Berryman's struggle leading nowhere, not into Paradise:

title: Skylab
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla.The pressure of history may have hardened earlier astronauts, particularly the first men to walk on the moon, but it is the pressure of the future that weighs heavy on the men of Skylab 1.

title: OFIELD VICTOR ON 684 SHOTPUT
description: KANSAS CITY, Kan., May 26 AP)Brian Oldfield put the shot 68 feet 4 inches in the Professional Track Association meet tonight, failing in a bid to break the world indoor best of 7010 he set tet night at salt Lake City.

title: Why Do Young People. Love Lemmings'?
The Aftermath
description: For all of its apologies, the statement did not stop suspicions and criticisms, any more than did his statement of last Aug. 28 that no one then employed in the White House had been involved; nor his April 17 statement acknowledging the possibility of White House involvement; nor his April 30 television appearance in which he implied that two innocent men, Messrs. Haldeman and Ehrlichman, were being wrongly hounded out of office.

title: C. L. Fisher 3d Weds Miss Myers
description: WASHINGTON, May 26In the Bethlehem Chapel of the Episcopal Cathedral of SS. Peter and Pawl here this evening, Miss Christine Gueydan Myers, daughter of Dr. and, Mrs. Richard C. Myers of Bethesda, Md., became the bride of Chester L. Fisher 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Fisher Jr. of Briarcliff Manor, N. Y.

title: The Scandal
description: Like the words in the old hymn about Jacob's ladder, the investigations into the Watergate and related scandals kept climbing higher... higher... higher last week into the White House hierachy and in other directions as well. These were the major developments:

title: Jazz/Rock/Folk/Pop
description: NEGRO ENSEMBLE COMPANY, St. Mark's Playhouse, 133 Second Avenue. Novella Nelson, S and 8:40 P.M., next Sunday, 2:30 P.M.

title: New Briefs
description: BELFAST, Northern May 26 (Reuters)A fouryearold boy died tonight after shot in the head during a fight here between soldiers a sniper.

title: Calendar of Horse Show Events
description: TodayHelping Hand, Mr. and Mrs. Alan Corey, Jr. estate, Lewis Path and Wheatley Road, Old Westbury, L.I. Regular, green, amateurowner and junior working hunters; ponies, equitation. 8:45 A.M.

title: Cosmos Rout Apollos, 50, As Fink Scores 3 Goals
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., May 26Joe Fink, a 21yearold American who learned his soccer on the sandlots in Queens and at New York University, scored three goals in his first professional soccer league game tonight to lead the New York Cosmos to a 50 victory over the Atlanta Apollos.

title: Abigail Peterson Wed To Thomas A. Reilly
description: MIDDLETOWN, N. Y., May 26  Miss Abigail Janet Peterson, a lecturer in speech and theater at Lehman College in the Bronx, was married here this afternoon to Thomas Anthony Reilly, assistant professor of political science at Trinity College in Hartford.

title: Numismatics
description: HAT old slogan of the ripoff artists, Caveat Emptor (Let the Buyer Beware), seems to be going into a slow but steady decline in the numismatic hobby. Protection for the buyer is becoming the new, watchword. And this change is not the result of any outside pressure, not even from the pnblidity about the hopedfor Fibbby Protection law. The change is coming from the best possible source within the hobby itself.

title: Miss Schwalje Wed To William Eaton
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., May 26Miss Paula Schwalje and William Baker Eaton were married here at noon today in the Voorhees Chapel of Douglass College.

title: Sing Sing: The View From Within
description: We had a photography course here lately, a sixweek course by The Floating Foundation of Photography. It was really appreciated by a lot of inmates, as we looked forward each week to the instructors coming in. Most of us had never used a camera before in our lives, and you should have seen useager to learn and full of enthusiasm, trying to outdo the other guy with a better picture. It was a great, beautiful thing, a damn good accomplishment having that course here.John Conroy, No. 145490.

title: Marisol: A Humorist In Three Dimensions
description: MARISOL  Surname Escobar, a 4Iyearold native of Venezuela  has been showing regularly in New York since the early sixties. She is usually considered a Pop artist, though her work has rarely had much in common with mainstream Pop besides a taste for large scale and a certain mixture of coolness and blatancy. Once a student of William King, she is essentially a satirical sculptor, a humorist in three dimensions. Her rather chic wit, sometimes tapical and frequently surreal, is the main resource and limitation of her art.

title: The Statement
description: The statement, like others before it, seemed largely designed to answer the latest charges while offering no information beyond what was required for a legalistically exact reply. The President said that from the time he entered office in 1969, there was deep concern in the White House about leaks of national security mattersdetails of talks on arms limitations, the Pentagon Papers, and so onand about domestic violence and unrest. Accordingly, the White House set up special investigative units with a Presidential mandate to get to the bottom of it all. Against that background he made the following admissions:

title: Fairleigh Graduates Urged to Speak Out
description: RUTHERFORD  Supreme Court Justice William 0. Douglas exhorted the graduating class of Fairleigh Dickinson University last week to play, its rightful role in the governmental processes by upholding the people's constitutional sovereignty over peace and war and the struggle to maintain a livable environment. He seemed hopeful that the young would rise to that task.

title: Southern Pacific Mainline Reopens After Explosions
description: BENSON, Ariz., May 26 (AP) Southern Pacific Railroad's transcontinental mainline was open today, two days after 12 cars loaded with 500 pound boas caught fire and exploded.Al Bradshaw, an SP spokesman, said crews had installed sections of prefabricated track around the scene of the explosions that destroyed 200 yards of railway.

title: And Bruno Takes Showers With His Socks On
description: I HAVE for some time thought Steve Tesich, whose plays are normally seen only by subscription audiences at the American Place Theater, one of the most promising young dramatists lurking in the land. now think he's crazy. And I'm glad he's crazy because if, in this desperate time of our lives, we can't have orderly plays we might as well have funny ones. Baba Goya, now being seen by subscription audiences at the American Place Theater, is as funny as it is inexplicable.

title: 70 Bergen Police Study Car Safety
description: HACKENSACK  Seventy members of the Bergen County Police Department took part in a safedriving program and 13 officers and nine patrolmen attended a lecture on barricaded emergencies and civil disorders during April.

title: Soccer Scores at the Box Office
description: Now that the nine North American Soccer League teams have played at home and openingday crowd figures are available, Phil Woosnam, commissioner of the league, says the sport has turned the corner.

title: OTTAWA LEARN TO TRUCE PULLOUT
description: OTTAWA, May 26With a decision expected in the next few days, a majority of Canada's Cabinet reportedly favors ordering the Canadian peacekeeping force out of Vietnam, ending a fourmonth exercise in frustration.

title: The Knack of Keeping Matter Over Mind
description: People in many parts of the world adopt this levelheaded approach to the problem of transporting bulky objects. The technique is not so  prevalent in the U.S., but it is not unheard of either. All these pictures were taken abroad, except for the one directly below; it was snapped outside a Connecticut supermarket.

title: Country cousin to a city apartment
description: Most families would ask for a total change of pace for their weekend house. But that wasn't the case with the Peter Lowensteins. They liked the plan of their city apartment so much (an open livingdining area, a master bedroom on a balcony loft and the children's rooms tucked behind) that they asked architects Chimacoff/Peterson for the same thing in their weekend house at Montauk, Long Island. But the architects immeasurably improved on the package. There was no need, for instance, for the party walls that hem in a city apartment. Without them, they achieved a lightfilled house, rimmed by decks and opened to the outdoors with wide windows. The 900 square feet of indoor space is greatly expanded by 600 square feet of surrounding deck. The long deck faces south to the ocean and looks over a grassy plateau where the Lowensteins play volleyball and badminton. Opening off the living room at the west end of the house is an outdoor room, a semienclosed area with an upper walkway that is both an observation deck and a platform for sunbathing. Completed last year, the house cost slightly less than $90,000; inflation has since added an additional $5,000 to$10,000 to that price.

title: Virginia Stott Sets Nuptials
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., May 26The engagement of Miss Virginia Elizabeth Stott, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard T. Stott to Louis Palombit Jr. has been announced by her parents. Mr. Palombit is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Palombit of Grosse Pointe Shores, Mich.

title: Horse Vaccination Is Urged by State
description: TRENTON  A second warning to horse owners to have their animals vaccinated against eastern and western encephalitis before Friday has been issued by Dr. C. Kenneth Jewell, director of the Division of Animal Health of the Department of Agriculture.

title: The Other Primates
description: Darwin's notion that man is a little closer to the apes than the angels no longer provokes storms of righteous indignation. In fact, considering mankind's performance in this century alone, there is some comfort in the thought that we are kin, in physiology and behavior, to these comparatively gentle beasts.

title: HATANOI OFFENSIVE THOUGHT UNLIKELY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 26United States intelligence analysts say they believe the likelihood of a North Vietnamese offensive in the near future diminishing and that it appears the Communists intend to concentrate instead on political activity.

title: Prophylactics Law Is Eased
description: ELIZABETH  A littleknown New Jersey law that prohibited drugstores from displaying prophylactics on their counters has been amended to allow such advertising. Thus ended a controversy over the application of the edict since its enactment in 1898.

title: Officer Fiance Of Miss White
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. L, May 26Mrs. Frederick John Leary Jr., of Locust Valley, and Gardiner Winslow White Jr. of Atlantis, Fla., have announced the engagement of they daughter, Miss Elizabeth Blaine White, to Mariano Antonio das Neves Pitta Tavares, son of Dr. and Mrs. Antonio Tavares of Lisbon. An August wedding is planned.

title: Wendy White Is Bride
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., May 26  St. Paul's Episcopal Church here was the setting this afternoo for the marriage of Miss Wendy Elizabeth White and Lewis Thomas Winger. The Rev. Thomas Lee Crum and the Rev. Philip C. Douglas officiated. The bride is the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Linden Harris White Jr. of Nantucket. Mr. Winger is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Small Winger of Georgetown, S. C.

title: Architecture
description: OUT of the scandals of the Nixon administration comes a curious survivor: the arts. While social programs are axed with a cruelty visible only to those who see the individual death of hope, and Watergate shakes the national morality and the Federal establishment to their foundations, the arts, traditional stepchild of government, are doing very well, thank you. This year's appropriation for the National Endowment for the Arts, headed by Nancy Hanks, seems to be on the way to being doubled, and all programs are cooking with gas.

title: Sonic Arts Union Playing 72 Hours Of the New Music
description: The Sonic Arts Union is an electronic and newmusic collective that manages to embrace a healthy range of postserial styles. Two of its four members were founders of the ONCE Festival in Michigan.

title: ASTRONAUTS BOARD SPACE STATION AND PARTLY DEPLOY SOLAR SHIELD; SKYLAB CABIN FOUND CLEAR OF GAS
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., May 26  The Skylab astronauts finally boarded their massive space station today and unfurled a parasol over its roof tonight in an effort to make the overheated vehicle habitable for, a planned 28day, mission.

title: John Ward Is Fiance of Jennifer Brown
description: FRANKLIN LAKES, N. J., May 26The engagement of Miss Jennifer Lorraine Brown to John Bessom Ward has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Sherwood Gilbert Brown, father and stepmother of the future bride. Her fiance is the son of Ralph E. Ward, president and chief executive officer of ChesebroughPond's, Inc., and Mrs. Ward of Greenwich.

title: It Was Minnie's Musical Mecca
description: GRIMY, graffiti scarred, with crumbling masonry, it looks like an abandoned fort. In an area of Manhattan that once knew better days, it waits with sullen,, gloomy patience for the wrecker's ball that will, some time this summer, demolish it for an elaborate complex of school buildings.

title: C.J. Parsons Weds Christina Johnson
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., May 26In the Scarsdale Community Baptist Church this afternoon, Miss Christina Anne Johnson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Evan A. Johnson Jr., was married to Charles J. Parsons, son of Armine M. Parsons of Hiltons, Va., and the late Mrs. Parsons. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Herbert W. Hansen, assisted by the Rev. Paul V. Beam.

title: U.S. PLANES STRIKE CAMBODIAN TARGETS
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 26 (UPI)American warplanes struck suspected Communist positions along the Mekong River southeast of Phnom Penh and along Highway 5 to the northwest today.

title: Coulton Waugh, 77, Cartoonist, Author of The Comics, Dead
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., May 26Coulton Waugh, artist, cartoonist and author, died at his home here Wednesday. His age was 77.

title: Bridge
description: Plays aimed at cutting the opponents communications are among the most difficult and subtle in the game. Great foresight may be required, especially if the hand at which the play is aimed seems well supplied with entries.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  When it comes to oil, the Nixon Administration is pursuing objectives that officials say privately are in conflict.

title: Nobody Digs the Clam Rights
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I.  A source of revenue that could fatten the coffers of Suffolk County and its five Eastern towns has been untapped for four years because the county has not surveyed and mapped the shellfishrich lands underwater of Gardiners and Peconic Bays.

title: Niger Will Flow on Film
description: THE RIVER NIGER, which flowed swiftly from Off Broadway to Broadway last March, will soon be surging onto the screen. The Negro Ensemble Company's presentation of Joseph A. Walker's powerful play has been acquired for the movies by Sidney Beckerman, the independent., producer who recently resigned as head of Allied Artists Productions. Shooting is expected to begin here in the fall.

title: Michael's Homer Leads Yankees to 105 Victory
Penn Eight Defeats Cornell By a Length on Schuylkill
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 26Penn's varsity eight defeated Cornell by one length in winning the Crawford Madeira Cup an the Schuylkill River today. The red and blue heavyweight crew covered the 2,000meter course in 5 minutes 50.1 seconds. Cornell was clocked in 5:53.8.

title: Susan L. Chambers, Interne, Is Married
description: YORKTOWN HEIGHTS, N. Y., May 26  Dr. Susan Lynn Chambers, a surgical interne at the Peter Bent Brigham Hospital in Boston, was married here this afternoon to Dr. Murray Frederick Brennan, a senior resident in surgery at the hospital. Msgr. James Lynch.performed the ceremony in St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Legislature Approves Measure to Curb Powers of Urban Developrnent Agency
description: ALBANY, May 26With Democrats raising charges that the bill was racially inspired, the Senate late this afternoon gave final legislative approval to a plan allowing towns and villages in the state to exclude lowincome and moderateinhousing projects sponsored by the State Urban Development Corporation.

title: A Day of One's Own
description: JACKSON, Miss. A week before it was announced that she had won the Pulitzer Prize for her novel, The Optimist's Daughter, Eudora Welty woke up one morning to find herself a local celebrity, with her name on billboards and in neon lights. In long career, never lacking in honors, it was a new kind of public/private tribute devised by proud fellowMississippians  and it went to everyone's heart, including the publicityshy author's: for a full week (May 16) in her hometown of Jackson a whopping Eudora Welty Celebration was staged as part of the 10th annual Mississippi Arts Festival. An ingenious idea, which pooled the resources of some 1,000 enterprising committee members throughout the state and brought together a multitude of the writer's friends, it spotlighted the uniqueness of Miss Welty's career in American letters.

title: Sunday Observer By Russell Baker
description: We started school back in the Middle Eisenhower Period, toddlers paws in ours, crossing at the marked intersection under the stern benignity of good Officer Riley, who was doomed a dozen years later to become bad pig cop to a lot of those kidswe always called them kids then  to whom he taught survival. The nineteensixties were lurking out there, though we didn't suspect it, of course, never guessed at the future of hair, grass, Beatles, cop hate, Vietnam, televised state murders waiting out there in the future to shame us and shape the people our toddlers were going to become.

title: Nixon Copter Crashes
description: A Secret Service agent was killed and six other were injured last night in the crash of a Presidential helicopter off Grand Cay, the Bahamas, Reuters reported. Neither President Nixon, who was visiting the island, nor members of his family were aboard. Page 33.

title: Browsing for Goods From the Land of Mao
description: A couple from Great Neck, L. I., stopped off in Dallas en route to California last month to buy two of the antique Chinese court robes that NeimanMarcus had been advertising at $1.500 to $5,000 apiece. A Californian ordered one by telephone for his daughter.

title: The glorious garlic
description: The Greeks fed garlic to gamecocks before a fight to fuel their tempers. Anyone who has eaten raw garlic will understand why this worked and why garlic should have been a popular metaphor for ferocity in the ancient world.

title: Equal Access
description: Equal access to the law has always been the intention, but not always the fact, under the Constitution. In the House of Representatives last week, the Education and Labor Committee sent to the floor, somewhat liberalized, a proposed Administration bill providing legal services to the poor, but there is doubt about which version, if either, will become law. The Supreme Court, meanwhile, has been fashioning judicial doctrine. Here is a report on its rulings.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Extensive Evaluation of Priests in the Brooklyn Diocese Runs Into Resistance
description: Among tte more than 900 priests affiliated with parishes and institutions of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, it is known as the evaluation thing. Some wish it would go away.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: BOOM TIMES are good, times, the dictionary tells us, periods of rapid economic expansion, prosperity, rising wages and profits and fairly full employment. This is the situation in the country today. So why are we feeling so depressed?

title: GIRARD COLLEGE IN A NEW BATTLE
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 26A new controversy at Girard College, an orphans school that fought a 14year court battle to uphold its founder's racial segregation policy, heated up this week in a battle of news conferences. A group of mothers of students and the school's alumni association are seeking to oust the school's president, Dr. Gayle K. Lawrence, on charges of gross ineptness.

title: Murrow Center Picks Chief
description: MEDPORD, Mass., May 26 (AP)The appointment of Philip Clark Horton, former editor of The Reporter magazine, to be director of the Edward R. Murrow Center of Public Diplomacy was announced yesterday by Tufts University.

title: For 2 Students at Stony Brook, a Flight to Tel Aviv is All in a Day's Work
description: STONY BROOK, L.I. For two students at the State University center here, a weekend trip to Paris, London or Tel Aviv is as common as a daily trip to the university.

title: Valerie Boltz Married to Stephen Austin
description: CEDARHURST, L.I., May 26  Miss Valerie Ann Boltz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Emmet Boltz, was married here today to Stephen Bradford Austin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Earl B. Austin, Jr. of Auburn, Me. The ceremony was performed in St. Joachim's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Joseph D'Angelo, the assistant pastor.

title: New Jersey
description: ACTORS CAFETHEATER, 263 Central Avenue, East Orange Waiting for Godot, by Samuel Beckett. Thursday through Saturday, 8:30 P.M. (through June 22). $3.50$3.90; students, $2 $2.90. (201) 675.1881.

title: 128POINT MARGIN POSTED BY ITALY
description: GUARUJA, Brazil, May 26Italy won the world bridge team championship in the early hours of this morning, crushing the defending champion Aces in the final and regaining the Bermuda Bowl. The Italians last won in 1969.

title: PIRATES VICTORS OVER ASTROS, 72
Summer Season Begins in Hamptons
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I.Long Island's population rose by more than a quarter of a million people yesterday as the swingers, the wealthy, the artists and the aristocrats left the five boroughs of New York and the wintering spots of Palm Beach and Majorca for the annual pilgrimage to what is perhaps the most intensively cultivated resort area of the East Coastthe 100 miles of sand from Montauk Point to the Fire Island inlet.

title: A mostly sorry story
MARYLAND GAINS LACROSSE FINAL
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., May 26  The University of Maryland's lacrosse team, ranked first in the nation, advanced to the final of the third annual National Collegiate Athletic Association championship tournament rather easily today with an 187 triumph over Washington and Lee at Byrd Stadium.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: School Sex Bias Fought
description: The New Jersey chapter of the National Organization for Women answers with an emphatic yes and is taking legal action against school boards throughout the state to prove it.

title: Washington Bridal For Cynthia Weller
description: WASHINGTON, May 26In St. John's Episcopal Church, Lafayette Square, Miss Cynthia Elizabeth Weller was married this afternoon to David Eugene Spray of Middleburg, Va. The Rev. Felix Kloman, who christened and confirmed the bride, performed the ceremony.

title: A Program At Stevens Is Aiding Delinquents
description: HOBOKENAfter almost 28 years of helping young people and grownups to find careers that suit their aptitudes, a group of scientists at the Stevens Institute of Technology is embarking on a program of dealing with juvenile delinquency.

title: Miss Josephine Corner Martin Bride of Richard Henry Bayard
description: WILMINGTON, Del., May 26Miss Josephine Corner Martin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John McKenzie Martin, and Richard Henry Bayard, were married here this afternoon by the Rev. Charles MacDonald in the Greenhill Presbyterian Church.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Miss Menge Has Bridal
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 26Miss Ann Menge, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Dodd Menge, was married here this evening to Nathaniel Barton Loomis. Both are of New York, where the bride is an associate editor in the promotion department of. Harper's Bazaar. Her husband is chief executive officer of the Defensive Security Corporation of Huntington Station, L. I.

title: AFRICAN NATIONS CLASH AT PARLEY
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, May 26Libyan and Ethiopian officials exchanged insults tonight at the 10th anniversary celebration here of the Organization of African Unity.

title: Pepitone Quits Again
description: ST. LOUIS, May 26 (AP)Joe Pepitone, who was obtained by the Atlanta Braves in a deal with the Chicago Cubs on May 19, has decided to quit again. He informed Manager Eddie Mathews of his decision tonight.

title: Danny the Red 5 Years Later
description: PARIS, May 26Two names dominated the events of May, 68. They were Charles de Gaulle and Daniel CohnBendit. Both are gone.

title: New ovel
description: Victorian Africa is the scene of another of Alan Scholefield's bluechip adventure novels. As the curtain rises we find Lord and Lady Lamming on a multicamel safari to Abyssinia, where he hopes to bag a rare ibex. Their guide is exCapt. John Franklin, a sometime advisor to Theodore II, the reigning Negus. As are the author's earlier novels about the confrontations of the Zulus with the British, and the Hereros with the Germans, this one is a tightly packed mixture of fact and spellbinding.

title: A Moonscape In Cambodia
description: If the picture in South Vietnam is one of receding war, the opposite is true of Cambodia. In a lengthy dispatch last week from Phnom Penh, the Cambodian capital, New York Times correspondent Sydney H. Schanberg had this to report:

title: Cahill Housing Bills Stalled as Legislature Leaves
description: TRENTON  Among the Casualties of this year's abbreviated legislative session Was Governor Cahill's housing program.

title: Tornado Kills 4, Hurts 15 In Eastern Oklahoma Town
description: KEEFETON, Olda., May 26 (UPI)  A tornado smashed through this Eastern Oklahoma community today, killing four persons, injuring at least 15 and destroying much of the town.

title: Son to Mrs. John Byers Jr.
description: DARIEN, Conn., May 26A son was born May 10 at Greenwich Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. John Crawford Byers. Jr. Mrs. Byers is the former Miss Victoria Read Kelly of New Orleans. Her husband is vice president of the Raymond & Whitcomb Company, a New York travel agency founded in 1879. The child has been named John Crawford Byers 3d.

title: School Districts Increasing
description: TRENTONDespite a national trend toward reducing school districts by consolidating them, there has been an increase in such districts in the state.

title: Boy Hurt in a Fall
description: A 14yearold Brooklyn boy suffered second degree burns and a fractured skull last night when he slipped off a Long Island Railroad tunnel, grazed a hightension line and fell 16 feet to the tracks, the Fire Department reported. The boy, Joseph Darragh, who was reported in serious condition at Elmhurst General Hospital, had been climbing with friends on the tunnel at 21st Street and 49th Avenue, about a mile from his home at 95 India Street in the Greenpoint section.

title: A View From Fiery Run
description: FIERY RUN, Va.Up here in the foothills of the Blue Ridge, a lot of people have television sets even if they don't have central heating. It is better to be cold than lonely. If you have sense enough to get off the superhighways and wander slowly through these flowering coves and valleys, you will see the TV aerials on the cabin roofs on Rattlesnake Mountain, and even on chicken houses in Little Africa, and people here have been watching the Watergate hearings with mounting interest and concern.

title: Nature Is Lifelong Interest of New Sanctuary. Director
description: BERNARDSVILLE  The old stone house on Hardscrabble Road is being prepared to welcome a new tenant. Come June 4, and Mr. and Mrs. Richard Kane he is the new director of the Scherman Wildlife Sanctuaryand their two preschool children (Martin and David) will occupy the residence.

title: Miss Elizabeth Harris Is Married
description: BETHESDA, Md., May 26 Miss Elizabeth Harris, daughter of Gregg Harris of New York and Mrs. Joan Harris of Silver Spring, was married here this afternoon to Edward Dugger 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Dugger Jr. of Dayton, Ohio. The Rev. Lewis A. McGee, grandfather of the bride, performed the ceremony in the Cedar Lane Unitarian Church.

title: Hackensack Awaiting Collectors Of Rocks
description: HACKIENSACKWhile other people are still in bed, the rock hound's perfect weekend may begin at 7 A.M., when he dons old clothes, packs a hard hat and safety goggles and heads for a quarry. Once there, he digs in the mud on hands and knees, hoping to tote home a backbreaking bagful of prize minerals.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Like the lion tamer who leaves his hospital bed to stick his head once more into the lion's mouth, the noble sport of boxing is about to plunge again into the alldevouring maw of television. The fisticuffing racket took a dreadful mauling the last time it became involved with TV and was chewed almost beyond recognition. Only its inherent toughness permitted it to survive. Although it no longer is the boisterous brawler it once was, at least it still is. alive. It has been living in such a reduced, enfeebled state for many years, however, that the average sports follower probably neither knew nor cared whether it still existed. But then would come an electrifying event like Joe Frazier and Muhammad Ali or shocking events like George Foreman against Frazier and Ken Norton against Ali. Suddenly the bustedbeak industry would be transported back to the giddy days when it commanded attention and enraptured a large segment of the population. Sports of The Times the population. Sports of TheTimes the population.

title: MISS STEIERT GETS 3 DEVON RIBBONS
description: DEVON, Pa., May 26Mary Ann Steiert, a slim blonde from Malvern, Pa., who advances to the senior division in seven monthsmuch to the relief of her rivalsrode the winners of two championships today at the Devon Horse Show.

title: Busing
description: WASHINGTONHow can you bring racial balance into a city school system that is 70 per cent black and growing blacker? That was the problem that the city of Richmond faced in its efforts to comply with the Supreme Court's integration edicts.

title: Camera World
description: SEVEN courses in still photography and four in filmmaking are being offered by the School of Visual Arts, 209 East 23d Street, as part of their summer program. All are evening classes that will meet from 6:40 to 9:40 on Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursday, starting June 12. Inperson registration takes place at the school from June 47 from 6 to 8 P.M., or by mail before June 6. The photography courses include three on basics, one on experimental techniques, one on blackandwhite printing, one on color printing, one on creative conar. Tuitions range from $80 to $120, and for applications or more information those interested can write to the school or call (212) OR 97350.

title: Presidential Copter Crashes Into Ocean
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (Reuters)The Secret Service said that one agent was killed and six injured tonight when Presidential helicopter crashed on a flight from Key Biscayne, Fla., to Grand Cay in the Bahamas.

title: Chrissie and Rosie and the Arm and Billie and Wendy
Nixon Files Yet Another Legal Brief
description: WASHINGTONThe man who had endured with pride so many crises was caught under what one of his still functioning lieutenants called a Niagara of accusations in the Watergate and related scandals. In characteristic manner, the President responded.

title: Calendar of Dog Show Events
description: Plainfield Kennel Club allbreed show and obedience trial at St. Joseph's High School, Plainfield Avenue, Metuchen, N.J.; 1,950 entries; 8 A.M.

title: Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRESEighteen years after Juan Domingo Peron was overthrown by a widely supported military coup, the Peronists are back in power.

title: Naturalist Unravels Insect Life on Film
description: ENGLEWOOD  Spending the week by filming a colony of praying mantises or tent caterpillars may not be everyone's idea of a heady experience, but for Campbell Norsgaard it is great joy.

title: Drive Is On to Acquire Somerset Estate
description: BERNARDSVILLEConservationists hereabout have mounted an intensive drive to raise between $60,000 and $120,000 as a down payment on a choice piece of property that they want to preserve as a public park. The land will go on the open market by July 1.

title: Music: Carole King's Casual Journey
description: Carole King in Central Park yesterday, a free holiday affair (although the TV special derived from this appearance with attendant cast of thousands will doubtless not be to the networks) was predictably an event as well as a concert. Miss King's familiarity of repertory coupled with a molelike attitude to public display, more or less guaranteed it.

title: Sorcery Is Said to Lead Equation by 20 Minutes in Block Island Sailing
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., May 26 Sorcery was the first yacht observed today at the halfway point of the Storm Trysail Club's 200mile race around Block Island. James French Baldwin's 61foot Cuthbertson Cassian sloop had a 20minute lead on Equation, according to the Coast Guard, and reached the southeast point lighthouse at 8:30 A.M.

title: SPOTLIGHT
Harvard Medical School Accepts 165 for Fall Class
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 26 (AP)  The Harvard Medical School has admitted 165 students to its fall entering class.

title: Miss Bushey Is Bride on L.I. Of Paul Cooke
description: MANHASSET, LI., May 26 In St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church here at noon today, Miss Catherine Joan Bushey, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis B. Bushey, was married to Paul Kiernan Cooke, son of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Cooke of. Garden City.

title: Massachusetts Gets Grant
description: BOSTON, May 26 (AP)The Massachusetts Division of Water pollution Control has been awarded a $529,100 grant from the Environmental Protection Agency to establish and maintain adequate measures for the prevention and abatement of water pollution.

title: FILM PRIZES GIVEN AT HILTON FETE
description: Prize winners of the 15th annual American Film Festival were announced last night at the closing banquet of the fiveday assembly at the New York Hilton Hotel. Winners were selected from 36 categories with more than 250 entries. The festival is sponsored by the Educational Film Library Association.

title: Music in Review
description: Lois Whiteman is a pianist of tasteful restraint, smooth technical facility and cultivated musical instincts. All the works on her Carnegie Recital Hall program last Saturday afternoon were modestly scaled, but within this frame of reference her performances made sound sense.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Daughter to the Goughs
description: WESTFIELD, N.J., May 26 A daughter was born April 29 to Mr. and Mrs. Peter J. Gough at the Overhiok Hospital in Summit. The child has been named Sarah Courtney.

title: Gardens
description: BEARDED irises, herbaceous peonies and day lilies head the list of essential garden peren nials; Blooms of all three are big, beautiful and brilliantly colored. Plants are vigorous, hardy and longlived. All flower profusely, and are ridiculously easy to grow. Together, the Big Three can turn a runofthe mill landscape into a gorgeous showstopper.

title: Miss Eppridge Wed to R. F. Norum
description: HOCKESSIN, Del., May 26  Miss Mary Randall Eppridge and Roger Frank Norum, both of New York, were married here this afternoon in St. Mary of the Assumption Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Edward Carley, assisted by the Rev. J. Francis McDonough.

title: To Make May Complete
description: It often seems that snow melts, ice breaks up on the ponds, brooks surge in spate, hepaticas bloomand then all at once catbirds are nesting in the untrimmed lilac at the corner of the lawn and brown thrashers are filling the apple trees with songs to match their blossoms. May slips past so swiftly that April almost merges with June.

title: Trying to Defuse a Bomb
description: CAPETOWN  Following trends in South Africa is a little like trying to track an animal over stony African ground. Much of the time one has to make do with a broken twig here, a bit of crushed grass there and scuff marks that lead nowhere.

title: Nuclear Power
description: Soon after the first experimental nuclear power plant began operating in 1951, scientists and utility companies began to dream of thousands of cheap, clean, nonpolluting atomic reactors serving a nation increasingly hungry for electricity.

title: Soviet Team Wins Shooting; W. Germany Is 2d, U.S. 3d
description: PFORZHEIM, West Germany, May 26 (UPI)  The Soviet Union won a threenation shooting meet today, with West Germany second and the United States third.

title: 460 Pounds of Revenge Waits to Fall on Russian
description: Chris Taylor has waited nine months for his revenge against the Russians.

title: CENTROWITZ RUNS 1:54,6 HALFNILE
description: I really didn't expect to have to run that hard, said Matt Centrowitz of Power Memorial after he won the 880yard run yesterday in the Catholic High Schools New York Section track and field championships at Mount St. Michael, the Bronx.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Summer doubles By Patricia Peterson; Caftan news; Seeing double? Not really. The long caftan, which has captured the hearts of women with its flattering lines, has been joined by a shorter version this summer. The kneeskimming caftans are cool alternatives for city summer wear. You'll also be seeing them by the pool, on the croquet lawn and buying corn and tomatoes at the roadside stand.
Letters: Do Travel Writers Pollute?
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Don't People Go To the Movies They Don't Go To?
description: HOLLYWOOD STARING out of the advertisement is a picture of Elliott Gould with a cat on his shoulder. He is holding a can of cat food. The line of type reads, I have two friends in the world. One is a cat. The other is a murderer. The ad blanketed the Los Angeles area last March. United Artists was sure it had a winner in Robert Altman's The Long Goodbye, starring Elliott Gould as Raymond Chandler's detective, Philip Marlowe.

title: About the Race
description: Event200 laps around the 2mile asphaltonbrick track, sanctioned by United States Auto Club, but open to NASCAR, S.C.C.A., Grand Prix and other drivers through international F.I.A. listing; does not count in world standings because of engines up to 4.2 liters against Formula One limit of 3 liters.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE TRADE BALANCE of the United States improved substantially in April for the second consecutive month and moved into surplus for the first time since September, 1971. Exports in April rose to a record $5.49billion while imports dropped to $5.29billion.... Gold in London closed Friday at $106.50 an ounce, up $1 from the week before. Occidental Petroleum and El Paso Natural Gas are negotiating a deal with the Soviet Union to build a 2,000mile pipeline from western Siberia to Murmansk to supply natural gas to the West Coast of the United States.

title: Chess: A Losing Position Can Offer At Best a Choice of Evils
description: The same logic is required to find the best move in a losing position as in a winning position, yet the two tasks are psychologically worlds apart. Hours of struggling with a critical disadvantage leaves a player wrungout and punchy; even when turn in the play goes in his favor he is often unable to take the chance it offers.

title: Kicking the Secrecy Habit
description: LIVERMORE, Calif.The harnessing of energy from controlled nuclear fusion is one of those elusive scientific developments that, when finally achieved, promises immense benefits to all of mankind. At the seventh international Quantum Electronics Conference in Montreal last year an exciting (though distant) possibility was discussed openly: the production of fusion by concentrating laser light on extremely small droplets of a liquid deuteriumtritium mixture.

title: 128PONT MBE POSTED BY ITALY
description: GUARUJA, Brazil, May 26Italy won the world bridge team championship in the early hours of this morning, crushing the defending champion Aces in the final and regaining the Dermuda Bowl. The Italians last won in 1969.

title: Criminals At Large
description: To recapitulate: Michael Innes is the pen name of John Innes Mackintosh Stewart, who was born in 1906 and has been writing mystery stories for longer than even he would like to remember. He is the creator of John Appleby, formerly of Scotland Yard, now Sir John and retired., Officially retired, that is, But crime follows him around, as it does in APPLEBY'S, ANSWER (Dodd, Mead $4.95).

title: John Wain Gets Chair in Poetry From Oxford
description: LONDON. May 26Oxford University chose its Professor of Poetry today with the selection, by ballot, of John Wain. Though Mr. Wain has written poetry, he is better known as a novelist and critic

title: LOUIS RAPP
description: Louis Rapp, an executive in the men's Wear industry for many years, died Friday at his home in Monroe, N.Y. His age 64.

title: Steel Mills And Ecology
description: The chairman of the Republic Steel Corporation put it this way:

title: Candidates'
description: Representative Herman Badillo started his day of campaigning in high spirits, saying in jest that the threatening clouds had been seeded by Controller Abraham D. Beame.

title: 4 Die in Fire on French Ship
description: THORSHAVN, Faeroe Islands, May 26 (Reuters)Four seamen were found dead in their berths today when firemen put out a blaze aboard a French trawler that caught fire at sea on Thursday night.

title: A Great Big Ugly Man Came Up and Tied His Horse to Me; A Book of Nonsense Verse. Illustrated by Wallace Tripp. 46 pp. Boston: Little, Brown & Co. $5.95. (Ages 4 to 8)
description: There can never be enough nonsense for children, and there's enough craziness in this collection to bring a smile or a laugh to everyone!

title: Headliners
description: The military custom of, using enlisted men as domestic servants for generals and admirals has come under smallarms fire from a oneman guerrilla band in Congress, Senator William Pioxmire. An investigation conducted by the General Accounting Office at Senator Proxmire's request has found that the custom costs $21.3million a year; military training schools for the servants cost $360,000 a year some servants were being used, contrary to policy, for such chores as babysitting and dog walking. Last week departing Defense Secretary Elliot L. Richardson, responding to the criticism, announced a 28 per cent reduction in the number of servants in the program and said the abuses would be halted. He said the cutback would be phased out to avoid hardship and inconvenience to the enlisted men.

title: Son to Mrs. Lembeck
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Morton B. Lembeck of New York on May 6 in the Klingenstein Pavilion. Mrs. Lembeck is the former Miss Jacqueline Fish of Logan; W. Va.

title: Omnibus Racing Bill Is Viewed as a Mixed Feedbag
description: Political patronage appears to be a major ingredient of the state's now omnibus racing and betting bill, but enough legislative oats have been included to make the ailing horse industry healthy.

title: Wall St. Weathervane
description: Wall Street hasn't been really happy since 1968. It went through the trauma of 1969 and 1970 and then seemed to recover, but now it has fallen on hard times again. Red ink and mergers are commonplace.

title: Bayonne May Lose Its Trains
description: BAYONNE  There were strong hints from the state's Department of Transportation last week that drastic curtailment or a complete cutoff of the Jersey Central's commuter service to Bayonne is imminent.

title: ABORTION CLINICS FACE CRISIS HERE
description: The Center for Reproductive and Sexual Health, Inc., one of the city's larger abortion clinics and one with a mainly outofstate clientele, has become the first to suspend activity as the result of the United States Supreme Court decision in January that made abortion as legal elsewhere as in New York.

title: Met Games This Week
description: TodayAt Los Angeles. TomorrowAt San Francisco. TuesdayAt San Francisco, night. WednesdayAt San Francisco; ThursdayOpen date. FridayAt San Diego, night. SaturdayAt San Diego, night.

title: Susan Magennis. Married to Physician
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., May 26 Susan McAllister Magennis, daughter bf Mr. and Mrs. Jack McAllister Magennis, was married here this noon to Dr. Stephen George Underwood, son of Mr. and Mrs. John T. Underwood of Roslyn Heights. The Very Rev. Harold F. Lemoine performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation, of which he is dean.

title: DOBERMAN JUDGED MONMOUTH BEST
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., May 26A beautifully moving Doberman Pinscher, Ch. Galaxy's Corry Carina, captured bestinshow honors today in the annual Monmouth Country Kennel Club fixture.

title: 5 Accused West Point Cadets Contest Academy Panel's HonorCode Procedures as Unconstitutional
description: Five West Point cadets, in a Federal lawsuit believed to be the first of its kind, have challenged as unconstitutional the procedures by which the cadet honor committee administers the venerable honor code of the United States Military Academy.

title: Miss Bresnan Becomes Bride
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., May 26Miss Patricia Bresnan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Bresnan of Pelham, N. Y., and Peter McCallion, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry McCallion of Pelham and Cutchogue, L. I., were married here this morning in the chapel of Wesleyan University by the Rev. Paul Schweitzer.

title: Helen Powell Wed to L. F. O'Brien 3d
description: Miss Helen Marie Powell was married here yesterday afternoon to Lawrence Francis O'Brien 3d, son of Lawrence Francis O'Brien, former Postmaster General of the United States, and Mrs. O'Brien of New York and Washington. The bride is the daughter of Irwin Augustus Powell of New York and the late Mrs. Louise Behn Powell of St. Jean de Luz, France.

title: Nation's Meat Consumers Are Still Angry but Less Rebellious
description: Today's meat prices may be making the American housewife unhappy, but she does not seem to be as rebellious as she was two months ago.

title: Art
description: THE annual Ceremonial of the American Academy of Arts and Letters and the National Institute of Arts and Letters took, place this year on the afternoon of May. 16. New membersLeon Edel and Richard Wilbur for the Academy, Jasper Johns and Allen Ginsberg (among others) for the Institutewere inducted into the ranks of both organizations. The usual medals and awards were bestowed, each accompanied by its own perfect nosegay of flattering epithets, and there were, of course, the customary speeches. This year the principal address was given by the distinguished Argentine editor, translator and belleslettrist, Victoria Ocampo.

title: the traveler's world
description: NOW is the time for all who travel by air between Canada and the United States to come once again to the aid of the efficient, timesaving and very successful practice of customs preclearance, which is customs inspection of passengers prior to takeoff rather than after landing. This is the second time this year this &arum has been sounded. The first was in February when the U. S. Customs Bureau bureaucracy almost succeeded in its attempts to scuttle preclearance of travelers departing Canada, Bermuda and the Bahamas for the States.

title: Motor Calendar
description: Today and tomorrow  New England Region, Sports Car Club of America national championship races at Thompson (Conn.) Speedway. Today: practice and qualifying: noon; 1:30 P.M., races:. 2 P.M. Tomorrow: practice: 10 A.M. Races: 1 P.M.

title: Catholic School Celebrates 100th Year
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I.Long Island's oldest Catholic private elementary school, Sacred Heart Seminary, 95 Fulton Avenue, recently cele brated its centennial, with an oldfashioned country fair complete with home crafts and a white elephant sale.

title: Long Hours And Success
description: Twenty years ago Charles R. Stuber left his job on the railroad and went to work in a gasoline station.

title: Irate Senators Shelve Move to Investigate Political Corruption
description: TRENTON  During the legislative session that just ended, the Republican leaders of both houses were largely successful in preventing any airing of the corruption charges that have been leveled repeatedly against the Cahill Administration.

title: WALL
description: Over the last decade, one group of stocks that has endeared itself to the hearts and walletsof the investors is the specialized area of automotive parts. These companies manufacture both original equipment and replacement parts, thereby tying themselves quite profitably to this nation's love for automobiles.

title: EXUGANDAN HEAD CHARGES GENOCIDE
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzanla, May 26Dr. Milton Obote, deposed as President of Uganda in January, 1971, by a military coup d'etat, has broken his 28. month silence to accuse his successor, Gen. Idi Amin, of the killing of tens of thousands of Ugandans.

title: Public Use of Beaches Faces Navy Court Test
description: TRENTONNew Jersey's summerVacation season officially arrived this weekend, and with it another suit against the. restrictions that many shore communities use to. keep the public and nonresidents off their Atlantic beaches.

title: Scandal
description: TRENTON  He was without doubt the most successful kingmaker in New Jersey's recent political history. He was instrumental in switching the New Jersey delegation to Richard M. Nixon in the first ballot nomination at the Republican National Convention in 1968. Less than a year later, he chose a relatively obscure Congressman, William T. Cahill, and made him the ultimately successful Republican candidate for Governor by initially delivering the decisive Bergen County Republican organization in the primary. Nelson G. Gross was one of the country's most successful young Republican leaders.

title: Government Paid $39,525 To Improve Nixon's Home
description: MIAMI, May 26The White House said today that Governmentfinanced improvements to President Nixon's estate in San Clemente, Calif., amounted to $39,525 and were mostly dictated by security measures.

title: Dance
description: I FORGET quite when it was I coined the now often quotedand often misquotedphrase that the. Stuttgart Ballet was Germany's ballet miracle. It must have been at least eight years ago, when people were still talking about West German recovery and expansion as Germany's economic miracle. It was at the end of 1960 that John Cranko began his close relationship with the Stuitgart Ballet, and a year later that the Opera House's Intendant, a gentle poet but firm administrator, Walter Erich Schafer, invited Cranko to accept full control of the ballet. (Dr. Schfer retired last year and his successor, Hans Peter Doll, seems to be equally committed to the idea of a ballet company of international renown in Stuttgart.)

title: Summer Job Aid Released But Legislator Is Critical
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (UPI) The Labor Departnient released an additional $33million for summer jobs for youths today, but drew criticism from RepreSentative George M. O'Brien, Republican of Illinois, for withholding $239million in Neighborhood Youth Corps funds.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development announced yesterday a grant of more than $1million to develop a socialservice center to serve 65,000 residents in South Jamaica, Queens. The center, to be built at Linden and New York Boulevards, will provide comprehensive health service and day care and will be administered by the Southeast Queens Community Corporation, a community action group.

title: Tick Count Found High, Advice Given
description: TRENTONThe State Department of Health reports evidence that the tick population is high this spring. The tick may carry Rocky Mountain spotted fever and other diseases.

title: The House Wishes It Would All Go Away
Soutine as Artist and Victim
description: As much as Van Gogh, and in some ways more, Chaim Soutine serves the popular imagination as the archetype of the artist with a capital A, a creature whose alldemanding genius drove him unsparingly through life to an early, unhappy death.

title: President Urges Congress To Act on Devaluation Bill
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (UPI) President Nixon urged Congress today to move on legislation involving the Administration's 10 per cent devaluation of the dollar last Feb. 12.

title: Governor Wins Approval For His City U. Board Plan
description: ALBANY, May 26The Legislature today narrowly approved the latest version of Governor Rockefeller's proposal to install gubernatorial appointees on a new Board of Higher Education, the governing body of the City University of New York. The vote was 32 to 27 in the Senate and 76 to 65 in the Assembly.

title: Navy's Trackmen Capture I.C.4A Title With 41 Points
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J. May 26Navy won the 97th annual I.C.4A outdoor track and field championship today, its first title since 1946.

title: Nassau Warns of Possible Infestation of Dishonest Exterminators of Termites
description: WESTBURY, L.I.  The problem with termite infestation is that when the termites swarm, so do dishonest salesmen peddling unnecessary jobs, said Albert Gottesman, assistant executive director of the Long Island Better Business Bureau.

title: Miss Lucy Castles Wed to John Hough
description: DARIEN, Conn., May 26Miss Lucy Shepherd Castles and John Duncomb Hough were married here this afternoon in the chapel of the Noroton Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Lawrence McColl Horton.

title: Vermont Bishop to Retire
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., May 26 (AP)The Right Rev. Harvey D. Butterfield, the sixth bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Vermont, announced this week that he would retire on June 12, 1974.

title: African Liberation Day Marked By a March and Rally in Harlem
description: About 1,500 people gathered in Harlem's Col. Charles Young Park yesterday for a rally to observe the second annual African Liberation Day in support of the struggles of blacks in Africa and elsewhere.

title: Yank Games This Week
description: TodayTexas at Yankee Stadium, 2 P.M.

title: SETON HALL OUSTED IN N.C.A.A. BASEBALL
description: WEST WINDSOR TOWNSHIP, N. J., May 26 (AP)Jack Don, a catcher, drove in four runs as Temple beat Seton Hall today, 4.2, in the National Collegiate Athletic Association Dittrict II baseball playoffs to eliminate the Pirates.

title: But So Do Many Other Lawyers
description: WASHINGTONAlong with the disparate and unusual aspects of the Watergate Investigation have come legal questions not often encountered by most people following the case. One most often raised concerns the relationship between the Ervin Committee and the Washington grand jury.

title: Davis Regaining Speed After Crippling Injuries
description: LOS ANGELES, May 26Mad Anthony Davis, the Southern California whizz who reeled off six touchdowns against Notre Dame, appears to be bouncing back well from the severe automobile accident that jeopardized his athletic career four months ago.

title: Students Turn Seamen for Ecology
description: Twentytwo Queens College science students, half of them women, were on a fourday cruise recently between City Island in the Bronx and Mystic Conn., aboard a 71foot converted racing yacht. Some got seasick, but none were discouraged.

title: 8 Top Drivers Compete Tomorrow at Saratoga
description: Two more drivers have been confirmed for the Battle of Stars at Saratoga Harness tomorrow afternoon. noon.

title: SHOP TALK
description: MORRISTOWNThe thrift shop operated by the Market Street Mission is as big as a department store of respectable size, and offers about as great a variety of merchandise, All the articles are secondhand; they have been contributed to benefit the mission, which has been housing, counseling and rehabilitating homeless men since 1889.

title: Donna Lee Kendall Affianced To Irwin Joseph Pass Warren.
description: Miss Dams Lee Kendall; assistant to the fashion consultant at Saks Fifth Avenue, and Irwin Joseph Pass Warren, vice president and associate creative director of Cunningham & Walsh, the advertising agency, plan to marry here in August.

title: There Was a Time
description: That we have a leadership crisis today, even a leadership vacuum, hardly needs spelling out and underscores the contrast between 1776 and 1973.

title: Field Hockey Assn. NORTHERN DIVISION
description: DIVISION I

title: Hawthorne. OldTime Religion Updated
description: HAWTHORNE  It's the people that really count, not just the buildings,". the Rev.

title: Sewage Plant Set. For Raritan Bay
description: SAYREVILLEThe largest grant ever awarded by the state's Department of Environmental Protection for the construction of a watertreatment facility  $22.2millionwas made last week to the Middlesex County Sewerage Authority. It is a a project to increase the capacity of a seweragetreatment plant and thus alleviate pollution in Raritan Bay.

title: Anne T. Starr Engaged to a Lieutenant
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., May 26 Miss Anne Townsend Starr, a group research manager with the Westinghouse Broadcasting Company in New York, plans to be married July 21 to Lieut. Stephen Stewart Cunningham of the Air Force, who is stationed at Kirtland Air Force Base in Albuquerque, N. M.

title: Perfect Day on Mound, At Bat for Schoolboy
description: CHERRY VALLEY, N. Y., May 26 (AP)For 18yearold Alan Whiteman, yesterday was a perfect day for baseball.

title: Britain
description: LONDONFor the British watching the Watergate case, there is an element lacking, a crucial ingredient that always seems to turn up whenever there's scandal in high places here. That ingredient, of course, is sex.

title: Child to Mrs. R. D. Jaffe
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 26 A daughter was born last Saturday to Mr. and Mrs. Richard D. Jaffe at the Stamford Hospital. The child has been named Marisa Lyn. Mrs. Jaffe is the former Miss Miriam Margolin of Mount Vernon, N. Y. Mr. Jaffe is president of SciTex North America. Corporation here.

title: In Search of Security
description: In a lengthy public statement and again in a speech to former prisoners of war, President Nixon has retreated into a fortress called national security as his ultimate defense shelter against the storms of Watergate. The tapping of telephones, the illegal breakins and burglaries, the creation of a secret police staff operating outside the supervision of Congress or any duly authorized Federal agency, the collection and disbursal of huge sums of cash for undercover activities, and the obstruction of an F.B.I. investigation are all justified because foreign agents and domestic radicals threatened the security of the nation. It is an extraordinary argument which has enjoyed repeated use in recent decades. It is time that argument received careful examination.

title: Nadjari Agents Seize Policeman In Brooklyn on a Bribery Charge
description: Agents of the special state prosecutor, Maurice. H. Nadjari, arrested a 24yearold police officer at Coney Island early yesterday on a. charge of having accepted a $2,000 bribe to alter his testimony in the pending trial of a man accused of being a narcotics dealer.

title: Social Announcements
description: Mrs. Gwendolyn L. Gaul and Mr. Harold Brown exchanged marriage vows on Saturday May 26th, in Tillman Chapel, at the Church Center for United Nations. Also attendance were Mrs. Gaul's two nephews, Kevin Robinson and Alexander Lewis, Mrs. Joan Guthrie was matron of honor. Mr. Len C. Zeferetti was best man for Mr. Brown. The bride wore champagne sleeveless princess type gown with matching jacket. To complement her gown she wore camolet head piece of matching fabric trimmed with Alencon lace. Her bridal bouquet an unadorned mass of cymbidium orchids. The bride is a secretary with Department of Social Services. Her husband is a correction officer and first vice president of Correction Officers Benevolent Association.

title: My Onward and Upward Mobility
description: WHEN we were children, my next older brother Albert and I would see sightseeing buses on the streets. We also saw ,posters that said See America First. We were willing to start modestly. Hey, Al. How about we start with New York? We saved penny upon penny, each night measuring the growing pile. Thirtytwo cents to go... 28 cents to go... 10 cents to go... Over the top!

title: Susan Schroeder, Designer, Fiancee
description: HAMMONDSPORT, N. Y., May 26  Mr. and Mrs. C. Frederic Schroeder have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Martha Schroeder, to William Milford Bethke, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert H. Bethke of Armonk.

This is largely because in international competition, unlike domestic competition, governments as well as enterprises are involved, and the laws and practices of the United States Government are nowhere near as helpful to exporters as are the laws and practices of other governments.

The Italian Government said it had granted them asylum.

title: AROUND THE
description: After last weekend's deluge, catch up wherever possible on everything: planting, weeding, mowing, pruning and trimming... Fungus spores spread in wet wether so be alert for rose black spot and lawn troubles.... When everything is finished, enjoy the long weekend.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW

description: SOME plants in the home vegetable garden don't attract pests, or the few they may have do little harm. As a class, herbs are more or less immune.

description: Perhaps the ultimate test of a great ballet, apart from the unrelenting test of time, is whether it can look like a great ballet in the context of a merely good performance. New York City Ballet seems to be having almost an epidemic of injuries, with some programs changed and many oddly varying casts. I think that all of the 12 dancers appearing in Jerome Robbins's Dances at a Gathering at the New York State Theater on Friday night have been in the ballet before, but many were dancing sections of the ballet (for the cast can be used, as it were, as movable feasters) unfamiliar to them.

title: Television
description: NO AREA of the communications explosion demands more attention than cable television, and no area is more ignored and less understood by the general public, Everyone agrees that cable TV could eventually have vast social and political ramifications. Yet discussions on the development of cable have generally been limited to special interests.

title: Home Improvement
description: BUILTin central vacuum cleaning systems are one of the newest and fastest growing (in popularity) major home appliances, and the reasons are not hard to understand: They eliminate the need for dragging a cumbersome machine from room to room or floor to floor; no dusty air is recirculated inside the house, it is vented directly to the outside; they are extremely quiet (the motor unit is in the basement or garage); so there is no need for shouting or disturbing other members of the house when vacuuming, and there is no problem with hearing doorbells, telephones or radios while the machine is in

title: Murrow Center Picks, Chief
description: MEDFORD, Mass., May 26 (AP)The appointment of Philip Clark Horton, former editor of The Reporter magazine, to be director of the Edward R. Murrow Center of Public Diplomacy was announced yesterday. by Tufts University.

description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, May 26 (UPI)New Zealand's Prime Minister, Norman E. Kirk, has said that there is something of a case for a greater distinction between the New Zealand and Australian flags, since they are often mistaken for each other in Asia.

Charles Ehrhart in St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Today Hartford
description: On the surface the travail of the New York Giants is all over now. The team will be able to play in the Yale Bowl right through 1975 while its new stadium in New Jersey is being built, and a plan has been worked out so that the games at Yale can be televised over the Hartford station, Channel 3, as in the past. However, the National Football League's blackout policy, which the owners regard as the keystone of their solvency, has been compromised by the accommodation to the Giants, an action that also enhances the view of Senator of Rhode Island. title: Freighter Solitaire: Life on the Endless Saucer of the Sea
description: JANUARY. I have taken sea passage from New York for Le Havre and board an American freighter whose sides bleed winter rust. I am her sole passenger. My cabin is high above the water, at the after end of the boat deck. It contains two bunks; I select the inboard one. There are three large closets in the peagreen room and an adjoining bath. A framed notice advises me that meals will be served at 7:30 and 11:30 in the morning, and at 5 in the afternoon. A Chinese steward fetches my luggage from the head of the gangway. His vocabulary consists of a few mandatory words of English. He and 46 other men and officers make up the ship's

description: The Brooklyn Councilmanic races this year will definitely produce the city's first Puerto Rican Councilman and possibly boost the number of Republicans on the City Council.

Emerson Craig of Longmeadow, Mass., and the late Mr. Craig. The Rev. Henry Powers performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Atonement.

title: Timothy Brown Weds Miss Linda Rohman
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 26Miss Linda Rohman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Rohman of New York, was married here this afternoon to Timothy Brown, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Houston Brown of Cambridge, Mass. description: DEWEY, Okla., May 26 (UPI)  The State Legislature this week rescued the financially troubled Tom Mix Museum with a $30,000 appropriation. The museum's board of directors and the Oklahoma Historical Society had been near to closing the museum because of debts and is considering a change in the name of the museum. Tom Mix just doesn't seem to draw anymore, said Bill Halter, the board chairman,

description: ALBANY; May 26 (AP)The Assembly minority leader, Stanley Steingut, has issued his second apology to the Albany Medical Center on behalf of two Democratic Assemblymen who harassed a female hospital technician last February.

description: PLAINFIELDWhen Fred Linc Guirty and his family moved to Plainfield a little more than a year agoout of New York by way of Paterson he was impressed by the fact that this city of 50,000 did not seem to offer much in the way of music.

title: A pathetic life and powerless to change it
description: At the beginning of this English novel Virginia Fly, the heroine, is 31 and a virgin. She lives, resignedly, at home with an intolerable mother and a wet father, and she teaches school in a London suburb. In the middle of the book she loses her virginity, humiliatingly, to an American pen friend of 12 yearsCharlie, from Utah, who is on his first visit to London. At the end of the novel she marries, reluctantly, an elderly, unpassionate professor of music.

description: Robert Matos, John Kopka, Jose Cabassa, Vic Werbin and Steven Faille all live at the Young Men's Christian Association in Jamaica, Queens. Their last place of residence was in a state prison.

description: WASHINGTON  As the number of illegal entries into the United States continues to rise, the morale of those charged with enforcing the immigration laws continues to drop; and, as morale in the Immigration and Naturalization Service worsens, corruption spreads within its ranks. That at least, is how some Federal agents investigating the Immigration Service explain the problems besetting that agency.

title: Watergate Fallout
description: WASHINGTONThe morning after the release of his detailed statement on Watergate, President Nixon met with a group of 22 Republican Senators and Representatives. When the session was over, they gave him a standing ovation, and later some of them echoed his explanation of the scandal's origins.

description: PASADENA, Tex., May 26 (AP)Alfred Daley anchored Essex Community College of Newark to a national junior college record for the onemile relay last night in the national junior college outdoor track and field championships. Essex qualified for the final in 3 minutes 9.1 seconds.

description: Out an open window of home on a peaceful, treelined street in Queens, waft the notes of a Steinway baby grand piano in combinations and patterns never heard publicly before.

description: ACROSS
