description: AUGUSTA, Me., May 27 Gov. Kenneth M. Curtis said he hoped the boundary dispute between. Maine and New Hampshire could be worked out on a friendly basis so that lobster fishing could continue without further incident.

title: Candidates Day
description: Representative Herman Badillo was both aided and upstaged by a Congressional colleague, Representative Ronald V. Delurns, on a walking tour through Harlem yesterday afternoon.

title: A Lawyer's Thoughts
description: I don't know whether Richard Nixon should be impeached. It's one thing to let him run the country, but it's another thing to let him practice law. As the facts come in, we ought to examine his conduct by standards now in use by, the. American Bar Association. The New York and California Bar Associations should now begin their own investigations. This is not a premature suggestion, for even if John Mitchell, Maurice. Stans and others are acquitted, Mr. Nixon's conduct may be such that he should be disbarred, or, at the very least, disciplined.

title: KIDNAPPING SUSPECT JUMPS FROM A ROOF
description: A 19yearold Queens girl imiplicated in a bizarre kidnaping case last year suffered critical injuries yesterday when she plunged from the roof of a six;story apartment building in Flushing where she had visited a close relative.

title: Finch Named Trustee
description: LOS ANGELES, May 27 (AP) Robert H. Finch, a former counselor to President Nixon, has been named a trustee of Occidental College, of which he is a 1947 graduate.

title: Allegation of Staff Violence Tainting Rome State School
description: ROME, N.Y.  For many parents of retarded children at the Rome State School in upstate New York, it is a familiar scene. The child comes home for a visit, covered with welts and bruises. The school says the child took a fall or got into a fight with another child. The child says an attendant beat him.

title: Rizzo's Four Goals Spark 6.5 Brookville Polo Victory
description: BETHPAGE, L. L, May 27Paul Rizzo scored four goals and led Brookville to a 65 polo triumph over Muttontown today in the opening match of the season at Bethpage State Park. Muttontown was paced by Ted Brinkmann and Fred Braunstein with two goals each.

title: Navy's Racial Trouble Persists Despite Long Effort to Dispel It
description: SAN DIEGO, May 27In the six months since racial disorders erupted on two aircraft carriers at sea, the first reactions of shock and anger within the Navy have given way to a period of. quiet.

title: Analysts Doubt Efficacy Of Fed's Lending Curbs

description: METUCHEN, May 27 A new rule requiring druggists to keep medical profiles of customers has pharmacists in the state scurrying to comply within the prescribed 30day limit.

title: Legislature Passes Bill Raising Lawmakers Salaries 60% in 75
description: ALBANY, Monday, May 28The Legislature early today passed, without debate, a bill that would increase lawmakers salaries in 1975 by nearly 60 per cent and grant them $40aday expense accounts.

title: French Family Survives Its Growing Pains
description: PARIS, May 27  When, in the winter of 1968, Richard Jarville started to grow his hair and slouch around and wear studiously tattered blue denims, his father, Simon, could barely tolerate the sight of his older son at table in the family's sumptuous apartment on the Right Bank.

title: Soviet Union Joins Copyright Nations
description: MOSCOW, May 27Confusion appeared to reign inthe Soviet publishing industry and among writers as Moscow's adherence to theInternational Copyright Convention became effective to day.

title: McCord Lawyer Linked To False Statementin '65
description: LOS ANGELES, May 27Bernard Fensterwald Jr., attorney for James W. McCord Jr., the convicted Watergate burglar and conspirator, made false statements and false implications during his questioning of a key witness while serving as counsel to a Senate, subcommittee investigating electronic snooping in the midnineteensixties, sources close to that investigation said today.

title: DiplomaDenial Ruling Awaited
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn is expected to rule shortly on whether the United States Merchant Marine Academy acted constitutionally in denying a diploma to a former cadet from Irvington, N. J., because of his secret marriage.

title: MEDIATORS NAMED IN AFRICAN DISPUTE
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiobia, May 27A commission made up of leaders of five African nations was set up today by the Organization of African Unity to mediate a border dispute between Ethiopia and Somalia.

title: G.O.P. in Nebraska Says $10,000 Check Is Missing
description: LINCOLN, Neb., May 27A $10,000 check reportedly sent to the Committee for the Reelection of the President last June by the Nebraska Republican party was never cashed and is still missing, two state Republican officials acknowledged yesterday.

title: Capitol's Secret Places Provide Hideaways and Tidbits of History
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 Within the manylayered honeycomb of offices, corridors, stairwells, cubicles, closets and numberless niches and cubbyholes of the nation's Capitol, there are many places that no tourists ever see.

title: Jacques Lipchitz, Sculptor, 81, Dead
description: Jacques Lipchitz, one of the foremost sculptors of the 20th century, died Saturday of a heart attack at the hotel where he was vacationing in Capri. He was 81 years old.

title: BAKER CAPTURES WORLD 600 AGAIN

description: PARIS, May 27 (AP)Herve Frayssineau of France beat George Burns 3d of Manhasset, L. I, 1 up, today for the French amateur golf championship.

title: REGIME IN GREECE SAID TO PLAN VOTE ON KING'S FUTURE
description: ATHENS, May 27  Two Athens newspapers reported to day that the armybacked Government had decided to hold nationwide referendum soon to allow the Greeks to determine the future of the exiled King Constantine.

title: Bill Bradley Warns Class of Materialism
description: JERSEY CITY, May 27William Warren Bradley, former Rhodes scholar, rumored political aspirant and small forward for the New York Knickerbockers, urged the graduating class of St. Peter's College today to choose a life of introspection and contemplation and to reject the excesses of materialism.

title: Borough Presidencies
description: Two good candidates of unusual promise confront oldline, organization opponents in Democratic primary contests for Borough Presidencieson June 4. In each case, the Democratic nomination is virtually the equivalent of election.

title: OPEC and Oil Companies Avert Showdown on Prices
description: VIENNA, May 27The major oilexporting nations and the biggest petroleum companies have backed away from a showdown over oil prices and decided to continue to negotiate their differences.

title: Ferraris Run 1,2 in 1,000 at Nuerburgring
description: ADENAU, West Germany, May 27 (AP)Jackie Ickx of Belgium and Brian Redmond of Britain drove a Ferrari 312P to victory today in the grueling 1,000 kilometer (621 miles) race at the Nuerburgring, the seventh leg of the World Manufacturers Championship series. More than 200,000 spectators lined the 14mile course that winds through the Eifel Mountains.

title: Report Brands Watergate A Low in Election Tactics
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The Fair Campaign. Practices Committee called the Watergate affair today the low point in campaign tactics since the committee began monitoring political campaign activities nearly 20 years ago.

title: Roselle Catholic Captures Parochial A Track Title
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., May 27Chris Inman of Essex Catholic won the mile in 4 minutes 14.2 seconds and Tim Conheeney of Paramus Catholic the twomile in 9:16.8 at the New Jersey parochial track and field championships today at Williams Field.

title: Michael J. Heaney Dead; ExHead of Security Traders
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., May 27 Michael J. Heaney, senior partner in Michael J. Heaney & Co., stockbrokers, 120 Broadway, New York, who had been active on the American Stock Exchange for 50 years, died today at his home here. He was 68 years old.

title: Harmon Cardozo, 59, Dies; A Realty Executive Here
description: WESTPORT, Conn., May 27 Harmon H. Cardozo, a New York real estate executive and member of the representative town meeting here for 16 years, died today at his home, 7 Hidr den Hill. He was 59 years old.

title: Ulster Families Are Prisoners of Violence
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland In the small, cluttered living room of Noel and Brigid Hopkins Sunday is like a prison.

title: Israel Seeks to Widen Japanese Trade
description: TOKYO, May 27Last week an Israeli Cabinet minister urged the Japanese, who have been accused of discriminating against Israel, to ignore Arab threats of boycotting Japanese exports and to improve their trade relations with Israel.

title: DODGERS SUTTON SUBDUESMETS, 24

description: LINCOLN, Neb., May 27The Watergate issue kept intruding into the 66th meeting of the American Baptist Churches in the U. S. A., which ended here today.

title: Henry at 50
description: Friends of Henry Kissinger gave party for him on the occasion of his 50th birthday last Saturday night.

title: Bank's Chairman Resigns
description: SAN DIEGO, May 27 (AP) C. Arnholt Smith, 74 years old announced yesterday he was resigning as chairman of the board of the United States National Bank after a banking career that spanned 56 years because of the pressures of duties.

title: French Driver Is Killed
description: MONTBRISON, France, May 27 (AP) A French racing driver, Richard Antracoli, was killed today when his car crashed off the road into tree and then a telegraph pole while he was competing in hillclimbing meet.

description: KATMANDU, Nepal, May 27 (AP)Four Japanese and a Sherpa guide were buried by an avalanche at 20,000 feet on May 18 as they tried to climb the 26,500foot Annapurna peak in northwest Nepal, the Foreign Ministry said today.

description: Neil Tarangioli of Fordham Prep defeated his teammate, Jim McNamara, 6.4, 3.6, 63, yesterday to win the varsity singles tennis championship of the Fordham University invitation tournament on the Bronx campus. Fordham Prep won the team championship with 191/2 points.

title: 80 Toast Kissinger For 50th Birthday
description: Henry A. Kissinger's 50th birthday was celebrated Saturday night at a private party at the Colony Club attended by some 80 friends, including at least three couples whose telephones he reportedly had had bugged.

title: 2 Schools Succeed in Teaching Reading Where Others Fail
description: Public School 91 in Brooklyn's racially changing Crow Heights section is an anomaly for it is one of a handful schools in the city with a pre dominantly black and Hispanic enrollment that have higher readingproficiency scores than the national average.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FOOD FOR THOUGHT Alex, the beluga whale, is be coming a research worker and, if he does well, he'll put on weight. Alex works at the Nev York Aquarium, at the Coney Island boardwalk and West 8th Street, Brooklyn (2668500), where he is one of four of his kind, the only beluga whales in this country.

title: IRONBOUND AREA HONORS VETERAN,
description: NEWARK, May 27In a colorful display of national and neighborhood pride, the hetetogenous population of Ironbound, with roots in Italy, Portugal, Cuba, Hungary, Poland and Ireland, today saluted the dead, the missing in action, the returned prisoners of war and the millions of Americans who served and survived on the batlefield.

title: ROSE SEES CURE FOR URBAN BLIGHT

description: ALBANY, May 27The Assembly approved today a bill permitting New York City to create a sports authority to construct or acquire sports facilities to attract professional and amateur teams or to keep those already in the city.

title: Rain Threatens to Still Indy 500 Motors Today

description: One thing about the Safari Now boutique at Bonwit Teller is that its rather exclusive stock is constantly changing, so the women who pay the prices that prevail there are not likely to see themselves coming and going.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, the Soviet Nobel prize winner, has warned his former wife, Natalya Reshtovskaya, that she has no right to publish letters written by him to her in her projected memoirs.

title: Allegation of Staff Violence Tainting Rome State School
description: ROME, N.Y.  For many parents of retarded children at the Rome State School in upstate New York, it isa familiar scene. The child comes home for a visit, covered with welts and bruises. The school says the child took a fall or got into a fight with another child. The child says an attendant beat him.

title: Bill Bradley Tells Class To Escape Materialism
description: JERSEY CITY, May 27William Warren Bradley, former Rhodes scholar, rumored political aspirant and small forward for the New York Knickerbockers, urged the graduating class of St. Peter's College today to choose a life of introspection and contemplation and to reject the excesses of materialism.

title: Argentine Guerrillas Vow More Attacks
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 27Despite a wideranging amnesty for political prisoners approved today by the new Argentine Congress, leftwing guerrillas vowed to continue their attacks against businesses and the armed forces.

title: Beame Is Leading in the Polls, But Rivals Question Strength,
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame is in the lead as the campaign for the Democratic nomination for Mayor enters its final week, officials of the various campaign teams said yesterday.

title: Harvard Conquers Providence to Gain Finals in Baseball
description: BOSTON, May 27 (AP)Harvard University defeated Providence College, 81, today to win the National Collegiate Athletic Association District baseball tournament at Soldiers Field.

title: Memorial Day
description: Securities exchanges and commodities markets will be closed, as will most banks and other financial institutions. Government offices, libraries and most businesses will be closed, but many department stores will be open.

title: 1,000 American Workers in Vietnam, Their Jobs Ended, Refuse to Go Home
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 27About 1,000 American civilian technicians and construction workers are living in Vietnam illegally. Their jobs with United States defense contractors were closed out recently as part of the Vietnamization program, but the 1,000 do not want to go home.

title: Mayor Stays Aloof in Primary
description: The man who has dominated New York City politics for more than seven yearsMayor Lindsayhas had no discernible impact on the Democratic primary in which his successor is very likely to be chosen.

title: Link to Heroic Period
description: With the death of Jacques Lipchitz, one of the last of our living links with the heroic period of the School of Paristhe period of cubismis gone. Lipchitz was, as he once said himself, always a cubist in his art, and his earliest claim to distinction lay in being one of the first to apply the principles o An cubist form ti Appraisal sculpture. But hi real achievemen is not to be fount in matters of historical priorityPicasso, after all, had made cubist sculpture before himbut in the peculiar eloquence and ambition he brought to the sculptor's vocation.

title: DiplomaDenial Ruling Awaited
Riva Ridge, Key to the Mint Clash Today
description: The 80th running of the $114,800 Metropolitan Handicap, a onemile test for 3yearolds and up, will be the stage for this year's first meeting between Riva Ridge and Key to the Mint today at Belmont Park.

title: A SHELLED TRAWLER REPAIRED BY BRITISH
description: LONDON, May 27 (AP)The British trawler Everton, hit by shells from an Icelandic gunboat, has been repaired by British naval team and is no longer in danger of sinking, the British Defense Ministry reported today.

title: Railroad Buffs Take a Journey With Old 2102 to Binghamton
description: DOVER, May 27More than 1,100 railroad buffs took a happy jaunt into yesterday this weekend on a 24car excursion train pulled by a massive 16wheel steam locomotive on its farewell ramble.

title: Canada to Ask U.N. Group To Widen Fishing Limits
description: ST. ANDREWS, New Bruns wick, May 27 (AP)  Canada wants exclusive fishing right to her entire continental shell aid will make a push for their at a United Nations conference this fall, according to Environment Minister Jack Davis.

title: TOOL SHIPMENTS POST SHARP GAINS
description: The people who build and sell machine toolsboth new and usedare completely happy with results through April.

title: MISS LOEB'S NO ALIBI WINS 2 SHOW EVENTS
Red Smith
Culebra Over Goliath
description: Before ending his brief stint as Secretary of Defense to become Attorney General, Elliot Richardson came down decisively on the side of Culebra, the Caribbean mouse that roared at the United States Navy. Mr. Richardson ordered the Navy to terminate by mid1975 the gunnery and air bombardment practice that for years has annoyed and harassed the 726 residents of the 7,000acre island off Puerto Rico's east coast.

title: India's Police Rebels Defiant in Defeat
description: JEHANGIRABAD, India, May 25The decrepit, ancient fort palace in this desolate village 25 miles east of Lucknow, the state capital of Uttar Pradesh, was never meant for battles. The Nawab of Jehangirabad built it 50 years ago as a country house for fun and frolic.

title: Down on the Farm, a Wife's Life Isn't the Drudgery It Used to Be
description: RUGBY, S. D. (AP)  Glory Monson shops in the grocery store, can't remember the last time she was up dawn and smiles at talk about weatherbeaten farm wives in gingham dresses slaving over hot stoves.

title: Markets Observe Holiday
description: All securities exchanges and commodities markets are closed today in observance of Memorial Day. Most banks and other financial institutions are also closed. In Britain, securities exchanges, commodities exchanges, and banks are closed because of the national bank holiday.

title: Plenty of Dough for Pasta
description: ROME, May 27 (AP)An unidentified soccer fan won $500,000 for correctly predicting the results of all 13 soccer games today in the weekly pool, the Totacalcio. The payoff was the largest of the year, but fell short of the record.

title: Meri E. Leeds Wed in Suburb
description: TARRYTOWN, N.Y., May 27Miss Meri Ellen Leeds, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Lawrence Leeds of White Plains, was married here this afternoon to Thomas Frederick Pollak, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Pollak 2d, also of White Plains. Rabbi Bernard Schactel performed the ceremony on the terrace of the Tarrytown House.

title: FREDERICK W. SPECHT
description: WHEATON, Ill., May 27 (AP) Frederick William Specht, former president and chairman of the board of Armour & Co., died today at his home here. He was 83 years old.

title: Parasol in Space
description: So many mishaps befell Skylab at the outset that many questioned whether there was any point in sending up even the first of the three astronaut crews scheduled live and conduct experiments in this huge space laboratory. Now the brilliant salvage job performed in space over this holiday weekend has erased fear that Skylab might have to be abandoned under the same conditions of total failure that befell its Soviet counterpart, the Salyut vehicle, last month.

title: WORMER SETS HALFMILE MARK
description: LOS ANGELES, May 27 (AP)Rick Wohlhuter, a former Notre Dame star, set a world record in the halfmile run today as he beat.South Africa's Danie Malan in 1 minute 44.6 seconds in the Vons Classic at the Coliseum.

title: Watergate Seen as Boon to Urban Aid and Civil Rights
ALBANY CREATES 7MEMBER BOARD
description: ALBANY, Monday, May 28The Legislature approved a bill yesterday that would establish an appointed, sevenmember New York City Board of Education to replace the interim board created by the school decentralization law in 1969.

title: The Price of Equality
description: The amendment to assure equal rights for womenEquality of rights under the law shall not be denied abridged by the United States or by any state on account of sex"has now been ratified by some thirty states, not far short of the number needed to incorporate into the Constitution. The supporters of the provision still have six years during which to persuade state legislatures to vote affirmatively or to reconsider their negative votes.

title: Life Cycle Beats Cougar on Turf
description: INGLEWOOD, Caif., May 27 (UPI)Life Cycle, a Floridabred 4yearold, captured the fifth running of the $125,000 Hollywood Invitation Turf Handicap today at Hollywood Park.

title: Allegheny Airlines Earnings Rose to $1.5Million in April
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) Allegheny Airlines has reported next earnings of 1.5million for April, up $506,000 from its net earnings for April, 1972.

title: SKYLAB COOLING; ASTRONAUTS ABLE TO INSPECT CABIN
description: HOUSTON, May 27  Temperatures in the parasolshaded Skylab space station were slowly dropping today as the three astronauts checked out living and working conditions aboard their giant orbital home.

title: BIG CHICAGO BLAZE LEVELS 4 BUILDINGS
description: CHICAGO, May 27 (UPI)Two mammoth warehouses, a, petroleum plant and a food supply center were destroyed today by a series of explosions and fire.

title: ISSUES DIM IN RACE FOR COUNCIL HEAD
description: Running for an office that historically has had little power and visibility, three Democratic candidates for the nomination for City Council president began the final week of the primary campaign stressing differences of approach rather than issues.

title: Mideastern Oil Exports Tripled In Last 10 Years, B. P. Reports
description: HOUSTON, May 27 (AP) The world's dependence on Middle East oil has increased sharply in the last five years, according to the new edition of the British Petroleum Co., Ltd., annual statistical review of the world petroleum industry.

title: Case Touches Many in Establishment
Bills Pass in a Flood as Adjournment Nears
description: ALBANY, May 27The towering shadow of the South Mall construction project intruded briefly into the Assembly this morning as the Republican majority voted to continue for two years a costly contract loophole that is keeping the Governor's favorite marbled project going.

title: Amended Racing Bill Is Sent to Rockefeller
description: ALBANY, May 27 (AP)A bill intended to head off a threatened strike by racetrack employes over job security cleared the Legislature tonight and was sent to Governor Rockefeller.

title: Motorcyclist Dies in Plunge
description: MOAB, Utah, May 27 (UPI)A 25yearold man from Provo, Utah, plunged 600 feet to his death yesterday when he rode a motorcycle over the rim of the Colorado River canyon. He was identified as Roger Fen; ainte.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The care of young children and adolescents from homes broken up by divorce, separation, desertion or other forms of family disintegration has become the first priority of New York Catholic Charities childcare department. The organization reported yesterday that in 1972 it had provided residential and daycare services through its 36 affiliate agencies to 15,676 young people, 70.4 per cent whom were black or Hispanic. Msgr. Robert A. Arpie, director of child care for Catholic Charities, said the program was aimed chiefly at alleviating emotional, educational and environmental deprivation of the young.

title: Killian Sees Watergate as Helping Public TV
description: The Watergate scandal and its apparent aftermath of diminished antagonism to the press by the Nixon Administration may help assure that public broadcasting in the United States will be free of political control, according to Dr. James R. Killian Jr., the newly elected chairman of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting.

title: Jacques Lipchitz, Sculptor, 81, Dead
description: Jacques Lipchitz, one of the foremost sculptors of the 20th century, died Saturday of a heart attack at the hotel where he was vacationing in Capri He was 81 years old.

title: Weekly List of Mutual Funds
REGIME IN GREECE SAID TO PLAN VOTE ON KING'S FUTURE
GREEKAMERICANS BOW IN SOCCER 31
description: The GermanAmerican Soccer League's dominance in the United States Challenge Cup, the most coveted prize in American soccer since 1912 came to an end yesterday when Inter of Cleveland eliminated the New York GreekAmericans, 31.

title: Skylab's Apparent Rescuer Jack Albert Kinzler
description: HOUSTON, May 27For hundreds of years peoplehave been designing parasolsfrom dainty, papercovered oriental models to  giantbeach umbrellas. But no one,until now, has produced one to pass through a hole eight and onehalf inches squarein a space station, and then open to cover an area 22by24 feet. T h e successful production of such a parasol, whose d c ployment last night seems to have saved the $2.5billion Skylab, was largely the achievement of a man with a lifelong passion for tinkering.

title: Groupthink in Washington
description: NEW HAVENOver and beyond all the familiar sources of human error is a powerful source of defective judgment that arises in cohesive groups of decision makersthe concurrenceseeking tendency, which fosters overoptimism, lack of vigilance and sloganistic thinking about the weakness and immorality of outgroups.

title: Using the Anatomy As a Design Motif
description: Nicola leaned back against the armshaped pillows on her Gianttolieon Sofa at the Waddell Gallery the other morning and conceded, I have an obsession about the human body.

title: BEAME IS LEADING, CANDIDATES AGREE
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame is in the lead as the campaign for the Democratic nomination for Mayor enters its final week, officials of the various campaign teams said yesterday.

title: L.I. Cyclist Wins Marathon With 405 Miles in 24 Hours
description: A Long Island Linotype operator who describes himself as just a plugger won the secland annual Central Park bike marathon yesterday, covering 405 miles in 24 hours.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 3 Eras of Jazz Played By McPartland Quintet
description: There has probably never been a quintet that covers five decades and three eras of jazz with the authenticity of the group that Jimmy and Marian McPartland are leading at the Royal Box of the Americana Hotel. Jimmy McPartland came out of the fertile Chicago jazz ferment of the nineteentwenties, replacing Bix Beiderbecke as the cornetist in the Wolverines in 1924. Buddy Tate, who was playing saxophone with the McPartland quintet, swung to the top with Count Basie's orchestra in the late thirties and forties while Marian McPartland's reputation as a pianist was developed in the fifties sixties.

title: Pepitone Hoping to Do His Swinging in Japan
description: ST. LOUIS, May 27 (AP)It had nothing to do with the Atlanta Braves, Joe Pepitone said today. I'm just fed up and can't keep coming back.

title: Connally Says Watergate Hurts All Who Hold Office
description: The Watergate scandal and other chicanery in Washington may hurt incumbent politicians of all persuasions and not just Republicans, John B. Coninally said last night.

title: Australians Hope U.S. Envoy Can Repair Frayed Relations
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 27  Australians speak of the imminent arrival of Marshall Green, the United States Ambassadordesignate, as if the veteran diplomat were a trophy like the Davis Cup. We got Marshall Green, one high official declared triumphantly in a foreign affairs discussion in Parliament last week.

title: James Fishkin Weds Miss Fisher
description: WESTPORT, Conn., May 27At Temple Israel here this afternoon, Miss Shelley May Fisher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Fisher, was married to James Fishkin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Fishkin of Oxon Hill, Md. Rabbi Byron T. Rubenstein performed the ceremony, assisted by Cantor Paul Kwartin.

title: Sports Today
description: Tape of Indianapolis 500. (Tele. visionChannel 7, 9 P.M.)

title: Arda Takes Dunlop Golf
description: ICHIHARA, Japan, May 27 (AP)Ben Arda of the Philippines shot a finalround 70 today for an eightunderpar 280 total and won the $57,682 Dunlop golf championship. Masashi (Jumbo) Ozaki of Japan finished four strokes back after soaring to a 74.

title: Nye's Carina Wins Block Island Race
Books of The Times
description: LIFE SIGNS. By Johanna Davis. I83 pages. Atheneum. $5.95.

title: ViolinMaking Is Vanishing Soviet Craft
description: MOSCOWViolinmakers, it turns out, are the forgotten men of Soviet society.

title: EDMUND LEONE
description: Edmund Leone, who became president of the Union State Bank in Nanuet, N. Y., after his retirement in 1971 as vice president and secretary of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, died yesterday in Good Samaritan Hospital in Suffern, N. Y. He was 66 years old and lived at 215.43 27th Avenue in Bayside, Queens.

title: KLECATSKY DEFEATS DIETZ IN SCULLING
description: Jim Dietz, the United States singles champion, was upset tolay by Dr. Larry Klecatsky, a New York Athletic Club teammae in the elite handcap singles Memorial Day race of the New York Rowing Association.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: SUMMIT, May 27Kathy Heddy is everyone's image of what an Olympic swimmer should be: shortcropped blond hair, pixie face and a deceptively muscular frame. She also happens to be a longrange favorite for the 1976 United States team at Montreal.

title: Gorman, Gerken Advance; Pasarell Bows in France
description: PARIS, May 27 (UPI)Tom Gorman and Paul Gerken, two unseeded Americans, reached the quarterfinals in the men's singles in the $133,000 French open tennis championships today with straightset victories.

title: SOVIET GIVES WAY ON EUROPE PARLEY
description: LONDON, May 27Diplomatic sources reported today that the Soviet Union had made major concession on one of the most difficult issues facing the delegates in Helsinki preparing for a European security conference.

title: Candidates Day
description: Representative Herman Badillo was both aided and upstaged by a Congressional colleague, Representative Ronald V. Dellums, on a walking tour through Harlem yesterday afternoon.

title: Nixon Orders Inquiry Into Fatal Crash Of Army Copter Ferrying His Guards
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., May 27 (UPI)President Nixon ordered today an investigation to determine what forced an Army helicopter to plummet into the Atlantic last night while taking seven Secret Service agents to guard him and his family on a Bahama island. One agent died and nine men suffered minor injuries.

title: New Phones Complicate Hearing Aids
description: WASHINGTON, May 27A resolution may be near on question of growing concern to the hard of hearingnew telephones that are incompatible with present hearing aids.

title: EDWIN J. WALTER
description: Edwin J. Walter, chairman of D. N. & E. Walter & Co., one of the country's oldest and largest floor coverings distributors, died Friday at his residence at 480 Park Avenue. He was 94 years old.

title: BusinessConsumer Woes Laid to Company Bigness
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 27If there is nothing inherently wrong in bigness  as bigbusiness men contendbigness does present problems in the face of consumerism, executives acknowledged here last week.

title: AREA STARS VICTORS AT BUZZER,105 TO 104
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., May 27 Ernie Grunfeld of Forest Hills High in Queens sank 20foot jump shot at the buzzer today to give New YorkNew Jersey AllStars a 105104 victory over the United States AllStars in the third annual Seamco basketball tournament.

title: Personal Finance
description: If you need additional life insurance coverage now and have been thinking about a variablelife policy as an inflation hedge, don't hold your breath. Insurance experts suggest buying a convertible term life policythe cheapest basic typeand waiting.

title: Cod War II
description: The disabling of a British trawler by shells from an Icelandic gunboat has brought into a stage of active conflict the revival of the Cod War between Britain and Iceland. Renewal of the bruising struggle that first erupted in the late 1950's comes after British naval vessels had been dispatched to waters off Iceland in response to shootings, rammings and other incidents involving British trawlers and Icelandic patrol craft.

title: College Board May Quit Over Governor's Power
description: ALBANY, May 27The chairman of New York City's Board of Higher Education tonight summoned the 21member board to a meeting tomorrow to consider mass resignation to protest Governor Rockefeller's legislation giving him appointive powers on a revised board.

title: Barrister, Fox Terrier, Best in Plainfield Show
MRS. WILLIAM JACOBS
description: Mrs. Frances Halper Jacobs, widow of Dr. William K. Jacobs, a physician, and mother of William K. Jacobs Jr., president of the Abacus Fund, Inc., died yesterday at her apartment in the Surrey Hotel. She was 93 years old.

title: SKYLAB COOLING; ASTRONAUTS ABLE TO INSPECT CABIN
description: HOUSTON, May 27  Temperatures in the parasolshaded Skylab space station were slowly dropping today as the three astronauts checked out living and working conditions aboard their giant orbital home.

title: Stage: Loot Resurrected
description: Is there anything that the C.S.C. Repertory Company cannot do and do well? Take Loot. One way is to sit back, relax and laugh your head off. This is a truly blistering and diabolically clever play. C.S.C., at 89 West Third Street, has spun off the play as its last seasonal entry like vestpocket dream.

title: Nicklaus Shoots 73 but Wins Atlanta Golf by Two Strokes
description: ATLANTA, May 27Although his finalround score seemed more humane to his rivals than his previous ones, Jack Nicklaus won the Atlanta golf classic by two strokes with a 72hole aggregate of 272 today.

title: First Phase of Inquiry;Senate Hearing Moves at a Leisurely Pace and Postpones Major Questions
description: WASHINGTON, May 27During the first five days of hearings br the Senate Watergate committee, the sevenmember panel performed largely as expected: Its tone was reasonably nonpartisan and lawyerlike, its pace was slow and cautious, its immediate purpose was narrow and unusually restrained. There were appearances by such exotic characters as James W. McCord Jr. and John J. Caulfield, both of whom created minor sensations with hearsay or suspicionor bothabout the possibility of President Nixon's involvement in a coverof the affair. News Analysis

title: Report Brands Watergate A Low in Election Tactics
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The Fair Campaign Practices Committee called the Watergate affair today the low point in campaign tactics since the committee began monitoring political campaign activities nearly 20 years ago.

title: Gorman, Gerken Advance; Pasarell Bows in France
description: PARIS, May 27 (UPI)Tom Gorman and Paul Gerken, two unseeded Americans, reached the quarterfinals in the men's singles in the $133,000 French open tennis championships today with straightset victories.

title: Ulster Families Are Prisoners of Violence
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland In the small, cluttered living room of Noel and Brigid Hopkins Sunday is like a prison.

title: Memorial Day
description: Securities exchanges and commodities markets will be closed, as will most banks and other financial institutions. Government offices, libraries and most businesses Will be closed, but many department stores will be open.

title: GREEKAMERICANS BOW IN SOCCER, 31
description: The GermanAmerican Soccer League's dominance in the United States Challenge Cup, the most coveted prize in American soccer since 1912 came to an end yesterday when Inter of Cleveland eliminated the New York GreekAmericans, 31.

title: Youth Has Its Day at Eastchester Fete
description: EASTCHESTER, N. Y., May 27Come on, people, help us make it a nationwide thing, called out 17yearold Joanne Smith, as she hawked Youth Day buttons and Tshirts today to strollers around Eastchester JuniorSenior High School.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: Fourteen persons were injured, one critically, when an Orange and Black line bus and a taxicab collided yesterday near the Lincoln Tunnel in Weehawken. The Hudson County police said the bus apparently struck the cab broadside at the intersection of North Marginal Highway and Pleasant Avenue at about 12:37 A.M. They did not know how many people were in the bus.

title: JERSEY G.O.P.CLUB FACES U.S. AUDIT; G.A.O. Plans to Check the Executive Group's Filing of 1972 Campaign Data
ALBANY CREATES 7MEMBER BOARD FOR CITY SCHOOLS
description: ALBANY, May 27The Legislature approved a bill today that would establish an appointed, sevenmember New York City Board of Education to replace the interim board created by the school decentralization law in 1969.

title: State Aide Weds Roslyn Schwartz
description: ELKINS PARK, Pa., May 27Miss Roslyn Carol Schwartz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alan Schwartz of Wyncote, was married here this afternoon to Joel Henry Sachs, an assistant attorney general for New York State. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Sachs of Mount Vernon, N. Y. Rabbi Jacob Rosenberg performed the ceremony in Temple Adath Jeshurun.

title: Sports Today
description: Tape of Indianapolis 500. (TelevisionChannel 7, 9 P.M.)

title: Ballet: New Balanchine
description: The most remarkable aspect of last year's Stravinsky Festival given at the New York State Theater by New York City Ballet was simply its quality. Its second most remarkable aspect was its quantity. Indeed it was the second aspect that made the first aspect so remarkably remarkable.

title: Law, Not Men
description: BOSTON, May 27The hopeful view of Watergate is that it represents only a personal aberration in a still sound political structure. The fault, then, would lie in the character of Richard Nixon, not in the Presidential institution and what it has become.

title: Legistature Considers Pay Raise And 85Million Budget Addition
description: ALBANY, May 27The Legislature prepared late tonight to act on an $85million supplement to the main $8.77billion budget as well as on a bill that would increase legislators salaries in 1975 by nearly 60 per cent and grant them $40aday expense accounts.

title: ASSOCIATE OF VESCO WILING TO TESTIFY
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, May 27Norman P. LeBlanc, accused with Robert L. Vesco,the New Jersey financier, and others of looting four mutualfunds of $224million, said tonight that he had the missinglink to the Watergate affair and complained that he fas being harassed by the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Tarangioli Is Tennis Victor
description: Neil Tarangioli of Fordham Prep defeated his teammate, Jim McNamara, 6.4, 36, 63, yesterday to win the varsity singles tennis championship of the Fordham University invitation tournament on the Bronx campus. Fordham Prep won the team championship with 19 points.

title: 17 FOOD PLACES HERE GET HEALTH NOTICES
description: Seventeen foodprocessing establishments in Manhattan, Brooklyn and the Bronx have failed a second healthcode inspection, the Health Department has reported. Failure to pass a final inspection next month could result in closing orders.

title: Fog Over San Clemente
description: President Nixon has done a good deal but, regrettably, not enough to dissipate the swirling fog of confusion he allowed to arise over the financing of his estate San Clemente. To clarify the questions left obscure by last week's White House statement and the subsequent explanations of a Presidential spokesman, an auxiliary statement is much in order.

title: BYRNE IN LOW KEY IN SOUTH JERSEY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 28Brendan T. Byrne, the former Essex County prosecutor and judge, was playing it in a lowkey in southern New Jersey today in his quest for the Democratic nomination for Governor.

title: 100 Drunken Students Are Arrested at Shore
description: WILDWOOD, May 28The annual Memorial Day journey of college students to the Jersey shore brought more than 100 arrests here and in North Wildwood over the weekend, mostly on drunkenness charges.

title: STATE LEGISLATES EXTRA CITY FUNDS
description: ALBANY, May 28As the 1973 session of the Legislature drew to a close, New York City emerged with about $90million extra, but more than half of this was not real money, just authorization for fiscal sleightofhand programs good for $50million. To this was added $10million in real money for new programs and $30million from the supplemental budget.

title: Dance: Mozartian Gem
description: Although George BaIanchine has more than once been termed the Mozart of choreographers, he has used Mozart in his work comparatively rarely. Offhand I can think only of the old Mozartiana, which was before my time; Symphonie Concertante, which has been out of the repertory for many years now, and Divertimento N?. 15 which New York City Ballet gave at the New York State Theater on Sunday afternoon.

title: Indy 500 on Today; 16 Hurt in Crash
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 28Twelve spectators and four drivers were injured, one seriously, as an enormous ball of flame and a shower of debris from a 12car accident stopped the Indianapolis 500 today an instant after it started.

title: Investment Banker Seeks Arctic GasLine Backing
description: TORONTO, May 28William P. Wilder, an investment banker who hopes over the next few yea'ns. to raise and then spend $5billion for a naturalgas pipeline, is busily seeking support for the project through appearances from coast to coast.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 19yearold Queens girl who was about to turn state's evidence against four codefendants in a kidnapping case died yesterday of injuries suffered in a plunge from the roof of a sixstory apartment house in Flushing Sunday night. Ann Marie Paixao had reportedly been despondent about her involvement in the brief abduction last Oct. of Gerald Lazar, 31, a Manhattan construction company executive.

title: San Diego Is Surprised, May Go to Court
description: SAN DIEGO, May 28  The San Diego Padres, running perhaps the most thrifty overhead operation in the National League, actually showed an operating profit estimated at $50,000 last year with an attendance of only 644,273.

title: Canadian Price Index Up
description: OTTAWA, May 28 (Reuters)  Canada's general wholesale I price index gained 0.8 per cent in April to 353.6 per cent from 350.9 in March, Statistics Can ada reported today. The latest increase brought the gain since April, 1972, when the index was 303.5, to 16.5 per cent.

title: Coast Records Show $100,000 Government Outlay on Western White House
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., May 28 (AP)The Federal Government has spent more than $100,000 for improvements at President Nixon's San Clemente estate since he bought it four years ago, records have shown.

title: Bridge: A WellKnown Partnership Captures the Goldman Pairs
Raise Proposed for Official Making Him Highest Paid
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 28 (AP) A study commissioned by the Delaware River Port Authority recommends that its executive director get a pay raise that would put him ahead of the Governor of either New Jersey or Pennsylvania.

title: Jockey Suspended 5 Days
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 28 (AP)  Steve Valdez, an apprentice and the No. 2 rider during the current Hollywood Park meeting, was suspended today for five days because of interference in a race yesterI day. The stewards charged Valdez with failure to maintain a straight course during the stretch run of the fifth race, May 27.

title: Indochina as Arena Of First Principles
description: NEW HAVEN  The Watergate tragedy is stirring the nation's instinct for constitutional respoisibility, After years of erasion, or worse, on the part of many participants in the process of government, it is surely a time to review political problems in the light of first principles.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: EAST MEETS EAST BROADWAY The nearest you're likely to get to Hong Kong night life, as much as we've learned about it from TV and movies, anyway, is the spanking new (two weeks old) Chinese Quarter, 89 East Broadway (2335372), in a decrepit neighborhood, just a few feet north of the Manhattan Bridge overpass in the new uptownish region of Chinatown less familiar to tourists. By day, this is a Chinese restaurant; after 9 P.M. until the wee hours, it becomes a Chinese nightclub, like no other in town, with live and varied music, beauteous singers, pretty waitresses, a Cantonese menu and a welldressed clientele, among whom only two nonChinese were visible the other night.

title: Changing A Senseless System
description: BOSTONMore than a hundred years ago, we had a giant prison down South and the prisoners were called slaves. The poor whites ran it and the planters got cheap labor. Now we've got a lot of prisons just like thatlowpaid white guards and blacks in the cells.

title: Demand for Sugar Exceeding Supply
description: Because people long accustomed to hunger place a high value on sweets, rising living standards around the world are leading to a rare tight supply of sttgar.

title: Music: Mozart Updated
description: Mozart's operas resist the hand of the inventive stage director more than most, probably because Mozart not only knew what he wanted in terms of words and music, but also achieved it with a specificity that other composers rarely matched. Undaunted, the Masterworks Laboratory Theatre undertook to update and revamp scenes from Mozart's operas Sunday night at Spencer Memorial Church In Brooklyn Heights, in a program conceived and directed by Walt Witcover.

title: Cahill Again Alleges Sandman Supports Off shore Oil Port
description: TRENTON, May 28 Governor Cahill, in a statement intended to underscore his support of environmental protection for New Jersey's shoreline, today renewed his charge that Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr. favored an oil port for supertankers in the northern part of the state and the New York Harbor area.

title: JUDGE GEORGE GRANT JR.

description: Morning

description: Tape of Indianapolis 500. (TelevisionChannel 7, 9 P.M.)

title: Quack Wins Californian, Rallying From Last Place

description: TRENTON, May 28A proposal calling for limited state financing of governorship election campaigns in New Jersey, along with ceilings on the amounts private contributors could give and candidates could ,spend, has received A mixed reaction among the major candidates in the Republican and Denfocratic primaries for Governor.

title: Candidates Seeking to Overcome Apathy
description: Although short of money, the four Democratic mayoral candidates plan extensive television advertising in the final) week of the primary, campaign to combat what their strategists believe is extraordinary voter apathy.

title: Levitt Says City Overpaid $6.3Million on Textbooks
description: An audit by State Controller Arthur Levitt has found that the city school system may have been overcharged as much as $6.3million on its textbook purchase during the fiveyear period from 196768 through 197172.

title: ANTIWALLACE AID LAID TO KALMBACH
description: WASHINGTON, May 28John W. Dean 3d has told Watergate investigators that Herbert W. Kalmbach, President Nixon's former personal attorney, approved the spending of $200,000 to $400,000 in leftover 1968 Republican campaign contributions to help defeat Gov. George C. Wallace in the closely contested Democratic primary in Alabama in 1970, sources close to the case said today.

title: AUSTRALIA. PLANS CROATIAN INQUIRY
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 28 A political storm is brewing in Australia over official actions against alleged Croatian terrorists here who oppose the Communist Government of Yugoslavia.

title: SMITH TRIUMPHS OVER VAN DEN
description: PARIS, May 28 (AP)  Top. seeded Stan Smith struggled for five sets in overcoming Erik Van Dillen in the $133,00C French open tennis champion ships tonight.

title: ANTIWALLACE AID LAID TO KALIVIBACII
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 John W. Dean 3d has told Watergate investigators that Herbert W. Kalmbach, President Nixon's former personal attorney, approved the spending of $200,000 to $400,000 in leftover 1968 Republican campaign contributions to help defeat Gov. George C. Wallace in the closely contested Democratic primary in Alabama in 1970, sources close to the case said today.

title: Soviet Flier Asks West German Asylum
description: BONN, May 28 (AP)  A young Sovet pilot whose jet I had crashed in West Germatiy defected today.

title: Woman Olympics Runner Is Held on Murder Charge
description: WILMINGTON, Calif., May 28 (UPI)Rosie Kreidler, member of the 1964 women's Olympic track team and a sister of the San Francisco Giants baseball slugger, Bobby Bonds, was held on a murder charge today in connection with the shooting death of a bartender.

title: Yankees Rained Oat, Play A's Here Tonight
description: Followed by bad weather wherever they go, the Yankees lost a game to it yesterday when rain forced postponement of their game with Texas. It will be made up as part of a twilightnight doubleheader Aug. 7.

title: REDUCTION URGED IN HOME PRICES
description: The forestproducts industry suggested strongly last week that the time may be ripe for the nation's home builders to reduce prices.

title: Rush Hour at the Lincoln Tunnel A Challenge to Traffic Controllers
description: WEEHAWKEN, May 28 (UPI)  The scene is pure James Bond: a darkened room computers, banks of flashing television screens, batteries of technicians huddled around a control board.

title: METS LOSE, 65; DROP 4TH IN ROW
John Bogan Sr., Rescued Survivors of Morro Castle
description: POINT PLEASANT BEACH, N. J., May 28 (AP)John Bogan Sr., a sea captain who rescued 67 people in the 1934 Morro Castle fire, died at his home here yesterday. He was 90 years old.

title: Margot R. Morris, Nurse, Is Married
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 28 Miss Margot Rose Morris, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold R. Morris, was married here today to Michael Mikita, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Mikita of Scarsdale, N. Y. The ecumenical ceremony was performed at the home of the bride's parents by the Rev. Fred Sullivan, a Roman Catholic priest of Somerk, N. Y., and Rabbi Samuel Silver of Stamford.

title: GREECE WILL TRY 35 FOR REBELLION
description: ATHENS, May 28  Greece's militarybacked Government declared today that 35 navy officers would be tried, probably on treason charges, in the mutiny that broke out last week aboard a destroyer.

title: CANADIAN OFFICIAL OPPOSES REFINERY
description: ST. ANDREWS, New Brunswick, May 28 (Canadian Press) Environment Minister Jack Davis said over the weekend hei opposed a proposed oil refinery for Eastport, Me., that would use a narrow channel in Canadian waters as a transporbation route for oil tankers.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: EDISON, May 28, St. Thomas Aquinas High School has one of the most ambitious baseball schedules in the state40 games. It is quite an undertaking for a school that is only four years old and has its first senior class this season.

title: National League
Deadlock in Vietnam Truce Unit Is Broken, Averting a Walkout
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 28 (UPI)The International Commission of Control and Supervision ended its fourth month today with two of its members, Hungary and Poland, giving way on an issue that has deadlocked two previous commission meetings and brought a threat of a Canadian and Indonesian walkout.

title: Watergate Brings Novelty Items
description: WASHINGTON, May 28While almost a dozen writers future books on the subject struggle to follow the incidents in the bizzare Watergate affair, a flood of games, records, trinkets and bumper stickers has already come from what started as a thirdrate burglary.

title: Baseball to Washington
description: The San Diego Padres of the National League have been sold to a Washington syndicate for $12million, heralding the return of major league baseball to the capital. The transaction, confirmed yesterday, is subject, to approval by the club owners. Details, Page 43.

title: ROGERS ENDS TOUR WITH JAMAICA STOP
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, May 28 (UPI)Secretary of State liam P. Rogers ended his 17day tour of Latin America and the Caribbean today after meetings with Jamaican officials.

title: AFRICANS RATIFY ACCORD ON TRADE
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, May 28The 41 countries of the Organization of African Unity vowed today to concert and organize their international trade plans in advance of all negotiations with the developed countries.

title: VESCO HARASSMENT BY THE C.I.A. DENIED
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Ride, May 28 (AP)  The United States Ambassador, Viron P. Vaky, denied today that the Central Intelligence Agency was harassing Robert L. Vesco and his associates in Costa Rica.

title: Rain and High Death Toll Mar the Holiday
description: Rain driven in some places by high winds, and then drizzle, yesterday washed out parades and other Memorial Day events in the metropolitan area. The weather raised the death toll on the holiday dedicated to those who, in President Nixon's words, fell in America's wars from Bunker Hill to Khe Sanh and Hue.

title: The Making of a Man of Letters
description: Now I am a man of letters, cried Arthur Rubinstein, when he was told last winter that his volume of autobiography, My Young Years, had been chosen as the June BookoftheMonth  which meant a windfall of more than $120,000 to him and his publishers, Knopf. This is how the selection came about:

title: Looming Blackmail
description: The United States and Western Europe are soon to face their first major diplomatic test of the oilrich Arab bloc's power to exercise blackmail in respect to the energy shortage. A United Nations Security Council debate on the entire ArabIsraeli confrontation is scheduled soon, the first such comprehensive discussion since November 1967.

title: SyrianBritish Tie Resumed
description: LONDON, May 28 (UPI)The Foreign Office has announced that Britain is resuming full diplomatic relations with Syria. The two several official ties in June, 1967, after the war between Arabs and Israel.

title: Racial Policy Being Altered By Loyal Order of Moose
description: CHICAGO, May 28 (AP) The Loyal Order of Moose has voted to amend its membership, policy, which has set qualifications based on race.

title: 2 Accused of Killing Youth In Attempt to Rob His Hat
description: A scuffle over a mountaineer's stovepipe hat in Little Neck Queens, early yesterday ended with its owner stabbed to death and his companion seriously wounded. Two suspects were seized in the attack.

title: News Summary and Index TUESDAY, MAY 29, 1973
description: International Greece's militarybacked Government declared that 35 navy officers would be tried, probably on treason charges, in the mutiny that broke out last week aboard a destroyer. The Government said that the episode was not merely a ,mutiny but a fullfledged attempt to overturn the leadership by blackmail. The Defense Ministry said naval officers had planned to hijack the Greek fleet, occupy some unguarded Aegean islands, blockade the main ports, and after inviting the army and air force to join them, to ask the Government's surrender. [Page 1, Col1.]

title: Horses &
description: You can find the finest facilities for horse & rider in Newburgh, NY. We have one of the largest Indoor rings In the area, 100400 scenic bridal paths. large box stalls, large standing stalls, large selection of reg. Quarter. horses, thoroughbreds, Appaloosas, spot ted horses. Finest quality selected, 1 to suit every rider. English & Western. Every horse coggins tested. Sil Termini, (914) 5644220.

title: GIORDANO TAKES DEVON COACHING
Chilean BreakIns Puzzle Watergate Investigators
description: One unsolved puzzle that Watergate investigators are studying is the identity of intruders who broke into the offices and residences of Chilean diplomats in Washington and New York at least four times from April, 1971 to May, 1972.

title: Democrats Report on Spending
description: Campaign spending that ranged from Joseph L. Caliber's $8,120 to Harrison J. Goldin's $300,000 was reported yesterday by the four candidates for the Democratic nomination for Controller.

description: Some months ago, Linda Rossbach met some friends for lunch at Orsini's. The staff at the restaurant, and the patrons on hand that day, still remember the occasion.

title: Mays Returns and Hopes to Play
17 DIE IN GUATEMALA IN CLASH OVER LAND
description: GUATEMALA CITY, May 28 (UPI)Clashes between the police and peasants who invaded lands in a mountainous area 21 miles east of here have left 17 people dead.

title: JUSTICE DEPARTMENT SCORES MILK. PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI) The Justice Department is urging Senate farm leaders to reconsider proposed new legislation that antitrust officials charge would greatly increase the power of big dairy cooperatives to dominate the milk supply.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As the Watergate and related disclosures continue to unfold, the commentators in the press have belabored the immorality inherent in such practices and the corruption of our democratic institutions which they represent.

title: Miners for Democracy Gets All Posts in District Election
description: UNIONTOWN, Pa., May 28 (UPI)  A Miners for Democracy slate scored a clean sweep in an election for officers of District 5, United Mine Workers of America, complete but unofficial returns showed yesterday.

title: Jockey Suspended 5 Days
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 28 (AP)  Steve Valdez, an apprentice and the No. 2 rider during the current Hollywood Park meeting, was suspended today for five days because of interference in a race yesterday. The stewards charged Valdez with failure to maintain a straight course during the stretch run of the fifth race, May 27.

title: Swiss Bankers on Guard Against New Gold Fraud
description: PARIS, May 28  Ostensibly there were 10 tons of gold in Panama, to be sold to the Union Bank of Switzerland by the man with a bushy mustache.

title: Padres Are Sold to a Washington Group
description: Spurred by Congressional pressures, major league baseball apparently will return to Washington next season after an absence of two seasons.

title: ICELAND BIDS NATO PRESS THE BRITISH
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, May 28 (UPI)Iceland demanded today that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization take immediate action to remove British warships from the 50mile zone that she claims as her territorial waters.

description: A group which hopes to gather all of the country's sportfishing interests in its embrace held an organizational meeting in the auditorium of the National Wildlife Federation in Washington, last week.

title: Rights Bloc Spurs Plan for Ratification
description: WASHINGTON, May 28  A coalition of 25 national organizations, not all of them exclusively women's groups, is working out a master plan, aimed at achieving ratification of the equal rights amendment to the Constitution by 1975.

title: SESSION IN ALBANY ENDS WITH PASSING OF WELFARE BILL
description: ALBANY, May 28Delaying and haggling right to the end, the Legislature adjourned tonight.after approving a measure sought by Governor Rockefeller that prepares the way for a state takeover of the administration of New York City's welfare system.

title: Brief on the Arts
description: The Dictionary of the History of Ideas, a fourvolume compendium of studies dealing with pivotal and recurrent ideas in the development of Western thought, will be published on June 22 by Charles Scribner's Sons. Consisting of 311 articles by scholars from many countries, with Philip P. Wiener, editor of The Journal of the History of Ideas serving as Editor in Chief, it is intended as an important contribution to an understanding of intellectual history. Work on the Dictionary began in 1967 and the project will ultimately comprise five volumes. The fifth will be an index, designed so that concepts and subjects can be traced through the entire work.

title: Roundup: Wood Wins 12th and 13th
description: Wilbur Wood, the Iron Man McGinnity of modern baseball, won two games last night.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, May 28 (Reuters)The Bank of Japan will raise its official discount rate early this week, Finance Minister Kiichi said today.

title: Board of City U. Considers Resigning
description: The city's Board of Higher Education convened in a special meeting last night to consider a protest resolution calling for the mass resignation of the 21member board, the annulment of the City University's budget request and, in effect, the transfer of City University's fouryear colleges to the State University system.

title: Levitt Says City Overpaid $6.3MilliononTextbooks
description: An audit by State Controller Arthur Levitt has found that the city school system may have been overcharged as much as $6.3million on its textbook purchase during the fiveyear period from 196768 through 197172.

title: Upstate Town Is Sauerkraut Capital, Where Science Attacks Old Problems
description: PHELPS, N. Y.  There are no signs to tell a stranger driving into this picturesque upstate village that he is entering the nation's sauerkraut capital. But as he hits the western edge of town on canning days, his nose would give it away.

title: Advertising: Lilly Shifts Thtust
description: After five years, Eli. Lilly & Co., has altered the thrust of its corporate advertising campaign.Since 1968 the theme of the advertising has been, in the words of Peter Geer, president of Lilly's agency, Geer, du Bois, a small child in big world.Beautiful, fourcolor, fullpage ads, have ,each showing lone youngsters in a variety of settings photographed in many locales.The single copy line has been, For four generations we've been making medicines as if people's lives depended on them followed by the Lilly logotype.By all measurements, the campaign has been a success, according to Richard S. Seclove, the agency's executive vice president, who is of the opinion that no other pharmaceutical manufacturer is currently running image vertising.Well, the new advertising has retained the old copy line, but has added to it.Picking out the word generations from the old copy, the agency has produced five ads each with a large photo of a grandparent with a grandchild shot by Duane Michaels, the photographer.Mr. Geer thinks they have an old masters look, a Titian look".

title: Ford Begins the Distribution Of $1Million in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 28 (Reuters)  The Argentine affiliate of the Ford Motor Company began paying money to children's hospitals today in response to an urban guerrilla threat of violence if $1million was not spent on welfare.

IVAN TROSCH

title: DAVID SHUB DIES; EXPERT ON LENIN
description: David Shub, an authority on the Russian revolution and author of a classic work on Lenin, died Sunday night in a Miami Beach hospital from complications following a series of heart attacks. He was 85 years old and lived at 355 Eighth Avenue.

description: WASHINGTON, May 28Within the Joint Congressional Committee on Atomic Energy, long the promoter of ever more atomic weapons, a changing the guard is taking place that Could have farreaching repercussions on the nuclear weapons program.

description: Rain driven in some places by high winds, and then drizzle, yesterday washed out parades and other Memorial Day events in the metropolitan area. title: Nixon Appoints Evans As an S.E.C. Member
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., May 28 (AP)  President Nixon today named John R. Evans, 40, of Murray, Utah, for appointment of a new fiveyear term as a member of the Securities and Exchange Commission,

description: CHICAGO, May 28 (AP)Damage from an explosion and fire that destroyed four buildings in an eightblock industrial area on the Southwest side here yesterday morning may run as high as $40millon, fire officials said today.

description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., May 28The marriage of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and Sister Elizabeth McAlister was reported tonight by the Rev. Paul Mayer, a close friend.

title: DOBERMANNAMED BEST AT QUEENS
DollarFree Politics
description: If there is one subject that has been studied, argued and microscopically analyzed for decades, it is the reform of American political campaign financing. It does not need another commission to start from scratch and come up with a report for stimulating Congressional action, especially in the full tide of Watergate.

title: Elf TOKYO AIDE FORCED TO RESIGN
description: TOYKO, May 28Premier Kakuei Tanaka's Government, already weak, took another blow from the Opposition parties today as the Speaker of the lower house of Parliament was forced to resign.

title: YORTY AND BRADLEY WIND UP CAMPAIGNS
description: LOS ANGELES, May 28 (AP) Mayor Sam Yorty and City Councilman Thomas Bradley ended their campaigns for the mayoralty today with lastminute charges and countercharges.

title: The Big Truth
description: WASHINGTONSo might the Big Truth of Watergate never be fully comprehended. Not that the American people know too much about it, in the Lairdian sense. It is simply that since midApril, in the span of a very few weeks, we have been called on to digest so much, so quickly. And there is apparently so much more to know.

title: Soviet Action Against Writer Is Denounced by Sakharov
description: MOSCOW, May 28 (AP)The renowned physicist and civilrights advocate Andrei D. Sakharov has denounced new action against the imprisoned dissident writer Andrei A. Amalrik as an impermissible attempt against intellectual freedom, and a threat of a new reprisal against Mr. Amalrik.

title: Strike Catches Antioch in Web of Its Liberal Tradition
description: YELLOW SPRINGS, Ohio, May 28  Antioch College, symbol of academic liberalism for 120 years, is caught in web of its own traditions as it struggles to resolve a student strike that has kept the school closed for 39 days.

title: Miss Penick Jersey Bride
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., May 28The marriage of Miss Jeannette Elizabeth Penick to John Secret Young, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Clements Young, took place here this afternoon. The Rev. John B. Coburn performed the Episcopal ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Sydnor Barksdale Penick Jr., parents of the bride. He was assisted by the Rev. Herbert E. Donovan.

title: Book Clubs Wield Vast Influence in Publishing Industry
description: Fans of Nathaniel Hawthorne's novel The Scarlet Letter know that a big red A used to stand for a kind of sin. But nowadays, in the hushed inner sanctums the BookoftheMonth Club, the same symbol may mean fame and power and hundreds of thousands of dollars for a writer.

title: DOBERMAN NAMED BEST AT QUEENS
Lipchitz Dedicated Work To Labovitcher Leader
description: One of the last pieces of sculpture that Jacques Lipchitz was creating depicted a Rebbe and His Hasidim.

title: Yugoslav Ship Fire Put Out
description: GALVESTON, Texas, May 28 (Reuters)  A fire aboard the Yugoslav motor vessel Vise Vica was extinguished today after the ship, carrying 73 passengers and a crew of 51, returned to port from 80 miles in the Gulf of Mexico. No injuries were reported.

title: Youth Drowns in River
description: OIL CITY, Pa., May 28 (UPI)  Robert Smith, 13 years old, drowned Saturday when the canoe in which he was riding capsized in the Allegheny River near here., The authorities said he and two other youths, were on an outing when Smith stood up, causing the canoe to capsize.

title: Crew of Skylab Confident Of a Full 28Day Mission
description: HOUSTON, May 28The Skylab 1 astronauts reported today that their orbiting space station was in excellent shape and that they fully expected to complete their planned 28day mission.

title: Chess:What Is It That Motivates The Passionate Passivist?
Watergate Has Hampered Functioning of Congress
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 An amateur lobbyist walked into the office of a key Senate aide one day last week to talk about legislation that would cut off funds for bombing Cambodia.

title: Tentam, $16.60, Beats Key to the Mint
description: Tentam of the Cragwood Stable made a frontrunning performance stand up to the wire and succeeded in taking the $114,300 Metropolitan Mile at Belmont Park yesterday. The outcome was a surprise to many in the holiday crowd of 43,160, for the race had among its participants the Rokeby Stables Key to the Mint and the Meadow Stable's Riva Ridge.

title: MYRON KOMMEL
description: Myron Kommel, a lawyer for 49 years and founder of Kommel, Rogers, Lorber & Shenkman, 475 Fifth Avenue, died Sunday at his home. He was 70 years old and lived at 1025 Fifth Avenue.

title: BookBuying on an Allowance
description: Maybe one reason that Johnny can't read, say Nancy Foutz and Cynthia Herbert, is that there are so few stores where children don't have to fight their way through towering adults to buy a book.

title: Eight Executed in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 28 (AP) Eight terrorists arrested while laying land mines on bridges near the border with Iraq were executed today by a firing squad, the Government announced. It said that they were caught April 8, tried by a military court and confessed. The Government said that they had admitted their connection with a foreign regime, but the country was not named.

title: From Hanoi Hilton to Saigon Hilton?
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam May 28The Hanoi Hiltonthe ironic name captured American pilots gave their prison in North Vietnamis gone. But if a group of architects and businessmen here have their way there will soon be a real, gleaming white Saigon Hilton Hotel, with 500 rooms.

title: A Scholar Infers Jesus Practiced Magic
description: In two books scheduled for publication this month, Prof. Morton Smith of Columbia University presents evidence that may alter understanding of the New Testament, of Christianity and of Jesus.

title: SESSION IN ALBANY ENDS WITH PASSING OF WELFARE BILL

title: Mrs. Halpern Remarried
description: ROSLYN, L. I., May 28Mrs. Susan Halpern and Stephen L. Cooperman were married here this morning at the Roslyn Country Club by Rabbi Abraham Feldbin. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Glanzberg of Bayside, Queens. Her father is assistant administrator of the Queens Hospital Center. Mr. Cooperman's parents are Mrs. Samuel Hersh of Brooklyn and the late David Cooperman. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.

title: Mass Transit a Key Issue In Jersey Governor Race
description: TRENTON, May 28While charges of corruption have tended to preempt the headlines in the New Jersey campaign for Governor; a poll for Representative Charles W, Sandpan Jr. suggests that as a campaign issue the allegations have taken a back seat to mass transit.

title: Bhutto Threatens to Try Bengalis Held in Pakistan
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, May 28President Zolfikar All Bhutto has warned that if Pakistani prisoners of war go on trial in Bangladesh, similar tribunals will be held here against Bengalis.

title: Illinois Begins Proceedings Against Equity Funding Co.
description: CHICAGO, May 28 (AP) The Illinois Attorney General said today he is starting criminal proceedings against the Equity Funding Life Insurance Company in connection with reports of massive fraud.

title: Alberta Oil Output Rises
description: CALGARY, May 28 (Canadian Press)Liquid petroleum production in Alberta averaged 158 million barrels a day during the week ended May 22, the Alberta Energy Resources Conservation Board reported yesterday. Production in the previous week averaged 1.52million barrels a day. Daily production in May was expected to average 1.6 million barrels.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Among the many memorable things that attended the winning of the Kentucky Derby by Citation in 1948 was the recollection of how brutally cold it was. I shivered on the roof alongside the television booth on a raw, intermittently rainy afternoon with the temperature plummeting to 42.degrees, lowest in the history of this mint julep classic. Not even a heartwarming performance by Citation could dispel the chill.

title: Mayor Sees Red Stegosaurus
description: HARTFORD, May 20On the mall next to City Hall, a sculpture by Alexander Calder, a 50foothigh abstract rendering of the stegosaurus in heavy steel plate, painted a brilliant orangered color, has risen dramatically, much to the consternation of Mayor George A. Athanson.

title: DEAN SAID TO GET OFFER TO REDUCE POSSIBLE CHARGES

title: Mayoral Candidates Seek To Thwart Voter Apathy
description: Although short of money, the four Democratic mayoral candidates plan extensive television advertising in the final week of the primary campaign to combat what their strategists believe is extraordinary voter apathy.

title: Futures Gain in Canada
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, May 28 (Canadian Press)All commodities futures advanced their maximum trading limits in light trading at the close today on the Winnipeg Commodity Exchange. Flax, rapeseed, barley and rye futures in all delivery months were up the 10cent limit, and oats was up its limit of 8 cents. Trading was sparse and buyers outnumbered sellers throughout the session.

title: Argentina Resumes Ties With Cuban Government
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 28The new Peronist Cabinet of Argentina today recognized the Cuban Government of Premier Fidel Castro.

description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 28Bishop Abel Muzorewa, the black nationalist leader, has been refused an invitation to preach in the Anglican cathedral of this whitegoverned capital.

description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office is looking into shortage of just over $5,000 in the customerservice department of the Offtrack Betting Corporation.

title: 2 Long Shots Long on Hope, Too
description: NEWARK, May 28With five Democrats in this year's race for Governor, one question raised by the primaries is, what makes Brendan, Ralph, Ann, Frank and Vito run?

title: GREECE WILL TRY 35 FOR REBELLION
description: ATHENS, May 28  Greece's militarybacked Government declared today that 35 navy officers would be tried, probably on treason charges, in the mutiny that broke out last week aboard a destroyer.

title: Space With a Purpose
description: WASHINGTON, May 28Every 93 minutes three men pass in the sky overhead on a route that takes them around the planet.

title: Mikhail D. Millionshchikov Dies; A Leading Soviet Scientist, 60
description: MOSCOW, May 28  Mikhail D. Millionshchikov, vice president of the Soviet Academy of Sciences and the principal spokesman for scientific contacts with the West, died here yesterday at the age of 60.

title: Baseball to Washington
description: The San Diego Padres of tine National League have been sold to a Washington syndicate for $12million, heralding the return of major league baseball to the capital. The transaction, confirmed yesterday, is subject to approval by the club owners. Details, Page 43.

title: Taipei Seems Largely Unmoved by Overtures From Peking for Unification
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, May 28k the year since President Nixon visited Peking, propaganda from the mainland has sought to influence the governing Chinese Nationalists here and the Taiwanese people in the direction of accepting unification under the Chinese Communist Government.

title: For the Court of Appeals
description: New Yorkers have come to realize that the state's courts are in disarray. How much or how little is done to reform them will depend, in considerable measure, on the choice the voters make in next November's elections for a new Chief Judge of the Court of Appeals. The Democrats can play their part in starting the reform process by designating a candidate who promises initiate administrative changes to improve the system of delivering justice.

title: 89TH St. GUNMAN IS YOUTH WITH TOY
description: A report that a gunman was loose on the Upper West Side brought police radio cars converging on a quiet corner of Central Park West yesterday afternoon. But the only usualties were a green Cadillac and two shaken policemen.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., May 28 (AP)Knockout victories by Albert Sandoval of Pomona, Calif., a flyweight, and Bob Stewart of Albany, N. Y., a lightheavyweight,.paced the United States to a 6.3 victory over Canada in the fourth North American amateur boxing championships tonight at the Nassau Coliseum. It was the fourth straight victory for the United States in the series.

title: DEVON JUMP WON BY DOUBLE DICE
MiddleClass Whites Still Leaving City
Skylab Aska Report On Indianapolis Race
description: HOUSTON, May 28 (UPI)The Skylab 1 astronauts, receiving their first news of world events since they blasted off last Friday from Cape Kennedy, asked today about the Indianapolis 500.

title: LibyaEgypt Merger Facing Obstacles
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, May 17By their official statements the leaders of Libya and Egypt are committed to bringing about a full merger between their countries by Sept. 1, but the obstacles to real unity seem to be growing daily.

title: Elsie de Wolfe Wouldn  t Have Approved
Gains in Earnings Shown By Western Broadcasting
description: VANCOUVER, British Coluinbia, May 28 (Canadian Press)Substantial increases in revenue and earnings were reported over the weekend in an interim yearend statement of Western Broadcasting Com pany, Ltd., for the fiscal year ended March 31. Net income was up 22 per cent, earnings per common share were up 15 per cent, and net operating revenue was up 20 per cent.

title: Crew of Skylab Confident Of a Full 28Day Mission
description: HOUSTON, May 28The Skylab 1 astronauts reported today that their orbiting space station was in excellent shape and that they fully expected to complete their planned 28day mission.

title: Common Market to Stress Tough Stand in U.S. Talks
description: BRUSSELS, May 28 (UPI)The European Common Market bowed to demands by France today and toughened the language it will take into world trade talks with the United States later this year.

title: Democrats Report on Spending
description: Campaign spending that ranged from Joseph L. Galiber's $8,120 to Harrison J. Goldin's $300,000 was reported yesterday by the four candidates for the Democratic nomination for Controller.

title: Swiss Shows Invoke Nostalgia of the 20's
description: ZURICH, SwitzerlandThree simultaneous exhibitions here illustrate not only the creative upsurge of the years between the World Wars but also the troubles and shame of those same years and their consequences until 1945. One, Contrasts of a Decade, deals with the art and general atmosphere o f the nineteen twenties. It includes furniture, glass and iron objects, theater decor, graphic and photographic art, works of functionalism, constructivisn?, late expressionism and cubism, samples of art deco and the work of the Russian modernists. In recent years several exhibitions have emphasized some aspects of this epochsuch as 1925 in Paris, or The Bauhaus in London. But none has ever been as complete as the one at the Museum of Applied Arts here, assembled by Erika Billeter. Forty museums, libraries and many private lenders are mentioned in the richly illustrated catalogue of the 462 exhibits.

title: White House Staff Seeks to Carry On During Crisis
description: MIAMI, May 28Over the last few days, the White House has been announcing appointmentsmanagement positions in the Department of Defense, assistant secretaries in the departments and othersjust as if the Government were functioning under normal conditions.

title: Candidates'
