description: Representative Mario Biaggio found himself, unexpectedly, part of a memorable Memorial Day scene in Herald Square yesterday.

title: Fairgoers in Soviet Ask About U.S.
description: MOSCOW, May 28 Miss Andrea Wine, who serves as a guide at the United States Outdoor Recreation Exhibition in Moscow, wears a Star of David pendant, admittedly as a conversation piece.

title: A School Voucher Experiment Rates an A in Coast District
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.On the east side of this city of half million an hour's drive south of San Francisco, six schools are finishing the first year of project that has made them the focus of national attention and controversy.

title: Miss De Ferrari Wed at Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 28In the Appleton Chapel of the Memorial Church at Harvard University this afternoon, Miss M. Laura De Ferrari, daughter of Mrs. Ar mando De Ferrari of Tacna, Peru, and the late Mr. De Ferrari, was married to John Sinnott 3d, son of Dr. and Mrs. Sinnott Jr. of Rumson, N. J. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Blayney Colmore 3d, rector of St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Dedham.

title: Ohio Servicewoman Honored
description: CANTON, Ohio, May 28 (UPI) Stark County commemorated its war dead today and paid tribute to Sharon Lane, the first American servicewoman killed in Vietnam. Miss Lane was 25yearold first lieutenant in the Army Nurse Corps when she was fatally wounded at Chu Lai in June, 1969. A bronze statue of Miss Lane was dedicated on the grounds of Altman Hospital here. She was a graduate of the Altman School of Nursing.

title: 100 Drunken Students Held at Jersey Shore
description: WILDWOOD, N.J., May 28  The annual Memodrial Day journey of college students to the Jersey Shore brought more than 100 arrests here and in North Wildwood over the weekend, mostly on drunkeness charges.

title: 7th U.S. Baby Is in Japan For BileDuct Operation
description: TOKYO, May 28 (UPI)Another American baby born with deficient bile ducts arrived here yesterday for treatment by Japanese surgeon who has developed a special technique for correcting the defect.

title: PRESIDENT TO GIVE BRIEFING ON TRUCE
description: WASHINGTON, Mayo 28,President Nixon and Henry A. Kissinger will meet with Congressional leaders tomorrow to discuss foreign affairs developMentsincluding the negotiations with North Vietnam to achieve stricter observance of the tourmonthold ceasefire agreement.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: FICTION Be Home by Eleven by Amber Dean (Putnam, $4,95). A novel of suspense.

title: Two More G,oals for Pele As Santos Tops Lazio, 4.1
description: CHICAGO, May 28 (UPI)Pele scored the first two goals today and set up the third as he led Santos of Brazil to 41 soccer victory over Lazio of Italy before an estimated crowd of 12,000 in Hanson Stadium,

title: SICKLE CELL TRAITS ELUDE SOME TESTS
description: CHICAGO, May 28 (UPI)Blood tests that have been used in screening programs for sickle cell anemia have not detected all the abnormal blood traits that can be genetically transmitted and cause health problems, a report said today. States Public Health Service, was published in the current Journal of the American Medical Association.

title: Nunn Gains After Accident
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., May 28 (UPI)Former Gov. Louie B. Nunn was in good Samaritan Hospital here Monday recuperating from a broken right ankle he suffered in a boating accident.

title: Legislature Quiet About Pay Rise
description: ALBANY, May 28It was a minute past midnight when the Assembly clerk began to read the title of a bill that had whisked through the Senate while earlier with an alacrity uncommon to the adjournment crush.

title: Garden Scoring With Reverse Stock Split
description: Anyone who went to Madison Square Garden for the circus over the holiday weekend paid more for a $2 program than an investor would pay for a share of the Garden's stock.

title: Knightly Dawn Captures $131,200 Jersey by Nose
Candidates Day
description: Representative Mario Biagio found himself, unexpectedly, part of a memorable Memorial Day scene in Herald Square yesterday.

title: A BRAZILIAN FLAVOR IN GUITARIST'S SONGS
description: Gaudencio Thiago de Mello, composerguitarist, left the Brazilian Amazon for New York in 1967, and has since built up a small but enthusiastic following for his special Brazilianflavored jazz settings. His score for The Visit currently graces the Spanishlanguage production of the Diirrenmatt work now on view at I.N.T.A.R., and a concert there Sunday night was devoted to 13 of his compositions.

title: Books of The Times
description: The function of the contemporary hero is to cancel the affirmations but to keep the setting of what once made him feel like a God. I found this one of the more interesting examples of Alfred Kazin'S style in Bright Book of Life. The sentence itself has a heroic. sweep; it is full of heuristic excitement. I felt a thrill of largeness, luxuriated in the vista offered to me. Yet I had an uneasynot quite naggingreservation because I sensed instinctively that the statement is too broad: Not all contemporary heroes can have the same fundtion. Nor am I sure that they always cancel the affirmations (which affirmations, exactly?) or keep the setting. And isn't feel like a God overreaching just a bit?

title: U.S. MAY RELEASE CITY HOSING AID
description: The Nixon Administration said yesterday that, despite its freeze on new Federal housingsubsidy commitments, it would consider applications to subsidize the extensive rehabilitation of 40 decayed Bronx tenements.

title: Beard's Golf Earns a Horse
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 28 (UPI)Frank Beard, playing before a hometown gallery, made eight straight birdies in courserecord nineunderpar 63 today as he won the fourth annual Kentucky Thoroughbred procelebrity golf tournament and earned a yearling race horse.

title: MRS. RICHARD MEALAND
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 28 Mrs. Marie Mealand, widow of Richard Mealand, novelist and motion picture executive, died Saturday in a nursing home here. Her age was 80.

title: HARRY H. GREER JR., NAVY HERO IN WAR
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., May 28 (AP)Harry H. Greer Jr., retired Navy captain who commanded the submarine that mapped the Japanese minefields in Tokyo harbor during World War II, died Saturday at his home. He was 62 years old.

title: Smoker Causes Hotel Fire
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 28 (AP) An assistant fire marshal here has said that a twoalarm fire at the St. Francis Hotel, which killed one person and injured 12 others, was caused by an elderly tenant's smoking in bed.

title: The President as Witness
description: The White House has reacted strongly to a report The Washington Post that the Watergate prosecutors have told the Justice Department that there is justification for calling President Nixon to answer questions before the District of Columbia grand jury which investigating the case. Mr. Nixon, according to his press spokesman, would not consider appearing before the grand jury under any circumstances and would not even answer written questions.

title: LEFKOWITZ GETS MET WHITE PAPER Offers Museum Suggestions on PrivateSales Report
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz, who opened an inquiry last January into the legality of recent private sales of paintings by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, said yesterday that his office had received a draft of the museum's white paper and had made suggestions concerning it to museum officials.

title: Hoffa Prosecutor Named To Aid Coxon Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 29James F. Neal, an experienced prosecutor from Nashville, has joined the staff of the special Federal prosecutor in the Watergate case.

title: Nicklaus's 70 Captures National Golf Day Round
description: CLEVELAND, May 29 (AP)Jack Nicklaus pulled ahead of Gary Player on te ast tree holes and finished with a oneunderpar 70 today, winning the National Golf Day Round of Champions at the Canterbury Golf Club. Player carded a 72.

title: Some Found It a Lark; Others Became Panicky
description: To some it was a lighthearted escapade providing a useful anecdote about the foibles of the Penn Central; to others it was a deeply, frightening experience.

title: Too Many to Feed
description: Six years ago in a book prophetically entitled Famine 1975, William and Paul Paddock warned that world population growth was outstripping food production and that an international food crisis was probable by the middle of the decade.

title: Abbott Labs and 5 Indicted in Fluids Sale
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Abbott Laboratories, Inc., and five of its present or former officers were indicted by a Federal grand jury today in a case involving the sale of allegedly contaminated intravenous fluids in 1970 and 1971.

title: Australian Leader Will Visit the U.S. Without Invitation
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 29 Prime Minister Gough Whitlam said today that he would visit the United States this year even without the official invitation from President Nixon that has been awaited in vain till noW.

title: Robert M. Lichtenberg, 51, A Port Authority Economist
description: Robert M. Lichtenberg, an economic analyst for the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, died Monday night in Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. He was 51 years old and lived at 16517 33d Avenue, Flushing, Queens.

title: Lipchitz Is Buried in JerUsalem With Lubavitcher Hasidic Rite
description: TEL AVIV, May 29Jacques Lipchitz, the expressionist sculptor, was buried in Jerusalem today. He died in Capri Saturday, and his body was flown to Israel for burial in cemetery plot he had bought during a visit to Jerusalem.

title: Current Figures Shown
CANADA TO RECALL TRUCE OBSERVERS WITHIN 60 DAYS
description: OTTAWA, May 29The Canadian Government, maintaining that its ceasefire observers in Vietnam were not being permitted to do their job properly, announced today that it had decided to bring them home within 60 days.

title: KEY SENATE TEST WON BY WAR FOES
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Opponents of the United States bombing of Cambodia won a key procedural test on the Senate floor today in their effort to cut off funds for the air war.

title: Red Smith
description: Five years to the day after C. Arnholt Smith and his daughter got up $10million for a National League baseball franchise in San Diego, they sold the club to three guys in Washington, D. C., for $12million. Considering that the Padres laid an egg on the beach, but still brought $2million more than the Yankees cost six months earlier, this looks at first glance like another illustration of Soriano's law that in baseball nothing succeeds like failure. (In a single year, Dewey Soriano and his associates converted Seattle into a disaster area and Sports then sold out to Milwaukee interests for $10.5million.)

title: Kissinger Expects Talks To Strengthen CeaseFire
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Henry A. Kissinger said today that he expected to conclude new.understandings with Hanoi next week to strengthen the Vietnam ceasefire agreement. In a news conference. at the White House, President Nixon's adviser on national security made his first comments on his current round of talks with Hanoi's chief negotiator, Le Duc Tho.

title: Due Process and N.C.A.A. Eligibility Code
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association bent just enough last week from its usual rigid policy of rules enforcement to permit Fred Amara of Pennsylvania and Dennis Walker of Adelphi to compete in the I.C.4A. track and field championships. But Samara's secondplace finish in the decathlon and Walker's part in Adelphi's 440 yard relay victory are not as important as the right they may have established to full and open hearings for college athletes accused of violating N.C.A.A. regulations.

title: Ilona Kabos Is Dead at 75; Pianist Taught at Juilliard
description: Ilona Kabos, a wellknown piano teacher who taught or coached many celebrated pianists, including Gina 13achauer, John Browning and Tamas Vasary, died in London on Sunday. Her age was 75.

title: Safety Council Is Accused Of Undeestanting Accidents
description: ATLANTIC CTY, May 29 (UFOThe privately run National Safety Council has been understating the nation's actual number of disabling accidents and occupational injuries, Irving Bluestone, a United Auto Workers vice president, said today.

title: FOES OF ABORTION CALL FOR BOYCOTT
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 29Some Roman Catholic Churches in this area have been circulating petitions calling for a financial boycott of Atlantic City Hospital because of its liberalized abortion policy.

title: NAUMBURG CONCERTS BEGIN ON PARK MALL
description: The arrival of Memorial Day is the traditional signal for New York's first openair concerts of the summer. Although Monday's cold, rainy weather early in the day forced the Harlem Philharmonic to cancel its afternoon concert in Damrosch Park, the skies cleared by evening and the 68th annual Naumburg series began as scheduled on Central Park's chilly but dry Mall.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: TRUSTEESHIP COUNCIL Meets at 10:30 A.M:

title: Kissinger Expects Talks To Strengthen CeaseFire
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Henry A. Kissinger said today that he expected to conclude new understandings with Hanoi next week to strengthen the Vietnam ceasefire agreement. In a news conference, at the White House, President Nixon's adviser on national security made his first comments on his current round of talks with Hanoi's chief negotiator, Le Duc Tho.

title: Steel Output Is Below Peak
description: Steel production for the week ended May 26 eased, but total output of 3,010,000 tons was the second highest in the industry's history, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The decline of 0.2 per cent left the index at 123.4, compared with the record of 123.6 in the week ended May 19, when production reached 3,015,000 tons, record.

title: Antiques Is First Of Stage Telecasts In CableTV Series
description: The first of a projected series of live, closedcircuit telecasts of New York stage productions over pay and cable television facilities will he Antiques, a new musical revue written by Alan Greene and Laura Manning, with special material by Dore Schary.

title: GAS TANKS LEAK IN TEST CRASHES
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Test crashes of six 1973model automobiles have demonstrated deficiencies in fuel tank design that needlessly expose occupants to fire, a Congressional hearing was told today.

title: Gram Prices Alarm Officials; Ways to Cool Markets Sought
description: The Government, which prommised an end to soaring food costs for the second half of the year, has become alarmed over the unabated surge in prices of soybeans, corn and wheat.

title: HIGH COURT BACKS COMMITMENT CURB
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that a crim. final defendant adjudged toe mentally ill to stand trial could not be committed to a New York State mental hospital operated by the Department of Correction unless a jury determined him to be dangerous.

title: AID BY EXCHANGE FOR WEIS BARRED
description: The New York Stock Exchange decided late yesterday not to come to the rescue of the customers of Weis Securities, the brokerage firm charged with fraud last week. Instead, it left the problem to the courts and the Securities Investor Protection Corporation.

title: Stop The Music 85 Pick Today in Withers Mile
description: Harold (Fats) Wicsman, the agent who decides which horses Jacinto Vasquez rides, doesn't believe in hedging his predictions with uncertainty.

title: Biaggi Sues The Post Over Headline on Him
description: Representative Mario Biaggi yesterday filed a $25,250,000 damage suit against The New York Post and two staff members over a Post headline in its issue of May 16 dealing with Mr. Biaggi's appearance before a special state grand jury.

title: HoIstra Names Payton as Head; He Is Leaving Post College
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 29 Robert L. Payton, who had resigned as the president of the C. W. Post College Center of Long Island University, effective Aug. 31, was named today as the new president of Hofstra University.

title: GOLD PRICES STEADY AS DOLLAR DECLINES
description: LONDON, May 29 (UPI)The price of gold remained firm at nearrecord highs and the dollar lost value in European moneY exchange markets today.

title: Nixon Urges Japanese to Invest in U. S.
description: TOKYO, May 29President Nixon urged Japanese businessmen today to invest in the United States, saying that throughout American history, investments from abroad have made important contributions to the growth of our economy.

title: Buchanan Outpoints Otero In Florida Lightweight Bout
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 29 (Reuters)Ken Buchanan of Scotland, former world lightweight champion, gained a unanimous 10round decision tonight over sixthranked Frankie Otero of Hialeah.

title: Abbott Labs and 5 Indicted in Fluids Sale
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Abbott Laboratories, Inc., and five of its present or former officers were indicted by a Federal grand jury today ire a case involving the sale of allegedly contaminated intravenous fluids in 1970 and 1971.

title: Philadelphia Power Fails
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 29 (AP) Some 20,000 West Philadelphia customers lost their lights for almost 40 minutes early this morning when a Philadelphia Electric Company substation failed.

title: DeRose Charges Byrne Had aDoLittle Record
description: JERSEY CITY, May 29 State Senator Ralph C. DeRose declared today that Brendan T. Byrne, his main rival for the Democratic gubernatorial nomination, had a dolittle record as a Prosecutor in Essex County.

title: SOYBEANS CLIMB ON SPECULATION
description: The new 40centabushel daily trading limit on soybeans effective yesterday failed to curb speculative buying.

title: Major Redesign Urged For Union Sq. and Park
description: Plans for a major redesign of Union Square, develop by students at the Parsons School of Design, were unveiled yesterday and presented to public officials.

title: Roundup: Cepeda Homer Wins Another for Boston
description: Orlando Cepeda, rescued from baseball's scrap heap by the designatedhitter rule in force in the American League this season, won another game for the Boston Red Sox last night.

title: Ozark Air Lines Talks Set
description: ST. LOUIS, May 29 (AP)Representatives of striking mechanics and Ozark Air Lines are to meet tomorrow in Washington before the National Mediation Board in a new effort to end a 41dayold strike that has paralyzed Ozark operations in 62 cities. Union members were paid $6.02 under their old contract; they seek $6.82 hourly plus certain premium pay. The company has offered $6.80 an hour.

title: DENIS DUFOR
description: Denis DuFor, a Broadway manager andproducer, died of a stroke Monday evening at St. John's Hospital, Elmhurst, Queens. He was 81 years old and lived at 90.07 68th Avenue, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two Manhattan patrolmen were indicted for allegedly lying in connection with a Civil Court negligence suit about the details of a crash between their patrol car and another automobile.

title: Stock Prices Edge Lower In Dull Trading Session
105 Women Police Recruits Told the Age of Equality Dawns
description: At 12:52 yesterday afternoon an incoming class of 250 police recruits rose to take a departmental oath and at that moment the number of women on the ciy's police fort rose by 34,2 per cent.

title: The Winner in Albany
C.&O. Meeting Sees Profit Gain; Garden Corp. Sets Reverse Split
description: Stockholders of the Chesapeake & Ohio Railway attending the annual meeting in White Sulphur Springs, W. Va., yesterday were told that assuming good business continues through June that consolidated revenues of the system should cross the $500million mark and net income should exceed $4 a, share. Both figures, if

title: Mrs. Nixon to Attend Rites For Secret Service Agent
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)Mrs. Richard M. Nixon and her daughter, Mrs. David Eisenhower, will attend the funeral tomorrow in Greenwich, Conn., or J. Clifford Dietrich, the Secret Service agent who was killed in a crash of a Presidential helicopter in the Bahamas Saturday.

title: Blob Grows in Dallas; Housewife Is Puzzled
description: DALLAS, May 29 (UPI)A growth in a back yard garden turned white today and appeared to be dying.

title: Amex Stocks Rise
CAMBODIA REPORTS KEY ROAD REOPENED
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 29 (UPI)The Cambodian High Command said today that Government troops with intense United States air support had broken a twomonth rebel stranglehold on Route 5 that cut off Phnom Penh from the rice provinces in the west.

title: Rate of Discount in Japan Increased From 5 to 5.5%
description: TOKYO, May 29Japan today raised her official discount rate from 5 to 5.5 per cent. The new rate will go into effect tomorrow.

title: MATHEW PAYTON
description: Mathew Payton, 18yearold son of Robert L. Payton, president of C. W. Post College in Brookville, L. I., died yesterday of Hodgkin's disease at the SloaneKettering Institute for Cancer Research. His father was named president yesterday of Hofstra University in Hempstead, L. I.

title: People in Sports: Books Lose to Baskets, 5 to 1
description: Wearing a black and white striped suit with matching cap and a blue turtleneck sweater, Ernie DiGregorio, the flashy former guard at Providence College; finally showed up to meet the Buffalo press yesterday at the fourth news conference called to announce his reported $1million dollar contract with the N.B.A.'s Braves and proceeded to crack everybody up with the comment: When in college, there's no question you have to put the time in on the books. I put an hour a day in the books and five hours a day in the game. DiGregorio rushed back to Providence to rehearse for his wedding on Saturday.

title: Showdown for Safety
description: A bureaucratic reorganization by the new chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission, Dixy Lee Ray, gives promise of a constructive new voice in the ongoing debate over the safety of nuclear power generating plants. Plunging ahead where many, before her hesitated to tread, Dr. Ray has abruptly established a Division of Reactor Safety Research in the commissionremoving this sensitive study from the jurisdiction of the Division of Reactor Development and Technology and its formidable chieftain, Milton Shaw.

title: ATHENS EXPECTED TO END MONARCHY
description: ATHENS, May 29Newspapers here, with unusual unanimity, said today that the immediate consequence of the Greek naval mutiny of last week would be the early abolition of the monarchy, by decree not by a referendum.

title: BOY, 10, IS KILLED; GAME SUSPECTED
DeBusschere to Become Boss of Nets in 197475
description: Dave DeBusschere, considered by many the key to the Knicks two National Basketball Association championships, will quit as a player after one more season to become general manager of the Nets in the rival American Basketball Association. The Nets have scheduled a news conference today at the 21 Club to make official his appointment, effective with the 197475 season.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Elected officials from the New York suburbs met with Mayor Lindsay yesterday to discuss his plan for regional financing of mass transit and then flatly rejected a key feature of his plan, a regional payroll tax. It would be political suicide for us, said Ralph G. Caso, Nassau County Executive.

title: Men Working, the Sign Saidbut That Wasn't So
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.Women ditchdiggers, long familiar sight in the Soviet Union and occasionally encountered in Israel during its formative years, are now being seen along South Ocean Boulevard.

title: People and Business
description: William M. Fine, who resigned last week as president of the Bonwit Teller specialtystore chain, has been named to the new post of president of the Wamsutta Domestics division of M. Lowenstein & Sons, Inc., a leading textiles and textileproducts manufacturer, effective July 15.

title: 500 Race May Delay Rex Mays 150
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 29The second postponement of the Indianapolis 500 today may have a backup effect on the next race of the United States Auto Club's championship circuit, the Rex Mays 150 next Sunday at Milwaukee.

title: Tornado Leaves 12 Homes in a Small Jersey Community in Ruins
ASTRONAUTS TURN SCOPES ON THE SUN
description: HOUSTON, May 29The Skylab 1 astronauts became solar astronomers today as they trained an array of telescopes to observe Xray emissions and examine the structure of the sun's atmosphere.

title: 2 FLIRTING MANIKINS IN A REDLICH DANCE
description: Broad in its sweeping movement and cushioned in the sound of a dozen old nostalgic songs, Don Redlich's Everybody's Doin It has the exuberance of a street festival. And as part of the City Center's Spring Dance Festival, it was seen Friday evening near the Lincoln Center fountain.

title: HUNT SAYS HE URGED MURDER OF CASTRO
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (UPI)E. Howard Hunt Jr., Watergate conspirator and former Central Intelligence agent who helped plan the abortive 1961 invasion of Cuba, has said he recommended to his superiors that Fidel Castro be assassinated as part of the plot.

title: Senate Watergate Panel: Despite Its Prestige and Mandate, It Is a Typical Congressional Committee
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr. excused himself briefly from the Watergate hearings one day last week to go off on what the audience presumed was an important mission. It turned out he had to meet with a delegation of constituents representing junior colleges in his home state of North Carolina.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of 1.6 million shares of Bond Shares of America, Inc. common stock at $15 a share was made yesterday by a group of underwriters headed by Loeb Rhoades & Co. The minimum number of shares that may be purchased of the newly formed closedend diversified management investment company was set at 60. The offering will not be completed unless 800,000 shares are purchased by the underwriters from the company. Bond Shares of America, Inc. intends to apply for listing on the American Stock Exchange. Funds, Inc. is the investment adviser the company.

title: HARRY R. LITCHFIELD, PEDIATRICIAN, DEAD
description: Dr. Harry R. Litchfield, senior pediatrician at the Brookdale Hospital Medical Center in Brooklyn, died of a heart attack Sunday at his home, 870 Fifth Avenue. He was 73 years old.

title: Ferrar Registers Upset In Met College Tennis
description: Steve Ferrar, a St. John's junior, upset secondseeded Barry Lazar of City College, 16, 6.4, 63 en route to the quarterfinals of the Metropolitan College Tennis Conference championships yesterday at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: White House Rejects Move To Review Kent U. Deaths
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP) The White House has turned down the petitions of four Kent State University students who sought a Federal grand jury to further investigate the shooting deaths of four Kent State students in 1970 antiwar demonstrations.

title: 30 Felled as Scores Flee Penn Central Tunnel Fire
description: Tens of thousands of homebound Penn Central commuters were stranded or delayed last night after a fire broke out in the engine of a train stalled under Park avenue at 76th Street, prompting a power shutdown that halted all service into and out of Grand Central Terminal.

title: COALITION IN ITALY LOSES ITS MAJORITY
description: ROME, May 29The 11monthold centrist coalition Government of Premier Giulio Andreotti lost its narrow majority in Parliament late last night when a small party that had supported it announced that it could no longer do so.

title: Texas Votes Death Penalty
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 29 (Reuters)The Texas Legislature has voted to reinstate the death penalty for murder under five specific conditions. The Legislature acted last night at its closing session in response to the June 29, 1972, ruling by the United States Supreme Court, which declared most state capital punishment laws unconstitutional.

title: Florida Law Restores Cape Canaveral's Name
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., May 29 (UPI)Gov. Reubin Askew signed into law today a measure restoring the name Cape Canaveral to a geographical area of Florida that President Johnson renamed Cape Kennedy on Nov. 29, 1963.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Governor Cahill signed into law a bill authorizing November referendum on a $25million bond issue provide facilities for the education of severely handicapped children.

title: Scores of Commuters Flee Penn Central Tunnel Fire
description: Tens of thousands of homebound Penn Central commuters were stranded or delayed last night after a fire broke out in a train stalled under Park Avenue at 76th Street, prompting a power shutdown that halted all service into and out of Grand Central Terminal.

title: Borg, 16, Beats Stockton, Continuing Upset Streak
description: PARIS, May 29 (AP)Bjorn Borg, the 16yearold Swede, conquered Dick Stockton, the United States Davis Cup player, 67, 75, 62, 76, with another astonishing display in the $133,000 French open tennis championships today.

title: ERNEST H. SCHROEDER
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., May 29Ernest H. Schroeder, a vice president of Reichold Chemicals, Inc., in White Plains, died at his home here yesterday. He was 57 years old.

title: ECONOMIC GAUGES DECLINED IN APRIL
description: WASHINGTON, May 29The Governmebt's composite index of leading indicators of the economy turned down in April for the first time since October, 1970, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Watergate Effect on Aid Worries Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 29  President Nguyen Van Thieu today indicated for the first time that he was concerned that the Watergate scandal might have affected American polcy toward South Vietnam.

title: ALBERT F. HOWARD
description: ESSEX FELLS, N. J., May 29 Albert Franklyn Howard, who retired in 1966 as vice president of Marsh & Mc Lennan, Inc., international insurance brokers of New York, died today at his home here. His age was 72.

title: Soviet Allows South Korean To Attend Moscow Meeting
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 29The Soviet Union has allowed a South Korean theatrical director to enter to attend an international conference in Moscow, it was reported here today.

title: Kennedy Library Plans Are Unveiled
description: BOSTON; May 29  On what would have been President Kennedy's 56th birthday, the Kennedy family today unveiled the longawaited, longdelayed plan for the John F. Kennedy Library.

title: U.S. Warns on a U. N. Mideast Measure
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 The United States served notice today that it would block any efforts to push through the United Nations Security Council a new resolution on the Middle East that would differ from what was worked out to the satisfaction of the Israelis and Egyptians in November, 1967.

title: Rangers'Vickers Named N.H.L. Rookie of the Year
description: Steve Vickers, New. York Ranger left wing, was named winner yesterday of the Calder Memorial Trophy as the National League's outstanding rookie for the 197273 season. He is the first Ranger to win the award since Camille Henry after the 1953.54 season.

title: 2 OFFICERS FACE PERJURY CHARGE
description: District Attorney Frank S. Hogan of Manhattan announced the indictment yesterday of two policemen on charges that they had lied about a crash between their patrol car and another automobile.

title: EDWIN ANDREW DIES; HEADED AD AGENCY
description: Edwin L. Andrew, who retired in 1959 as chairman of the Fuller & Smith & Ross, Inc., advertising agency, then of Cleveland but now of New York, died Saturday in St. Vincent's Hospital in, Bridgeport, Conn. He was 78 years old and lived at 3030 Park Avenue in Bridgeport.

title: JOHN C. SHINN, 54, U.S. OFFICIAL, DIES
description: WASHINGTON, May 29John C. Shinn, Deputy AssistSecretary of Labor for labormanagement relations, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home in McLean, Va. he was 54 years old.

title: BIRTHCURB DEVICE IS RECALLED BY F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration announced today the seizure of 9,000 Majzlin spring intrauterine devices and the recall of others because of possible harmful complications to users.

title: ECONOMIC GAUGES DECLINED IN APRIL
description: WASHINGTON, May 29The Government's composite index of leading indicators of the economy turned down in April for the first time since October, 1970, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Dr. Matthew Indicted on New Charges
description: Dr. Thomas W. Matthew, the prominent advocate of black capitalism, has been indicted on two further counts of grand larceny, Queens District Attorney Michael F. Armstrong announced yesterday.

title: Lone Ranger and Tonto Promoted to Detectives
description: Housing Patrolmen John Sepe and Louis Telano, the plainclothes anticrime team that has become history on the streets of Brooklyn as the Lone Ranger and Tonto, will be promoted to detectives today.

title: Great Neck School Board Bars Inquiry on Nazi Song in Concert
description: GREAT NECK, L I., May 29 The school board in this predominantly Jewish community tonight rejected a plea for an investigation of why a socalled Nazi youth song had been scheduled for a recent junior high concert.

title: 1969 Race Involved By RICHARD PHALON
description: NEWARK, May 29  A Federal grand jury investigating alleged irregularities in the financing of Governor Cahill's 1969 election campaign today indicted two corporations on charges of filing false income tax returns.

title: 72 SOVIET TRADE SHOWS A DEFICIT
description: MOSCOW, May 29  The Soviet Union ran such a large deficit last year in trade with the West that it produced a deficit in Moscow's total world trade for the first time since World War II.

title: She Defends Nixon In Difficult Times
description: WASHINGTON  When the White House receives a request these days for a Presidential aide to turn out for public forum to discuss the Watergate case, it is not unusual that the only one with nerve enough to make the appearance is a Southern woman named Anne Legendre Armstrong.

title: Current Figures Shown
description: TRENTON, May 29  A new list of contributors to Governor Cahill's reelection campaign made public today includes the name of E. Lawrence Bellante, the head of an engineering concern that was indicted today on charges of Federal tax fraud involving concealed donations to the Governor's 1969 election campaign.

title: Figueres Describes Vesco Aid
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, May 29  President Jose Figueres says he urgently needed a massive injection of new capital for his financially troubled company, looked everywhere for potential investors and wound up with Robert L. Vesco without knowing him very well.

title: Nixon Still Seeks a New Atlantic Charter
description: WASHINGTON, May 29On the eve of President Nixon's departure for a conference with President Pompidou of France, Henry A. Kissinger said today that the Administration still hoped for a new Atlantic charter in some form.

title: Monetary Policy: Key to the Price of Gold
CITY GETS A PLAN TO SAVE HOUSING
description: Mayor Lindsay. announced yesterday a program to save housing in transitional neighborhoods where blight has entered its first stages.

title: FISHING DISPUTE AIRED AT THE U.N
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 29Britain and Iceland exchanged angry words today in letters sent to the President of the Security Council over the fishing dispute between the two countries.

title: The New School Board
description: The Legislature has, in effect, given the city's interim Board of Education a vote of confidence. This is clearly the intent of the overwhelming support in Albany for establishment of a permanent New York City board in 1974 differing very little from the present one, which was originally created to preside over the transition to decentralization. The only significant change is the addition of two members, named by the, Mayor, to the five who are to continue to be appointed by the Borough Presidents.

title: URBAN COALITION WILL MEET TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 Born six years ago out of the rubble and rhetoric of the riots of the nineteensixties, the National Urban Coalition will hold its first conference this week to assess its past and future,

title: Candidates'
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame said he would demand a special session of the Legislature to save the 35cent fare on the city's transit system.

title: Carl B. Molander, 71, Dies; ExSales Director of U.P.I.
description: Carl B. Molander, who retired as sales director of United Press International in 1967 after 45 years with the wire service, died apparehtly of heart attack, on Monday at Elmhurst (Queens) General Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 3450 80th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens, and on Shelter Island, N. Y.

title: 7 Indicted in Drug Smuggling
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 29 (AP)Seven foreigners have) been indicted for conspiracy to smuggle at least $25million in, heroin into this country, United States Attorney James L. Browning Jr. disclosed Tuesday. Six of those indicted are Malay sian and one is from Thailand.

title: JUSTICES BROADEN POWER OF POLICE TO HUNT EVIDENCE; Use of Fingernail Scrapings and a Car Search Are Upheld in Two Rulings; VOTES ARE 72 AND 6.3; Court Also Backs Refusal of TV and Radio Stations to Accept Political Ads
Sports News Briefs
description: KANSAS CITY, May 29 (AP)A group of Kansas City businessmen have bought the Kansas CityOmaha Kings of the National Basketball Association, it was announced today. The purchase price was undisclosed.

title: Issue and Debate
description: No Gas signs that went up more than usual over the holiday weekend added frustration and bitterness to the oftenangry debate over the reason for the nation's gasoline shortages. One of the issues is whether the shortages are real or manufactured.

title: Pennsylvania Ave. Closing
description: Traffic Commissioner Benjamin Ward said yesterday that traffic to and from the Belt Parkway along Pennsylvania Avenue in Brooklyn would be dirveted to a temporary roadway between ,the parkway and Flatlands Avenue at Van Siclen Avenue until repair work was completed do Pennsylvania Ave nue.

title: D. C. Black Repertory Stages Jean Genet's Blacks
MRS. CAROLINE CHAPMAN
description: Mrs. Caroline Randolph Chapman, for 60 years a psychic medium often mentioned in literature on the subject, died Monday of a stroke in Huntington (L.I.) Hospital. She was 92 years old and lived at 155 East 34th Street.

title: Princess Anne Is Engaged to an Army Lieutenant
description: LONDON, May 29They met at the horse events at the Olympics in Mexico. They competed in jumping trials all over England. Their romance became the talk of the land. And tonight Buckingham Palace announced the engagement of the two young riders: Princess Anne and Lieut. Mark Phillips.

title: SCHOOLAID PLAN GETS EXTENSION
description: TRENTON, May 29  The United States Supreme Court ruled today that New Jersey's $19.5million program of state aid to private and parochial schools could remain in effect while it decided a state appeal of a Federal Court decision that had struck down the program as unconstitutional.State officials said today's decision in Washington meant that the state's parochial and private school aid program which was being dismantled would most likely be allowed to continue with the new school year in September. This is because, they said, the ultimate ruling by the Court on their appeal is not expected until late fall, at the earliest.

title: Gen. Cushman Tells Jury That Hunt Violated Trust
description: LOS ANGELES, May 29Gen. Robert E. Cushman Jr., former deputy director of Central Intelligence, told a Los Angeles grand jury today that E. Howard Hunt Jr. had violated his trust by involving the C.I.A. in the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's psychiatrist.

title: C.B.S. Ousts an. Executive And Sues Him for $94,000
description: Clive J. Davis, president of the CBS Records Group and the man responsible for changing the Columbia record label image from classical and show music to rock, was dismissed) yesterday, and a civil suit was filed against him charging him with illegally spending almost $94,000 in corporate funds.

title: Friendly Foes Serve in Campaign Camps
description: The people who are tearing down one another's campaign posters, this week  and who are denouncing one another in time for the 6 o'clock news all know one another.

title: New Institutes of Health Chief Robert Samuel Stone
description: WASHINGTON, May 29The story going around Washington is that when the name Robert Samuel Stone was mentioned a few weeks ago at the annual meeting. of the Institute of Medicine of the National Academy of Sciences, few of those present could place him. This is not a legitimate reflection on Dr. Stone, who is certainly well known and respected in his fieldspathology and medical education. But it does illustrate one of the problems he will face as the next director of the National Institutes of Health. His appointment to that top administrative position in American medical research was announced today by the White House

title: Notes on People
description: Donald C. Alexander was sworn as the new Commis. sioner of Internal Revenue. Mr. Alexander, who replaced Johnnie Walters, was inducted by Supreme Court Justice Potter Stewart in Washington. As he prepared to assume his duties, Mr. Alexander said the Internal Revenue Service must also see to it that all pay their proper share of the nation's taxes.

title: 2d Tokyo Aide in 2 Days Forced to Resign
description: TOKYO, May 29  Premier Kakuei Tanaka's shaky Government was stunned again today when a second senior official in two days was forced to resign under pressure from the leftist Opposition parties.

title: Administration ls Attacked On Economic Management
description: One of Wall Street's leading economists launched a blistering attack yesterday on the Nixon Administration's management of the national economy.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (Reuters)The House of Representatives approved today a bill ratifying February's per cent dollar devaluation after defeating several amendments that would have set a specific date for allowing Americans to buy and sell gold.

title: Goes International
description: In Quito, the Cookie Monster gobbles tacos. Big Bird is Bibo in Hamburg and Garibaldo in Sao Paulo. In Latin America,. Oscar the Grouch has left his garbage can to become Paco, the opinionated parrot, in Mexico City, and Gugu, a cantankerous (but goodhearted) junk collector in Rio de Janeiro.

title: Youths Flock to Kabul, Still Drug Sanctuary
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, May 24Night falls early in this city rimmed with snowstreaked mountains. In the bleak downtown quarter the only sounds are donkeys with carts clattering and sporadic rock music from the dozen flophouses and cheap restaurants that line the bazaar.

title: Philippine General Says Blockade Cut Aid for Insurgents
description: MANILA, May 29 (AP)A Philippine army field commander said today that a naval blockade had cut down foreign assistance to insurgents in the central Mindanao region and restored relative stability to the area.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Amex Registers Deficit
description: Higher costs for automation and other projects  coupled with the effects of lower trading volumeresulted in a firstquarter loss of $107,000, the American Stock Exchange reported yesterday.

title: Armbro Steven Favored In Yonkers Trot Tonight
GOING OUT Guide
description: STAR TREK There's an air of show biz that hovers over Catch a Rising Star, a night spot at 1487 First Avenue, near 78th Street (RE 49777), right from the euphoric name down to the photos on the wall and the sign that hopefully proclaims Broadway over the tables. The place attracts a young crowd and is a fairly cheerful looking establishment.

title: The Trials Of Ron Ziegler
description: WASHINGTON, May 29One of the mysteries around the White House these days is why Ron Ziegler remains as the President's spokesman rather than being called to testify before the grand jury and the Ervin Committee on the Watergate case.

title: CAMPORA IS GIVEN BACKING OF ARMY
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 29The new Commander in Chief of Argentina's army pledged his support of the new Peronist Government today, but asserted that it would have to abide by the Constitution.

title: J. N. BARNETTE
description: J. N. Barnette, a divisional vice president for Latin America of Pan American World Airways, died Saturday of heart attack at his home, 627 Nassau Avenue, Freeport, L. I. He was 57 years old.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WAYNE, May 29Phil Zofrea has been in the construction business for some time, but the one thing he always wanted to build was a college football team. Now that he has been appointed to head William Paterson's football program, his wish will perhaps come true.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, May 29The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Bridge: Husbands and Wives Refute Old Theory in Eastern Play
President Will Not Testify In Inquiries on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 29President Nixon will not testify, either orally or in writing, to either the grand jury or the Senate committee investigating the Watergate case, the White House said today.

title: Steindecker Consents to Bar by S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged the New York brokerage firm of Steindecker, Friedman & Co. with fraudulent trading in 1968 and 1969 and barred it from doing business on the American Stock Exchange for 15 days beginning June 4.

title: Ending Soviet Isolation
description: In his Bonn speech extolling EastWest dtente, Leonid I. Brezhnev spoke for growing openness in Moscow's global relations. Our course, he said, is not toward isolating our country from the outside world. On the contrary, we proceed from the fact that it will develop under conditions of growing cooperation with the outside world, and not only with socialist countries at that, but in considerable measure with the states of the opposite social system as well.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Spain Invites Frazier to Conduct

title: Contracts for April On Building Gained; Appropriations Up
description: Construction contracts in April totaled $8,814,128,000 up from $8,212,059 in April of 1972, it was reported yesterday by the F. W. Dodge division of the McGraw Information Systems Company. The Dodge index, however, was 177 per cent of the 1967 base period, down from 193 in March, chiefly as a result of the decline in homebuilding last month.

title: Books of The Times
description: It is a tempting notion that Walter Karp sets forth in Indispensable Enemies: The Politics of Misrule in America. Perhaps is much more than a notion; possibly it is a lightning bolt out of the blue. At any rate, what Mr. Karp, an editor and journalist, suggests is that everything that is now wrong with our Republiceverything from racism to pollution to the excessive amount of money we budget for weapons systems  can be explained by the corruption of the twoparty system by a conspiring oligarchy. This oligarchy, which Mr. Karp only indirectly identifies, rules our lives, frustrates our hopes, yet keeps us in thrall to the system, by going to any and all lengths to keep political

title: Visitor From Moscow Finds Surprises in. Soviet Bloc
description: BERLIN  When Leonid 1 Brezhnev came here, for visit in midMay, officials of the East German Communist party marshaled thousands of young people to pay him a proper welcome.

title: TRAFFIC IS BANNED IN 3 MAJOR PARKS PART OF EACH DM
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that three of the city's major parks  Central Park in Manhattan, Prospect Park in Brooklyn and Forest Park in Queens  would be closed to motor vehicles from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. Monday through Friday, beginning next Monday and continuing through September.

title: 1 Killed, 2 Hurt in Crash
description: MOUNT UNION, Pa., May 29 (UPI)A Pennsylvania woman was killed and two New York men injured when a tractortraller struck an automobile near here on U. S. 22 ,Sunday night and plowed into a service station, causing an estimated $50,000 damage. The police said Vera Doyle, 51, driver of the car, was killed. The injured men were Robert Constantine, Wantagh, L. I., and Michael Birmingham of Brooklyn.

title: Black News Office Ruined
description: WILMINGTON, N.C., May 29 (AP)An explosion last night demolished the office of the Wilmington Journal, a blackowned weekly newspaper, the police said. No one was reported injured.

title: TRAFFIC IS BANNED IN 3 MAJOR PARKS PART OF EACH DAY
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that three of the city's major parks  Central Park in Manhattan, Prospect Park in Brooklyn and Forest Park in Queens  would be closed to motor vehicles from 10 A.M. to 4 P.M. Monday through Friday, beginning next Monday and continuing through September.

title: Heller Agrees to Acquire American National Corp.
description: The Walter E. Heller International Corporation and the American National Corporation said yesterday that a formal agreement merging American National into Heller would be submitted to directors of both concerns on June 15.

title: Bradley Beats Yorty In Los Angeles Race
description: LOS ANGELES, May 29Thomas Bradley, the son of a poor Texas fieldhand, was erected tonight as the first black Mayor of Los Angeles.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Soviet Satellite Launched
description: MOSCOW, May 29 (AP)The Soviet Union launched a meteor satellite today designed to help meteorologists forecast the weather. Tass, the Soviet news agency, said the satellite was orbiting the earth every 102.5 minutes with a high point of 565 miles and a low point of 539 miles.

title: Jersey and New York Rarely Get Tornadoes
description: Until a tornado hit Flanders, N.J., Monday night, only 25 had touched down in New Jersey and 49 in New York State in the last 20 years.

title: Postcard and LetterBomb
description: LONDONEnglish newspapers correctly assess this country's brief sensation involving politicians and call girls as about like a dirty postcard compared to the exploding letterbomb of America's Watergate.

title: BAN ON 2 PESTICIDES IS SOUGHT BY E.P.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)The Environmental Protedtion Agency, seeking to ban the pesticides Aldrin and Dieldrin, charged today that they posed a definite and considerable risk of cancer to man."

title: Capitol Hill, in Throes of Restoration, Is Rivaling Georgetown for Elegance
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Cluttering many front yards in the residential neighborhood behind the United States Capitol are piles of broken bricks, crumbled plaster and rotted twobyfours.

title: ExTop G.I. Gets Probation in Bribery
description: LOS ANGELES, May 29 (UPI) William O. Wooldridge, once the Army's topranked enlisted man, was given five year's probation today on a bribery charge. He was also ordered to sign over most of his assets, to the Government and to work for three years without pay for a charitable organization.

title: SHOP TALK
description: It seems that almost everyone is into some sort of art or craft these days. If you Want to join the movement, don't let the fact that you don't know how to hold a crochet hook or operate a potter's wheel stand in your way. Many stores specializing in handcraft supplies also provide instruction.

title: Ryun Finds Balance of Payments Relaxing
description: After years of chasing the clock as his challenge and burden, Jim Ryun has finally learned how to win.

title: Detroit Reporter Arrested
description: DETROIT, May 29 (AP)Howard Kohn, a suspended reporter for The Detroit Free Press, was arrested and arraigned today on charges of filing a false police report. The Free Press published articles quoting Mr. Kohn as saying he had been kidnapped after he had written a series on the city's drug kingpins. Later, he reportedly acknowledged the article was false, and was suspended by the newspaper.

title: Yanks'4 Homers Defeat A's by 71
description: In a display reminiscent of the days when such lusty hitIters as Ruth, Gehrig, Lazzerii and Dickey were making the Bronx Bombers a feared name, the Yankees clouted four home runs last night in defeating the Oakland A's, 71, at Yankee Stadium.

title: Princess Anne Is Engaged to an Army Lieutenant
description: LONDON, May 29 They met at the horse events at the Olympics in Mexico. They competed in jumping trials all over England. Their romance became the talk of the land. And tonight Buckingham Palace announced the engagement of the two young riders: Princess Anne and Lieut. Mark Phillips.

title: Alabama and Arkansas Declared Disaster Areas
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)  President Nixon declared Alabama and Arkansas major disaster areas today because of weekend tornadoes and the White. House promised similar action would be taken soon for other states hit hard by the storms.

title: Advertising: Alberto in Switches
description: AlbertoCulver has found a way to overcome the conflict problem at its ad agenciesbecome the first client of a brand new shop.

title: Due Process and N.C.A..A. Eligibility Code
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association bent just enough last week from its usual rigid policy of rules enforcement to permit Fred Samara of Pennsylvania and Dennis Walker of Adelphi to compete in the I.C.4A. track and field championships, But Samara's secondplace finish in the decathlon and Walker's part in Adelphi's 440 yard relay victory are not as important as the right they may have established to full and open hearings for college athletes accused of violating N.C.A.A. regulations.

title: JUSTICES BROADEN POWER OF POLICE TO HUNT EVIDENCE
description: WASHINGTON, May 29The Supreme Court broadened the power of law enforcement officials to search suspects and their property in decisions today on two criminal cases.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: ARVIN SHAW 3D, 67, ARCHITECT, DEAD
description: Arvin Shaw 3d, a wellknown architect who designed many office buildings in this city and elsewhere, died yesterday at Roosevelt Hospital after a short illness. Ire was 57 years old and lived at 150 East 65th Street until last fall, when he moved to Sagaponack,

title: SAINT GOBAIN TO BUY CERTAINTEED STOCK
description: Compagnie de SaintGobainPontaMousson announced yesterday it was purchasing 2.3 million shares, or about 52 per cent of the approximately 4.4 million shares of the CertainTeed Products Corporation tendered to it during its recent tender offer.

title: Chinese Envoy Arrives in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)  Huang Chen, one of China's most seasoned diplomats, arrived today to open his Government's liaison office and declared that the detour in friendly relations between the Chinese and American peoples had ended.

title: SOLID GOLD WINS IN DEVON JUMPOFF;Jenkins Mount Defeated in Intermediate Class
Ford Recalls Police Cars For Check on Fuel Hoses
description: DETROIT, May 29 (UPI)The Ford Motor Company said today it had begun recalling 1,230 Ford and Mercury police interceptor cars that may have improperly fitted fuel hoses, which could cause fires under the hood.

title: 1969 Race Involved
Profit for J. P. Stevens
Records: Brubeck Tour
description: Dave Brubeck's attempt to retire from the life of the traveling performer at the end of 1967 after 17 steady years. on the road has proved An be a happy failure. He broke up his quartet then, intending to spend most of his time composing. But, al though he has since written several nonjazz works, with in six months he had assembled a trio and lured Gerry Mulligan out of his own semiretirement to play at the New Orleans Jazz Festival and several engagements in Mexico. This four some, with Jack Six on bass and Alan Dawson on drums, has been together ever since, playing and traveling extensively.

title: The Drastic Remedies
description: Impeachment Is not the only remedy provided by the Constitution where the integrity and conduct of the Chief Executive or his ability to govern, may be called into question.

title: Summary of Actions Taken in the 1973 Legislative Session
description: ALBANY, May 29Following are the major actions taken during the regular 1973 session that ended yesterday afternoon:

title: KEY SENATE TEST WON BY WAR FOES
description: WASHINGTON, May 29Opponents of the United States bombing of Cambodia won key procedural test on the Senate floor today in their effort to cut off funds for the air war.

title: Racism in Albany
description: While much of the steam has gone out of the antibusing furor, the Legislature has placed New York in the company of diehard segregationists. It accomplished that feat of irresponsibility by voting for a resolution to call a Federal constitutional convention to seek an amendment to ban, as euphemism phrases it, the assignment of students on the basis of race.

title: 8 P.O.WS CHARGED WITH MISCONDUCT
8 Are in Primary Race for 4 Judgeships
description: Eight Civil Court judges will be elected in the city this year and there are primary contests to be decided June 4 for four of these positions.

title: Hoffa Prosecutor Named To Aid Cox on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 James F. Neal, an experienced prosecutor from Nashville, has joined the staff of the special Federal prosecutor in the Watergate case.

title: Indy 500 Is Postponed Again and Reset for Today
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 29 The Indianapolis 500 became the TwentyFour Hours of In dianapolis today as rain forced a second postponement, and this weather keeps up it ma) yet become the TwentyFour Days of Indianapolis. Admission tickets to Indianapolis Motor Speedway have only two rainchecks, and after tomorrow there will be none left. The weather forecast rates the chance of rain at 20 per cent.

title: REV. DANIEL MILLARD OF JERSEY PARISH, 50
description: BROOKLAWN, N. J., May 29 Rev. Daniel F. M. Millard, pastor since 1963 of the Roman Catholic Church of St. Maurice, died Sunday at his rectory. He was 50 years old.

title: Court Backs TV and Radio Refusal of Political Ads
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 The Supreme Court ruled today that radio and television stations have an absolute right to refuse to sell time for advertisements dealing with political campaigns or controversial public issues.

title: MEE'
Birthday of Johnson Now Texas Holiday
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 29 (UPI)  The Texas Legislature last night designated Aug. 27  the birthday of Lyndon B. Johnson  as state holiday.

title: CANER RECALL TRUCE OBSERVERS WITHIN 60 DAYS
description: OTTAWA, May 29The Canadian Government, maintaining that its ceasefire observers in Vietnam were not being permitted to do their job properly, announced today that it had de cided to bring them home with in 60 days.

title: Rev. Don Hall, ExDirector Of Presbyterian Foundation
description: The Rev. Don Emerson Hall who retired April 30 after 15 years as director of the United Presbyterian Foundation, died Sunday in Denver, where he and his wife, Mrs. Mildred Lilyquist Hall, had been visiting friends. He was 66 years old.

title: Hammer Throw Judge Hit on Head and Killed
description: PRAGUE, May 29 (UPI)A Czechoslovak track and field official was killed by, the hammer of a young athlete during a meet at Pardubice near Prague, according to the Czechoslovak newspaper, Lidova Demokracie.

title: Wichita Mortgage Concern Files Petition in Bankruptcy
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., May 30 (UPI)The Securities and Exchange Commission today said First Home Investment of Kansas, Inc., a Wichita concern, has filed for bankruptcy and will undergo reorganization.

title: At This Show, There's No Business... Like. Textiles
description: The early curtain was apparently a great shot in the arm for New York theater, but isn't 7:58 A.M. carrying it a bit too far?

title: STOCKS TUMBLE; DOW FALLS 1610
description: A wave of selling tumbled into the stock market late yesterday and doused much of the remaining hope that had been kindled in last week's rally.

title: Stock Prices Plunge
description: The stock market declined sharply again yesterday. The DowJones industrial average plurfged 16.70 points, its third largest drop this year, and closed at 908.87. The selling apparently came in response to renewed pressure on the dollar in European currency markets. At the same time, the price of gold rose to new highs in London and Zurich. Details, Page 59.

title: In Greenwich Village, Indifference Marks the Primary
description: Greenwich Village is generally considered to be among the most politically sophisticated areas of the city. On any given night there are probably more meetings there dealing with Southeast Asia street lights, dog runs, playgrounds garbage removal and highway plans than in any other neighborhood.

title: Scientists Say Sunset on Moon May Be Cause of Dust Cloud
description: A glow on the moon's horizon at lunar dusk, observed by a Surveyor moonlander in the the late nineteensixties, is probably caused by scattered dust clouds that are lifted off the surface by electrostatic forces, two American scientists reported yesterday.

title: NASSAU BUS LINES ARE TAKEN OVER
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 30Nassau County signed a contract today to take over all 10 private bus companies in the county effort to improve service for the 75,000 daily riders. The county will become the new owner at 12:01 A.M. Sunday. The contract was signed by Ralph G. Caso, the Nassau County Executive; Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, and union officials.

title: VOLLY DEFAUT
description: CHICAGO, May 30 (AP)Voltaire Volly DeFaut, jazz clarinetist was found dead yesterday in his house trailer in South Chicago Heights. He was 69 years old.

title: COLLEGE CONTROLS SET IN ARGENTINA
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 30 The new Peronist Government today took control of national universities in Argentina by appointing special trustees who will have ultimate power in all administrative and ideological questions on those campuses. The Government also endorsed strongly nationalist, leftleaning educational programs for the 19 national universities in which more than twothirds of the country's 330,000 college students are enrolled.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission in Lyndhurst, N. J., unanimously passed a resolution that would ban the dumping of solid waste from out of state. About 10,000 tons of nonNew Jersey garbage, most of it from New York City, are now dumped on the 20,000acre Meadowlands every week. A public hearing on the proposed ban, which would take effect Aug. 1, will be held June 18, starting at 10 A.M. in Kearny.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ELBOW ROOM When it comes to intime, May Cagney's, 947 Second Avenue, near 51st Street (7554155), must come close to setting the record. This tiny restaurantbar, with dartboard up front and singers down in the back, has the clientele shouldertoshoulder with one another and with the talent. There are several tiny tables at which you may sit and a bar at which you may stand (or sit, if you find a stool).

title: Atlantic City Crime Figure Gave $600 to Sandman
description: TRENTON, May 30Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr.'s financial disclosure statement shows that one of the contributions to his campaign in the Republican gubernatorial primary election was Herman Orman, who has been identified by Federal and state law enforcement authorities as the kingpin of organized crime in Atlantic City.

title: COURT ORDERS END TO ANTIOCH STRIKE
description: XENIA, Ohio, May 30  A group of students trying to reopen the striketorn Antioch College won today a preliminary injunction that bars striking students from barricading campus buildings.

title: WOMAN, 74, IS KILLED IN 12TH ST. BLAST
description: A 74 year old woman was killed and a 69yearodd man was critically injured in an explosion just before midnight last night in the woman's thirdfloor walkup apartment at 504 East 12th Street near Avenue A in the East Village.

title: 2 KILLED IN HOME OF A POLICE AIDE
description: WILLINGBORO, N.J., May 30 The wife and a son of the director of the state crime laboratory died today when a blast damaged their home on Normandy Street.

title: Communist Tank Attack Is Reported by Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, May 31The South Vietnamese miiltary command today announced a Communist tank attack on a Government outpost west of Hue, but informed United States sources said they had no knowledge of such an assault.

title: Mills Reassures Business on Investment Credit and Tax Rule on Depreciation
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, promised business today that no changes would be made in either the investment credit or the tax treatment of depreciation.

title: Raiders (Now Blades) Trade Ward for Lacroix
description: New York's World Hockey Association team officially changed its name from Raiders to Golden Blades yesterday, then announced a trade involving the league's top two scorers, Andre Lacroix and Ron Ward.

title: EHRLICHMAN SAYS NIXON SOON KNEW OF MEXICO INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 John D. Ehrlichman told a Senate subcommittee today that President Nixon knew six days after the Watergate breakin that Federal agents were investigating Mexican aspects of the case.

title: Trustee Named to Liquidate Weis Firm
description: Weis Securities, Inc., the brokerage firm cast adrift by the New York Stock Exchange late Tuesday, will be liquidated by the Securities Investor Protection Corporation.

title: NASSAU BUS LINES ARE TAKEN OVER
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 30Nassau County signed a contract. today to take over all 10 private bus companies in the county effort to improve service for the 75,000 daily riders. The county will become the new owner at 12:01 A.M. Sunday.

title: U.S. INQUIRY IS AIDED BY SUSPENDED CHIEF
description: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., May 30 (UPI)The suspepded police chief of Newburgh, who has been suspended and is under conviction for several felony counts, is assisting a Federal grand jury in New York City that is investigating official corruption in Newburgh.

title: Directors Back Writers
description: LOS ANGELES, May 30Negotiations between the Writers Guild of America and the Association of Motion Picture and Television Producers, which collapsed in midMay, will resume Saturday, at the invitation of the association. But unless the 13weekold strike is settled very shortly, considerable delays in the 1973 television season are likely, as well as a noticeable shortage of motion pictures in theaters by fall. The last writers strike, in 1960, went on for 22 weeks.

title: MITCHELL'S TRIAL SET FOR SEPT. 11
description: Former Attorney General John N. Mitchell, charged by a Federal grand jury with. conspiring to help Robert L. Vesco, a businessman who was in trouble with the Government, will stand trial here next September, Federal District Judge Lee P. Gagliardi ruler here yesterday.

title: U.S. Warplanes Aid Convoy In Trip Back Down Mekong
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 30 (UPI)American spotter planes and fighterbombers helped conduct a convoy of 10 barges and empty fuel tankers safely down the Mekong River to the Vietnamese border today, naval sources said. The United States warplanes flew cover after the convoy came under fire.

title: HOLIDAY FESTIVAL FACES A CUTBACK.
description: The Eastern College Athletic Conference will trim the field for its December Holiday Festival basketball tournament from eight teams to four in 1976 because the competing colleges are not earning enough money at the annual Madison Square Garden event.

title: Skylab Crewmen Begin Earth Survey Experiment
description: HOUSTON, May 30 From an orbit 270 miles high over the western part of the United States, the Skylab 1 astronauts began today a survey of the earth that should expand man's understanding of his mineral resources, crops and forests, pollution and weather.

title: THREE MEN ACCUSED IN WIDOW'S MURDER
description: MAYS LANDING, May 30 (AP)  Three men have been charged in the murder of a 69yearold widow who disappeared, after an auto accident on April 20, the state police said today.

title: U.S. Plan for Relief Assistance May Cost New Yorkers More
description: Caspar W. Weinberger, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, said yesterday that New York taxpayers might have to pay more for public assistbee to the aged, the blind and the disabled next Jan. 1 when the Federal Government takes over such programs from the city without any improvement in benefits.

title: Lindsay Won't Endorse Candidate in Primary
description: I don't want to damage anyone's candidacy by wrapping my arms around him, Mayor Lindsay said yesterday in what he described as teasing a little bit.

title: Zambia Says Lone Sentry Shot 3 as Saboteurs
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 30 (Canadian Press)  Zambia told the United Nations today that a lone army sentry, fearing that a mission of sabotage against against a vital waterworks was under way, shot and killed two Canadians and wounded an American May 15 at the Victoria Falls power station while they were swimming in Zambian waters.

title: Sandman Urges Halt to Further Work On Sports Center in the Meadowlands
description: TRENTON, May 30 Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr. today urged a halt in work on the Hackensack Meadows sports center and freeze on further development of the vast Meadowlands area until we know where the money is coming from and what is going on.

title: The Outrage of Wiretaps
description: WASHINGTONHere in the nail tion's capital, having your phone tapped is a status symbol. Thus in 1969, when we began to tell friends in Washington that we suspected the F.B.I. had a bug on our phone they thought we were bragging. As the signs increasedphones often out of order, phone company trucks frequently on our deadend streetwe began telling outoftown friends who called that the Government was listening in. They thought we were paranoid; now they are contacting us to apologize and to concede that what looks like paranoia, at least in Washington, often turns out to be wellfounded suspicion.

title: Radio
City Hall Park Was No Place for Poets
description: Three poets in search of an audience arrived in City Hall Park yesterday for a scheduled lunchhour reading of their works but found the local people's culture park seriously overbooked.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: CEDAR GROVE, May 30This tiny community northern Essex County has a rich polevaulting tradition.

title: People and Business
description: The New York Stock Exchange has named. Henry P. Poole as the first inside general counsel in its history. The 41yearold lawyer was also named a vice president of the exchange.

title: COLLEGE CONTROLS SET IN ARGENTINA
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 30The new Peronist Government today took control of national universities in Argentina by appointing special trustees who will have ultimate power in all administrative and ideological questions on those campuses.

title: Court's Leniency to Actress Stirs, Protests in Norway
description: OSLO, Norway, May 30 (AP) Norwegian newspapers are unhappy about what they call special court treatment for the actress Liv Ullmann.

title: No Progress in PATH Talks
Gallup Says Connally Trails Kennedy in Poll on '76
description: John B. Connally, a possible Presidential contender who recently switched from the Democratic to the Republican party, trailed Senator Edward M. Kennedy by 14 percentage points,) 50 to 36, in a recent trial heat of the 1976 Presidential election, the Gallup poll reported, yesterday.

title: Jane Bowles, Novelist, is Dead; Author of Two Serious Ladies
description: Jane Bowles, a dramatist and novelist, died in Malaga, Spain on May 4. She was 56 year old and lived in Tangier with her husband, Paul Bowles, a composer and writer.

title: Survey Urges an Overhaul of Court Procedure Here
Beef Production Down 14%
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (UPI)Beef production for April was off 14 per cent from the same period a year earlier, the Agriculture Department reported today.

title: 4 Wisconsin Papers Accused By G.A.O. on Campaign Ads
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP) The General Accounting Office referred to the Attorney General today a report alleging that four Wisconsin newspapers violated the Federal election law.

title: Chess Wrong Response Can make A 2dRate Move Look Good
Challenge to the Senate
description: Administration efforts to defer or deflect Senate action to cut off all furids for United States military operations in Cambodia and Laos represent a dangerous flight from reality on two vital issues.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL Yankees vs. Oakland A's, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161 Street; the Bronx, 7:30 P.M. (RadioWMCA, 7:30 ,P.M.) HARNESS RACING Yonkers Raceway, Central and Yonkers Avenues, 8 P.M. Freehold (N.J.) Raceway, 1:30 P.M. THOROUGHBRED RACING Belmont Park, Elmont, LI., 1:30 P.M.

title: New TV Spots Planned By 3 Mayoral Candidates
description: With the Democratic mayoral primary only four days away, three of the four candidates were scheduled to produce lastminute television and radio commercials yesterday and even today as funds for production costs and air time became available.

title: 4 Mayoral Hopefuls Bid U.N. Aid Jews In Syria and Iraq
description: The four Democratic mayoral candidates and other political hopefuls gathered at a memorial rally last night to decry the treatment of Jews in Syria and Iraq and to appeal for the United States and the United Nations to help them.

title: Sightseeing Bear Causes Stir in Dutchess County
description: BEACON, N.Y., May 30 (AP) The Beacon police station was turned into a madhouse, with citizens calling in so fast their names couldn't be taken down, according to one police officer.

title: Papp's Bene factor Likes Theater and His Vitality
description: An autograph seeker at a Broadway opening once walked up to Mrs. Samuel I. Newhouse and asked: Are you anybody?

title: SPEED ON INQUIRY URGED BY AGNEW
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Vice President Agnew said today that the facts in the Watergate conspiracy case should be dredged into the open quickly so that the nation, and the Republican party, could get it over with.

title: CANTEEN APPROVES JOINING T.W.A. UNIT
description: Directors of the Canteen Corporation approved yesterday a previously announced agreement to merge Canteen with a subsidiary of Trans World Airlines, Inc.

title: Many Catholics Vote in Ulster Election Despite I.R.A. Intimidation
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 30Thousands of Roman Catholics in Northern Ireland voted for local council officials today in spite of intimidation and harassment by the militant Provisional wing of the illegal Irish Republican Army.

title: Vesco Indicates Accord With Figueres's Stand
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, May 30Robert L. Vesco, the financier under Federal indictment in the United States, issued statement today in which he essentially dissociated himself from remarks made Sunday by his friend and former business associate, Norman P. LeBlanc.

title: ARBITRATION SOUGHT IN BASS ART DISPUTE
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 30 (AP) John Bass, New York philanthropist, wants a third party to settle a dispute with the City of Miami Beach and get his namesake museum, with works once valued at $7million, reopened.

title: Connecticut to End Machine Collection Of Highway Tolls
description: HARTFORD, May 30  Connecticut will replace all automatic toll machines with people next month, Transportation Commissioner A. Earl Wood said today.

title: Arabs Plan Meeting on Oil
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, May 30 (UPI)  Oil ministers of members of the Organization of Arab Petroleum Exporting Countries will meet here June 23, the Syrian Arab News Agency said today. The agency said the meeting would be attended by delegations from 12 Arab countries.

title: Concert
description: George Gershwin's Rhapsody in Blue is so much a part of our pop culture that it seems to have been with us always. Recause it retains a contemporaneity, it is also hard to beheve that it will be 30 years old next year. It was played in the GershwinTchaikovsky Promenade on Tuesday night by the New York Philharmonic, with Agustin Anievas as pianist.

title: BronxWoman Dies in Plunge
description: Mrs. Muriel Cherrington, 78 years old, fell or jumped to her death at 3 A.M. yesterday from the window of her eighthfloor apartment at 790 Concourse Village West in the Bronx, the police said. The police said she had lived with a nephew, Victor Whitfield.

title: A Food Story With a Moral: Fancy Doesn't Always Mean Good
description: We first met up with hightoned grub at Boy Scout camp 40plus years ago, when the chef honored some visiting state dignitaries with a banquet that included, to our childish wonderment, a salad of iceberg lettuce, canned pineapple, cottage cheese and mayonnaise, topped with a maraschino cherry.

title: JURY FOREMAN OUT; WAS BURGLAR IN 30'S
description: ALBANY, May 30 (AP)AI policeman's memory has led to, the removal of a State. Supreme Court grand jury foreman and may result in nullification of 39 indictments handed down in Albany County in recent weeks.

title: Canada's Pullout: The Truce Unit May Be Weakened
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 30Canada's decision to withdraw from the International Commission of Control and Supervision will not mean the end of the commission, but it will probably be the end of the effort the Canadians sponsored to make the commission into an active and effective investigative body. This is the view of most experienced South Vietnamese and Western officials here, who regretted the announcement from Ottawa that Canada would pull her 290member delegation out of the commission within 60 days, by July 31.

title: BONN AND PRAGUE REACH AN ACCORD
description: BONN, May, 30In another West German step toward reconciliation with Eastern Europe, negotiations were completed with Czechoslovakia to day on a treaty to establish normal relations, ending 35 years of hostility.

title: Store Acquisition Approved
description: The Federal Trade Commission has approved the request of Arlen Realty and Development Corporation, which operates the Korvettes department store chain, to acquire three Lansburgh department stores in the Washington, D. C., metropolitan area. F.T.C. approval is required under a 1966 F.T.C. order against Korvettes. The Lansburgh stores are owned by the City Stores Company.

title: Books of The Times
description: AFTER CLAUDE. By iris Owens. 206 pages. Farrar, Straus & Girous $6.95.

title: Candidates Day
