description: Calling the city's educational system a dismal and tragic failure, Representative Herman Badillo presented an eightpoint educational plan yesterday that emphasized tutorial programs, manpower training geared to jobs and greater coordination between high schools and the City University.

title: G.E. Contract Offer Expected Today by Two Major Unions
description: The General Electric Compang is expected to make a formal contract offer today to two major electrical unions representing 100,000 of its workers, according to labor sources.

title: Rockefeller Session
description: From the opening gavel of the legislative session, when he addressed members of the State Senate and Assembly to demand life terms for pushers, until the closing gavel when both houses approved a scheme that gives the state level of government additional control over local welfare systems, Governor Rockefeller was very much in charge of everything that went on at Albany. Always a commanding force, the Governor this year displayed a domination of the legislative branch of government that was almost complete.

title: Professor Warns New Rochelle an Atom Plant Would Pose Peril
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y. May 30A scientist who has been warning of the dangers of lowlevel radiation for more than decade came to this Westchester County community last night and reinforced the worst fears of those opposed to construction of four atomic power reactors on nearby David's Island.

title: Brennan Pledges Help On Employing Women
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP)  Secretary of Labor Peter J. Brennan has pledged to help women expand their opportunities in occupations not now open to them.

title: SHARES ON AMEX DECLINE SHARPLY
BreakIn by F.B.I. Alleged Before 1969 Inauguration
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation broke into the offices of a radical newspaper in Washington without a search warrant shortly before President Nixon's inauguration in 1969 in an attempt to find evidence of overseas Communist influence, two former Army Intelligence operatives said today.

title: Stock Prices Plunge
description: The stock market declined sharply again yesterday. The DowJones industrial average plunged 16.70 points, its third largest drop this year, and closed at 908.87 The selling apparently came in response to renewed pressure on the dollar in European currency markets. At the same time, the price of gold rose to new highs in London and Zurich. Details, Page 59.

title: Missing Republican Check Apparently Never Written
description: OMAHA, Neb., May 30 (AP) The missing $10,000 check from Nebraska Republicans to the Committee for the ReElection of the President was probably never written, party officials said yesterday.

title: Nixon Aide Pledges to Modify Draft Bill to Satisfy Labor Lobby
description: WASHINGTON, May 30A high Nixon Administration official has signed a written agreement with labor lobbyists promising to make inoperative a section of a Governmental reorganization plan to consolidate drug law enforcement operations.

title: A TOP YEMENI SLAIN; SOUTH IS ACCUSED
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 30A prominent member of Yemen's Government was assassinated in front of his home in the southern town of Taiz early today, according to an official announcement on the Governmentcontrolled radio in Sana.

title: COX STAFF BEGINS REVIEW OF CASE
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 An imposed silence fell over the Watergate criminal investigation today as Archibald Cox, the special prosecutor, and his staff began reviewing the case.

title: RANK CURB IN SOUTH CHALLENGED IN SUIT
description: For the second time in a week, a legal challenge has been filed against the legal and regulatory barriers currently being erected by many Southern states against the entry of outofstate financial institutions.

title: MARY ARE FACING FOOD STAMP LOSS
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 About 1.5 million aged blind and disabled welfare recipients will lose eligibility for food stamps, and up to 150,000 other persons may no longer receive Medicaid benefits when a new Federal guaranteed income plan takes effect next Jan. 1, the Department of Health, Education and Welfare said today.

title: U.S. Judge Acts to Bar Order Halting Small City's Air Flight
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., May 30Federal District Judge Albert Eagle issued a preliminary injunction here today preventing United Air Lines from canceling a 7:45 A.M. flight from Muskegon, Mich., to Chicago. The order is believed to represent the first time a Federal court has ever ruled in a case involving airline scheduling.

title: ASHE VANQUISHES SOLOMON IN RAIN
description: PARIS, May 30 (AP)Arthur Ashe played tennis in the rain for six minutes today and made sure of his place in the fourth round of the men's singles at the $133,000 French open championships.

title: MEMBER SOUGHT FOR TRUCE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Norway and Brazil are among orations under consideration to replace Canada on the fournation ceasefire commission in Vietnam, a Nixon Administration official said today.

title: Skylab Targets: Locusts, Trees, Craters
description: HOUSTON, May 30A plague of locusts in the Sudan, an infestation of trees at the mouth of the Rio Grande and a chain of restless Central American volcanoes are typical targets of the Skylab earthscanning that began today.

title: To Palmer, There's Only One Oakmont
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 30 Jack Nicklaus considers next week's pro golf tour site, the (Whitemarsh Valley course outside Philadelphia, similar to the Oakmont (Pa.) Country Club, where the United States Open will be played starting June 14. But Arnold Palmer disagrees.

title: SOVIET AIDE SEIZED AT PARIS AIR SHOW
description: PARIS, May 30 (AP) The assistant air attach at the Soviet Embassy in Paris, Lieut. Col. Yevgeny N. Mironkin, was arrested by the French police on charges of trying to steal an item on exhibit at the Paris air show, the police reported today.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time
Personal Finance
description: Rising resentment among home buyers about the high closing costs involved in home purchases resulted in Government and Congressional studies last year.

title: I Was Back in Peking
description: MADISON, Conn.I looked out the window of the former Grand Hotel de Pekin and thought of the days before World War II when I waltzed there with assorted Nazi, fascist and Scandinavian diplomats. On the street the slowmoving bicycles moved silently where once I listened to the shuffling padpad of camels bringing coal from Mentoukou. On these streets on Dec. 9, 1935, desperate Peking students had declared war on all kinds of fascism (so had I) and marched to break the white terror, as they called it.

title: Selected Shorts
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Fred Allen had an idea for a pocketsized Look magazine, which he called Squint. Similarly, Stewart Alsop, whose insights make his fellow columnists whinny in vexation, has invented minicolumnsshort takes and pithy ideas that might lose flavor in longer development. Freely appropriating that format, I will from time to time provide instant essays, hasty profundities for quick thinkers.

title: Evacuation of Tunnel Marked Turning Point in Firemen's Battle
description: A few minutes after 9 o'clock Wednesday night, Fire Chief John T. O'Hagan knew that his most important job was done.

title: Government Says It Overheard a Radical Lawyer 23 Times on Taps in 195570
description: The Federal Government acknowledged yesterday that it overheard a prominent radical lawyer 23 times from 1955 to 1970 on national security wiretaps apparently made without court consent.

title: Victor Over Yorty Sees Further Gains
description: LOS ANGELES, May 30Thomas Bradley said today that his.election as the first black Mayor of Los Angeles could help open a new thrust of black leadership into electoral politics.

title: The Next Mayor of Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, May 30Last night, Thomas Bradley stood in front of his cheering arapporters at a moment charged with drama and emotion. The returns showed that he would be the next Mayor of Los. Angelesthe first black Mayor in the city's history, and he said: Tonight was the fulfillment of a dream, the impossible dream, because the people of this city have given me the highest honor that can be given to any citizen of our city. Man In the News

title: An Airline Leader Reports Industry Has No Fuel Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (UPI) The airline industry said today that there was no immediate threat of a fuel shortage that would ground any of the nation's 2,326 airliners.

title: NeonThe Industrial Craft That's Been Turned Into Decorative Lighting
description: Neon fixtures that pulse, blink, flash, burn and even ooze with light....

title: 19 CHILDREN HURT ON COASTER RIDE
description: MOUNT ARLINGTON, May 130Nineteen schoolchildren on class outings were injured here today, none of them seriously, in an accident on the roller coaster at Bertrand's Island Amusement Park.

title: RESOLUTION LAUDING THE TIMES OFFERED
description: WASHINGTON, May 30A resolution commending The New York Times for its defense of freedom 4of, the press against the threats of the People's Republic of China was introduced today in the House by Representative Edward J. Derwinski, Republican of Illinois.

title: Mrs. Newhouse Gives Papp $1Million
description: On the basis of a $1million gift from Mrs. Samuel I. Newhouse, the wife of the publisher, Joseph Papp has decided to go ahead with plans for his New York Shakespeare Festival to become the theater constituent at Lincoln Center.

title: IDLE DICE SCORES AT DEVON EVENT
Transit Clerk Shot Dead In BedfordStuyvesant
description: A Transit Authority changebooth clerk was a slain by a gunman shortly after midnight at the IND station at Nostrand Avenue and Fulton Street in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, according to the police.

title: FIRE IN KANSAS CITY LED TO CRACKDOWN
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 30 (AP)The deaths of two children in a house fire nearly four years ago led to today's crackdown on plastics manufacturers by the Federal Trade Commission, a spokesman for the commission said.

title: CARTOON IS REJECTED FOR GUILTYCOMMENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Gary Trudeau, author of the Doonesbury cartoon strip, has been burned, as he puts it, by the Watergate scandal.

title: Equity Financing
description: A secondary offering of 300,000 common shares of the Otter Tail Power Company at $20 per share was oversubscribed yesterday according to Paine, Webber, manager of the underwriting group. The company's stock, traded on the overthecounter market, closed at 19 bid, 20 asked, up .

title: Police Aide's Wife and Son Are Killed in Jersey Blast
description: WILLINGBORO, N. J., May 30 The wife and a son of the director of the state crime laboratory died today when a blast damaged their home on Normandy Street.

title: Major Foreign Aid Change asked in House Measures
description: WASHINGTON, May 30A proposal for a major transformation and, effective increase in the foreign economic aid program was made today by majority of the House Foreign Affairs Committee.

title: A Prairie Dullsville Becomes a Boom Town for JobSeekers
description: NEWTON, Kan., May 29Pasted in a fanlike design across the plate glass window of the Kansas State Employment Service on Main Street here was a handlettered sign that said there were jobs and more jobs for anyone who wanted them.

title: Rockefeller Session
description: From the opening gavel of the legislative session, when he addressed members of the State Senate and Assembly to demand life terms for pushers, until the closing gavel when both houses approved a scheme that gives the state level of government additional control over local welfare systems, Governor Rockefeller was very much in charge of everything that went on at Albany. Always a commanding force, the Governor this year displayed a domination of the legislative branch of government that was almost complete.

title: OPPONENTS OF PARK SENTENCED IN SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 30  The Seoul district criminal court handed down prison terms to three former opposition members of the National Assembly today after finding them guilty of extortion and bribery.

title: Raids in Cambodia By B52 Bombers Reported Cut
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Bombing raids by B52 bombers over CambOdia have been cut nearly in half in the last few days, according to sources at the Pentagon.

title: TRAMUNTI IS GUILTY AT CONTEMPT TRIAL
description: Carmine Tramunti, the reputed boss of one of New York's five Mafia families, was found guilty in State Supreme Court, Brooklyn, yesterday of three counts of criminal contempt.

title: MRS. KLEIN TAKES UNION AIDE TO TASK
description: NEWARK, May 30  Ann Klein paused during a frenetic day of campaigning today long enough to level a blast at regional labor leader who hat urged liberals not to waste their votes on her in the Democratic gubernatorial primary.

title: 2 Unhurt in Plane Mishap
description: PESCADERO, Calif., May 30 (UPI)James Dizanica, 18 years old, and Bill Carrel, 18, suffered only minor injuries when the light plane Mr. Dizanica was flying flipped into the ocean about 100 feet off Bean Hollow State Beach: They swain to shore.

title: Film: Parable on Cruelty
Times Declares Dividends
description: The New York Times Company declared yesterday quarterly dividend of 15 cents a share on the, Class A and B common stock, payable on June 26 to stockholders of record on June 11. A quarterly dividend of $1.375 a share also was declared on the 5 per cent cumulative prior preference stock payable on July 2 to stockholders of record on June 11.

title: African Unity Group Strained but Not Torn by Bitter Disputes
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, May 30The Organization of African Unity has survived the bitterest internal squabbles of its 10year history, brought on when delegates forced the explosive issues of the Ethiopian Somali border dispute and the African nations relations with Israel,

title: Peking's Envoy Received By Nixon at White House
description: WASHINGTON, May (UPI)  The first envoy to represent Communist China in the capital of the United States met for 25 minutes with PresiIdent Nixon in the White House today.

title: City, Citing Son's Crime, Seeks to Evict a Family
description: For 23 years, Mrs. Cynthia Bryant has lived in the Lillian Wald Houses, a Lower East Side city project for lowincome families.

title: Briefs On The Arts
description: Johann, Strauss's Fledermaus and Puccini's Tosca will be brought to New York parks this summer by the. Metropolitan Opera in its seventh season of free opera concerts in the city's five boroughs.

title: YANKS TOP A'S, 43, ON INN HOME
description: With two on and two out in the first inning last night, Thurman Munson hit a drive to right field that Reggie Jackson snared before it reached the stands.

title: Gaullists Manques
description: There is no particular reason to anticipate that the meeting of Presidents Nixon and Pompidou in the Icelandic capital will be long remembered in diplomatic history. Neither President is leading from personal strength on his homefront; neither seems to feel any of the great outstanding issues can be solVed in a summit bargain, after teams of diplomats have allowed any number of specific transAtlantic concepts to lie fallow.

title: TV: 3 News Specials
description: Although generally sluggish in audience ratings, news specials can still score a number of important brownie points for television. On the Columbia Broadcasting System, for instance, the Saturday morning lineup of children's programs owes its modicum of prestige to assorted contributions from C.B.S. News.

title: Dioguardi Is Denied Parole
description: John Dioguardi, an alleged former labor racketeer serving a fiveyear sentence for bankruptcy fraud, was denied parole by the United States Parole Board. The sentence, which he is serving at the Federal penitentiary in Danbury, Conn., runs to June 8, 1974.

title: Mellon Bank Plans Sale of Its Lloyd And BOLSA Stake
description: The $7.4billion Mellon Bank in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania's largest bank, announced yesterday that it had agreed to sell its 12.6 per cent minority interest in Lloyds and BOLSA International Bank, Ltd. of London for $54.5million.

title: Millionaire Sentenced for PX Fraud
description: A Mount Vernon millionaire who once did a $140millionayear business with military post exchanges overseas was fined $176,000 and sentenced to 18 months in prison yesterday for defrauding the Government.

title: People in Sports: Howe And Sons May Be a Line
description: Gordie Howe, 45yearold retired hockey superstar, said yesterday he planned to meet with officials of the World Hockey Association's Houston Aeros on Monday to discuss.playing again. His two sons, Mark, 18, and Marty 19, are on the team. They knew my greatest wish has always been to play pro hockey with my sons and when they asked me, Would you be interested? said, Hell, yes.'

title: HOLIDAY FESTIVAL FACES A CUTBACK
description: The Eastern College Athletic Conference will trim the field for its December Holiday Festival basketball tournament from eight teams to four in 1976 because the competing colleges are not earning enough money at the annual Madison Square Garden event.

title: CLOSED TALKS QUIT BY MERRILL LYNCH
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith confirmed yesterday that five or six of its research analystsconforming to a recent policy of the firmhad resigned from splinter groups that do not permit press attendance at meetings. It has to do with the receipt of potentially inside information, an official of the brokerage house said.

title: FANNIE MAE AUCTION POSTS YIELD MARKS
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (Reuters)  The Federal National Mortage Association today auctioned $140million of fourmonth Federal Housing AdministrationVeterans Administration mortgage commitments and $74million of fourmonth conventional mortgage pledges at record yields.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 30An Administration official said today that he expected that the. United States would exchange letters with the Soviet Union by the end of the week expressing both nations political endorsement of the $8billion, 20year fertilizer deal between the Occidental Petroleum Corporation and the Soviet Government.

title: COLONEL'S CHARGE DENIED BY P.O.W.'S
description: Prisoners of war charged by Col. Theodore W. Guy with collaborating with the enemy said, yesterday, some through spokesmen, that they had not helped the North Vietnamese any more than most prisoners had done.

title: Democrats Granted 90 Days
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (UPI) Federal District Judge Charles R. Richey granted today a request by lawyers for the Democratic National Committee for an additional three months to seek new evidence in their $6.4million civil suit against the Committee for the Reelection of the President.

title: Georgia Southern Victor, Will Face Texas in Series
description: STARKVILLE, Miss., May 30 (UPI)  Georgia Southern scored three runs in the fourth inning yesterday and defeated Miami (Fla.), 41, for the National Collegiate District 3 baseball championship.

title: Saigon's Economy, in Trouble, Awaits Added Help From U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 30 South Vietnam's foreignexchange reserves are plummeting and both American and South Vietnamese economists are worried.

title: Cause of Blast Suggested
description: PHOENIX, Ariz,, May 30 (AP)A hot metal sliver from an airbrake shoe may have caused the explosion May 24 of 12 railroad cars carrying bombs in southeastern Arizona, the Arizona Corporation Commission said today.

title: Cambodian Envoy Off to Paris To Seek Talks With Sihanouk
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, May 30 (Reuters)Former Deputy Premier Son Sann left here today for Paris to try to open the way for peace talks with the government in exile of Prince Norodom Sihanouk. Mr. Son Sann said that his official mission was to bring together the Government of President Lon Nol and the prince's Royal Government of National Union.

title: NEW STRAIN FOUND IN INFLUENZA VIRUS
description: A new strain of influenza virus against which Americans have little or no immunity has been identified in Hong Kong, Australia and Birmingham, England, according to a report from the National Center for Disease Control.

title: NIXON IN ICELAND; TO JOIN POMPIDOU FOR TALKS TODAY
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, May 30President Nixon, on the first foreign journey of his second term, met tonight with the leaders of Iceland's Government.

title: Mt. Sinai Is Named A Research Center For Asbestos Study
description: The Mount Sinai School of Medicine here was named yesterday as the site of the nation's seventh environmental health sciences research center.

title: HAROLD HASTINGS, MUSICAL DIRECTOR
description: Harold Hastings, musical director of Broadway's A Little Night Music, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 33 Bonnie Briar Lane, Larchmont, N.Y. He was 56 years old.

title: ENDORSEMENTS FOR PROSECUTOR
description: Frank S. Hogan, the Manhattan District Attorney, and his challenger in the Democratic primary, William J. vanden Heuvel, offered competing sets of endorsements yesterday.

title: Shell to Limit Gasoline Sale; Texaco: A 10Gallon Ration
description: The Shell Oil Company announced yesterday that it would limit the amount of gasoline will sell its service stations, starting tomorrow. Texaco said it would ration drivers to 10 gallons at its stations on toll roads, the Associated Press reported.

title: EHRLICHMAN SAYS NIXON SOON KNEW OF MEXICO INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 John D. Ehrlichman told a Senate subcommittee today that President Nixon knew six days after the Watergate breakin that Federal agents were investigating Mexican aspects of the case.

title: De Busschere: $75 000 Annually From Nets for 10 Years
description: Dave De Busschere's appointment as general manager of the New York Nets, effective June 1, 1974, with a 10year contract for an estimated annual salary of $75,000, was confirmed yesterday but he foresaw no conflict of interest during his final season with the New York Knicks.

title: OREPRICE VICTORY SEEN IN AUSTRALIA
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 30 Japanese acceptance of Australian demands for raising the dollar amounts of ironore contracts is viewed here as the first victory for Prime Minister Gough Whitlam in pursuing his new resources diplomacy.

title: RapidAmerican Cites Gains
description: Meshulam Riklis, chairman the RapidAmerican Corporation, using the word very six times in one sentence to describe how well his company was faring, told shareholders here yesterday that earnings for the consumergoods conglomerate would rise at least 25 per cent in the current fiscal year. He also said that he would recommend an increase in the 50cent annual dividend by the year's end.

title: RAILROAD DENIES FIREALARM DELAY
description: An attorney for the Penn Central yesterday angrily denied allegations that the railroad had failed to report promptly a fire in a crowded comuter train under Park Avenue Tuesday night.

title: CyprusBagdad Deal Delay
description: The Cyprus Mines Corporation and the Bagdad Copper Corporation said yesterday they had deferred the closing of their $61milion merger until not later than June 13 pending further legal review because of uncertainity on how the Jus, tice Department's antitrust division will view the deal.

title: Furniture Concern Shows Lag
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 30 Firstquarter results of the Levitz Furniture Corporation fell far short of projections, Ralph Levitz, chairman, said today at the annual meeting of the company.

title: Hauge Says Soviet Pacts Bring Dubious Banking
description: Gabriel Hauge, chairman of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, assailed yesterday what he termed the development of dubious banking in the current scramble of nonCommunist financial institutions to do business with the Soviet Union.

title: Jackson Sees Peril to O.S. In Reliance on Foreign Oil
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP) Senator Henry M. Jackson said today that the national security was endangered because President Nixon had ignored the development of domestic petroleum resources.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has begun preliminary tests for construction of a highspeed rail line between Newark International Airport and Plainfield.

title: News Summary and Index
SANDMAN DINNER AIDED BY ORMAN
description: TRENTON, May 30Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr.'s financial disclosure statement shows that one of the contributors to his campaign in the Republican gubernatorial primary election was Herman Orman, who has been identified by Federal and state law enforcement authorities as the kingpin of Organized crime in Atlantic City.

title: SPEED ON INQUIRY URGED BY AGNEW
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Vice President Agnew said today that the facts in the Watergate conspiracy case should be dredged into the open quickly so that the nation, and the Republican party, could get it over with.

title: FLIGHT INSURANCE BEING RESTORED
description: Low cost flight insurance policies, quietly removed from all airports in New York State nine months ago, will be offered once again beginning tomorrow, state insurance regu lators said here yesterday.

title: Ajax Tops Juventus, 10, To Win European Cup
description: BELGRADE, May 30 (UPI) Ajax of Amsterdam scored a 10 soccer victory over Juventus of Turin, Italy, today and won the European Cup for the third straight year.

title: Victor Over Yorty Sees Further Gains
description: LOS ANGELES, May 30Thomas Bradley said today that his election as the first black Mayor of Los Angeles could help open a new thrust of black leadership into electoral politics.

title: FYODOR PETROV, A SOVIET EDITOR
description: MOSCOW, May 30Fyodor N. Petrov, one of the oldest Russian revolutionaries, ar, early Soviet science adminis. trator and an encyclopedia editor, died here on Monday. He was 96 years old.

title: West Milford Residents Fighting Drought
description: WEST MILFORD, N. J., May 30The disintegration of the watersupply system for the homes of 124 families in the Post Brook Farms development near here has forced them to improvise.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Oakland A's, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161 Street, the Bronx, 7:30 P.M. (RadioWMCA, 7:30 P.M.)

title: MAFIOSO INDICTED AS TOP LOAN SHARK
description: Anthony Salerno, who is reported to be one of the most powerful Mafia figures in the metropolitan area, was indicted yesterday on charges involving a multimilliondollar loanshark ring.

title: G.O.P. Panel Picks Educator
description: LONG BEACH, May 30 (AP)Dr. William S. Banowsky, president of Pepperdine University, is the choice of the Republican state central committee for California Republican National Committeeman. His appoiptment yesterday is subject to confirmation by the Republican National Committee.

title: A Kennel of Champions Thrives in Historic Bohemia
description: PODEBRADY, CzechoslovakiaHard by the Elbe River in this historic town, famous in the past for its King George of Bohemia and more recently as a health spa, is one of the leading German shepherd kennels in Czechoslovakia. For 15 years, Mrs. Jaroslav Holy has been breeding shepherds, the most popular dog in this country and she has had marked success. Her Hein vom Schwafordener Land, imported from West Germany, was undefeated in the breed in 13 outings. In 1971, the striking gold and black won the group at Brno and gained an international certificate. He also became the Czechoslovak national champion. The big doghe is 77 pounds took at Pardubice, Prague and last month at Prerov, where he led field of 270 on the grounds where the annual sale of horses is held. bice, Prague and last month at Prerov, where he led field of 270 on the grounds where the annual sale of horses is held.

title: F. P. C. APPROVES BIG GAS PRICE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 By a vote of 21, the Federal Power Commission approved today three longterm contracts for the sale of offshore Louisiana natural gas at a wellhead price 73 per cent higher than the ceiling price for that area set by the agency just two years ago.

title: BreakIn by F.B.I. Alleged Before 1969 Inauguration
description: WASHINGTON, May 30Agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation broke into the offices of a radical newspaper in Washington without a search warrant shortly before President Nixon's inauguration in 1969 in an attempt to find evidence of overseas Communist influence, two former Army intelligence operatives said today.

title: Christian Science Units Open
description: BOSTON, May 30 (AP)A $70million expansion of the world headquarters of the Church of Christ, Scientist, was officially opened today. The new structures are a 26story adminiStration building, a semicircular Sunday school building and a long, low general service building.

title: ShortTerm Rates of Interest Soar on Strong Credit Demand
Saigon's. Economy, in Trouble, Awaits Added Help From U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 30South Vietnam's foreignexchange reserves are plummeting and both American and South Vietnamese economists are worded.

title: Johncock Captures Indy 500 Mechanic Is Killed and Savage critically Injured
Television
description: 6:30 (2)Summer Semester (4)All About Your Car (5)The Love of Words (7)Listen and Learn

title: Arthur Daley
description: Joseph Jerome McGinnity pitched for the New York Giants shortly after the turn of the century and became something of a baseball legend under the nom de guerre of Iron Man McGinnity. During the 1903 and 1904 seasons he and the incomparable Christy Mathewson were fabulous pair. McGinnity won 31 and 35 games in those years while Matty was on his way toward superstardom with 30 and 33. But one thing McGinnity could do Matty didn't even try to do. The Iron Man could pitch and win doubleheaders. Over the course of his Sports career he achieved it five times, a record. Many years ago, Lefty Gomez brought his of new bride to the Yankee Stadium to see her The Times first ball game and he was particularly distressed because she saw him lose a heartbreaker, 10. She tried to console him afterwards. Cheer up, honey, she said. You'll beat them tomorrow.

title: FUTURES, IN GRAIN YIELD TO JITTER
Mrs. Nixon and Daughter Attend Funeral of Agent
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 30  Mrs. Richard Nixon and her daughter, Mrs. David Eisenhower, came to Greenwich today to attend a funeral service for J. Clifford Dietrich, a Secret Service agent who had helped guard the Nixon family.

title: TRADE BOARD'S HEAD TO RESIGN IN CHICAGO
description: Henry Hail Wilson will resign as president of the Chicago Board of Trade, the nation's largest commodities exchange, this morning to return to politics in North Carolina, according to his close aides.

title: BONN AND PRAGUE REACH AN ACCORD
description: BONN, May 30In another West German step toward reconciliation with Eastern Europe, negotiations were completed with Czechoslovakia today on a treaty to establish normal relations, ending 35 years of hostility.

title: Colombian Jet Hijacked to Aruba
description: ARUBA, Netherlands Antilles, May 30 (UPI)  Four men who hijacked a Colombian airliner and forced it to fly here threatened today to blow up the plane on the ground with 58 passengers aboard unless the Colombian government releases 39 Communist guerrilla suspects and pays a $200,000 ransom.

title: Hurok Fire Trial Opens
description: Jury selection began yesterday in Federal Court in Manhattan in the trial of two 19yearold members of the Jewish Defense League accused of participating in the firebombing of Sol Hurok's midtown office last year. One person died and 13 were injured in the fire. The two defendants are Sheldon Davis and Stuart Cohen.

title: Brinegar Defends a Rail Plan
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 Claude S. Brinegar, Secretary of Transportation, sought to assure the Senate Surface Transportation subcommittee today that the Northeast could support one or more solvent railroads in addition to the Chesapeake & Ohio and Norfolk & Western railway systems. The financial community would finance that railroad once it was in operation, he added.

title: Proxmire Bids Haig Resign One of His Two Positions
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (UPI)  Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, today urged Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr. either to quit the Army or to resign as President Nixon's top assistant.

title: Bridge. 32 Teams Start Third Round Of Reisinger Event Tonight
Texas Scientists Think Backyard Blob Is Dead
description: DALLAS, May 30 (AP)The blob in Mrs. Marie Harris's backyard is dead and probably will not return, two Texas scientists said today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (UPI)The National Football League Players Association asked the Government today to prohibit the installation of synthetic turf until safety regulations were devised. Ed Garvey, exectuive director, said the club owners had refused to cooperate in moratorium on artificial turf. He told the Consumer Product Safety Commission that players are concerned not only about their own careers being shortened, but also for thousands of high school and college athletes.

title: Salerno, Mafia Figure, Indicted as Chief of Million Dollar LoanShark Ring
description: Anthony Salerno, who is reported to be one of the most powerful Mafia figures in the metropolitan area, was indicted yesterday on charges involving a multimilliondollar loanshark ring.

title: NIXON IN ICELAND; TO JOIN POMPIDOU FOR TALKS TODAY
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, May 30President Nixon, on the first foreign journey of his second term, met tonight with the leaders of Iceland's Government.

title: All Those Dishwashers and No Detergents
description: Col. Richard P. Fredey strode down the aisle of a midtown A&P supermarket the other day bearing three gold boxes of Calgonite automatic dishwasher detergent as if they were bars of bullion.

title: INTELLIGENCE UNIT IS BEING ABOLISHED
description: WASHINGTON, May 30The Nixon Administration is quietly dismantling the Intelligence Evaluation Committee, the supersecret body created by President Nixon in an attempt to strengthen relations among the Federal Government's intelligencegathering agencies, Justice Department officials said today.

title: Mail Tampering Reports Prompt Bid for Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP)  The chairman of a House Post Office subcommittee, Representative Charles H. Wilson, Democrat of California, asked for an investigation today into reports that the mail of two Democratic Presidential candidates was illegally opened.

title: Crimes Of State
description: BOSTON, May 30On 85 successive days now, without any authority in law, American planes have bombed Cambodia. The latest official figures, for April, showed that the average daily tonnage had risen to nearly one and onehalf the amount dropped on North Vietnam during the Christmas bombing campaign.

title: Badillo and Biaggi Capital Staffs Toil On
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 Mira Luy, an antipoverty assistant, crouched in the middle of the office floor and spoonfed milk and honey to Jana, a lethargic 76pound Rottweiler puppy Behind her, Stuart Brabs, another assistant, casually thumbed a copy of AmexCanada, a magazine published by American exiles in Canada, and tossed it into the wastebasket.

title: At This Show, There's No Business... Like Textiles
description: The early curtain was apparently a great shot in, the arm for New York theater, but isn't 7:58 A.M. carrying it a bit too far?

title: Daane, of Reserve, Sees Recent Payments Surplus
description: WASHINGTON, May 30The United States has had an overall surplus on international transactions since midMarch, a member of the Federal Reserve Board told Congress today.

title: Fulbright Reports Response To His Questions on Israel
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (Reuters)  Senator J. W. Fulbright, chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, said today that the State Department had assured him the United States had no information that Israel was planning military action against any other nation.

title: Meadows Panel Acts To Ban Some Damping
description: LYNDHURST, May 30The Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission passed a resolution today that would ban the dumping of solid waste from outside the state.

title: WITHERS IS TAKEN BY LINDA'S CHIEF
description: Linda's Chief exhibited his frontrunning capability to perfection in the Withers Mile at Belmont Park yesterday. Neil Hellman's Floridabred colt broke last in the field of six but under the guidance of Jorge Velasquez flashed into the lead in short order and stayed there to win by three lengths.

title: Senate Votes Today on Barring Funds for Bombing in Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, May 30After a day of stalling, the Senate agreed today to vote by 5 P.M. tomorrow on a catchall spending bill that would cut off all funds for bombing in Cambodia. Supporters of the Administration planned to make a lastditch effort to soften the cutoff of funds with amendments before the final vote tomorrow, but they were not optimistic.

title: DR. EDWIN BADER
description: Dr. Edwin Bader, a physician who had practiced in Flushing, Queens, for 30 years, died yesterday in Parsons Hospital, Queens. He was 82 years old and lived and had his office at 4220 Kissena Boulevard.

title: Notes on People
description: Prime Minister Gough Whitlam of Australia, who has said he intends to visit Washington without benefit of an invitation from the White House, seemed to be offering President Nixon advice that may or may not be welcome.

title: ERIC APPLEWHITE
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla,, May 30 (AP)Eric Leon Applewhite, the actor who portrayed the inspector in the film Dial M for Murder, died yesterday in the Miami Heart Institute. He was 76 years old.

title: Sclerosis Drive On
description: Today, hundreds of thousands of Americans stricken by multiple sclerosis need help, The affliction is a disease of the central nervous system that distorts or blocks nerve impulses from activating muscles vital to such functions as speech, movement and vision.

title: Stage. Capital's Raisin
City Offering Shoppers a Weekly Market Basket Survey
Meskill Helps Find A Retarded Boy, 8, Lost in a Swamp
description: HAMPTON, Conn., May 30 (UPI)Gov. Thomas J. Meskill and other rescue workers aboard a helicopter found an 8yearold retarded boy in swamp today, more than 24 hours after he wandered from his rural home.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Naomi Sims, the fashion model, has a small, elegant head set on a remarkable length of body, huge black eyes and skin the color of rich, espresso coffee. What she didn't have, until recently, were readymade wigs and hairpieces that she thought looked natural on a black woman.

title: House Urged Not to Curb Abortions
description: WASHINGTON, May 30A dozen national religious, civi liberties and women's organi zations joined today to ask tilt House of Representatives to reject an amendment restricting the availability of abortions. The amendment, which is in eluded in a health service: bill as reported to the House would permit any hospital of other health facility funded by the legislation to refuse to permit abortions or sterilizations.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The spokesmen for Normal (National Organization for the Reform of Marijuana Laws) in their efforts to obtain the commercial availability of marijuana in the United States [letter April 24] ignore the following:

title: Stage: Yin Yang Opens
German Rate Rise Hurts Dollar
description: LONDON, May 30 (AP)The West German Government announced today an increase of full, percentage point in its official lending rates. In reaction, the United States dollar weakened in money markets across Europe, and the price of gold hit new highs.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The last redorange light from the setting sun slipped through a rift in the black clouds, a pair of Canada geese flew low over the windruffled salt pond crying of spring and mating time, and, lost in watching them, I failed to see the striped bass when it made a pass at my fly.

title: Roundup: Evans Homer Helps Boston Win Again
description: A toovigorous charge at home plate, a beanball pitch or two, a near freeforall, a gamewinning home run and a game saving catchall that marked Boston's second straight victory over California, 21, in Fenway Park last night.

title: Gun Fired on School Bus
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 30 (UPI)An argument between two junior high school students ended yesterday with one of them shoving a loaded shotgun through an open school bus window and pulling the trigger, the police reported. The blast ripped a hole in the roof of the bus bound for Spaugh Junior High School, but none of the approximately 50 students aboard was hurt, officers said.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: May 31, 1973 TRUSTEESHIP COUNCIL, Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: McCloskey Doubts Nixon
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., May 30 (UPI)  Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr., Republican of California, said today that there appeared to be strong evidence to suggest that President Nixon knew more about the Watergate affair than he said.

title: Fundamentalist Sect Changes Style of Life to Avert Abductions
description: When Margarett Rogow goes to church these days she puts on her coat, grabs her Bible and goes off in the company of male bodyguards who are there to make sure that she will not be kidnapped by her parents.

title: Soviet Is Reported to Close Inquiry Into Jews in Minsk
description: MOSCOW, May 30 (UPI)Soviet authorities in Minsk have unexpectedly closed their investigation of socalled Case 97 in which more than 100 Jews were questioned about illegal activities, a Jewish source said today.

title: Libya,at U. N., Says That U.S. Seeks a Military Confrontation
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 30Libya accused the United States today of a series of military actions in an effort to provoke a confrontation in which the Libyan Arab Republic has no alternative but to defend its sovereignty, security and safety.

title: Survey Urges an Overhaul Of Court Procedure Here
description: The presiding justices of the Appellate Division here released a series of special studies yesterday showing, among other things, that juries have far smaller ratios women ana young people than the general adult population, that property belonging to victims of crime is often needlessly kept from them for years and that legal services for the indigent are so inadequate that a person may have to wait two years for an appointment to see a lawyer about a divorce.

title: Lieberson, Back at C. B. S. Post, Talks About Rock and Records
description: You know, it gives me pain to be considered the old Offer. He did a lot, true. But it had started before he came. l delivered him a pretty good Company.
